Danish: 'Havhingsten fra Glendalough' det længste genskabte vikingeskib, der er bygget til dato.

Danish: 'Havhingsten fra Glendaglough' blev bygget på Vikingeskibsmuseets bådeværft i 2000-2004, og er med sin længde på 30 meter verdens længste rekonstruktion af et vikingeskib.
English: 'Sea Stallion from Glendalough' was built at the Viking Ship Museum's boatyard from 2000 - 2004 and with a length of 30 meters is the world's largest Viking ship reconstruction.

Danish: Den 30-meter lange rekonstruktion af det originale vikingeskib Skuldelev 2, 'Havhingsten fra Glendalough' ligger ved den høje kaj i 'Becken 1' i den enorme flodhavn i Berlins vestlige bydel.
English: 'Sea Stallion from Glendalough', the 30m long reconstruction of the original Viking ship, Skuldelev 2, lies at the high quay in 'Becken 1', the enormous harbour in Berlin's western area.

Danish: 'Havhingsten' er verden længste rekonstruktion af et vikingeskib, og skibet blev verdensberømt, da det med sin 65-mand store besætning sejlede fra Vikingeskibsmuseet i Roskilde til Dublin og retur i 2007-2008.
English: 'Sea Stallion' is the world's longest reconstruction of a Viking ship, and the ship became world famous when it sailed with its 65-strong crew from the Viking Ship Museum in Roskilde to Dublin and back again in 2007-2008.

Danish: 'Havhingsten' blev bygget på Vikingeskibsmuseets bådeværft fra 2000 til 2004 med kopier af værktøj fundet fra vikingetiden og med de samme teknikker, som vikingerne gjorde brug af.
English: 'Sea Stallion' was built at the Viking Ship Museum's boatyard from 2000 - 2004 using copies of tools from the Viking Age and with the same techniques the Vikings used.

Danish: ’Havhingsten’ blev navngivet af Hendes Majestæt Dronningen i 2004 og skibet kan fejre sit 10 års jubilæum under rejsen til Berlin.
English: 'Sea Stallion' was named by Her Majesty the Queen in 2004 and the ship can celebrate its 10 year anniversary on the way to Berlin.

English: A group of 14 men and women have only three weeks to prepare.

Danish: Et laugsmedlem er optaget af et eller flere laug, og kan deltage i alle laugets aktivitet.
English: A guild member belongs to one or more guilds and can participate in all activities organised by those guilds.

Danish: en hammer
English: a hammer

Danish: En svær nød at knække", siger Carsten Hvid.
English: A hard nut to crack”, says Carsten Hvid.

Danish: Årekejpen er også surret på med vidjer.
English: A hazel withy sits in a hole in the oar lock.

Danish: En sund forretning
English: A healthy business

Danish: Stærk strøm og høj sø
English: A heavy stream and high sea

Danish: En hektisk uge
English: A hectic week

English: A high-pressure above Scandinavia could yield winds from the East, releasing the crew of the Sea Stallion from rowing days on end and blisters the size of apples.

Danish: En historiker skal også formidle til et bredt publikum og opbygge billeder af fortiden som er forståelige for ikke fagfolk.
English: A historian should also reach a broad public and create a picture of the past that is understandable for non-specialists.

Danish: En Danmarks historie, der ikke forholder sig til det maritime element, er bare en halvkvædet vise”.
English: A history of Denmark that ignored the maritime aspect would have a gaping hole”.

English: A hoard of Hiberno-Norse coins dating to the 1040s was also found on Rathlin.

Danish: Medieinteressen er enorm!
English: A huge Media interest!

Danish: Et instrument, som man i gamle dage anvendte på Færøerne, kunne derimod godt være en arv fra vikingerne: Den såkaldte sólskyggafjól - "solskyggepind" består af en viser, der kaster skygge på en vandret plade; f. eks. flydende i en vandbalje.
English: A instrument, which was used in the past on the Faroe Islands, could, conversely, have been inherited from the Vikings: The so-called sólskyggafjól (“sun shadow stick”) comprises a pointer, which throws a shadow onto an horizontal plate which, for example, is floating in a water bath.

Danish: Den rejse vil hele verden følge med nysgerrige øjne.
English: A journey followed curiously by the whole world.

English: A journey that hasn't taken in the last 1000 years since the Viking Age is beginning this summer.

Danish: Udover skatterne var der også en anden grund til at kongen gerne ville udbrede sine egne danske mønter.
English: A king always needed silver so there was probably a tax or charge for changing to Danish coins.

Danish: En knarr er selvfølgelig stadig et åbent skib, men det er meget bredere, har højere fribord, er mere rummeligt og er derfor på mange måder mere egnet til længere sejladser på åbnet hav.
English: A knarr is, of course, still an open ship, but it is much broader, has a higher freeboard, is more spacious, and is therefore in many ways more suited to long voyages on the open sea.

Danish: en kniv
English: a knife

Danish: En dame fortæller smilende: "Vi besøgte museet i Roskilde, da drengene var små.
English: A lady smiles and says, "We visited the museum in Roskilde when the boys were small.

English: A large number of people came along on Friday afternoon to witness the ceremonial part of the Time Capsule's long voyage into the future when it was buried at the front of the Viking Ship Hall.

Danish: De kendes også i stort tal fra stednavnene; for eksempel Korshavn og Korsør.
English: A large number of these are known from place names, for example Korshavn and Korsør.

Danish: En stor del af den følger den naturlige strømrende, men strækningen mellem Enehøje og Kuddeholm/Barneholm er kunstigt gravet.
English: A large part of it follows the natural water current channel, but the part between Enehøje and Kuddeholm/Barneholm has been artificially excavated.

Danish: En større jordlod i midten af Sigtuna tyder på, at kongsgården lå her.
English: A large plot of land in the centre of Sigtuna indicates the location of the royal seat.

Danish: En stor sæl modtager os i havnebassinet.
English: A large seal welcomes us in the dock.

Danish: En stor stenmur lå udenfor voldgraven.
English: A large stone wall was built outside the ditch.

English: A large wall map illustrated where in Denmark the maritime archaeologists have found archaeological remains, and showed film from the more recent, large-scale excavations.

Danish: Stor og stærk mand, med langt hår og skæg.
English: A large, strongly-built man with long hair and a beard.

English: A leader might be one who ‘binds the mast-top correctly' bindr hún beinan, and he could be ‘the one who sends the fire of the mast-top.

Danish: Svag vind fra nord nordøst.
English: A light wind from north-north-west.

English: A light wind from the north has sent the Viking Ship Museum's research project down along the coast of Ireland.

Danish: En pram er fladbundet, en jollepram har derudover et hjerteformet spejl.
English: A lighter is flat-bottomed, and a dinghy lighter also has a heart-shaped stern-frame.

English: A list of the publications of the Viking Ship Museum's staff can be found under the following Danish title: Medarbejdernes publikationer.

Danish: Et stykke længere henne i tapetet vises et engelsk skib, der bringer bud til Vilhelm om Harolds kroning til konge.
English: A little further on in the tapestry an English ship is shown that is carrying the news to William about Harold’s coronation as king.

Danish: Det er da lidt underligt.”
English: A little strange I think.

Danish: Lang men smuk tur.
English: A long but beautiful trip.

Danish: En lang planke i den øverste bordgang, hvori årehullerne er udskåret, har ligefrem siddet i samme position i et andet skib.
English: A long plank in the upper row in which the oar holes have been carved, even had the same position in another ship.

Danish: En Longphort var en skandinavisk vikingebase eller vinterlejr i Irland.
English: A Longphort was a Scandinavian base or winter camp in Ireland.

Danish: Kik bag kulissen
English: A look behind the scenes

Danish: En løsfundet kanon, en 3-punds finbanker fundet af en undervandsjæger, er hjemtaget af hensyn til genstandens sikkerhed.
English: A loose cannon, a 3-pound ‘finbanker' found by an underwater hunter has been taken home out of regard for the safety of the artefact.

Danish: En løsfundet kanon, en 3-punds finbanker fundet af en undervandsjæger, er hjemtaget af hensyn til genstandens sikkerhed.
English: A loose cannon, a 3-pound ‘finbanker’ found by an underwater hunter has been taken home out of regard for the safety of the artefact.

Danish: Mange børn skriver, at det var sejt at få besøg af en ”rigtig viking” og en der har sejlet med Havhingsten.
English: A lot of children write that it was great to get a visit from a “real Viking” who had sailed with the Sea Stallion.

English: A lot of harbour masters and other authorities had to be contacted to find the potential port facilities needed for the Sea Stallion and its crew.

English: A lot of skill is involved in reading the wood and knowing when to turn it, when to wet it and, of course, when it was ready to be set into position against the keel.

Danish: Mange mindre havne imellem fik et også et kort tjek.
English: A lot of smaller harbours were also briefly checked.

Danish: Deltag i Vikingeskibsmuseets årlige, maritime festival der sætter spot på håndværk og vikinger.
English: A lust for adventure and their skillful ship technology brought them around the world.

Danish: En så storslået stormandsbegravelse vidner om at samfundsordningen allerede omkring år 700, var på vej mod en statsdannelse.
English: A magnificent, aristocratic burial such as this is evidence of the fact that, already around 700 AD, social organisation was on its way towards the formation of a nation state.

Danish: Et storsejl, en fok, en klyver og et topsejl.
English: A mainsail, a foresail, jib and topsail.

Danish: En blandet flok mænd og kvinder
English: A mixed group of men and women

Danish: En mobil hjemmeside åbner i dag.

English: A modern cable and offshore-diving support ship, Cable One, has been hired as sailing security for the entire trip from Dublin to the Thyborøn, thanks to large donation from the Nordea Danmark Foundation and the tremendous goodwill of its owner.

English: A modern teinæringur must be built with broad boards.

English: A more intentional political exploitation of reconstructions is to be found in the Norwegian projects Gaia and Embla.

English: A mould has been found in Haithabu in which both Christian crosses and Thor's hammers could be cast.

English: A much more detailed account of the experiments and the experimental set up will appear in the large book on the Skuldelev finds The Skuldelev Ships in the Viking Ship Museum's monograph series Ships and Boats of the North.

Danish: Meget mere detaljerede redegørelser for forsøg og forsøgsopstillinger vil fremkomme i den store bog om Skuldelevfundene The Skuldelev Ships i Vikingeskibsmuseets monografiserie Ships and Boats of the North.
English: A much more detailed account of the experiments and the experimental set up will appear in the large book on the Skuldelev finds The Skuldelev Ships in the Viking Ship Museum’s monograph series Ships and Boats of the North.

Danish: I museets arkæologiske værksted åbner en ny udstilling 10. maj med film fra udgravningerne under vand og arkæologiske genstande, hvoraf nogle har mere end 7000 år på bagen.
English: A new exhibition will open 10 May in the museum’s archaeological workshop, with films from the underwater excavations and the archaeological artefacts, some of which are more than 7,000 years old.

English: A number of questions arose during this process: could the height of the freeboard be increased?

English: A nurse is extremely important part of the crew on board the Sea stallion.

English: A person with insight into political decision-making processes at both a regional and state level - suggested by the Friends of the Viking Ship Mseum

English: A personal account by Ole Crumlin Pedersen

English: A rare task – raising an archaeological ship-find

English: A research excavation is planned and it is hoped that this will yield more information regarding the nature and duration of the Viking settlement here.

English: A review and a time warp: finding the Skuldelev Ships, excavation, conservation and exhibition in the Viking Ship Hall - a museum is created.

English: A richly illustrated enlarged edition of skjald's diary will be published in Danish and English by the Viking Ship Museum in cooperation with the Sohn publishing house.

English: A section of bark is removed, allowing the boatbuilders to make sure that the tree was in fact as straight-growing as it appeared to be prior to felling.

English: A series of partially mended/filled in oar holes are seen about 78 cm apart, which must have been the rib spacing on the earlier ship, whereas the oar holes for Skuldelev 5 were cut about 90 cm apart.

English: A ship like the Sea Stallion would certainly attract a lot of attention here”, says Tinna Damgård-Sørensen.

English: A ship over 21 metres long was dragged from the fjord and up to the top of a natural rise, where it was placed in a specially-dug hole.

English: A side scan sonar consists of a transducer, either mounted on the hull or towed behind the survey vessel.

Danish: Et lignende symbolsk indhold kan fundets eneste bevarede spore ligeledes tillægges, og det er nærliggende at antage, at den afdøde blev gravlagt med sporer på.
English: A similar symbolic content can be attributed to the find's only preserved spur, and it seems reason-able to suppose that the dead person was laid in the grave with his spurs on.

Danish: En enkelt, centralt placeret mast har båret et firkantet råsejl.
English: A single centrally located mast carried a square sail.

English: A site is documented by several archaeologists using different techniques, and after the excavation a report is prepared on the objects discovered and other traces, such as post holes and fire places.

English: a spearhead

Danish: Et bundstokslod sørger for, at emnet passes ned i samme vinkel fra det nederste til det øverste bord
English: A special bevel gauge is used to make sure the timber maintains the same angle from the lowest to the uppermost planks

Danish: Et stift skibsskrog giver maksimal fart, fordi det derved er muligt at kontrollere formen.
English: A stiff hull gives maximum speed, because it makes it possible to get exactly the shape you want.

Danish: Midtpå gulvet var anlagt et ildsted med sten omkring.
English: A stone kerbed hearth was located in the middle of the floor area.

Danish: En udspændt stammebåd fra Pomark i Finland, bygget i 1976
English: A stretched dugout from Pomark in Finland, 1976

Danish: Et kraftigt og tydeligvis overdimensioneret sideror er vist agterude, mens såvel for- som agterstævn er vist med nærmest grotesk store udsmykninger.
English: A sturdy and clearly over-dimensioned side-rudder is shown aft, while both fore-stem and aft-stem are shown with almost grotesquely large decorations.

Danish: Det penetrerende ekkolod udsender lydbølger ned mod havbunden.
English: A sub-bottom profiler emits sound waves through the water to the seabed.

Danish: Et sommerhøjtryk har bidt sig fast i Nordsøen og giver perfekt ferievejr på både den danske og den engelske side af havet.
English: A summer high pressure area has latched on to the North Sea and is giving perfect holiday weather on both the Danish and the British side of the sea.

Danish: Solkompasset er altid retvisende.
English: A sun sompass always shows the correct direction.

Danish: Et støttemedlem er med i livet omkring lauget, men er måske ikke så aktiv med hensyn til sejladserne, og sejler maksimalt 3 dagture i sejlsæsonen.
English: A support member is a part of the life around the guild but is not so active in terms of sailing and takes part in maximum 3 day-sailings during the season.

Danish: et sværd
English: a sword

Danish: Ved en så kompleks opgave som at bygge en fortidig bådtype er der brug for folk med mange forskellige indfaldsvinkler til opgaven og en struktur, der kalder på disse talenter.
English: A task as complicated as that of building a complex boat type of the past calls for people with a wide range of skills and professional backgrounds, as well as a structure encouraging these talents.

Danish: Mød forfatteren Susanne Clod Pedersen
English: A taste of the Viking Age

Danish: Originalens udførelse af optimerede elementer med en fin finish viser, at den må være baseret på en lang tradition, og at det er erfarne skibsbyggere, der har stået for arbejdet.
English: A team of ten experienced boatbuilders would probably have been able to build the original boat in two or three months under such conditions.

Danish: En tanke som vandt gehør ikke mindst under sidste års kolde og regnfulde togt.
English: A thought that met sympathy during last year's cold and rainy voyage.

Danish: Tusind år senere rammes en spunsvæg af jern ned i fjordbunden omkring spærringen.
English: A thousand years later an iron cofferdam is driven into the seabed around the barrier.

Danish: En hyldest til besætningen
English: A tribute to the crew

Danish: En helt igennem fantastisk dag
English: A truly fantastic day

Danish: En unik oplevelse
English: A unique experience

Danish: Ved afslutningen af bådrummet var fæstet en stor kløftet stævn ovenpå bundplanken, hvortil også sideplankerne var fastsyet.
English: A vertical stem-locking board of oak fastened the winged stem to the bottom strake.

Danish: En stærkt forenklet men i hovedtrækkende fyldestgørende beskrivelse af nedlæggelse og rejsning af masten lyder således:
English: A very simplified but fairly comprehensive outline of lowering and raising the mast is as follows:

Danish: En meget lille kildegruppe udgøres af skibsbilleder på tekstiler, hvoraf Bayeux-tapetet er langt det mest kendte.
English: A very small group is formed by ship-representations on textiles, of which the Bayeux Tapestry is by far the most famous.

Danish: Fra Hedeby kendes en meget velbevaret langbue af takstræ med en længde på 191,5 cm og en påkrævet trækkraft på ca. 45 kg. Den maksimale rækkevidde for denne bue er ca. 200 m. Buestrengen har formodentlig været fremstillet af hør.
English: A very well-preserved yew bow was found at Haithabu; this has a length of 191.5 cm and a draw weight of about 45 kg. Its maximum range is about 200 m. The bow string was probably made of flax.

Danish: En landtoning er et lille billede af en kyst, som sejleren kan bruge til at genkende, hvor han befinder sig.
English: A view is a small picture of a stretch of coast, which a sailor can use to recognise his position.

Danish: Et kik mod agterenden.
English: A view towards the aft.

Danish: 200 år gamle flådeege bliver til vikingeskib
English: A Viking ship built from 200 year old fleet oak

Danish: En synlig institution
English: A visible institution.

Danish: Besøg af handelsmænd fra fremmede egne betød nye og spændende varer, f.eks. glas og vin fra Frankeriget (Tyskland, Frankrig, Holland), samt silke og krydderier fra Orienten.
English: A visit from a merchant coming from a foreign area meant the introduction of new goods and wares, for example Frankish glass and wine or silk and spices from the Orient.

Danish: Besøg i Brede af Karsten Krabbe, Roskilde
English: A visit to Brede by Karsten Krabbe, Roskilde

Danish: Et frivilligt bådelaug blev etableret, og der blev udført systematiske forsøg med roning og sejlads, for at undersøge skibets sejladsevner.
English: A volunteer boat guild was established and systematic sailing and rowing tests were carried out to determine the ship’s sailing abilities.

Danish: En rejse som i vikingetiden?
English: A voyage like in the Viking Age?

Danish: En sejlads på 1700 kilometer i stiv modvind, lyder som en barsk omgang, men helt så galt behøver det nu ifølge Morten Sørensen heller ikke at gå:
English: A voyage of 1,700 kilometres against the wind sounds like a rough affair, but it does not have to be all that bad according to Morten Sørensen:

Danish: Sejlads igennem farvande der kan sammenlignes med skibets oprindelige fartområde
English: A voyage through waters similar to those of the ship's original operational area

Danish: Sejlads igennem farvande der kan sammenlignes med skibets oprindelige fartområde
English: A voyage through waters similar to those of the ship’s original operational area

Danish: Et krigsskib på diplomatisk kurs
English: A warship on a diplomatic course

Danish: En vagt varer fire timer og skal bemandes dag og nat.
English: A watch lasts four hours and must be manned day and night.

Danish: en vejrstation, der måler vindhastighed, lufttryk, temperaturer og vandtemperaturer
English: a weather station on board for measuring wind speed, air pressure and an air and water temperatures

Danish: En dam er et rum i båden hvori der, på grund af en masse huller i bunden af båden, altid er frisk havvand hvor fiskene kan opbevares levende, til de sælges på land.
English: A wet well is a space in the boat, where holes in the base of the hull ensure that there is always a well full of fresh seawater in which to store the live eel, until they are sold on land.

Danish: en hvæssesten
English: a whetstone

Danish: I den ene af disse bådgrave lå en kvinde begravet.
English: A women was buried in one of them.

Danish: En liste langs rælingen, som besætningen kunne placere deres skjolde bag, viser at fartøjet utvivlsomt var et krigsskib.
English: A wooden list running along the gunwale behind which the crew could place their shields, shows that the vessel was undoubtedly a warship.

Danish: En ulden affære!
English: A woolly affair!

Danish: Et opgaveark vil guide igennem udgravningen og stille spørgsmål, der indbyder til aktivitet og fordybelse i udstillingens fortællinger.
English: A worksheet will guide the participants through the excavation and pose questions that encourage activity and absorption of the exhibition’s narrative.

Danish: Et år efter 'Gislingebåden Open-Source' projektet tog sin begyndelse, ser det ud til, at det kan godt lade sig gøre.
English: A year after the Gislinge Boat Open Source Project began, it would seem that yes, they can.

Danish: En zigzag-kurs kan være det du leder efter.
English: A zigzag course could be what you are looking for.

Danish: I nutidens Århus by ligger gaden Immervad stadig.
English: Aarhus river valley has provided optimal conditions for the growth of the city.

Danish: Det er svært at sige noget præcist om bebyggelsens karakter og byplan, fordi de fleste rester af huse for længst er rådnet bort eller ødelagt af senere tiders byggerier.
English: Aarhus' location, in the middle of Jutland's eastern coast and facing towards the Danish islands and the territories around the Kattegat, was strategically well chosen.

Danish: Ådalen ved Århus har haft stor betydning for byen.
English: Aarhus's position here on the river valley made it a key point in Jutland.

Danish: Ude agter er rorskottet passet til.
English: Abaft, the rudder bulkhead is fitted.

Danish: Abhara, en hyrde fra det persiske højland, ender som langfartskaptajn på fjerne mål i Indien og Kina.
English: Abhara, a shepherd from the Persian highlands, ended his days as a long-distance captain sailing between ports in India and China.

Danish: Ombord ses fra venstre, værftets bådebyggerlærling Erik Jochumsen og Carl Sorensen fra Dansk Canadisk National Museum i Edminton, Canada
English: Aboard from the left are the boatyard’s boat builder apprentice Erik Jochumsen and Carl Sorensen from the Danish Canadian National Museum in Edminton, Canada.

Danish: Den altomsluttende audio-visuelle installation tager dig med ud på åbent hav.
English: Aboard the warship, the cramped conditions can be experienced, and chests with warrior equipment reveal the hierarchy aboard.

Danish: På sejladsen vil deltagerne opleve, hvordan det var at være viking til søs.
English: Aboard this sailing trip, you will experience how it is to be a viking at sea.

Danish: Ombord befandt sig 61 moderne mennesker fra store dele af Nordeuropa.
English: Aboard were 61 modern people from a large part of northern Europe.

Danish: Der kendes omkring 150 fund af møntdepoter fra Irland.
English: About 150 coin hoards are known from Ireland.

Danish: Cirka 20 personer sætter sig i en lang række på tofterne i Havhingsten og tager fat i et tykt hampetov, som er en forlængelse af forstaget og løber igennem to blokke for at gøre det nemmere for besætningen, når de haler.
English: About 20 people sit in a long row on the Sea Stallion's thwarts and take hold of a thick hemp rope, which is an extension of the fore stay lower and runs through two blocks to make it easier for the crew when they haul.

Danish: Omkring 25 år efter at skibet blev bygget, blev kølbordene repareret.
English: About 25 years after the ship was built, the keel boards were repaired.

Danish: Cirka 30 år senere blev skibet sejlet til Danmark, hvor det endte sine dage på bunden af Roskilde Fjord som en del af et forsvarsværk mod indtrængende fjender.
English: About 30 years later the ship sailed to Denmark and ended her days on the bottom of the Roskilde Fjord as part of a fortification against enemies traveling on the water.

Danish: Omkring 70 % af Vikingeskibsmuseets besøgende kommer fra udlandet, men det er dog ikke hver uge, at vi kan notere to så prominente besøg, som den forgangne uge bød på.
English: About 70% of visitors to the Viking Ship Museum come from abroad, but it is not every week that we have two such prominent visitors on one week.

Danish: Om kommentarer fra skrivebordet
English: About armchair comments

English: About skjald's diary

English: About skjalds's diary

Danish: Om bogen
English: About the book

Danish: Om webloggen 'Gislinge blog'
English: About the Gislinge blog

Danish: Om rummenes dagbog
English: About the room's diary

Danish: Om skibet selv får vi dels at vide hvor stort det er - 34 rum er en angivelse af, hvor mange spantemellemrum, der har været roere i, og det svarer derfor til 34 par årer - dels at det er lige så højt til rælingen som et havskib.
English: About the ship itself we read first how large it is - 34 rum is an indication of how many spaces between the frames there had been for the rowers and this corresponds to 34 pairs of oars, and secondly the vessel is equally as high up to the gunwale as the gunwale on a sea-going ship.

Danish: Om skibet selv får vi dels at vide hvor stort det er - 34 rum er en angivelse af, hvor mange spantemellemrum, der har været roere i, og det svarer derfor til 34 par årer - dels at det er lige så højt til rælingen som et havskib.
English: About the ship itself we read first how large it is – 34 rum is an indication of how many spaces between the frames there had been for the rowers and this corresponds to 34 pairs of oars, and secondly the vessel is equally as high up to the gunwale as the gunwale on a sea-going ship.

Danish: Ovenfor ses modellen under og efter udspænding.
English: Above you can see the model durring and after expansion.

Danish: Ovenfor ses en 1:10 model før og efter udspændning.
English: Above, you can see the 1:10 model after expansion.

Danish: Akademikere bidrager med deres viden om den udgravede genstand og dennes kulturhistoriske sammenhæng, mens håndværkere bidrager med deres praktiske kunnen og forståelse af materialer.
English: Academics contribute with their knowledge about the excavated artefact and its cultural and historical context, while craftsmen bring their practical skills and understanding of materials to bear.

Danish: Ifølge Ansgars Levned omvendte han mange dér, og fik tilladelse til at bygge en kirke.
English: According to Angar's Life History, he converted many people here and obtained permission to build a church.

Danish: Ifølge den klassiske geometri er solkurven derfor enten en hyperbel, en parabel eller en ellipse.
English: According to classical geometry the sun curve is therefore a hyperbola, a parabola or an ellipse.

Danish: I Helge Hundingsbane historie står, at krigsskibene endda havde særskilt vagtpost til, at spejde efter fjenden.
English: According to Helge Hundingsbane's story warships had a special watch for looking out for the enemy.

Danish: Når vinden rammer forliget, (den forreste kant af sejlet), tvinges luftstrømmen til at ændre retning og hastighed.
English: According to Newton's third law, an object A (the sail), which influences an object B (the air) with a force, will be subject to an equally great force in the opposite direction.

Danish: Ifølge den danske krønikeskriver Saxo kom to af Harolds sønner og en datter til Danmark til deres onkel, Kong Svend Estridsen.
English: According to the Danish chronicler Saxo, two of Harold's sons and a daughter came to Denmark to their uncle, King Sven Estridsson.

Danish: Ifølge Gulatingloven fik hvert besætningsmedlem en løn på 1 øre pr. måned.
English: According to the Gulating Law each member of the crew was paid a salary of 1 øre per month.

Danish: Ole Crumlin-Pedersen understreger ifølge Roskilde Tidende den 20. juni 1969, at "man i bestyrelsen havde ønsket at åbne allerede nu (5 år før vikingeskibene forventedes færdigopstillet, red.), da Vikingeskibshallen skal være et levende museum, hvor publikum kan følge det spændende restaureringsarbejde".
English: According to the newspaper Roskilde Tidende from 20 June 1969, Ole Crumlin-Pedersen emphasised that “the board had expressed a wish to already open now (5 years before the Viking ships were expected to be completed, ed.), since the intention is that the Viking Ship Museum should be a living museum where the public can follow the exciting restoration work”.

Danish: På tværs af sunde og bælter og langs uvejsomme kyster bragte langskibene krigere og ufred - men også orden, struktur og statsmagt, der hen ad vejen førte til at de nordiske kongeriger fandt deres plads i Europa.
English: Across sounds and belts and along trackless coasts the longships carried warriors and discord - but also order and the power of the state and this led gradually to the Nordic kingdoms finding their places within Europe.

Danish: På tværs af sunde og bælter og langs uvejsomme kyster bragte langskibene krigere og ufred – men også orden, struktur og statsmagt, der hen ad vejen førte til at de nordiske kongeriger fandt deres plads i Europa.
