English: In the Viking Ship Hall a small exhibition on the Vikings on Greenland and the advetures of the modern crew can be seen throughout the entire sailing period.

Danish: I Vikingeskibshallen kan børn i alle aldre prøve en vikingedragt, skrive med runer, spille vikingespil og høre om vikingernes liv.
English: In the Viking Ship Hall, children of all ages can try on Viking costumes, write with runes, play a Viking game and hear about life in the Viking Age.

Danish: I Vikingeskibshallen viser vi særudstillingen 'The World in the Viking Age', der sætter vikingernes sørejser i et globalt perspektiv og fortæller historien om 800-tallets søfart, der ændrede verden.
English: In the Viking Ship Hall, you can see the special exhibition, 'The World in the Viking Age', which sets the voyages of the Vikings in a global perspective and tells the story of how 9th century seafaring changed the World.

Danish: I Vikingeskibshallen arbejder væveren på det 27 kvadratmeter store uldsejl til båden.
English: In the Viking Ship Museum, the weaver is working on the 27-square-metre woollen sail.

Danish: I Vikingernes værksteder for børn deltager alle aktivt og kan selv fremstille en amulet i gevir, sy en pung af læder, lave smykker af farvestrålende glasperler eller lære at skrive med runer.
English: In the Vikings’ Workshops for Children, everybody participates actively and can make an amulet from antler, sew a leather pouch, make jewellery from colourful glass beads or learn to write with runes.

Danish: I Vikingernes Kølvand
English: In the Wake of the Vikings

Danish: I den uge, testen varede, var der heldigvis både stærk kuling, der krævede hele to reb i det ellers meget stabile skibs sejl, og mere “yndigt” vejr, hvor fuldt sejl næsten var for lille en sejlføring.
English: In the week of the trials there were fortunately near gale-force conditions, requiring a full two ropes in the sail of this otherwise very stable ship, as well as more 'pleasant' weather in which a full sail was almost too little canvas.

Danish: I weekenderne inviterer Vikingeskibsmuseet børn og voksne med ud på en spændende rejse i vikingernes verden!
English: In the weekends, the Viking Ship Museum invites children and adults to take part in an exciting journey in the Vikings' world!

Danish: I weekenderne inviterer Vikingeskibsmuseet børn og voksne med ud på en spændende rejse i vikingernes verden!
English: In the weekends, the Viking Ship Museum invites children and adults to take part in an exciting journey in the Vikings’ world!

Danish: I værkstedet kan du arbejde med frisk egetræ og prøve kræfter med det værktøj, der også bruges af museets bådebyggere.
English: In the workshop, you can work with fresh oak and try your hand with the same tools the Museum's boatbuilders use.

Danish: I år 1874 blev gjort et stort skattefund, Mandemarke-Skatten, ved Busenehave på Møn.
English: In the year 1874 a great tresure.find was made at Busenehave on the Island of Møn.

Danish: Skjaldene gør i deres digte brug af kenninger som er omskrivninger af almindelige begreber så de bliver til mytiske betegnelser.
English: In their poems the scalds use kennings - conventional metaphors for everyday concepts, which create a somewhat dramatic and poetic tone.

Danish: Under disse forhold er der meget pres på sideroret, både i rorvidjen, men også i rorstroppen.
English: In these conditions there is much pressure on the side-rudder, both on the wicker-band, but also on the rudder-strap.

Danish: Spantekonstruktionen er meget raffineret på denne båd.
English: In this boat the frame construction is very refined.

Danish: I denne bog fremlægger arkæolog Ole Crumlin-Pedersen de udspændte bådes arkæologiske baggrund, mens bådebygger Hanus Jensen fortæller om bygningen af de tre rekonstruktioner.
English: In this book, archaeologist Ole Crumlin-Pedersen presents the archaeological background of expanded boats, while boat-builder Hanus Jensen describes how the three reconstructions were built.

Danish: I denne bog redegør Morten Gøthche for færøbådens historie, og belyser bådens bygning, brug og betydning for det færøske samfund.
English: In this book, Morten Gøthche, investigates the history of the Faroese boat.

Danish: I denne bog fremlægger arkæolog Ole Crumlin-Pedersen (†) de udspændte bådes arkæologiske baggrund, mens bådebygger Hanus Jensen fortæller om bygningen af de tre rekonstruktioner.
English: In this book, Ole Crumlin-Pedersen (†) analyses the archaeological context of the three boat finds, and Hanus Jensen describes the building of the reconstructed boats.

Danish: I denne bog giver Ole Crumlin-Pedersen, den danske pioner inden for den maritime arkæologi, et fascinerende overblik over mere end fyrre års arbejde.
English: In this book, Ole Crumlin-Pedersen, the Danish pioneer of maritime archaeology, gives a fascinating overview of more than forty of years of work.

Danish: I dette tilfælde er det energiselskabet E.ON Danmark som står bag havvindmølleparken, den såkaldte Rødsand 2.
English: In this case, the energy company E.ON Danmark are the developers behind the offshore sea turbine park, the so-called Rødsand 2.

Danish: I denne forbindelse erfarede vi at det kan lade sig gøre at agterste asdreng sidder fast og at man samtidig kan flytte beitåsen.
English: In this connection we discovered that it is possible to let the aftermost ássdreng sit fast and that one can at the same time move the tacking boom.

Danish: I denne tidlige periode var målet først og fremmest klostrene, som var de eneste større centre med tæt befolkning og stor rigdom, og hovedmålet var at finde guld, sølv og slaver
English: In this early period the principal targets were the monasteries which were the only large centres of population and wealth and the main quest was for loot and slaves.

Danish: I denne opgave skal vi finde ud af, hvor effektivt Havhingsten vender.
English: In this exercise we will find out how efficient The Sea Stallion is at turning.

Danish: I denne opgave skal du undersøge, hvor godt Havhingsten krydser op mod vinden.
English: In this exercise you will investigate the ability of The Sea Stallion to tack against the wind.

Danish: I denne opgave skal du bruge et GIS til at analysere Havhingstens observationer fra togtet til Dublin.
English: In this exercise you will use GIS to analyse The Sea Stallion's observations from the voyage to Dublin.

Danish: I denne opgave skal du bruge et GIS til at analysere Havhingstens observationer fra togtet til Dublin.
English: In this exercise you will use GIS to analyse The Sea Stallion’s observations from the voyage to Dublin.

Danish: I denne støbeform kunne man både støbe kors og torshamre.
English: In this mould both crosses and Thor's hammers could be cast.

Danish: I denne støbeform fra Danmark kunne man både støbe torshamre og kors.
English: In this mould from Denmark, both Thor's hammers and crosses could be cast.

Danish: I denne periode er der visse ligheder mellem mønstret fra Hjortspring og bevæbningen i det øvrige Europa.
English: In this period, there are certain similarities between the pattern displayed by the Hjortspring find and armaments in the rest of Europe.

Danish: Vikingernes våben var i denne periode forskellige fra de irske, og generelt af en bedre kvalitet.
English: In this period, Viking weapons were different from Irish ones, and were generally of better quality.

Danish: I dette forskningsprojekt blev flere af de uafklarede forhold udforsket og løsninger på de talrige gåder der omgav skibsgraven blev fremført.
English: In this research project, the above mentioned uncertainties were investigated afresh leading to a better understanding of the ship, the grave-goods and the archaeological and historical context of the ship-grave.

English: In this way, maritime cultural heritage is preserved and given further to future generations, both in a tangible ship but also as an embodiment of intangible heritage, where craft work and knowledge about Viking Age boatbuilding methods are kept alive.”

English: Inside the boat were found the re-mains of ten rows of cleats for fastening lashings around elegantly-shaped frames, each consisting of a thwart with carved seats for two men, and an arched hazel branch held as a bent rib by vertical supports under the thwarts and a horizontal cross beam.

English: Inspiration is also found in the American-journalistic style of National Geographic, and in 2007, his images of the Sea Stallion from Glendalough graced both the cover and a 17-page article in the Scandinavian version of the magazine.

English: Inspired by similar North-German fishing boats, the so-called Zeesboote, the eeldrifter was designed by boatbuilders on the island of Fejø, north of Lolland.

English: Instead, the boat's rocker had to be increased so that the curvature of the plank was reduced to 12 cm. On the inner sides of the strakes, a total of 198 cleats were made with square holes for the lashings from the frames, and on each of the stem-tops there were four cleats for the hogging truss.

English: It also has to be taken into account here that the coin representations are without doubt the most official and most regulated of the illustration programmes in which Viking-Age artists were engaged.

Danish: Det betyder på den anden side, at ikke alle har fået opfyldt deres ønsker, men det er nu en gang vilkårene på Havhingsten".
English: It also means, of course, that there will be people who will be disappointed in not gaining their dreamt of place aboard - but we have to put the ship's requirements first.”

Danish: Det ser ud til, at der var to hovedveje, omtrent hvor Peter Street og High Street ligger i dag.
English: It appears that there were two main thoroughfares, roughly where Peter Street and High Street are today.

Danish: Det er blevet en meget fin jolle af Lynæstypen, med sin karakteristiske runde hæk og fyldige linier.
English: It became a very fine Lynæs type dinghy, with the characteristic rounded stern and ample lines.

Danish: Det kan være vanskeligt at sortere i indholdet og at gennemskue om hele fortællingen er sandfærdig.
English: It can be difficult to sift the contents and tell whether the whole narrative is truthful.

Danish: Det er bestemt ikke ufarligt at sejle et åbent skib ud i de urolige farvande, vi skal igennem.
English: It can be quite dangerous to sail an open deck ship in the troubled waters we have to go through.

Danish: Umiddelbart kan det dog siges, at der er pæleorm i alle plader både fra Skærbæk og Hirtshals, bl.a. fordi pæleormsforekomsterne i 2002 har bredt sig uventet langt ind i Østersøen og helt til Bornholm.
English: It can be reported that there are shipworms in all the experimental wood from both Hirtshals and Skærbæk, as the occurrence of shipworms in 2002 had extended unexpectedly far into the Baltic and all the way to Bornholm.

Danish: Den kan rigges med et sprydstagssejl som vist (og evt et sværd).
English: It can be rigged with a sprit sail as shown (and possibly a leeboard).

Danish: Det har næppe heller været ønskeligt at vise skibene i deres rette proportioner, fordi det ville gøre tapetet meget længere og menneskeskikkelserne mindre fremtrædende.
English: It can hardly have been desirable to show the ships in their correct proportions, since that would have made the tapestry much longer and the human figures less prominent.

Danish: Det kan synes sparsomt med brugbare oplysninger, men ved gennemlæsninger opdager man, konkrete oplysninger om fx størrelsen på vandtønder, indretninger af sovepladser, beklædning på Atlanterhavet, regler for kvinder om bord og ikke mindst størrelsen på de flåder der angreb England.
English: It can seem as though useful information is rare, but after reading through these exuberant texts several times you discover definite information on the size of water barrels, arrangement of sleeping spaces, clothing for the Atlantic, rules for women on board, and not least the size of the fleets that attacked England.

Danish: Det kan tage rimelig lang tid at passe så store bord til.
English: It can take a long time to adjust the fit of a plank.

Danish: Det består af en central, kraftig del, hvori mastesporet er udhugget, og to lange ”arme”, der strækker sig mod for og mod agter i skibet.
English: It comprises a central robust section into which the step of the mast has been cut, and two long "arms" which extend out towards the stem and stern, respectively.

Danish: Det består af en lodret pind, der kaster en skygge på underlaget.
English: It consists of a vertical stick, which throws a shadow on an underlay.

Danish: Især spejder man efter vraggods eller andet, vi kan sejle ind i. Det kan være fatalt og betyde Havhingstens forlis, hvis jeg overser ting i vandet.
English: It could be fatal and mean the loss of the Sea Stallion if I fail to see something in the water.

Danish: Det skildrer begivenhederne op til og under hertug Vilhelms erobring af England i 1066, og består af en 50 cm høj og 70 m lang, broderet dug.
English: It describes the events leading up to and under William’s conquest of England in 1066 and consists of a 50 cm-wide and 70 m-long embroidered linen frieze.

Danish: For det åbnede jo først det år vi blev studenter i 1969, og Roskilde Katedralskole var flyttet ud på 'landet' med lærkesang og åbne marker hele vejen ud mod Svogerslev.
English: It didn't open until the school year of 1969 and by then Roskilde Cathedral School had moved out to the country, surrounded by bird songs and open fields.

Danish: Kan holde sig flere måneder, smager godt og man skulle efter sigende ikke blive træt af det.
English: It doesn´t get bad for months, tastes good and supposedly you will never tire of it.

Danish: Det blev til hele 206 cm!
English: It ended up an entire 206 cm above sea level!

Danish: Den strækker sig mod nordøst fra Vendsyssels faste moræneland mellem Frederikshavn og Hirtshals.
English: It extends out to the northeast from the solid moraine landscape of Vendsyssel between Frederikshavn and Hirtshals.

Danish: Kan det forventes, at hævnen af blod vil komme fra nord?
English: It fell ominously from the roof towards the north, even though the sky was cloudless.

Danish: Byen blomstrede i denne periode, og dens første biskop blev indviet i 1107.
English: It flourished during this period, and its first bishop was consecrated in 1107.

Danish: Den gir varme, energi og næring og er med til at holde maveni orden.
English: It gives the body warmth, energy and sustenance and helps keeping the stomach working.

Danish: Sjægterne var slanke, lette og hurtige både.
English: It had a well amidships for storing live fish.

Danish: Asger tog nogle prøver, som blev sendt til Hussvamp Laboratoriet for analyse, og problemet var identificeret som Oksetungesvamp.
English: It had attacked the very centre of the oak but the samples taken confirmed that it hadn't extended further outwards.

Danish: Det har haft dæk af løse planker for og agter, og midtskibs et åbent lastrum med plads til omkring 4 tons last.
English: It had decks of loose planks fore and aft and an open hold amidships with room for about 4 tons of cargo.

Danish: Det var ikke forlist eller sænket, men blev fundet under en højt beliggende gravhøj, hvor der var udsyn over Kertinge Nor.
English: It had not sunk or been wrecked, but was found below a burial mound high in the terrain looking out over Kertinge Nor.

Danish: Det var ikke forlist eller sænket, men blev fundet under en højt beliggende gravhøj, hvor der var udsyn over Kertinge Nor. Alt træværk i fartøjet var rådnet væk, men de mange nagler af jern, som havde holdt skibets planker sammen, lå stadig på deres plads.
English: It had not sunk or been wrecked, but was found below a burial mound high in the terrain looking out over Kertinge Nor. All the woodwork in the vessel had rotted away, but the many iron rivets, which had held the ship's planks together, still lay in place.

Danish: Det skulle gøres med maner.
English: It had to be done in a proper manner.

Danish: Der er også fundet spor af arbejde med jern på øen.
English: It has a central hearth, benches and evidence of a drain.

Danish: Det har enkelte reparationer, men virker ikke slidt, og har formodentlig kun været få år gammelt, da det forliste i bunden af Roskilde Fjord.
English: It has a few repairs, but does not seem worn and was probably only a few years old when it sank at the end of Roskilde Fjord.

Danish: Den har en god rod, men selve vidjen er ikke så pæn som den første.
English: It has a good root, but the tackle itself is not as nice as the first.

Danish: Den har en lille sprydstagsrig eller luggerrig og sværd, så den krydser bedre.
English: It has a small sprit sail rig or lugsail rig and leeboard so that it beats to windward better.

Danish: Det har været en simpel, men effektiv måde at komme omkring på, og jollen har bragt fisk hjem til mange familier langs de danske kyster.
English: It has been a simple but effective way of getting around, and the dinghy has brought fish home to many families along the Danish coasts.

Danish: Det er blevet fremført, at det var i løbet af deres tid i Nordengland, at vikingerne fik kendskab til by skabelse, og at det var dem, der tog ideen med sig til Dublin i begyndelsen af 900-tallet.
English: It has been argued that it was during their time in the north of England that the Norse learned about urbanisation, and it was they who brought it to Dublin in the early tenth century.

Danish: Det er besluttet, i samråd med Nationalmuseets bevaringsafdeling, at lade plastikafdækningen blive liggende, indtil vinduesafskærmningen er væk, for at beskytte skibene mest muligt mod støv.
English: It has been decided in consultation with the National Museum's conservation department, to let the plastic cover remain until the window covering is gone, to protect the ships as much as possible against dust.

Danish: Det har været spændende at følge hele projektet gennem de 12 år."
English: It has been exciting to follow the whole project over the last 12 years."

Danish: Det er blevet foreslået, at denne begravelse i en simpel nedgravning repræsenterer en faldet kriger, som blev gravlagt i al hast.
English: It has been suggested that this burial in a simple pit may represent a fallen warrior who was given a hurried burial.

Danish: Det er blevet bakket flot op af Roskilde kommune og af regionen.
English: It has been well backed up by Roskilde City Council and the Region.

Danish: Den er bearbejdet med et tydeligt fordybning i midten, hvor håndværkeren er begyndt på et hul, der formodentlig skulle gå hele vejen igennem amuletten.
English: It has been worked and has clear hollow in the middle, where the craftsman began boring a hole, which most likely was intended to go the whole way through the amulet.

Danish: Den har kløvede, håndhuggede bord, håndsmedede søm, uldsejl, lindebast tovværk osv. Vi mener at Gokstadbåden oprindeligt var en regattabåd.
English: It has cleaved, handmade planks, handmade nails, woollen sails, linden tree cordage etc. We believe that the Gokstad boat was originally a regatta boat.

Danish: Men af og til er det sket, at en stædig kaptajn har trodset DMI’s anbefalinger.
English: It has happened though, from time to time that a stubborn captain has disregarded the DMI’s suggestions.

Danish: Det har ligget i værkstedet gennem længere tid for at tørre optimalt op.
English: It has lain in the workshop for a long time, to allow it to dry out.

Danish: Den er aldrig blevet presset tilnærmelsesvist så længe og så hårdt.
English: It has never been pushed any where near so long and so hard.

Danish: Den har ikke udsugning, så det støver fra det tørre egetræ.
English: It has no extractor, so the dry oak generates a lot of dust.

Danish: Det har taget 27.000 timer, fordelt på fire år, at bygge selve skibet.
English: It has taken 27,000 man hours - distributed over four years - to build the ship itself.

Danish: Det har taget 27.000 timer, fordelt på fire år, at bygge selve skibet.
English: It has taken 27,000 man hours – distributed over four years – to build the ship itself.

Danish: I den forbindelse har det været nødvendigt at åbne budgettet igen for at frigøre midler til aktiviteter, der kan tiltrække publikum.
English: It has therefore been necessary to open the budget again in order to free up funds for activities that can attract the public.

Danish: Det skal ske tidligt, inden byen vågner, så dagens første etape bliver et slæb bag en lille flodslæbebåd.
English: It has to happen early, before the city awakes, so the day's first stage is a tow behind a small tug boat.

Danish: Det er - om forhåbentlig ikke klimakset - så et betydningsfuldt højdepunkt inden den del af eksperimentelarkæologien, som vedrører rekonstruktioner af vikingeskibe.
English: It is - if hopefully not the climax - then a significant peak within that part of experimental archaeology concerned with the reconstruction of Viking ships.

Danish: Det er 36 meter langt - 6 meter længere end Havhingsten,” fortæller Tinna Damgård-Sørensen.
English: It is 36 metres long - 6 metres longer than the Sea Stallion,” Tinna Damgård-Sørensen says.

Danish: Det er 36 meter langt - 6 meter længere end Havhingsten,” fortæller Tinna Damgård-Sørensen.
English: It is 36 metres long – 6 metres longer than the Sea Stallion,” Tinna Damgård-Sørensen says.

Danish: Det er en udfordring for bådebyggerne at få bordene pænt rundt, ind til agterstævnen.
English: It is a challenge for the boatbuilders to get the strakes neatly round into the stern.

Danish: Det er et lukket arrangement, men River Cottage filmer det til en dokumentar, der bliver tilgængelig for alle.
English: It is a closed event, but River Cottage is filming it for a documentary that will be accessible to all.

Danish: Det er et kompakt og stærktbygget skib, karakteriseret af et sammentrængt rummodul med tætsiddende bundstokke, biter og tofter, samt en skarp bund med opretstående kølbord.
English: It is a compact and sturdily built vessel, characterised by similarly compact partitioning modules with closely-spaced frames (floor timbers), cross-beams and thwarts together with a sharp bottom with upright garboard.

Danish: Det er et hårdt slag for Vikingeskibsmuseet, men det er også et stort tab for Roskilde, ja for hele Danmark.
English: It is a hard stroke for the Viking Ship Museum, but also a great loss for Roskilde, and for the whole of Denmark.

Danish: Det er overliggerdag og døsigheden har sænket sig over besætningen, efter et par begivenhedsrige dage...
English: It is a lay over day and the sleepyness is visible amongst the crew members after a couple of eventfull days...

Danish: Det er nemlig væsentligt nemmere at ro i sø og modvind med mast og alt stående gods nede.
English: It is a lot easier to row in a swell and against a contrary wind when the mast and rigging are down.

Danish: Om vikingerne bevidst har konstrueret skibene fleksible, eller om skibenes fleksibilitet er et resultat af deres teknologi og den konstruktion, hvormed de er bygget, kan diskuteres.
English: It is a matter of discussion as to whether the Vikings deliberately built their ships to be flexible or whether it is the result of their technology and the way the ships were built.

Danish: Det er en gåde, hvordan vikingerne uden GPS, magnetkompas eller sekstant kunne finde vej over åbent hav.
English: It is a mystery how the Vikings managed to sail across open sea without GPS, magnetic compass or sextant.

Danish: Det er en rekonstruktion af det lille krigsskib Skuldelev 5.
English: It is a reconstruction of the small warship, Skuldelev 5.

Danish: Båden er en kopi af en langbåd fra 1700-tallet, et kaptajnsfartøj på en af Napoleons fregatter.
English: It is a replica of an 18th century longboat that was used by the captain of one of Napoleon's frigates.

Danish: Det er et sideror, ligesom på andre skibe og både fra vikingetiden.
English: It is a side-rudder, just like on other ships and boats from the Viking Age.

Danish: Den situation vil jeg meget nødig stå i. Vi ved godt, hvad vi skal gøre, problemet er først og fremmest, at hjælpen udefra er langt væk.
English: It is a situation I would like to avoid – we know what to do, the problem is that help is far away.

Danish: Det er en historie, som udfordrer forankrede forestillinger om fortiden og nutiden, og om tidligere generationers evner og muligheder".
English: It is a story that challenges entrenched ideas about the past and present, and the skills and opportunities of previous generations".

Danish: Det en tidskrævende proces, som nutidens mennesker nok sjældent tænker over, når de står med et stykke tøj i hånden.
English: It is a time consuming process that today's people probably rarely think about when faced with a piece of clothing.

Danish: Det er en slags meget koncentreret blanding af grovrugbrød og frugt/nøddekage.
English: It is a very concentrated mixture of whole grain bread and fruit-/nutcake.

Danish: Den er en dejlig udfordring hver gang og en fantastisk mulighed for at formidle vikingetidens bådebygning for publikum”, fortæller Søren Nielsen, leder af museets afdeling for Maritime håndværk og rekonstruktion.
English: It is a wonderful challenge every time and a fantastic opportunity to demonstrate Viking boat building for a wider audience”, explains Søren Nielsen, head of the museums department for maritime craftsmanship and reconstruction.

Danish: Det ligger næsten i menneskets natur at forhold sig til historien – til dét, vi kommer fra.
English: It is almost human nature to relate to history – to where we come from.

Danish: For det moderne menneske er det næsten umuligt at forestille sig, at man kan sejle lange stræk over åbent hav uden en eller anden form for navigationsinstrument.
English: It is almost impossible for modern humans to imagine that it is possible to make long voyages over the open sea without some form of navigation instrument.

Danish: Det er næsten symbolsk.
English: It is almost symbolic.

Danish: Regnar var skeptisk, men sendte bud til gården og indbød pigen til besøg på skibet.
English: It is already a risk in itself to cross the open sea in an open ship with sixty-five people onboard.

Danish: Det er også et tværfaglig arbejdsmiljø, hvor eksperter fra mange forskellige fag, samarbejder om at udforske skibe og søfart i fortiden.
English: It is also a multi-disciplinary working environment, where experts from many different fields collaborate in order to explore ships and seafaring in the past.

Danish: Det er også et aktivt bådeværft, et center for nordisk bådkultur og en forskningsinstitution.
English: It is also an active boatyard, a centre for Nordic maritime culture and a research institute.

Danish: Det forlyder oven i købet, at Havhingsten krydser udmærket mod vinden, hvilket undertegnede uberettiget havde tvivlet på.
English: It is also apparent that the Sea Stallion tacks admirably into the wind, which the present author, wrongly, had doubted.

Danish: Det er også tydeligt at ekspeditionerne havde en leder, en konge eller stormand, som bød over hele flåden, og som de enkelte skibsførere havde et loyalitetsforhold overfor.
English: It is also clear that the expeditions had a leader, a king or magnate, who had command over the whole fleet, and to whom the individual captains had sworn loyalty.

Danish: Men det er også tænkeligt at de samme håndværkere, som byggede og udsmykkede kirkerne, også var dem der byggede og udsmykkede de store skibe.
English: It is also conceivable, however, that the same craftsmen who built and decorated the churches, were also those who built and decorated the great ships.

Danish: I øvrigt er det vigtigt, at gøre sig klart, at der i de skriftlige kilder og traditionen materialemæssigt ofte skelnes mellem reb (reip) og tov (tog).
English: It is also important to be aware that in the various sources and traditions a material distinction is often made between cord (reip) and rope (tog).

Danish: Det er også vigtigt, at dokumentere de faktiske forhold for besætningen undervejs på turen.
English: It is also important to document the actual conditions for the crew on the journey.

Danish: Interessant er det også at ask, askr, som ellers indgår i engelske og irske kilder om danskernes skibe og krigere, og hvis brug er arkæologisk belagt i Skuldelev, ikke optræder som skibsbygningsmateriale i sagadigtningen.
English: It is also interesting that askr ‘ash', which generally occurs in English and Irish sources referring to Danish ships and warriors and whose use is archaeologically documented in Skuldelev, is not mentioned as a material for shipbuilding in saga literature.

Danish: Interessant er det også at ask, askr, som ellers indgår i engelske og irske kilder om danskernes skibe og krigere, og hvis brug er arkæologisk belagt i Skuldelev, ikke optræder som skibsbygningsmateriale i sagadigtningen.
English: It is also interesting that askr ‘ash’, which generally occurs in English and Irish sources referring to Danish ships and warriors and whose use is archaeologically documented in Skuldelev, is not mentioned as a material for shipbuilding in saga literature.

Danish: Der skal også holdes orden ombord og sættes vand på gasblusset til morgenmaden; havregrød og kaffe / te.
English: It is also necessary to keep order on board and put water on the gas-jet ready for breakfast; porridge and coffee/tea.

Danish: Man kan også nogen gange finde land ved hjælp af de skyer, der om sommeren rejser sig over landjorden.
English: It is also possible sometimes to recognise land with the aid of the clouds that are fomed above it.

Danish: Det er også muligt, at billedet skal læses som at de mindre skibe er de mindre betydningsfulde i sammenhængen (hierakisk skalering), eller at de helt enkelt skal forestille mindre fartøjer, både i stedet for skibe.
English: It is also possible that the picture is to be understood as showing that the smaller ships were of less importance (hierarchic scaling), or quite simply that they represent smaller ships, boats rather than ships.

Danish: Der er desuden mulighed for, at indrette særlige sygepladser om bord, hvor patienterne kan få ro og sove.
English: It is also possible to establish sick berths on board where the patients can rest and sleep.

Danish: På hjemmesiden er det ligeledes muligt at følge byggeriet i ord og billeder.
English: It is also possible to follow the building work in words and pictures on the homepage.

Danish: Man kan også gå den anden vej og regne ud, hvad strømmen er: Hvis man ved, at man i virkeligheden har bevæget sig ad en bestemt vektor, og også har holdt øje med, hvad man styrede for at komme frem, kan man trække vektorerne fra hinanden: Fra samme udgangspunkt tegnes de to vektorer.
English: It is also possible to go the opposite way and calculate the current: If you know that you have, in reality, moved along a particular vector and if you have also kept a check on the course you steered to achieve this, the vectors can be subtracted from one another: The two vectors are drawn from the same starting point.

Danish: Også om natten kan man bestemme verdenshjørner og breddegrad, hvis der er klar himmel og tilstrækkeligt mørkt.
English: It is also possible to identify the points of the compass and latitude at night if there is a clear sky and it is dark enough.

Danish: På udvalgte dage og aftener er det muligt at møde medlemmer fra de frivillige bådelaug.
English: It is also possible to meet the members of the volunteer boat societies on selected days and evenings.

Danish: Det er også muligt at se og købe bogsortimentet i webbutikken.
English: It is also possible to view the book selection and make purchases online via the Museum Webshop.

Danish: Det er også almindeligt, at finde kamme af forskellig størrelse, pincetter af jern eller bronze og øreskeer blandt genstandene i gravene.
English: It is also quite normal to find combs of various sizes, pairs of tweezers of iron or bronze, and ear picks (aural scoops) among items in graves.

Danish: Det er også forrygende at se de festlige optagelser fra skibets ankomst til Dublin i august 2007 og heltemodtagelsen på havnen i Roskilde i august 2008.
English: It is also wonderful to see the festive scenes from the ship's arrival in Dublin in August 2007 and the hero's welcome it received at the harbour in Roskilde in August 2008.

Danish: Skjalde optrådte bestemt også ved de danske og svenske hoffer, men i de bevarede digte er det først og fremmest de norske forhold, som bliver belyst.
English: It is certain that scalds often performed at the Danish and Swedish courts but in the surviving verses it is first and foremost Norwegian conditions that are described.

Danish: Det er klart at hensynet til skibet og sejladsen kommer i første række.
English: It is clear that attention to the ship and the voyage is of primary importance.

Danish: Og det siger sig selv at ikke alle har mulighed for at tage så mange dage ud af kalenderen, uden at det på et tidspunkt må stoppe", fortæller skipper Carsten Hvid og fortsætter: "Størstedelen af besætningen er frivillig og uden deres enorme indsats ville dette projekt aldrig være blevet til noget.
English: It is clear that not everybody can take so much time free from other engagements without being forced to stop at some point", explains the captain, Carsten Hvid, and continues: "Most of the crew are volunteers and without their enormous efforts this project would never have got off the ground.

Danish: Det fremgår tydeligt, at skibene er sænket i to omgange, først Skuldelev 1, 3 og 5, dernæst efter få års forløb Skuldelev 2, '4' og 6.
English: It is clear that the ships were sunk on two different occasions, first Skuldelev 1, 3, and 5, and then after an interval of a few years, Skuldelev 2, '4', and 6.

Danish: Det fremgår tydeligt, at skibene er sænket i to omgange, først Skuldelev 1, 3 og 5, dernæst efter få års forløb Skuldelev 2, ’4’ og 6.
English: It is clear that the ships were sunk on two different occasions, first Skuldelev 1, 3, and 5, and then after an interval of a few years, Skuldelev 2, '4', and 6.

Danish: Det er vanskeligt at forestille sig at et større antal heste skulle blive transporteret på denne måde, mens det omvendt er givet, at der var mange heste med - rytteriet var en vigtig del af Vilhelms hær.
English: It is difficult to believe that a large number of horses could be transported in this way, although it is on the other hand certain that there must have been many horses on the ships – the cavalry was an important part of William’s army.

Danish: Det er svært at forestille sig, at en enkelt storm kan rive 44 skibe med sig, men dette anker og roret fra St. George, som vi fandt for syv år siden, er faste vidnesbyrd om hændelserne" fortæller afdelingsleder Jørgen Dencker fra Vikingeskibsmuseets marinarkæologi som deltog i bjærgningen.
English: It is difficult to imagine that one single storm could sink 44 ships, but the anchor and rudder from the St. George that we found seven years ago, are firm evidence of the events" explains Jørgen Dencker, head of the Viking Ship Museum's marine archaeology department, who participated in the salvage operation.

Danish: Det er svært at sige om bådebyggeren var en del af besætningen om bord på vikingernes krigsskibe.
English: It is difficult to say whether the boat builder was part of the crew on board Viking warships.

Danish: Det er let at forestille sig, at skibene i Vikingetiden kunne få alvorlige skade som et knækket ror eller et hul i skroget, og det samme kan ske for Havhingsten.
English: It is easy to imagine how ships in the Viking Age could suffer serious damage, such as a broken rudder or a hole in the hull, and the same could happen to the Sea Stallion.

Danish: De traditionelle Nordiske både er tydeligt i nær familie med vikingeskibet.
English: It is easy to see that the traditional Nordic boats are closely related to Viking ships.

Danish: Den er klippet af Henrik Bech Peterson, Lydia og programmeret af Tore Dalsgaard, Vikingeskibsmuseet.
English: It is edited by Henrik Bech Peterson from Lydia and programmed by Tore Dalsgaard from the Viking Ship Museum.

Danish: Der findes omkring 20.000 skibsvrag i Danmark fra stenalderen og frem til nutiden.
English: It is estimated that Danish waters contain some 20,000 shipwrecks dating from the Stone Age to the present day.

English: It will also be the culmination of 25 years’ work in experimental archaeology – which is a special research discipline we have specialised in here at the Museum”, explains Tinna Damgaard-Sørensen, museum director at the Viking Ship Museum in Roskilde.

English: It's about acknowledging the historic basis that constitutes the point of departure for action and about recognising the future consequences of the choices and decisions that we make" explained Tinna Damgård-Sørensen, before she declared the museum's new exhibition as opened.

English: It's almost unbelievable to stand with a piece of worked wood that 8,000 years old, animal bones with traces of Stone Age craftsmens tools and hazelnuts that look like they were cracked yesterday”.

Danish: Byggeriet er beskrevet i Sverres saga, som blev skrevet af Karl Jónsson på opfordring af kongen selv, og det er bemærkelsesværdigt så kritisk sagaen er overfor skibet.
English: Its construction is described in Sverris saga, which was written by Karl Jónsson at the command of the king himself and it is noteworthy how critical the saga is of the ship.

Danish: Dets overordnede dimensioner og proportionsforhold mellem længde og bredde passer inden for fløjternes karakteristika: et langt og slankt fartøj, selv om det er blevet fremhævet, at typerne fløjter (karakteriseret ved et rundt agterskib) og pinasser (karakteriseret ved at have et agterspejl) har haft større lighedstræk end antaget.
English: Its dimensions and relationship between length and breadth fit in with the characteristics of the vessel-type: a long and narrow hull with full ends; though Ab Hoving has pointed out the similarity between the flute (characterised by a round stern) and the pinnace (characterised by a flat transom).

Danish: Netop den store længde har gjort det nødvendigt for skibsbyggerne at gribe til usædvanlige løsninger.

English: It’s about acknowledging the historic basis that constitutes the point of departure for action and about recognising the future consequences of the choices and decisions that we make" explained Tinna Damgård-Sørensen, before she declared the museum’s new exhibition as opened.

Danish: Det har gjort det muligt for os at komme i kontakt – og have en dialog – med andre bådebyggere og håndværksentusiaster over hele verden.

Danish: Det er er spændende at følge med i, hvordan bådebyggerne først åbner en lille flække i hele stammens længden, og så langsomt - med større og større kiler og masser af tunge slag med muggerter - får åbnet stammen mere og mere og får tvunget fibrene i egetræet fra hinanden indtil den massive stamme splittes i to.
English: It’s an exciting process to witness, as the boatbuilders first use small wedges to create a small split in the root end of the log and then slowly – with larger and larger wedges and heavy blows from their mallets – work the split deeper into the log, forcing the fibres to split until the massive log eventually splits in two.

English: Land’s End was rounded at midnight between Monday and Tuesday after 24 hours of sailing in gale-force winds.

English: Language: Danish and English

English: Large areas that look sailable at high tide can change completely within 6 hours.

English: Large birds of prey and drawn bows!

English: Large cargo ships as indicators of specialised merchant seafaring

English: Large cargo vessels are expensive to build and operate, but if they are used efficiently, their large cargo capacity can be a very profitable source of income for their owners.

Danish: Store grupper af krigsskibe betegnes som flotar, flåder, men en floti kan også betegne alle mændene på en flåde.

English: Large groups of warships are referred to as flotar ‘fleets’ but a floti can also denote all the men in a fleet.

English: Large parts of the midship and the starboard side of the bow are preserved.

English: Large parts of the three upper rows of planks and a single large rib had previously been part of other vessels.

Danish: Især store, faste og lidt syrlige æbler er gode at tørre.
English: Large, firm, slightly sour apples are especially good for drying.

English: Larne Viking Grave

English: Larsen in 1921

English: Larsen, Anne-Christine et al. (eds) 2008: Havhingsten fra Glendalough/The Sea Stallion fra Glendalough Roskilde-Dublin 2007.

Danish: I nat sov besætningen på banjedækket i fregattens hængekøjer – en lidt anden luksus end flade liggeunderlag og uldtæpper.
English: Last night the crew slept on the canon deck in the ships’ hammocks – a different kind of luxury than sleeping mats and wool blankets of the Sea Stallion.

Danish: I går aftes ankom vi til Sønderborg efter næsten 24 timer undervejs.
English: Last night we arrived in Sønderborg after almost 24 hours at sea.

Danish: Sidste melding er, at vinden løjer i nat, så sejler vi forhåbentlig….
English: Last we heard the wind will die down during the night and then hopefully we will set sail.

Danish: I sidste uge blev sidste hånd lagt på listen over besætningsmedlemmer, og i den kommende tid vil der blive arbejdet med Havhingstens sejlrute.
English: Last week, the crew list was finalised and the next phase will involve working out the sailing route for Sea Stallion.

Danish: Sidste år kunne flere millioner mennesker jorden rundt følge de dramatiske begivenheder der fulgte i kølvandet på skibet under rejsen fra Roskilde til Dublin, nord om Skotland i et af de mest udfordrende farvande i verden - uden motor - med råsejl - og 60 årer.
English: Last year several million people worldwide were able to watch the dramatic events that followed in the wake of the ship during its voyage from Roskilde to Dublin, round the north of Scotland through some of the most dangerous waters in the world - with no motor - just a square sail and 60 oars.

Danish: Sidste år modtog museet de første 2 millioner og pengene var i høj grad med til at sikre den historisk regnfulde, men meget succesfulde sejlads fra Roskilde til Dublin.
English: Last year the Museum received the first 2 million and the money really made a difference to the historically rainy but very successful voyage from Roskilde to Dublin.

Danish: Sidste år kom Havhingsten hjem til museumshavnen igen og her bliver skibet liggende sommeren over.
English: Last year the Sea Stallion returned home to the museum harbour and the ship will remain here all summer.

Danish: Sidste år sejlede skibet fra Roskilde til Norge på 36 timer – i alt 240 sømil.
English: Last year the ship sailed from Roskilde to Norway in 36 hours – 240 nautical miles in all.

Danish: Det viste sig sidste år, at vi havde brug for et sekretariat, tæt på begivenhederne men at det i perioder var nærmest umuligt at håndtere museets nyhedsformidling ombord på Havhingsten.
English: Last year we found that we needed a secretariat close to events but that it was sometimes almost impossible to manage the Museum's news dissemination on board the Sea Stallion.

Danish: Det viste sig sidste år, at vi havde brug for et sekretariat, tæt på begivenhederne men at det i perioder var nærmest umuligt at håndtere museets nyhedsformidling ombord på Havhingsten.
English: Last year we found that we needed a secretariat close to events but that it was sometimes almost impossible to manage the Museum’s news dissemination on board the Sea Stallion.

Danish: Sidste år oplevede museet en markant øget interesse for at komme tættere på vikingernes både.
English: Last year, the museum noticed a marked increase in the number of visitors interested in experiencing the Viking ships more directly.

Danish: Stænglerne skal tørre helt, inden de brækkes (brydes) for at frigøre den træagtige marv fra fibrene
English: Lastly, a hackle (comb with long iron teeth) is used to remove the final impurities and straighten the fibres

Danish: Til sidst trækkes hørren gennem et bræt med flere rækker spidse jerntænder (en hegle) for at fjerne de allersidste urenheder og rede fibrene ud
English: Lastly, a hackle (comb with long iron teeth) is used to remove the final impurities and straighten the fibres

Danish: Senere i livet er det gået op for mig, at det var et stykke kulturhistorie, der gik tabt.
English: Later in life I realised that it was a piece of cultural history that was lost.

Danish: I en senere artikel vil vi fortælle mere om skibet og rederiet.
English: Later in our newsletter, we will follow up with an article about the ship and the company.

Danish: Senere fik Ribe en egentlig befæstning, da bygrøften blev erstattet af en 8 meter bred voldgrav med vold på indersiden.
English: Later in the 9th century Ribe had a regular fortification when the town ditch was replaced by an 8 m wide moat with a rampart on the inner side.

Danish: Senere på efteråret når husdyrene blev slagtet, har man tørret, røget og/eller saltet kødet.
English: Later in the autumn, when the livestock were slaughtered, the meat was dried, smoked and/or salted.

Danish: I det videre arbejde hentedes også inspiration i danske bronzealderfund, keltiske fund fra Tyskland og Svejts samt et gotlandsk vikingetidsfund.
English: Later inspiration was also derived from Danish Bronze-Age finds, Celtic finds from Germany and Switzerland and a Viking-Age find from Gotland.

Danish: Af senere skriftlige kilder fremgår det dog, at bispesædet i Ribe var meget magtfuldt og allerede omkring 1000 e. Kr. kontrollerede store dele af Jylland.
English: Later written sources relate, however, that the Episcopal Residence in Ribe was very powerful and that by around AD 1000 it already controlled large areas of Jutland.

Danish: Efterfølgende er der foretaget analyser af kalfatringen og andre materialer (3.2).
English: Later, analyses were made of the caulking and other materials (3.2).

English: Later, in the evening, the viewers could watch the ship return to the fjord on the Danish Broadcasting Company’s ‘TV-Avisen’ and on the ‘TV2 Nyhederne’.

Danish: Senere blev sølvmønter almindelige og man betalte med et antal mønter.

Danish: Senere skulle også andre konger have haft deres kongsgård i Avaldsnes.
English: Later, other kings are also thought to have had their royal seat in Avaldsnes.

English: Later, these sailing directions were written down and many of them know from early Middle Age are probably from the Viking Age.

Danish: Senere, mens skibet endnu befandt sig i et område med adgang til fyrreskov, er det blevet ombygget ved påbygning af en bred syvende bordgang.
English: Later, while the ship was still in a region where there was access to pine forests, it was converted by the addition of a broad seventh strake.

English: Less than twenty-four hours after the Sea Stallion arrived at Kyleakin on the Isle of Skye new crew members were there, ready to take over and participate on the second half of the test sail from Roskilde to Dublin.

English: Like Dublin, archaeological excavations in Waterford have produced a large amount of evidence for the late Viking Age and Medieval settlement.

English: Like many of the letters, it has not been seen by anybody and will remain unopened until 2258.

English: Like Skuldelev 6, the original Skuldelev 1 was built in Sognefjord in Norway around the year 1030.

English: Like the deck, the ring deck is also made from larch.

English: Like the men they form part of the watches, and they are also expected to be able to sail the ship, bail out water, row and manage strenuous, physical tasks as well as the rough weather conditions at sea.

Danish: Ligesom vikingerne drikker Havhingstens besætning også mest vand.
English: Like the Vikings, the crew on the Sea Stallion also mostly drink water.

Danish: Den færøske båd er som vikingeskibene en let konstruktion, spids i begge ender, med høje stævne og et markant spring.
English: Like Viking ships, the Faroese boat has a light construction, is double-ended with high stems and has a marked sheer.

English: Limited number of places for children between 4-15 years old.

English: Lining the stems and keel up correctly takes time, and they are therefore first set temporarily in position while the final adjustments are made.

English: Link to the ship's route, and this weekend's festival "Water, wind and Vikings':

English: Location Vikingeskibshallen

English: Logan bread consists of whole-grain flour, syrup, butter, dried fruits and nuts, chocolate and coconuts.

English: Logbook-note from the skipper: Warning of gale keeps Ottar Anholt

English: Login on Laug-net

English: Login on Laug-net

English: Logs were cleaved rather than sawn.

Danish: Lokes Frimænd vil kæmpe til sidste blodsdråbe, musikere og deres instrumenter vil fylde luften med et sidste musikalsk farvel, bueskytter vil skyde til måls og berette om teknikken bag langbuen, markedspladsen vil danne ramme om gode handler og - ikke at forglemme - 65 gaster og alt deres udstyr vil langsomt, men sikkert finde plads på Havhingsten inden det store togt til Dublin.
English: Lokes Frimænd (a Viking fighting group) will fight to the last drop of blood, musicians will play a last musical farewell, archers will compete and tell all about the techniques behind the longbow, the market place will set the setting for fine trades, and - most importantly - 65 people and all their equipment will slowly but steadily find a place on the Sea Stallion before the great expedition for Dublin.

Danish: På latin hedder London og Lund det samme - Hvorfor?
English: London and Lund have the same name in Latin – why is this?

Danish: Lange planker i skibssiden øger styrken i langskibet, og er af stor betydning i lange, smalle konstruktioner som langskibene.
English: Long planks in the hull contribute to the strength of a longship and are of great importance in the long, narrow constructions seen in these vessels.

Danish: Langskib med særtransport
English: Long ship with special transport

Danish: Langskibene fra Hedeby
English: Long Ships from Hedeby

Danish: Længde
English: Longitude

Danish: Longphort betyder skibshavn og er sammensat af det latinske navis longa, som hentyder til langskibene, og portus som betyder havn.
English: Longphort means ship harbour and is compounded of the Latin navis longa, which refers to the longships, and portus, which means harbour.

Danish: Ordet Longphort opstod, da en irsk munk i Vikingetiden skulle beskrive den bebyggelse, vi i dag kender som byen Dublin.
English: Longphort means ship harbour and is compounded of the Latin navis longa, which refers to the longships, and portus, which means harbour.

Danish: Deres skrogform er i meget høj grad dikteret af ro-funktionen, og det er derfor væsentligt at forsøge at indkredse, hvorfor dette var så vigtigt.
English: Longship hull design was largely determined by the rowing requirement and it is therefore important to establish why rowing was so important to the Vikings.

Danish: Langskib i storslået landskab nær Loch Inver 23. juli 2007.
English: Longship in a beautiful landscape near Loch Inver, 23rd July 2007.

Danish: Langskibe fundet ud for den polske Østersøkyst
English: Longships found of the Polish Baltic coast

Danish: Kig på et danmarkskort og et bykort og find ud af hvordan sted- og gadenavne dannes i dag.
English: Look at a map of your country and work out how place and street names are given today.

Danish: Se på den historiske baggrund for begivenheden.
English: Look at the historic background for the event.

Danish: Kig på skibets spor.
English: Look at the trace of the ship.

Danish: Ved at snakke med besætningsmedlemmer og se dem arbejde, må man beundre deres entusiasme, og jeg kunne mærke at mange af dem virkelig forstod, hvad det betyder at befinde sig ombord på Havhingsten til havs”.
English: Looking at the crew and talking to some of them I admire their enthusiasm and I feel that some of them really appreciate what it could be like at sea on the Sea Stallion”.

Danish: Passer på hinanden
English: Looking out for each other

Danish: Masser af vraggods, vandet har efterladt, da det trak sig tilbage, en væltet kopi-runesten og et undermineret dansegulv.
English: Lots of debris, the water left behind as it withdrew, an overturned reconstruction of a rune stone and an undermined the dance floor.

Danish: Der skal masser af varme og vand til, før båden kan spændes ud.
English: Lots of heat and water is required in order to expand the boat.

Danish: Og Louise fik sig lidt af en forskrækkelse, da hun så Havhingsten på sin vej igennem søerne på Skagerrak.
English: Louise got a bit of a scare on the bridge when seeing the Sea Stallion on Skagerrak.

Danish: Har været ansat på Vikingeskibsmuseet siden 2003 - i de første år som studerende.
English: Louise has been employed at the Viking Ship Museum since 2003 - initially as a student.

Danish: Louise Henriksen, der er gast i midtskibet på Havhingsten, kom til skade med sit knæ, da hun skulle pøse vand over essingen - det der kaldes rælingen på moderne skibe.
English: Louise Henriksen, crew member in the mid ship on the Sea Stallion hurt her knee when bailing water over the rail.

Danish: Louise er også historiker og skriver om kampen om England, de store konger og tekster til de forskellige figurer på skibet.
English: Louise is also a historian and she’s writing about the battle for the throne of England, the great kings and the text attached to the different figures on the ship.

Danish: Louise fik sovet til klokken syv i morges, hvor der ventede hende et - for en gast på Havhingsten - fyrsteligt morgenmåltid med blandt andet æg og nybagte boller.
English: Louise slept untill seven and woke up to a great breakfast with eggs and freshly baked bread.

Danish: "Jeg havde ikke været på skibet ret længe, før fem besætningsmedlemmer havde
English: Louise was impressed by the help she received one 'Cable One'.

Danish: Elsker dig.
English: Love you.

Danish: At lægge og rejse masten på Havhingsten kan gøres forbløffende hurtigt på trods af, at det er en ret kompliceret affære, hvor en meget lang række handlinger, som er uddelegeret til enkeltpersoner og grupper, skal falde i en meget bestem rækkefølge for at alt lykkes.
English: Lowering and raising the mast on the Sea Stallion can be done surprisingly quickly despite being a quite complicated affair, requiring a large number of actions delegated to individuals and groups being done in a very definite sequence if everything is to be successful.

Danish: Ved et, for os, heldigt tilfælde blev der i Skuldelevspærringen sænket skibe, der repræsenterer to byggemåder (i løvtræ og i nåletræ), tre oprindelsesområder (Danmark, Norge og Irland) og fem forskellige transportbehov (fiskeri og andre daglige ærinder, korte og længere handelsrejser, lokalt forsvar og overregional magtudøvelse).
English: Luckily for us, ships representing two construction methods (in hardwood and softwood), three areas of origin (Denmark, Norway and Ireland), and five different transportation types (fishing and other daily trips, short and long trading voyages, local defence and the projection of regional power) were sunk in the Skuldelev barrage.

Danish: Ham her var retvokset.
English: Luckily, this tree is perfect.

Danish: Heldigvis kommer den fra den rigtige retning.
English: Luckily, though, it's coming from the right direction.

Danish: Frokosten er groft rugbrød, som vi har fået specielt fremstillet (og doneret) fra Kohberg.
English: Lunch is whole grain rye bread, specially made (and donated) by Kohberg.

Danish: Lund bliver det første ærkebispesæde i Norden i 1104 og flere af byerne påbegynder opbygningen af prægtige domkirker i sten allerede i slutningen af 1000-tallet og begyndelsen af 1100-tallet.
English: Lund became the first archiepiscopal see in the Nordic Countries in AD 1104 and as early as the conclusion of the 11th century and the beginning of the 12th century several of the towns began the construction of magnificent cathedrals in stone.

Danish: Luksusvarer og hverdagsting, der har rejst om bord på skibene, og som giver et levende billede af udveksling af varer og ideer i den nye, åbne verden vikingerne var del af.
English: Luxury goods and everyday items, which have travelled on board ships and which painted a vivid picture of the exchange of goods and ideas in the new, open world, which the Vikings were part of.

Danish: Kostbarheder strømmede til landene omkring Den Persiske Golf, og for første gang i næsten 1000 år var Middelhavet ikke den maritime handels midtpunkt.
English: Luxury goods flooded into the lands surrounding the Persian Gulf, and for the first time in almost 1,000 years, the Mediterranean was no longer the main centre of maritime trade.

Danish: I projektbeskrivelsen skriver Mads Thomsen:
English: Mads Thomsen defines the project in this way:

Danish: Mads Thomsen ser Havhingsten sejlads som en fantastisk mulighed for at udvide sit forskningsfelt og undersøge hvordan vikingerne var med til at ændre verdens gang.
English: Mads Thomsen sees the voyage of the Sea Stallion as a fantastic opportunity to extend his field of research and study the impact of the Vikings on the natural world.

Danish: Mads Thomsen vil derefter indsamle prøver fra Vikingeskibsmuseets traditionelle både, liggende i museumshavnen, for at vurdere om det 'introducerede biologiske samfund' på Havhingsten afviger fra de organismer der findes på de lokale både.
English: Mads Thomsen will then collect samples from the Viking Ship Museum's traditional boats in the museum harbour to see if the “introduced biological community” on the Sea Stallion differs from the organisms found on the local boats.

Danish: Post-doc forsker Mads Thomsen fra Afdeling for Marin Økologi, Danmarks Miljøundersøgelser, arbejder til dagligt med 'introducerede marine organismer' og har rettet henvendelse til Vikingeskibsmuseet for at få lov til at indsamle prøver fra Havhingstens skrog under vandlinjen.
English: Mads Thomsen, from the Department of Marine Biology at Denmark's National Environmental Research Institute, is doing Post Doc research on “introduced marine organisms”, and he asked the Viking Ship Museum if he could collect samples from the Sea Stallion's hull under the water line.

English: Male graves contain weapons such as swords, spearheads and shields and the female graves contain personal ornaments such as oval brooches.

English: Malmö (in collaboration with the Viking Ship Museum), 122 pages.

English: Malthe cleaves the crooked timbers with the same technique used when radially cleaving the straight oaks; straight through the centre and along the rays of the tree.

English: Manned by a group of volunteers, this cargo vessel managed to cover the distance faster than Wulfstan did in his time.

Danish: Med sin 65 mand store besætning sejler Havhingsten den lange vej fra Vikingeskibsmuseet i Roskilde, over Nordsøen, nord om Skotland og gennem Det Irske Hav til Dublin.
English: Manned with 65 crew members the Sea Stallion will venture all the way from the Viking Ship Museum in Roskilde, cross The North Sea, north of Scotland and pass The Irish Sea to Dublin.

English: Many activities have been planned in conjunction with the build, so that visitors to the Museum can experience all the aspects of the boatbuilding project.

Danish: Mange arkæologiske fund understreger, at Avaldsnes var et vigtigt sted allerede inden vikingetiden.
English: Many archaeological finds underline the importance of the place already in the Viking Age.

Danish: Børn fra Orø Skole, som har bidraget med breve til fremtidens børn, fyldte godt op på plænen.
English: Many children from Orø School, who contributed letters to the children of the future, were there on the grass lawn.

Danish: Da byens katedral og øvrige kirkers klokkespil begyndte at blande sig med tågehorn og folks jubel, var der rigtig mange besætningsmedlemmer, som mere eller mindre skjult, måtte knibe flere tårer.
English: Many crew members had teary eyes when the bells on Christ Church Cathedral and other Dublin Churches mixed with the foghorns and the crowd cheering.

Danish: Mange besætningsmedlemmer var mødt op for a følge skibets på dets foreløbigt sidste rejse gennem byen.
English: Many crew members were in the streets to follow the ship on its last jouney through Dublin city.

Danish: Mange kendte søfarer har kastet los fra denne by.
English: Many famous seamen have cast off from Portsmouth.

Danish: Mange håndstore sten fandtes i fundlaget sammen med knogler af hest, hund, lam og kalv.
English: Many fist-size stones were found in the find-layer, together with bones of a horse, dog, lamb and calf.

Danish: I mange gravfund er en del af det personlige udstyr ligeledes spillebrikker og terninger, enten lavet af glas, ben, tak, tand eller horn.
English: Many graves also contain gaming pieces and dice made of glass, bone, antler, tooth or horn.

Danish: Mange har været del af projektet helt tilbage fra søsætningen af Havhingsten i 2004.
English: Many have been part of the poroject since its beginning in 2004.

Danish: Flere gaster har medtaget kort og små skakspil med magneter.
English: Many have brought cards and magnetic chess games.

Danish: Det er vanskeligt at anslå effekten af de tidligste vikingeangreb.
English: Many monasteries were never attacked, and attacks were not equally severe.

Danish: Nogle klostre blev aldrig udsat for angreb, og heller ikke alle angreb var lige alvorlige.
English: Many monasteries were never attacked, and attacks were not equally severe.

Danish: Mange måneder senere kom Havhingstens irske besætningsmedlem John Nicholl igen til Wicklow havn, og her på ydermolens rå beton, så han Havhingsten sirligt og detaljeret afbildet.
English: Many months later, the Sea Stallion's Irish crew member, John Nicholl, visited Wicklow harbour again and he saw a meticulous and detailed image of the Sea Stallion on the raw concrete of the outer pier.

Danish: Mange måneder senere kom Havhingstens irske besætningsmedlem John Nicholl igen til Wicklow havn, og her på ydermolens rå beton, så han Havhingsten sirligt og detaljeret afbildet.
English: Many months later, the Sea Stallion’s Irish crew member, John Nicholl, visited Wicklow harbour again and he saw a meticulous and detailed image of the Sea Stallion on the raw concrete of the outer pier.

Danish: Mange tons brænde er også nødvendig, for at fremstille den trækul, der skal til for at forsyne ovnen og essen.
English: Many more tonnes of wood are required in order to produce the charcoal required to fuel the furnace and the fires of the forge.

Danish: Mange rigninger får i dag allerede fra begyndelsen hestehårsreb i skøderne.
English: Many of our boats today are rigged from the start with horsehair rope in the sheets.

Danish: Se de aktuelle datoer og læs mere om sejladserne ved at klikke på linkene herunder:
English: Many of the boats were built at the Museum's own boatyard and a sailing trip is the perfect way to complete your visit.

Danish: Mange af de arbejdsteknikker, som man kendte og brugte dengang, var i mange år gået tabt, og har måttet genfindes på ny, når man f.eks. vil rekonstruere et skib som Havhingsten.
English: Many of the craft techniques, which were used at that time, were later lost and had to be rediscovered when wishing, for example, to reconstruct a ship like the Sea Stallion.

Danish: Derfor måtte mange af hullerne dækkes til og nye huller skæres ved siden af.
English: Many of the holes had therefore to be covered over and new holes cut beside these.

Danish: Mange af de ting, som blev fragtet rundt med skibe, havde knap været kendte uden for deres hjemegne, inden søfarten gjorde dem tilgængelige.
English: Many of the objects that filled the hulls had been literally unknown beyond their region before seafaring made them available.

Danish: Mange af de kildemæssige problemer som følger det skriftlige kildemateriale kan dog afhjælpes ved sammenligning mellem de forskellige kildegrupper.

Danish: Og mange af dem vil fortsætte som aktive sejlere i nogle af Vikingeskibsmuseets andre både.

English: Many of these can also be found through other links on this website

English: Many of these graves also reveal evidence of religious practices, showing for example that gifts were given to the deceased for their life after death.

Danish: Mange af disse byer i Irland og Storbritannien var påvirket på godt og ondt af vikingernes ekspansion mod vest.
English: Many of these towns in Ireland and Great Britain experienced both the positive and the negative influences of the Vikings' expansion towards the west.

English: Many offers throughout April

Danish: Mange steder havde allerede en kirke, en stormandsgård og var allerede befæstet, men erobrernes ankomst betød en øget omsætning og gav flere steder stødet til en egentlig bydannelse med handel, lokaladministration, forsvar og kirke.
English: Many places already had a church, a chieftain's farmstead and were fortified, but the arrival of the conquerors resulted in increased turnover and gave several places a push in the direction of proper urban development with commerce, local administration, defence and the Church.

Danish: Mange steder havde allerede en kirke, en stormandsgård og var allerede befæstet, men erobrernes ankomst betød en øget omsætning og gav flere steder stødet til en egentlig bydannelse med handel, lokaladministration, forsvar og kirke.
