English: Oselver tolværing from Os in Norway, 1998

Danish: Vikingeskibsmuseet har blandt andet mulighed for at opstille en udstilling om projektet i museumsområdet.”
English: Other attractions include the D-day Museum, where you can see the Overlord Embroidery (modern tapestry).

Danish: Øvrige afgange sælges i billetsalget på dagen efter princippet 'Først til mølle'.
English: Other departures are sold on the day at the Ticket office on a 'first come, first served' basis.

Danish: Andre eksempler omfatter:
English: Other examples include;

Danish: Udover sværdet indeholdte graven:
English: Other finds from the burial include:

Danish: Øvrige fund af dele af vikingernes langskibe
English: Other finds of the Viking Longships

Danish: Vikingesølvet i Irland blev forvandlet til forskellige former for spænder og armringe.
English: Other forms, such as torcs made of twisted silver wires, are less common.

Danish: Af øvrigt udstyr omfatter fundet enkelte beslag og nåle af bronze, snore med øjer, tuden til en blæsebælg, værktøjer af træ, træskiver med håndtag, en drejet tallerken samt fem fint drejede genstande: tre små trædåser, en skål og en lille cylindrisk beholder.
English: Other objects in the find include a few fittings and pins of bronze, cords with eyelet holes, the nozzle of a bellows, wooden tools, wooden discs with handles, a turned plate and five finely turned objects: three small wooden containers, a dish and a small cylindrical container.

Danish: Til for- og agterstævnene, planker, knæ og spanter er det vigtigt at vælge træ med de rette karakteristika.
English: Other pieces are selected for the fore and after stems, planks, frames and knees.

Danish: Andre teorier nævner Vilhelms hustru, dronning Matilda af Flandern, eller Edward Bekenderens hustru, dronning Edith af Wessex, som mulige ophavskvinder til værket.
English: Other theories name William’s wife, queen Matilda of Flanders, or Edward the Confessor’s wife, queen Edith of Wessex, as possibly being responsible for the work.

Danish: Andre gange har vi rebet sejlet for at sagtne farten, for ikke at nå for tidligt til en bestemt passage, som ikke kunne passeres i andet end strømstille eller medstrøm.
English: Other times we have reefed the sail to reduce speed so as not to arrive too early at a passage that could not be passed if the tide was against us.

Danish: Andre kendte fortidsminder tæller det sønderjyske voldanlæg Dannevirke, ringborgene og broen over Ravning ege ved Vejle.
English: Other well-known ancient monuments include the Danevirke defensive structure in Southern Jutland/Schleswig, the circular strongholds, and the bridge across Ravninge meadows near Vejle.

Danish: Andre mere abstrakte - som skibets form og karakter, der kan fortælle os om skibets funktion, farvandsområde, ”bygherrens” ønsker og de intentioner bådebyggeren havde for skibets sejlegenskaber.
English: Others are more abstract, such as the ship' s form and nature, and these can tell us about the ship' s function, the waters in which it sailed, the “contractor' s”wishes and the intentions that the boat-builder had for the ship' s sailing characteristics.

Danish: Andre mere abstrakte - som skibets form og karakter, der kan fortælle os om skibets funktion, farvandsområde, ”bygherrens” ønsker og de intentioner bådebyggeren havde for skibets sejlegenskaber.
English: Others are more abstract, such as the ship's form and nature, and these can tell us about the ship's function, the waters in which it sailed, the ‘contractor's' wishes and the intentions that the boatbuilder had for the ship's sailing characteristics.

Danish: Andre mere abstrakte - som skibets form og karakter, der kan fortælle os om skibets funktion, farvandsområde, ”bygherrens” ønsker og de intentioner bådebyggeren havde for skibets sejlegenskaber.
English: Others are more abstract, such as the ship’ s form and nature, and these can tell us about the ship’ s function, the waters in which it sailed, the “contractor’ s”wishes and the intentions that the boat-builder had for the ship’ s sailing characteristics.

Danish: Andre mere abstrakte - som skibets form og karakter, der kan fortælle os om skibets funktion, farvandsområde, ”bygherrens” ønsker og de intentioner bådebyggeren havde for skibets sejlegenskaber.
English: Others are more abstract, such as the ship’s form and nature, and these can tell us about the ship’s function, the waters in which it sailed, the ‘contractor’s’ wishes and the intentions that the boatbuilder had for the ship’s sailing characteristics.

Danish: Andre havde karakter af, at være mere planlagte byanlæg fra starten, evt. opbygget af konge eller en anden lokal stormand.
English: Others had, from the very beginning, the character of more planned urban structures, perhaps built up by the king or a local chieftain.

Danish: På andre inskriptioner findes navnene på mændene, pralende historier om deres bedrifter og vittigheder.
English: Others inscriptions show names of the men, boastful tales of their exploits and jokes.

Danish: Andre fortæller, om hvordan de fulgte med i Havhingstens togt til Irland og retur i 2007 - 2008.
English: Others tell about how they followed Sea Stallion's voyage to Ireland and back again in 2007 - 2008.

Danish: Andre drog ud af nysgerrighed, som Ottar, der efter eget udsagn sejlede til Hvidehavet ”for at finde ud af, hvor langt landet mon kunne strække sig”.
English: Others were driven by curiosity, like Ohthere, who sailed to the White Sea of his own volition, “to find out how far the land extended”.

Danish: Andre har trukket sig på grund af helbred eller fordi de har indset, at projektet er for omfattende eller udfordrende.
English: Others withdrew because of their physical condition or because they realised that the project is too massive or challenging.

Danish: Ellers alle raske.
English: Otherwise all are well.

Danish: Ellers alle raske.
English: Otherwise all are...

Danish: Ellers ingen yderligere tegn på skamfiling på riggen.
English: Otherwise no signs of chafing in the rigging.

Danish: Ellers vil de to kræfter søge at dreje båden omkring en akse, og båden bliver "hård på roret" - man skal hele tiden kompensere for bådens tendens til at dreje.
English: Otherwise the two forces will attempt to turn the boat about an axis and the boat becomes "hard on the helm" - it is necessary to compensate constantly for the boat's tendency to turn.

Danish: Ellers vil de to kræfter søge at dreje båden omkring en akse, og båden bliver "hård på roret" - man skal hele tiden kompensere for bådens tendens til at dreje.
English: Otherwise the two forces will attempt to turn the boat about an axis and the boat becomes "hard on the helm" – it is necessary to compensate constantly for the boat's tendency to turn.

Danish: Men Kattegat er stille!
English: Otherwise, Kattegat is calm!

Danish: Men ellers blev den færøske båd bygget af træ, der blev importeret fra Norge.
English: Otherwise, the Faroese boats were built with wood imported from Norway.

Danish: I efteråret 2003 blev den 16 meter lange havknar Ottar (Skuldelev 1) testsejlet i det sydlige Kattegat med Hundested som basishavn.
English: Ottar (Skuldelev 1) the 16 m seagoing knarr, was tested in the autumn of 2003 in the southern part of the Kattegat with Hundested as the base harbour.

Danish: Ottar - Logbog og dagbog fra skibsskjalden
English: Ottar - Log book-notes and travel blogs

Danish: Ottar - fotos fra besætningen
English: Ottar - Photos from the crew

Danish: OTTAR her.
English: OTTAR calling.

Danish: Ottar laster ca. 20 tons, bærer råsejl og sejler med en besætning på mellem 6 og 15 personer.
English: Ottar can carry about 20 tons, has square sails and a crew of between 6 and 15 people.

Danish: Ottar er en rekonstruktion af Skuldelev 1.
English: Ottar is a reconstruction of Skuldelev 1.

Danish: Ottar kan ses i Museumshavnen.
English: Ottar is lying in the Museum Harbour.

Danish: Ottar returnerer til Anholt.
English: Ottar returns tol Anholt.

Danish: Ottar sejlede imidlertid forbløffende godt og tørt under de afprøvede forhold.
English: Ottar sailed amazingly well under all the test conditions.

Danish: Ottar tager endnu en nat på Anholt - besætningen håber på bedre vind i morgen.
English: Ottar takes another night at Anholt - the crew hopes for better wind tomorrow.

Danish: Ottar under sejlads
English: Ottar under sail

Danish: Ottar er bygget af fyrretræ på Vikingeskibsmuseets værft i 1999 - 2000.
English: Ottar was built of oak, pine and lime at the museum boatyard in 1999-2000.

Danish: Ottar sejler fra Vikingeskibsmuseet den 25. juni, og det forventes at returnere den 7. august.
English: Ottar will sail from the Viking Ship Museum on 25 June and is expected to return on 7 August.

Danish: Ottars sommertogt 2015
English: Ottar's Voyage 2015

Danish: Ottar, Havhingsten fra Glendalough, Helge Ask, Roar Ege og Kraka Fyr - alle museets fem rekonstruktioner sætter sejl i den kommende weekend
English: Ottar, the Sea Stallion from Glendalough, Helge Ask, Roar Ege and Kraka Fyr, all of the museum’s five reconstructions, will set sail next weekend.

Danish: Handelsskibet Ottar: Uge 27 - 28
English: Ottar: Week 27-28

Danish: Den største konstruktionsmæssige succes i år er nok vores nye rorvidje.
English: Our biggest construction success this year was the new rudder tackle.

Danish: En fire uger lang testsejlads til Norge i sommeren 2006 har forsikret mig om, at vi har et særdeles sødygtigt skib.
English: Our four-week test voyage to Norway in the summer of 2006 has given me full assurance that we have an extremely seaworthy ship, and a crew capable of mastering it.

Danish: Vores mål er, at kunne bygge disse lokale fjordjoller som de blev bygget traditionelt.
English: Our goal is to be able to build these local fjord dinghys as they would have been built traditionally.

Danish: Vores mål er at få eleverne til at søge rundt på siden.
English: Our goal is to get schoolchildren to explorer the site.

Danish: Havhingsten sejler ud på TOGT!
English: Our guilds - a historic society

Danish: Vores irske besætningsmedlemmer mener, at tidevandet betyder det samme for dem, som årstiderne betyder for os.
English: Our Irish crew members think the tides mean as much for them as the seasons do for us.

Danish: Vores moderne samfund har i aller højeste grad præget disse farvande, som er nogle af de mest befærdede og intensivt udnyttede i verden.
English: Our modern society has significantly impacted these waters, which are amongst the busiest and most intensively used in the world.

Danish: ESTHER kunne se jer for sejl ,ved Strynø,ved siø/langelandsbroen ,jeg var nødt til bare at køre for ikke at misse ankomst,Det gik Jo stærkt.
English: Our photographer at the Museum has been filming Anna's work and will be editing the material together once the project is over.

Danish: Vi har prioriteret at gå i havn og formidle projektet, og vi har valgt at sejle, når det var muligt.
English: Our priority has been going into harbours and explaining the project, and sailing when possible.

Danish: Folkene bag Carsten Brebøl-fonden blev nemlig opmærksomme på projektet via den megen presseomtale, træningssejladsen kastede af sig,” fortsætter Tinna Damgård-Sørensen.
English: Our project caught the attention of the people behind the Carsten Brebøl-foundation because of all the media publicity generated by the test voyage,” Tinna Damgård-Sørensen says.

Danish: Vores lidt søvnige ”lejr” rutine blev brudt og stemningen var høj.
English: Our rather sleepy “camp” routine was disrupted and the atmosphere was high.

Danish: Vores forskning sejler rundt ude på havet og indsamler resultater, som er til at forstå for enhver, der interesserer sig for vikingetid, træskibe og sømandskab,” siger Preben Rather Sørensen.
English: Our research is sailing the ocean and collecting results, understandable for anyone who is interested in the Viking Age, wooden boats and seamanship”, says Preben Rather Sørensen.

Danish: Vores sejladserfaringer med rekonstruktioner af de større fartøjer fra vikingetiden viser imidlertid, at dette er et svagt led i vikingernes skibe.
English: Our sailing trials with reconstructions of larger Viking Age ships have shown that this is a weak point on Viking ships.

Danish: Vores dygtige faghåndværkere deler deres kundskaber med museets besøgende, der herefter kan prøve selv.
English: Our skilful craft specialists share their knowledge with the Museums's guests, so they can try it themselves.

Danish: De dygtige smede vil både fortæller om og demonstrerer den ædle smedekunst - og du kan selv få lov at smede med!
English: Our skilled blacksmiths will both demonstrate and explain the noble art of blacksmithing - so come and join in!

Danish: Vores skipper opfordret ligefrem til aftenbøn om vestenvind…
English: Our skipper has even suggested that we pray for westerly winds before going to sleep.....

Danish: Og skipper tilbød regenten og prinsgemalen et lift tilbage til ’Dannebrog’, hvis der skulle have interesse.
English: Our skipper then offered to escort the queen and the prince back to the royal ship, if interested.

Danish: Opholdet udviklede meget hurtigt tætte relationer til både befolkning og bystyret, der stillede en lokal skole til rådighed, så besætningen kunne komme under fast tag og sove.
English: Our stay quickly led to a good relationship with the people of Wicklow and its town council, who placed a local school at our disposition so the crew could sleep under a roof.

Danish: Vores klasselærer Michael hauser havde fortalt os, at det var en tur på 12 kilometer - det grinede vi meget af, for det troede vi ikke på.
English: Our teacher Michael Hauser had told us that it was a 12 kilometre walk - we laughed a lot and didn't believe him.

Danish: Vores træskibe sejler ud flere gange dagligt på en-times ture på den smukke Roskilde Fjord.
English: Our wooden ships sail several times a day, for an hour-long trip on the beautiful Roskilde Fjord.

Danish: Herude er der god plads på begge sider af floden Spree.
English: Out here, there is lots of room on both sides of the Spree.

Danish: Udsolgt.
English: Out of print.

Danish: Ude af øje, ude af sind”.
English: Out of sight, out of mind.

Danish: Udenfor Dublin, er Church Bay på Rathlin Island den eneste anden vikingegravplads i Irland.
English: Outside of Dublin, Church Bay on Rathlin Island is the only other probable Viking cemetery in Ireland.

Danish: Udenfor på værftspladsen mødte den Bhutanske delegation Vikingeskibsmuseets bådebyggere, der fortalte om byggeriet af rekonstruktionen af vikingeskibet Skuldelev 6, der i øjeblikket er i fuld gang.
English: Outside on the shipyard site, the Bhutanese delegation met the Viking Ship Museum's boat-builders, who talked about the work on the reconstruction of a Viking ship, Skuldelev 6, which is currently in full swing.

Danish: Udenfor på værftspladsen mødte den Bhutanske delegation Vikingeskibsmuseets bådebyggere, der fortalte om byggeriet af rekonstruktionen af vikingeskibet Skuldelev 6, der i øjeblikket er i fuld gang.
English: Outside on the shipyard site, the Bhutanese delegation met the Viking Ship Museum’s boat-builders, who talked about the work on the reconstruction of a Viking ship, Skuldelev 6, which is currently in full swing.

Danish: Ovale spænder og en skål fundet ved Ballyholme, Bangor, Co. Down.
English: Oval brooches and bowl found at Ballyholme, Bangor, Co. Down.

Danish: Ovale skålspænder findes næsten udelukkende i forbindelse med kvindebegravelser, mens våben - som for eksempel sværd og spydspidser - kun findes i mandsgrave.
English: Oval brooches have almost always been found with female burials while weapons such as swords and spearheads are exclusive to male interments.

Danish: Ovale skålspænder findes næsten udelukkende i forbindelse med kvindebegravelser, mens våben – som for eksempel sværd og spydspidser – kun findes i mandsgrave.
English: Oval brooches have almost always been found with female burials while weapons such as swords and spearheads are exclusive to male interments.

Danish: Skålspænder har været genstand for omfattende studier, og på baggrund af deres form er det nu muligt at datere dem med ret stor nøjagtighed.
English: Oval brooches have been studied extensively and it is possible to date them approximately, based on their form.

Danish: Ovale, skålformede spænder blev båret sætvis af kvinderne og brugt til at fæstne kjolens stropper - én ved hver skulder.
English: Oval brooches were worn by women and were used to fasten the straps of their dresses at the shoulders.

Danish: Ovale, skålformede spænder blev båret sætvis af kvinderne og brugt til at fæstne kjolens stropper – én ved hver skulder.
English: Oval brooches were worn by women and were used to fasten the straps of their dresses at the shoulders.

Danish: Ovn- og saltbagte pastinakker
English: Oven-baked parsnips

Danish: På kortere strækninger måltes med GPS svingende værdier på 7,4-8,2 knob.
English: Over shorter distances, speeds varying between 7.4 and 8.2 knots were measured with GPS.

Danish: Regnen har gennem de mange tusinde år udvandet jernet fra tørven og kan derfor ligge som en skal i højen, kaldet allaget.
English: Over the many hundreds of years the rain has washed the iron from the peat and it has formed a shell in the mound, called the hardpan layer.

Danish: I løbet af de næste tre år, kan du følger byggeprocessen her på hjemmesiden.
English: Over the next three years, you can follow the progress with the build here on the website.

Danish: I løbet af de næste tre år, kan du følger byggeprocessen i billeder her på hjemmesiden.
English: Over the next three years, you can follow the progress with the build in pictures here on the website.

Danish: I løbet af de næste to år, blev Roar Ege bygget af en gruppe frivillige på museets bådeværft.
English: Over the next two years, a group of volunteers built Roar Ege at the Museum boatyard.

Danish: I løbet af de næste år, blev de fem skibe dokumenteret, konserveret og rekonstrueret for at blive udstillet i den nybyggede Vikingeskibshal.
English: Over the next years, the five ships were documented, conserved and reconstructed for exhibition in the newly-built Viking Ship Hall.

Danish: Igennem fem år har mere end 250 frivillige besætningsmedlemmer fulgt hinanden i dramaer og begivenheder.
English: Over the past five years, more than 250 volunteer crew members have accompanied each other through dramas and events.

Danish: Vikingeskibsmuseets marinarkæologer er i disse uger travlt optaget af de omfattende undersøgelser på det første af to træskibsvrag i Femern Bælt.
English: Over the past two weeks, the Viking Ship Museum's maritime archaeologists have been busy with a detailed study of the first of two wooden shipwrecks in the Fehmarn Belt.

Danish: Mange har i løbet af sommeren henvendt sig med ønske om at komme med.
English: Over the summer, there were a lot of people who wanted to join us.

Danish: I løbet af weekenden vil hele skibet gennemgå et grundigt tjek-up, så det er optimalt rustet til den krævende tur hjem til Danmark.
English: Over the weekend, the whole ship will have a thorough check-up, so it is well prepared for the demanding trip home to Denmark.

Danish: Igennem årene har det givet holdet mulighed for at finpudse deres evner og forfine deres håndværk.
English: Over the years, this has allowed the team to hone their skills and perfect their craft.

Danish: Livet ved kysten og udnyttelsen af de marine ressourcer i Norden og naboområderne langs Østersøen og Vesterhavet har igennem årtusinder affødt materiel kultur og kulturelle mønstre der er værd at undersøge og dokumentere.
English: Over thousands of years, coastal life and the exploitation of marine resources in Scandinavia and its neighbouring areas around the Baltic and North Sea have produced material culture and cultural patterns, which are worth investigating and recording.

Danish: Ejet af Kertemindeegnens museer.
English: Owned by Kerteminde Museums.

Danish: Ejer:
English: Owner:

Danish: Ilt og jernindhold
English: Oxygen and iron content

Danish: Side 2
English: Page 2

Danish: Bemaling, sejl og rig
English: Painting, sail and rig

Danish: Maling: Vibeke Bischoff, Rikke Johansen
English: Painting: Vibeke Bischoff, Rikke Johansen

Danish: Paperback udgave.
English: Paperback edition.

Danish: Formmæssige paralleller til de drejede trædåser findes i senere førromersk keramik fra Bornholm og Gotland, og fra samtidig keramik fra et område omkring Hamburg.
English: Parallels in shape to the turned wooden containers are found in late Pre-Roman ceramic ware from Bornholm and Gotland, and from contemporary ceramics from around the Hamburg area.

Danish: Forældre: Ethelred den Rådvilde og Emma
English: Parents: Ethelred the Unready and Emma

Danish: Forældre: Svend Tveskæg og Gunhild
English: Parents: Svein Forkbeard and Gunhild

Danish: Hér vil det være udstillet indtil skibet skal forberedes til hjemrejsen i forsommeren 2008.
English: Parked here the ship will be on exhibit until the preparations start for the voyage back to Roskilde in early summer of 2008.

Danish: Sammen med fartøjet, med uden forbindelse med dette i øvrigt, blev blandt andet fundet en del af en lille modelbåd af fragtskibsfacon.
English: Part of a small model cargo ship was found along with the vessel, but without any other connection to it.

Danish: Endvidere er fundet en del af en stævn, som ikke hører til det sammenhængende vrag, men som pt. heller ikke lader sig kæde sammen med det andet fund.
English: Part of a stern post was also found, which does not belong to the intact wreck, but which also cannot be connected to the other find at present.

Danish: Scene fra Hedebys havn.
English: Part of Haithabu's harbour.

Danish: En del af forklaringen kan dog også ligge i, at de to fartøjer har været bygget for forskellige farvande.
English: Part of the explanation could be, however, that the two ships were built for different sailing conditions.

Danish: En del af marinarkæologiens problem er, at man ikke kan se den, fordi den ligger under vandet.
English: Part of the problem for marine archaeology is that you can’t see this cultural heritage, because it’s under water.

Danish: En del af din opgave er at identificere og frasortere disse målinger.
English: Part of your task is to identify and remove these records.

Danish: På aftensejladsen får du indblik i kunsten at sejle med råsejl.
English: Participants are welcome to bring food or evening coffee.

Danish: Deltagerne vil høre nærmere om hele Gislingeprojektet, bådens materialer, værktøjet og bådebyggernes håndværk.
English: Participants will get to hear all about the Gislinge Project, the boat's materials, tools and the boatbuilders' craft.

Danish: Ved dykkerundersøgelser i Hedebys havn blev dele af et langskib fundet i 1953.
English: Parts of a longship were found in Hedeby Harbour in 1953 during underwater investigations by divers.

Danish: Svendeprøven er bestået
English: Passed the test

Danish: Kodeord:
English: Password:

Danish: Ærtepesto samt ramsløgs-mayonnaise
English: Pea pesto with ramson mayonnaise

Danish: Det var sjældent de fredelige hændelser der blev skrevet om, men derimod de dramatiske plyndringer og erobringer, de store slag, drabene, bortførelserne og de politiske alliancer.
English: Peaceful events were rarely described, but rather the dramatic plundering and conquests, great battles, killings, abductions and political alliances.

Danish: Peel Castle har gennem flere historiske perioder været et magtcenter og religiøst samlingssted på Isle of Man.
English: Peel Castle has been a site of religious and secular importance in Isle of Man history.

Danish: Vedhæng i bronze
English: Pendant in Bronze

Danish: "Toke" armbånd m lakseskind
English: Pendant in silver

Danish: Vedhæng i bronze
English: Pendant in silver

Danish: "Thor" Armbånd i rensdyr skind
English: Pendant in silver, Prow

Danish: Menneskene bliver påvirket af tidevandet.
English: People are affected by the tide.

Danish: Folk ringer og skriver for at spørge, hvilken rute Havhingsten vil følge gennem de danske farvande.
English: People call and write, asking what route the Sea Stallion will take through the Danish waters.

Danish: Mange ville forbi og med egne øjne se skibet, de har hørt så meget om.
English: People came to see the ship they had heard so much about, with their own eyes.

Danish: Folk spiser en del fede ting.
English: People eat a good deal of fat products.

Danish: Folk fra tidevandsområderne, som lever af og på havet, har et naturligt forhold til tidevandet.
English: People in tidal areas who live from and on the sea have a natural relationship to the tides.

Danish: Kom man hjem fra togt eller handelsrejse med udenlandske mønter, måtte man veksle dem hos kongens mænd mod en afgift eller skat.
English: People returning from expeditions or trading trips with foreign coins had to exchange these with the king's men.

Danish: Man vil til alle tider forsøge at skabe et historisk billede der passer til samtidens selvforståelse.
English: People will always try to create a picture of history in keeping with their own self-conception.

Danish: Det er folk, som følger levende med i Havhingstens færd, og de vil naturligvis vide, hvor vi er.
English: People with a lively interest in what the Sea Stallion is doing obviously want to know where we are.

Danish: Folk mødtes på markedspladser og byttede overskuddet fra egen gård til ting, de manglede.
English: People would meet at market places and barter the surplus from their own farm for the items they needed.

Danish: Måske fordi de er skrevet til at prise fyrsterne, nævner skjaldedigtningen stort set ikke noget om organisationen ombord i skibene eller af flåden som sådan, bortset fra at fyrstens rolle som leder naturligvis altid fremhæves.
English: Perhaps because they were composed in honour of princes, the scaldic verses hardly ever mention anything about the organisation on board the ship or of the fleet as such, except that the prince's role is naturally always emphasised.

Danish: Måske fordi de er skrevet til at prise fyrsterne, nævner skjaldedigtningen stort set ikke noget om organisationen ombord i skibene eller af flåden som sådan, bortset fra at fyrstens rolle som leder naturligvis altid fremhæves.
English: Perhaps because they were composed in honour of princes, the scaldic verses hardly ever mention anything about the organisation on board the ship or of the fleet as such, except that the prince’s role is naturally always emphasised.

Danish: Måske blev han genbegravet i St. Clement Danes udenfor bymuren.
English: Perhaps Harold Harefoot was re-buried in St. Clemens Danes outside the town wall.

Danish: Måske har gravskibet fra Hedeby mindet mere om det norske Tuneskib på 18-19 m længde, selvom det næppe har haft dette skibs bredde på omkring 4 m. Tuneskibet daterer sig til omkring 900, og er som Ladbyskibet således noget yngre ende gravskibet fra Hedeby.
English: Perhaps the burial ship from Hedeby was more like the Norwegian Tune ship, which was 18 -19 m long, although it probably did not have this ship's width of around 4 m. The Tune ships dates from around AD 900 and is, like the Ladby ship, somewhat later than the burial ship from Hedeby.

Danish: Måske er der noget helt specielt ved bådene fra Mykines.
English: Perhaps there is something special about the Mykines boats.

Danish: Måske ville disse krigeriske naboer give færre problemer, hvis de var kristne.
English: Perhaps these warlike neighbours would give fewer problems if they became Christians.

Danish: Måske kan du fortælle en af "byens" historier.
English: Perhaps you can tell one of these stories from "the town":

Danish: Snak evt. om vikingernes hygiejneforhold.
English: Perhaps you could discuss the Viking hygiene.

Danish: Hent evt. inspiration i billeder og film på denne hjemmeside eller se på vikingernes egne billeder af skibe – på Bayeux tapetet, mønter, billedsten osv.

English: Politically, ideologically and economically the ship played a central role, and in the military operations, which are the subject of this book, the ship and its armed crew were the fundamental means of achieving military goals.

Danish: Bagbord halse og styrbord halse betyder, at halsen er gjort fast i den pågældende side (som er den side vinden kommer fra).

Danish: Citat: - i en søstad i hans rige, som var meget skikket dertil ?, Slesvig er dens navn, hvor købmænd kom til fra alle kanter, tillod han ham (Ansgar) at bygge en kirke, indrømmede ham et sted, hvor præsten kunne bo, og gav tillige den tilladelse: at hvem i hans rige der ville måtte blive en kristen.
English: Quote: - at a seaport in his kingdom, which was very suited to it ?., Schleswig is its name, to where merchants from all regions came, he allowed him (Ansgar) to build a church, granted him a place where the priest could live, and also gave this permission: that anybody in his kingdom who wished to do so was allowed to become a Christian.

Danish: Citat: Kong Harald hørte om dette, og han samlede en stor hær og gik imod ham ved det grå æbletræ, og Vilhelm gik imod ham og overraskede ham, før hans hær var parat…
English: Quote: King Harold heard this, and he gathered a great army and went against him by the grey, old apple tree, and William went against him and surprised him before his army was ready….

Danish: Citat: Måtte Herren i dag dømme mellem Vilhelm og mig, og måtte Han undsige, hvem af os, der har ret.
English: Quote: May the Lord today judge between William and I, and may He declare who of us is right.

Danish: Citat: The pagans were driven from Ireland, from the longphort of Dubh Linn; and they abandoned a good number of ships and escaped half dead, after they had been wounded and broken.
English: Quote: The pagans were driven from Ireland, from the longphort of Dubh Linn; and they abandoned a good number of ships and escaped half dead, after they had been wounded and broken.

Danish: Citat: "Der var samlet mange folk til dette arbejde.
English: Quote: “A lot of people were gathered for this work.

Danish: Citat: "Hver dag, tidligt om morgenen, bringer en af slavinderne et stort kar med vand og giver det til sin herre, som vasker sine hænder, sit ansigt og sit hår i det.
English: Quote: “Every day, early in the morning, one of the slave girls brings in a large dish of water and gives it to her master, who washes his hands, face and hair in it.

Danish: Når den første er færdig bærer slavinden karret videre til den næste, der fortsætter som den første, hvorefter hun bærer det fra den ene til den anden, indtil det har været hele raden rundt.
English: Quote: “Every day, early in the morning, one of the slave girls brings in a large dish of water and gives it to her master, who washes his hands, face and hair in it.

Danish: Citat: "Alle skibsfolkene havde også drik sammen; der skulle nemlig stå et kar med låg, hvori drikken var, men drikken havde man ellers i mindre tønder, hvorfra den fyldtes i karret, når det var tomt."
English: Quote: “The whole crew also drank together; there had to be a lidded trough in which the drink was kept, but drink was also stored in smaller barrels, from which the trough was filled when it was empty.”

Danish: Den forskningsvirksomhet som har vært drevet i 50 år, med «Det etterliknende eksperiment» som en viktig nyskapning, har gitt ny konkret kunnskap om vikingtidens båtbygging, seilmakeri og seilas, og lagt grunnen for mange nye tanker om vikingtidens samfunn.
English: Research carried out for 50 years with ‘the replicating experiment' as a vital innovation has given us new concrete knowledge of Viking Age boatbuilding, sail-making and navigation and has laid the foundation for many new theories about Viking Age society.

Danish: Den forskningsvirksomhet som har vært drevet i 50 år, med «Det etterliknende eksperiment» som en viktig nyskapning, har gitt ny konkret kunnskap om vikingtidens båtbygging, seilmakeri og seilas, og lagt grunnen for mange nye tanker om vikingtidens samfunn.
English: Research carried out for 50 years with ‘the replicating experiment’ as a vital innovation has given us new concrete knowledge of Viking Age boatbuilding, sail-making and navigation and has laid the foundation for many new theories about Viking Age society.

English: Research into the traces left by tools in the original wood confirmed that the most important tool for cleaving tree trunks, and hewing planks and all other ship's parts, was the axe.

English: Ropemaking is one of the oldest crafts in the world and many of the techniques and tools used at the Museum's ropemaking workshop today have remained relatively unchanged since the Viking Age.

English: Rosenberg's reconstruction of the boat was based on his observations of the surviving primary material alone, but he also noted that the resulting shape is very similar to several ship representations on rock carvings in Bohuslän, Sweden.

Danish: Videnskabelige studier af disse skibe vil uden tvivl udvide vores kendskab til middelalderens skibsbygning og demonstrere nødvendigheden af en yderligere udvidelse af Vikingeskibsmuseet – institutionen skabt til Skuldelevskibene.
English: Scientific studies of these wrecks will no doubt broaden our knowledge of Mediaeval shipbuilding and demonstrate the necessity of further expanding of the Viking Ship Museum – the institution created for the Skuldelev ships.

Danish: Vikingetidens Skotland er ikke meget lig det Skotland vi kender i dag.
English: Scotland during the Viking Age was not the Scotland we know today.

Danish: Skotland er nu i sigte i horisonten.
English: Scotland is now in sight on the horizon.

Danish: Scrambled æg m/ urter
English: Scrambled egg with herbs

Danish: Havhingsten og TOGTET indtager Sjælland fra søsiden.
English: Sea Stallion and 'The RAID' occupy Sjælland from the seaward side

Danish: Havhingsten ankommer til København.
English: Sea Stallion arrives in Copenhagen

Danish: Havhingsten startede lørdagens tur genne Berlin ude fra Ost-Hafen.
English: Sea Stallion began Saturday's tour through Berlin from Ost-Hafen.

Danish: Billedserie: Havhingsten fejrer 10-årsdag
English: Sea Stallion celebrates 10th anniversary

Danish: Havhingsten fejrer 10-års dag
English: Sea Stallion celebrates 10th anniversary

Danish: Havhingsten fra Glendalough
English: Sea Stallion from Glendalough

Danish: Havhingsten af Glendalough sejles af et frivilligt bådelaug, der består af knapt 200 medlemmer og antallet er stadig stigende, fordi lauget er åbent for nye medlemmer.
English: Sea Stallion from Glendalough is sailed by a volunteer crew, comprised of almost 200 members and that number is still rising, as the guild are still open for new members.

Danish: 'Havhingsten fra Glendalough' er det nærmeste, vi i dag kan komme oplevelsen af et komplet langskib, og skibet repræsenterer vikingetidens højteknologi og vikingernes store maritime kunnen.
English: Sea Stallion from Glendalough is the closest thing to an original longship that we modern people can experience and the ship represents the high point of Viking Age technology and the incredible maritime skills of the Vikings themselves.

Danish: Langskibet Havhingsten fra Glendalough: uge 27 - 29
English: Sea Stallion from Glendalough: Week 27-29

Danish: Havhingsten glider roligt gennem det stille vand de ca. 10 kilometer til Ost Hafen, hvor besætningen slipper slæbetrossen og lægger årerne ud.
English: Sea Stallion glides calmly through the quiet waters and the ca. 10km distance to Ost Hafen, where the crew release the tow rope and lay out the oars.

Danish: Havhingsten skal hurtigt fra Vest Hafen ud til Ost Hafen, hvor turen er planlagt til at begynde.
English: Sea Stallion has to quickly make its way from Vest Hafen out to Ost Hafen, where the tour is due to begin.

Danish: Havhingsten i Langør 24. - 25. juli
English: Sea stallion in Langør, Samsø 24 - 25 July

Danish: Nu er det snart Havhingstens tur.
English: Sea Stallion is also 'down under'

Danish: Forbilledet for 'Havhingsten' er det originale Skuldelev 2-langskib, der blev udgravet i 1962 og, som i dag kan opleves på Vikingeskibsmuseet i Roskilde.
English: Sea Stallion is based on the original Skuldelev 2 longship, which was excavated in 1962 and can today be seen at the Viking Ship Museum in Roskilde.

Danish: Havhingsten fejrer sin 10-års fødselsdag langt fra Roskilde.
English: Sea Stallion is celebrating its 10th birthday far from Roskilde.

Danish: Havhingsten fra Glendalough er med.
English: Sea Stallion is going to spend the winter in Dublin

Danish: Havhingsten er på besøg i Berlin for at skabe opmærksomhed omkring åbningen af Vikingeudstilling 'Die Wikinger', der er er skabt i et samarbejde mellem Museum für Vor- und Frühgeschichte i Berlin, British Museum i London og Nationalmuseet i København.
English: Sea Stallion is in Berlin to generate interest in the opening of the Viking exhibition, 'Die Wikinger', which has been created in collaboration between the Museum für Vor- und Frühgeschichte in Berlin, the British Museum in London and the National Museum in Copenhagen.

Danish: 'Havhingsten' sejler efter planen fra Fæstningen i Korsør.
English: Sea Stallion is scheduled to leave the 'Fæstning' in Korsør.

Danish: Havhingsten sejler uden om London
English: Sea Stallion not sailing to London

Danish: Havhingsten på Spree-floden på sin tur gennem Berlin den 6. september 2014.
English: Sea Stallion on its tour through Berlin on the river Spree, 6th September 2014.

Danish: Havhingsten på Spree-floden på sin tur gennem Berlin den 6. september 2014.
English: Sea Stallion on the Spree on its journey through Berlin, 6th September 2014.

Danish: Havhingsten på Spree-floden på sin tur gennem Berlin den 6. september 2014.
English: Sea Stallion on the Spree on the way through Berlin, 6th September 2014.

Danish: Havhingsten på Spree 6. september 2014
English: Sea Stallion on the Spree, 6th September 2014

Danish: Havhingsten på Spree-floden på sin tur gennem Berlin den 6. september 2014.
English: Sea Stallion on the Spree, 6th September 2014.

English: Sea Stallion on the Spree, which runs through the centre of Berlin, 6th September 2014.

Danish: Havhigsten passerer Duart Castle tæt ved the Caledonian Canal den 29. juli 2007.
English: Sea Stallion passes Duart Castle, close to the Caledonian Canal, 29th July 2007.

Danish: Havhingsten passerer under jernbanebroen ved Friedrichstrasse Station.
English: Sea Stallion passes under the railway bridge at Friedrichstrasse Station.

English: Sea Stallion rows under the bridge and the crowds run over to the other side, across the wide boulevard.

Danish: Havhingsten ror under den imponerende bro 'Oberbaum Bücke', og nu snævrer havnearealerne ind til smalle stier langs den brede flod.
English: Sea Stallion rows under the impressive Oberbaum Bucke bridge, and now the quayside narrows in to become small paths along the wide river.

Danish: Havhingsten sejler ud på TOGT!
English: Sea Stallion saila again

Danish: Havhingsten sejlede med en besætning på 60 mænd og kvinder på forsøgsrejsen i 2007.

Danish: Havhingsten sejler ud på TOGT!
English: Sea Stallion sails again

Danish: Havhingsten sejler igen

Danish: Havhingsten sejler på sommertogt med kurs mod København.

English: Sea Stallion under sail, bound for Loch Inver.

Danish: Havhingsten blev bygget på Vikingeskibsmuseets bådeværft i årene 2000 - 2004.
English: Sea Stallion was built at the Viking Ship Museum's boatyard between 2000 - 2004.

Danish: Havhingsten flyttes kl. ca. 09.00.
English: Sea Stallion will be moved at 09:00.

Danish: Den 28. juli returnerer Havhingsten til Roskilde.
English: Sea Stallion will return to Roskilde on 28th July.

English: Sea Stallion will sail all the way to Korsør, the last port of call in TOGTET, which the ships will reach on the 31st July.

Danish: Havhingsten lægges til kaj i Frederiksholms Kanal.
English: Sea Stallion will then be moored in the Frederiksholm Canal.

Danish: Havhingsten skal ud på en 10 kilometer lang rotur gennem Berlins centrum den 6. september.
English: Sea Stallion will undertake a 10km long rowing trip through the centre of Berlin on the 6th September.

Danish: Havhingstens besætning skriver hjem via deres og Vikingeskibsmuseets Facebook sider.
English: Sea Stallion's crew send messages home via their own and the Viking Ship Museum's Facebook pages.

Danish: Havhingstens ror er placeret på styrbordside og er fastholdt til skibet med en birkevidje lavet af et snoet birketræ.
English: Sea Stallion's rudder is placed on the starboard side and is attached to the ship using a withy made from a twisted birch tree.

English: Sea Stallion, Aslak and Agnete arrive 19:00

English: Sea Stallions departure the 1st of July - the ship is ready!

Danish: Forsøget viser, at det teknisk har været muligt på denne måde at lave både af form som den tidlige bronzealders skibsbilleder og derved undgå det meget store arbejde med udhugning af store planker.
English: Sea trials over a period of two weeks would have strengthened the evaluation of the results, especially in estimating the potential radius of action of the boat.

English: Sea trials with the Sea Stallion from Glendalough

Danish: Søfarten gav mulighed for at nå noget andet end det, man kendte.
English: Seafaring allowed one to go beyond the familiar.

Danish: Søfart over åbent hav byggede på en fortrolighed med navigation uden landkending, som krævede lang erfaring til søs.
English: Seafaring over the open ocean was based on the skills to navigate without landmarks, which required many years' experience at sea.

Danish: Søfart over åbent hav byggede på en fortrolighed med navigation uden landkending, som krævede lang erfaring til søs.
English: Seafaring over the open ocean was based on the skills to navigate without landmarks, which required many years’ experience at sea.

Danish: Kravene til gasterne har været sømandsskab, fysisk og psykisk udholdenhed og sociale kompetencer.
English: Seaman ship, physically and mentally stamina and social abilities are some of the demands that a crew members needs to forfill.

Danish: Søg på 'Seehengst', 'Spree', og evt. 'Reuters', så dukker der mange sider op - god jagt!
English: Search for 'Seehengst', 'Spree' or even 'Reuters' and you'll get pages of results.

Danish: Søg i besætningens log- og dagbøger, og svar på følgende:
English: Search in the crew’s logbooks and diaries and answer the following:

Danish: Søsygen er svær at undgå, og mange bliver ramt af kvalme og træthed.
English: Seasickness is hard to avoid, and many were affected by nausea and tiredness.

Danish: Søsyge, diarré, hedeslag, hypertermi, nældefeber, hjernerystelse, forbrændinger, vabler og småsår er nogle af de sygdomme og skader der forekommer om bord på Havhingstens sommertogter.
English: Seasickness, diarrhoea, nettle rash, concussion, hypothermia, burns, blisters and minor cuts are some of the illnesses and injuries occurring on the Sea Stallion's summer voyages.

English: Seastallion from Glendalough

English: Secondly the sampled parts are presented and discussed, demonstrating that small apparently insignificant details can in fact give important information about a specific building method.

English: See them here…

English: See you in Roskilde on Saturday 9 August.

Danish: Set i forhold til muslimerne, der var forpligtede til at afvaske ansigt, hænder og fødder inden dagens fem bønner, kan vikingernes vaskevaner synes urenlige.
English: Seen in relation to the Muslims, who were obliged to wash the face, hands and feet before each of the day’s five prayers, Viking washing habits seem most unclean.

Danish: Så send en mail til redaktøren .
English: Send an e-mail to the editor .

Danish: Så send en mail til redaktøren.
English: Send an e-mail to the editor.

Danish: Opmålt og beskrevet af Christian Nielsen.
English: Serie: Ship and boats of the North .

Danish: Serveres på hjemmebagt brød med ramsløgmayo, kål og gulerod, syltede rødløg, sennepsdressing og brøndkarse.
English: Served on home-baked bread with ramson mayo, cabbage and carrot, pickled red onions, mustard dressing and watercress.

Danish: Serveres på hjemmebagt brød med ramsløgmayo, tørret bær og gulerodstave.
English: Served on homebaked bread with ramson mayo, dried berries and carrot sticks.

Danish: Anrettes separat på tallerkenen.
English: Served with cabbage, carrot and herb dressing.

Danish: Serveres med rodfrugtpuré, kål og gulerod, syltede rødløg, havtorn, brøndkarse og grøn dressing.
English: Served with root vegetable purée, cabbage and carrot, pickled red onions, sea buckthorn, watercress and herb dressing.

Danish: Indstil solkompasset til sommersolhverv og tjek ovenstående påstande ved at vælge breddegrader, gnomon og radius på passende vis.
English: Set the sun compass to the summer solstice and check the above statement by choosing appropriate latitudes, gnomon and radius.

Danish: Bopladsfund og højtliggende grave er ofte i fare ved almindelig landbrugspløjning og dybtliggende grave samt gravhøje bringes ud af deres egentlige kontekst, når der dybdepløjes til skovrejsning.
English: Settlement finds and high-lying graves are often endangered by ordinary agricultural ploughing and deep-lying graves and burial mounds are taken out of their proper context during deep ploughing in connection with forestation.

Danish: Bopladsfund bliver nummereret efter optagning, mens vragdele nummereres, før de tages op. De fleste genstande skal holdes våde.
English: Settlement finds are numbered after they have been lifted, while shipwreck finds are numbered in situ on the seabed.

Danish: Husene stod tættere og i flere tilfælde bygget op med hovedgaden som byens centrum, og ikke havnen, som det var i de ældre byer.
English: Settlement was denser and, in several cases, built up as a network of streets centred on a main street and not, as in the earlier towns, on access to the harbour.

Danish: Udvalget har udpeget en række besætningsmedlemmer, der hver får ansvar for at dokumentere og afrapportere særskilte problemstillinger under rejsen:
English: Several crew members appointed by the commission will be responsible for the documentation of individual problems during the journey.

Danish: Takket være finansiering fra den danske regering har flere medarbejdere fra Polish Maritime Museum (inklusive undertegnede), inviteret af Vikingeskibsmuseets direktører gennem tiden gennemført undersøgelser på denne kendte institution.
English: Several employees of the Polish Maritime Museum (including the author of this text) have conducted studies at this renowned institution, invited by directors of the Viking Ship Museum, and thanks to the Danish government fundings.

Danish: Flere engelske skriftlige kilder nævner vikingerne.
English: Several English written sources mention the Vikings.

Danish: Sidst i teksten her gives eksempler på flere opskrifter
English: Several examples of recipes are given at the end of this section.

Danish: Flere omstændigheder tyder på, at forstyrrelsen dels har fundet sted inden for en kort årrække efter gravlæggelsen, dels er foregået i fuld offentlighed.
English: Several factors indicate that the disturbance both took place within a few years of the burial, and took place fully in public view.

Danish: Flere rekonstruktioner, baseret på Skuldelev 5, fulgte i de kommende år.
English: Several further reconstructions, based on Skuldelev 5, followed in subsequent years.

Danish: Der kendes flere fornemme grave fra vikingetiden, bl.a. Mammengraven ved Viborg i Jylland og de kendte skibsgrave fra Oseberg og Gokstad i Norge.
English: Several magnificent graves are known from Viking times, including the Mammen grave at Viborg in Jutland and the famous ship burials at Oseberg and Gokstad in Norway.

Danish: Flere af B&W skibene var af en størrelse og kompleksitet som gjorde det nødvendigt at anvende en hurtig metode til udgravning og dokumentation, da anlægsarbejdet ikke kunne udsættes på grund af de arkæologiske fund.
English: Several of the B&W shipwrecks were of a size and a complexity that made it necessary to use a fast and effective method of excavation and documentation, as the building contractors could not be stopped for very long.

Danish: Flere af tværbjælkerne var savet over og forkortet, dele af skibets skelet var presset unaturligt ind og enkelte spanter var deformerede.
English: Several of the crossbeams had their ends sawn over and shortened, other elements of the ship’s hull had been pressed inwards at an unnatural angle and individual frames were deformed.

Danish: Flere af de tidlige byer forsvandt, da deres beliggenhed ikke længere var optimal.
English: Several of the early towns disappeared as a consequence of their location.

Danish: Flere af de nye resultater, der blev præsenteret i udstilling og publikation var resultat af Entrepot-projektets undersøgelser af maritime udvekslingsnetværk og urbanisering fra Nordatlanten til Det Indiske Ocean.
English: Several of the new results presented in the exhibition and in the book were the result of the Entrepot project's research into maritime exchange networks and urbanisation from the North Atlantic to the Indian Ocean.

Danish: Omkring byen boede der en masse hedenske stormænd og vikingehøvdinger.
English: Several of the town's stone churches undoubtedly had a predecessor of wood.

Danish: Flere folk fra disse spejderprojekter involveredes senere i en række af Vikingeskibsmuseets rekonstruktionsprojekter.
English: Several people from these scout projects later became involved in a series of the Viking Ship Museum's reconstruction projects.

Danish: Flere folk fra disse spejderprojekter involveredes senere i en række af Vikingeskibsmuseets rekonstruktionsprojekter.
English: Several people from these scout projects later became involved in a series of the Viking Ship Museum’s reconstruction projects.

Danish: Flere er forkølede og har ondt i halsen.
English: Several people have colds and sore throats.

Danish: Flere gjorde nu krav på tronen, men da det Kongelige Råd mødtes i London, valgte man Harold Godwinson.
English: Several people now claimed the throne, but at the Royal Council's meeting in London, Harold Godwinson was chosen.

Danish: Mange skjaldekvad indeholder kenninger som gav dem deres spændende og dramatiske stil med blodige detaljer.
English: Several poems contain kenninger, which gave them their exciting and dramatic style, often by supplying bloody details.

Danish: Der er bygget flere modeller af Gislingebåden i USA og Canada, og eftersom tegninger til Gislingebåden stadig er tilgængelige på nettet, vokser det virtuelle Gislingebåd-fælleskab stille og roligt.
English: Several scale-models of the Gislinge Boat have also been completed in the USA and Canada and with the working drawings still available for download, the Gislinge Boat virtual community continues to grow.

Danish: Flere korte krydsforsøg med 1-2 sømil fra start til mål er at foretrække for et langt.
English: Several short beating trials, each covering 1-2 nautical miles from start to finish, will be preferable to one long.

Danish: Der er opstået enkelte revner i træet under udspændningen, men én revne var der på forhånd.
English: Several small cracks appeared during the expansion, one of which had already been present from the start.

Danish: Roret var flere gange løftet helt ud af søen.
English: Several times, the rudder was out of contact with the water.

Danish: Sølvtøjet bar hun frem og fulde skåle.
English: She brought out the silver and filled bowls.

Danish: Hun fik øje på nogle hidtil oversete detaljer, der nu er indarbejdet i den 1:5 model, som har dannet grundlag for de to forrige rekonstruktioner af Gislingebåden: ”Estrid”, som blev bygget i 1995 og ”Gisle”, fra 2015.
English: She discovered several details that led her to make changes to the 1:5 scale model, which had provided the basis for the two previous reconstructions of the Gislinge Boat: Estrid, built in 1995 and Gisle, built in 2015.

Danish: Havhingstens skipper Carsten Hvid glæder sig til at få skibet hjem til Roskilde og vise, hvor godt det sejler.
English: She discovered some details that led her to make changes to the model which had provided the basis for the two previous reconstructions, Estrid and Gisle.

Danish: Hun har været med ved byggeriet af flere af museets egne både, lige som hun har sejlet som skipper på flere af skibene, fx Havhingsten og lige nu altså også på Saga Osebergs rejse fra Oslo til Roskilde.
English: She has been involved in the construction of several of the Museum's own boats and has sailed as skipper on several of the ships, such as Sea Stallion from Glendalough, and now also on Saga Oseberg on its journey from Oslo to Roskilde.

Danish: Hun har været med ved byggeriet af flere af museets egne både, lige som hun har sejlet som skipper på flere af skibene, fx Havhingsten og lige nu altså også på Saga Osebergs rejse fra Oslo til Roskilde.

English: Since the reconstruction of the Skuldelev ships began over 30 years ago, it has been a fixed principle for the Museum that the Skuldelev ships are best understood when we have a full-scale, sailing reconstruction of each of them.

English: Since the Roar Report was published, a distinction has been made between "experimental voyages", where the overall performance of the ship and her crew is investigated and documented in terms of travelling speed, and "sea trials", where individual factors are isolated in order to investigate the ship's sailing characteristics under various conditions.
