Danish: Skipper har det overordnede ansvar; lige under ham står to styrmænd – en til hver vagt.
English: Skipper is in charge and just beneath him are two steersmen – one for each shift.

Danish: Skjaldens dagbog er en personlig beretning om rejsen med Havhingsten fra Glendalough, og om de oplevelser og indtryk, der møder besætningen undervejs fra Roskilde til Dublin.
English: Skjalds's diary is a personal account of the Sea Stallion from Glendalough's voyage and of the impressions and adventures experienced by the crew en route from Roskilde to Dublin.

Danish: Skjoldungen i sydvestgrønland (2016)
English: Skjoldungen in southwest Greenland (2016)

Danish: Skjoldungen bliver fragtet til Nanortalik i Grønland af Royal Arctic Line, og herfra tager togtet sin begyndelse 2. juli.
English: Skjoldungen will be shipped by the Royal Arctic Line to Nanortalik in Greenland, from where the voyage will start on July 2nd.

Danish: Skjoldungens sommertogt 2015
English: Skjoldungen's voyage 2015

Danish: Skjoldungens besætning har brugt tre år på at planlægge og træne til togtet, og her to måneder før Roskilde Fjords bløde, skovklædte kyst skiftes ud med isbjerge, bræer og klipper, bruser forventningen om eventyr raskt i blodet, fortæller skipper Ole Sand:
English: Skjoldungen’s crew have used three years to plan and train for this voyage and now, two months before Roskilde Fjord’s gentle, tree-decked coastline is to be swapped for icebergs, glaciers and cliffs, the sense of expectation and adventure fills every waking moment, relates skipper Ole Sand:

Danish: Skuldelev 1 (5.1 og 6.3.2)
English: Skuldelev 1 (5.1 and 6.3.2)

Danish: Skuldelev 1, der med sin lasteevne på 20-25 tons er mindre end andre skibsfund af samme karakter (fx Hedeby 3), tolkes på grundlag heraf som en austrfararknörr, en knar til sejladsen på Danmark og ind i Østersøen.
English: Skuldelev 1, with its cargo-carrying capacity of 20-25 tons, is smaller than other ship-finds of the same character (e.g. Hedeby 3), and is thus interpreted as an austrfararknörr, a knar for sailing to Denmark and into the Baltic.

Danish: Skuldelev 2 - Det store langskib
English: Skuldelev 2 - The great longship

Danish: Skuldelev 2 består af vragdelene markeret med 2 og '4' samt af de løse skibsdele fundet indenfor områderne A-E.
English: Skuldelev 2 consists of the wreckage marked 2 and '4' and loose timbers found within the areas A-E.

Danish: Skuldelev 2 er en krigsmaskine, bygget til høj fart og transport af mange krigere.
English: Skuldelev 2 is a war machine, built to carry many warriors at high speed.

Danish: Skuldelev 2 har efter alt at dømme været i funktion omkring Det Irske Hav de første ca. 25 år som led i de militære operationer ved midten af 1000-tallet, som vikingebyerne i Irland var involveret i, især Dublin.
English: Skuldelev 2 probably sailed its first ca 25 years around the Irish Sea, taking part in the mid-eleventh-century military operations that Viking towns in Ireland, in particular Dublin, were involved in.

Danish: Skuldelev 2 var bygget til disse farvande i år 1042.
English: Skuldelev 2 was built for these waters in the year 1042.

Danish: Skuldelev 2 blev fundet i 1957 ved den første arkæologiske dykkerundersøgelse i Peberrenden i Roskilde Fjord.
English: Skuldelev 2 was found in 1957 during the first underwater archaeological investigations by divers in Peberrenden, Roskilde Fjord.

Danish: Skuldelev 2 blev oprindeligt bygget af skandinaver i Dublin i året 1042, men endte efter mange års tjeneste sit liv som del af en sejlspærring anlagt til beskyttelse af Roskilde, det daværende kongesæde i Danmark.
English: Skuldelev 2 was originally built by Scandinavians in Dublin in the year 1042 but after many years in service, it ended its days as a part of the fjord barrier constructed to protect Roskilde, which was the king's base in Denmark.

Danish: Skuldelev 2 blev oprindeligt bygget af skandinaver i Dublin i året 1042, men endte efter mange års tjeneste sit liv som del af en sejlspærring anlagt til beskyttelse af Roskilde, det daværende kongesæde i Danmark.
English: Skuldelev 2 was originally built by Scandinavians in Dublin in the year 1042 but after many years in service, it ended its days as a part of the fjord barrier constructed to protect Roskilde, which was the king’s base in Denmark.

Danish: Skuldelevs 2's rekonstruerede stævn.
English: Skuldelev 2's reconstructed stem.

Danish: Skuldelev 3 er et lille, elegant og solidt handelsskib, bygget til fragt af varer i de indre danske farvande og i Østersøen.
English: Skuldelev 3 is a small, elegant and sturdy trading ship, built for transporting goods in Danish coastal waters and the Baltic.

Danish: Gensyn med Skuldelev 3 – et nyt projekt begynder
English: Skuldelev 3 revisited – a new project begins

Danish: Gensyn med Skuldelev 3:
English: Skuldelev 3 Revisited:

Danish: Skuldelev 3-skibet blev fundet sammen med fire andre vikingeskibe – de såkaldte Skuldelevskibe – der alle er udstillet på Vikingeskibsmuseet i Roskilde.
English: Skuldelev 3 was found together with four other Viking ships – the so-called Skuldelev ships – all of which are exhibited at the Viking Ship Museum in Roskilde.

Danish: Skuldelev 3-skibet blev fundet sammen med fire andre vikingeskibe – de såkaldte Skuldelevskibe – der alle er udstillet på Vikingeskibsmuseet i Roskilde.
English: Skuldelev 3 was found together with four other Viking ships – the so-called Skuldelev ships – all of which are on display at the Viking Ship Museum in Roskilde.

Danish: Skuldelev 3 har formentlig været af typen byrding eller skude.
English: Skuldelev 3 was probably of the type referred to as a byrding or skude.

Danish: Skuldelev 5 - Det lille langskib
English: Skuldelev 5 - The small longship

Danish: Skuldelev 5 ved udgravningen i 1962.
English: Skuldelev 5 during excavation in 1962.

Danish: Skuldelev 5 hører blandt til de mindste langskibe i en krigsflåde og er ideelt til sejlads i de indre, danske farvande og i de korte, krappe bølger på Østersøen.
English: Skuldelev 5 is one of the smallest long ship in a war fleet, and is ideal for sailing in Danish coastal waters and through the short, choppy waves of the Baltic.

Danish: Skuldelev 5 blev fundet ved dykkerundersøgelserne i Peberrenden i Roskilde Fjord i 1959, og blev udgravet sammen med de andre Skuldelev-skibe i 1962.
English: Skuldelev 5 was found during underwater investigations by divers in Peberrenden, Roskilde Fjord in 1959, and was excavated together with the other Skuldelev ships in 1962.

Danish: Skuldelev 5 blev genskabt som en sejlende rekonstruktion med navnet Helge Ask ved Vikingeskibsmuseet i årene 1990-1991 og indgår i dag i museets fartøjssamling.
English: Skuldelev 5 was recreated as a sailing reconstruction with the name Helge Ask by the Viking Ship Museum in 1990-1991 and is today part of the Museum's collection of vessels.

Danish: Skuldelev 6 har et beskedent kølsvin med spor til masten, men har formentlig i sin første udformning været forsynet med åretolde til seks årer i hver side.
English: Skuldelev 6 has a modest keelson with mast-step but in its original form it was probably equipped with rowlocks or tholepins for six oars on each side.

Danish: Skuldelev 6 blev første gang rekonstrueret i 1998 og nybygningen fik navnet Kraka Fyr.
English: Skuldelev 6 was first reconstructed in 1998 and the new boat was named Kraka Fyr.

Danish: Skuldelev 6 stævne var ikke bevaret, da det blev udgravet og derfor blev den nuværende rekonstruktion bygget med en såkaldt trappestævn som på Skuldelev 3 (Roar Ege).
English: Skuldelev 6’s stem was not preserved when it was excavated and the current reconstruction was therefore built with a so-called stepped stem, as in Skuldelev 3 (Roar Ege).

Danish: Døsighed i Odden
English: Sleepyness in Odden

Danish: Langsomt drejede de omking deres akser og løftede skibet stille og roligt med nærmest kærlig hengivenhed.
English: Slowly they turned around their axes and lifted the ship quietly and carefully with almost loving devotion.

Danish: En lille esping blev fremdrevet af en dobbeltbladet pagaj.
English: Small "espings" were propelled using a double-bladed paddle.

Danish: Museets esping er skænket af Museiverket, Sjöhistoriska Byrån, Helsingfors.
English: Small "espings" were propelled using a double-bladed paddle.

Danish: Måske har småbåde, som denne Gokstadbåd, været med på slæb eller ombord på de store skibe på længere togter.
English: Small boats like this Gokstad boat may have been towed or may have been aboard the larger ships during longer voyages.
Small flatbread (*GF) ...............

Danish: Små kiler af egetræ blev banket ind i dette spor, og dermed blev den første separation af træets fibre skabt.
English: Small oak wedges were then driven into the oak along this line, forcing the first separation of the oak's fibres.

Danish: Små kiler af egetræ blev banket ind i dette spor, og dermed blev den første separation af træets fibre skabt.
English: Small oak wedges were then driven into the oak along this line, forcing the first separation of the oak’s fibres.

Danish: Jernudvinding
English: Smelting

Danish: Udvinding og smedning er processer som har et højt materialeforbrug.
English: Smelting and blacksmithing are processes, which are heavy on materials.

Danish: Med et stort smil om munden lovede jeg, at bringe ideen videre til skipper og de gode folk om bord – hvilket hermed er gjort.
English: Smiling broadly, I promised to pass on the idea to the skipper and the good people on board – and this I have duly done.

Danish: Røget og saltet kød
English: Smoked and salted meat

Danish: Derfor står salt og røget kød højt på dosmersedlen, når der om få måneder skal købes ind til den historiske sejlads.
English: Smoked and salted meats are therefore have a high priority when the shopping is done for this historical sail in a few months time.

Danish: Røget bacon
English: Smoked bacon

Danish: Snekkehavne i Vikingetiden 1996
English: Snekke harours of the Viking Age 1996

Danish: Snekkja optræder i otte strofer, de syv af dem fra midten af 1000-tallet.
English: Snekkja occurs in eight stanzas, seven of them from the middle of the eleventh century.

Danish: Snorre Sturluson skriver i sin Heimskringla både om de store langskibe fra slutningen af 900-tallet, Olav Trygvasons TRANA og ORMR INN LANGI, og om Olav Haraldsons VISUNDR fra 1026 og Harald Harderådes drageskib fra 1061-62.
English: Snorri Sturluson writes in his work Heimskringla about the great longships from the end of the tenth century, Olaf Tryggvason’s TRANA ‘crane’ and ORMR INN LANGI ‘the long serpent’, and of Olav Haraldson’s VISUNDR ‘bison’from 1026 and Harald Hardrada’s dragon-ship from 1061-62.

Danish: Snorre var selv skjald og ved at skrive et værk om tidens digterkunst (Edda), har han gjort det lettere for eftertiden at tolke skjaldekvadene.
English: Snorri was himself a skald (bard), and by writing a work on the poetry of his time (Edda), he helped posterity understand the skaldic epics.

Danish: Snorres tekst giver os flere vigtige oplysninger, både om byggeriet og om skibets udseende.
English: Snorri's text gives us some significant information, both about the building of the ship and its appearance.

Danish: Snorre skrev imidlertid først sine sagaer ca. 1230, og hans beretninger afspejler formodentlig snarere skibsbyggeriet i dette århundredes begyndelse end i den sene vikingetid.
English: Snorri, however, did not write his sagas until about 1230 and his descriptions are probably more likely to apply to shipbuilding early in the thirteenth century than in the Late Viking Age.

Danish: Snorres tekst giver os flere vigtige oplysninger, både om byggeriet og om skibets udseende.
English: Snorri’s text gives us some significant information, both about the building of the ship and its appearance.

Danish: SNOS var interesseret i et samarbejde om en ny rekonstruktion, en bygning og testsejladser af et nyt Osebergskib.
English: SNOS was interested in collaborating on the new reconstruction, building and sea trials of a new Oseberg ship.

Danish: Det betyder at 33 år efter Roar Ege blev søsat, vil museets første rekonstruerede vikingeskibe nu blive udstillet permanent på land.
English: So 33 years after Roar Ege was launched, the Museum’s first reconstructed Viking ship will now be permanently exhibited on land.

Danish: I dette farverige udstyr kan Helge Ask om sommeren ses næsten overalt i de danske farvande når skibets bådelaug tager på ferietur, ofte sammen med privatejede vikingeskibskopier fra andre dele af landet.
English: So colourfully adorned, Helge Ask can be seen almost everywhere in Danish waters during the summer when the "bådelaug" (boat guild) often sail their ship together with privately-owned Viking ship reconstructions from other parts of the country.

Danish: Så selvom skibet har vist sig utroligt sødygtigt, kan der ikke tages nogen chancer.
English: So even though the ship has proved incredibly seaworthy, we can take no chances.

Danish: Der foreligger indtil nu logbogsoptegnelser fra Havhingsten fra Glendalough (Skuldelev 2), Ottar (Skuldelev 1), Roar Ege (Skuldelev 3), Helge Ask (Skuldelev 5), Ruth (Danmarksslup af 1854), Rana (Nordlandbåd af 1892) og Victoria (Åledrivkvase af 1904).
English: So far there are logbook entries for the Sea Stallion from Glendalough (Skuldelev 2), Ottar (Skuldelev 1), Roar Ege (Skuldelev 3), Helge Ask (Skuldelev 5), Ruth (a Danish sloop from 1854), Rana (a Norwegian Nordland fishing boat from 1892) and Victoria (a little Danish eel drifter from 1904.

Danish: Der er indtil videre kun set en enkelt løst liggende genstand: En fugleknogle op ad bundstok 6.
English: So far, only one loose artefact has been found: a bone from a bird lying up against floor timber 6.

Danish: Indtil videre omfatter det arkæologiske materiale fra undersøgelsesperiodens danske farvande heller ingen skibsfund af tysk oprindelse, selv om der er skriftlige vidnesbyrd om tysk handelsfart i Nord- og Østersøen fra anden halvdel af 1100-årene.
English: So far, the archaeological record does not reveal any ship-finds of German origin in Danish waters in the period examined, despite the historical evidence for German commercial seafaring in the North Sea and in the Baltic Sea from the second half of the 12th century onward.

Danish: Indtil nu har arkæologerne, til deres store glæde, lokaliseret en del sammenhængende skibsdele, hvilket tyder på, at der er mindst ét af skibsdækkene bevaret.
English: So far, the archaeologists, to their great delight, have located some coherent ship parts, suggesting that at least one of ship's decks is preserved.

Danish: Indtil nu har arkæologerne, til deres store glæde, lokaliseret en del sammenhængende skibsdele, hvilket tyder på, at der er mindst ét af skibsdækkene bevaret.
English: So far, the archaeologists, to their great delight, have located some coherent ship parts, suggesting that at least one of ship’s decks is preserved.

Danish: Så det er sidste chance det næste lange stykke tid for at komme helt tæt på og nyde synet af dette utroligt smukke sejlskib.
English: So for a long while this will be the last chance to come real close and enjoy the sight of this encredibly beautiful sailing ship.

Danish: Og jeg måtte ty til nogle af mine favorit-anekdoter.
English: So I had to turn to some of my favourite anecdotes.

Danish: Så jeg sagde mange gange til mig selv: Kig fremad, makker!”.
English: So I said to myself, ‘Look ahead, mate!’ many times.”

Danish: Så sætter jeg mig lidt for mig selv.
English: So I sit alone somewhere.

Danish: Jeg må have de store ord frem: Projektet med Havhingsten er en gigantisk succes”.
English: So I will have to use the big words: The project with the Sea Stallion is a gigantic success.

Danish: Derfor er det nemt at glemme den.
English: So it easily gets forgotten.

Danish: Det er således også ham, der komponerede stykket ”Havhingsten”, som vil indgå ved alle disse arrangementer.
English: So it was he who composed the “Sea Stallion” music which will be a part of all these arrangements.

Danish: Så er det jo fantastisk, at etableringen af netop en ny bro kan hjælpe os med at blive klogere på, hvordan man løste det samme problem for knapt tusind år siden: Hvordan kommer man på bedst mulige måde fra den ene kyst til den anden?”, siger Frederik Hyttel, teamleder for marinarkæologi på Vikingeskibsmuseet.
English: So it’s fantastic that the construction of this bridge in particular can provide us with new insights into how people solved this problem almost a thousand years ago: how do you best get from one coast to the other?”, says Frederik Hyttel, team leader for Maritime Archaeology at the Viking Ship Museum.

Danish: Så følg med - måske kommer vi til en havn nær dig!
English: So join us - maybe we'll come to a harbour near you!

Danish: Så følg med – måske kommer vi til en havn nær dig!
English: So join us – maybe we’ll come to a harbour near you!

Danish: Så hold øje på hjemmeside og Facebook - måske kommer Havhingsten til en havn nær dig!
English: So join us – maybe we’ll come to a harbour near you!

Danish: Så hold øje på hjemmeside og Facebook - måske kommer Havhingsten til en havn nær dig!
English: So keep an eye on the website and Facebook - maybe Sea Stallion is coming to a harbour near you!

Danish: Så mange landgange kunne lade sig gøre fordi krigsskibene, så vidt det var muligt, sejlede langs kysterne.
English: So many landings were possible because, as far as they could, warships took their bearings from points along coasts.

Danish: Så meget at det måtte fastholdes, og videregives.
English: So much so that it had to be maintained and passed on.

Danish: Derfor er ikke blot vikingetiden med også vikingeskibene en meget vigtig del af vores historie”
English: So not just the Viking Age, but the Viking ships in particular are an important part of our history”.

Danish: Så sejladsen fylder ikke meget i tid.
English: So not much time is spent sailing.

Danish: Så intens var indflydelsen fra skandinavisk skibsbyggeri i Irland, at mange af ordene på irsk for skibe og skibsdele tilsyneladende er låneord fra oldnordisk.
English: So profound was the influence of Scandinavian ship-building in Ireland that many of the words in Irish for ships and their parts appear to be loan words borrowed from Old Norse.

Danish: For at båden ikke skal dreje op mod eller væk fra vinden, er det vigtigt, at sejlcenteret og lateralcenteret, centeret for kraftpåvirkningen af undervandsskroget, ligger lodret over hinanden.
English: So that the boat cannot turn up against or away from the wind it is important that the sail centre and the lateral centre, the centre for the influence of force on the underwater hull, lie vertically above one another.

Danish: Historikeren benytter sig derfor både af andre videnskabsteorier og andre kildegrupper end den skriftlige.
English: So the historian makes use of both other scientific theories and other sources than written ones.

Danish: Så nu får ungerne en usædvanlig og lærerig oplevelse.
English: So the kids are getting an unusual and instructive experience.

Danish: Planen er derfor, at der installeres presse- og kommunikations-medarbejdere på følgeskibet", fortæller Tinna Damgård-Sørensen.
English: So the plan is to install the press and communication workers on the support vessel,” explains Tinna Damgård-Sørensen.

Danish: Så skibet er nu sejlet nordpå og lægger til i Donsö.
English: So the ship in stead went north and docks in Donsö.

Danish: Derfor var interessen stor, da det irske nationale museums skoletjeneste i marts kontaktede et udvalg af irske skoler og spurgte, om de ville have besøg af folk fra projektet.
English: So there was a lot of interest when the National Museum's Schools' Service contacted selected Irish schools in March to ask if they would like a visit from people from the project.

Danish: Det er altså ikke et nyt fænomen med disse lange ventetider...
English: So these long waiting periods are not some new phenomenon...

Danish: Derfor er Havhingsten i år udstyret med en BGAN satellit-sender, en mini-C transciever samt 6 HDV-camcorders og videoredigeringsudstyr.
English: So this year the Sea Stallion has been equipped with a BGAN satellite emitter, a mini-C transceiver, and 6 HDV-camcorders and video editing gear.

Danish: Altså at skibet nok er bygget i Irland, men dog er bygget af mennesker med nordisk blod i årerne.
English: So to speak: the ship was built in Ireland but by people who had Nordic blood in their veins.

Danish: Så vi monterede det hele igen og er helt trygge ved, at det nok skal holde hele vejen tilbage til Roskilde igen.
English: So we put everything back together again, quite confident that it will hold all the way back to Roskilde.

Danish: Nu mangler vi sådan set kun det vigtigste; at træne sikkerhed i det udstyr, som er blevet valgt til sejladsen," fortæller projektleder Preben Rather Sørensen.
English: So we really only lack the most important thing; to train safety in the equipment chosen for the voyage,” head of secretariat Preben Rather Sørensen explains.

Danish: Så i mange døgn opholdt vi os i land.
English: So we were ashore for many days.

Danish: Så er vi helt klar inden det går løs i formiddag på roturen tilbage gennem centrum".
English: So we'll be fully ready before the craziness hits on the rowing tour through the city".

Danish: Så onsdagens centrale aktivitet på skibet var en tretimers øvelse i at sænke og rejse masten.
English: So Wednesday's major activity on the ship was a three-hour exercise in lowering and raising the mast.

Danish: Så onsdagens centrale aktivitet på skibet var en tretimers øvelse i at sænke og rejse masten.
English: So Wednesday’s major activity on the ship was a three-hour exercise in lowering and raising the mast.

Danish: Derfor åbnes der op for tilmeldinger til næste års sejlads når skibet skal sejles hjem fra Dublin til Roskilde.
English: So you can now enrol for next year's sea crossing when the ship is to sail home from Dublin to Roskilde.

Danish: Derfor åbnes der op for tilmeldinger til næste års sejlads når skibet skal sejles hjem fra Dublin til Roskilde.
English: So you can now enrol for next year’s sea crossing when the ship is to sail home from Dublin to Roskilde.

Danish: Så selv om det kolde danske efterårsvejr ikke huede den Bhutanske delegation, viste premierministeren stor interesse for hele museumsområdet.
English: So, even though the cold Danish autumn weather was not to the liking of the Bhutanese delegation, the prime minister showed great interest in the entire museum area.

Danish: Så kort sagt: Under vandet er fundene i mange tilfælde bedre bevaret, og de kan supplere det materiale, vi kender fra landjordsarkæologien.
English: So, to put it briefly, underwater finds are often better preserved, and they can supplement the material we know from archaeology on land.

Danish: Så vi håber på lavtryksvejr på udturen og fint sommervejr med højtryk på hjemturen.
English: So, we are hoping for low-pressure weather on the voyage out and fine summer weather with high pressure on the return voyage.

Danish: Så hvad er mere nærliggende at benytte den kolde og mørke vintertid til at komme tættere på museets bådsamling?
English: So, what could be more natural than to use the cold and dark winter season to get closer to the museum's boat collection?

Danish: Sogn er blot en 'samling af mennesker', mens sókn er en 'søgning' og også kan betyde et slag eller et angreb - altså en samling af mennesker som vil gennemføre noget i fællesskab.
English: Sogn is just a ‘collection of human-beings', while sókn is a ‘seeking' and can also mean a battle or an attack - that is a gathering of people who are going to do something in company with each other.

Danish: Sogn er blot en ’samling af mennesker’, mens sókn er en ’søgning’ og også kan betyde et slag eller et angreb – altså en samling af mennesker som vil gennemføre noget i fællesskab.
English: Sogn is just a ‘collection of human-beings’, while sókn is a ‘seeking’ and can also mean a battle or an attack – that is a gathering of people who are going to do something in company with each other.

Danish: Ottar
English: Solidarité

Danish: Bygget på Vikingeskibsmuseets værft 1990.
English: Solidarité was built at the museum boatyard in 1990.

Danish: Nogle stiger af og tager hjem, nye kommer til.
English: Some are going home and others are coming to sail.

Danish: Næbbene stinger i røde bringer, blod dem pletter ulven sig mætter .
English: Some came to say goodbye, others just to have a look at the fine Viking ship.

Danish: Nogle opstod langsomt ud fra et behov om gradvis større aktivitet hele året.
English: Some emerged slowly out of a need for steadily greater and all-year-round activity.

Danish: Eksempler på kenninger kan være: ”sårets hav” eller ”sværdets sved”, som hentyder til blodet, der flyder fra et krigssår, ”bølgernes hest” hvor hest betyder skib og ”Rhinens lue” som betyder Rhinens guld.
English: Some examples of kenninger are: "the wound's sea" or "the sword's sweat", which refer to the blood flowing from a battle wound, "horse of the waves" where horse means a ship, and "flame of the Rhine" which means the Rhine's gold.

Danish: Nogle med at fælde træer, nogle med at glathugge tømmer, nogle med at slå skibsnagler i og nogle med at transportere tømmeret".
English: Some felled trees, some dressed the timber, some made ship's rivets, and others transported the timber.”

Danish: Nogle med at fælde træer, nogle med at glathugge tømmer, nogle med at slå skibsnagler i og nogle med at transportere tømmeret".
English: Some felled trees, some dressed the timber, some made ship’s rivets, and others transported the timber.”

Danish: Enkelte galvaniserede belsag mangler stadig at blive monteret.
English: Some few galvanised fittings still need to be mounted.

Danish: Nogle få runesten peger på, at selve det at styre et skib var en særlig rolle.
English: Some few rune stones point to the fact that the very act of steering a ship played a special role.

Danish: Nogle af fibrene holdt stadig fast, så Martin og Asger tog fat i de to del af rodenden og rokkede dem frem og tilbage, indtil den endelig gav op ( Du kan se en kort film klip af den store øjeblik her… )
English: Some fibres still held on stubbornly, so Martin and Asger took hold of either side of the oak at the root end and rocked it back and forth until it finally gave way ( you can see a short clip of the big moment here… ).

Danish: Nogle af fibrene holdt stadig fast, så Martin og Asger tog fat i de to del af rodenden og rokkede dem frem og tilbage, indtil den endelig gav op (Du kan se en kort film klip af den store øjeblik her…)
English: Some fibres still held on stubbornly, so Martin and Asger took hold of either side of the oak at the root end and rocked it back and forth until it finally gave way (you can see a short clip of the big moment here…).

Danish: Nogle havde 60 årer, nogle mere; og de var både hurtigere og mere stabile end de andre.
English: Some had 60 oars, other more than these; and they were both swifter and steadier than the others.

Danish: Nogle gaster havde mere udsatte positioner end andre.
English: Some hands were in more exposed positions than others.

Danish: Nogle havde sejlet hele deres liv, andre havde lært at sejle på Havhingsten.
English: Some have sailed all their life, other have learned on the Sea Stallion.

Danish: Ifølge etnografiske undersøgelser er maoriernes rangsystem og sociale systemer afspejlet i padleårerne, og noget lignende kan tænkes at have været tilfældet i bronzealderen i Norden.
English: Some images from the Bronze Age depict paddles shaped like the blades of spears, and corresponding shapes are known from miniatures in some of the men's graves of the period.

Danish: Hvis der er længere leveringstid på en vare, står det angivet på den enkelte vare.
English: Some items have a longer delivery time and this will be clearly marked on the individual items.

Danish: Enkelte ikke- tildannede genstande, fundet ved en boplads, kan ligeledes være oldsager, hvis det kan bevises at genstanden har været brugt at mennesker.
English: Some non-fashioned objects found a settlement can also be regarded as artefacts if it can be shown that the object has been used by people.

Danish: Andre stykker var så tynde, at bådebyggerne bare kunne gå i gang med at tilhugge med det samme, uden at fjerne alt for meget.
English: Some of the cleaved pieces were roughed out by cutting scores and removing the joggles in between, while others were thin enough to just begin hewing straight away.

Danish: Nogle gaster har nået det stade, hvor bare ordet ”havregrød” giver dem kvalme.
English: Some of the crew members now feel sick if they just hear the word porridge.

Danish: Nogle af øvelserne går nemlig ud på at måle, hvor hurtigt vi kan ro under forskellige forhold.
English: Some of the exercises are to measure how fast we can row under various conditions, including in a contrary wind in which the mast needs lowering first.”

Danish: Undertiden er graffitien ret underholdende: "Ingigerth er den smukkeste af alle kvinder".

Danish: Nogle af stenalderjægernes byttedyr overrasker os noget mere; vi har fundet spor af vildkat, mosegris, pindsvind, odder, ræv og bæver”.
English: Some of the hunter's prey has been quite a surprise - we've found traces of wild cat, water vole, hedgehog, otter, fox and beaver”

Danish: Nogle af teksterne fortæller om dyrbare skatte:
English: Some of the inscriptions talk of treasure.

English: Some of the most important Viking sites on the island include the burial mound at Ballateare, Peel Castle on St Patrick’s Isle and Tynwald.

Danish: I stedet for handlen, var det nu den voksende kongemagts behov for et centrum for administration og forvaltning, samt for den nyetablerede katolske kirke.
English: Some of the new towns out-competed older urban centres whereas other older towns such as Ribe and Aarhus expanded and became re-structured.

English: Some of the numbers: Breakfast: Porridge from 8 litres of oat flakes, 8-10 breads, 3 packages of butter, 1.5 kilo cheese, 1.5 kilo jam, 10 litres of juice, 6 litres of milk, 3 glasses of nutella, 2 kilos of müsli, 2 kilos of corn flakes.

Danish: Noget af runeteksten var forsvundet, men resten kunne læses som "Sakse ristede disser runer, ...mand".
English: Some of the runic text was destroyed, but the rest said: "Sakse carved these runes, ...man."

Danish: Nogle ture vil ske i samarbejde med Vikingeskibsmuseet i forbindelse med forskning, publikumsarrangementer eller fotooptagelser.
English: Some of the sailings are organised in co-operation with the Viking Ship Museum in relation to research, activities for the public or photo shoots.

Danish: Nogle af rejserne blev sejlet med 'flydende hypoteser', nogle med nøjagtige skibsrekonstruktioner.
English: Some of the voyages were sailed with ‘floating hypotheses', some with exact reconstructions.

English: Some of the voyages were sailed with ‘floating hypotheses’, some with exact reconstructions.

Danish: Nogle af dem er svære at datere, men som reglen er det muligt at give dem et terminus ante quem eller et terminus post quem - et tidspunkt før hvilket eller et tidspunkt efter hvilket graffitien er blevet til - ud fra dateringen af den genstand, grafittien er blevet indridset på.
English: Some of them are difficult to date but as a rule it is possible to give them a terminus ante quem or a terminus post quem - a time before which, or a time after which, the graffito was made - on the basis of the dating of the object upon which the graffito was carved.

Danish: Nogle af dem er svære at datere, men som reglen er det muligt at give dem et terminus ante quem eller et terminus post quem - et tidspunkt før hvilket eller et tidspunkt efter hvilket graffitien er blevet til - ud fra dateringen af den genstand, grafittien er blevet indridset på.
English: Some of them are difficult to date but as a rule it is possible to give them a terminus ante quem or a terminus post quem – a time before which, or a time after which, the graffito was made – on the basis of the dating of the object upon which the graffito was carved.

Danish: Nogle opgaver findes også i andre sammenhænge her på hjemmesiden.

English: Some of these are difficult to control in an experiment; for example the skill of the crew and, in particular, the helmsman, the height and wave length of the waves as well as the ship's own weight.

Danish: Nogle er svære at kontrollere i et forsøg; for eksempel besætningens og især rorsmandens dygtighed, bølgehøjden og -længden samt skibets egenvægt.
English: Some of these are difficult to control in an experiment; for example the skill of the crew and, in particular, the helmsman, the height and wave length of the waves as well as the ship’s own weight.

English: Some of these ship fortresses, or longphuirt, such as Dublin, Waterford and Wexford, were later to develop into towns but others, such as the ship base at Annagassan, Co. Louth were to lapse into obscurity.

English: Thanks to archaeological excavations and descriptions of towns in written sources we now know what many of the Viking Age towns in Denmark looked like.

Danish: Til trods for en tilsyneladende begrænsning i specialiseringen, blev denne institution hurtigt et verdensførende forskningscenter inden for skibsbygningshistorie og eksperimentalarkæologi, takket være omfattende studier i oldtidens skibsbygning (også i forhold til ikke-europæiske teknikker) ledet af Ole Crumlin-Pedersen, der var en fremragende ekspert på området.
English: Thanks to comprehensive studies of ancient shipbuilding (including non-European techniques) led by an outstanding expert on the subject, Ole Crumlin-Pedersen, this institution, although seemingly limited by its specialization, soon became a world leading centre for research in shipbuilding history and experimental archaeology.

Danish: Takket være årtiers forskning er det blevet muligt at rekonstruere såvel skibets oprindelige udseende som de metoder, der blev anvendt af skibsbyggerne i Dublin for næsten tusind år siden.
English: Thanks to decades of research it has been possible to reconstruct both the original appearance of the ships and the methods that were employed by the shipbuilders in Dublin almost a thousand years ago.

English: That it is possible to build a satisfactory reconstruction is solely due to the fact that the 1800 fragments that were found included essential parts of the bottom, the whole keelson and the stern - and the ship's side adjacent to the stern, right up to the gunwale.

Danish: Det betyder, at den får samme udseende og samme egenskaber, men også, at vi har skiftet de galvaniske klinknagler og spiger ud med kobbernagler og rudstfri skruer, da det har en meget længere holdbarhed.
English: That means that it will have the same appearance and capabilities, but also that we have replaced galvanised nails with acid-resistant stainless steel, which has a much greater longevity.

Danish: Det betyder, at der altid er mindst en person vågen ombord eller omkring Havhingsten – døgnet rundt.
English: That means there is always at least one person awake on board or around the Sea Stallion the whole day.

Danish: Det betød, at vi måtte til at gentænke påstande som den, at vikingerne den ene dag optrådte som fredelige handelsmænd, den næste som pirater.
English: That meant that we had to reconsider claims as to why the Vikings one day acted as peaceful merchants and the next day as pirates.

Danish: Det spørgsmål kan bogholderne på Vikingeskibsmuseet med rette stille sig.
English: That question is definitely on the minds of the book keepers at the Viking Ship Museum.

Danish: Den rekord bliver slået i dag.
English: That record will be broken today.

Danish: Fra Dublin drog to af Godwinsons yngste sønner samme år mod Bristol med en hær i forsøget på at rejse et oprør mod Vilhelm.
English: That same year, two of Godwinsson's youngest sons set off with an army from Dublin for Bristol in an attempt to raise a rebellion against William.

Danish: At Snorres Edda i dag er anerkendt som gyldig kilde til de forestillinger, regler, skrivetraditioner og det indhold vi finder i gude- og heltedigtene.
English: That Snorri's Edda is recognised today as a valid source for the concepts, rules, writing traditions and content that we find in the mythological and heroic poems.

Danish: Det blev en vigtig sidegevinst, at Skuldelevskibene, som i sin tid blev sænket for at skabe en søspærring til forsvar for Roskilde, gav ny opmærksomhed mod denne type af militære anlæg.
English: That the Skuldelev ships were scuttled to create a barrage to defend Roskilde became an important side effect that motivated new interest in this kind of military installation.

Danish: Det var det umiddelbare resultat.
English: That was the immediate result.

Danish: Dette år byggedes den første rekonstruktion i fuld skala af Ladbyskibet, med henblik på at undersøge fartøjets sejlegenskaber.
English: That was the year in which the first full-scale reconstruction of the Ladby ship was built, with the aim of investigating the vessel's sailing attributes.

Danish: Dette år byggedes den første rekonstruktion i fuld skala af Ladbyskibet, med henblik på at undersøge fartøjets sejlegenskaber.
English: That was the year in which the first full-scale reconstruction of the Ladby ship was built, with the aim of investigating the vessel’s sailing attributes.

Danish: Derfor fandt man både egetræskisten, pigens hud, hår, negle og klæder bevaret.
English: That was why the oak coffin, the girl's skin, hair, nails and clothing were preserved.

Danish: Det spiller også ind, at vi er så frygtelig mange ombord med forholdsvis lidt plads per person.
English: That we are so very many people on board with very little room per person also plays a role.

Danish: At vi skulle øse som aldrig før, siger måske mere om hvor meget (eller lidt…) vi har øst i vores liv, end det siger noget om grænsen for, hvad Havhingsten kan klare.
English: That we had to bale out as never before, says more perhaps about how much (or little…) we have baled out in our lives, than it says about the limits for what the Sea Stallion can take.

Danish: Derfor skal alle gaster have en redningsdragt.
English: That why every crew members must have a life preserver.

Danish: Det vil give et billede af skibenes forskellige egenskaber
English: That will give a picture of how the various ships differed.

Danish: Hviletid og ventedage kommer med i det store regnskab, hvilket gør det muligt at vurdere den samlede rejsetid.
English: That will make it easier to estimate the entire time of travelling.

Danish: Det ville være hån og ikke pris."
English: That would be insult and not praise.”

Danish: Den bedste søvn siden søndag!
English: That's the best night sleep since Sunday!

Danish: Det er et spørgsmål vi ofte bliver stillet.
English: That’s a question we are often asked.

Danish: Den bedste søvn siden søndag!
English: That’s the best night sleep since Sunday!

Danish: Sådan kan det sejlende forsøgsprojekt sige tak, fordi vi må ligge på jeres græs, tak for brug af toiletter, varmt vand og badefaciliteter.
English: That’s the way the sailing experimental project can say thank you for letting us lie on your grass and use your toilets, hot water and bathing facilities.

Danish: Derfor er kabyssen så uhørt vigtig om bord på et skib som Havhingsten," fortæller Preben Rather Sørensen.
English: That’s why the galley is extremely important on a ship like the Sea Stallion" says Preben Rather Sørensen.

Danish: "Maskestenen" er i dag udstillet på Moesgård Museum.
English: The "Mask Stone" is exhibited on the Moesgård Museum.

Danish: Tunet danner rammen for museets sommeraktiviteter.
English: The "Tunet" forms the basis for the summer activities.

Danish: Ottemannafaren blev brugt på Færøerne til vinterfiskeri med håndliner efter torsk, lange og helleflynder.
English: The "áttamannafar" (8-man boat) was used for winter fishing with hand-held lines for cod, ling and halibut.

Danish: De oprindelige padler har formentlig givet lidt ringere sprintfart, men lettere langtursroning.
English: The 'standard paddles' of Tilia did not match the original paddles in size, species of wood or weight.

Danish: Tilias ’standardpadler’ afveg fra originalerne med hensyn til såvel træsort og dimensioner som vægt.
English: The 'standard paddles' of Tilia did not match the original paddles in size, species of wood or weight.

Danish: Det knap 10 meter lange vikingeskib 'Eik Sande' rejser fra Roskilde til Kina for at kaste glans over udstillingen ”Dragons of the Northern Seas”
English: The 10m long Viking ship 'Eik Sande' travels from Roskilde to China as a special element of the exhibition, 'Dragons of the Northern Seas'

Danish: Det 13 meter lange kølsvin og de mange kølsvinsknæ illustrerer skibets tekniske stade og dristige konstruktion.
English: The 13 m long keelson and the many keelson knees illustrate the ship's advanced technical level and daring construction.

Danish: Det 13 meter lange kølsvin og de mange kølsvinsknæ illustrerer skibets tekniske stade og dristige konstruktion.
English: The 13 m long keelson and the many keelson knees illustrate the ship’s advanced technical level and daring construction.

Danish: Denne 17 fods jolle har rigeligt plads til 4-5 mand.
English: The 17 foot dinghy has plenty of room for 4-5 crew.

Danish: 1. juli sejler skib og den 65 mand store besætning ud på en 1.000 sømil lang rejse, som ingen i 1.000 år har vovet sig ud på.
English: The 1st of July ship and a crew of 65 set out on journey of 1,000 nautical miles that no one has dared in a 1,000 years.

Danish: I den 20 min. lange film følges vikingeskibet Havhingsten fra Glendalough på den spændende rejse til Dublin i 2007 og retur til Roskilde i 2008.
English: The 20 minute long film follows the Viking ship the Sea Stallion from Glendalough on the exciting voyage to Dublin in 2007 and back to Roskilde in 2008.

Danish: Derefter slækker de 20 personer varsomt på forstaget, så masten langsomt glider bagover og ned i den høje store gaffel henne agter, som fastholder den tunge mast.
English: The 20 people then cautiously slip the fore stay, letting the mast slowly glide backwards and down into the large, high gaff aft, which locks the heavy mast.

Danish: De 262 år imellem Oseberg og Skuldelev 2 giver forskere og bådebyggere en fantastisk indsigt i vikingeskibets teknologiske udvikling, når fuldskala rekonstruktionen af Oseberg igen sejler på havet.
English: The 262 years between the Oseberg and Skuldelev 2 will provide researchers and boat-builders with a fantastic insight into the Viking ship's technological development, when the full-scale reconstruction of the Oseberg sails on the sea once again.

Danish: Forsøgsrejsens 2. etape slutter i Roskilde den 9. august
English: The 2nd half of the experimental voyage ends in Roskilde on 9th August.

Danish: Den 30 meter lange rekonstruktion blev søsat i 2004.
English: The 30 metre long reconstruction was launched in 2004.

Danish: Den 300 m brede landtange, der adskiller Ebeltoft Vig fra Begtrup Vig og forbinder Mols med halvøen Helgenæs, hedder Draget.”
English: The 300 metre wide isthmus that divides Ebeltoft Vig from Begtrup Vig and connects Mols with the Helgenæs peninsula id called Draget.”

Danish: Det 30 meter lange krigsskib skal transporteres via veje og med færge de mere end 400 kilometer fra Roskilde til Berlin.
English: The 30m long warship will be transported by road and ferry during the 400km long journey from Roskilde to Berlin.

Danish: Byggeriet af Havhingsten
English: The 4-year construction of the Sea Stallion

Danish: Den 60-mand store besætningen roede 10 kilometer ad Spree-floden gennem Berlins centrum.
English: The 60-strong crew rowed 10km down the Spree through the centre of Berlin.

Danish: 61 besætningsmedlemmer ombord den 30 meter lange ”Havhingsten fra Glendalough” bliver med garanti allerede dyngvåde midt i Dublin Harbour i morgen middag.
English: The 61 members of the crew on the 30-metre long “Sea Stallion from Glendalough” are sure to get soaking wet already in the middle of Dublin Harbour tomorrow morning.

Danish: Det 70 meter lange billedtæppe Bayeuxtapetet fra 1070'erne fortæller om slaget ud fra Vilhelms synspunkt.
English: The 70 m long Bayeux Tapestry from the AD 1070s recounts the battle from William's point of view.

Danish: Det 70 meter lange billedtæppe Bayeuxtapetet fra 1070’erne fortæller om slaget ud fra Vilhelms synspunkt.
English: The 70 m long Bayeux Tapestry from the AD 1070s recounts the battle from William’s point of view.

Danish: Det 70 meter lange vævede Bayeux tapet i Normandiet, fortæller om Vilhelm Erobrerens invasion af England i 1066 med en flåde på 200 skibe, som fremstilles med mange detaljer.
English: The 70-metre long woven Bayeux Tapestry in Normandy tells of William the Conqueror's invasion of England in 1066 with a fleet of 200 ships, which are presented with fine detail.

Danish: Det 70 meter lange vævede Bayeux tapet i Normandiet, fortæller om Vilhelm Erobrerens invasion af England i 1066 med en flåde på 200 skibe, som fremstilles med mange detaljer.
English: The 70-metre long woven Bayeux Tapestry in Normandy tells of William the Conqueror’s invasion of England in 1066 with a fleet of 200 ships, which are presented with fine detail.

Danish: De 700 år fra vikingetid til 1732 er selvfølgelig lang tid og det er heller ikke sikkert, at reglerne har overlevet så længe, men det er det bedste bud vi har.
English: The 700 years which elapsed between the Viking Age and 1732 represent, of course, a very long time and it is not certain that the rules survived for so long, but this is the best source we have.

Danish: Den 8-meter lange egestamme ankommer til bådeværftet.
English: The 8 meter long oak log arrives at the boatyard.

Danish: Den ovenfor nævnte sten fra Svinnegarn er et eksempel fra en gruppe på mere end tyve svenske runesten, som alle er rejst over mænd, der mistede livet på Ingvarrs ekspedition til Serkland.
English: The above-mentioned stone from Svinnegarn is an example of a group of more than twenty Swedish rune stones that were all raised over men who lost their life on Ingvar's expedition to Serkland.

Danish: Den ovenfor nævnte sten fra Svinnegarn er et eksempel fra en gruppe på mere end tyve svenske runesten, som alle er rejst over mænd, der mistede livet på Ingvarrs ekspedition til Serkland.
English: The above-mentioned stone from Svinnegarn is an example of a group of more than twenty Swedish rune stones that were all raised over men who lost their life on Ingvar’s expedition to Serkland.

Danish: Derfor kan store lastskibe opfattes som højt udviklede handelsværktøjer og dermed som centrale elementer i en professionel søhandel.
English: The absence of an accepted centralised power might have hindered the development of specialised merchant seafaring in other Baltic Sea regions.

Danish: Manglen på en accepteret centralmagt kan have hindret udviklingen af professionel søhandel i andre Østersøregioner.
English: The absence of an accepted centralised power might have hindered the development of specialised merchant seafaring in other Baltic Sea regions.

Danish: Uheldet skete om formiddagen mandag.
English: The accident happend late monday morning.

Danish: Selve skibskosten kaldtes nest, farnest eller hafnest og bestod af grød lavet i en stor gryde der var nittet sammen.
English: The actual food eaten on board ship was called nest, farnest or hafnest, and consisted of porridge made in a large riveted pot.

Danish: Det konkrete produkt, rekonstruktionen, kan sammenlignes med en historisk fremstilling.
English: The actual product, the reconstruction, can be described as an historical hypothesis.

English: The admission of oxygen and the iron content in particular determine what is preserved.

English: The adventurer is Jens Christian Knudsen - among the crewmembers of the Sea Stallion better known as ‘Jens Cook'.

Danish: Det berørte havbundsområde udgjorde ca. 1 million kvadratmeter.
English: The affected sea floor area covered approximately 1 million square metres.

English: The after stem was produced the same way.

Danish: Om efterspillet til 1066 - og om transport af prinser og prinsesser
English: The aftermath of 1066 – and the transport of princes and princesses

Danish: Den agterste del af kølen og agterstævnen var blevet beklædt med kobberplader, hvoraf rester var bevaret.
English: The aftermost part of the keel and the sternpost had been sheathed with copper plates.

Danish: Den tidsalder, hvor disse ting fandt sted, kendes under mange forskellige navne.
English: The age when this happened is known across the world by reference to a diversity of ruling dynasties and empires.

Danish: Formålet er altid at forske i skibenes konstruktion og sejlegenskaber, som en del af den eksperimentalarkæologiske forskning.
English: The aim is to explore the ships' construction and sailing skills, as part of the experimental archaeological research.

Danish: Tallene er behæftet med en vis usikkerhed, men viser dog en klar tendens for de padlede både, hvor de britiske plankebyggede fartøjer har en beregnet vægt pr.
English: The aim of developing a new survey-concept, was to allow a post-excavation study of the preserved wrecks, as they all were to be destroyed after excavation, and therefore it would be physically impossible to collect supplementary information.

Danish: Formålet med at udtage udsnit af skibsskrogene var at dokumentere og studere skibsbygningsdetaljer, som ikke kunne blive undersøgt I løbet af det intense feltarbejde.
English: The aim of sampling parts of the ships' hulls was to document construction details that could not be examined during the intensive field work.

Danish: Målet for 'Oseberg Projektet 2006' var at evaluere og rekonstruere formen på Osebergskibet ved hjælp af ny dokumentation samt en revurdering og tolkning af de enkelte dele ud fra overbevisningen om, at nye metoder og ny ekspertise ville bringe nye svar.
English: The aim of the 'Oseberg Project 2006' was to evaluate and reconstruct the hull form of the Oseberg ship anew, with the help of new methods of documentation and a reassessment and reinterpretation of the individual ship parts, based on the belief that new techniques and new expertise could provide new answers.

Danish: Målet for ’Oseberg Projektet 2006’ var at evaluere og rekonstruere formen på Osebergskibet ved hjælp af ny dokumentation samt en revurdering og tolkning af de enkelte dele ud fra overbevisningen om, at nye metoder og ny ekspertise ville bringe nye svar.
English: The aim of the 'Oseberg Project 2006' was to evaluate and reconstruct the hull form of the Oseberg ship anew, with the help of new methods of documentation and a reassessment and reinterpretation of the individual ship parts, based on the belief that new techniques and new expertise could provide new answers.

Danish: Visionen for Vikingeskibsmuseets Bådelaug er, gennem aktiv brug af bådsamlingen, at støtte forskning i og formidling af den maritime kulturarv, samt udbrede kendskabet til sejlads og godt sømandskab.
English: The aim of the Viking Ship Museum's boat guild is to support research and communication of maritime cultural heritage through the active use of the boat collection, while also developing knowledge of sailing and good seamanship.

Danish: Visionen for Vikingeskibsmuseets Bådelaug er, gennem aktiv brug af bådsamlingen, at støtte forskning i og formidling af den maritime kulturarv, samt udbrede kendskabet til sejlads og godt sømandskab.
English: The aim of the Viking Ship Museum’s boat guild is to support research and communication of maritime cultural heritage through the active use of the boat collection, while also developing knowledge of sailing and good seamanship.

English: The alarm is set for 04.45

English: The amount of daily visitors rose from next to nothing to 5,000 in the course of the four weeks we sailed the Kattegat, Skagerrak and the North Sea.

Danish: Beløbet vil blive overført direkte til din bankkonto, så du bedes angive dit kontonummer på kopien af ordrebekræftelsen.
English: The amount will be transferred directly to your bank account, so you are asked to indicate your account number on the copy of your order confirmation.

Danish: Det analyseret udsnit af skroget viser store lighedstræk med de oplysninger vedrørende skibsbygningsprincipper, som publiceredes af Witsen første gang i 1671.
English: The analysed hull sample showed affinities with the information given by Witsen in 1671.

Danish: Analysen af dette materiale gør det muligt at identificere to størrelsesklasser af lastskibe blandt de 18 fartøjer, som er bygget i det middelalderlige Danmark: store lastskibe med en lasteevne over 40 tons og mellemstore lastskibe med en lasteevne på 10-30 tons.
English: The analysis of this material gave rise to the identification of two size classes of cargo ships among the 18 vessels which were built in medieval Denmark: large cargo vessels with a cargo capacity of over 40 tons, and medium-sized cargo vessels with a cargo capacity of 10-30 tons.

Danish: Ankertrosserne på 30 skibe sprang, hvorpå skibene drev hjælpeløse omkring og blev aldrig set siden.
English: The anchor cables broke on 30 ships and they began to drift helplessly and were never seen again.

Danish: Ankeret er nu i Nationalmuseets bevaringsafdelings varetægt, som i den kommende tid vil undersøge det nærmere.
English: The anchor is now in the care of the National Museum of Denmark’s conservation department, who will examine further over the coming period.

Danish: Ankeret var forsynet med en ca. 11 m lang ankerkæde.
English: The anchor was equipped with an 11 m long anchor chain.

Danish: Ankeret var af den type, der har været forsynet med træstok og kunne derfor meget vel være et af de mange ankre, der gik tabt de stormfulde nætter i 1811.
English: The anchor was one of the type equipped with a wooden pole and could therefore very well be one of the many anchors that were lost on the stormy nights in 1811.

Danish: Ankervagterne og formidlingsgruppen har travlt med at finde deres skoletysk frem og hjælpe folk om bord.
English: The anchor watch and ship presentation group are busy showing people around on board and remembering the German they learned in school.

Danish: Ankervagten går på skift mellem rummene.
English: The anchor watch rotates between the rooms.

Danish: Det gamle håndværk, der ligger i Havhingsten er også en del af fascinationen.
English: The ancient craftsmanship in the Sea Stallion is also part of the fascination.

Danish: I den Angelsaksiske Krønike fra 1066, hvor Slaget navngives "Slaget ved det grå æbletræ", står:
English: The Angle-Saxon Chronicle written in AD 1066, in which the battle is named "The Battle by the Grey Old Apple Tree” reports:

Danish: Den angelsaksiske krønike
English: The Anglo-Saxon Chronicle

Danish: Den angelsaksiske krønike er en samling annaler, der er blevet ført ved forskellige engelske klostre.
English: The Anglo-Saxon Chronicle is a collection of annals that have been compiled at various English monasteries.

Danish: Den angelsaksiske krønike kendes i dag i ni forskellige versioner, som til tider er meget forskellige.
English: The Anglo-Saxon Chronicle is known today in nine different versions that differ considerably from each other.

Danish: Den angelsaksiske krønike er en af vores vigtigste kilder til vikingernes aktiviteter i Vesteuropa, og naturligvis især i England.
English: The Anglo-Saxon Chronicle is one of the most important sources for Viking activities in Western Europe, and naturally particularly in England.

Danish: Den Angelsaksiske Krønike omtaler med meget få linier, at Vilhelm i 1051 besøgte Edward Bekenderen i England:
English: The Anglo-Saxon Chronicle mentions, in a very few lines, that William visited Edward the Confessor in England in AD 1051:

Danish: Også den Angelsaksiske krønike er en vigtig kilde til vikingetiden.
English: The Anglo-Saxon Chronicles are also an important source for the Viking Age.

Danish: Dyrehovederne og stævnfløjene, såvel som de fleste stævnes høje, slanke karakter, er det der indikerer, at skibene i den afbildede flåde virkelig er langskibe.
English: The animal heads and the weather-vanes, together with the tall, slender character of most of the stems, are what show that the ships in the fleet depicted really are longships.

Danish: De frankiske Rigsannaler beretter i 808, at danernes konge Gotfred, grundet stridigheder med kejser Karl den Store i Frankerriget, befæstede sin sydlige grænse med en vold.
English: The Annals of the Frankish Empire report that in 808 Godfred, King of the Danes, fortified his southern border with a bank because of conflict with the Emperor Charlemagne of the Frankish Empire.

Danish: Krønikerne fortæller, at vikingerne i 824 plyndrede klosteret, ødelagde oratoriet, dræbte adskillige lærde og gejstlige, og rystede resterne af klosterets grundlægger, St. Comhgall, ud af det skrin de lå i.
English: The Annals record that in 824 Vikings plundered the monastery, destroyed the oratory and killed a number of scholars and ecclesiastics and shook the relics of its founder, St. Comhgall, from the shrine.

Danish: Svaret er god fantasi og en hel del forberedelser.
English: The answer: Imagination and preparation.

Danish: Ja, indtil videre hedder svarene en ret avanceret hjemmeside og et meget tæt samarbejde med centrale medier,” fortæller Preben Rather Sørensen, der er leder af det sekretariat, som planlægger Havhingstens forsøgsrejse fra Roskilde til Dublin.
English: The answers are found in an advanced website and close cooperation with local press and media,” says Preben Rather Sørensen, head of the secretariat planning Sea Stallion's test sail from Roskilde to Dublin.

Danish: Nordens apostel, munken Ansgar, besøgte Birka i 829 og i Danmark fik han lov at opføre en kirke i Hedeby omkring 860 og senere i Ribe.
English: The apostle to the Nordic Countries, Ansgar, visited Birka in AD 829, and in Denmark he was given permission to build a church in Haithabu around AD 860 and later also in Ribe.

Danish: Fremkomsten af den søgående kogge i det danske rige i midten af 1100-årene signalerer begyndelsen på en dynamisk blomstringstid, da Danmark under kongerne Valdemar den Store, Knud VI og Valdemar Sejr fremtrådte som en ”nogenlunde europæiseret magt” inden for semiperiferien af et ”katolsk verdenssystem”.
English: The appearance of the seagoing cog in the Danish Kingdom in the middle of the 12th century marks the beginning of a highly dynamic and prosperous period, where Denmark under the kings Valdemar, Canute VI and Valdemar II emerged as a “fairly Europeanized power” within the semi-periphery of a ‘Catholic World-system’.

Danish: Vikingernes udseende, tøj og smykker
English: The appearance of the Viking

Danish: Den arabiske gesandt, Ibn Fadlan, mødte i 900-tallet vikingerne ved floden Volga, og hans beretning om dette møde indeholder beskrivelser af vikingernes ceremonier og ritualer ved høvdingebegravelser; herunder trælleofringer.
English: The Arab envoy, Ibn Fadlan, met the Vikings in the 10th century by the River Volga, and his account of this meeting contains descriptions of Viking ceremonies and rituals associated with the burial of chieftains, including the sacrifice of slaves.

Danish: Det arkæologiske vidnesbyrd om mellemstore lastskibe på 10-30 tons svarer stort set til den afgiftsklasse af skibe på mellem 5 og 12 læster, der nævnes i Lübecks toldrulle af 1222.
English: The archaeological evidence for medium sized cargo vessels of 10-30 tons capacity largely coincides with the taxation class of ships between 5 and 12 lasts, as stated in the Lübeck customs tariffs of 1222.

Danish: Det arkæologiske eksperiment
English: The archaeological experiment

Danish: Det arkæologisk eksperiment begynder
English: The archaeological experiment begins

Danish: De arkæologiske fund vidner om, at byen havde mange håndværkere, heriblandt smede, bronzestøbere, kam- og benmagere, lædermagere, smykkesmede, ravslibere, pottemagere og glasmagere.
English: The archaeological finds also indicate the presence of many craftsmen in Haithabu, including smiths, bronze casters, comb makers, workers of bone and leather, jewellers, amber craftsmen, potters and glassblowers.

Danish: Arkæologiske fund vidner også om, at byen er brændt ned i anden halvdel af 1000-tallet og at den derefter ser ud til at miste sin betydning.
English: The archaeological finds also reveal that the town burnt down in the second half of the 11th century and that subsequently it apparently lost its importance.

Danish: Det hollandske skibsbyggeris succes ligger i dets enkelhed, samtidig med at det tillader serieproduktionen af store søgående fartøjer.
English: The archaeological finds of pure sailing vessels provide some of the oldest evidence for specialised merchant seafaring in Denmark.

Danish: Fundene af de omtalte rene sejlskibe fremstår som nogle af det ældste vidnesbyrd om professionel søhandel i Danmark.
English: The archaeological finds of pure sailing vessels provide some of the oldest evidence for specialised merchant seafaring in Denmark.

Danish: De skibsarkæologiske fund fra perioden viser foreløbigt meget bast og ingen hamp.
English: The archaeological finds show so far a great deal of bast but no hemp.

Danish: De arkæologiske undersøgelser gennemføres forud for anlægsarbejdet på den faste Femern Bælt forbindelse.
English: The archaeological investigations are being conducted prior to construction work on the fixed Fehmarn Belt link.

Danish: Det skibsarkæologiske eksperiment er så kompliceret og så præget af indbyrdes sammenhænge, at det ikke er muligt at udvælge, isolere og analysere en enkelt faktor på samme måde, som det kan gøres i et forsøgslaboratorium.
English: The archaeological ship experiment is so complicated and comprised of so many inter-dependent elements, that it is impossible to choose, isolate and analyse a single factor in the same way as can be achieved in a test facility.

Danish: Arkæologen på arbejde.
English: The archaeologist at work.

Danish: Arkæologerne har også bjærget mere end 60 flintpilespidser og et større fragment af det gådefulde 'store spidsvåben', der er karakteristisk for Kongemosekulturen.
English: The archaeologists have raised more than 60 flint arrowheads and one larger fragment of the mystic 'large projectile weapon', which is characteristic of the Kongemose Culture.

Danish: Arkæologerne mener, at Skuldelev 2 blev omkring 25 år gammelt.
English: The archaeologists think Skuldelev 2 was about 25 years old.

Danish: Marinarkæologerne anvender såkaldt Ortofotomosaik-teknik til at fremstille oversigtbilleder af de bevarede skibsdele 'in-situ' - der, hvor de er fundet.
English: The archaeologists use a so-called Orthophotomosaic technique to produce overviews of the preserved parts of ships 'in-situ' - where they are found.

Danish: Ærkebispesædet i Hamborg-Bremen havde oprindeligt fået Norden som missionsområde og havde i slutningen af vikingetiden overhøjhed (politisk magt) over den danske kirke.
English: The archiepiscopal see in Hamburg-Bremen was originally given the Nordic Countries as its missionary area and exercised, at the end of the Viking Age, superiority over the Danish church.

Danish: Arkivet indeholder sagsakterne fra de landsdækkende marinarkæologiske undersøgelser frem til 2004.
English: The archives holds the files of the underwater archeological investigations conducted until 2004.

Danish: Området, hvor graven blev fundet, er nu indlemmet i den moderne by ved Bangor.
English: The area in which the burial was found has now been incorporated into the modern town of Bangor.

Danish: Området lå godt beskyttet; dels af floderne, som også var adgang til Nordsøen, og dels af de gamle romerske volde og mure.
English: The area was well protected by the rivers, which also gave access to the North Sea, as well as the old Roman ramparts and walls.

Danish: Argumenterne herfor er først og fremmest at katedralen i Bayeux, som tapetet vides at have tilhørt allerede i 1476, netop blev bygget af biskop Odo kort efter invasionen, samt at tre af Odo's følge optræder og er navngivne på tapetet.
English: The arguments in favour of this are first and foremost that the cathedral in Bayeux, to which the tapestry is known to have belonged already in 1476, was in fact built by bishop Odo shortly after the invasion and that three of Odo’s attendants appear and are named in the tapestry.

Danish: Fundene fra sydlige Skandinavien er alle af fyr, mens man længere mod nord også finder pile i birk.
English: The arrow shafts found in southern Scandinavia are all made of pine, whereas further to the north there are also examples of birch.

Danish: Spidserne er alle af jern og i mange forskellige typer.
English: The arrowheads are all of iron and there are many different types.

Danish: Genstandene i dette tema spænder fra forskningsplanens dokumentation af tankerne bag projektet til bådebyggernes håndværksmæssige udførelse, i form af arbejdstegninger til skibet.
English: The artefacts in this theme therefore extend from the research plan documentation of the thoughts behind the project to the craftsmanship of the boat builder's work, represented by drawings of the ship.

Danish: Genstandene er udvasket og omlejret og ligger i dybere aflejringer end uddybningsdybden.
English: The artefacts were washed out rebedded and lie at a deeper level than the dredging depth.

Danish: Artiklen skal være moderne og kunne bruges i en guidebog til England.
English: The article should be modern in style and suitable for a guide book on England.

Danish: Måske er det gået sådan for sig, da en rig mand skulle gravlægges ved Ladby.
English: The artist's interpretation of the ship burial at Ladby.

Danish: Samlingen, eller "skaret" mellem det forreste og agterste bord samles også med klinknagler.
English: The assembly or scarfs between the foremost and sternmost plank is also joined with rivets.

Danish: Gennemgangen vil omfatte 43 punkter vedrørende skibets skrog, rig, sejl og rorsystem.
English: The assessment will cover 43 individual points concerning the ship's hull, rigging, sail and rudder system.

Danish: Foreningen eksisterer for at fremme gaffelrigget sejlads og har en aktiv medlemsskare over hele Irland på over 200.
English: The Association exists to promote gaff-rigged sailing and has an active membership throughout Ireland of over 200.

Danish: Foreningen har blandt andet involveret sig i aids-problemet i Zambia og fordømt bombningerne af Afghanistan i 2001.
English: The Association has been involved in, among other things, the AIDS problem in Zambia and it condemned the bombings in Afghanistan in 2001.

Danish: Foreningen Vikingeskibsmuseets Venner blev stiftet den 26. november 1990 af en kreds af historisk interesserede med det formål at støtte Vikingeskibsmuseets arbejde og udvikling.
English: The association, the Friends of the Viking Ship Museum, was established on 26 November 1990 by a group of people with a profound interest in history.

Danish: Angrebet på Rathlin Island
English: The Attack on Rathlin Island

Danish: Angrebene på de marsvinsoliebehandlede plader karakteriseres som “ringe til moderat”, hvorimod angrebene på ubehandlede plader er “alvorlige”.
English: The attacks on the wood treated with porpoise oil are characterised as 'slight to moderate', whereas those on the untreated wood are 'serious'.

Danish: Publikum spørger "Skibet kommer da hertil ikke?".
English: The audience asks, "The ship is coming here, isn't it?".

Danish: Augustinus Fonden har netop meddelt, at den støtter den historiske vikingeskibssejlads fra Roskilde til Dublin.
English: The Augustinus Foundation just announced that it sponsors the historic Viking Ship voyage from Roskilde to Dublin.

Danish: Artiklens forfatter Henrik Kastoft er med hele vejen til Dublin og sørger for at bringe beretningerne fra skibet og besætningen, ind på hjemmesiden.
English: The author of the article Henrik Kastoft is with us all the way to Dublin and provides news and stories from the ship and crew to the homepage.

Danish: Akslerne i begge blokke er tjekket og bændslet.
English: The axles in both blocks have been checked.

Danish: B&W 4 er ikke det eneste kendte eksempel på hollandsk eller frisisk byggetradition.
English: The B&W 4 ship is not the only example of this Dutch or Friesian building tradition.

Danish: Baggrunden for kravet er, at Skuldelev 2 oprindeligt blev bygget i år 1042... i Irland.
English: The background for this claim is the fact that Skuldelev 2 originally was built in the year 1042... in Ireland.

Danish: Baggrunden herfor var formodningen om, at der i de marine sedimenter aflejret i umiddelbar nærhed af Roskildes vikingetidige og middelalderlige havn kunne findes rester af vrag og havneanlæg.
English: The background for this was a suspicion that the maritime sediments deposited in the immediate vicinity of Roskilde's Viking and medieval harbour could contain the remains of wrecks and harbour installations.

Danish: Baggrunden herfor var formodningen om, at der i de marine sedimenter aflejret i umiddelbar nærhed af Roskildes vikingetidige og middelalderlige havn kunne findes rester af vrag og havneanlæg.
English: The background for this was a suspicion that the maritime sediments deposited in the immediate vicinity of Roskilde’s Viking and medieval harbour could contain the remains of wrecks and harbour installations.

Danish: Baggrunden for forstyrrelsen er straks mere usikker, men i betragtning af selve gravformen samt af genstandsinventarets art og sammensætning kan der med en degradering af den afdødes magt eller styrke være tale om en politisk motiveret ødelæggelse.
English: The background to the disturbance is much more difficult to establish, but taking into account the grave-shape itself and the type and com-position of the contents, this downgrading of the dead person's power or influence could well be a matter of politically motivated destruction.

Danish: Skjalden var ofte medlem af en konges eller høvdings hird, og hans vigtigste opgave var, at fortælle dramatiske historier om kongen eller høvdingens heltemodige bedrifter.
English: The bard was often one of the retainers of a king or chief, and his most important job was to tell dramatic stories about the king or chief’s heroic deeds.

Danish: Fyrretræsstammen er barket af inden den hugges til.
English: The bark is removed from the pine log before it is hewn into shape.

Danish: Efter disse to spærringsfaser var dette anlæg med til at hindre Kong Niels' flåde i at sejle helt til Roskilde under stridighederne med Erik Emune forud for slaget ved Værebro Å i 1133.
English: The barrier, after these two stages of construction, evidently prevented King Niels' fleet from sailing all the way to Roskilde during the conflict with Erik Emune before the Battle at Værebro River in 1133.

Danish: Efter disse to spærringsfaser var dette anlæg med til at hindre Kong Niels’ flåde i at sejle helt til Roskilde under stridighederne med Erik Emune forud for slaget ved Værebro Å i 1133.
English: The barrier, after these two stages of construction, evidently prevented King Niels' fleet from sailing all the way to Roskilde during the conflict with Erik Emune before the Battle at Værebro River in 1133.

Danish: Grundtrækkene i historisk metode
English: The basics of historical criticism

Danish: Grundlaget for tidskapslen er Havhingstens rejse Roskilde-Dublin tur/retur og Vikingeskibsmuseets projekt 'Fuldblod på Havet'.
English: The basis for the time capsule is the Sea Stallion's return voyage from Roskilde to Dublin and the Viking Ship Museum's project 'Thoroughbred on the Sea'.

Danish: Grundlaget for denne bemærkelsesværdige proces er en særdeles indgående undersøgelse og rekonstruktion af de enkelte vrag.
English: The basis for this remarkable process is an exceptionally thorough investigation and reconstruction of the individual wrecks.

Danish: Slaget ved det grå æbletræ
English: The battle by the grey old apple tree

Danish: Kampen om England
English: The Battle for England

Danish: Slaget ved Clontarf er ofte blevet tolket som et stort nederlag for vikingerne, og et som ændrede deres skæbne i Europa.
English: The battle of Clontarf is often interpreted as a major defeat for the Vikings and one which changed their fortune in Europe.

Danish: Gennem mange år forsøgte andre irske konger og stormænd at vælte deres herredømme.
English: The Battle of Clontarf was primarily a conflict between Munster and Leinster.

Danish: Slaget ved Clontarf, der blev udkæmpet langfredag i 1014, er en af de mest berømte begivenheder i Irlands historie.
English: The Battle of Clontarf, fought on Good Friday in 1014 AD, is one of the most famous events in Irish history.

Danish: Slaget ved Hasting
English: The Battle of Hasting

Danish: Slaget ved Hastings
English: The battle of Hastings

Danish: Kampen blev voldsom og blodig, og først sidst på dagen, da Harald Hårderådes banner faldt, og kongen selv blev dræbt ved en pil i struben, gav nordmændene op.
English: The battle was violent and bloody and it was first late in the day. when Harald Hardrada's standard fell and the king himself was killed by an arrow through the throat. that the Norwegians gave up.

Danish: Bayeuxtapetet, en af de mest værdifulde billedlige kilder til vikingetiden, skildrer hvordan Vilhelm i oktober ankom til England med næsten 8000 mand, og tvang Harold Godwinson til hurtigt at sende sine krigere sydpå.
English: The Bayeux Tapestry describes how William arrived in England in October with almost 8000 men and forced Harold to send his warriors rapidly southwards.

Danish: Bayeux Tapetet viser hvordan Vilhelm den 28. september ankom til Sydengland med en stor flåde og næsten 7000 mand.
English: The Bayeux Tapestry shows how William arrived in Southern England on 28th September with a great fleet and almost 7000 men.

Danish: Perlerne har alle forskellige størrelse, form og farver.
English: The beads are all in different size, shape and colour.

Danish: Klokkerne på Roskilde Domkirke, Dublins Christ Church Katedral, samt andre kirker i Dublin vil markere næsten et årtusindes historie denne sommer.
English: The bells of Roskilde Cathedral, Denmark and of Christ Church Cathedral, Dublin and other Dublin Churches will mark nearly a thousand years of history this summer.

Danish: Berliner Dom ses i baggrunden.
English: The Berlin Cathedral can be seen in the background.

Danish: Den bedste besætning
English: The best crew

Danish: De mest kendte er de fem borganlæg: Lincoln, Nottingham, Leicester, Derby og Stamford, hvorfra vikingerne kontrollerede dele af Midtengland.
English: The best known of these are the five castles: Lincoln, Nottingham, Leicester, Derby and Stamford, from where the Vikings controlled parts of Central England.

Danish: Fra materialelageret findes den bedste planke, som skæres ud i den rigtige form på båndsaven.
English: The best plank is chosen from the stock pile and cut into the correct shape using the band saw.

Danish: Det store farvel
English: The big farewell

Danish: Den største bøde blev dog givet, hvis man ophuggede det gamle skib inden stævnene og kølen var samlet på det nye.
English: The biggest fine, however, was for breaking up the old ship before the keel, bow and stern had been put together on the new ship.

Danish: Fuglene advarede Sigurd om at Regin ville stjæle Fafni's troldom, stjæle guldet og slå Sigurd ihjel.
English: The birds told him that Regin would kill Sigurd, steal the gold and Fafni's wisdom.

Danish: Biskoppen hed på det tidspunkt Kristian, og han deltog i angrebet på England i 1069.
English: The bishop at that time was called Kristian and he participated in the Battle of England in 1069 AD.

Danish: Vores smed håndsmeder flere hundrede nagler
English: The blacksmith is hand-forging several hundred nails

Danish: Smeden fremstiller jernnagler til skibet.
English: The blacksmith makes iron rivets for the ship.

Danish: Jernet skal renses og foldes, for at fjerne de sidste urenheder, før smedning af barre og til sidst, nagler, kan begynde.
English: The bloom must then be worked further to remove any remaining impurities before the actual process of producing iron bars and eventually, rivets can begin.

Danish: Bestyrelsen bag Carsten Brebøl-fonden har nemlig besluttet at støtte den historiske sejlads med en donation på hele 2 mio. kroner.
English: The board of the Carsten Brebøl-foundation has decided to support the historic voyage with a donation of nothing less than 2 million kroner.

Danish: Båden nærmest fløj henover vandet.
English: The boat almost flew over the water.

Danish: Nu er båden næsten nede i de færdige mål.
English: The boat almost has the correct dimensions.

Danish: Bådelaugene mødes allerede klokken 10 og tømmer skibene for ballast og rig.
English: The boat associations will meet at 10 'o clock and empty the ships of ballast and rigging.

Danish: Bådelaugene mødes allerede klokken 10 og tømmer skibene for ballast og rig.
English: The boat associations will meet at 10 ’o clock and empty the ships of ballast and rigging.

Danish: Bådebyggerne skulle også finde de rigtige materialer - fx træ med størrelse og styrke som i Vikingetiden.
English: The boat builders also had to find the right materials - including wood of the same size and strength as in the Viking Age.

Danish: Bådebyggere og forskere er tilfredse.
English: The boat builders and researchers are satisfied.

Danish: Bådebyggerens værktøj
English: The boat builder’s tools

Danish: Og her er tale om en meget bredt repræsenteret bådsamling men naturligvis med hovedvægt på de fem rekonstruktioner af Skuldelevskibene; Roar Ege, Helge Ask, Kraka Fyr, Ottar og Havhingsten fra Glendalough.
English: The boat collection is very broadly representative, but naturally the emphasis is on the five reconstructions of the Skuldelev ships; Roar Ege, Helge Ask, Kraka Fyr, Ottar and the Sea Stallion from Glendalough.

Danish: Båden er straks taget i brug af sejladstjenesten.
English: The boat comes immediately into use with the Museum's sailing service.

Danish: Båden sank ikke; den blev antagelig blot efterladt på lavt vand efter ca. 50 års brug.
English: The boat does not appear to have sunk; rather, it seems to have been abandoned after an estimated 50 years of use.

Danish: Bådgraven, dateret til 850-950 e. kr., indeholdt et 11 meter langt vikingeskib med en gravlagt mand og kvinde iklædt fine dragter samt hesteudstyr, værktøj og et skjold.
English: The boat grave dates to 850 - 950 AD and contained a Vikign ship at 11 metres with a burried mand and woman dressed in fine clothing as well as equipment for horse riding, tools and a shield.

Danish: Bådgravene lå tæt sammen på toppen af en bakke og kunne både ses fra land- og vandsiden.
English: The boat graves were situated close together on the top of a hill and they could be seen from both the landward and the seaward side.

Danish: Bådelaugenes togter med museets fartøjer får dermed en særlig betydning som en sjælden kilde til førstehåndserfaringer og -data til historisk sejladsforskning.
English: The Boat Guilds' voyages with the museum's vessels attain therefore a particular significance as a rare source of first-hand experience and data for historical sailing research.

Danish: Bådelaugenes togter med museets fartøjer får dermed en særlig betydning som en sjælden kilde til førstehåndserfaringer og -data til historisk sejladsforskning.
