English: The Boat Guilds’ voyages with the museum’s vessels attain therefore a particular significance as a rare source of first-hand experience and data for historical sailing research.

Danish: Den havde været opbygget som en spinkel skal ud fra en bundplanke og to planker i hver side, fæstet indbyrdes ved syning rundt om plankeoverlapningen.
English: The boat had been constructed as a delicate shell around one central bottom strake with two broad strakes on each side, fastened to each other by means of sewing along the overlaps of the planks.

Danish: Båden har fem bordgange, som holdes sammen af håndsmedede jernnagler.
English: The boat had four strakes, which were held together with hand-forged iron nails.

Danish: Der er tre par årer i båden.
English: The boat has three pairs of oars.

Danish: Båden er med to par årer, og meget letroet.
English: The boat has two pairs of oars and is very easy to row.

Danish: Båden er meget fin i linierne og konstrueret efter samme principper, som de større skibe fra vikingetiden.
English: The boat has very elegant lines and is constructed according to the same principles as the large ships from the Viking Age.

Danish: Båden blev også bygget i halv størrelse.
English: The boat is also built in half-scale.

Danish: Båden er bygget af fyrretræ, spanterne er fyrretræsrødder og årekejperne er birk.
English: The boat is built from pine wood, the frames are pine roots and the oarlocks are birch.

Danish: Båden er bygget i fyrretræ, og kan føre et lille sejl, evt. et luggersejl.
English: The boat is built of pinewood and can carry a small sail, possibly a lugsail.

Danish: Båden, der er af oregonpine, eg, ask og fyr, blev oprindeligt blev bygget til "Glaskalle" (John Carlsson), der dengang var Sveriges kendteste sejler.
English: The boat is constructed from Oregon pine, e.g. ash and pine, was originally built for "Glaskalle" (John Carlsson), who was Sweden's best-known sailor at the time.

Danish: Båden, der er af oregonpine, eg, ask og fyr, blev oprindeligt blev bygget til "Glaskalle" (John Carlsson), der dengang var Sveriges kendteste sejler.
English: The boat is constructed from Oregon pine, e.g. ash and pine, was originally built for "Glaskalle" (John Carlsson), who was Sweden’s best-known sailor at the time.

Danish: Båden er i øjeblikket opstillet i værftshallen, hvor den gennemgår omfattende vedligeholdelsesarbejde.
English: The boat is currently located in the shipbuilding hall, where it is undergoing extensive maintenance work.

Danish: Båden bliver udhulet ved at hugge spor på tværs, og derefter kløve store stykker egetræ væk.
English: The boat is dug out by cutting sections across the log and then cleaving out large pieces of oak.

Danish: Undervejs i opvarmningen bliver båden spændt mere og mere ud.
English: The boat is gradually expanded as it is warmed up.

Danish: Ved udspændningen kom der en lille sprække ved naglehovedet i stævnen, denne sprække udviklede sig senere til en flække, der ødelagde båden
English: The boat is heated for half an hour, as hot as is possible without the timbers igniting.

Danish: En måneds tid efter bliver båden igen taget op af vandet.
English: The boat is laid in water until the boatbuilders are ready to expand it.

Danish: Båden bliver sat midt mellem to bål, så den bliver varmet op fra begge sider.
English: The boat is placed between two fires, so that it can be warmed up from both sides.

Danish: Tidligt i processen blev, bådens bagbord side, ved et uheld, hugget og høvlet lidt for tynd.
English: The boat is placed between two fires, so that it can be warmed up from both sides.

Danish: Båden fremdrives af to sprydsejl på ustagede master.
English: The boat is propelled by two spritsails on unstayed masts.

Danish: Båden er klar til søsætning.
English: The boat is ready to be launched.

Danish: Efter bålet er brændt ned, så der kun er gløder, stilles båden på klodser, tæt på gløderne.
English: The boat is then set up on blocks, close to the embers.

Danish: Båden bliver varmet op.
English: The boat is warmed up.

Danish: Båden repræsenterer afslutningen en epoke hvor den åbne råsejlsbåd blev anvendt til vinterfiskeri i Nordnorge, helt frem til tiden omkring første verdenskrig.
English: The boat represents the end of an era where the open, square sailed boat was used for winter fishing in northern Norway, right up to the period around World War I.

Danish: Båden virkede meget ustabil i tom tilstand, men var rimelig stabil og sødygtig med fuldt mandskab og 600 kg ballast ombord, og den gled let op på stranden ved landsætning.
English: The boat seems very unstable when empty but is reasonably stable and seaworthy with a full crew and 600 kg ballast on board, and it glides easily up onto the sand when beaching.

Danish: Båden suger en masse tjære.
English: The boat soaks up a large quantity of tar.

Danish: Bådtypen blev opkaldt efter avisen og kendes som DN'eren.
English: The boat type was named after the newspaper and is known as the DN.

Danish: Båden hed ”Kretora”, opkaldt efter en grønlandsk fangerkone, K'etura "Qítûlâraq" Heilmann, som kongen havde mødt og var blevet betaget af, på Kongebesøget i Grønland i 1921.
English: The boat was called “Kretora”, named after a Greenlandic hunter's wife, K'etura "Qítûlâraq" Heilmann, whom the king had met and had been enchanted by during the Royal Visit to Greenland in 1921.

Danish: Båden hed ”Kretora”, opkaldt efter en grønlandsk fangerkone, K'etura "Qítûlâraq" Heilmann, som kongen havde mødt og var blevet betaget af, på Kongebesøget i Grønland i 1921.
English: The boat was called “Kretora”, named after a Greenlandic hunter’s wife, K'etura "Qítûlâraq" Heilmann, whom the king had met and had been enchanted by during the Royal Visit to Greenland in 1921.

Danish: Båden har oprindeligt været udstyret med ca. tre par årer og et råsejl, der gjorde den til et meget fleksibelt transportmiddel.
English: The boat was equipped with three pairs of oars and a square sail, making it a flexible means of transport.

Danish: Båden var udstyret med tre par årer og et råsejl, der gjorde den til et meget fleksibelt transportmiddel.
English: The boat was equipped with three pairs of oars and a square sail, making it a flexible means of transport.

Danish: Efter navngivningen blev båden søsat
English: The boat was launched after it was named.

Danish: Den 23. april blev båden søsat.
English: The boat was launched on 23rd April.

Danish: Båden er en bestilling fra en privat kunde, og er en unik chance for værftet til at fastholde en bådebygger-tradition, som langsomt dør ud.
English: The boat was ordered from a private client and is a unique opportunity for the boatyard to maintain a boat-building tradition that is slowly dying out.

Danish: Båden menes at være bygget i fyrretræ, og er forhøjet med en ekstra påsyet planke, på hver side.
English: The boat was originally built of pine and its height was increased with the addition of an extra plank sewn on to each side.

Danish: Den båd, vi skal bygge, skal have næsten samme form som en ældre åledrivkvase.
English: The boat we built should have almost the same form as the older eel drifters.

Danish: Skibet er bygget med de samme metoder, materialer og værktøj, som vikingetidens bådebyggere brugte, og skibene repræsenterer noget af det tætteste, vi kommer de oprindelige skibe.
English: The boat were constructed using the very same methods, materials and tools used by the Viking boat-builders and the ships are about as close as it is possible to get to the original Viking ships.

Danish: Båden bygges næsten udelukkende af eg, og til kølstykket valgte vi et langt, lige træ.
English: The boat will be built almost entirely from oak, and for the keel, a tall, straight tree is chosen.

Danish: Båden skal bruges som lystbåd.
English: The boat will be used as a pleasure boat.

Danish: Båden skal bruges til formidling af det historiske landskab omkring Roskilde Fjord.
English: The boat will be used to present and explain the historic landscape around Roskilde Fjord.

Danish: Den har derfor i datiden repræsenteret en farlig trussel for udsatte kystegne og krævet et effektivt lokalt forsvar.
English: The boat would therefore have represented a dangerous threat to exposed coastlines and necessitated an effective local defence force.

Danish: Bådens form bliver skabt over nogle faste målepunkter, som bliver afsat under bygningen.
English: The boat's form is created over some fixed measuring points, which are marked out during construction.

Danish: Båden har fået sit navn på baggrund af den meget specielle fangstmetode fiskerne brugte til ålefiskeriet.
English: The boat's name is derived from the special methods used when fishing for eel.

Danish: Båden har fået sit navn på baggrund af…
English: The boat's name is derived from the speci…

Danish: Jollen er en såkaldt smakkejolle med sprydstagesejl, fok, klyver og topsejl.
English: The boat, a so-called "four-sail" dinghy, is rigged with spritsail, foresail, jib and topsail.

Danish: Bådebyggeren er selv designeren og konstruktøren, indenfor den tradition han nu er en del af.
English: The boatbuilder becomes both designer and constructor within the tradition he is now a part of.

Danish: Bådebyggeren skal passe de to bordplanker sammen, så de bliver vandtætte.
English: The boatbuilder has to fit the strakes together in such a way, so that they will be watertight.

Danish: Bådens linjer danner bådebyggeren ved hjælp af sit øjemål.
English: The boatbuilder shapes the boat's lines by eye.

Danish: Bådens linjer danner bådebyggeren ved hjælp af sit øjemål.
English: The boatbuilder shapes the boat’s lines by eye.

Danish: Bådebyggeren, smeden, rebslageren, sejlmageren, pilefletteren, løbbinderen, træskæreren og væveren er i gang hele dagen og står klar til en snak om materialer, værktøj og teknikker.
English: The boatbuilder, blacksmith, rope maker, sail maker, willow worker, wood carver and weaver are working all day and stand ready to talk about materials, tools and techniques.

Danish: Bådebyggerne arbejder på bådeværftet med værktøj, som det vikingerne brugte.
English: The boatbuilders are constructing a Viking ship using replica Viking tools.

Danish: Vikingeskibsmuseets bådebyggere arbejder med kopier af vikingernes værktøj, og bruger tilsvarende materialer og teknikker.
English: The boatbuilders at the Viking Ship Museum works with copies of Viking Age tools and corresponding materials and techniques.

Danish: Fornemmelsen i hænderne bliver brugt til at måle bådsidens tykkelse.
English: The boatbuilders gauge the thickness of the boat's sides by hand.

Danish: Bådebyggerne henter træ til Gislingebåden
English: The boatbuilders get wood for the Gislinge Boat

Danish: Bådebyggerne fugter nu bordet godt med en våd kost, før de forsigtigt lægger bordet tilrette over varmen.
English: The boatbuilders give the planks a good soaking with water before they carefully set them into position above the flames.

Danish: Lige så snart det første bord er på plads, er det næste klar, og processen begynder forfra.
English: The boatbuilders have to move quickly here as the wood begins to stiffen again as it cools down.

Danish: Bådebyggerne har bygget alt fra en rekonstruktion af et 30 meter langt krigsskib fra vikingetiden, til udspændte stammebåd og traditionelle fiskerbåde.
English: The boatbuilders have undertaken everything from the reconstruction of a 30m long Viking Age warship to expanded log boats and traditional fishing craft.

Danish: Bådeværftet byder indenfor, hvor der i øjeblikket bygges på livet løs.
English: The boatbuilders invite you behind the scenes, where they're in full swing with many projects.

Danish: Bådeværftet byder indenfor, hvor der i øjeblikket bygges på livet løs.
English: The boatbuilders invite you behind the scenes, where they’re in full swing with many projects.

Danish: Bådebyggerne udskifter nogle af bordplankerne og spanterne.
English: The boatbuilders will be replacing some of the planks and frames.

Danish: Bådebyggerne tilhugger derefter de kløvede stykker med økser, for at få glatte, smidige og stærke planker til skibets skrog.
English: The boatbuilders will then use axes to hew these cleaved sections down to smooth, flexible and strong planks for the ship’s hull.

Danish: Bådebyggerne arbejder der, hvor museets gæster færdes, og en stor del af deres arbejde går ud på at besvare de mange spørgsmål, som museets nysgerrige gæster stiller.
English: The boatbuilders work in full view of the Museum's guests and a large part of their work involves answering questions from curious visitors.

Danish: Bådebyggerne arbejder der, hvor museets gæster færdes, og en stor del af deres arbejde går ud på at besvare de mange spørgsmål, som museets nysgerrige gæster stiller.
English: The boatbuilders work in full view of the Museum’s guests and a large part of their work involves answering questions from curious visitors.

Danish: Bådebyggerens værksted
English: The boatbuilders workshop

Danish: Bådebygningsmiljøet på museet er også noget helt særligt.
English: The boatbuilding environment at the Museum is also something quite unique.

Danish: Bådebygningsholdet på museet består af nogle af Danmarks mest erfarende bådebyggere indenfor konstruktion af klinkbygget træbåde.
English: The boatbuilding team at the Museum includes some of Denmark's most experienced traditional clinker-built wooden boat builders.

Danish: Bådebygningsholdet på museet består af nogle af Danmarks mest erfarende bådebyggere indenfor konstruktion af klinkbygget træbåde.
English: The boatbuilding team at the Museum includes some of Denmark’s most experienced traditional clinker-built wooden boat builders.

Danish: Bådene har plads til hver 20 gæster og to sejladsinstruktører.
English: The boats accommodate 20 guests each as well as two sailing instructors.

Danish: Skibene sejles af frivillige fra museets bådelaug.
English: The boats are sailed by volunteers from the respective boat guilds.

Danish: Farvandet mellem disse øer udgør ideelle forhold for sejlads med åbne både af forskellig størrelse.
English: The boats are strengthened athwartships, for example, with "bites" (crossbeams) in much the same way as the Viking ships were.

Danish: Også bådene i området er præget af tidevandet.
English: The boats in the area are also affected by the tide.

Danish: Bådene var forsætligt slået i stykker, og stumperne lå blandet med hinanden.
English: The boats were deliberately broken up and the fragments lay mixed together on the deck.

Danish: Bådene blev ganske simpelt solgt uden åre fra bådebyggerens side.
English: The boats were sold without oars.

Danish: Bådsmandsbogen: indeholder forskellige observationer omkring skrog, rig, sejl og rorsystem.
English: The Boatswain’s Journal: contains various observations on the hull, rigging, sail and rudder system.

Danish: Arbejdet foregår, så publikum har mulighed for at følge håndværkerne på nært hold.
English: The boatyard builds clinker-built boats and its purpose is to preserve the maritime crafts associated with these boats.

Danish: Bådeværftet genlyder af øksehug, hammerslag og lyden af store stammer, der kløves.
English: The boatyard echoes with axe strikes, hammer blows and the sound of large timbers being split.

Danish: På bådeværftet formidler vores dygtige bådebyggere vikingetidens håndværk og bådebygningskultur.
English: The Boatyard evhibits the craftsmanship and boat-building culture of the Viking Age.

Danish: Bådeværftet er desuden åbent for museets publikum året rundt.
English: The boatyard is also quite unusual in that it is open to the public, all year round.

Danish: Værftet bygger Fejø-pramme til udlejning
English: The boatyard is building Fejø-prams for hire

Danish: På bådeværftet, der ligger på Museumsøen, bygges der klinkbyggede brugsbåde med det formål at bevare de maritime håndværk, der er knyttet til disse både.
English: The boatyard is located on the Museum Island and work is carried out so that the public can follow the process at close quarters.

Danish: Bådeværftets speciale er rekonstruktioner af forhistoriske både i fuld størrelse, efter datidens metoder.
English: The boatyard specialises in full-scale reconstructions of prehistoric boats using the methods of the time.

Danish: Bådens form bliver skabt over nogle faste målepunkter, som bliver afsat under bygningen.
English: The boat’s form is created over some fixed measuring points, which are marked out during construction.

Danish: Den gravlagte har tilsyneladende været udsat for en lignende ødelæggelse.
English: The body of the dead person was apparently also subjected to similar destruction.

Danish: Der skal bores et hul gennem knæ og stævn, til motorens aksel ud til propellen.
English: The bolts have a washer on the inner face, allowing them to be tightened.

Danish: Knoglematerialet fra udgravningen er usædvanlig godt velbevaret.
English: The bonemass from the site is unusually well preserved.

Danish: Knoglerne giver os indblik i stenalderjægernes kost og jagtstrategier.
English: The bones give us an insight into the diet and hunting strategies of Stone Age hunters.

Danish: Desuden analyseres 18 fund af lastskibe fra perioden i forhold til skibskonstruktioner, byggetradition, lasteevne og kulturel kontekst.
English: The book also analyzes 18 finds of cargo ships from the period in relation to ship design, building tradition, carrying capacity and cultural context.

Danish: I bogen findesa desuden bidrag af Ole Crumlin-Pedersen, Aoife Daly, Tinna Damgård-Sørensen, C. Jahnke, M.
English: The book also contains contributions by Ole Crumlin-Pedersen, Aoife Daly, Tinna Damgaard-Sørensen, C. Jahnke, M.

Danish: I bogen findesa desuden bidrag af Ole Crumlin-Pedersen, Aoife Daly, Tinna Damgård-Sørensen, C. Jahnke, M. R. Kristiansen, H. J. Kühn, O. Magnus, S. Möller-Wiering & O. Nakoinz.
English: The book also contains contributions by Ole Crumlin-Pedersen, Aoife Daly, Tinna Damgaard-Sørensen, C. Jahnke, M. R. Kristiansen, H. J. Kühn, O. Magnus, S. Möller-Wiering and O. Nakoinz.

Danish: Bogen kan bestilles via museets webbutik på www.vikingeskibsmuseet.dk.
English: The book can be ordered online via the Museum Webshop or www.oxbowbooks.com.

Danish: Bogen kan bestilles via museets webshop
English: The book can be ordered online via the Viking Ship Museum's webshop

Danish: Bogen kommer langt omkring emnet og beskriver i detaljer især fire interessante skibsfund:
English: The book covers the topic in detail and describes four particularly interesting ship finds:

Danish: Temabogen tager udgangspunkt i aktuelle forskningsspørgsmål på tværs af fagdiscipliner og geografiske områder, og har derfor inddraget en række eksperter fra ind- og udland.
English: The book is based on current research issues across disciplines and geographic areas, and has involved a range of experts from both at home and abroad.

Danish: Bogen forventes at udkomme i november 2007.
English: The book is expected to be published in November 2007.

Danish: Bogen er udgivet med støtte fra Dronning Margrethes og Prins Henriks Fond, The Danish National Research Foundation, Farumgaard-Fonden.
English: The book is kindly supported by: Dronning Margrethes og Prins Henriks Fond, The Danish National Research Foundation, Farumgaard-Fonden.

Danish: Bogen er udgivet med støtte fra The Danish National Research Foundation og The Danish Research Council for the Humanities.
English: The book is kindly supported by: The Danish National Research Foundation og The Danish Research Council for the Humanities.

Danish: Bogen er udgivet med støtte fra The Danish National Research Foundation, The Danish Research Council for the Humanities, Ingeniør N.M. Knudsens Fond og Møllerens Fond.
English: The book is kindly supported by: The Danish National Research Foundation, The Danish Research Council for the Humanities, Ingeniør N.M. Knudsens Fond og Møllerens Fond.

Danish: Bogen er udgivet med støtte fra The Royal Greenland Foundation, The Danish Research Council for the Humanities, Kay Bojesens Fond, A.P. Møller og hustru Chastine McKinney-Møllers Fond til Almene Formål & Tuborg-Fondet.
English: The book is kindly supported by: The Royal Greenland Foundation, The Danish Research Council for the Humanities, Kay Bojesens Fond, A.P. Møller og hustru Chastine McKinney-Møllers Fond til Almene Formål & Tuborg-Fondet.

Danish: Bogen er planlagt til udgivelse i slutningen af 2011
English: The book is scheduled for release in late 2011

Danish: Der reflekteres over de eksperimentalarkæologiske erfaringer, dette i relation til både arkæologiske og skriftlige vidnesbyrd om søfart og samfundsorganisation fra vikingetiden og højmiddelalderen.
English: The book reflects on the experimental archaeological insights gained during the voyages, and these insights are subsequently compared with both archaeological and written evidence for Viking Age and High Medieval seafaring and society.

Danish: Kogebogen 'The Irish Kitchen' indeholder både traditionelle og moderne irske retter.
English: The book the 'Irish Kitchen' is a cook book of Irish recipes.

Danish: Hos booking teamet kan du booke undervisningsforløb, private arrangementer og sejlture.
English: The booking team takes care of booking activities for school children, private events and sailing trips.

Danish: Bogen præsenterer skibet Havhingsten fra Glendalough i tre kapitler: ”Fundet”, ”Skibet” og ”Rejsen”.
English: The booklet presents the Sea Stallion from Glendalough in three chapters: “The Find”, “The Ship” and “The Voyage”.

Danish: Bibliotekets bøger og tidsskrifter er registreret i Nationalmuseets onlinekatalog NatKat under de følgende bibliotekssignaturer:
English: The books and journals of the library are registered in the National Museum's online catalogue NatKat under the following signatures:

Danish: Bogens hovedforfatter er arkæolog og ph.d. Anton Englert, som til dagligt arbejder som museumsinspektør i Vikingeskibsmuseets Forskningsafdeling.
English: The book’s main author is archaeologist and PhD Anton Englert, who works as a curator of the Viking Ship Museum’s Research Department.

Danish: Begge konger anvendte i høj grad udenlandske skibsbygmestre til at bygge flådens store skibe, fortrinsvis efter engelske metoder.
English: The bottom (which was shell-built) is relatively flat, with a hard chine between the floor and the sides.

Danish: Bunden og næsten hele bagbord side er intakt, så det har· været relativt let at rekonstruere den manglende styrbords side.
English: The bottom and almost all of the port side were intact, which made it relatively easy to reconstruct the missing starboard side.

Danish: Bunden og hele bagbord side af skibet - ca 65 % er bevaret - og det var derfor muligt at genskabe den manglende styrbord side.
English: The bottom of the hull and the entire port side - approximately 65 % - is preserved and it was therefore possible to recreate the starboard side.

Danish: Stævnene støttedes udefra og med spændtovet mellem klamperne for og agter.
English: The bottom plank was held fast to supports made to fit the selected rocker shape.

Danish: Stævnsmeden (Stafnasmidir) var den mest erfarne bådebygger på pladsen - bygmesterens højre hånd og dermed den der havde det praktiske ansvar for formen på skroget.
English: The bow and stern smith (Stafnasmidir) was the most experienced boat builder on the site - the master shipbuilder's right-hand man. He had the practical responsibility for the shape of the hull.

Danish: Forskibet løftede sig fire meter op og ned på de store atlanterhavsdønninger”, siger Andes B. S. Fischer.
English: The bow rose four meters up and down on the large Atlantic swells.”

Danish: Kassen skal være klar til nedgravning den 1. maj 2009 og skal først genåbnes om 250 år.
English: The box will be ready for burial 1 May 2009 and will remain sealed for the next 250 years.

Danish: De skal vendes ofte og er færdige når de lyder hule, hvis der bankes på dem med en negl.
English: The breads should be turned often and are ready when they sound hollow if you tap them with a fingernail.

Danish: Sejlets bredde kan derfor nøje beregnes.
English: The breadth of the sail can therefore be calculated precisely.

Danish: Broen har stor regional betydning og er samtidig en vigtig del af jernbaneforbindelsen mellem København og Tyskland.
English: The bridge is of great regional importance and is also an important part of the railway connection between Copenhagen and Germany.

Danish: Broen har stor regional betydning og er samtidig en vigtig del af jernbaneforbindelsen mellem København og Tyskland.
English: The bridge is of great significance regionally and is also an important element in the rail connection between Copenhagen and Germany.

Danish: Broen, der blev indviet i 1978, er 1.717 meter lang og har en gennemsejlingshøjde på 26 meter.
English: The bridge, which was inaugurated in 1978, is 1,717 metres long and has an average clearance height of 26 metres.

Danish: Bronzealderafbildninger viser i nogle tilfælde spydbladsformede padler, og tilsvarende former er fundet i miniudgave i flere af periodens mandsgrave.
English: The broad paddles were presumably used for short trips while the narrow ones were used for longer voyages.

Danish: Det antages, at de brede åreblade blev anvendt ved kortere sejladser, de smallere ved længere rejser.
English: The broad paddles were presumably used for short trips while the narrow ones were used for longer voyages.

Danish: Bronzestøberen bruger vikingernes teknikker og materialer til støbning af smykker.
English: The bronze caster uses Viking Age techniques to cast jewellery.

Danish: Der er tale om ovale, skålformede spænder - en af de mest velkendte genstandstyper fra vikingetiden.
English: The brooches are known as oval brooches, one of the best-known types of Viking artefacts.

Danish: Der er tale om ovale, skålformede spænder – en af de mest velkendte genstandstyper fra vikingetiden.
English: The brooches are known as oval brooches, one of the best-known types of Viking artefacts.

Danish: Brough of Birsay er en tidevands-ø ud for nordvestkysten af Orkney-øerne, En tidevandsø er et landområde som bliver til en ø, når tidevandet står højt.
English: The Brough of Birsay is a tidal isalnd off the north-west coast of mainland Orkeny, which is only accessible by foot at low tide.

Danish: Boblen sprænges
English: The bubble will burst

Danish: Søsyge og lænsevagt
English: The bubble will burst

Danish: Budgettet er beskåret med i alt 2,6 millioner kroner.
English: The budget is reduced by DKK 2.6 million.

Danish: Ved bygningen og udrustningen af rekonstruerede fartøjer fra vikingetiden og middelalderen anvendes forskellige håndværk og en teknologisk viden, der i vid omfang er ved at forsvinde.
English: The building and fitting out of a reconstructed vessel from the Viking period or the Middle Ages requires the application of a broad range of craftsmanship and technological knowledge, much of which has been lost today, or is about to be lost.

Danish: Byggestedet er fastlagt til indenfor det middelalderlige Danmark.
English: The building location has been determined to being within medieval Denmark.

Danish: Ved byggeriet af større og måske kongelige skibe, fx et langskib som Skuldelev 2, blev arbejdet ledet af en skibsbygmester kaldet Hofudsmidir.
English: The building of large and possibly royal ships, such as a longship like the Skuldelev 2, was led by a master shipbuilder called a Hofudsmidir.

Danish: Byggeriet af Roar Ege blev grundigt dokumenteret.
English: The building of Roar Ege was carefully documented.

Danish: Byggeriet af invasionsflåden
English: The building of the invasion fleet

Danish: Byggeriet af langskibets skrog var det største arbejde både for 1000 år siden og i dag, og arbejdstimerne kan fordeles således:
English: The building of the longship's hull was the largest task both 1000 years ago and today.

Danish: Byggeriet af Havhingsten fra Glendalough og rekonstruktionsmodellen er finansieret af Tuborgfondet
English: The building of the Sea Stallion from Glendalough and the reconstruction model are funded by the foundation

Danish: Byggeriet af Havhingsten blev gengivet gennem film og billeder, og udstillede genstande fundet ved arkæologiske udgravninger af Dublin, beskrev livet i hovedstaden i perioden 800-1150.
English: The building process of the Sea Stallion was shown through film and pictures, and exhibited items found at archaeological excavations in Dublin described life in the capital between 800-1150 A.D.

Danish: Byggeriet foregår tæt på Trondheim, og der er en stor mængde mennesker beskæftiget.
English: The building takes place close to Trondheim and many men are employed upon it.

Danish: Bygningen er tegnet af professor og arkitekt Erik Chr. Sørensen som vandt arkitektkonkurrencen med sit senmodernistiske bygningsanlæg, der tydeligt er inspireret af japansk arkitektur og står som en sjælden repræsentant for stilarten ”brutalisme”.
English: The building was designed by Professor and Architect Erik Chr. Sørensen, who won the architecture competition with his late-modern building design, which was clearly inspired by Japanese architecture and is a rare example of the 'brutalist' style.

Danish: Bygningerne blev overdraget til Roskilde Sejlklub som opførte nye bygninger på arealet.
English: The building was transferred to Roskilde Sailing Club which built new buildings on the site.

Danish: Her er byggeriet flyttet indendøre på værftet og bådebyggerne er igang med den sidste bordgang.
English: The building work has been moved indoors to the boatyard and the boatbuilders are working on the last strake.

Danish: Byggeriet i billeder
English: The building work in pictures

Danish: Byggeriet i 2000-2004 og de efterfølgende forsøgssejladser med Skuldelev 2-rekonstruktionen Havhingsten fra Glendalough er det hidtil mest omfattende projekt af denne karakter.
English: The building, in 2000-2004, of the Skuldelev 2 reconstruction the Sea Stallion from Glendalough, and the vessel's subsequent sea trials, constitute the most comprehensive project of this nature to date.

Danish: Skottet er lavet af en egetræstveje.
English: The bulkhead is made from a forked piece of oak.

Danish: Gravhøjene, forsvarsværkerne, borgene og de utallige opførte veje og broer gennem utilgængeligt landskab, har krævet en kolossal manuel arbejdskraft, hvilket vidner om en stærk konge, der havde magt og mulighed for at sætte mange mand i arbejde.
English: The burial mounds, defensive works, strongholds and the numerous roads and bridges constructed through difficult landscapes demanded a colossal amount of manual labour, which is evidence of a strong king who had power and money to levy a large workforce.

Danish: Smørret kan æltes med salt, så holder det længere.
English: The butter can be kneaded with salt to improve its keeping qualities.

Danish: Kærnemælksosten kan krydres med timian, hvidløg, mynte eller den kan røres med lidt fløde og tilsættes æbler og nødder.
English: The buttermilk cheese can be flavoured with thyme, garlic or mint or it can be mixed with a little cream, after which apple and nuts are added.

Danish: Der må ikke røres i kærnemælken mens den opvarmes, men træk en slev forsigtigt igennem en enkelt gang eller to for at fordele varmen.
English: The buttermilk must not be stirred while it is being warmed, but draw a ladle carefully through it once or twice in order to redistribute the heat.

Danish: De ca. 25% - i alt 1.800 skibsdele - der er tilbage, omfatter imidlertid skibets vigtigste målepunkter.
English: The ca. 25 % that remained - a total of 1800 ship components - includes, however, the most important parts needed to establish the ship's original dimensions.

Danish: De ca. 25% - i alt 1.800 skibsdele - der er tilbage, omfatter imidlertid skibets vigtigste målepunkter.
English: The ca. 25 % that remained – a total of 1800 ship components – includes, however, the most important parts needed to establish the ship’s original dimensions.

Danish: Cafeen, der ligger med udsigt til bådeværftet og Vikingeskibsmuseets mange smukke træskibe, anretter et lækkert brunchbord med brunch-klassikere som røræg med urter, røget bacon og skyr med honningcrunch og bærsovs.
English: The cafe, situated with views of both the boatyard and the Viking Ship Museum's many beautiful wooden boats, serves a delicious brunch with brunch classics such as scrambled eggs with herbs, smoked bacon and skye with honey crunch and berry sauce.

Danish: Beregningerne viste, at båden ville være meget følsom for forskydninger af vægte sidelæns, hvilket bekræftedes af målinger i 1999.
English: The calculations showed that the boat would be very sensitive to lateral shifting of weight and this was confirmed by measurements made in 1999.

Danish: Dåsen lukkes til med en græstørv og lægges ind i gløderne på et bål eller i en kakkelovn.
English: The can should be sealed with a grass turf and then placed in the embers of a fire or in a stove.

Danish: Kanalen stammer tilbage fra cirka år 700.
English: The canal dates back to year 700.

Danish: Kanalen var en to meter dyb og 12 meter bred rende.
English: The canal was two metres deb and 12 metres wide.

Danish: Fortrydelsesfristen udløber 14 dage efter den dag, hvor du eller en af dig angiven tredjepart, dog ikke transportøren, får varerne i fysisk besiddelse.
English: The cancellation period expires 14 days after the day you, or your stated third party (excluding transport personnel) have received the item.

Danish: Lasteevnen er 35 kubikmeter eller ca. 20 tons.
English: The cargo-carrying capacity is 35 cubicmetres, or about 20 tons.

Danish: Skuldelev 6’ lasteevne er dermed blevet forøget, men samtidig er brugsmulighederne indskrænket til, at fartøjet kun kunne fungere som ’føringsbåd’ under sejl, enten lokalt eller, som fundstedet viser, på længere rejser.
English: The cargo-carrying capacity of Skuldelev 6 increased, but at the same time the vessel would no longer have been so versatile.

Danish: Lasteevnen er omtrent 1 ton, f.eks. 4 mand og 10 får.
English: The cargo-carrying capacity was around 1 ton, e.g. 4 men and 10 sheep.

Danish: Frankerriget i vest og Byzans i øst udviklede i stedet kontakter med landene omkring Nordsøen og Sortehavet.
English: The Carolingian Empire in the West and the Byzantine Empire in the East began instead to develop relations with the lands around the North and Black Seas.

Danish: Frankerriget i vest og Byzans i øst udviklede i stedet kontakter med landene omkring Nordsøen og Sortehavet.
English: The Carolingian Empire in the West and the Byzantine Empire in the East began instead to develop relations with the lands around the North and Black Seas.[v]

Danish: Da var handverkerne alt kommet dit, de sto der alle sammen og gjorde ingen ting.
English: The carpenters were there before them, but all were standing idle with their arms across.

Danish: Stik modsat er det med højtryk, som på den nordlige halvkugle drejer om sig selv med urets retning.
English: The case is opposite with high-pressures, which spin clockwise in the northern hemisphere.

Danish: Undersøgelserne er organiseret i afsnit, som er ens organiseret.
English: The case studies are organised in sub-chapters, each dealing with its own aspect.

Danish: Herudover indeholder kataloget et forord og et afsluttende opslag, ”Hvem støtter projektet?” med omtale af fonde, sponsorer og offentlig støtte.
English: The catalogue further includes a preface and a final entry, “Who supports the project”, with a list of public and private sponsors.

Danish: Rapporten giver et nøjagtigt billede af en irsk husstands sammensætning og økonomi i tiden omkring Havhingstens besøg.
English: The Central Bank of Ireland provided a full set of coins and some notes used in everyday circulation.

Danish: Bundplanken fortsatte i begge ender ud over selve bådrummet som et kraftigt, opadbøjet horn med ovalt tværsnit.
English: The central bottom strake extended from both ends of the boat proper, forming sturdy, upwards-turning horns with oval cross-sections.

Danish: Det helt centrale er den elementære balance mellem skrog, sejl og ror under sejlads op mod vinden, dvs. under bidevindsejlads.
English: The central crucial factor is the elementary balance between hull, sail and rudder when sailing against the wind, i.e. sailing close-hauled.

Danish: Flådens centrale del med Vilhelms skib.
English: The central part of the fleet with William’s ship.

Danish: Den centrale kongemagt kan have ønsket at placere byerne anderledes ud fra indenrigspolitiske og strategiske kriterier, og dermed have medvirkende til, at der opstod nye byer og gamle blev forladt.
English: The central royal power could also have wished to locate towns differently on the basis of internal political and strategic criteria, and thereby prompted the emergence of new towns and the abandonment of the old.

Danish: Århundrederne frem mod år 1000 kendes mange steder kendes som en tid, hvor antikke imperier og deres bykultur forsvandt.
English: The centuries leading up to the year 1000 are widely known as the time in which the ancient empires and their urban cultures dwindled.

Danish: Udfordringen for Vikingeskibsmuseet bliver ikke mindre af, at hele verden kigger med.
English: The challenge for the Viking Ship Museum does not get any easier when the whole world is watching.

Danish: Muligheden for at få noget andet til morgenmad end havregrød, skal udnyttes.
English: The chance of having something other than oat-porridge for breakfast must be taken.

Danish: Skiftet i skibenes form fra asymmetrisk profil med stabilisator agter i bronzealderen til den tidlige jernalders symmetriske profil, undertiden med styreårer, skete formentlig omkring 500 f.Kr. Der er generelt næsten ingen overgangsformer mellem bronzealderens og jernalderens skibe bevaret i ristningerne, undtagen på Bornholm.
English: The changes in ships’ shapes from asymmetrical in profile with stabilisers aft during the Bronze Age to symmetrical in profile (sometimes with steering oars) in the Early Iron Age, probably occurred around 500 BC.

Danish: Kapitlet ”Fundet” fortæller kort om udgravningen og rekonstruktionen af det originale fartøj.
English: The chapter “The Find” briefly describes the excavation and reconstruction of the original find.

Danish: Stævnens karakteristiske kurve begynder at komme frem, og du kan begynde at få en fornemmelse af de endelig proportioner af det færdige emne.
English: The characteristic curve of the stems began to take shape and you started to get a sense of the eventual proportions of the finished element.

Danish: TV-kokkene fra River Cottage har været et smut i Danmark for at sejle med Havhingsten og prøve kræfter med madkonceptet Ny Nordisk Vikingemad.
English: The chefs from River Cottage has been in Denmark to sail The Sea Stallion and try out the food concept 'New Nordic Viking food'.

Danish: Kokkene fra River Cottage tilberedte et festmåltid til Havhingstens besætning af lokale råvarer fra Samsø, blandt andet makrel, gutefår, løg og strandkål.
English: The chefs from River Cottage prepared a feast for the Sea Stallion's crew of local ingredients from the island of including mackerel, Gute sheep, onion and sea kale.

Danish: På Samsø var der, i anledning af Havhingstens besøg, arrangeret en festival 'Vikingernes Samsø', der sammen med besøget af TV-kokkene fra River Cottage, også var med til at trække nysgerrige til Langør.
English: The chefs from River Cottage prepared a feast for the Sea Stallion's crew of local ingredients from the island of including mackerel, Gute sheep, onion and sea kale.

Danish: Projektet er blevet til med støtte fra Samsø Kommune, Samsø Fonden, lokale producenter på Samsø og F.O.O.D.
English: The chefs from River Cottage will go aboard the Sea Stallion and sail from Kerteminde to Samsø.

Danish: Stormanden holder fest på Vikingeskibsmuseet i Roskilde den 8. og 9. august og Havhingsten fra Glendalough sætter sejl igen.
English: The Chieftain will give a feast at the Viking Ship Museum in Roskilde on 8 and 9 August and the Sea Stallion from Glendalough will set sail again.

Danish: Stormanden serverer mad fra vikingernes køkken
English: The Chieftain's Banquet Dinner

Danish: Børnenes spørgelyst var meget stor.
English: The children's inquisitiveness was boundless.

Danish: Så for os har valget været let," fortæller Preben Rather Sørensen.
English: The choice has been an easy one for us,” Preben Rather Sørensen explains.

Danish: Den kristne præst blev faktisk jaget ud af byen og kirken blev lukket.
English: The Christian priest was actually chased out of the town and the church was closed.

Danish: Den kristendom de mødte, var ikke altid den samme - hvorfor ikke?
English: The Christianity they met was not always the same - why not?

Danish: Den kristendom de mødte, var ikke altid den samme – hvorfor ikke?
English: The Christianity they met was not always the same - why not?

Danish: Krøniken indledes med en kort redegørelse for folkeslagene på De britiske øer, og beskriver herefter øernes historie fra Julius Cæsars tid og frem.
English: The Chronicle begins with a brief account of the tribes living in England and then goes on to describe the history of the British Isles from the time of Julius Caesar and on.

Danish: Krøniken er en samling af dokumenter som dækker anglesaksernes historie i England frem til 1154.
English: The chronicles are a collection of documents covering the history of the Anglo-Saxons in England down to 1154.

Danish: Kirken blev indviet i 1077 og flere kilder mener, at Bayeux Tapetet, som beskriver Slaget ved Hastings og Vilhelms indtog i England, blev udarbejdet hertil.
English: The church here was consecrated in AD 1077 and several sources are of the opinion that the Bayeux Tapestry, which describes the Battle of Hastings and William's conquest of England, was made specifically for the building.

Danish: Byen er flagsmykket med Havhingstens logo i anledning af afrejsen.
English: The city is full of flags decorated with the Sea Stallion logo.

Danish: Roskilde Kommune
English: The City of Roskilde

Danish: Byen Skagen
English: The City of Skagen

Danish: Kravet fra Irland kom højst overraskende for os.
English: The claim from Ireland came by a huge surprise for us.

Danish: Lerkarret fra Skarpsalling, Himmerland, blev fundet i et gravkammer af sten i 1891.
English: The clay pot from Skarpsalling, Himmerland, was found in a stone burial chamber in 1891.

Danish: Lerkarret blev skabt, da jættestuerne blev bygget omkring 3200 f.Kr. Dengang stod pottemagerkunsten på sit højeste.
English: The clay pot was made when the passage graves were constructed around 3200 BC.

Danish: Lerkarrene blev brugt ved begravelsesritualerne, hvorun-der nogle lerkar med indhold blev anbragt i gravkamrene, andre blev stillet uden for indgangen til kamrene.
English: The clay pots were used for burial rituals, whereby some clay pots with contents were placed in the burial chambers, while others were placed outside the entrance to the chambers.

Danish: Den tydelige rolle som havnebyerne har spillet i forbindelse med Vilhelm Erobrerens invasionsforberedelser belyser indirekte også grundlaget for etableringen af langskibsflåder i Skandinavien i den sene vikingetid.
English: The clear role played by the harbour-towns in connection with William's preparations for the invasion also throw an indirect light on the basis for the establishment of fleets of longships in Scandinavia in the Late Viking Age.

Danish: Den tydelige rolle som havnebyerne har spillet i forbindelse med Vilhelm Erobrerens invasionsforberedelser belyser indirekte også grundlaget for etableringen af langskibsflåder i Skandinavien i den sene vikingetid.
English: The clear role played by the harbour-towns in connection with William’s preparations for the invasion also throw an indirect light on the basis for the establishment of fleets of longships in Scandinavia in the Late Viking Age.

Danish: Det tydeligste eksempel på denne type er runestensskibet fra Tulltorp i Skåne, som har 15 skjolde langs skibssiden, men derimod ikke nogen rigning.
English: The clearest example of this type is the rune-stone ship from Tullstorp in Skåne, which has 15 shields along the side of the ship but, on the other hand, no rigging.

Danish: Den kløvede planke
English: The cleaved plank

Danish: Kløvningen starter onsdag den 6. september kl. 10.00
English: The cleaving starts at 10:00, Wednesday September 6th

Danish: De klinkbyggede bord, eller overlappet mellem to bord, er i sig selv et langsgående styrkeelement i skroget.
English: The clinker-built boards, or the overlap between two boards, act as a longitudinal strengthening element in the hull.

Danish: De klinkbyggede både, der stadig bliver bygget på Færøerne, er efterkommere af vikingernes skibe.
English: The clinker-built boats that are still built on the Faroes are the descendants of the Vikings' ships.

Danish: De klinkbyggede både, der stadig bliver bygget på Færøerne, er efterkommere af vikingernes skibe.
English: The clinker-built boats that are still built on the Faroes are the descendants of the Vikings’ ships.

Danish: Bidevinds vanterne bemandes med seks besætningsmedlemmer i hver side, og det er deres opgave ved at holde igen eller hale på vanterne at sørge for, at masten ikke svinger ud til styrbord eller bagbord.
English: The close-haul shrouds are manned by six crew on each side, and it is their task to ensure that the mast does not swing to starboard or port by holding back or hauling on the shrouds.

Danish: Det nærmeste man kommer et billede af vikingernes sygdomsforhold og hygiejne er de arkæologiske fund og den omrejsende arabiske forfatter Ibn Fadlans betragtninger.
English: The closest we can get to a picture of Viking ill-health and hygiene is in the archaeological finds and the observations of the travelling Arab author, Ibn Fadlan.

Danish: Den kystnære boplads blev oversvømmet og efterhånden dækket af et beskyttende lag af dynd - det arkæologerne kalder gytje - et fedtet lagt af organiske materiale, der har aflejret sig over bopladsen og den tidligere kyst og hermed indkapslet rester af fortidens måltider, redskaber, våben - og mennesker i et iltfattigt miljø, der har bevaret de ellers forgængelige spor gennem 8.000 år.
English: The coastal settlements were flooded and afterwards buried under a protective layer of silt - a thick layer of organic material that spread over the settlement and the earlier coast, encapsulating the remains of past meals, tools, weapons, and people, in an oxygen-poor environment which has preserved the otherwise perishable remains for the last 8,000 years.

Danish: Den kystnære boplads blev oversvømmet og efterhånden dækket af et beskyttende lag af dynd - det arkæologerne kalder gytje - et fedtet lagt af organiske materiale, der har aflejret sig over bopladsen og den tidligere kyst og hermed indkapslet rester af fortidens måltider, redskaber, våben - og mennesker i et iltfattigt miljø, der har bevaret de ellers forgængelige spor gennem 8.000 år.
English: The coastal settlements were flooded and afterwards buried under a protective layer of silt – a thick layer of organic material that spread over the settlement and the earlier coast, encapsulating the remains of past meals, tools, weapons, and people, in an oxygen-poor environment which has preserved the otherwise perishable remains for the last 8,000 years.

Danish: Koggernes betragtelige dybgang og begrænsede manøvreevne bidrog formentlig til, sammen med bl.a. sociale og politiske faktorer, at vigtige gamle farvande som Slien og Roskilde Fjord mistede deres betydning i de følgende årtier og århundreder, hvilket fik alvorlige følger for byerne Slesvig og Roskilde.
English: The cog’s deep draught and restricted manoeuvrability may, along with other, socio-political factors, have rendered ancient fairways like the Schlei fjord and Roskilde Fjord obsolete in the decades and centuries to come, possibly with severe consequences for the cities of Schleswig and Roskilde and the general pattern of urbanisation on the North Sea and Baltic coasts.

Danish: Møntbilleder er antalsmæssigt måske den største kildegruppe, men byder kun på lille variation, de enkelte billeder imellem, ligesom den meget begrænsede plads på mønterne har sat snævre grænser for udformningen og detaljeringsgraden.
English: The coin pictures are perhaps the largest group but they show little variation between the individual pictures and the space on the coins is limited and does not allow much scope for refinements of shape or detail.

Danish: Møntbillederne er således et 800-tals fænomen og kan dermed ikke forventes at vise de store skibe.
English: The coin pictures, for example, are a ninth-century phenomenon and cannot therefore be expected to show the great ships.

Danish: Mønten blev præsenteret på Vikingeskibsmuseet i Roskilde samme dag.
English: The coin was presented at the Viking Ship Museum in Roskilde on the same day.

Danish: Møntudgivelsen finder således sted to dage før Havhingsten fra Glendalough den 9. august vender hjem fra sin forsøgsrejse Roskilde – Dublin – Roskilde.
English: The coin will be issued two days before the Sea Stallion from Glendalough returns home on 9 August from its experimental voyage Roskilde – Dublin – Roskilde.

Danish: Alle disse billeder af skibe som vikingerne selv har lavet, giver os en ide om hvordan skibene måske har set ud.
English: The coins in the top row were minted in Dorestad and they probably formed the model for the coins in the other two rows, all of which are Scandinavian so-called ‘Hedeby coins'

Danish: Tapetet viser også de forhandlinger, som vi kan læse om i de skriftlige kilder, og dermed understøtter kilderne hinanden.
English: The coins of King Canute (known as Cnut the Great in Denmark) can be recognised from two symbols: the four-leaved clover and the pointed helmet.

Danish: Samarbejdet omfattede en international forskningskonference i april 2013 på Vikingeskibsmuseet i Roskilde, som frembragte uvurderlig viden, som dannede baggrund for udstillingen og indsamlingen af indhold til publikationen.
English: The collaboration included an international research conference in April 2013 at the Viking Ship Museum in Roskilde, which brought invaluable knowledge together to form the basis for the exhibition and gather content for the publication.

Danish: Han var thegn i Norfolk og en velgører over for klostret St Benet's, Holme, der sandsynligvis stillede kongeskibet, og hvis abbed, Aelfweald, der havde udført kystvagttjeneste for kong Harold imod Vilhelm, også måtte søge tilflugt i Danmark.
English: The colour pigments are as follows: yellow (natural ochre), reddish-brown (burnt ochre), white (white lead), black (carbon black - actually soot), red - on dragon head and tail -(caput mortuum, which is very hard-burnt ochre).

Danish: Indfarvningen med rød og gul okker, med saltvand som eneste bindemiddel, holder overraskende godt, det kan blive piftet op igen om et par år.
English: The colouring with red and yellow ochre and salt water as the only binder is holding surprisingly well and can always be brightened up in a year or two.

Danish: Farvningen skete med okkerfarve og saltvand.
English: The colours were a mix of ochre and salted water.

Danish: Kammen er magen til en type, som er fundet i grave ved Birka i Sverige og desuden i den berømte Oseberg skibsgrav i Norge.
English: The comb is similar to a type found in graves at Birka in Sweden and also in the famous Oseberg ship burial in Norway.

Danish: Netop kombinationen af det moderne eventyr og den dybt seriøse forskning tiltrak sig i weekenden stor opmærksomhed fra blandt andre det britiske BBC og det prisbelønnede amerikanske magasin The Smithsonian.
English: The combination of modern adventure and serious research attracted the attention from BBC and the prized American magazine The Smithsonian.

Danish: Tegneserien er et medie fuld af kreativitet og fantasi.
English: The comic series is a medium full of creativity and imagination.

Danish: Udvalget består af repræsentanter fra den menige besætning og fra skibets kernebesætning samt fra Vikingeskibsmuseet.
English: The commission consists of representatives from the ordinary crew, the core crew and the Viking Ship Museum.

Danish: Råvarerne er udvalgt fra vikingetidens spisekammer, og de leveres af lokale producenter.
English: The commodities will be selected from the Viking Age larder and supplied by local producers.

Danish: Den almindelige befolkning lærte ham at kende gennem mønterne.
English: The common people came to know him through his coins.

Danish: De mere almindelige er brede kødskærende spidser og slanke, lange spidser.
English: The commoner ones have broad flesh-cutting or long slender points.

Danish: Der er primært sammenlignet på krydsegenskaber og på fartroser; men også på enkeltmanøvrer som vendinger og rebning.
English: The comparisons were mainly concerned with the ships' beating characteristics and speed roses, but also examined specific manoeuvres like tacking, wearing and reefing.

Danish: Det kan beregnes matematisk, men det kan også laves ved at notere solens gang dagen igennem.
English: The compass can be calculated mathematically, but it can also be made by noting the passage of the sun throughout the day.

Danish: Både engelsksprogede konferencer og konferencer udelukkende med indlæg på skandinaviske sprog afholdes.
English: The conferences communicate research results in either English or the Scandinavian languages.

Danish: De konferencer der afholdes på Vikingeskibsmuseet er oftest tværfaglige og der anvendes mange forskellige oplægsformer.
English: The conferences held at the Viking Ship Museum are often cross-disciplinary, and the research results are presented in many different ways.

Danish: Konserveringen foretoges på Nationalmuseet med alunmetoden, hvor træet blev kogt i en opløsning af alun (KAl(SO4)2-12H2O), i dette tilfælde med tilsætning af glycerin.
English: The conservation was carried out at the National Museum by the alum method, in which the wood was boiled in a solution of alum (K Al (SO4)2 - 12 H2O), in this case with the addition of glycerine.

Danish: Konsolideringen af kongelig magt og administration er repræsenteret ved den særlige beskatning af ejendom i byer og implementeringen af et møntmonopol baseret på mønternes pålydende værdi.
English: The consolidation of royal power and administration at the end of the Viking Age is represented by the specific taxation of urban property and by the enforcement of a monetary standard based on the face value of coins.

Danish: Anlæggelsen og indretningen af skibsgraven viser imidlertid, at vi hér står over for en særlig betydningsfuld person.
English: The construction and organisation of the ship-grave show, however, that we are here dealing with a person of particularly great importance.

Danish: Byggeriet er planlagt at tage 1½ år.
English: The construction is scheduled to take 1½ years.

Danish: Byggeriet af et skib, kan betragtes som kernen af et meget større produktionsnetværk, hvilket involverer utallig materialer, processer og håndværks-specialister.
English: The construction of a ship can be seen as the nucleus of a much wider production network, which involves countless materials, processes and craft specialists.

Danish: Nu starter byggeriet af endnu en udgave af den smukke båd fra Sognefjorden i Vestnorge
English: The construction of another copy of the beautiful boat from the Sognefjord in western Norway is beginning now.

Danish: Skibets konstruktion svarer til den, vi finder i andre syd-skandinaviske langskibsfund.
English: The construction of the ship corresponds to that seen in other examples of Scandinavian longships.

Danish: Byggeprojekt gennemføres af Vikingeskibsmuseets bådeværft, med mest mulig involvering af publikum.
English: The construction project is being carried out at the Viking Ship Museum's boatyard, with as much involvement from the public as possible.

Danish: Byggeprojektet var desuden det første, hvor bådebyggerne arbejdede med bordplanker af fyrretræ og ikke egetræ.
English: The construction project was the first in which we worked with planks of pine rather than oak.

Danish: Byggepladsen midt i Tønsberg, trækker dagligt mange turister til og giver mulighed for god formidling.
English: The construction site in the centre of Tønsberg attracts a large number of tourists every day and provides an excellent opportunity for this communication.

Danish: Byggeholdet skulle være åbent over for en mere end 1000 år gammel byggetradition.
English: The construction team had to be open to a shipbuilding tradition more than 1,000 years old.

Danish: Med byggeriet får museets bådebyggere mulighed for at afprøve nye tolkninger af det oprindelige vrag.
English: The construction will provide the museum’s boat builders with the opportunity to test new interpretations of the original wreck.

Danish: Byggeriet vil tage omkring 6 måneder, båden forventes færdig til søsætning i efterårsferien.
English: The construction will take ca. 6 months and we expect to launch the boat during the autumn holiday.

Danish: Byggeriet, der foregik på værftspladsen, indgik i et forsknings- og formidlingsprojekt, der bl.a. har til formål at give os større viden om vikingetidens langskibe, materialer, værktøj, byggeprocesser, sejl og rig - og at skabe større offentlig bevidsthed om denne del af vor kulturarv.
English: The construction, which took place in the boatyard, is part of a research and communication project, the aims of which include increasing knowledge of Viking Age longships, materials, tools, construction processes, sails and rigging – and creating greater public consciousness concerning this aspect of our cultural heritage.

Danish: Indhold og webudstillinger er udarbejdet af Eamonn Mac an Bheatha, Department of Arts, Sport and Tourism, Sofie E. Jensen og Louise K. Henriksen, Vikingeskibsmuseet.
English: The content and web exhibition have been produced by Eamonn Mac an Bheatha, Department of Sport, Arts and Tourism, Sofie E. Jensen and Louise K. Henriksen, the Viking Ship Museum.

Danish: Det er stammebåde af eg fundet i ferskvandsområder, hvorfor de næppe har været havgående.
English: The content of the wrecks (mainly consisting of building debris and household waste) was not examined in detail.

Danish: Skibskrogenes indhold, som for det meste bestod af husholdnings- og byggeaffald, blev ikke undersøgt i detalje.
English: The content of the wrecks (mainly consisting of building debris and household waste) was not examined in detail.

Danish: Indholdet er Vikingeskibsmuseets bud på en beskrivelse af dansk-irsk kulturhistorie.
English: The contents are our suggestion of a description of Danish-Irish cultural history.

Danish: Kvadenes indhold
English: The contents of the poems

Danish: Der er ikke tale om teknologiske revolutioner, men blot et lille skridt fremad.
English: The contents of the tank are linked to stories about the work of surveying, documenting and preserving the wooden ships.

Danish: Karrets indhold knyttes til fortællinger om arbejdet med opmåling, dokumentation og konservering af skibstræ.
English: The contents of the tank are linked to stories about the work of surveying, documenting and preserving the wooden ships.

Danish: Genstandsinventaret viser forbindelser såvel internt på Fyn som overregionalt inden for det skandinaviske område samtidig med, at det afspejler tilhørsforholdet til et elitært miljø karakteriseret ved en ensartet demonstration af rigdom og magt.
English: The contents show connections internally on Funen, and also across the whole Scandinavian region, and at the same time reflect association with an elite milieu characterised by a homogeneous demonstration of wealth and power.

Danish: Man aner konturerne af det oprindelige vrag, i baggrunden ses Kraka Fyr og forrest i farver: tegningen af den nye rekonstruktion.
English: The contours of the original wreck can be made out and Kraka Fyr can be seen in the background and, at the front, in colour: the drawing of the new reconstruction.

Danish: Ombygningen betød formentlig, at båden i højere grad blev brugt til transport langs Norgeskysten.
English: The conversion presumably meant that the ship was used more for transport alng the Norwegian coast.

Danish: Hovmesterens dagbog, fredag den 27. juli, 2007
English: The cook's diary, Friday, July 27th, 2007

Danish: Kobbernaglerne hedder 4X65, det betyder at de er 4 mm tykke og 65 mm lange.
English: The copper nails are called 4x65, because they are 4mm thick and 65mm long.

Danish: Udgaven placeret i tidskapslen er signeret af Robert MacCarthy, den nuværende domprovst ved St. Patricks Katedral.
English: The copy placed in the Time Capsule is signed by the current Dean of St. Patrick's Cathedral, Robert MacCarthy.

Danish: Udgaven placeret i tidskapslen er signeret af Robert MacCarthy, den nuværende domprovst ved St. Patricks Katedral.
English: The copy placed in the Time Capsule is signed by the current Dean of St. Patrick’s Cathedral, Robert MacCarthy.

Danish: Kurset omfatter også en omvisning på bådeværftet, værftspladsen og i Vikingeskibshallen for at sætte erfaringer og viden om håndværk og materialer ind i en historisk kontekst.
English: The course also includes a tour of the boatyard, boatbuilding site and the Viking Ship Hall, in order to set the experiences and knowledge about craftwork and materials in an historical context.

Danish: Kurset lægger vægt på praktisk sejlads, og gennem dagen vil kursusdeltagerne blive introducerede til vikingeskibets konstruktion, sejl og tovværk.
English: The course focuses on pratical sailing and during the day the course participants will be introduced to the construction, sails and rigging of the Viking ship.

Danish: Kursen er sat mod det sydvestlige ”hjørne” af England: Lands End. Men hvis materiel, mandskab og vinden holder er der mulighed for, at Havhingsten går direkte til Portsmouth i Den Engelske Kanal.
English: The course has been set for the south-western "corner" of England, Lands End. But if the ship, crew and wind are up to it, the Sea Stallion may go on all the way up the English Channel to Portsmouth in one go.

Danish: Kurset udbydes i forbindelse med byggeriet af Gislingebåden, der er støttet af Kraks Fond.
English: The course is offered in connection with the construction of the Gislinge Boat, which is supported by Kraks Fond.

Danish: Kursen er sat - mod Østersøen?
English: The course is set - for the Baltic Sea?

Danish: Kursen er sat mod Irland.
English: The course is set for Ireland.

Danish: Gennemførelse af kurset afhænger af antal tilmeldinger.
English: The course may be cancelled if there are not enough participants.

Danish: Sejladsen nord om Skotland bliver givetvis den vanskeligste del af Havhingstens togt fra Roskilde til Dublin.
English: The course North of Scotland is likely to be the hardest part of the voyage of the Sea Stallion from Roskilde to Dublin.

Danish: Kurset starter klokken 10.00 og slutter cirka klokken 16.00
English: The course will commence at 10:00 and end at about 16:00.

Danish: Sluttidspunkt kl. ca. 16.00.
English: The course will end at about 16:00.

Danish: Kursernes gennemførelse afhænger af antal tilmeldinger.
English: The course will only take place if there are enough participants.

Danish: Der kræves ikke forudgående kendskab til sejlads med vikingeskibe for at deltage i heldagskurset.
English: The course will provide the participants with a thorough introduction to sailing with square sails, which is very different from sailing on modern sailing boats.

Danish: Kurset giver deltagerne en grundlæggende introduktion til sejlads med råsejl, vikingeskibets særlige konstruktion og skibets tovværk - ofte i originale materialer, som hestehår og lindebast - præsenteres og forklares.
English: The course will provide the participants with a thorough introduction to sailing with square sails, which is very different from sailing on modern sailing boats.

Danish: Kurset giver deltagerne en grundlæggende introduktion til sejlads med råsejlet, som vikingeskibenes sejltype kaldes, og som adskiller sig væsentligt fra sejlads med moderne rigtyper.
English: The course will provide the participants with a thorough introduction to sailing with square sails, which is very different from sailing on modern sailing boats.

Danish: Kurset giver deltagerne en grundlæggende introduktion til sejlads med råsejlet, som vikingeskibenes sejltype kaldes, og som adskiller sig væsentligt fra sejlads med moderne sejlbåde.
English: The course will provide the participants with a thorough introduction to sailing with square sails, which is very different from sailing on modern sailing boats.

Danish: Kurset giver deltagerne en hands-on introduktion til sejlads med råsejlet, som vikingeskibenes sejltype kaldes.
English: The course will provide the participants with a thorough introduction to sailing with square sails, which is very different from sailing on modern sailing boats.

Danish: Kurset vil give deltagerne en grundlæggende introduktion til sejlads med råsejl, som adskiller sig væsentligt fra sejlads med mere moderne sejlbåde.
English: The course will provide the participants with a thorough introduction to sailing with square sails, which is very different from sailing on modern sailing boats.

Danish: Kurserne starter klokken 10.00 og slutter cirka klokken 16.00
English: The courses will commence at 10:00 and end at about 16:00.

Danish: Styrmanden udvalgte besætningen.
English: The coxswain selected the crew.

Danish: De udvalgte mænd var som regel ugifte unge mænd.
English: The coxswain would then select the crew – as a rule these were young, unmarried men.

Danish: Bådebygning er kernen af alle de aktiviteter, der udføres på Vikingeskibsmuseet.
English: The craft of boatbuilding lies at the heart of all the activity carried out at the Viking Ship Museum.

Danish: Rebslagning er en helt afgørende del af bådebygningsprocessen.
English: The craft of ropemaking is an essential part of the boatbuilding process.

Danish: Besætningen bydes velkommen af Vikingeskibsmuseets bådebyggere, der har gjort Havhingsten klar til den store dag på floden Spree.
English: The crew are welcomed by the Viking Ship Museum's boatbuilders, who have made Sea Stallion ready for a great day on the river Spree.

Danish: Besætningen på Isle of Man.
English: The crew at Isle of Man.

Danish: Mandskabet bestod af 53 eliteroere, hvilket viste sig at være en fejldisposition, da moderne roning har meget lidt tilfælles med roning i vikingeskib.
English: The crew comprised 53 elite oarsmen, and this proved to be a mistake as modern rowing has very little in common with rowing a Viking ship.

Danish: Besætningen til rejsen er udvalgt.
English: The crew for the trip has been selected.

Danish: Det er dog ikke altid at man kan holde helt fri på vagten.
English: The crew get to know each other better and pay visits to the other rooms of the ship.

Danish: Gasterne lære hinanden bedre at kende og går på besøg i de andre rum i skibet.
English: The crew get to know each other better and pay visits to the other rooms of the ship.

Danish: Besætningen går ombord igen og tilskuerne får sig en kæmpe overraskelse.
English: The crew go on board again and the audience gets a big surprise.

Danish: Besætningen har haft god brug for regntøjet på årets togt.
English: The crew has had good use of rain clothes during this year's expedition.

Danish: Gasterne har faste pladser i rummene, så alle ved hvor de skal pakke deres grej ned og hvilke arbejdsopgaver de skal tage fat på.
English: The crew have fixed positions in the room so that everybody knows where to stow their gear and which tasks they must perform.

Danish: Besætningen har ikke planlaget at nå en bestemt destination og der er ingen aftaler om besøg i havne.
English: The crew have not made any plans to visit particular destinations or made any agreements about visits to harbours.

Danish: Vikingeskibsmuseets formidlere inviterer folk om bord på vikingeskibet.
English: The crew invites people aboard the Viking ship.

Danish: Besætningen er også på plads.
English: The crew is also ready.

Danish: Besætningen består af ti forskellige nationaliteter og gasterne ses ikke så tit.
English: The crew is made up from ten different nationalities and the crew does not meet all that often.

Danish: Besætningen venter utålmodigt på River Cottages fiskesuppe.
English: The crew is waiting impatiently for the fish soup.

Danish: Midtskibet arbejder med sejlet
English: The crew is working with the sail

Danish: Sejlet er sat og humøret er i top.
English: The crew is working with the sail

Danish: Besætningen sætter projektet igang.
English: The crew kickstarts the project.

Danish: Det blev lyttet intenst til eksperternes fortællinger, da besætningen var til rundvisning og foredrag hos Danmarks Meteorologiske Institut.
English: The crew listened intently to the words of the experts during the tour and presentation at the Denmark’s Meteorological Institute.

Danish: Gasten er ved godt humør.
English: The crew member is in good spirits.

Danish: Gasterne om bord på Havhingsten får uundgåeligt nogle knubs, når skibet er på togt.
English: The crew members will inevitable get cuts and bruises when the ship is sailing.

Danish: Besætningen har netop hilst på den danske Dronning Margrethe og den norske kongefamilie, som er i byen for at åbne en rekonstrueret kanal fra vikingetiden.
English: The crew met the Danish queen Magrete and the Norwegian royal family in town to open an reconstructed canal from the Viking Age.

Danish: Undervejs skal besætningen stride sig gennem de barskeste farvande i Europa og nogle af de mest udfordrende i verden nord og vest for Skotland.
English: The crew must fight through the toughest waters of Europe and some of the most challenging waters of the world north and west of Scotland.

Danish: Uden brug af søkort, GPS og traditionelt kompas fandt besætningen vej over Nordsøen.
English: The crew navigated their way across the North Sea without the use of any charts, GPS or traditional compass.

Danish: Mange af dem har sejlet før men aldrig i et vikingeskib.
English: The crew of the Sea Stallion are all volunteers who applied to take part in the expedition.

Danish: Besætningen på 'Cable One' var ikke så bekymrede for skibet under nattens sejlads.
English: The crew on board 'Cable One' wasn't worried about the ship during the night sail.

Danish: Besætningen ombord på et skib kaldes ofte for skiparar, skibsmænd.
English: The crew on board a ship were often referred to as skiparar ‘shipmen'.

Danish: Besætningen ombord på et skib kaldes ofte for skiparar, skibsmænd.
English: The crew on board a ship were often referred to as skiparar ‘shipmen’.

Danish: Besætningen på Havhingsten skal ikke holde øje med fjendtlige skibe, men ellers er skibet vagtsystem organiseret ligesom i Vikingetiden.
English: The crew on board the Sea Stallion do not have to look out for enemy ships - apart from that the ship is organised as in the Viking Age.

Danish: Besætningen på Havhingsten skal ikke holde øje med fjendtlige skibe, men ellers er skibet vagtsystem organiseret ligesom i Vikingetiden.
English: The crew on board the Sea Stallion do not have to look out for enemy ships – apart from that the ship is organised as in the Viking Age.

Danish: Ligesom på krigsskibene i Vikingetiden, drikker gasterne på Havhingsten vand.
English: The crew on board the Sea Stallion drink water like the Vikings did on board their warships.

Danish: I den hårde vind og urolige sø midt på Skagerrak satte besætningen på 'Cable One' hurtigt en gummibåd i vandet og lagde kort efter til på bagbord side af Havhingsten i læ for den sydøstlige vind.
English: The crew on the following ship place a rubber dinghy into the hard wind and unsteady sea in the middle of Skagerrak and made it to the portside of the Sea Stallion in lee of the south eastern wind.

Danish: Dermed er der sat navne på de besætningsmedlemmer, som skal sejle Havhingsten til Dublin på første og anden etape.
English: The crew selected are for both the first and second legs of the voyage to Dublin.

Danish: Hele torsdagen blev brugt til at forberede skibet på dets rejsen gennem Dublins gader.
English: The crew spend the entire Thursday making the Sea Stallion ready for its jouney through the streets of Dublin.

Danish: Havhingsten har været en attraktion hos National Museum of Ireland vinteren over, men nu er det slut, den skal hjem til Roskilde.
English: The crew uses several days to prepare the launch of the Sea Stallion every spring.

Danish: Besætningen har mødt deres fysiske og psykiske yderste grænser efter en dramatisk nat.
English: The crew went to the farthest limits of body and spirit in a dramatic night.

Danish: Besætningen blev indkvarteret i lune lokaler og i Wicklow Sailing Club blev besætningen trakteret og hyldet som helte.
English: The crew were accommodated in warm rooms and the crew were regaled and celebrated as heroes in the Wicklow Sailing Club.

Danish: Besætningen var velforberedt, og turen startede med en frisk tur fra Roskilde, hvor vi i regn og blæst fór op til den norske kyst.
English: The crew were well-prepared and the voyage started with a fast trip from Roskilde up to the Norwegian coast in rain and strong winds.

Danish: Med om bord har besætningen aktiviteter og en masse fortællinger om vikingeskibene.
English: The crew will have various activities and masses of stories about Viking ships with them when they arrive.

Danish: Besætningen skal blandt andet undersøge og dokumentere sejltider og distancer for sejl og årer i forhold til vind, tidevand, is osv.
English: The crew will investigate and document sailing times and distances, under both oar and sail and in relation to wind, tide, ice and other factors.

Danish: Gasternes personlige grej pakkes ikke i skibskister, men i vandtætte sække som indeholder moderne udstyr såsom regntøj, uldundertøj, varmetrøjer, pandelygte, kniv, ting til personlig hygiejne, sovepose, liggeunderlag m.m.
English: The crew's personal gear will not be stored in ship's chests but will be stowed in waterproof sacks holding equipment such as modern waterproof clothes, woollen underwear, warm sweaters, a headlamp, a knife, items for personal hygiene, a sleeping bag and underlay etc.

Danish: Tunet på Museumsøen danner rammen om vikingekamp og lege, udsmykning af våben, historiefortælling, mad med smag fra vikingetiden, møntslagning og meget mere.
English: The croft on the Museum Island will be the setting for Viking combat and games, decoration of weapons, storytelling, food with flavours from the Viking Age, minting of coins and more.

Danish: Krumtræet er også nøje udvalgt egetræ.
English: The crooked timbers are also carefully selected oak pieces.

Danish: Det krumvoksede træ skal bruges til bådens spanter.
English: The crooked timbers would be used to make the frames for the boat.

Danish: Det gipper i publikum, der returnerer med klapsalver.
English: The crowd enjoy it and respond with applause.

Danish: Vi står tættere og tættere.
English: The crowds are pressed closer and closer together.

Danish: Derfor har Kulturarvsstyrelsen, af de såkaldte §28-midler, bevilliget et beløb til at opmåle, beskrive og datere anlæggene.
English: The Cultural Heritage Authority has therefore granted a sum of money from the so-called §28 funds to survey, describe and date the installation.

Danish: Nysgerrigheden vil næsten ingen ende tage, når det kommer til sommerens historiske forsøgsrejse.
English: The curiosity is endless when it comes to the historical test sail this summer and this demands great efforts from the Viking Ship Museum.

Danish: Strømmen er sydvestgående 0,5 knob.
English: The current is running southwest at 0.5 knots.

Danish: Danskerne måtte opgive togtet og dermed muligheden for at erobre den engelske trone.
English: The Danes were forced to abandon the expedition and their opportunity to conquer the English throne.

Danish: Danmarks Radio har fulgt tilblivelsen af Havhingsten tæt.
English: The Danish Broadcasting Corporation has been following the creatio of the Sea Stallion.

Danish: De danske ringborge står som store fortidsminder i den danske natur.
English: The Danish circular strongholds stand out like great monuments in the countryside.

Danish: Det er vanskeligt at sejle i mange af de danske farvande, som i århundreder har været nogle af verdens mest befærdede.
English: The Danish coastal waters, though among the world's busiest shipping lanes, are treacherous to sail.

Danish: Firmaet har netop indgået samarbejde om at levere udstyr til verdens største rekonstruktion af et vikingeskib, som også er dansk.
English: The Danish company has just provided equipment for the world biggest reconstruction of a Viking ship which is also Danish.

Danish: Den danske by
English: The Danish town

Danish: Oplysningerne sendes fra skibet via satellit til hjemmesiden ca. hvert 15. minut.
English: The data is sent from the ship to the website via satellite ca. every 15 minutes.

Danish: Oplysningerne sendes fra skibet via satellit til hjemmesiden ca. hvert 15. minut.
English: The data is sent from the ship via satellite to the website every 15 minutes.

Danish: Det er et vigtigt arbejde, der bruges af forskere og i forbindelse med eksperimentalarkæologiske projekter.
English: The data is used in the museum's research and experimental archaeological projects.

Danish: Dataerne er under bearbejdning og vil blive publiceret løbende.
English: The data of these are still being analysed and will be published in due course.

Danish: Databasen med abonnenter bare vokser og vokser – og i øjeblikket er vi oppe på 2.000 modtagere,” fortæller Preben Rather Sørensen.
English: The database with subscribers is growing steadily – and at the moment we are at approximately 2,000 recipients,” Preben Rather Sørensen explains.

Danish: Datoerne for sejladskurser i 2018 er fastlagt og du kan allerede nu booke sommerens sejladsoplevelse.
English: The dates for the full-day courses of 2018 has now been set, and you can start booking the sailing experience of a lifetime.

Danish: Datoerne for sejladskurser i 2018 er fastlagt og du kan allerede nu booke sommerens sejladsoplevelse.
English: The dates for the full-day courses of 2018 has now been set, and you can start booking the sailing experience of a …

Danish: Dagen der på stod den på oprydnig - heldigvis oplevede vi kun skader på bygninger og anlæg!
English: The day after - thankfully we only saw damage to buildings and facilities!

Danish: Dagen før varmer korene op på Guinness Sky Bar i Dublin.
English: The day before, the choirs will warm up in the Guinness Sky Bar in Dublin.

Danish: Dagen fejres i Berlin, hvor skibet skal deltage i festlighederne i forbindelse med åbningen af vikingeudstillingen.
English: The day was celebrated in Berlin, where the ship is taking part in the celebrations in connection with the opening of the Viking exhibition.

Danish: Vikinger er en succes i Berlin
English: The day was celebrated in Berlin, where the…

Danish: Dagen bliver fejret med særlige omvisninger, åbent skib i Havhingsten, bogudgivelse, nostalgi, åbent værft m.m. - og der er gratis entre hele dagen til både voksne og børn.
English: The day will be celebrated with special guided tours, open access to the Sea Stallion, publication of a book, the boatyard will be open to the public etc. There will also be free admission all day for both adults and children.

Danish: Vi ved også, at han må have været en betydningsfuld person.
