English: The dead man's identity is unknown, but cut marks on the skeleton indicate that he died in battle.

Danish: Deadline for indsendelse af fotos er 10. august 2008 til skyd(at)havhingsten.dk hvorefter en kompetent jury udpeger vinderne den 12. august 2008.
English: The deadline for sending photos to skyd(at)havhingsten.dk is 10 August 2008, after which a competent jury will pick the winners by 12 August 2008.

Danish: Fortrydelsesfristen er overholdt, hvis du sender din meddelelse om udøvelse af fortrydelsesretten, inden fortrydelsesfristen er udløbet.
English: The deadline for your right to cancellation will be honoured if you inform us of your intention to exercise this right before the deadline has expired.

Danish: Fristen er overholdt, hvis du returnerer varerne inden udløbet af de 14 dage.
English: The deadline will be respected if you return the item before the 14 day period has expired.

Danish: Dørken ligger færdig, der bliver god plads om bord.
English: The deck is finished and there is a good amount of space available on board.

Danish: Dækket er smurt med linoliefernis.
English: The deck is given a coating of linseed oil varnish.

Danish: Dørken ligger på langs, ved det der før var damtragten og nu er en kiste til grej, og på tværs i resten af jollen.
English: The deck is laid longitudinally where there would originally have been a wet well - where there will instead be a chest for storing gear - and laterally in the rest of the dinghy.

Danish: Dækket ligger oven på essingen og øverste bordkant.
English: The deck is laid on top of the gunwale and the uppermost strake edge.

Danish: Ruffet er lavet på forhånd.
English: The deckhouse is made beforehand.

Danish: Øen var derfor let at forsvare og adgangen til havet gjorde det tiltrækkende at bosætte sig her gennem Oldtiden.
English: The defensibility of the island and the open access to the ocean made the area very attractive to settle.

Danish: Skrogets deformationer blev registreret med en laserstråle fra midtskibs aftegnet på en kvadreret plade i forskibet.
English: The deformations of the hull were registered with a laser beam from amidships and plotted on a square plate in the bow.

Danish: De danske skibsbyggere synes stadig at anvende en hollandsk inspireret skalbygningsmetode helt op til midten af 1800-tallet.
English: The delimitation of the period was given by the dendrochronological dating of the carvel-built ships that were selected as primary case-study material.

Danish: Hermed yder Bornholms helleristninger et vigtigt bidrag til tolkningen af ændringerne i skibenes former i Skandinavien fra bronzealderen og et stykke ind i førromersk jernalder.
English: The delimitation of the period was given by the dendrochronological dating of the carvel-built ships that were selected as primary case-study material.

Danish: De dendrokronologiske dateringer synes at bekræfte, at skibet blev sænket i Grønnegaard Havn omkring 1624.
English: The dendro-datings suggested that the ship was scuttled in the harbour in 1624 at the earliest.

Danish: Dendroanalysen tyder på, at skibets fyrretræsbord stammer fra Sognefjordsområdet.
English: The dendroanalysis indicates that the ship's pine strakes derive from the Sognefjord area.

Danish: Afdelingen består af tre teams.
English: The department consists of three teams.

Danish: Bådeværftets speciale er at rekonstruere forhistoriske skibe i model, på tegning, i computer og i fuld størrelse.
English: The department specialises in reconstructions of prehistoric boats in full scale using the methods of the time.

Danish: Hastighedens afhængighed af disse variabler vi kan afbilde i en såkaldt fartrose.
English: The dependence of the speed on these variables can be depicted in a so-called speed diagram.

Danish: Men omtalen af kong Sverres MARIASUDEN, der blev bygget i Trondheim i 1182-83, er dog værd at nævne.
English: The description of king Sverri's MARIASUDEN, which was built in Trondheim in 1182-83, however, is worth mentioning.

Danish: Men omtalen af kong Sverres MARIASUDEN, der blev bygget i Trondheim i 1182-83, er dog værd at nævne.
English: The description of king Sverri’s MARIASUDEN, which was built in Trondheim in 1182-83, however, is worth mentioning.

Danish: Anvendelsen af jern i stedet for bronze eller flint til redskaber har betydet meget for effektiviteten.
English: The design and excellent finish of the boat with elements of optimal strength at a minimal weight show that highly skilled craftsmen were originally in charge.

Danish: Detaljerne viser, at skibstypen har rødder længere tilbage i tiden, da et skib af denne størrelse åbenbart tidligere kunne bygges med kun syv bord i hver side, mens man i dette skib har måttet anvende otte bord for at opnå den samme bordhøjde.
English: The details show that the ship-type is based on earlier traditions, utilised to build ships of this size with seven strakes on each side, while for this ship it was necessary to employ an eighth strake to achieve the same sheer-height.

Danish: Bestemmelse af breddegraden ved måling af solens middagshøjde er heller ikke kendt fra vikingetiden.
English: The determination of latitude by measuring the height of the sun at midday is similarly not known from Viking times.

Danish: Skibsteknologisk udvikling - en ny brik i puslespillet
English: The development of ship technology – a new piece of the puzzle

Danish: Dialogen mellem arkæologer, skibsrekonstruktører, historikere og håndværkere er centralt placeret i museet arbejde.
English: The dialogue between archaeologists, ship reconstructors, historians and craft specialists lies at the core of the Museum's work.

Danish: Dialogen mellem arkæologer, skibsrekonstruktører, historikere og håndværkere er centralt placeret i museet arbejde.
English: The dialogue between archaeologists, ship reconstructors, historians and craft specialists lies at the core of the Museum’s work.

Danish: Dagbogen føres af journalist Henrik Kastoft, der har været medlem af besætningen siden 2004, og som i perioden fra september 2006 - september 2007 er ansat som journalist på projektet.
English: The diary is kept by Henrik Kastoft, a journalist who has been a member of the crew since 2004 and who is employed in the project from September 2006 to September 2007.

Danish: De forskellige materialer der brugt til fremstilling af reb, har alle sammen deres egne naturlige styrker og svagheder.
English: The different materials used in rope making all have their own inherent strengths and weaknesses.

Danish: De forskellige genstandstyper samt forekomsten af udsmykning i såvel Borre- som Jellingstil viser, at graven er anlagt på et tidligt tidspunkt i yngre vikingetid.
English: The different types of object and the presence of ornamentation in both the Borre and the Jelling style show that the grave was built at an early time in the late Viking Age.

Danish: De forskellige skibstyper afprøves så vidt muligt i de farvande, de antages at have sejlet i oprindeligt.
English: The different types of ship are tested as far as possible in the waters in which they are presumed to have originally sailed.

Danish: De vanskelige landingsforhold på de færøske klippekyster havde også stor betydning for bådenes form.
English: The difficult landing conditions on the cliffs of the Faroese coasts had a great impact on the boats' form.

Danish: Jollen er sprydstagsrigget.
English: The dinghy has a sprit rig.

Danish: Jollen har dam midtskibs, fordi den skulle kunne holde de fangne tunger og andre fladfisk levende og friske.
English: The dinghy has a well amidships to keep alive and fresh the sole and other flatfish that were caught.

Danish: Jollen er bygget i lærk efter opmåling af en gamle jolle.
English: The dinghy is built in larch according to the measurements of an old dinghy.

Danish: Jollen bliver bygget i lærk på egesvøb.
English: The dinghy is built of larch with a frame of oak.

Danish: Jollen er bygget af eg på eg og har et lille ringdæk.
English: The dinghy is built of oak and has a small ring deck.

Danish: Jollen er bygget af eg på eg og har et lille ringdæk.
English: The dinghy is built of oak on oak and has a small ring deck.

Danish: Jollen er færdig, klar til at blive malet.
English: The dinghy is complete, ready to be painted.

Danish: Jollen får ringdæk, dvs. lille dæk for og agter og ned langs essingen.
English: The dinghy is fitted with a ring deck: a small deck fore and aft and along the gunwale.

Danish: Disse spiger bruges også i spanterne (bundstokke og oplængere).
English: The dinghy is made in 'oak on oak', i.e. oak planks on oak frames.

Danish: Jollen er bygget i "eg på eg" dvs. egebord på egespanter.
English: The dinghy is made in 'oak on oak', i.e. oak planks on oak frames.

Danish: Jollen fik navnet LUNA.
English: The dinghy is named LUNA.

Danish: Morten kalfatrer - han slår lige tilpas med bomuld i, så nodden bliver lige så dyb som den er bred, så bliver tjærekitten hængende.
English: The dinghy is painted with anti-fouling paint under the waterline, with tar and oil on the exterior and with pure anti-fungal oil internally.

Danish: Jollen blev brugt til persontransport og til at føre fortøjninger og lange spring i land ved havnemanøvrer.
English: The dinghy was used for transporting people and for running mooring lines and hawsers ashore when docking.

Danish: Jollen vejer 150 kg, så den er meget let at håndtere.
English: The dinghy weighs 150kg so it is very easy to handle.

Danish: Gangen er orienteret mod det punkt, hvor solen går ned ved midvinter, og i december måned skinner solen ind i kammeret.
English: The directions of the passage points to the midwinter sunset, and in December the sun shines into the chamber.

Danish: Daværende leder af museet, Civilingeniør og museumsinspektør Ole Crumlin-Pedersen, blev på åbningsdagen citeret for at der var over 10.000 gæster på omvisning i Hallen, året før den egentlige åbning.
English: The director of the museum at the time, civil engineer and museum curator Ole Crumlin-Pedersen, was quoted on the opening day as stating that there had been over 10,000 visitors on guided tours around the Hall in the year before the actual opening.

Danish: Museets Direktør Tinna Damgaard Sørensen skriver i en kronik i Roskilde Avis om de første år: ”Som i alle gode historier har der været medgang og modgang, opture og nedture, men i det store perspektiv kan museet fejre jubilæum som en succes”.
English: The director of the museum, Tinna Damgaard Sørensen, writes the following in a feature article in the Roskilde Avis newspaper about the early years: ”Like in all good stories, there have been ups and downs, but generally the museum can celebrate the anniversary as a great success”.

Danish: Nationalmuseets direktør, Dr. Patrick Wallace har skrevet et brev til sine fremtidige kollegaer.
English: The director of the National Museum of Ireland, Dr Pat Wallace, wrote a letter to colleagues of the future.

Danish: Nordea Danmark-fondens direktør, Torben Klein, udtaler: ”Vi er glade for, at Nordea Danmark-fonden kan medvirke til, at Vikingeskibsmuseet kan gennemføre hjemrejsen med Havhingsten fra Dublin til Roskilde næste år.
English: The Director of the Nordea Denmark Foundation, Torben Klein, says: “We are happy that the Nordea Denmark Foundation can help the Viking Ship Museum carry through the voyage home with the Sea Stallion from Dublin to Roskilde next year.

Danish: Vikingeskibsmuseets direktør slog formålet fast.
English: The director of the Viking Ship Museum explained the purpose of the project.

Danish: Vikingeskibsmuseets direktør Tinna Damgård-Sørensen fortæller, at det var arrangeret ud fra præsidentens ønske: ”Vi troede, at vi bare skulle vise hende rundt, men hun ønskede selv at møde besætningen”.
English: The director of the Viking Ship Museum, Tinna Damgård-Sorensen, explains that the meeting with the crew was arranged based on the wishes of the president: “We thought that we were only going to show her around, but she wanted to meet the crew herself”.

Danish: ”2 mio. kroner fra Carsten Brebøl-fonden er jo en helt utrolig smuk gave,” siger direktør for Vikingeskibsmuseet, Tinna Damgård-Sørensen.
English: The director of the Viking Ship Museum, Tinna Damgård-Sørensen says: “2 million kroner from the Carsten Brebøl foundation is an incredibly fine gift.”

Danish: Den historiske videnskab bruger en bestemt fremgangsmåde, når skriftlige kilder skal fortolkes.
English: The discipline of History uses a certain procedure when interpreting written sources.

Danish: Opdagelsen og den succesrige udforskning af vragområdet nær Skuldelev, hvor fem vikingetids skibe blev fundet samt den efterfølgende forskning, konservering og udstilling af vragene, bidrog med inspiration til skibshistorikeres og museumsspecialisters vigtige aktiviteter - ikke bare i Danmark, men også i mange andre lande.
English: The discovery and successful exploration of a wreck site near Skuldelev, where five Viking Age ships were found, as well as the subsequent research, conservation and exhibition of the ships, gave shipping historians and museum specialists an incentive for important activities, not only in Denmark but in many other countries.

Danish: Fundet af Skuldelevskibene og aktiviteterne under Vikingeskibsmuseets første direktør, Ole Crumlin-Pedersen blev værdsat og blev - så meget som det dengang var muligt - fulgt i Polen.
English: The discovery of the Skuldelev ships and the activities of the first director of the Viking Ship Museum, Ole Crumlin-Pedersen were appreciated and - as much as possible at the time - followed in Poland.

Danish: Fundet af Skuldelevskibene og aktiviteterne under Vikingeskibsmuseets første direktør, Ole Crumlin-Pedersen blev værdsat og blev - så meget som det dengang var muligt – fulgt i Polen.
English: The discovery of the Skuldelev ships and the activities of the first director of the Viking Ship Museum, Ole Crumlin-Pedersen were appreciated and - as much as possible at the time - followed in Poland.

Danish: Primært var det slidet på båden den blev diskuteret samt de små reparationer der er lavet.
English: The discussions primarily concerned the wear and tear of the boat as well as the small repairs made.

Danish: Afstanden mellem spanterne er ca. 80 cm, og dermed kan det omtrentlige antal roere beregnes.
English: The distance between the ribs is about 80 cm, allowing the approximate number of oarsmen to be calculated.

Danish: Den sejlede distance kunne man ikke måle direkte, men kun beregne ved at gange skibets hastighed med den sejlede tid:
English: The distance sailed could not be measured directly but it could be calculated by multiplying the ship's speed with the time sailed:

Danish: Indholdet af de hedenske vikingegrave i Irland er værdifuldt vidnesbyrd for den tidligste kontakt mellem vikingerne og Irland.
English: The distribution and content of pagan Viking burials in Ireland are valuable indicators of the nature of the earliest contact between the Vikings and Ireland.

Danish: Udbredelsen og indholdet af Irlands hedenske vikingegrave udgør et værdifuldt materiale for den første kontakt mellem vikingerne og Irland i den tidlige vikingetid.
English: The distribution and content of pagan Viking burials in Ireland are valuable indicators of the nature of the earliest contacts between the Vikings and Ireland in the early Viking Age.

Danish: Fordelingen af arbejdsopgaver kan vi også læse om i norske lovtekster, hvor det fremgår, at nogle håndværkere arbejdede på køl og stævne og andre med plankerne.
English: The distribution of work can be seen in Norwegian law texts, where it is clear that some craftsmen worked on the keel, the bow and the stern, and others with the planking.

Danish: Mønsteret med byernes rolle som skibsbygningscentre ser vi også i andre nordeuropæiske kilder, f.eks. i Vilhelm Erobrerens skibsliste.
English: The distribution pattern showing the role played by towns as sites for shipbuilding is one that is also familiar in other Northern European sources, for example in William the Conqueror's ship list.

Danish: Mønsteret med byernes rolle som skibsbygningscentre ser vi også i andre nordeuropæiske kilder, f.eks. i Vilhelm Erobrerens skibsliste.
English: The distribution pattern showing the role played by towns as sites for shipbuilding is one that is also familiar in other Northern European sources, for example in William the Conqueror’s ship list.

Danish: Dykkerne er Thomas Nygård Andersen og Daniel Dalicsek.
English: The divers are Thomas Nygaard Andersen and Daniel Dalicsek.

Danish: Dykkeren tager dig med et hurtigt kig ned under havet, ned til middelalderskibsvraget fra Kalverev.
English: The divers takes you on a quick trip down under the sea surface to the medieval shipwreck from Kalverev.

Danish: Og der er ikke bare dykket for at opleve den fredede vragplads.
English: The dives were not carried out only in order to explore the preserved wreck site.

Danish: 50-kronesedlen udsendes som den første seddel i Danmarks nye seddelserie 2009-2011.
English: The DKK 50 note was issued as the first note in Denmark's new note series 2009-2011.

Danish: 50-kronesedlen udsendes som den første seddel i Danmarks nye seddelserie 2009-2011.
English: The DKK 50 note was issued as the first note in Denmark’s new note series 2009-2011.

Danish: Dokumentationen af disse rejser er meget varierende.
English: The documentation for these voyages is very variable.

Danish: Dokumentationen baseres på de følgende elementer:
English: The documentation is based on the following elements:

Danish: Opmålingerne herfra har efterfølgende udgjort det vigtigste arbejdsgrundlag for analyserne af hvert enkelt skibs form, størrelse, oprindelige udseende og reparationsfaser (3.1).
English: The documentation made at this time subsequently formed the working-basis for the analyses of each individual ship's shape, size, original appearance, and phases of repair (3.1).

Danish: Med en donation på 3 millioner kr. fra Nordea Danmark-fonden kan museet leje det helt rigtige følgeskib til hjemrejsen.
English: The donation of DKK 3m from the Nordea Denmark Foundation means the Museum can lease the perfect support vessel for the home trip.

Danish: Opsamlingsbordene bliver hugget lidt i facon, men primært kommer formen ved at tvinge det ud med "bordvridere" eller ind med skorestokke (pinde) udefra.
English: The double hood end is partly shaped initially, but the final form of the piece is produced by manipulating the timber either inwards or outwards.

Danish: Dejen skal være god sammenhængende men ikke for våd.
English: The dough should stick together but not be too wet.

Danish: Dramatiken med roret var dog ikke ovre.
English: The drama wasn't over, however.

Danish: Den dramatiske udvikling, time for time, set af medarbejder i Museumbuikken, Pernille Simonsen:
English: The dramatic development, hour by hour, watched by staff member in the Museum Shop, Pernille Simonsen:

Danish: I forbindelse med dette arbejde indeholdt tegninger og fotos fra udgravningen og opstillingen af skibet afgørende information.
English: The drawings and photographs that had been made during excavation and assembly were also an invaluable source of information.

Danish: Drømmen om at genskabe de fem Skuldelevskibe var opfyldt.
English: The dream of recreating all five Skuldelev ships had been fulfilled.

Danish: Drømmene er store - og muligheden for at møde nye mennesker, mærke historiens vingesus og lære at sejle et enestående fartøj ligeså.
English: The dreams are big - an the opportunity to meet new people, feel history under your skin and learn how to sail an outstanding vessel likewise.

Danish: Øvelsen foregik på Roskilde Fjord om lørdagen og kom søndag til at involvere en redningshelikopter fra Flyvertaktisk Kommando.
English: The drill took place on Roskilde Fjord on Saturday and on Sunday a rescue helicopter from SOK (The Naval Command) joined to the ship.

Danish: Datteren Edith blev også gift med kong Edward Bekenderen.
English: The earl's daughter Edith married King Edward.

Danish: Tapetets detaljer og livagtige motiver giver det en enorm kildeværdi - især til vikingetidens langskibe.
English: The early examples were merely copies of foreign coins, especially of Frankish origin.

Danish: De tidlige byer
English: The early towns

Danish: Knud den Helliges jordiske rester.
English: The earthly remains of Cnut the Holy.

Danish: Redaktøren af BBC's Timewatch-serie, John Farren, har udtalt om programmet:
English: The editor of BBC Timewatch, John Farren, says about the programme:

Danish: Drivkvasen er bygget på en plankekøl, det vil sige at kølen er bredere end den er høj.
English: The eel drifter has a plank keel, i.e. the keel is wider than it is high

Danish: Åledrivkvasen er klinkbygget (plankerne uden på hinanden) og ikke kravelbygget (plankerne ovenpå hinanden), som det kunne se ud til på skabelonen.
English: The eel drifter is clinker-built (planks overlapping each other) and not carvel-built (planks on top of each other), as can be seen on the mould.

Danish: Drivkvasen er malet med linoliemaling fra Wolf's linolie og tjærefabrik.
English: The eel drifter is painted with linseed oil paint from Wolf's Linseed Oil and Tar Factory.

Danish: Drivkvasen er malet med linolie, rundholterne er gran og sejlet er ClipperCanvas
English: The eel drifter is painted with linseed oil paint, the mast and spars are made of spruce and the sail is made from Clipper Canvas.

Danish: Den 1. juli blev drivkvasen søsat.
English: The eel drifter was launched on the 1st July

Danish: Den Åledrivkvase vi bygger på Vikingeskibsmuseets bådeværft, tager udgangspunkt i de både der blev bygget af bådebygger Christian Nielsen i perioden fra 1890 til ca. 1910-15.
English: The eel drifter we built at the Viking Ship Museum's boatyard is based on the boats built by boatbuilder Christian Nielsen, from 1890 - ca. 1910-15.

Danish: Åledrivkvaserne var omkring 26-28 fod (ca. 8,5 meter) lange.
English: The eel drifters were about 26-28 feet (approx. 8.5 metres) long.

Danish: De fangede ål blev holdt levende i dammen midtskibs.
English: The eels that were caught could be kept alive in the well amidships.

Danish: De fangede ål holdes levende i dammen midtskibs.
English: The eels that were caught could be kept alive in the well amidships.

Danish: Endvidere måltes virkningen af at lade nogle af padlerne hvile i perioder, hvilket aflastede mandskabet så meget, at de skønnede at kunne have fortsat ca. 4 timer mere, hvorved dagsdistancen ville have været på ca. 40 sømil eller 74 km.
English: The effect of letting some of the paddlers rest for short periods was to refresh the crew so greatly that they estimated they could have continued for another 4 hours, easily extending their distance to about 40 nautical miles or 74 km in one day.

Danish: Ud fra den beregnede fremdrivningsmodstand ved forskellige hastigheder kan den fornødne kraft dermed beregnes.
English: The energy needed at various speeds may then be calculated.

Danish: Modellerne blev testet i skibsmodeltanken hos MARINEK i Trondhjem, hvor ingeniørerne undersøgte sejlegenskaberne for forskellige forhold i op til 20 knobs fart, og op til 15 graders krængning og 10 graders afdriftsvinkel.
English: The engineers then measured the sailing performance of the ship under conditions up to 20 knots and up to 15 degrees of heel angle and 10 degrees of drift angle.

Danish: Englænderne havde ingen erfaring med rytterkamp, og hæren talte derfor primært fodfolk.
English: The English had no experience of cavalry battles and their army therefore primarily numbered infantrymen.

Danish: Den engelske konge Harold Godwinson, der trods truslen om en invasion sydfra var marcheret mod York med sin hær, fik efterretning om dette, og vandt over nordmændene i et historisk overraskelsesangreb.
English: The English king Harold Godwinson who, despite the threat of an invasion from the south, had marched northwards York with his army, received intelligence of this and was victorious over the Norwegians in an historic surprise attack.

Danish: Den engelsk metode, som beskrevet af Baker i slutningen af 1500-tallet og senere andre, gjorde også brug af cirkelslag for at definere ikke kun mesterspantet, men også de fleste af skrogets hovedspanter ved at justere og tilpasse cirkelslagenes centrum i forhold til skrogets centerlinie.
English: The English system, as depicted by Baker (at the end of the 16th century) and others also used arcs of circles to determine not only the master-frame, but also the main frames in the greater part of the hull, by using systematic adjustments to the centres of each arc in relation to the ship’s centreline.

Danish: Der er indgået samarbejde med en række institutioner om udvikling af Havhingstens hjemmeside herunder: National Museum of Ireland, Huntarian Museum, Glasgow, Roskilde Museum, Knowledge Lab, SDU, Avedøre Gymnasium, Trællerupskolen, Dimension 3, Thrane & Thrane, Danmarks Meteorologiske Institut, www.dr.dk og en række forskere fra andre institutioner.
English: The enhancing the Sea Stallion homepage is a corporation of a series of institutions including: National Museum of Ireland, Hunterian Museum – Glasgow, Roskilde Museum, Knowledge Lab, University of Southern Denmark, Avedøre Gymnasium, Trællesrupskolen, Dimension 3, Thrane & Thrane, Danish Meteorological Institute, Danish Broadcast Corporation, and researchers from other institutions as well.

Danish: Arbejdet med rekonstruktionen af Skuldelev 2
English: The enormous task of reconstructing Skuldelev 2

Danish: Hele kurset er baseret på praktiske øvelser på Roskilde Fjord, og inden afgang fra museumshavnen vil deltagerne modtage en kort sikkerhedsinstruks, og der vil blive udleveret
English: The entire course will be based on practical exercises on Roskilde Fjord and before leaving the museum harbour, the participants will be provided with a brief introduction to safety precautions and life vests will be distributed.

Danish: Hele kurset er baseret på praktiske øvelser på Roskilde Fjord, og inden afgang fra museumshavnen vil deltagerne modtage en kort sikkerhedsinstruks, og der vil blive udleveret redningsveste.
English: The entire course will be based on practical exercises on Roskilde Fjord and before leaving the museum harbour, the participants will be provided with a brief introduction to safety precautions and life vests will be distributed.

Danish: Vikingeskibets særlige konstruktion og materialer bliver også introduceret til deltagerne ligesom skibets tovværk - ofte i originale materialer, som hestehår og lindebast - præsenteres og forklares.
English: The entire course will be based on practical exercises on Roskilde Fjord and before leaving the museum harbour, the participants will be provided with a brief introduction to safety precautions and life vests will be distributed.

Danish: Sandsække kan anbringes beskyttende omkring depotet, der dækkes med en presenning.
English: The entire depository can be surrounded by protective sandbags and covered with tarpaulins.

Danish: Hele Museumsøen blev oversvømmet i løbet af natten.
English: The entire Museum Island was flooded during the night.

Danish: Hele rekonstruktionsarbejdet er blevet grundigt dokumenteret i en rapport fra 2007.
English: The entire reconstruction work has been thoroughly documented in a report from 2007.

Danish: Indgangen til sidekamrene ligger over gulvniveau.
English: The entrances to the side-cells are above floor level.

Danish: Kvadene er mundtligt overleveret fra generation til generation, men trods risiko for mange og måske mangelfulde genfortællinger vurderes de i dag som vigtige kilder til vikingetiden.
English: The epics were handed down orally from generation to generation, but despite being retold many times they are considered today to be important sources for the Viking Age.

Danish: Europa Kommissionen havde givet en flot bevilling på 15.000 euro.
English: The European Commission had made a generous grant of €15,000.

Danish: Hvordan turen forløber, og hvor den går hen, afhænger af vejret.
English: The evening trips are dependent on wind and weather.

Danish: Aftenen slutter med en sejladsoplevelse i det smukke aftenlys på Roskilde Fjord, i rekonstruktionen Kraka Fyr.
English: The evening will ends with a sailing experience in the beautiful evening light on Roskilde Fjord in the reconstruction Kraka Fyr.

Danish: Begivenheden vil blive bragt som videofilm på hjemmesiden.
English: The event will be shown in a video podcast on the website.

Danish: Udgravningen af fundkompleks 1 blev gennemført i august-september 1997.
English: The excavation of find complex 1 was performed in August-September 1997.

Danish: Udgravningen af Skuldelevskibene i 1962
English: The excavation of the Skuldelev ships in 1962.

Danish: Udgravningen af skibsvraget fra Kalverev Syd og den kommende detaljerede opmåling og analyse af skibsdelene vil være et væsentligt bidrag til belysning af en periode i den nordiske skibsbygningshistorie, der var kendetegnet ved markante teknologiske og samfundsmæssige forandringer.
English: The excavation of the wreck from Kalverev Syd and the forthcoming detailed documentation and analysis of the ship’s parts will be a significant contribution to our understanding of a period in the history of Nordic shipbuilding, which was defined by marked technological and social changes.

Danish: Udgravningen var på det tidspunkt en skuffelse, da skibsgraven ikke viste sig at indeholde et velbevaret fartøj, som man havde fundet fra de norske gravhøje fra Tune, Gokstad og Oseberg.
English: The excavation was a disappointment in so far as it did not contain a well-preserved vessel such as those known from the Norwegian burial mounds from Tune, Gokstad and Oseberg.

Danish: Udgravningen afsluttedes i september 1922, efter at fundlagets grænser til alle sider var konstateret.
English: The excavation was concluded in September 1922, after a thorough examination of the surrounding area of the layer with finds.

Danish: Udgravningen ved Skuldelev, byggeriet af Vikingeskibshallen og opsætningen af de originale vikingeskibe, har hele vejen igennem haft overvældende interesse.
English: The excavations at Skuldelev, the construction of the Viking Ship Hall and the setting up of the original ships attracted a great deal of interest from the very beginning.

Danish: Udgravningerne ved Skuldelev i sommeren 1962 bragte enestående viden om vikingetidens skibsbygning og håndværk.
English: The excavations at Skuldulev in the summer of 1962 provided unique insights into Viking Age shipbuilding and craftwork.

Danish: I 1962 kunne udgravningen begynde.
English: The excavations began in 1962.

Danish: Udgravningen af Hedebys havneområde i 1979-1980 blev begyndelsen på et langstrakt tysk-dansk forskningsprojekt omhandlende vikingetidens skibsfund og skibsbygning med et særligt fokus på vikingetidens Hedeby og Slesvig.
English: The excavations conducted in Hedeby’s harbour area in 1979-1980 led to a long-lasting German and Danish research project concerned with Viking Age ship-finds and shipbuilding, with a focus on Viking Age Hedeby and Schleswig.

Danish: Udgravningerne i Dublin gav oplysninger om en række forskellige bygningstyper.
English: The excavations in Dublin yielded evidence for a number of different building types.

Danish: Udgravningerne, der blev foretaget med udgravningen af Skuldelevskibene som forbillede, frembragte resterne af et uhyre elegant bygget og meget slankt langskib.
English: The excavations, which were modelled on those of the Skuldelev ships, led to the recovery of the remains of an exceptionally elegant, very slender longship.

Danish: Spændingen stiger i takt med lydene fra det stærke egetræ, der knagende giver efter for bådebyggernes velanrettede slag.
English: The excitement mounts in time with the sounds from the strong oak, as it creaks with each of the boatbuilders’ well-aimed blows.

Danish: Det spændene øjeblik.
English: The excitement mounts.

Danish: De spændende historier om vikingerne og Havhingstens sejlads hittede naturligvis.
English: The exciting stories about the Vikings and the Sea Stallion's voyage were a big hit.

Danish: Opgaverne kan løses på papir, med regneark, i et databaseprogram eller ved hjælp af et geografisk informations system (GIS) - eller i en kombination af disse.
English: The exercises can be solved on paper, in a spreadsheet or with the aid of a geographic information system (GIS) - or a combination of these.

Danish: Opgaverne kan løses på papir, med regneark, i et databaseprogram eller ved hjælp af et geografisk informations system (GIS) - eller i en kombination af disse.
English: The exercises can be solved on paper, in a spreadsheet or with the aid of a geographic information system (GIS) – or a combination of these.

Danish: Udstillingen og bådebygningen blev støttet af:
English: The exhibition and boatbuilding was supported by:

Danish: Udstillingen bragte den nye viden om de sydlige have sammen med arkæologiske fund fra udgravninger af vikingernes handelsbyer langs Nordeuropas kyster.
English: The exhibition brought this new knowledge of the Southern Seas together with archaelogical finds from excavations of Viking trading centers along the coasts of Nothern Europe.

Danish: Her er montrer og skuffer med råmaterialer og rekonstruerede, arkæologiske fund, der tilsammen med billeder, citater og tegninger udgør et 'billedsprog', som til dels erstatter udstillingstekster.
English: The exhibition Climb Aboard is supported by Kraks Fond and developed in collaboration between scenographer Sarah Piyannah Cederstrand, the digital design agency Yoke and the Viking Ship Museum.

Danish: Her præsenteres indholdet i billeder og tekst.
English: The exhibition contains pictures and texts related to the content.

Danish: Udstillingen fortsætter på museets hjemmeside.
English: The exhibition continues at the museum website.

Danish: Udstillingen gik tæt på arbejdet med tegneserien; fra de første skitser til de farvelagte originalsider.
English: The exhibition focused the work involved in producing the comic, from the first sketches to the colourful original prints.

Danish: Udstillingen går tæt på arbejdet med tegneserien; fra de første skitser til de farvelagte originalsider.
English: The exhibition focuses the work involved in producing the comic, from the first sketches to the colourful original prints.

Danish: Udstillingen fra København og London er udvidet med nye aktiviteter, som den danske ambassade i Berlin har arrangeret i samarbejde med Vikingeskibsmuseet i Roskilde.
English: The exhibition from Copenhagen and London has been expanded to include new activities, organised by the Danish embassy in Berlin in collaboration with the Viking Ship Museum in Roskilde.

Danish: Udstillingen er udarbejdet i samarbejde med Suzhou Museum og et konsortium bestående af nogle af Danmarks førende museer og forskningsinstitutioner: Sydvestjyske Museer, Aarhus Universitet, Vikingeskibsmuseet og Nationalmuseet, der rummer nogle af de fineste arkæologiske samlinger i Danmark.
English: The exhibition has been developed in collaboration between Suzhou Museum and an exhibition team comprised of some of Denmark's leading museums and research institutions: Sydvestjyske Museer, Aarhus university, the Viking Ship Museum and the National Museum, which houses some of the finest archaeological collections in Denmark.

Danish: Udstillingen er skabt i et samarbejde mellem Sydvestjyske Museer, Aarhus Universitet, Vikingeskibsmuseet og Nationalmuseet, der rummer nogle af de fineste arkæologiske samlinger i Danmark.
English: The exhibition has been developed in collaboration between Sydvestjyske Museer, Aarhus University, the Viking Ship Museum and the National Museum, which houses some of the finest archaeological collections in Denmark.

Danish: Udstillingen er muliggjort gennem en stor donation fra A.P. Møller og Hustru Chastine Mc-Kinney Møllers Fond til almene Formål.
English: The exhibition has been made possible by a generous donation from A.P. Møller and Hustru Chastine Mc-Kinney Møkkers Fond til almene Formål.

Danish: Udstillingen har to dimensioner og spejler fortællingen om menneskerne, rejsen, fartøjet og livet - i vikingetiden og nu.
English: The exhibition has two dimensions and mirrors the story of the people, the voyage, the vessel and life - in the Viking Age and now.

Danish: Udstillingen i og ved Havhingsten kan opleves fra den 25. juni.
English: The exhibition in and around the Sea Stallion can be seen from 25 June.

Danish: Udstillingen rummede helt nye fund fra Zanzibar, sølvskatte og guldperler, kamme af rensdyrtak, koransider samt et imponerende buddhahoved fra Borobudur templet på Java.
English: The exhibition included brand new finds from Zanzibar, silver treasure and gold beads, a comb of reindeer antler, a page from the Koran as well an impressive carving of Buddha from the Borobudur temple in Java.

Danish: Udstillingen tager afsæt i fire skelsættende udviklinger i museets historie:
English: The exhibition is based on four landmark developments in the history of the museum:

Danish: Udstillingen er indrettet i museets arkæologiske værksted, hvor de seneste fund opbevares i et stort vandkar.
English: The exhibition is housed in the museum’s archaeological workshop, where the latest discoveries are stored in a large tank of water.

Danish: Udstillingen produceres i samarbejde med Vikingeskibsmuseet, og baserer sig hovedsagligt på den elektroniske formidling, der produceres af Vikingeskibsmuseet.
English: The exhibition is produced in corporation with the Viking Ship Museum, and is mainly based on the electronic communication, composed at the Viking Ship Museum.

Danish: Udstillingen er støttet af: Kraks Fond
English: The exhibition is supported by: Kraks Fond

Danish: Udstillingen markerer 50-året for udgravningen af de fem vikingeskibe i Roskilde Fjord, der blev grundlaget for museets eksistens og skabte drømmen om udforskning og formidling af vikingetidens maritime kultur.
English: The exhibition marks the 50th anniversary of the excavation of the five Viking ships in Roskilde Fjord, which became the foundation for the Viking Ship Museum and created the dream om researching and disseminating Viking Age maritime culture.

Danish: Udstillingen åbnedes i sommeren 1937, men på grund af lokalets høje luftfugtighed viste der sig snart problemer med en omkrystallisering af alunen, som beskadigede træets struktur indefra.
English: The exhibition opened in the summer of 1937, but because of the high humidity in the hall, problems soon developed with re-crystallisation of the alum and surface discharges of alum, glycerine, wax, etc., making the structure of the wood disintegrate.

Danish: Udstillingen åbner i arkæologisk værksted den 10. maj.
English: The exhibition opens in the archaeological workshop on 10 May.

Danish: Udstillingsprojektet var forankret i et samarbejde mellem Vikingeskibsmuseet og Det Frie Forskningsråds Sapere Aude forskningsprojekt 'Entrepot - maritime udvekslingsnetværk og urbanisering i global middelalderarkæologi', et samarbejde mellem Aarhus Universitet og University of York, Storbritannien.
English: The exhibition project was anchored in collaboration between the Viking Ship Museum and the Danish Council for Independent Research (DFF) Sapere Aude research project 'ENTREPOT - Maritime Network Development and Urbanisation in Global Medieval Archaeology', based at Aarhus University and the University of York, England.

Danish: Udstillingen giver et tilbageblik på museets historie og Werner Karraschs virke som fotograf, gennem en række udvalgte temaer.
English: The exhibition provides a retrospective on both the Museum’s history and Werner Karraschs work as a photographer, through series of selected themes:

Danish: Udstillingen indtog hele museumsområdet og formidlede arbejdet med rekonstruktionen af Skuldelev 2, byggeriet af Havhingsten, sejladserfaringer, forskningens resultater, livet om bord og historierne fra den eventyrlige rejse.
English: The exhibition spread across the entire museum area and communicated the reconstruction of the original ship, Skuldelev 2, building the Sea Stallion, sailing experiences, research results. life on board and the stories from the adventurous voyage.

Danish: Udstillingen tog udgangspunkt i den begejstring og de drømme, der har bygget bro mellem forskere, håndværkere og sejlere, virkeliggjort omfattende eksperimentalarkæologiske forsøg og har formet museet, som det er i dag.
English: The exhibition was based on the enthusiasm and dreams that build bridge between researchers, craftsmen and sailors and has shaped the museum into what it is today.

Danish: Udstillingen var produceret i samarbejde med:
English: The exhibition was created in co-operation with:

Danish: Udstillingen var indrettet i museets arkæologiske værksted, hvor de seneste fund blev opbevaret i et stort vandkar.
English: The exhibition was displayed in the Museum's archaeological workshop, where the latest finds were stored in a large water tank.

Danish: Udstillingen var sponsoreret af:
English: The exhibition was supported by:

Danish: Udstillingen var støttet af:
English: The exhibition was supported by:

Danish: Udstillingen i forbindelse med skibets overvintring i Dublin bliver en fantastisk udnyttelse af Collins Barracks udstillingsområder og jeg håber, at alle vil gribe den enestående mulighed for at byde skibet velkommen i havnen ved Dublin Docklands den 14. august".
English: The exhibition will be a fantastic use of the Collins Barracks exhibition space and I hope that everyone will take this unique opportunity of welcoming the Sea Stallion to Dublin Docklands on 14th August.”

Danish: Udstillingerne åbnes den 9. september af Hendes Majestæt Dronningen og Tysklands Forbundspræsident, Joachim Gauck, der sammen også besøger Havhingsten.
English: The exhibition will be opened on the 9th September by Her Majesty the Queen of Denmark and German President, Joachim Gauck, who will also visit Sea Stallion together.

Danish: Udstillingen kommer til at genlyde af øksehug og dufte af trætjære.
English: The exhibition will echo with the sound of chopping axes and smell of wood tar.

Danish: Udstillingsteamet tilrettelægger museets udstillinger og særarrangementer.
English: The Exhibitions team plans and designs all exhibitions and special arrangements.

Danish: Den eksisterende sejlrende er 40 m bred (bundbredde) og ca. 6,5 m dyb.
English: The existing channel is 40 metres wide (bottom width) and about 6.5 metres deep.

Danish: Togtet til Dublin i 2007 er derfor også en test af Havhingsten.
English: The expedition to Dublin in 2007 is therefore also a test of the Sea Stallion.

Danish: Og så giver det en indsigt i hvordan moderne mænd og kvinder håndterer mangel på privatliv og mangel på komfort.
English: The expedition will also give an insight in how modern man and woman deal with such an environment and lack of privacy.

Danish: Oplevelsen fortsætter også efter dit besøg, idet museet har valgt en open source tilgang til projektet.
English: The experience can also continue after your visit as the Museum adopts an open source approach to the project.

Danish: Erfaringerne fra sommerens togt til Norge er, at selv under den varmeste hedebølge i mands minde er nætterne om bord på Havhingsten hundekolde.
English: The experience from last summers sail to Norway was that even during the warmest heatwave ever, nights on board the Sea Stallion can be freezing.

Danish: De to skibe er lastet med udstyr og handelsvarer, der understreger skibenes oprindelige funktion, og opfordrer til at gå på opdagelse; lette låget på tønder og kister, åbne dørken og kikke under dækket, gå til ro i skibsteltet eller prøve kræfter med rollen som rorgænger.
English: The experience is enhanced by the opportunity to dress in reconstructed Viking Age clothing and step into the role as a merchant sailing towards the Mediterranean markets or a chieftain heading towards the English coast.

Danish: Oplevelsen er uforstyrret og giver rum til fordybelse og fantasi.
English: The experience is undisturbed and gives room for immersion and fantasy.

Danish: De oplevelser, som han og andre rejsende vendte hjem med, dannede ophav til nogle af historiens mest originale rejseskildringer i de sande og opdigtede fortællinger, som blev samlet i Siraf og andre byer ved Den Persiske Golf.
English: The experiences he and other travellers came home with gave rise to some of the most original travel accounts known to history, with tales ranging from the accurate to the embellished, which were collected in Siraf and other Persian Gulf ports.

Danish: Forsøget foregik i samarbejde med Ebeltoft Museum.
English: The experiment was performed in cooperation with Ebeltoft Museum.

Danish: De eksperimentalarkæologiske metoder vi bruger på museet er blevet meget forfinet i løbet af de 35 år der er gået, siden byggeriet af Roar Ege fandt sted.
English: The experimental archaeological methods practised at the Museum have been greatly refined in the 35 years since the construction of Roar Ege began.

Danish: Forsøgsopstillingen stod i omtrent et år, hvor vandtemperatur og saltholdighed i Skagerak og Lille Bælt året igennem blev optegnet med jævne mellemrum efter DMIs hjemmeside.
English: The experimental set up was left in place for about a year, during which the water temperature and salt content in Skagerrak and Little Belt were plotted at regular intervals from the Danish Meteorological Institute's website.

Danish: Forklaringen herpå skal formentlig ses i lyset af den øgede betydning sejlads får i både de indre og ydre danske farvande i løbet af yngre jernalder.
English: The explanation for this is probably connected with the increased importance of sailing on both inshore and open water during the late Iron Age.

Danish: Den udsatte post og en meget uheldig placeret soveplads fik konsekvenser for Anders B. S. Fischer:
English: The exposed position and a very awkwardly located place for sleeping had consequences for Anders B. S. Fischer:

Danish: Dette funds materiale peger på flere muligheder inden for det nordtyske og sydskandinaviske område, hvor den angribende mobile styrke kan være kommet fra.
English: The extant archaeological source material reveals several possibilities for the origin of the mobile, attacking army to be in the northern German or southern Scandinavian area.

Danish: Den intensive brug af totalstation som opmålingsinstrument udgør en metodologisk innovation som karakteriserer B&W udgravningerne.
English: The extensive use of total station as a survey instrument is the main methodological innovation characterising the B&W excavations.

Danish: Kr. er bygget af eg, lind, fyr og gran, samlet med jernklinknagler og i enkelte partier ved syning.
English: The extensive use of total station as a survey instrument is the main methodological innovation characterising the B&W excavations.

Danish: Omfanget af reparationer og brugen af genanvendte skibsdele har ført til en teori om, at skibet måske har været et ledingsfartøj.
English: The extent of the repairs and the use of re-used ship components have prompted the theory that the vessel was, perhaps, a leidang ship.

Danish: Omfanget af slid på Gislingebåden afspejler mange års hårdt arbejde på fjorden.
English: The extent of the wear and tear on the Gislinge boat is a testament to many years hard service on the fjord.

Danish: Disses udstrækning blev fastslået ved sonderinger og udgravet i efteråret 1996 (fundkompleks 2).
English: The extent of these finds was determined by probing and they were excavated in the autumn of 1996 (find complex 2).

Danish: At udvinde jern fra myremalm er en kulturteknik med rødder helt til bage til den danske jernalder.
English: The extraction of iron from bog ore is an ancient technique with roots going back to the Danish Iron Age.

Danish: Øjet rettedes mod genstande, der har rejst over lange distancer og unikke fund, der viser inspiration fra fjerne kulturer.
English: The eye was drawn toward artefacts, which have travelled ove rlong distances and unique finds showing inspiration from foreign cultures.

Danish: At næsten alle undersøgte lastskibsfund er bygget i det middelalderlige Danmark, bekræfter de skriftelige kilders udsagn om det danske riges veletablerede position som sø- og handelsmagt.
English: The fact that almost all of the examined finds of cargo vessels were built in medieval Denmark confirms the written sources’ evidence of the well-established position of the Danish kingdom as a naval and commercial power.

Danish: At kun vrag af store skibe blev fundet uden for sikre havne antyder en tendens imod, at store lastskibe senest efter ca. 1140 sejlede i regelmæssig fart og dermed blev udsat for et accepteret risiko, at løbe ind i farlige vejrforhold.
English: The fact that only large cargo vessels were found outside sheltered harbours indicates a tendency for large cargo vessels to be used on a regular basis, and with an accepted risk of exposure to dangerous weather conditions, after ca 1140, if not earlier.

Danish: Den omstændighed, at flere af snellerne mellem bundstokken og biten stod skråt i stedet for lodret, som gælder de øvrige sneller i resten af skibet, taler ydermere for denne konklusion.
English: The fact that several of the supports between the floor timbers and the biti stood at an angle rather than vertically - as all the other supports in the rest of the ship - supports this conclusion.

Danish: Opløser man denne kraft i en fremadrettet og en sideværts komposant, ser man at den bidrager noget til fremdriften, men overvejende presser sejlet sidelæns - det vil sige krænger båden og får den til at drive sidelæns.
English: The fact that the boat does not simply move in the direction of the force is due to the boat extending down into the water where it "stands fast" in the water with the aid of, depending on the type of boat, a more-or-less prominent keel.

Danish: At kvinder var et særsyn på skibene fremgår af enkelte skriftlige kilder, hvor der står, at de skulle beskyttes mod farer, kulde og regn.
English: The fact that the presence on the ships of women was quite exceptional is evident from a few written sources.

Danish: At skibet ikke blev fremstillet til gravlæggelsen fremgår dels af spor efter reparationer dels af forekomsten af kalfatring.
English: The fact that the ship was not made specifically for the burial can be seen partly from the traces of repairs and partly from the existence of caulking.

Danish: Når Theodosios under rejsen sendte budskaber videre til en fjern del af verden, som kejserhoffet i Byzans knap kendte eksistensen af få år forinden, skyldtes det sandsynligvis en lille gruppe skandinaver, som nyligt var sejlet ad de russiske floder til Konstantinopel - den første kendte rejse langs denne rute fra Skandinavien til Det Byzantinske Rige.
English: The fact that Theodosios sent messages to a far-off corner of the world, which the Byzantine emperor's court had only learned the existence of some few years earlier, was perhaps due to a small group of Scandinavians who had recently sailed down the Russian river systems to Constantinople - the first known voyage along this route.

Danish: Når Theodosios under rejsen sendte budskaber videre til en fjern del af verden, som kejserhoffet i Byzans knap kendte eksistensen af få år forinden, skyldtes det sandsynligvis en lille gruppe skandinaver, som nyligt var sejlet ad de russiske floder til Konstantinopel – den første kendte rejse langs denne rute fra Skandinavien til Det Byzantinske Rige.
English: The fact that Theodosios sent messages to a far-off corner of the world, which the Byzantine emperor’s court had only learned the existence of some few years earlier, was perhaps due to a small group of Scandinavians who had recently sailed down the Russian river systems to Constantinople – the first known voyage along this route.

Danish: Når det som her, er fundet i sammenhæng med daterede bopladslag bliver det ret unikt”, fortæller Morten Johansen.
English: The fact that we have found it in connection with a datable habitation layer is quite unique', tells Morten Johansen.

Danish: Den kendsgerning, at der er fundet sølvsmykker, som tydeligvis er fremstillet af irske sølvsmede, tyder på, at betydelige mængder sølv fandt vej til irske hænder.
English: The fact that we have silver ornaments clearly made by Irish craftsmen indicates that significant amounts of silver found its way into Irish hands.

Danish: På Vikingeskibsmuseets bådeværft bliver færøbådene bygget sådan.
English: The Faeroese boats are still built in this way at the Viking Ship Museum’s boatyard.

Danish: Familien emigrerede til Canada i 1957 og havde gennem et testamente doneret penge til byggeriet.
English: The family emigrated to Canada in 1957 and had left money in their will for the construction.

Danish: Den norske kong Olav Trygvassons berømte storskib "Ormen hin lange" var dog ifølge Snorres kongesaga større - hele 43 meter langt!
English: The famous great-ship of the Norwegian king, Olav Trygvasson, "Ormen hin lange" (Long Serpent) was, according to Snorre's saga, all of 43 m long!

Danish: Det berømte norske vikingeskib, Osebergskibet, der blev udgravet i 1904, er bygget i år 820 og sat i en gravhøj 14 år senere.
English: The famous Norwegian Viking ship, the Oseberg ship, was built in AD 820, buried in a grave mound 14 years later, and excavated in 1904.

Danish: Den berømte rorvidje.
English: The famous rudder tackle.

Danish: De berømte skibe fra Roskilde Fjord
English: The famous ships from Roskilde Fjord

Danish: Kosten er noget anderledes end den vikingerne fik serveret for tusind år siden.
English: The fare on board the Sea Stallion is somewhat different from that eaten by the Vikings a thousand years ago.

Danish: Bønderne skulle medbringe to pilekoggere med pile samt en bue til hver tofte eller bænk i skibet, og skulle også betale 3 øre pr. manglende bue.
English: The farmers were to bring two quivers of arrows and a bow for each thwart in the ship, and they also paid 3 øre per missing bow.

Danish: Færøbåden er i første række udviklet som en robåd på grund af øgruppens særlige geografi.
English: The Faroe boat was first and foremost developed as a rowing boat, due to the special geography of the island group.

Danish: Den færøske båd har helt frem til sidste halvdel af 1900-tallet været livsvigtig for fiskeri, grindefangst og samfærdslen mellem øerne.
English: The Faroese boat has, right up until the last half of the 20th century, been of critical importance for fishing, whaling and transport between the islands.

Danish: Frygter for en blodprop
English: The fear of blood clots

Danish: Til Stormandens festmiddag og for sejlads på fjorden kræves særlig billet, som kan købes på dagen.
English: The feast dinner and sailing on the Fjord require special ticket.

Danish: Måltiderne tilberedes efter principperne for Ny Nordisk Vikingemad, som kan opleves på Vikingeskibsmuset.
English: The feast on Samsø will be prepared according to the principles of the New Nordic Viking Food.

Danish: Det, der først og fremmest gør indtryk er skibets længde.
English: The feature that makes the most immediate impression, is the length of the ship.

Danish: Fænderlisten ligger uden på dækket.
English: The fender moulding lies around the deck.

Danish: Vand, Vind & Vikinger Festival er en maritim legeplads med oplevelser og aktiviteter, der stiller skarpt på Vand, Vind og Vikinger. udfolder Nordens originale maritime kulturhistorie.
English: The festival is a maritime playground with experiences and activities focusing on Water, Wind and Vikings.

Danish: Festivalen skyder efterårsferien i gang den 16. oktober med et brag af kongelige oplevelser i børnehøjde.
English: The festival will mark the start of the autumn holidays on 16 October, with a host of royal experiences for children.

Danish: De få utjærede stykker løbende rig, der havde sneget sig med, holdte ikke.
English: The few bits of untarred rigging that went unnoticed did not hold.

Danish: Fibrene bankes (skættes) for at fjerne de sidste små stykker marv
English: The fibres are then scutched (beaten) to remove the small fragments of pith

Danish: Tallet antyder, at de store langskibe i slutningen af 1100-tallet havde vokset sig langt bredere og dermed tungere end vikingetidens.
English: The figure suggests that the great longships at the end of the twelfth century had become much broader and hence heavier than those of the Viking Age.

Danish: Filen datalogger er en zippet semikolon- og linjesepareret tekstfil med kolonneoverskrifter som første række og én måling pr. række.
English: The file datalogger is a zipped, semi-colon and line separated text file with column headings as the first line and one record per line.

Danish: Filmen giver et indblik i livet ombord, ventetiden i havn, kampen mod elementerne og den menneskelige udfordring det er at leve med 64 andre mennesker på ca. 60 kvadratmeter.”
English: The film gives a good view of life on board, the time spent waiting in harbour, the fight with the elements, and the human challenge of living with 64 other people in about 60 square metres.”

Danish: Filmen viser både dramatiske billeder fra sejladser i hårdt vejr, smukke landskabsbilleder og episoder fra livet ombord.
English: The film shows dramatic pictures from the voyage in rough weather, beautiful landscape pictures and episodes from life on board.

Danish: Filmen blev foræret til vikingeskibsmuseet i 2003 af Børge Dahl, der husker, at han som barn var med sin far nede ved Fjorden og se på de lynhurtige isbåde.
English: The film was donated to the Viking Ship Museum in 2003 by Børge Dahl, who remembers that as a child, he accompanied his father down to the Fjord to see the very fast ice boats.

Danish: Filmen er optaget af Daniel Dalicsek
English: The film was shot by Daniel Dalicsek.

Danish: Filmen er optage kort inden, marinarkæologerne begyndte at bjærge skibsdelene.
English: The film was shot shortly before, the maritime archaeologists began to salvage a ship parts.

Danish: Filmen er optaget med dykkerens hjelmkamera, så det du ser, er de billeder, som udgravningslederen ser og bruger til at vejlede dykkerene i vandet.
English: The film was shot with the diver's helmet camera, so what you see is the footage the excavation leader sees and uses to guide the divers in the water.

Danish: Filmens fotografer er Werner Karrasch, Vikingeskibsmuseet; Asbjørn Date, DR; Nathan Williams, James Gray, BBC og Kasper Thor Larsen.
English: The film’s photographers are Werner Karrasch from the Viking Ship Museum, Asbjørn Date from Danmarks Radio, Nathan Williams and James Gray from the BBC and Kasper Thor Larsen.

Danish: Den sidste bro er passeret, stævnene klarede turen, skipper ånder lettet op.
English: The final bridge is passed, the stems pass safely under and the skipper breaths a sigh of relief.

Danish: Det sidste skibsbillede på tapetet.
English: The final picture of ships on the tapestry.

Danish: Det sidste afsnit (6.5) samler vidnesbyrdene fra alle undersøgelser i et forsøg på at datere spærringens faser og sætte disse i relation til begivenheder kendt fra datidens skriftlige kilder.
English: The final section (6.5) presents the combined evidence from all the analyses in order to date the phases of the barrier and to relate these to events known from contemporary written sources.

Danish: Fundfordelingen af store lastskibe viser et direkte forhold mellem disse skibe og vigtige verdslige og kirkelige centre for magt og handel.
English: The find distribution of large cargo vessels points toward a direct relationship between the owners of large cargo ships and prominent centres of secular and ecclesiastical power and trade.

Danish: Fundet er dateret til ca. 1131-36, og den udstrakte anvendelse af fyrretræ i kombination med enkelte egeplanker peger på en proveniens på Den skandinaviske Halvø, formodentlig i Kattegat-Skagerrak området.
English: The find has been dated to about 1131-36 and the extensive use of pine in combination with a few oak planks indicate a provenance on the Scandinavian peninsula, probably in the Kattegat-Skagerrak area.

Danish: Fundet er dokumenteret i 1:1, men materialet er ikke forsøgt analyseret endnu.
English: The find is documented on a 1:1 scale but no attempt has yet been made to analyse the material.

Danish: Til reparation og vedligeholdelse af syninger og til tætning af båden fandtes en klump tætningsmateriale og en S-formet 'snorestrammer'.
English: The find of a lump of caulking material and an S-shaped 'cord-tightener' indicate how the seams and caulking of the boat were maintained.

Danish: Til reparation og vedligeholdelse af syninger og til tætning af båden fandtes en klump tætningsmateriale og en S-formet ’snorestrammer’.
English: The find of a lump of caulking material and an S-shaped 'cord-tightener' indicate how the seams and caulking of the boat were maintained.

Danish: Fundet af kanalen er helt unik i norsk sammenhæng og er et af de største kendte byggeprojekter fra norsk jernalder overhovedet.
English: The find of the canal is unique i Norway and is one of the biggest constructions known from the Norwegian Iron Age.

Danish: Fundet vendte op og ned på vores viden om vikingetidens maritime kultur, har haft afgørende betydning for marinarkæologien i Danmark og er fundamentet for Vikingeskibsmuseet.
English: The find turned our knowledge of Viking Age maritime culture upside down, became crucial for the maritime archaeology in Denmark and is the foundation for the Viking Ship Museum.

Danish: Fundet vendte op og ned på vores viden om Nordens maritime kultur, og åbnede døren ind til verden i vikingetiden.
English: The find turned out knowledge of Nordic maritime culture upside down and opened the door to the Viking Age world.

Danish: Vikingeskibsmuseet inviterer børn og voksne med ud på en spændende rejse i Vikingernes verden.
English: The find turned out knowledge of Nordic maritime culture upside down and opened the door to the Viking Age world.

Danish: Fundet blev konserveret efter udgravningen i 1880, og i 1929 begyndte arbejdet med at restaurere skibet og rekonstruere de tre småbåde.
English: The find was conserved after the excavation in 1880, and in 1929, work on restoring the ship and reconstructing the three small boats began.

Danish: Skibet blev fundet i kote -0,6m DNN, og er øjensynligt forlist eller ophugget på lavt vand lige nedenfor det middelalderlige Skt. Jørgensbjerg, centralt i Roskildes daværende havneområde.
English: The find was made at a depth of 0.6 m DNN and was evidently wrecked or broken in shallow water just below the medieval Saint Jørgensbjerg, in the centre of Roskilde's harbour area at that time.

Danish: Skibet blev fundet i kote –0,6m DNN, og er øjensynligt forlist eller ophugget på lavt vand lige nedenfor det middelalderlige Skt. Jørgensbjerg, centralt i Roskildes daværende havneområde.
English: The find was made at a depth of 0.6 m DNN and was evidently wrecked or broken in shallow water just below the medieval Saint Jørgensbjerg, in the centre of Roskilde’s harbour area at that time.

Danish: For at bevare dem for eftertiden må fundene nogle gange beskyttes på stedet (in situ) vha. presenninger og sandsække.
English: The finds are then sometimes provided with in situ protection using tarpaulins and sandbags to preserve them for the future.

Danish: De store lastskibe adskiller sig fra de mindre skibe på tre punkter:
English: The finds of large cargo vessels are distinguished from other cargo ship-finds by three features:

Danish: De færdige kager smager godt med en klat smør eller honning.
English: The finished bread tastes good with a knob of butter or honey.

Danish: De første 50 år har plassert Skuldelevskipene og Vikingeskibsmuseet på toppen av listen over nyskapende forskningsinstitusjoner.
English: The first 50 years have placed the Skuldelev ships and the Viking Ship Museum at the top of the list of innovative research institutions.

Danish: De første, der rapporterer om størrelsen af de overfaldende flåder, stammer fra krønikens historiske del, og kan undertiden vække en del skepsis.
English: The first accounts to report on the size of the invading fleets derive from the historical section of the chronicle and can sometimes give rise to some scepticism.

Danish: De ældste fund af rene sejlskibe er dateret til tiden efter konsolideringen af kongemagten og den officielle overgang til kristendommen i Danmark i anden halvdel af 900-årene.
English: The first archaeological evidence for pure sailing vessels can be dated to the period following the consolidation of centralised royal power and the official conversion to Christianity in Denmark in the late 10th century.

Danish: I første kapitel behandles Roskilde Fjords geologiske historie (1.
English: The first chapter covers the geological history of Roskilde Fjord (1.

Danish: Bayeux tapetets første skibsafbildning: Harolds skibe stages fri af den engelske kyst
English: The first delineation of a ship on the Bayeux tapestry: Harold’s ship is poled off from the English coast

Danish: Dagens første øvelse gik ud på at træne en såkaldt ’tørskoet evakuering’.
English: The first drill of the day was a so-called evacuation with "dry shoes".

Danish: Den første udgravning af det, vi i dag med sikkerhed vil betegne som et langskib, blev foretaget i 1934-36 ved Ladby på Fyn.
English: The first excavation of what we today with certainty would term a longship was carried out in 1934-36 at Ladby on Funen.

Danish: En af de udenlandske kilder der fortæller om vikingernes skibe er den angelsaksiske krønike.
English: The first folio in the Peterborough Chronicle, a transcript from c.

Danish: Den første måde at handle på kan kaldes for bytteøkonomi, den sidste for møntøkonomi.
English: The first form of trade can be referred to as a barter economy, the second as a money economy.

Danish: Første gang i 948, hvor Århus' biskop deltog i et stort kirkemøde i Ingelheim i Tyskland sammen med bisper fra Ribe og Slesvig.
English: The first is in AD 948 when the bishop of Aarhus participated in a great synod in Ingelheim in Germany together with the bishops of Ribe and Schleswig.

Danish: Første gang i 948, hvor Århus’ biskop deltog i et stort kirkemøde i Ingelheim i Tyskland sammen med bisper fra Ribe og Slesvig.
English: The first is in AD 948 when the bishop of Aarhus participated in a great synod in Ingelheim in Germany together with the bishops of Ribe and Schleswig.

Danish: Det første langskib - skibsgraven fra Ladby
English: The first long ship - the grave ship from Ladby

Danish: Den første gang byen nævnes i de frankiske rigsannaler, er da den danske konge i 804 samlede hær og flåde i Hedeby.
English: The first mention of the town is in the annals of the Frankish Empire ? when the Danish king gathered his army and fleet at Haithabu in AD 804.

Danish: Den første af de tre, nordmanden Ottar, dukkede op som gæst op ved Kong Alfred den stores hof i England mens vikingetogterne hertil var på deres højeste.
English: The first of the three, the Norwegian Ohthere, appeared as a guest at the court of King Alfred the Great in England, when Viking raids upon the English coast were at their peak.

Danish: Den første side i Petersborugh-krøniken, en afskrift fra ca. 1150 af en ældre version Den Angelsaksiske Krønike
English: The first page of the Peterborough Chronicle, a copy from about 1150 of an older version of one of the Anglo-Saxon Chronicles

Danish: Den første side i Peterborough-krøniken, en afskrift fra ca. 1150 af en ældre version af Den angelsaksiske krønike
English: The first page of the Peterborough Chronicle, a copy from about 1150 of an older version of one of the Angosaxon Chronicles

Danish: Første del af Havhingstens forsøgsrejse er nu overstået.
English: The first part of the Sea Stallion's experimental voyage is now over.

Danish: Første del er fra 737, og den blev forstærket og udbygget flere gange i løbet af vikingetiden.
English: The first part of these defences dates from as early as AD 737 and they were extended and strengthened throughout Viking times.

Danish: Første fase af projektet var en ny vurdering af skibets skrogform.
English: The first phase of the project was a new assessment of ship's hull design.

Danish: Den der er hurtigst får kortene.
English: The first player to do this takes all the cards.

Danish: Den første rekonstruktion bar navnet 'Dronningen', og gik ned på sin jomfrufærd i 1987.
English: The first reconstruction was named ‘Dronningen' and sank on her maiden voyage in 1987.

Danish: Den første rekonstruktion bar navnet 'Dronningen', og gik ned på sin jomfrufærd i 1987.
English: The first reconstruction was named ‘Dronningen’ and sank on her maiden voyage in 1987.

Danish: Den første, Kraka Fyr, blev bygget i 1998.
English: The first reconstruction, Kraka Fyr, was built in 1998.

Danish: Den første sejlads
English: The first rowing trip.

Danish: Den første rorvidje monterede vi Dublin, dagen før afsejlingen.
English: The first rudder tackle was fitted in Dublin, the day before we sailed.

Danish: Den første kapsejlads blev afholdt i 1881 i USA, som sammen med Tyskland, Sverige og Holland er blandt de lande, hvor isbådssejlads har været mest udbredt.
English: The first sailing race was held in 1881 in the USA, which along with Germany, Sweden and Holland, is among the countries where ice boat racing is most popular.

Danish: Første etape går fra Roskilde til Gedser, hvor vikingetidens skibsteknologi møder nutidens forbindelsesled til det Europæiske fastland; færgen til Rostock med afgang kl. 20.00.
English: The first stage goes from Roskilde to Gedser, where Viking Age ship technology meets the present day connection to the European mainland; the ferry to Rostock, which departs at 20:00.

Danish: Stammen blev kløvet på samme måde som den stor kævle som plankerne skal fremstilles af ( se billederne fra kløvning her… ).
English: The first step involved cleaving the oak ( you can see a film of the explaining the cleaving process here... ) and the initial cleave into halves went like clockwork.

Danish: Som de første oprettedes en database om naturkemi med alle de oplysninger, opskrifter og muligheder indenfor giftmaling og konservering af træ som vi indtil nu kender til fra vikingetid og middelalder.
English: The first step was the construction of a chemical database containing all available information, formulae and potential sources with regard to biocidal paint and the preservation of wood, known so far from the Viking period and the Middle Ages.

Danish: Første stop bliver Halifax i det østligste Canada, hvor den skal udstilles på The Maritime Museum of the Atlantic, hvor The Tall Ships' Atlantic Challange passerer til juli.
English: The first stop will be Halifax in eastern Canada, where it will be displayed at the Maritime Museum of the Atlantic, where the Tall Ships' Atlantic Challenge will pass by in July.

Danish: De første åretag med Freydis Joanne blev gjort i smult vande.
English: The first stroke of the oars with Freydis Joanne took place on smooth waters.

Danish: Den første opgave for marinarkæologerne er at få styr det kaotiske morads af nedfaldne skibsdele, kanoner, trosser og genstande.
English: The first task for the maritime archaeologists is to sort out the chaotic tangle of fallen timbers, cannons, ropes and other artefacts.

Danish: Vikingerne satte fod i Skotland første gang omkring år 800.
English: The first time the Vikings sat foot in Scotland was about AD 800.

Danish: Første gang vi hører om størrelsen på dens flåde er i 893, 27 år efter at den er dukket op i England.
English: The first time we hear of the size of its fleet is in 893, 27 years after its first arrival in England.

Danish: De første byer blev etableret – med deraf følgende specialiserede håndværk, nye økonomiske systemer, og store handelsnetværk.
English: The first towns were established – leading to specialised handicrafts, new economic systems, and a large trading network.

Danish: De tidligere testsejladser
English: The first trial voyages

Danish: De første testsejladser i Vikingeskibsmuseets regi fandt sted så tidligt som i 1976 og 1977.
English: The first trial voyages under the auspices of the Viking Ship Museum took place as early as 1976 and 1977.

Danish: Den første tur var med initiativtageren fra det dansk-canadiske museum i Dickson, Edmonton, Canada, Carl Sorensen og Vikingeskibsmuseets bådebyggerlærling Erik Jochumsen.
English: The first trip was with the initiator from the Danish-Canadian museum in Dickson, Edmonton, Canada, Carl Sorensen and the Viking Ship Museum's boatbuilder apprentice, Erik Jochumsen.

Danish: Den første tur var med initiativtageren fra det dansk-canadiske museum i Dickson, Edmonton, Canada, Carl Sorensen og Vikingeskibsmuseets bådebyggerlærling Erik Jochumsen.
English: The first trip was with the initiator from the Danish-Canadian museum in Dickson, Edmonton, Canada, Carl Sorensen and the Viking Ship Museum’s boatbuilder apprentice, Erik Jochumsen.

Danish: De to første kender vi ikke i dag, og sagaerne fortæller ikke meget om reglerne, men bygger på senere kilder og vores egen fantasi.
English: The first two are unknown to us today, and the sagas reveal very little about the rules for these games, but we can make use of later sources and our own imagination.

Danish: De første videofilm er blevet lagt på hjemmesiden som optakt til, hvad der er i vente ved året sejlads.
English: The first video podcasts have appeared on our website as a foretaste of what is to come with this year's voyage.

Danish: I dette første bind behandles skibene og spærringen i deres historiske og topografiske kontekst, samt arbejdet med skibenes konservering og udstilling.
English: The first volume presents the ships and the barrier in their historical and topographical context, as well as the conservation of the ships and their subsequent restoration and exhibition.

Danish: Fiskerbåden, Skuldelev 6 - endnu en rekonstruktion
English: The fishing boat Skuldelev 6 - another reconstruction

Danish: Fiskerbåden Skjoldungen
English: The fishing vessel 'Skjoldungen'

Danish: De fem imponerende vikingeskibe er omdrejningspunktet for fortællingen om skibenes betydning for vikingernes samfund, om krig og togter, handel og rejser, og om livet i Norden for 1000 år siden.
English: The five impressive Viking ships are the focal point for the story about the ships’ significance for Viking Age society, about war and raids, trading and voyages and about life in the North 1,000 years ago.

Danish: De fem rekonstruktioner
English: The five reconstructions

Danish: Vikingeskibsmuseets fem rekonstruktioner af Skuldelevskibene, juni 2007
English: The five reconstructions of the Skuldelev ships, June 2007.

Danish: De fem skibsfund udgravet ved Skuldelev i Roskilde Fjord i 1962 er Vikingeskibsmuseet i Roskildes arkæologiske hovedattraktion og primære forskningsmæssige udgangspunkt.
English: The five ship-finds excavated at Skuldelev in Roskilde Fjord in 1962 are the main archaeological attraction and primary research basis at the Viking Ship Museum in Roskilde.

Danish: De fem skibe giver vidnesbyrd om et internationalt orienteret samfund, der samtidigt var begyndt med en arbejdsdeling i fiskere, bønder, håndværkere, købmænd og stormænd - en arbejdsdeling, der kendetegner det efterfølgende middelalderlige danske kongerige med Roskilde som et vigtigt verdsligt og gejstligt centrum".
English: The five ships are evidence of an internationally oriented society that had begun to be divided into fishermen, farmers, craftsmen, merchants and landowners or nobility - a division that characterises the late Danish Medieval kingdom with Roskilde as an important secular and ecclesiastical centre.

Danish: De fem skibe giver vidnesbyrd om et internationalt orienteret samfund, der samtidigt var begyndt med en arbejdsdeling i fiskere, bønder, håndværkere, købmænd og stormænd - en arbejdsdeling, der kendetegner det efterfølgende middelalderlige danske kongerige med Roskilde som et vigtigt verdsligt og gejstligt centrum".
English: The five ships are evidence of an internationally oriented society that had begun to be divided into fishermen, farmers, craftsmen, merchants and landowners or nobility – a division that characterises the late Danish Medieval kingdom with Roskilde as an important secular and ecclesiastical centre.

Danish: De fem vikingeskibe er datereret til vikingetidens sene del, omkring år 1040.
English: The five ships date to the late Viking Age, around the year 1040.

Danish: De fem skibe fra Skuldelev var et enestående og uvurderligt arkæologisk fund, fordi de omfattede de primære farttøjstyper som kendetegnede vikingetidens søfart: Et stort havgående lastskib, to krigsskibe og to mindre skibe, brugt til kystnær transport, handel og fiskeri.
English: The five Skuldelev ships were a unique and invaluable archaeological find as they represented each of the main vessel types that typified Viking Age seafaring: a large ocean going trading vessel, two warships and two smaller coastal transport/fishing vessels.

Danish: De fem Skuldelevskibe er bygget og brugt af mennesker, der har efterladt sig utallige spor i skibene: Formen vidner om funktionen, hvilke farvande de var bygget til at besejle og hvilke ønsker bådebyggeren havde til sejlegenskaberne.
English: The five Skuldelev ships were built and used by people who left innumerable traces in the vessels: The forms of the ships reveal their function, the waters they were built to sail, and the boatbuilders' wishes for sailing capabilities.

Danish: De fem Skuldelevskibe, hvis udgravning blev startskuddet til et videnskabeligt pionerarbejde på internationalt plan, er alle blevet analyseret, rekonstrueret til funktionelle fartøjer og testet behørigt.
English: The five Skuldelev ships, the excavation of which provided the starting signal for pioneering scientific research at an international level, have all been analysed, reconstructed as functional vessels and tested thoroughly.

Danish: De fem vikingeskibe, der blev udgravet ud for Skuldelev i Roskilde fjord i 1962, har naturligvis været og er stadig centralt placeret i Vikingeskibsmuseets forskningsvirksomhed.
English: The five Viking Age ships excavated off Skuldelev in Roskilde Fjord in 1962 have naturally been, and continue to be, at the centre of the Viking Ship Museum's research activities.

Danish: De fem vikingeskibe, der blev udgravet ud for Skuldelev i Roskilde fjord i 1962, har naturligvis været og er stadig centralt placeret i Vikingeskibsmuseets forskningsvirksomhed.
English: The five Viking Age ships excavated off Skuldelev in Roskilde Fjord in 1962 have naturally been, and continue to be, at the centre of the Viking Ship Museum’s research activities.

Danish: De fem vikingeskibe
English: The five Viking ships

Danish: De fem vikingeskibe er datereret til vikingetidens sene del, omkring år 1040.
English: The five Viking ships are dated to the last half of the Viking Age, ca. 1040.

Danish: De fem vikingeskibe er datereret til vikingetidens sene del, omkring år 1040.
English: The five Viking ships are dated to the later part of the Viking Age, ca 1040.

Danish: Fjordens brænding rullede op på den store græsplæne, der omgiver Vikingeskibshallen.
English: The fjord water rolled up on the large lawn that surrounds the Viking Ship Museum.

Danish: Hørren er nu klar til spinding
English: The flax is now ready to be spun

Danish: Planterne lægges i vand i 1-2 uger eller på en eng i 4-8 uger (rødnes) for at løsne fibrene fra resten af stænglerne.
