English: The original boat, which was deliberately broken up and placed within the powerful man's burial mound, has been meticulously reconstructed by the boatbuilders at the Viking Ship Museum and demonstrates the Vikings' understanding of the importance of choosing the correct timbers and how to exploit the natural shape of the trees.

Danish: Jollen var af og bliver bygget i eg.
English: The original dinghy was made of oak, and so is the new version.

Danish: Den originale Fejø-pram som er brugt som forlæg til byggeriet af de to udlejningsbåde
English: The original Fejø-pram, which is used as a template for the construction of two rental boats

Danish: Det originale fund
English: The original find

Danish: Originalen der er prydet med…
English: The original is decorated with…

Danish: Det oprindelige eller det reparerede?
English: The original or the repaired?

Danish: Det originale Osebergskib er dateret tilbage til år 820 og blev i 1904 fundet i en grav ved Tønsberg i Norge.
English: The original Oseberg Ship dates from 820 AD and was found in 1904 in a burial mound at Tønsberg, Norway.

Danish: De oprindelige padler har formentlig givet lidt ringere sprintfart, men lettere langtursroning.
English: The original paddles would probably have given a slightly lower sprint speed but would have eased paddling on longer voyages.

Danish: Den oprindelige rapport fastslår:
English: The original report states:

Danish: Det originale skib - Skuldelev 2 - står udstillet i Vikingeskibshallen sammen med de fire andre skibe, der i 1962 blev udgravet ud for Skuldelev i Roskilde Fjord.
English: The original ship - Skuldelev 2 - stands on display at the Viking Ship Hall together with four other ships, which were excavated near Skuldelev on Roskilde Fjord in 1962.

Danish: Det originale skib - Skuldelev 2 - står udstillet i Vikingeskibshallen sammen med de fire andre skibe, der i 1962 blev udgravet ud for Skuldelev i Roskilde Fjord.
English: The original ship - Skuldelev 2 - stands on display in the Viking Ship Hall together with four other ships, which were excavated from Roskilde Fjord in 1962.

Danish: Originalskibet er bygget i Sognefjorden, Vestnorge, omkring år 1030, mens Ottar er bygget på Vikingeskibsmuseet i 1999-2000.
English: The original ship was built in Sognefjord, Western Norway, around the year 1030, while Ottar was built at the Viking Ship Museum in Roskilde in 1999-2000.

Danish: Det oprindelige skib var det mest velbevarede skib i Skuldelevfundet.
English: The original ship was the best preserved vessel among those found at Skuldelev.

Danish: Det originale skib har været brugt til købmandsfart og fragtsejlads I indre danske farvande og den sydlige 0stersø.
English: The original ship was used for commerce and freight carrying in Danish coastal waters and the southern part of the Baltic.

Danish: De originale skibe kan ses i Vikingeskibshallen.
English: The original ships can be seen in the Viking Ship Hall.

Danish: Slusegårdbåden er oprindelig bygget i egetræ og vi havde købt en 154 år gammel egekævle, med forbavsende lidt splint.
English: The original Slusegård boat was made of oak and we bought a 154 year old oak log - with an astonishing lack of sapwood.

Danish: Den originale jolle blev bygget i Assens i 1907 af fyr på eg, til fiskeri efter ål og torsk samt undertiden marsvin i det sydlige Lillebælt.
English: The original smack was built of pine on oak in Assens in 1907 for fishing eels, cod and occasionally porpoises in the southern part of the Lillebælt.

Danish: De originale vikingeskibe præsenteres smukt med Roskilde Fjord og de imponerende rekonstruktioner som bagtæppe.
English: The original Viking ships presents itself beautifully at Roskilde Fjord and the impressive reconstructions as a backdrop.

Danish: Osebergskibet, som blev udgravet i 1904, rummer et af de største fund af genstande fra vikingetiden og skibet, som er fra 820 er det hidtil ældste vikingeskibsfund i verden.
English: The Oseberg ship, which was excavated in 1904, contained one of the largest finds of objects from the Viking Age and the ship, which is from 820, is the oldest Viking ship find in the world.

Danish: Den anden indeholder køkkenudstyr; pander, gryder, skærebræt og knive samt krydderier og olie.
English: The other box contains kitchen utensils such as pots and pans, a chopping board and knives as well as spices and oil.

Danish: Den anden åledrivkvase, der ligger i museumshavnen, hedder Dan.
English: The other eel drifter which can be seen in the Museum harbour is called Dan.

Danish: Den anden skrogform som optræder, ser vi kun i et enkelt tilfælde sammen med skjolde, og det er desværre kun delvist bevaret.
English: The other hull-form that occurs is only seen once together with shields and there it is only partially preserved.

Danish: De øvrige store stævne er alle høje og slanke, men plant afsluttede, og bærer for fleres vedkommende såkaldte stævnfløje, som er dekorative og ofte forgyldte plader med form som en fane, der blev monteret på stævnspidsen.
English: The other large stems are all tall and slender but flat at the top and several of them bear so-called weather-vanes, which are decorative and often gilded plates in the form of a standard that were fastened on the tip of the stem.

Danish: Også stenens andre sider er dækket med ristninger
English: The other sides of the stone are also covered with carvings

Danish: Den anden type kaldes geostationære satellitter og kredser i 36.000 kilometers højde og står over samme punkt på jorden.
English: The other type is the geostationary satellite, at 36,000 kilometres it stays in orbit over the same spot on earth.

Danish: De øvrige skal kunne manøvrere med sejlet og hvad der ellers er nødvendigt, dog ikke mere end at natsejlads med sovning altid foregår på samme halse.
English: The others have to be ready to manoeuvre with the sail and do the other things necessary, although not more than that sailing by night will always take place on the same tack.

Danish: Ottemanafaren kan både føre et råsejl eller den traditionelle færøske rig: et lugger sejl forrest og et mesansejl, sprydstagssejl agter.
English: The Ottemanafar can be rigged with either a square sail or the traditional Faeroese rig: A lugsail in front and a mizzen sail, spritsail aft.

Danish: Det midterste af stammen - også kaldt marven - er for uroligt vokset, og har en tendens til at flække, så den må også hugges bort.
English: The outer sapwood - wich is lighter in colour - rots too quickly and cannot be used, and the centre of the trunk (pith) grows irregularly, so that must also be cut away.

Danish: Stævnens ydre kanter og de karakteristisk 'trappetrin' er hugget ud.
English: The outer shape of the stem was chopped out and the characteristic 'steps' cut into the backside.

Danish: Stævnens ydre kanter og de karakteristisk ’trappetrin’ er hugget ud.
English: The outer shape of the stem was chopped out and the characteristic 'steps' cut into the backside.

Danish: Skibets linjer kan males op for at gøre dem tydeligere.
English: The outline of the ship can be painted in to make them clearer.

Danish: Ydersiden af det udstillede skib fremstår jævnt og sammenhængende og viser ingen tegn på uregelmæssigheder.
English: The outside of the ship as exhibited appears smooth and coherent and shows no visible signs of irregularities.

Danish: Ydersiden blev dokumenteret ved hjælp af en fotoscanner, som scannede 10 pkt/mm2 med minimum 0, 5 mm nøjagtighed.
English: The outside was documented with a photo scanner, which scanned at a rate of 10 points/mm2 and with minimum 0.5 mm accuracy.

Danish: Skibsejernes velstand og samfundsmæssige status har formodentlig svaret til deres skibes imponerende størrelse.
English: The owners of these large cargo ships must have been as outstanding in wealth and social rank as their ships were outstanding in size.

Danish: Bøger, Generel Historie og arkæologi
English: The Oxford illustrated history of the Vikings

Danish: Vikinger i vest Vikingetiden i Vestjylland Vikinger i vest handler om vikingetiden i Vestjylland - nærmere bestemt det tidligere Ringkøbing Amt. Bogen er skrevet…
English: The Oxford illustrated History of the Vikings Were the Vikings, as contemporary description had it, “a valiant, wrathful, foreign, purely pagan people who swept in…

Danish: Padlerne er vigtige funktionelle dele af Hjortspringbådens udstyr, og de er analyseret i arkæologisk og etnografisk sammenhæng af Nadia Haupt, mens Niels Peter Fenger har analyseret forholdene omkring den kraftoverføring fra mand til båd, som foregår under sejladsen.
English: The paddles, as an important functional part of the equipment of the Hjortspring boat, have been analysed in their archaeological and ethnographical context by Haupt as well as technically by Fenger.

Danish: Spænderne blev fundet i 1845 i forbindelse med etableringen af Limerick-Tipperary jernbanen.
English: The pair were discovered in 1845 during the construction of the Limerick-Tipperary railway line.

Danish: Skarpt der skødes, freden brødes.
English: The past tense is commonly used when writing stories.

Danish: Stierne blev til floder og dansegulvet rev sig løs fra underlaget.
English: The paths were to rivers and dance floor broke free from the ground.

Danish: Gasten har det lidt bedre, men er dog generet af tandsmerter og feber.
English: The patient is feeling better, but still has toothache and fever.

Danish: Smerterne er nu væk og betændelsen har fortaget sig og patienten har det godt igen.
English: The patient is feeling well again; the pain has gone and the inflammation has passed.

Danish: Freden i England var forbi.
English: The peace in England was over.

Danish: Folkene bag Carsten Brebøl-fonden blev ramt i solar plexus, da de læste om Havhingstens historiske togt fra Roskilde til Dublin i sommeren 2007.
English: The people behind the Carsten Brebøl-foundation ware hit in the gut, when they read about the historic expedition of the Sea Stallion from Roskilde to Dublin in the summer of 2007.

Danish: I sådanne både roede befolkningen fra de spredte gårde og bygder til kirke om søndagen.
English: The people who lived in the scattered villages and farms along the lake rowed boats like Brudpiga to church on Sundays.

Danish: Tilladelse til brug af billedet gives alene til det aftalte formål (som beskrevet på fakturaen).
English: The permission to use the image is strictly limited to the agreed purpose (as described on the invoice).

Danish: Men det fænomen at "genopføre" disse fartøjer, er dog ingenlunde en ny ting.
English: The phenomenon of "re-building" these vessels is, however, by no means new.

Danish: Billedserien viser Kraka Fyr da den blev sejlet af ni personer og med et deplacement på næsten 4,5 tons.
English: The photo series shows Kraka Fyr when it was sailed with nine crew members and a deplacement on nearly 4.5 tons.

Danish: Fotografen er Werner Karrasch, Vikingeskibsmuseet
English: The photographer is Werner Karrasch, the Viking Ship Museum

Danish: Fotografierne afslører ikke altid komplette historier.
English: The photographs do not always reveal complete stories.

Danish: Billederne er fra 30. oktober 2010 og fotografen er Werner Karrasch.
English: The photos are from the 30 October 2010 and the photographer is Werner Karrasch.

Danish: Billederne er fra efterårsferien 16. til 22. oktober 2010.
English: The photos are from the autumn holiday 16 to 22 October 2010.

Danish: Fotografierne suppleres af film og lydinstallationer samt dele fra fundet, som ikke tidligere har været udstillet.
English: The photos are supplemented with film and sound, as well as ship parts that have never been exhibited before.

Danish: Billederne er taget af fotograf Werner Karrasch.
English: The photos are taken by Werner Karrasch.

Danish: Billederne er taget af:
English: The photos were taken by:

Danish: Billederne er taget fra følgefartøjet Cable One af Vikingeskibsmuseet tekniske chef Morten Nielsen, der følger Havhingsten under hele den 7 uger lange rejse.
English: The photos were taken from the support vessel "Cable One" by the Viking ship Museum's tecnical Manager, Morten Nielsen, who is going to be on board the the support vessel during the 7 week long voyage.

Danish: De fysiske betingelser; landbrug og bevaringsforhold
English: The physical conditions, agriculture and preservation circumstances

Danish: Tæppet viser blandt andet en skibsbygnings-scene, hvor en mand hugger skibsplanker til med en bred økse, kaldet en bredbil.
English: The picture shows a shipbuilding scene in which a man is dressing planks with a broad axe called a bredbil.

Danish: På billedet ses kong Christian X i den isbåd, der blev bygget til ham.
English: The picture shows King Christian X in the ice boat that was constructed for him.

Danish: De gotlandske billedsten er en gruppe tekstløse gravmonumenter, rejst i germansk jernalder og i vikingetid, som hyppigt viser skibsbilleder.
English: The picture stones from Gotland are a group of textless grave monuments raised in the Germanic Iron Age and in the Viking Age that frequently show pictures of ships.

Danish: Billederne er ikke naturalistiske, som billeder ofte er i dag, og skaberens symbolik fremstår måske ikke tydeligt for os, hvis vi ikke i forvejen besidder en større viden om vikingetidens billedstil, tendenser og kunstneriske skoler.
English: The pictures are not naturalistic, as they often are today, and the artist's symbolism may not be clear to us unless we already possess considerable knowledge of the pictorial style, trends and artistic schools of the Viking age.

Danish: Billederne er ikke naturalistiske, som billeder ofte er i dag, og skaberens symbolik fremstår måske ikke tydeligt for os, hvis vi ikke i forvejen besidder en større viden om vikingetidens billedstil, tendenser og kunstneriske skoler.
English: The pictures are not naturalistic, as they often are today, and the artist’s symbolism may not be clear to us unless we already possess considerable knowledge of the pictorial style, trends and artistic schools of the Viking age.

Danish: Billederne er at læse fra venstre.
English: The pictures are numbered from the left.

Danish: Billederne er taget af musumsinspektør Lonnie Hansen, der står bag udviklingen af Ny Nordisk Vikingemad.
English: The pictures are taken by curator Lonnie Hansen, who is behind the development of New Nordic Viking.

Danish: Billederne vidner om svundne tider, fremmede kulturer, og mægtige statussymboler.
English: The pictures testify to times past, foreign cultures and mighty status symbols.

Danish: Billederne er optaget af Vikingeskibsmuseets fotograf, Werner Karrasch, der er med på togtet.
English: The pictures were taken by the Viking Ship Museum's photographer, Werner Karrasch, participating on the voyage.

Danish: Det hjælper på forståelsen af stykket, efterhånden som det bliver hugget færdigt.
English: The piece is easier to understand after it has been completed.

Danish: Ravstykket er eksempel på et populært ferieminde fra Danmark.
English: The piece of amber is an example of a popular holiday souvenir from Denmark.

Danish: Vragstumperne er så skrøbelige, at en transport fra Roskilde til Irland sandsynligvis ville gøre en ende på de jordiske rester af det engang så stolte skib.
English: The pieces of the wreck are so delicate that they would not survive a transport from Roskilde to Ireland.

Danish: De opfiskede vragdele er dokumenteret i 3-D, og vraget hvorfra de stammer er eftersøgt ved hjælp af side scan sonar og dykkerbesigtigelse.
English: The pieces of wreckage that were fished up are documented in 3D and the wreck that they come from has been investigated using side-scan sonar and diver observations.

Danish: Forundersøgelserne kan afsløre meget vigtige fund.
English: The pilot studies can reveal very important finds.

Danish: Vores fyrretræet var 55 cm i diameter, i brysthøjde.
English: The pine tree was 55cm in diameter, at chest height.

Danish: Ved Sandhage krydser ledningstraceet et område, hvor der i umiddelbar nærhed har ligget en boplads.
English: The pipeline crosses an area at Sandhage where there has been a settlement in the immediate vicinity.

Danish: Fakta: Stednavnet Sløjkanalen eller Sløjen kommer fra ordet "Slod", som betyder færdselsåre; et sted hvor man slæber noget
English: The place name itself, Sløjkanalen or Sløjen, is thought to originate from the word "Slod", which means something along the lines of a thoroughfare - a place where something is hauled or dragged.

Danish: Hvor bygningen skal placeres, dens fysiske udformning, størrelse og ikke mindst finansieringen af den, er stadig helt nye og jomfruelige udfordringer, som museet nu tager fat på.
English: The placing of the building, its physical design, its size and not least its funding are still completely new and unexplored challenges that the museum is now tackling.

Danish: Bordet formes og holdes fast med bordklemmer og bordvridere.
English: The plank is fashioned and secured with plank clamps and fork-shaped clamps.

Danish: Bordet håndhøvles for at fjerne kutterslagene fra tykkelseshøvlen.
English: The plank is planed by hand to remove the marks from the thickness planer.

Danish: Planken bliver opvarmet med vanddampe, så limstofferne i træet bliver opløst, og træet kan bøjes.
English: The plank is warmed up with steam, so that the wood can be bent into shape.

Danish: Bordet skal være tilpasset og opsat i den endelige facon, inden det nittes på.
English: The plank must be adjusted and set up in its final form, before it is riveted in place.

Danish: Dette gav en uhensigtsmæssig lav friktion i samlingerne, hvorfor man senere gik over til udvendigt at bruge en harpiks-tælle blanding.
English: The plank overlaps were caulked with a woollen thread dipped in a mixture of tallow and linseed oil.

Danish: God tur det sidste stræk til Slesvig i dag.
English: The planks are cut to the right length using a very sharp axe.

Danish: Plankerne er sammenføjet indbyrdes og med kølen ved hjælp af klinknagler med rundt skafttværsnit og firkantede klinkplader og med spanterne ved hjælp af trænagler.
English: The planks are fastened to each other and the keel with the use of rivets with round shanks and square-shaped roves, while the frames are fastened using treenails.

Danish: Bordplankerne bliver stødt sammen.
English: The planks are joined together.

Danish: Plankerne er store og tunge i forhold til den meget bløde bunddel, så de skal sættes på samtidigt i begge sider, hvis det skal undgås at båden bliver skæv.
English: The planks are large and heavy in relation to the very soft bottom of the boat, so they must be attached on both sides at the same time in order to prevent the boat becoming uneven.

Danish: Bordplankerne er fremstillet af egetæ.
English: The planks are made from oak.

Danish: Plankerne er i et stykke i hele bådens længde, og det gør det også meget arbejdskrævende at tilpasse dem.
English: The planks are made of a single piece all along the boat's length, and that makes them much more time consuming to adjust.

Danish: Bordmaterialet er eg.
English: The planks are made of oak.

Danish: Plankerne er høvlet i hånden for at undgå spor efter maskiner og nutidig teknologi.
English: The planks are planed by hand to avoid traces of machines and modern technology.

Danish: Plankerne nittes på med jernnagler.
English: The planks are riveted using iron nails.

Danish: Til sidst bliver bordplankerne hugget til med en bredbil, der i kraft af sin lange æg udjævner overfladen på bordplanken.
English: The planks are then smoothed using a broad-bladed axe, the long edge of which serves to even out the surface of the planks.

Danish: Plankerne på kvasen er 22 mm, og med vores effektive svedekiste kan bordplankerne imidlertid nøjes med knapt en halv time.
English: The planks on the drifter are 22mm thick, and with our effective steam chest, the planks were pliable after just half an hour.

Danish: Det betyder at Trolles stævne bliver mere udfaldende, da bådene jo skal have samme længde overalt.
English: The planks second to the keel, the "flábord", are angled more horizontally from the keel on Trolle than on Blakman.

Danish: Tætningen mellem bordplankerne udgøres af en tjæret, tre-slået uldtråd magen til den der blev fundet mellem plankerne på det originale skib.
English: The planks were caulked using tarred, three-stranded wool thread the same as that found between the planks of the original ship.

Danish: Plankerne er lavet af spejlkløvet egetræ og er for nogles vedkommende mere end 10 m lange.
English: The planks were made of radially-cloven oak wood and in some cases they were more than 10 m long.

Danish: Plankerne er spejlkløvede og plankløvede, og spanterne er fremstillet af krumtræ.
English: The planks were radially cleaved and the frames were made of crooked timber.

Danish: Plankerne, kølen og spanterne indbyrdes, kan give lidt efter.
English: The planks, keel and frames are all a little flexible.

Danish: Hørplanten høstes med håndkraft, så roden ikke ødelægges
English: The plant stems are pulled by hand, so the end of the stem remains intact

Danish: Hørplanten høstes med håndkraft, så roden ikke ødelægges Hørren redes med en kam (knevles) for at fjerne frøkapslerne fra stråene
English: The plants are rippled (combed) to remove the seeds from the stems

Danish: Hørren redes med en kam (knevles) for at fjerne frøkapslerne fra stråene
English: The plants are rippled (combed) to remove the seeds from the stems

Danish: Den, der til sidst har alle kortene, har vundet.
English: The player with all the cards at the end of the game is the winner.

Danish: Når alle brikker er lagt på brættet, fortsætter man ved at “trække” (flytte brikker langs mønsterlinjerne).
English: The players take turns by moving one piece at a time from one line crossing to another.

Danish: Nu vendes alle spillere et kort ind på midten af bordet og den spiller med det højeste kort får de andres kort.
English: The players then each turn over a card in the middle of the table and the player with highest card takes all the other players' cards.

Danish: Nu vendes alle spillere et kort ind på midten af bordet og den spiller med det højeste kort får de andres kort.
English: The players then each turn over a card in the middle of the table and the player with highest card takes all the other players’ cards.

Danish: Grundene er 7-8 meter brede og 30-40 meter lange.
English: The plots are 7-8 m wide and 30-40 m long.

Danish: Grundene i Ribe er oprettet efter et fast mønster, som vi også ser i andre byer fra perioden 700-1100.
English: The plots in Ribe were laid out according to a fixed pattern, as is also seen in other towns dating from the period AD 700-1100.

Danish: De er aflange og har husene placeret med gavlen ud mod vej eller å, således at det har været nemt for den enkelte at komme til sin egen jordlod.
English: The plots were rectangular with the house gables facing the street or the river so as to give easy access.

Danish: Digtet handlede om den modige sagnkonge Rolf Krake og hans mænds mange kampe, og skulle give Olav den Helliges krigere mod inden slaget.
English: The poem was about the brave, legendary king Rolf Krake and his men's many battles, and it was intended to give courage to Olav's warriors before the battle.

Danish: Digtet ”Rigs vandring” handler om guden Heimdal, som i skikkelse af Rig besøger menneskene.
English: The poem “Rig's journey” concerns the god Heimdal who in the person of Rig visits the human world.

Danish: Flere bådbygningsscener viser økser, høvle og materialer og dermed bekræfter tapetet de arkæologiske fund af værktøj samt de værkstøjsspor der er bevaret på originalskibene
English: The pointed helmet is typically Nordic and is also depicted on the Gotlandic picture stones and on a small bone sculpture from Sigtuna in Sweden.

Danish: Spidsvåbnet fra udgravningen er desværre knækket og måler 18 cm, men har været 35-40 cm langt i sin oprindelige form.
English: The pointed weapon from the excavation is unfortunately broken, and measures just 18cm, but it could have been 35-40cm long in its original form.

Danish: Spidsvåbenet fra udgravningen er desværre knækket men den spidse del er i sig selv 18 cm. lang.
English: The pointed weapon from the excavation is unfortunately broken, but the pointed part alone is 18cm long.

Danish: Det politiske efterspil
English: The political aftermath

Danish: Marsvinsoliemalingen har imidlertid klart hæmmet angrebene i forhold til ubehandlede plader af fyrretræ.
English: The porpoise oil treatment had, however, clearly hindered the attacks relative to the untreated pine planks.

Danish: Marsvinsolien var “afkogt” af spæk fra et selvdødt marsvin formidlet gennem Zoologisk Museum.
English: The porpoise oil was “rendered” from blubber from a porpoise which died of natural causes, obtained via the Zoological Museum in Copenhagen.

Danish: Det er solens, månens og jordens indbyrdes placering, der afgør hvor højt vandet stiger og falder ved flod og ebbe og dermed påvirker styrken på strømmen.
English: The position of the Sun, Moon and Earth in relation to each other determines how high the water rises and falls with flow and ebb and that affects the strength of the currents.

Danish: Positionen for vraget har været alment kendt gennem en årrække og arkæologerne venter derfor, at det er delvist plyndret af sportsdykkere.
English: The position of the wreck has been widely known for a number of years and the archaeologists therefore expect that it has been partially looted by sports divers.

Danish: Skibets position, fart og kurs vil blive opdateret med korte mellemrum og vi vil hver dag lægge dagbøger om livet om bord ud på hjemmesiden.
English: The position, speed, and bearings of the ship will be updated at short intervals, and the webpage will be boosted with daily additions of parts of journals on the life onboard.

Danish: Karret er et af de fineste eksempler på keramisk formgivning og dekoration, som vi kender fra stenalderen i Danmark.
English: The pot is one of the finest examples of ceramic design and decoration known from Stone Age Denmark.

Danish: Karret trækkes væk fra ilden og stilles nær ilden i ½ til 1 time, hvorefter grøden er klar.
English: The pot is taken off the fire and placed near the heat for ½-1 hour, after which the porridge is ready.

Danish: Kartoflen kom først til Norden fra Sydamerika flere århundrede senere.
English: The potato only arrived in Scandinavia from South America several centuries later.

Danish: De forudsætninger, som førte mennesker sammen her, lå ikke i et opland omkring byen, men i lange togter over havet.
English: The preconditions that brought people together at these places did not lie in the hinterland surrounding the towns, but in long voyages over the sea.

Danish: Den dominerende teori i dag er, at det er blevet til i Kent i England på foranledning af biskop Odo, Vilhelm Erobrerens halvbror, i løbet af 1070'erne.
English: The predominant theory today is that it was made in Kent in England at the request of bishop Odo, the half-brother of William the Conqueror, in the course of the 1070s.

Danish: De foreløbige rekonstruktioner af Skuldelev-skibene blev publiceret i 1968, og også disse er efterfølgende blevet revideret i lyset af fornyede og mere dybtgående undersøgelser.
English: The preliminary reconstructions of the Skuldelev ships were published in 1968 and these, too, have subsequently been revised in the light of more recent and more detailed investigations.

Danish: Forundersøgelsen gav ikke anledning til, at Kulturarvsstyrelsen stillede krav om yderligere undersøgelser.
English: The preliminary study did not provide grounds for the Cultural Heritage Authority to request further studies.

Danish: Tilstedeværelsen af våben, redskaber og brocher blandt fundene tyder på, at både mænd og kvinder var begravet her.
English: The presence of weapons, tools and brooches among the finds indicate that both men and women were buried there.

Danish: Det følgende er baseret på hendes resultater.
English: The present account is based on her results.

Danish: Den nuværende æra af europæisk integration og modernisering byder på et hidtil ukendt potentiale for såvel bevaring som ødelæggelse af kulturelle levn.
English: The present era of European integration and modernisation offers unprecedented potential for both preservation as well as destruction of heritage.

Danish: Det betyder, at disse fartøjer ikke kun hørte til den største skriftligt definerede afgiftsklasse, men også giver oplysninger om denne klasses variationsbredde og størrelsesspektrum.
English: The present era of European integration and modernisation offers unprecedented potential for both preservation as well as destruction of heritage.

Danish: Den nuværende havbund kan kortlægges i stor detaljeringsgrad med et multibeam- eller flerstråleekkolod, der sender lydbølger ud i mange retninger på samme tid.
English: The present seabed topography can be mapped in great detail using a multibeam echosounder emitting acoustic pulses in many directions simultaneously.

Danish: Bevaringsforholdene betyder, f.eks. at vi finder organisk materiale fra stenalderen, som for længst er forsvundet på landjorden.
English: The preservation conditions mean, for example, that we find Stone Age organic material that disappeared from the land surface long ago.

Danish: Jordens bevaringsforhold (surt eller basisk miljø) er ligeså bestemmende for fundsbilledet.
English: The preservation conditions of the soil (acid or alkaline environment) also determine the overall picture of an artefact.

Danish: Den bevarede del in situ af vraget bestod af dele af agterstævn, bordplanker og bundstokke, alt i eg.
English: The preserved part in situ of the wreck consisted of parts of the stern, strakes and floor timbers, all in oak.

Danish: De fremherskende vinde i sommermånederne er fra vestlig retning, styret af fronter, der kommer ind fra Nordatlanten.
English: The prevailing winds during the summer months are from the west, driven by fronts coming in from the North Atlantic.

Danish: Prisen har været at der skulle smedes og monteres et meget større antal nagler.sammenlignet med andre store langskibe
English: The price for this was that a greater number of rivets had to be made and fitted.

Danish: Det koster DKK 300,- pr. person, og sejladsen varer 3 timer.
English: The price is DKK 300 per person and the voyage will last 3 hours.

Danish: Prisen er DKK 450,- pr. deltager og billetter kan bestilles i museets booking, hverdage 10.00 til 15.00 på telefon +45 46 300 253 eller på email: booking(at)vikingeskibsmuseet.dk.
English: The price is DKK 450 per participant and tickets can be booked through the museum’s booking office on weekdays, 10:00 to 15:00 by telephone +45 46 300 253 or by e-mail: booking(at)vikingeskibsmuseet.dk.

Danish: Prisen pr. deltager er 675 kr.
English: The price per participant is DKK 675.

Danish: Priserne på bådene variere meget.
English: The prices of the boats vary a good deal.

Danish: Følgeskibets primære opgave er at være rednings- og standby skib for Havhingsten i tilfælde af ulykke eller havari.
English: The primary job of the support vessel is to be a rescue and stand-by ship for the Sea Stallion in the event of accident or shipwreck.

Danish: Premierministeren kommenterede på, at traditionelt tømmerarbejde stadig udføres på stort set samme måde i Bhutan.
English: The prime minister commented that the traditional timber work is still performed in much the same way in Bhutan.

Danish: Specielt tiltrak den svenske kirkebåd Brudpiga, fra 1944 premierministerens opmærksomhed.
English: The prime minister's attention was especially drawn by the Swedish ex-voto model ship from 1944, Brudpiga.

Danish: Problemet er ikke det at skulle pumpe, men den stadige afkøling af folk, som ydermere ikke kan finde et sted at hvile.
English: The problem is not the pumping but the continual chilling of people who furthermore can find nowhere to rest.

Danish: Problemet er, at solens højde (delkinationen) ændrer sig over året.
English: The problem is that the height of the sun (declination) changes through the year.

Danish: De aflaster de konserverede planker og markerer skibenes oprindelige linier udenfor de områder, hvor der er bevarede originale dele.
English: The problems involved with the care of the ships in the museum, and their long-term preservation are also discussed in relation to the experience gained this far.

Danish: Processerne kan deles op:
English: The process can be divided as follows:

Danish: Processen involverer mange eksperter, blandt andre arkæologer, håndværkere og skibsrekonstruktører.
English: The process involves many experts, including archaeologists, boatbuilders, craftsmen and ship-reconstructors.

Danish: Processen kaldes eksperimentalarkæologi.
English: The process is called experimental archaeology.

Danish: Producenterne er Anne-Christine Larsen, Vikingeskibsmuseet og Benny Jakobsen, Lydia.
English: The producers are Anne-Christine Larsen from the Viking Ship Museum and Benny Jakobsen from Lydia.

Danish: Fremstilling og forbrug af reb til de sejlende rekonstruktioner af arkæologisk skibsfund, er en meget vigtig del af museets eksperimental arkæologisk forskning.
English: The production and use of rope for sailing reconstructions of archaeological ship finds is an important part of the Museum's experimental archaeological research.

Danish: Fremstilling og forbrug af reb til de sejlende rekonstruktioner af arkæologisk skibsfund, er en meget vigtig del af museets eksperimental arkæologisk forskning.
English: The production and use of rope for sailing reconstructions of archaeological ship finds is an important part of the Museum’s experimental archaeological research.

Danish: Fremstillingen af tovværk blev ændredet markant i middelalderen, da hampen erstattede træbasten som det foretrukne materiale.
English: The production of rope changed drastically in the course of the Middle Ages when hemp fibre replaced wood bast as the preferred material.

Danish: Projektet startede i foråret 2015 med byggeriet af Gislingebåden – en 7,7 meter lang brugsbåd fra ca. 1130 – der blev rekonstrueret på museets bådeværft, og hele processen blev delt online i 'real time', via en dedikeret hjemmeside og de sociale medier.
English: The project began in the spring of 2015: the Gislinge Boat – a 7.7m working boat dating from ca. 1130 – was reconstructed at the Museum boatyard and the entire process was shared online in real time, via a dedicated website and social media platforms.

Danish: Projektet har mødt meget god vilje, men har primært måttet basere sig på private fonde.
English: The project has been met with a lot of good will, but has had to base itself mainly on private foundations.

Danish: Projektet er blevet til med støtte fra Samsø Kommune, Samsø Fonden, lokale producenter på Samsø og F.O.O.D.
English: The project has been supported by Samsø Municipality, the Samsø Foundation, local producers on Samsø and F.O.O.D.

Danish: Projektet har netop afsluttet en evaluering blandt besætningen, som på alle fronter bakker op om projektet og Vikingeskibsmuseet er nu i fuld gang med at planlægge næste års sejlads.
English: The project has just completed an evaluation among the crew, who fully back the project, and the Viking Ship Museum is now hard at work planning next year's trip.

Danish: Projektet har netop afsluttet en evaluering blandt besætningen, som på alle fronter bakker op om projektet og Vikingeskibsmuseet er nu i fuld gang med at planlægge næste års sejlads.
English: The project has just completed an evaluation among the crew, who fully back the project, and the Viking Ship Museum is now hard at work planning next year’s trip.

Danish: Projektet går ind i slutspurten
English: The project hit the final spurt

Danish: Følg projektet i billeder - tag et kig i Gislinge-galleriet!
English: The project in pictures - take a look at the Gislinge-gallery!

Danish: Projektet forsøger samtidig at belyse en række kulturhistoriske spørgsmål vedrørende sammenhængen mellem langskibene og datidens samfund.
English: The project is also attempting to shed light on a series of cultural-historical questions concerning the relationship between the Viking longships and contemporary society.

Danish: Projektet er kommet i stand med en offentlig bevilling på cirka 450.000 kroner.
English: The project is arranged because of a public grant at approximately 450.000 dkr.

Danish: Kraks Fond støtter byggeprojektet.
English: The project is supported by Kraks Fonden.

Danish: Projektet er finansieret af:
English: The project is supported by:

Danish: Projektet søger stadig penge.
English: The project still needs donations.

Danish: Projektet omkring Havhingsten har som mål at formidle selve skibet, rejsen og den forskning, der foregår undervejs, mens det sker.
English: The project surrounding the Sea Stallion has the objective of communicating the ship, the voyage, and the research taking place while travelling, as it happens.

Danish: Projektet med Havhingsten har givet museet et løft på alle områder.
English: The project with the Sea Stallion has given the museum a boost in all areas.

Danish: Projekt 'Fuldblod på Havet' er helt i fondens ånd.
English: The project “Thoroughbred of the Sea” is fully in the spirit of the foundation.

Danish: Projektet som museet kalder 'Fuldblod på Havet' har indtil nu kostet adskillige millioner og for et museum som i forvejen er hårdt trængt økonomisk, er en donation på i alt 4 millioner en enorm støtte," fortæller Vikingeskibsmuseets direktør Tinna Damgård-Sørensen.
English: The project, which the Museum calls “Thoroughbred of the Sea”, has already cost several million, so a donation totalling 4 million is an enormous help for a museum already under economic pressure, explains the Viking Ship Museum's Director Tinna Damgård-Sørensen.

Danish: Projektet som museet kalder 'Fuldblod på Havet' har indtil nu kostet adskillige millioner og for et museum som i forvejen er hårdt trængt økonomisk, er en donation på i alt 4 millioner en enorm støtte," fortæller Vikingeskibsmuseets direktør Tinna Damgård-Sørensen.
English: The project, which the Museum calls “Thoroughbred of the Sea”, has already cost several million, so a donation totalling 4 million is an enormous help for a museum already under economic pressure, explains the Viking Ship Museum’s Director Tinna Damgård-Sørensen.

Danish: Projektet kom i stand på initiativ fra den danske ambassade, der i samarbejde med Museum für Vor und Frühgeschichte ønskede formidling af Roskilde, Vikingeskibe og Vikingeskibsmuseet - som en ekstra dimension til den store vandreudstilling Die Wikinger, der tidligere har været vist i London og København.
English: The projects came about as a result of a collaboration between the Danish Embassy in Berlin and the Museum für Vor und Frühgeschichte, who wished to include the story of Roskilde, Viking Ships and the Viking Ship Museum as an extra dimension of the large Die Wikinger exhibition, which had previously been on show in Copenhagen and London.

Danish: De projekter som bliver udført på museets bådeværft, repræsenterer derfor en levende, nordisk håndværkstradition, som har sin rødder i fortiden, men som holdes i liv af den nutidig generation af håndværkere.
English: The projects carried out at the Museum boatyard therefore represent a living, Nordic craft tradition, which has its roots in the past but which is kept alive by the current generation of crafts men and women.

Danish: Armbånd i sort rensdyrskind med magnetlås i mat titanium.
English: The prow of a Trading Vessel from the Viking Age.

Danish: Broche fundet på en kirkegård i Pitney, Somerset, England.
English: The prow of a trading vessel from the Viking Age.

Danish: Pubben er stadig åben til en tørstig hals og sådan slutter vores vagt.
English: The pub is still open for a thirsty throat and that is how our watch closes.

Danish: The Puck Bay wrecks - an opportunity for a "Polish Skuldelev" af J. Litwin, i Shipshape.
English: The Puck Bay wrecks - an opportunity for a "Polish Skuldelev" by J. Litwin, in Shipshape.

Danish: Blokhuset og hjulene er fremstillet af birk, som er en meget slidstærk træsort.
English: The pulley house and the wheels are made of birch, which is a type of wood that is very resistant to wear.

Danish: Formålet med forsøgsrejsen er at teste rekonstruktionens sødygtighed i de barske farvande, det originale skib blev bygget til at besejle.
English: The purpose it to test the seaworthiness of the Sea Stallion in the rough waters where the original ship sailed a thousand years ago.

Danish: Anledningen til Havhingstens besøg i Berlin er at skabe opmærksomhed omkring åbningen af Vikingeudstilling 'Die Wikinger', der vises i udstillingsstedet Martin-Gropius-Bau i Berlin fra 10. september 2014 til 4. januar 2015.
English: The purpose of Sea Stallion's visit to Berlin is to raise awareness about the opening of the Viking exhibition 'Die Wikinger', which is on show at Martin-Gropius Bau in Berlin from the 10th September 2014 until 4th January 2015.

Danish: Formålet med rejsen er en videnskabelig dokumentation af vikingernes fænomenale sømandskab, som gjorde dem i stand til at bemægtige sig havene fra Nordamerika i vest til Sortehavet i øst.
English: The purpose of the voyage is scientific documentation of the superior seamanship of the Vikings, enabling them to seize control of the seas from the North American continent in the West to the Black Sea in the East.

Danish: Dronningen og Forbundspræsidenten modtages af Vikingeskibsmuseets direktør Tinna Damgård-Sørensen og Skipper Carsten Hvid.
English: The Queen and President will be received by Viking Ship Museum Director, Tinna Damgård-Sørensen and Skipper Carsten Hvid.

Danish: Dronningen og Forbundspræsidenten modtages af Vikingeskibsmuseets direktør Tinna Damgård-Sørensen og Skipper Carsten Hvid.
English: The Queen and the President will be received by the Viking Ship Museum's director, Tinna Damgård-Sørensen and Skipper Carsten Hvid.

Danish: Dronningen var 'gudmor' ved Havhingstens søsætning i 2004 og har siden sejlet med skibet flere gange, senest i 2012.
English: The Queen was 'godmother' to Sea Stallion when the ship was launched in 2004 and since then, has sailed with the ship several times, most recently in 2012.

Danish: Dronningen var 'gudmor' ved Havhingstens søsætning i 2004 og har siden sejlet med skibet flere gange, senest i 2012.
English: The Queen was 'godmother' when Sea Stallion was launched in 2004 and since then, has sailed with the ship several times, most recently in 2012.

Danish: Spørgsmålene vedrørende skibsgraven fra Ladby omfatter blandt andet gravens konstruktion, en mere præcis karakteristik af udvalgte dele af genstandsinventaret, lokaliseringen af den eller de gravlagte, gravens datering samt forstyrrelsens betydning og datering.
English: The queries concerning the ship-grave from Ladby concern e.g. the construction of the grave, the precise characteristics of certain parts of the artefacts found, the positioning of the body or bodies, the dating of the grave and the significance and date of the disturbance.

Danish: Spørgsmålet er, om Havhingsten kan stå tør på sin køl med sine 19 ton, inklusiv last og ballast, uden at det skader skibet?
English: The question is: Could the Sea Stallion stand dry on its keel with its 19 tons, including cargo and ballast, with being damaged?

Danish: De kan være af politisk eller begivenhedshistorisk karakter (hvem dræbte …), socialhistorisk (hvordan levede …), teknologihistorisk (hvordan sejlede …) eller noget helt fjerde.
English: The questions can stem from political history or historical particularism (who killed...), social history (how did ... live), technological history (how did ... sail) or something entirely different.

Danish: Du kan tage kappe og kofte på - eller særk og selekjole - og træde ind i rollen som handelsmanden på vej mod Middelhavets markeder eller høvdingen med kurs mod Englands kyster.
English: The quotes provide a link between Viking Age travel descriptions and the Museum guests' own experiences, while the images and illustrations represent a ‘pictorial language' that partly replaces the exhibition text.

Danish: Langs inderkanten kan spundingen antydes.
English: The rabbet can just be seen along the inner edge.

Danish: Spundningen er en fals eller en udhulning i stævnen.
English: The rabbet is a notch or channel in the stem.

Danish: Spundingen hugges først, når bordet skal på, så er det lettere at få den præcise vinkel.
English: The rabbet is first cut when the planks are to be set in place, so that it is easier to achieve the correct angle.

Danish: Spundningen, hvori kølbordet og bordenderne skal ligge i, er mærket op før køl og stævne rejses.
English: The rabbet, where the keel planks and plank ends will lie, is marked up before the keel, stem and stern are raised.

Danish: Øverste bords overkant var forstærket, men der var ingen spor af fæste for årer.
English: The rail, the upper edge of the top strake, had been reinforced but there was no trace of attachments for oars.

Danish: Den konstante regn og de kolde nætter på åbent hav betød, at enkelte gaster havde svært ved at få varmen.
English: The rain and the cold night at open sea made a lot of people really cold.

Danish: Regnbygerne stod konstant på lur, men gik udenom - vi fik kun vinden, der fulgte med.
English: The rain was constantly threatening but didn't get us, but the wind that followed did.

Danish: Under byggeriet måtte byggegruppen tage stilling til mange spørgsmål, hvoraf nogle løstes i samråd med Nationalmuseet, andre ud fra almindelig sund sans.
English: The raised deck in the stern was made of three planks, the small floor timbers were laid out as foot supports for the crew, and the first paddles were produced in a standard version.

Danish: Ranfjorden (Norway )
English: The Ran Fjord (Norway )

Danish: Sjældent fund vil give arkæologerne ny viden om det det nordiske skibs udvikling fra Vikingetidens lette og elegant…
English: The rare find will provide the archaeologists with new knowledge concerning the development of the Nordic ship, fro…

Danish: Hastigheden af dette henfald, halveringstiden, er kendt, og man kan derfor ved at tælle hvor mange atomer der henfalder over en periode finde ud af, hvor længe det er siden organismen døde.
English: The rate of this decay, the half-life, is known and so by counting how many atoms decay over a particular period, it is possible to work out how much time has elapsed since the organism died.

Danish: Den efterhånden ret store samling af træ til byggeprojektet ligger nu på værftspladsen, hvor vi begyndte at arbejde på kølen i midten maj. Målet er at blive klar til søsætning af båden i løbet af efteråret.
English: The rather large selection of wood is now located in the museum boatyard, where we began work on the keel in the middle of May, with the goal of finishing and launching the boat during the autumn.

Danish: ravnen fulgte mig, vikingerne trængte voldsomt frem
English: the raven followed me, the Vikings surged forward

Danish: Nye artillerisystemer blev indført og udviklet mod en standardisering af artilleriet.
English: The re-building was performed with the same building technique as the original building process.

Danish: Anledningen til de marinarkæologiske undersøgelser er byggeriet af den nye Storstrømsbro, en 4 km lang bro, der skal forbinde Sjælland og Falster via Masnedø, og som skal erstatte den gamle bro fra 1937.
English: The reason for the maritime archaeological investigations is the construction of the new Storstrøm bridge: a 4km long bridge that will connect Sjælland and Falster via Masnedø, and which will replace the old bridge from 1937.

Danish: Baggrunden herfor kan være at skibet er bygget til et farvand, Det irske Hav, der stiller store krav til skrogets fleksibilitet.
English: The reason for this could be that the ship was built for the Irish Sea, waters which make great demands on the flexibility of the hull.

Danish: Anledningen til dette skibs rejse til Roskilde i Danmark kan have været efterspillet efter Vilhelm Erobrerens invasion af England i 1066.
English: The reason for this ship's journey to Roskilde in Denmark may be related to the events following William the Conqueror's invasion of England in 1066.

Danish: Grunden til at træet skal have så stor en diameter, til en så forholdsvis lille båd er, at denne lille båd er bygget af meget brede bordplanker.
English: The reason the tree must have such a large diameter for such a relatively small boat is that this little boat is built with very wide strakes.

Danish: Baggrunden for de mange skibsgraffiti i stavkirkerne er ukendt, men det antages at de fleste af dem blev lavet af de håndværkere, der byggede kirkerne.
English: The reason why there are so many ship-graffiti on the stave churches is unknown but it is assumed that most of them were the work of the craftsmen who built the churches.

Danish: Oprøret var ledet af Harolds egen bror Tostig, der var jarl i området, og kampene endte med at Harold opfordrede kongen til at landsforvise Tostig.
English: The rebels were led by Harold's own brother Tostig, who was earl in that area, and the battles ended with Harold encouraging the king to banish Tostig from the country.

Danish: Langskibet blev søsat i 2004.
English: The reconstructed longship was launched in 2004.

Danish: Det genskabte skib - fra vrag til virkelighed 2002 - 2004
English: The reconstructed ship 2002 - 2004

Danish: De genskabte skibe
English: The reconstructed ships

Danish: Rekonstruktion og afprøvning i fuld skala indgår derfor ideelt som et element i den samlede analyse af et skibsfund.
English: The reconstruction and testing in full scale is therefore ideally included as an element in the overall analysis of a ship find.

Danish: Rekonstruktion og afprøvning i fuld størrelse indgår derfor som et element i den samlede analyse af såvel arkæologiske, historiske, etnologiske som ikonografiske kilder til det undersøgte skibsfund.
English: The reconstruction and testing in full scale is therefore ideally included as an element in the overall analysis of archaeological, historical, ethnographic and iconographic evidence related to the specific ship find.

Danish: Rekonstruktion og afprøvning i fuld størrelse indgår derfor som et vigtigt element i den samlede analyse af såvel arkæologiske, historiske, etnologiske som ikonografiske kilder til det undersøgte skibsfund.
English: The reconstruction and testing in full scale is therefore ideally included as an element in the overall analysis of archaeological, historical, ethnographic and iconographic evidence related to the specific ship find.

Danish: Hvis helheden og de mange enkeltdele fungerer, sandsynliggøres vores tolkninger, og rekonstruktionen kan betragtes som repræsentativ for det originale skib.
English: The reconstruction can then be considered as being representative of the original ship - although still with the proviso that we can never create an exact copy of the original.

Danish: Rekonstruktionen har kraftige, fyldige former og mørkt-tjæret træ.
English: The reconstruction has robust, full forms and dark-tared wood.

Danish: Rekonstruktionen er behandlet med en blanding af trætjære og linolie, der giver skibet sin smukke mørkerune farve.
English: The reconstruction is treated with a mixture of wood tar and linseed oil that gives the beautiful dark brown colour.

Danish: Rekonstruktion af arkæologiske skibsfund er et kerneområde i Vikingeskibsmuseets forsknings- og formidlingsarbejde.
English: The reconstruction of archaeological ship finds is a core area in the Viking Ship Museum' s research and dissemination work.

Danish: Rekonstruktionen af Ladbyskibet i 1963, Imme Gram, blev begyndelsen på en ny æra inden for rekonstruktion af vikingeskibe.
English: The reconstruction of the Ladby ship in 1963, Imme Gram, marked the beginning of a new era in the reconstruction of Viking ships.

Danish: Rekonstruktionen af Skuldelevskibenes sejl og rig har været en særlig udfordring for Vikingeskibsmuseet da der kun er få spor af det bevaret i det udgravede materiale.
English: The reconstruction of the Skuldelev ship's sails has proved a particular challenge for the Viking Ship Museum, as there are but few traces preserved in the archaeological record.

Danish: Derefter fremlægges resultaterne for de dendrokronologiske prøver og de opnåede dateringer diskuteres for at bestemme en datering for skibenes bygning.
English: The reconstruction of the wreck sample displayed the possible presence of a geometrical design-system, used to define the shape of the hull.

Danish: Rekonstruktionen af skrogudsnittet viste tilstedeværelsen af et muligt geometrisk formgivningssystem, som var blevet anvendt til at definere skrogformen.
English: The reconstruction of the wreck sample displayed the possible presence of a geometrical design-system, used to define the shape of the hull.

Danish: Rekonstruktionen af Vikingetiden og tidlige middelalders sejl og rig har været en særlig udfordring for Vikingeskibsmuseet da der kun er få spor af det bevaret i det udgravede materiale.
English: The reconstruction of Viking Age and Early Medieval ship's sails has proved a particular challenge for the Viking Ship Museum, as there are but few traces preserved in the archaeological record.

Danish: Byggeriet af rekonstruktionen repræsenterer alle disciplinerne indenfor bådebygning i vikingetiden.
English: The reconstruction process represents all the disciplines in the field of boat building in the Viking Age.

Danish: Rekonstruktionsprocessen skal begynde helt forfra, og starter med en genundersøgelse af de bevarede dele af Skuldelev 3, samt den 1:1 dokumentation, der blev lavet, da skibet blev udgravet.
English: The reconstruction process will begin from scratch, starting with a re-examination of the surviving timbers of Skuldelev 3 as well as the 1:1 documentation carried out at the time of its excavation.

Danish: Rekonstruktionen beviser sin styrke
English: The reconstruction proves its strength

Danish: Rekonstruktionen afslører, at dette løft giver skibet en større kølbugt end hidtil antaget og udført på det udstillede skib.
English: The reconstruction reveals that this lift gives the vessel a more rockered keel than was assumed and realised in the exhibited ship.

Danish: Båden er rekonstrueret af arkæolog Morten Johansen og bådebygger Hanus Jensen.
English: The reconstruction was designed by archaeologist Morten Johansen and boatbuilder Hanus Jensen.

Danish: Rekonstruktionen blev navngivet Havhingsten fra Glendalough og derefter søsat den 4. september 2004.
English: The reconstruction was named ‘Havhingsten fra Glendalough’ (The seastallion from Glendalough in Ireland) and launched on the 4th September 2004.

Danish: Rekonstruktionerne er ikke endegyldige sandheder.
English: The reconstructions are not definitive truths.

Danish: Målingerne viste, at tovet må strammes løbende for at holde spændingen.
English: The recorded figures showed that the rope needs to be tightened continually in order for the tension to be maintained.

Danish: Skibsvraget, der muligvis stammer fra et søslag i 1644, blev fundet ved marinarkæologiske forundersøgelser i 2008, og opdagelsen har siden været omgærdet med de største hemmelighedsforanstaltninger.
English: The remains of a ship, which may have sunk during a naval battle in 1644, were found during maritime archaeological investigations in 2008, and extensive measures were taken to keep the find's discovery secret.

Danish: Rester af kirkens mure står stadig som en del af Vor Frue Kirke i dag, og kirkens krypt fandt man næsten intakt, da man i 1955 gennemførte en udgravning under Vor Frue kirkes kor.
English: The remains of the church's walls are still standing as a part of the present Vor Frue Kirke, and the church's almost intact crypt was found in connection with an excavation in 1955 beneath the chancel of Vor Frue Kirke.

Danish: Rester af kirkens mure står stadig som en del af Vor Frue Kirke i dag, og kirkens krypt fandt man næsten intakt, da man i 1955 gennemførte en udgravning under Vor Frue kirkes kor.
English: The remains of the church’s walls are still standing as a part of the present Vor Frue Kirke, and the church's almost intact crypt was found in connection with an excavation in 1955 beneath the chancel of Vor Frue Kirke.

Danish: Reparationslapperne fortæller et vigtigt aspekt af Gislingebådens historie: Det var ikke et høj-status fartøj, tilhørende eliten.
English: The repair patches bear witness to an important aspect of the Gislinge boat's story: this was not a high status vessel belonging to the élite.

Danish: Reparationslapperne fortæller et vigtigt aspekt af Gislingebådens historie: Det var ikke et høj-status fartøj, tilhørende eliten.
English: The repair patches bear witness to an important aspect of the Gislinge boats story: this was not a high status vessel belonging to the élite.

Danish: Reparationslapperne fortæller et vigtigt aspekt af Gislingebådens historie: Det var ikke et høj-status fartøj, tilhørende eliten.
English: The repair patches bear witness to an important aspect of the Gislinge boat’s story: this was not a high status vessel belonging to the élite.

Danish: Reparationen blev udført i Irland, England eller Wales.
English: The repair was carried out in Ireland, England or Wales.

Danish: Vikingeskibsmuseets kopi blev bygget i Vestnorge i 1995 som et samarbejde mellem norske og danske bådebyggere.
English: The replica at the Viking Ship Museum was built jointly by Norwegian and Danish boatbuilders in Western Norway in 1995.

Danish: Desuden indgår også forsøg med roning og beskrivelser og registrering af forskellige manøvrer med sejlet.
English: The report also describes rowing trials and various sail-setting manoeuvres.

Danish: De er et bud på, hvordan skibene så ud for 1000 år siden.
English: The represent suggestions on how the ships may have looked 1,000 years ago.

Danish: Pindens skibsafbildninger er bemærkelsesværdige.
English: The representations of the ships on the stick are remarkable.

Danish: De gennemførte undersøgelser og indsamlede erfaringer fra sejladsen med Havhingsten vil ligge til grund for analysen af rekonstruktionens troværdighed.
English: The research carried out and experience collected from the voyage with the Sea Stallion will for the basis of the analysis of the authenticity of the reconstruction.

Danish: Vikingeskibsmuseets forskning hører ikke hjemme på støvede boghylder og den er ikke forbeholdt en snæver kreds af eksperter.
English: The research of the Viking Ship Museum is not old fashioned and it does not relate to just a small group of scholars.

Danish: Forskningsprojektet var finansieret af Det Frie Forskningsråds forskerkarriere-program Sapere Aude.
English: The research project was financed by the Danish Council for Independent Research (DFF) Researchers Career Programme, Sapere Aude.

Danish: I planperiode 2015-2019 er det særligt betydningsfuldt, at forskningsprojekterne bidrager til Vikingeskibsmuseets vision og helhedsplan for et nyt Vikingeskibsmuseum med fokus på mennesket, skibet og havet i oldtid og middelalder.
English: The research projects conducted between 2015-2019 are aimed at providing substantial contributions to the Viking Ship Museum’s vision and plan for a new Viking Ship Museum focusing on Man, Ship and Sea in ancient and medieval times.

Danish: ”Vi har besluttet os for, at vi vil formidle vores forskning, mens den er i gang.
English: The research staff at the museum is thinking out loud, while things are happening at sea.

Danish: Forskningsteamet står desuden for museets forlag og bibliotek.
English: The Research team takes also care of the museum's publication and library services.

Danish: Research-teamet gik systematisk til værks og startede længst mod vest i Falmouth og så gik det slag i slag gennem byer som Brighton, Portsmouth, Hastings, Dover med slut i Ramsgate nede i højre hjørne af England.
English: The research team was systematic, starting in the west at Falmouth and working their way bit by bit through towns like Brighton, Portsmouth, Hastings, Dover and ending at Ramsgate in the south-east corner of England.

Danish: Forskningsteamet arbejder med museets forskningsprojekter og samarbejder internationalt med universiteter igennem undervisning af studerende og vejledning af ph.d.-stipendiater.
English: The Research team works with the museum's research projects and collaborates internationally with universities, teaching students and advising PhD-stipendiates.

Danish: Forskningsteamet arbejder med museets forskningsprojekter og samarbejder internationalt med universiteter igennem undervisning af studerende og vejledning af ph.d.-stipendiater.
English: The Research team works with the museum’s research projects and collaborates internationally with universities, teaching students and advising PhD-stipendiates.

Danish: Forskerne forventer at få særdeles værdifuld - og ekstremt svært tilgængelig - viden om, hvordan hverdagslivet var for nordboerne.
English: The researchers expect to gather - not just extremely valuable, but also highly difficult to obtain - information about everyday life for the Norsemen.

Danish: Resten af turen til Berlin kommer til at foregå om natten, og turen er tilrettelagt således, at skibet ankommer til Berlin på det tidspunkt, hvor der er absolut mindst trafik i gaderne.
English: The rest of the trip to Berlin will take place at night, and the journey has been planned so that the ship will arrive in Berlin at the time where there is the least possible traffic in the streets.

Danish: Rastløsheden indfinder sig hurtigt, der drikkes uendelige mængder nescafe og vejrudsigten følges med spænding.
English: The restlessness is slowly kicking in; we are drinking extreme amounts of coffee and the weather forecast is followed closely.

Danish: Resultatet vises på en computerskærm.
English: The result is displayed on a computer monitor.

Danish: Resultatet var en kraftig vridning af båden, der gradvist rettede sig selv ud igen efter aflastning, indikerende at hovedparten af ændringen var elastisk, en mindre del plastisk.
English: The result was a strong twisting of the boat, which gradually straightened itself out again after pressure was relaxed, indicating that most of the change was elastic, and not so much plastic.

Danish: Resultatet var, at min del af historien smuldrede totalt og blev til støv.
English: The result was that my part of history crumbled and became dust.

Danish: Resultatet blev, at det 33 rum store skib hverken var harmonisk eller holdbart, og på dets første rejse lod kongen store kasser med nagler bringe ombord, så skibet kunne repareres undervejs.
English: The result was that the ship with its 33 rum was neither harmonious nor durable and on its maiden voyage the king had large chests full of nails brought on board so that the ship could be repaired as it sailed.

Danish: Resultatet vil give os en idé om langskibenes rejsehastighed i vikingetiden, og kan sammenlignes med de resultater, der er opnået af andre skibstyper på samme distance”.
English: The result will give us an idea of the travel speed of the Viking long ship and can be compared to results made by other ships sailing the same distance”.

Danish: Det resulterende skrog (hvoraf vraget udgravedes) bestod således af to lag bordplanker i for og agterskibet, mens der midtskibs kun var ét lag bordplanker.
English: The resulting hull therefore has two layers of planking in the foremost and aftermost parts, whereas there is only one layer of planking in the central (extended) part.

Danish: Den resulterende rejsehastighed overalt over den kortest mulige distance af 189 sømil på ruten Hundested - Anholt - Lyngør var i gennemsnit kun 27 sømil i døgnet eller 1,3 knob.
English: The resulting travelling speed overall, over the shortest possible distance of 189 nautical miles on the route from Hundested-Anholt-Lyngør was on average only 27 nautical miles per day or 1.3 knots.

Danish: De resultater, der opnås i den eksperimental arkæologiske proces, kan ikke sammenlignes med naturvidenskabens målinger, som fremkommer gennem forsøgsopstillinger, der principielt kan gentages i det uendelige under kontrollerede forhold.
English: The results achieved in the experimental archaeological process cannot be compared with the measurements of natural science.

Danish: Således er resultater for Roar Ege sammenholdt med såvel andre vikingeskibe/råsejlere (Saga Siglar og Rana), som moderne kapsejladsbåde (X 99) og forskellige brugsfartøjer op gennem tiden.
English: The results achieved with Roar Ege were thus compared with other Viking/square-sail ships (Saga Siglar and Rana), a modern yacht (X 99) and working vessels from various periods of history.

Danish: Resultaterne er stadig under bearbejdning, men vil sammen de øvrige Skuldelevskibes forsøgsresultater fremkomme i The Skuldelev Ships II og III.
English: The results are still being processed but they will, together with the trial data from the other Skuldelev ships, be published in The Skuldelev Ships II & III.

Danish: Resultaterne af målingerne vil kunne gøre det muligt at udtale sig om, hvad det oprindelige vikingeskib har kunnet præstere under forskellige vejr- og belastningsomstændigheder.
English: The results of the measurements make it possible to make statements concerning the capabilities of the original Viking ships under different weather conditions and with different loading/cargo circumstances.

Danish: Projektets resultater er publiceret i forskellige artikler, og en samlet præsentation af byggeprojektet er en del af et igangværende forskningsprojekt.
English: The results of the research project are published in different articles, and a complete presentation of the building of the Sea Stallion from Glendalough is part of an ongoing research project.

Danish: Projektets resultater, vedrørende såvel Punan Bah-folkets bådebygning som generelle aspekter ved deres kultur, blev publiceret i 1991 i bogen ’Building a Longboat.
English: The results of the research project were published in 1991 in the book, ’Building a Longboat.

Danish: Rekonstruktionsarbejdet er blevet grundigt dokumenteret i en rapport fra 2007, med Vibeke Bischoff som hovedforfatter.
English: The results of the research project were published in 2007 in a report, with Vibeke Bischoff as the main author

Danish: Forskningsresultaterne vil blive publiceret på dansk i en populær artikel og i en engelsk videnskabelig artikel samt blive formidlet gennem diverse foredrag ved konferencer.
English: The results of the research will be published in popular form in Danish and in a scientific paper in English, as well as disseminated through various lectures at conferences.

Danish: Resultaterne herfra er i korthed følgende:
English: The results of these individual analyses are briefly as follows:

Danish: Erfaringerne fra Roar-rapporten viser at spredningen i resultaterne vedr.
English: The results previously obtained in beating trials with Roar Ege show considerable variation in VMG.

Danish: Erfaringerne fra Roar-rapporten viser at spredningen i resultaterne vedr. VMG i forbindelse med krydsforsøg, gør det nødvendigt med mange forsøg.
English: The results previously obtained in beating trials with Roar Ege show considerable variation in VMG.

Danish: Projektets resultater blev publiceret i 2001 i bogen ’Ladby.
English: The results was published in 2001in the book ’Ladby.

Danish: Resultatet vil være retningsgivende for langskibenes rejsehastighed i vikingetiden, og kan sammenlignes med de resultater, der er opnået af andre skibstyper på samme distance.
English: The results will give us a standard travel speed for Viking longships, comparable with results achieved for other types of ship over the same distance.

Danish: Gennemgangen af det store materiale afslørende flere fejl i den oprindelige fortolkning af skibets form.
English: The review of the large volume of material revealed several errors in the original interpretation of the ship's design.

Danish: Spanterne i fartøjet sidder tæt, kun 85 cm fra hinanden, hvilket også har været afstanden mellem roernes tofter.
English: The ribs in the vessel are placed close together, only 85 cm apart, and this was also the distance between the oarsmen's thwarts.

Danish: Bådens ribben - Spanter og biter
English: The ribs of the boat - frames and biti

Danish: De har siddet med godt 90 cm afstand, således at roerne, der sad på tofter over spanterne, havde god plads til at betjene årerne.
English: The ribs were placed rather more that 90 cm apart so that the oarsmen, who sat on the thwarts above the ribs, had plenty of room to work the oars.

Danish: Spanterne, der har sørget for afstivning på tværs af skibet, var fastgjort til plankerne med trænagler.
English: The ribs, which were responsible for the transverse bracing of the ship, were secured to the planks with treenails.

Danish: Åsen krydser fjorden i et nord-sydgående forløb, og den er endnu synlig i Skuldelev Ås, på Kølholm og i Kalvøen ved Frederikssund.
English: The ridge crosses the fjord in a north-south direction and it is still visible at Skuldelev Ås, on Kølholm and on Kalvøen at Frederikssund.

Danish: Rigning er lige så vigtigt et element af det færdige skib som selve skroget, og reblæggeren er en fast del af museets bådebygningshold.
English: The rig is just as important an element of the finished ship as the hull and the ropemaker is a permanent member of the Museum’s boatbuilding team.

Danish: Riggen er vist med mast, rå, sejl og vanter eller stag, og øverst i mastetoppen vejer en vimpel - en overraskende detaljerigdom.
English: The rig is shown with mast, yard, sail and shrouds or stays, and at the very top of the mast a pennant is flying - a surprising wealth of detail.

Danish: Riggen er vist med mast, rå, sejl og vanter eller stag, og øverst i mastetoppen vejer en vimpel - en overraskende detaljerigdom.
English: The rig is shown with mast, yard, sail and shrouds or stays, and at the very top of the mast a pennant is flying – a surprising wealth of detail.

Danish: Riggen tilses af skipper selv, som også er rebslager på museet.
English: The rig will be supervised by the skipper himself; he is also a rope maker at the museum.

Danish: Netop sejl og rig skiller sig ud ved stort set ikke at være fysisk repræsenteret i det arkæologiske materiale.
English: The rigging and sail distinguish themselves by being virtually un-represented physically in the archaeological record.

Danish: riggen der på det ene tidspunkt et helt strammet op for på det næste tidspunkt at hænge løst ned
English: The rigging can be completely tightened up one moment, and hang loose the next

Danish: Rigningen er et godt eksempel herpå.
English: The rigging is a good example of this.

Danish: Rigning er lige så vigtigt et element af det færdige skib som selve skroget, og reblæggeren er en fast del af museets bådebygningshold.
English: The rigging is just as crucial an element of the finished vessel as the hull itself, and the ropemaker is a permanent member of the Museum's boatbuilding team.

Danish: Rigning er lige så vigtigt et element af det færdige skib som selve skroget, og reblæggeren er en fast del af museets bådebygningshold.
English: The rigging is just as crucial an element of the finished vessel as the hull itself, and the ropemaker is a permanent member of the Museum’s boatbuilding team.

Danish: Rigningen er et af de områder, der er allerdårligst belyst af det arkæologiske materiale - men desværre giver skjaldedigtningen kun få konkrete oplysninger herom.
English: The rigging is one of the areas that is most poorly illuminated by the archaeological material - but unfortunately scaldic verse gives only a very little concrete information about this.

Danish: Rigningen er et af de områder, der er allerdårligst belyst af det arkæologiske materiale – men desværre giver skjaldedigtningen kun få konkrete oplysninger herom.
English: The rigging is one of the areas that is most poorly illuminated by the archaeological material – but unfortunately scaldic verse gives only a very little concrete information about this.

Danish: Tovværket i rigningen er ligeledes tilvirket af autentiske materialer.
English: The rigging ropework is also made of authentic materials.

Danish: Nittet til kølen og stævnen med jern klinknagler, som der også var brugt på den originale båd.
English: The rivet for the keel and the stem with iron rivets, which were also used in the original boat.

Danish: Klinksøm og klinkplader er af kobber i stedet for af jern som i ældre tider.
English: The rivets and roves are of copper rather than iron, as was used in times past.

Danish: Naglerne har rustet og udvidet sig i et omfang, der medfører flækker i skrogets plankemateriale, hvilket gør skibet utæt.
English: The rivets have rusted and expanded to such a degree, that they have led to numerous cracks in the hull’s planking, causing the ship to leak.

Danish: Også Vejdirektoratet, der som bygherrer af Storstrømsbroen betaler for udgravningen, er interesseret i fundet.
English: The Road Directorate, who as developers of the Storstrøm Bridge are responsible for the cost of the excavation, are also interested in the find.

Danish: Roar Ege Projektet markerede begyndelsen på en proces, der ville blive til kernen af museets forskningsindsats; den eksperimentalarkæologiske rekonstruktion af arkæologiske skibe- og bådefund.
English: The Roar Ege Project marked the start a process that would form the core of the Museum’s research endeavours: the experimental archaeological reconstruction of archaeological ship and boat finds.

Danish: Romerne gav London sin første bro over floden Themsen og befæstede byen med en ringmur.
English: The Romans gave London its first bridge across the Thames.

Danish: Tårnet med vilde øjne og tænderne i skjoldet.
English: The rook with the huge teeth sunk into the shield.

Danish: Tovet blev hurtigt udskiftet af vores nødrrortov, der er lavet kunststof.
English: The rope was quickly replaced with our emergency-wicker-band, made out of non-biological material.

Danish: Reblæggeren skal lave reb af sælskin, uld og hestehår til museets både.
English: The ropemaker is making rope from sealskin, wool and horsehair for the Museum’s boats.

Danish: Rebslageren fremstiller tovværk af hamp, dyrehår eller hud til skibene.
English: The Ropemaker makes ropes of hemp, animal hair and hides for the ship.

Danish: Rebslageren arbejder året rundt med at fremstille tovværk til de nye fartøjer, som bygges på værftet, og deltager også i vedligeholdelse og reparation af rigning på hele museets bådsamling.
English: The ropemaker works year-round to produce rope for the new vessels built at the boatyard and also to maintain and repair the rigging of the Museum's wider boat collection.

Danish: Rebslageren arbejder året rundt med at fremstille tovværk til de nye fartøjer, som bygges på værftet, og deltager også i vedligeholdelse og reparation af rigning på hele museets bådsamling.
English: The ropemaker works year-round to produce rope for the new vessels built at the boatyard and also to maintain and repair the rigging of the Museum’s wider boat collection.

Danish: Rebslagerens værksted
English: The Ropemakers Workshop

Danish: Barske farvande ved Orkney
English: The rough seas of Orkney

Danish: De urolige og uforudsigelige vejrforhold, samt den heftige strøm mellem Færøerne, krævede særligt sødygtige både der samtidig var så lette at de kunne trækkes op på land.
English: The rough seas, unforeseeable weather and strong currents between the Faeroe Islands made it necessary to have particularly seaworthy vessels which at the same time were sufficiently light to be dragged ashore.

Danish: Ruten går tværs over Nordsøen, via Orkneyøerne ud i Atlanterhavet og videre sydpå gennem Det Irske Hav.
English: The route of the journey goes across the North See through the Orkney Islands into the Atlantic and the onwards south to the Irish Sea.

Danish: Hvor turen går hen afhænger af vejr, vind og besætning.
English: The route taken on the trip is determined by the wind, the weather and the ability of the crew.

Danish: Ruten gik fra Ost Hafen, under 13 broer og gennem en sluse inden Havhingsten endelig nåede frem til målet: Schiffsbauerdamm, midt mellem Rigsdagsbygningen og Museum Insel.
English: The route went from Ost hafen, under 13 bridges and through a lock before Sea Stallion finally reached its destination: Schiffsbauerdamm, right between the Reichstags building and Museum Insel.

Danish: Regentparrets fond støtter udgivelse fra museets forlag
English: The royal couple's foundation supports a publication from the museum

Danish: Og det takkede de kongelige ja til.
English: The royal family agreed.

Danish: Roret og sværdet (på billedet) bliver samlet med bolte, der bores helt eller delvist gennem hele stykket.
English: The rudder and the lee-board (seen in the photo) are held together with bolts that are drilled either partially or entirely through the timber.

Danish: Rorskottet kan skimtes i agterenden
English: The rudder bulkhead can just be seen in the aft.

Danish: Roret er færdigt og sidder i sine nye jernbeslag.
English: The rudder is complete and hangs on its new iron fitting.

Danish: Roret (styret) sidder i styrbord side (deraf navnet styrbord), fastgøres til skottet igennem siden af båden.
English: The rudder sits on the starboard side (the term derives from 'styrbord', the Old Norse term for a rudder) and is attached to the bulkhead through the side of the boat.

Danish: Rorstroppen er den læderstrop, der ligger om roret og går igennem essingen for at holde toppen af roret ind til skibssiden.
English: The rudder strap is the leather strap that holds the top of the rudder on to the side of the ship.

Danish: Rorvidjen fungerer upåklageligt.
English: The rudder tackle works irreproachably.

Danish: Roret blev fundet ved Rødsand i 2002, hvor det lå i området for den første af de store vindmølleparker ved Rødsand – den vindmøllepark, der i dag hedder Nysted Vindmøllepark.
English: The rudder was found at Rødsand in 2002, where it lay in the area of the first of the large wind turbine parks at Rødsand, which is now known as Nysted Offshore Wind Turbine Park.

Danish: Roret holdt resten af turen, men det var umuligt at undgå, at skibet girede temlig meget i den store medløbende sø, især tog det lang tid at falde af, hvis skibet skar op til styrbord.
English: The rudder was okay for the rest of the trip, but it was impossible to prevent the ship from sheering off in the heavy swell.

Danish: De forrevne klipper langs kysten, nogle af dem er basalt som er 4000 millioner år gamle, bryder bølgerne så de står op i skummende kaskader, det er et fantastisk syn.
English: The rugged cliffs along the coast, some of them of basalt and 4,000 million years old, break the waves that rise up in foaming cascades.

Danish: Spilleregler for mølle kan printes ud her fra hjemmesiden, og regler for nefatavl kan du finde på http://www.nefatavl.dk/.
English: The rules for Nine men's morris can be printed out here from the website, and the rules for Nefatavl are to be found at http://www.nefatavl.dk/english.html.

Danish: Bordgangenes forløb, sådan som de afspejles af naglerækkerne, viser, at skibet formodentlig har været bredere, men helt sikkert også kortere i agterskibet end Ladbyskibet.
