English: The run of the strakes, as reflected by the rows of rivets, shows that the ship was probably wider, but very probably also had a shorter stern section than the Ladby ship.

Danish: Runepinden kan nu ses på Roskilde Museum .
English: The Rune Stick can now be seen at Roskilde Museum .

Danish: Runesten fra Tullstorp i Skåne.
English: The rune stone from Tullstorp in Skåne.

Danish: Runestenene er tilsvarende grav- eller mindesten, men det er kun enkelte runesten, der er forsynet med skibsmotiver.
English: The rune stones are also grave monuments but it is only a few of these that bear ship-motifs.

Danish: Runeskriften på gravhøjens vægge.
English: The runic writing on the inside walls in the mount.

Danish: Redningsøvelserne er et hit hos museets gæster.
English: The safety drill is a hit with the museum guests.

Danish: I sagatekster omtales både spillene halatavl, nefatavl og skak.
English: The saga texts mention the games halatavl, nefatavl and chess.

Danish: Sagateksterne omtaler samlet set henved 15 eksempler på storskibe med 30 par årer eller mere, fra kort før år 1000 og frem til midten af 1200-tallet:
English: The saga texts refer to about 15 examples of large ships with 30 pairs of oars or more from shortly after the year 1000 to the middle of the thirteenth century:

Danish: I den mere fortællende ende af disse hører sagaerne og skjaldekvadene til.
English: The sagas and skaldic epics belong to the more narrative end of these sources.

Danish: I sagatekster omtales både halatavl, nefatavl og skak.
English: The sagas speak of games such as halatavl, nefatavl and chess.

Danish: Sejlet og riggen fungerer også godt.
English: The sail and rig also function well.

Danish: Sejladsen er ikke ufarlig
English: The sail can be dangerous

Danish: Sejlet passer fint og båden er i god ballance.
English: The sail fits perfectly and the boat has good balance.

Danish: Sejlet er på omkring 25 kvm.
English: The sail is about 25 m².

Danish: Stille og roligt løftes sejlet ned i havnen.
English: The sail is lifted carefully into the museum harbour.

Danish: Sejlet består af fem lange paneler, som syes sammen til det endelige sejl på 10 m2.
English: The sail is made up of five long panels, which will be sewn together to make the finished 10m2 sail.

Danish: Sejlet rebes af gasterne i midtskibet.
English: The sail is reefed in the midship.

Danish: Sejlet er sat og humøret er i top.
English: The sail is set and the mood is excellent.

Danish: Tæt trafik og stor imødekommenhed på Slien
English: The sail is set and the mood is excellent.

Danish: Sejlet er slidt, specielt syningerne har strukket sig.
English: The sail is worn and the needlework is particularly stretched.

Danish: Sejlet står fyldt og trækker under hele manøvren, men hvis man er i færd med at krydse op mod vinden, koster den en tur med vinden rundt før man er på plads på den nye kurs.
English: The sail remains full and pulls during the whole manoeuvre but if the boat is in the process of beating up against the wind, it costs a full downwind turn before the boat is in place on the new course.

Danish: Så begynder sejlet at fyldes fra den "forkerte" side, og mens skibet drejes videre rundt til den nye kurs, svinger man sejlet rundt.
English: The sail then begins to fill from the "wrong" side and while the ship turns further round to its new course, the sail is swung round.

Danish: Sejlet folder sig ud, efterhånden som råen kommer op til draghullet i mastetoppen.
English: The sail unfolds as the yard moves up to the halyard hole in the mast top.

Danish: Sejlet kurs og beholden fart kan nu aflæses.
English: The sailed course and the speed made good can now be read off.

Danish: Sejladsen Skagerrak rundt 2006 var svendeprøven for skib og besætning.
English: The sailing around Skagerrak 2006 was the final test of ship and crew.

Danish: Sejladsmanualen: beskriver håndteringen af skibet ved forskellige manøvrer.
English: The Sailing Manual: describes the handling of the ship in various manoeuvres.

Danish: Sejladsen starter i Roskilde den 8. juli og herefter går sejladsen nordpå og ud af Roskilde Fjord, rundt om Sjællands Odde og sydpå, hvor mange danske havne skal besøges.
English: The sailing starts from Roskilde 8th July and from here, continues north and out of Roskilde Fjord, around Sjællands Odde and then south, visiting many Danish harbours en route.

Danish: Sejladsteamet står for publikumssejladser, hvortil vi har ansat veluddannede sejladsinstruktører.
English: The sailing team plans our public boat trips, lead by well-trained sailing instructors.

Danish: Sejlmagerens værksted
English: The sailmaker's workshop

Danish: Sallingsundbroen forbinder halvøen Salling med Limfjordsøen Mors.
English: The Sallingsund Bridge connects the Salling peninsula with the Limfjordsøen Mors.

Danish: Saltet fungerer som bindemiddel og får farven til at hæfte på hørstoffet.
English: The salt is the binding materiale which secures the colours on the flags fabric.

Danish: Det samme gør sig gældende for eventuelle gæster, der sejler med på en bådelaugstur.
English: The same applies to any guests you take with you while sailing with a boat guild.

Danish: Det samme gør de nye havne og nye kyster, der rejser sig op fra havet og klipperne”.
English: The same applies to the new ports and new coasts that rise up out of the sea, and the cliffs.”

Danish: Det samme gør sig for så vidt gældende, når spørgsmålet går på, hvorfor vi så ikke krydser over.
English: The same applies to the question of why we don’t tack across the North Sea.

Danish: Samme princip som dengang
English: The same as back then

Danish: Det samme er sket på denne tur.
English: The same has happed on this trip.

Danish: Det samme gør sig til dels gældende for de gotlandske billedsten, der synes at ophøre i 900-tallet.
English: The same is the case with the Gotlandic picture-stones, which seem to come to an end in the tenth century.

Danish: Det samme gælder andre kendte vikingetidige krigsskibe.
English: The same is true of the other known Viking Age warships.

Danish: De samme forholdsregler gælder principielt også for arkæologiske og billedlige kilder.
English: The same precautions applies, in principle, to archaeological and iconographic sources too.

Danish: På de større fartøjer fra vikingetiden blev der brugt samme konstruktion.
English: The same system is also used on larger craft from the Viking Age.

Danish: Stiftelsen var interesseret i et samarbejde om en ny rekonstruktion, og samme år blev en samarbejdsaftale indgået mellem Stiftelsen Nytt Osebergskip i Tønsberg, Vikingeskibsmuseet i Roskilde og Kulturhistorisk Museum i Oslo.
English: The same year a collaboration agreement between Stiftelsen Nytt Osebergskip i Tønsberg, The Viking Ship Museum in Roskilde and The Museum of Cultural History in Oslo was signed and the project began.

Danish: Samme år sendte Svend en flåde på 240 langskibe mod England.
English: The same year Svein sent a fleet of 240 long ships against England.

Danish: Skjaldens opgave
English: The scald's task

Danish: Skjaldekvadene giver os også flere eksempler på at skibene kunne være ”smukt malede”, steini fagrdrifin.
English: The scaldic verses also give us more examples of the ships' being “beautifully painted” (steini fagrdrífin).

Danish: Skjaldekvadene giver os også flere eksempler på at skibene kunne være ”smukt malede”, steini fagrdrifin.
English: The scaldic verses also give us more examples of the ships’ being “beautifully painted” (steini fagrdrífin).

Danish: Skjaldekvadene er en kunstform, hvor hyldesten til fyrsten ikke kun bestod i lovprisningen af hans bedrifter, men også i elegancen i brugen af digtets udtryksform og i omgangen med dets regler.
English: The scaldic verses are an art form in which the tributes to the prince consisted not only in praise of his achievements but also in the elegance employed in the expression of the poem and the exploitation of its rules.

Danish: Skjaldekvadene består for en stor dels vedkommende af fastlagte formularer og poetiske omskrivninger, kenninger, hvis brug gjorde det muligt at skabe en varieret digtning på trods af stramme normer for strofernes opbygning og rim.
English: The scaldic verses consist for a large part of fixed formulae and poetical circumlocutions or kennings whose use made it possible to create a varied poetry in spite of the strict rules for the structure of the stanzas and the rhymes.

Danish: Skjaldekvadene modsiger altså ikke den praktiske iagttagelse fra de arkæologiske fund, at skjoldene ikke kan have været monteret under roning, og næppe under sejlads heller.
English: The scaldic verses do not therefore contradict the practical observation from the archaeological finds that the shields cannot have been mounted during rowing, and hardly during sailing, either.

Danish: Skjaldekvadene omtaler ofte rejser, søslag og andre begivenheder, der er knyttet til langskibene, og er derfor en værdifuld kilde hertil.
English: The scaldic verses often describe voyages, sea-battles and other events that are associated with the longships and they are therefore a valuable source of information about these.

Danish: Skaret består at to jernspiger, en trænagle og en klinknagle.
English: The scarf consists of two iron spikes, a wooden nail and a klinker nail.

Danish: Skoletjenesten har mange undervisningstilbud, der sætter vikingetiden, vikingerne og deres skibe og togter i relief.
English: The school service offers many educational activities focusing on the Viking Age, the Vikings, and their ships and expeditions.

Danish: Især de skotske skibsbygmestre spillede en vigtig rolle ved at designe og bygge skibe efter den engelske måde, som anvendte det skelet-baserede byggeri.
English: The Scottish shipbuilders especially played an important part in designing new ships that were built according to the English fashion, using a skeleton-based concept.

Danish: Søen lagde sig hen under aften og vinden blev mere moderat.
English: The sea quietened towards evening and the win moderated.

Danish: Havhingsten - fra Danmark til Kasakhstan
English: The Sea Stallion - from Denmark to Kasakhstan

Danish: Havhingsten - fra Danmark til Kasakhstan
English: The Sea Stallion - from Denmark to Kazakhstan

Danish: Havhingsten - nu med forstærkninger
English: The Sea Stallion - now with reinforcements

Danish: Havhingsten - lige nu
English: The Sea Stallion - right now

Danish: Havhingsten og ikonografien
English: The Sea Stallion and iconography

Danish: Havhingsten og projekt 'Fuldblod på havet' er kulminationen på årtiers enestående forskning og dokumentation.
English: The Sea Stallion and project ‘Full-blood at sea' are the culmination of decades of research and documentation.

Danish: Havhingsten og projekt ’Fuldblod på havet’ er kulminationen på årtiers enestående forskning og dokumentation.
English: The Sea Stallion and project ‘Full-blood at sea’ are the culmination of decades of research and documentation.

Danish: Havhingsten og River Cottage i Langør på Samsø
English: The Sea Stallion and River Cottage on Samsø

Danish: Havhingsten og den 55 mand store besætning fik en varm velkomst i Slesvig, hvor tusinder af mennesker tog i mod tilbuddet om at komme og opleves skibet på tætteste hold.
English: The Sea Stallion and the 55-man crew received a warm welcome in Schleswig, where thousands of people took the offer to come and experience the ship at close range.

Danish: Havhingsten og kongehuset
English: The Sea Stallion and the royal family

Danish: Havhingsten og Vikingeskibsmuseet i Roskilde havde et research-team i Sydengland i sidste uge, så i disse dage er der en del sydengelske havnefogeder, turistchefer og borgmestre, som går rundt og klør sig lidt i nakken, mens de forsøger at tænke meget kreativt.
English: The Sea Stallion and the Viking Ship Museum in Roskilde had a research team in southern England last week and quite a few harbour masters, tourism managers, and local mayors are now wandering around scratching their heads and trying to be very creative.

Danish: Den 14. august 2007 sejlede Havhingsten ind til en storslået modtagelse.
English: The Sea Stallion arrived in Dublin on the 14th of August 2007 to an overwhelming welcome.

Danish: Havhingsten ankommer til Dublin Docklands, og ankomsten markeres med en velkomstceremoni på Custom House Quay.
English: The Sea Stallion arrives at Dublin Docklands, and the arrival is honoured with a welcoming ceremony at Custom House Quay.

Danish: Havhingsten ankommer til Dublin 14. august 2007.
English: The Sea Stallion arrives in Dublin on 14th August 2007.

Danish: Havhingsten som grafitti
English: The Sea Stallion as graffiti

Danish: Havhingsten som den tog sig ud i Collins Barracks i Dublin.
English: The Sea Stallion as it appeared in Collins Barracks in Dublin.

Danish: Havhingsten som betalingsmiddel
English: The Sea Stallion as legal tender

Danish: Havhingsten ved Lindesnes Fyr den 13. juli.
English: The Sea Stallion at Lindesnes on the 13th of July.

Danish: Havhingsten vandt over chalup
English: The Sea Stallion beat the Chalup

Danish: Havhingsten foræres til det Irske National Museum.
English: The Sea Stallion belongs to the National Museum of Ireland.

Danish: Havhingstens Bådelaug
English: The Sea Stallion Boat Guild

Danish: Havhingstens bådelaug rekrutterer både erfarne og uerfarne sejlere til vores frivillige laug.
English: The Sea Stallion boat guild is recruiting experienced and inexperienced sailors to our volunteer guild.

Danish: Med sig hjem bragte Havhingsten fornyet viden om vikingetidens langskibe, deres rejsehastighed, sejlegenskaber og organisation.
English: The Sea Stallion brought home with it new knowledge of the longships of the Viking Age, their speeds, sailing characteristics and organisation.

Danish: I baggrunden ligger langskibet Havhingsten.
English: The Sea Stallion can be seen in the background.

Danish: Havhingsten fra Glendalough / The Sea Stallion from Glendalough.
English: The Sea Stallion carry exhibition and activities where it arrive for the pleasure of the curious visitors.

Danish: Havhingsten medbringer udstilling og aktiviteter, hvor den kommer frem til glæder for de nysgerrige besøgende.
English: The Sea Stallion carry exhibition and activities where it arrive for the pleasure of the curious visitors.

Danish: Havhingstens besætning er delt ind i små hold af to personer – et af formålene med det system er, at gasterne to og to skal holde øje med og hjælpe hinanden i nødsituationer som denne.
English: The Sea Stallion crew is divided into small teams of two persons – one of the purposes of this system is, to make the crew – two by two – keep an eye on each other and help out in emergencies like this.

Danish: Havhingsten fra Glendalough
English: The Sea Stallion from Glendalough

Danish: Havhingsten fra Glendalough ankommer til Vikingeskibsmuseets Museumshavn og dets besætning modtages af officielle repræsentanter fra Danmark og Irland.
English: The Sea Stallion from Glendalough arrives in the harbour of the Viking Ship Museum, and its crew are welcomed by official representatives from Denmark and Ireland.

Danish: Havhingsten fra Glendalough er en rekonstruktion af et vikingeskib, som blev bygget i Dublin i 1042.
English: The Sea Stallion from Glendalough is a reconstruction of a Viking ship build in Dublin 1042.

Danish: Havhingsten fra Glendalough er en rekonstruktion af Skuldelev 2-vraget, som i 1962 blev udgravet i Roskilde Fjord.
English: The Sea Stallion from Glendalough is a reconstruction of the Skuldelev 2-wreck, which was excavated in 1962 in Roskilde Fjord.

Danish: Det særlige ved Havhingsten - og ved andre langskibe - er at de både er ro- og sejlskibe.
English: The Sea Stallion from Glendalough is special because, like other longships, she is designed to be powered by either sail or oar.

Danish: Det særlige ved Havhingsten – og ved andre langskibe – er at de både er ro- og sejlskibe.
English: The Sea Stallion from Glendalough is special because, like other longships, she is designed to be powered by either sail or oar.

Danish: HAVHINGSTEN FRA GLENDALOUGH er det nærmeste, vi i dag kan komme oplevelsen af et komplet langskib fra den tid, hvor denne skibstype oplevede sit højdepunkt.
English: The SEA STALLION FROM GLENDALOUGH is the nearest that we can come today to experiencing a complete longship from the time when this type of ship reached its culmination.

Danish: Havhingsten fra Glendalough sejlede fra Dublin for mere end to år siden, men besøget i Irland er langt fra glemt.
English: The Sea Stallion from Glendalough sailed from Dublin more than two years ago, but its visit to Ireland is far from forgotten.

Danish: Sidst i oktober kommer Dronning Margrethe til Roskilde for at indvie den nye kongeport i Domkirken.
English: The Sea Stallion from Glendalough sailed from Dublin more than two years ago, but its visit to Ireland is far from forgotten.

Danish: Byggeriet af Havhingsten fra Glendalough foregik på Vikingeskibsmuseets bådeværft fra 2000 til 2004.
English: The Sea Stallion from Glendalough was built at the Viking Ship Museum's boatyard in 2000-2004.

Danish: Havhingstens kogekasser
English: The Sea Stallion galley.

Danish: Store badedag for Havhingsten
English: The Sea Stallion gets a bath

Danish: Havhingsten adskiller sig fra museets øvrige bådelaug pga. størrelsen på både skib og besætning, økonomien bag samt forventningerne til dem, som er en del af sejladserne.
English: The Sea Stallion guild differs a great deal from the other museum boat guilds by the size of ship and crew, the necessary funding behind it and by the expectations to all participating in the voyages.

Danish: Havhingsten melder om en fantastisk dag med masser af vind og sø, havgale gaster på stribe, en tårnfalk på masten og en sublim havnemanøvre som afrunding.
English: The Sea Stallion had a fantastic day with lots of wind and waves, an enthusiastic crew, a visiting kestrel atop the mast and some sublime harbor maneuvers to end the day.

Danish: The Sea Stallion needed help to get safely out of the port of Glomme, and is now heading for Hundested.
English: The Sea Stallion had a fantastic day with lots of wind and waves, an enthusiastic crew, a visiting kestrel atop the…

Danish: Havhingsten havde tænkt sig, at turen gik til Anholt, men vind og strøm ville det anderledes.
English: The Sea Stallion had planned to go to Anholt, but winds and currents had other plans.

Danish: I vikingetiden fandtes professionelle historiefortællere kaldet skjalde.
English: The Sea Stallion has a modern bard, a press officer, on board.

Danish: Vikingeskibsmuseets skibe har i dag en moderne skjald, en PR-medarbejder, med om bord.
English: The Sea Stallion has a modern bard, a press officer, on board.

Danish: I dag kan vores hovmester sagtens lave varm mad om bord på skibene.
English: The Sea Stallion has a team of two chief stewards who can easily make hot food on board the ship.

Danish: Havhingsten har mødt en vedholdende interesse, der overskrider alle grænser for, hvad vi tidligere har oplevet.
English: The Sea Stallion has been met with sustained interest well in excess of anything we have experienced before.

Danish: Det lange skib er stivet af
English: The Sea Stallion has been strengthened

Danish: Havhingsten har forladt Irland med kurs mod Lands End
English: The Sea Stallion has left Ireland on course for Lands End

Danish: Havhingsten har proviant og vand ombord til de 60 gaster i mindst seks døgn.
English: The Sea Stallion has provisions and water on board for the 60-strong crew for at least six days.

Danish: Havhingsten har tilbragt dennne vinter på Det Irske National Museum, som må afgive deres lånte perle den 29. juni 2008 , hvor en interntional besætning med vægt på danskere og irere sejler skiber hjem igen.
English: The Sea Stallion has spent the winter at the Irish National Museum, which must relinquish its borrowed jewel on 29 June 2008, when an international crew with a lot of Danish and Irish seamen will sail the ship home again.

English: The Sea Stallion in Egersund, Norway

English: The Sea Stallion in Haithabu

English: The Sea Stallion in high seas.

English: The Sea Stallion in Spangereid, Norway

English: The Sea Stallion in the Baltic Sea heading towards Schlei, the very narrow and crooked fjord leading to the the Viking Age trading center Haithabu and Schleswig today.

Danish: Havhingsten i Østersøen på vej mod Slien.
English: The Sea Stallion in the Baltic Sea heading towards Schlei.

Danish: Havhingsten i den Engelske Kanal med kurs mod Roskilde
English: The Sea Stallion in the English Channel on route to Roskilde

Danish: Havhingsten på museum?
English: The Sea Stallion in the museum?

Danish: Havhingsten i Slien, hvor den meget snævre og krogede fjord krævede at besætningen måtte have årerne ud.
English: The Sea Stallion in the Schlei, where the very narrow and crooked fjord required that the crew had to row the ship.

Danish: Havhingsten i vandet
English: The Sea Stallion in the water

Danish: Havhingsten er en mediestjerne.
English: The Sea Stallion is a media-star.

Danish: Havhingsten er en rekonstruktion af Skuldelev 2-vraget, et krigsskib som blev bygget i 1042 i Irlands hovedstad Dublin, som blev grundlagt af vikinger.
English: The Sea Stallion is a reconstruction of the Skuldelev 2-wreck, a war ship built in 1042 in the Irish capital Dublin, a city founded by Vikings.

Danish: Havhingsten har været af sted i en uge på sin hjemrejse Dublin-Roskilde, men har kun sejlet i alt cirka 50 sømil ud af de i alt 1400.
English: The Sea Stallion is a week into its return journey from Dublin to Roskilde, but has only sailed about 50 of the total 1400 nautical miles.

Danish: Havhingsten endelig på havet igen
English: The Sea Stallion is at sea again - at last

Danish: Havhingsten endelig på havet igen
English: The Sea Stallion is at sea again – at last

Danish: Havhingsten er tilbage i sit rette element og er flyttet til en ny bro, hvorfra museets besøgende kan få et bedre kik på skibet.
English: The Sea Stallion is back in its proper element and has been moved to a new wharf, where the museum's visitors can get a better look at the ship.

Danish: Havhingsten er tilbage i sit rette element og er flyttet til en ny bro, hvorfra museets besøgende kan få et bedre kik på skibet.
English: The Sea Stallion is back in its proper element and has been moved to a new wharf, where the museum’s visitors can get a better look at the ship.

Danish: Havhingsten er baseret på Skuldelev 2-skibet, som blev bygget af vikinger i Dublin i 1042 og siden sejlet til Danmark, hvor det blev udgravet fra bunden af Roskilde fjord i 1962.
English: The Sea Stallion is based on the Skuldelev 2 ship, which was built by Vikings in Dublin in 1042 and later sailed to Denmark, where it was excavated from the bottom of Roskilde Fjord in 1962.

Danish: Havhingsten er i Dublin
English: The Sea Stallion is in Dublin

Danish: Havhingsten i Skotland
English: The Sea Stallion is in Scotland

Danish: Havhingsten kan ses i Museumhavnen.
English: The Sea Stallion is lying in the Museum Harboor.

Danish: Havhingsten ligger fortøjet midt i Museumshavnen og lørdag den 20. juni kan publikum komme ombord
English: The Sea Stallion is moored in the centre of the Museum Harbour and the public can go aboard on Saturday 20 June

Danish: Havhingsten er nu tilbage i sit rette element og har fået en ny plads i havnen.
English: The Sea Stallion is now back in its element and has obtained a new space in the harbour.

Danish: Havhingsten ligger nu i Rørvig havn, hvor dagen bliver brugt til at vaske skibet og få styr på grejet, inden skibet…
English: The Sea Stallion is now in Rørvig and the crew will spend the day washing the ship and cleaning the equipment.

Danish: Havhingsten er sekunder fra at være tilbage i dets rette element
English: The Sea Stallion is only seconds away from being back in its proper element.

Danish: Havhingsten søger fortsat partnere som kunne være interesseret i at støtte projektet.
English: The Sea Stallion is still looking for partners who might be interested in supporting the project.

Danish: Havhingsten er verdens største rekonstruktion af et vikingeskib - en rekonstruktion i fuld skala af et af de fem skibe, der blev udgravet for et halvt århundrede siden.
English: The Sea Stallion is the world's largest reconstruction of a Viking ship - a full scale reconstruction of one of the five ships excavated half a century ago.

Danish: Havhingsten er verdens største rekonstruktion af et vikingeskib – en rekonstruktion i fuld skala af et af de fem skibe, der blev udgravet for et halvt århundrede siden.
English: The Sea Stallion is the world’s largest reconstruction of a Viking ship – a full scale reconstruction of one of the five ships excavated half a century ago.

Danish: Havhingsten venter på god bør.
English: The Sea Stallion is waiting for good wind.

Danish: Nordjyde med saltvand i blodet
English: The Sea Stallion is well……..

Danish: Havhingsten forlader tidevandet.
English: The Sea Stallion leaves tidal waters

English: The Sea Stallion moored in Kyleakin, Scotland.

Danish: Havhingsten ved Loch Inver i Skotland 2007.
English: The Sea Stallion near Loch Inver in Scotland 2007.

Danish: Havhingsten under sejlads til Norge 2007
English: The Sea Stallion near Norway 2007

Danish: Havhingsten sejler nu direkte til Thyborøn
English: The Sea Stallion now sailing direct for Thyborøn

Danish: Havhingsten fra Glendalough er med sine 30 meter verdens længste rekonstruktion af et vikingeskib.
English: The Sea Stallion of Glandalough measuring 30 metres is the longest reconstruction of a Viking ship in the world.

Danish: Havhingsten fra Glendalough er et krigsskib, og vikingerne er i dag kendt især for deres krigeriske overfald i store dele af Europa.
English: The Sea Stallion of Glendalough is a warship and the Vikings are famous today for their warlike attacks across large parts of Europe.

Danish: Der kan præges kongelige mønter, ristes runer i sværd og males skjolde.

Danish: Havhingsten var på alles læber
English: The Sea Stallion on everybody's lips!

English: The Sea Stallion on Facebook

English: The Sea Stallion on its way in over Collins Barracks, National Museum of Ireland, on 17 August 2007.

English: The Sea Stallion on its way out of Collins Barracks.

Danish: Havhingsten på vej til Roskilde med Domkirken i baggrunden.

English: The Sea Stallion on River Liffey.

English: The Sea Stallion passes Baily Lighthouse

Danish: Havhingsten klar til at krydse Nordsøen
English: The Sea Stallion ready to cross the North Sea

Danish: Havhingsten repræsenterer jo en tid, da Danmark havde føringen i vores del af verden".
English: The Sea Stallion represents a time, when Denmark was in the lead in our part of the World.”

Danish: Havhingsten genopliver historiens bånd.
English: The Sea Stallion revives the bonds of history

Danish: I den værste sommer i mands minde og med kun fem dage uden regn i løbet af togtets 45 dage, sejlede Havhingsten gennem nogle af de mest udfordrende farvande i Europa.
English: The Sea Stallion sailed in some of the most challenging waters in Europe in the worst summer in living history, with only five days without rain in the course of the journey's 45 days.

Danish: Havhingsten sejlede op langs den norske kyst den 13. og 14. juli.
English: The Sea Stallion sailed on the 13th and 14th of July from Lindesnes to Egersund.

Danish: Havhingstens sejlads fra Roskilde til Dublin er et videnskabeligt forsøg - men ikke et forsøg med 65 menneskers liv som indsats.
English: The Sea Stallion sailing from Roskilde to Dublin is a scientific experiment - but not one including the lives of 65 people.

Danish: Havhingsten sejler igen
English: The Sea Stallion sails again

Danish: Havhingstens sejlads langs Norges syd-vest kyst
English: The Sea Stallion sails up the South-West coat of Norway

Danish: Havhingsten sejler jubilæumssejlads til Hedeby i Nordtyskland, Korsør, Kerteminde og Langør på Samsø.
English: The Sea Stallion sets out on the anniversary voyage to Hedeby in Northern Germany and the Danish harbors in Korsør, Kerteminde and Langør on Samsø.

Danish: Havhingsten viste her lidt af sit potentiale, og vi så med spænding frem til de næste års sejladser.
English: The Sea Stallion showed some of its potential and we excitedly looked forward to the next year.

English: The Sea Stallion under sail

Danish: Langskibet er bygget på Vikingeskibsmuseets bådeværft fra 2000 - 2004.
English: The Sea Stallion was build at the Viking Ship Museum Boatyard from 2000-2004.

English: The Sea Stallion was build at the Viking Ship Museum Boatyard from 2000-2004.

Danish: Havhingsten blev bygget på Vikingeskibsmuseet i Roskilde, og det 30 meter lange skib er verdens største rekonstruktion af et vikingeskib.
English: The Sea Stallion was built at the Viking Ship Museum in Roskilde, and the 30-metre-long ship is the world's largest reconstruction of a Viking ship.

Danish: Havhingsten blev først løftet ind i parken Croppies Acre, videre over den elektriske togbane og op på parkeringspladsen udenfor Collins Barracks.
English: The Sea Stallion was lifted into the park Croppies Acre, onwards over a electric railway and up to the parking area outside Collins Barracks.

Danish: På Havhingsten ville vil selvfølgelig hilse på, og lå klar ude i bugten.
English: The Sea Stallion was lying in the bay ready to greet the royals.

Danish: Der var godt fyldt op på Havhingsten den 6. maj. Her er det sejladsen med partnere og sponsorer.
English: The Sea Stallion was packed on the 6th of May when sponsors and partners were offered a sail.

Danish: Havhingsten skal på land og kommer formentlig ikke i vandet igen de næste mange år.
English: The Sea Stallion will be brought ashore and will probably not be put into the water again next year.

Danish: Havhingsten tager ruten gennem Limfjorden, derefter ned gennem Kattegat.
English: The Sea Stallion will take the route through the Limfjord, then across the Kattegat.

English: The Sea Stallion would have worn out up 3–4 sails and a lot of rope.

Danish: Havhingsten - der er en kopi af et vikingeskib, der oprindeligt blev bygget i Dublin i 1042 - sejler 1. juli fra Roskilde til Dublin... og der vil ikke være en dråbe alkohol om bord.
English: The Sea Stallion – a copy of a Viking ship originally built in Dublin in 1042 – sets sail on the 1st of July, going from Roskilde to Dublin without a drop of alcohol in the cargo hold.

Danish: Havhingstens afrejse fra Roskilde 1. juli 2007
English: The Sea Stallion's departure from Roskilde on the 1st of July 2007

Danish: Havhingstens forsøgsrejse Dublin tur/retur står som et af de mest spektakulære marinarkæologiske eksperimenter nogensinde.
English: The Sea Stallion's experimental voyage to Dublin and back represents one of the most spectacular maritime archaeological experiments ever.

Danish: Havhingstens forsøgsrejse Dublin tur/retur står som et af de mest spektakulære marinarkæologiske eksperimenter noge…
English: The Sea Stallion's experimental voyage to Dublin and back represents one of the most spectacular maritime archaeolo…

Danish: Havhingstens navigationsudstyr monteres.
English: The Sea Stallion's navigation equipment is being installed.

Danish: Sommerens sejlads med Havhingsten gav omtale i et hidtil uhørt omfang.
English: The Sea Stallion's summer voyage to Ireland resulted in enormous press coverage.

Danish: Havhingsten, River Cottage og Ny Nordisk Vikingmad
English: The Sea Stallion, River Cottage and New Nordic Viking Food

Danish: Havhingstens sejl skyllet
English: The Sea Stallions sail has been rinsed

Danish: Havhingstens dørk vil blive taget op, så man kan se til det udstyr, som både nutidens besætning og vikingetidens krigere bragte med sig.
English: The Sea Stallion’s deck will be taken up so that it will be possible to see the equipment that both the present crew and the Viking Age’s warriors brought with them.

Danish: Havhingstens tidligere hjemmeside er blevet integreret i det nye vikingeskibsmuseet.dk.
English: The Sea Stallion’s previous homepage has been integrated into the new page: vikingeskibsmuseet.dk.

Danish: Havhingstens research gruppe fik lejlighed til at besøge Coast Guard i Falmouth.
English: The Sea Stallion’s research group had the chance to visit the Coast Guard in Falmouth.

Danish: Havhingstens hjemkomst fra Dublin blev sidste år fejret på mere moderne maner.
English: The Sea Stallion’s return from Dublin was celebrated last year in a more modern manner.

Danish: Havhingstens rejse imponerede premierministeren, der dog ikke kunne lade være med at spørge om besætningen, ligesom vikingerne, lod sig friste af de iltre irske ungmøer.
English: The Sea Stallion’s voyage impressed the prime minister, though he couldn’t resist asking about the crew, just as the Vikings were tempted by the feisty Irish maidens.

Danish: Havhingstens togt til Irland - kun et eventyr?
English: The Sea Stallion’s voyage to Ireland - an adventure only?

Danish: Forsøgssejladserne viste også, at Havhingsten gik stærkere og højere til vinden, end nogen af de andre skibe, vi har rekonstrueret fra vikingetiden.
English: The sea trials also showed that the Sea Stallion could go faster and closer to the wind than any of the other Viking ships we had reconstructed.

Danish: Forsøgssejladserne med Osebergskibet bliver kulminationen afdet store arbejde der ligger forud for bygningen af skibet.arbejdet.
English: The sea trials with the Oseberg ship will be the culmination of all the hard work that is taking place before the building of the ship.

Danish: Afprøvningen af Tilia har vist god holdbarhed af lindebastsyningerne og bekræftet anvendelsen af bundbrædderne som fodstøtte og brugbarheden af fundets smalle padleårer.
English: The sea trials with Tilia have shown the robustness of the sewn linden bast fastenings, confirmed the use of the floor boards as foot supports for the paddlers and demonstrated that the narrow paddles served their purpose well.

Danish: Havhingsten fra Glendalough - et genskabt langskib
English: The Seastallion from Glendalough - a Viking Longship recreated

Danish: I en række forskelligartede artikler beragtes vikingetidens samfund gennem fyrstedigtningens rige kildematerile, der længe har været overset som gyldigt historisk vidnesbyrd.
English: The SEASTALLION FROM GLENDALOUGH is the nearest that we can come today to experiencing a complete longship from the time when this type of ship reached its culmination.

Danish: Koordinatsystemets anden akse går udad fra centrum og viser skibets hastighed på den givne kurs til vinden.
English: The second axis of the co-ordinate system departs from the centre and shows the speed of the ship on the given course to the wind.

Danish: Det andet indbrud i det gamle gravkammer skete i 1153, da medlemmer af jarl Ragnvalds selskab vendte hjem fra korstogene.
English: The second break-in to this ancient burial chamber was in 1153, when members of Earl Rognvald's party returned from their Crusades.

Danish: Det andet kapitel opsummerer undersøgelsesperiodens hidtil kendte kravelskibsbygnings- og designmetoder og det danske kravelbyggeri sættes i et historisk perspektiv.
English: The second chapter summarises the different known carvel building techniques and design methods of the period and Danish carvel shipbuilding is set into a historical perspective.

Danish: I det afsluttende kapitel analyseres Hjortspringbåden som primærkilde og perspektiveres ved sammenligning med andre fund af fartøjer fra bronzealder og tidlig jernalder.
English: The second chapter summarises the different known carvel building techniques and design methods of the period and Danish carvel shipbuilding is set into a historical perspective.

Danish: Anden dags sejlads var på 45,4 km, og den kombineredes bl.a. med et ’omvendt slæbeforsøg’, hvor modstanden fra vand og luft var 2 minutter og 32 sekunder om at bremse båden helt op fra 5,5 knobs fart.
English: The second day’s voyage was 45.4 km long and it was combined with other tests, including an ‘inverted towing trial’ where, after the paddlers stopped paddling, resistance from water and air brought the boat to a standstill from a speed of 5.5 knots in 2 minutes and 32 seconds.

Danish: For det andet er opmålingen og tegningen af fundene, meget mere besværlig.
English: The second difference is that measuring and drawing are much more difficult.

Danish: Det andet forskningsseminar fandt sted 24.-25. september 2004 på det tidligere svenske tøjhus i Wismar under titlen: Wulfstan’s Voyage.
English: The second research seminar took place on the 24th and 25th September 2004 at the former Swedish armoury in Wismar under the title Wulfstan’s Voyage.

Danish: Anden gang svarede Harold:
English: The second time Harold answered:

Danish: Rumdagbogen: beskriver besætningsmedlemmernes liv om bord.
English: The Section Journal: describes the life of the crew on board.

Danish: Udvalget omfatter også moderne kunsthåndværk med hovedvægt på skandinavisk design.
English: The selection also includes modern handicrafts, primarily of Scandinavian design.

Danish: Valget af træsort er en vurdering mellem styrke, vægt, varighed, udseende, voksemåde mm.
English: The selection is made on the basis of an analysis of the wood's strength, weight, longevity, appearance, growth pattern and so on.

Danish: Seminaret tog udgangspunkt i beskrivelsen af den nordnorske vikingehøvding Ottars rejser langs den norske kyst ind i Hvidehavet og ned gennem de danske farvande til Hedeby.
English: The seminar focussed on the description of the North Norwegian Chieftain Ohthere's voyages along the Norwegian coast into the White Sea and down through Danish waters to Hedeby.

Danish: Seminaret tog udgangspunkt i beskrivelsen af den nordnorske vikingehøvding Ottars rejser langs den norske kyst ind i Hvidehavet og ned gennem de danske farvande til Hedeby.
English: The seminar focussed on the description of the North Norwegian Chieftain Ohthere’s voyages along the Norwegian coast into the White Sea and down through Danish waters to Hedeby.

Danish: Bopladsen har store forekomster af sjældne stenaldergenstande.
English: The settlement contains large quantities of rare Stone Age artefacts.

Danish: Bopladsfundet er en vigtig brik i et langt større puslespil: ”Vi ved ganske lidt om netop denne periodes kystbosættelse, netop fordi de ligger under vand.
English: The settlement is an important piece of a much larger puzzle: “We know very little about coastal settlements during this period, precisely because they're now located under water.

Danish: Bosættelsesmønsteret på Nordøstfyn adskiller sig inden for dette tidsrum ikke fra, hvad vi kender andre steder i Danmark.
English: The settlement pattern of north-east Funen is not distinctively different within that period from what is known in other parts of Denmark.

Danish: Alle bopladser ligger ved kysten, og vandvejen har formentlig været den bedste mulighed for forbindelse mellem nordboerne, men hvilken mobilitet havde de?
English: The settlements all lie near the coast and the sea-routes most likely offered the best potential for maintaining contact between the Norse settlements, but how mobile were they in reality?

Danish: Bopladserne er imidlertid samtidig vanskelige at datere, hvilket kan være en medvirkende årsag til, at vi ser dette billede.
English: The settlements at the same time become more difficult to date, which could be another contributory reason for the picture that has emerged.

Danish: De bestod af et beboelsesområde og et køkken, adskilt af en træskærm.
English: The settlements were concentrated of the lower slope of the Island, away from the cliffs and the Atlantic waves.

Danish: Den syv uger lange sejlads til Irland er kulminationen på det største marinarkæologiske eksperiment, der nogensinde er udført.
English: The seven week voyage to Ireland will be the culmination of the greatest marine-archaeological experiment ever carried out.

Danish: Løftingen agter udførtes af tre planker, og de smalle bundplanker blev udlagt som fodstøtte for mandskabet.
English: The sewing was done from the middle towards the ends with freshly tarred linden cords, after which the holes were caulked with ox tallow.

Danish: Skafterne bliver tyndere mod enderne men der er ingen enstydighed i tykkelsen på skafter og hvornår de tyndes mod enderne.
English: The shafts taper towards each end but there is no uniformity in the thickness of the shafts and where they begin to taper.

Danish: Faconen på båden justeres med de lange bordvridere som kan trække ned i bordet, eller med skorestokke nedefra, der kan skubbe bordene op i den ønskede facon.
English: The shape of the boat is adjusted by pressing either downwards or upwards in the planks, until they acquire the correct shape.

Danish: Den færdige båds form blev dokumenteret i to omgange, i maj 1999 før søsætningen og i oktober 2000 efter afslutningen af sejlsæsonen.
English: The shape of the finished reconstructed vessel was documented twice, first in May 1999 before launching and again in October 2000 at the close of the sea trials of that year.

Danish: Skroget rekonstrueres ud fra de bevarede dele af originalskibet.
English: The shape of the hull is reconstructed based on the preserved parts of the original ship.

Danish: Formen på det foregående bords overkant måles op og overføres på den nye bordplanke.
English: The shape of the previous strake is marked off and transferred to the new strake.

Danish: Pelsen kan variere i…
English: The sheep fur varies…

Danish: Fleksibilitet Essingen (den øverste langsgående forstærkning) spytter ikke længere trækilerne ud af trænaglerne, som den gjorde sidste år.
English: The sheer (the uppermost longitudinal reinforcement) no longer spits out the wedges, as it did last year.

Danish: Skjoldene er ikke alle bevaret på Sønder Kirkeby-afbildningen, men der har formodentlig næppe været over 12 at se.
English: The shields do not all survive on the Sønder Kirkeby depiction but there would probably have been more than 12 of them originally.

Danish: Skjoldene i dette fund udgør den største samling af bevarede træskjolde fra hele Europas forhistorie.
English: The shields in the find make up the largest collection of surviving shields from the prehistoric period in Europe.

Danish: Skjoldene på stævnene af nogle af skibene, og lanternen i MORA's mastetop fortæller os om, hvordan man kommunikerede, når en stor flåde skulle holdes i orden under et angreb.
English: The shields on the stems of some of the ships and the lantern at MORA’s mast-top reveal how communication took place when a large fleet was to be kept together under an attack.

Danish: Skjoldene på stævnene bærer formodentlig de enkelte stormænds mærker
English: The shields on the stems probably bear the standards of the individual magnates

Danish: Skibet og besætningen har prøvet det før: I 2006 sejlede Ottar til Edinburgh i Skotland.
English: The ship and crew have all tried it before: In 2006, Ottar sailed to Edinburgh in Scotland.

Danish: Så langt har mandskab og skib ikke prøvet at sejle før i ét stræk”, siger Carsten Hvid.
English: The ship and crew have never sailed so far in one stretch before", says Carsten Hvid.

Danish: Op i mod 100.000 mennesker var mødt op for at byde skib og besætning velkommen.
English: The ship and crew were greeted by around 100.000 spectators.

Danish: Skibet, og dets besætning på 61 mænd og kvinder fra hele verden, kan fortælle en historie om et af Vikingetidens mest spektakulære militære instrumenter, som gav Danmark en stærk magtposition i Europa.
English: The ship and its crew of 61 men and women from all over the world can tell a story about one of the Vikings' most spectacular military devices, which gave Denmark a strong position of power in Europe.

Danish: Skibet, og dets besætning på 61 mænd og kvinder fra hele verden, kan fortælle en historie om et af Vikingetidens mest spektakulære militære instrumenter, som gav Danmark en stærk magtposition i Europa.
English: The ship and its crew of 61 men and women from all over the world can tell a story about one of the Vikings’ most spectacular military devices, which gave Denmark a strong position of power in Europe.

Danish: Skib og besætning bliver i Spangereid til vinden vender og kan bringe dem op langs Norges vestkyst og over Nordsøen.
English: The ship and its crew will stay in Spangereid until the wind is able to bring the ship round the Norwegian west coast and across the North Sea.

Danish: Skibet og den 60 mand store besætning returnerer til Roskilde den 28. juli kl. 14.00.
English: The ship and the 60-man crew returns to Roskilde on 28 July 14:00.

Danish: Skibet og projektet er med til at markedsføre Danmark i et omfang og på en måde, som måler sig med de største danske sportspræstationer i nyere tid, og netop derfor er det vigtigt at vi vælger det rigtige sted!”, slutter Tinna Damgård-Sørensen.
English: The ship and the project help market Denmark to a degree and in a way that measures up to the biggest Danish sporting triumphs in recent time, and that is precisely why it is important that we pick the right place!” concludes Tinna Damgård-Sørensen.

Danish: Skibet blev verdensberømt, da det gennemførte den spektakulære forsøgsrejse fra Roskilde, nord om Skotland til den irske hovedstad Dublin i 2007, og tilbage til Roskilde syd om England i 2008.
English: The ship became world famous when it undertook the spectacular test sailing from Roskilde, north around Scotland to the Irish capital, Dublin, in 2007 and back to Roskilde, going south around the English coast in 2008.

Danish: Skibet blev verdensberømt, da det gennemførte den spektakulære forsøgsrejse fra Roskilde, nord om Skotland til den irske hovedstad Dublin i 2007, og tilbage til Roskilde syd om England i 2008.
English: The ship became world famous when it undertook the spectacular trial voyage from Roskilde, north around Scotland to the Irish capital, Dublin, in 2007 and back to Roskilde, going south around the English coast in 2008.

Danish: Derudover kan skibet fortælle om datidens skibsteknologi samt materialeanvendelse og -forståelse.
English: The ship can also tell us about the ship technology at the time and the use and understanding of materials.

Danish: Skibet vil kunne tilføre museet ny attraktionsværdi som udstillingsgenstand i en ny udstillingsbygning, hvor historien om rekonstruktionen, bygning og sejladsen kan fortælles som en enestående, sammenhængende og klart fattelig historie.
English: The ship can give the museum new attraction value as an exhibition object in a new exhibition building, where the story of the reconstruction, building and voyage can be told as a unique, coherent and comprehensible story.

Danish: Skibet klarede sig fantastisk, kravlede over den ene sø efter den anden, vred sig og rystede i hele skroget for hver bølge den mødte, men fortsatte ufortrødent videre.
English: The ship coped fantastically, crawling over swell after swell, the whole hull twisting and shaking with every wave it met, but continuing undaunted.

Danish: I sin opbygning afviger langskibet ikke fra det, vi kender fra andre af den senere vikingetids større skibe.
English: The ship does not differ in its basic construction from that of other large ships known from Late Viking times.

Danish: Skibet er øjensynligt forlist på overgangen mellem lavt og dybt vand lige nedenfor det middelalderlige Skt. Jørgensbjerg, centralt i Roskildes daværende havneområde.
English: The ship evidently sank in the transition from deep to shallow water just below the medieval Saint Jørgensbjerg, which was in the centre of Roskilde‘s harbour area at that time.

Danish: Skibsfundene bekræfter, at vikingernes plyndrings- og erobringstogter samt togter over Nordatlanten var mulige.
English: The ship finds confirm that the Vikings’ expeditions of pillage and conquest and their voyages across the North Atlantic were indeed possible.

Danish: Skibet fra gravpladsen ved Hedeby er meget dårligt bevaret.
English: The ship from the grave at Hedeby was very poorly preserved.

Danish: Sidste år fik skibet også en pose penge.
English: The ship got the same last year.

Danish: Skibsgraffitien på kirkeskibets nordvæg i Fortun stavkirke.
English: The ship graffiti from the north wall of the nave in the stave church at Fortun in Norway.

Danish: Skibet havde 322 besætningsmedlemmer, hovedsagligt unge mænd.
English: The ship had a crew of 322, mainly young men.

Danish: Skibet havde haft en længde på godt 21,5 m og var næsten 3 m bredt midtskibs.
English: The ship had a length of rather more than 21.5 m and was almost 3 m wide amidships.

Danish: Skibet har haft en imponerende rig.
English: The ship had an impressive rigging.

Danish: Skibet var meget repareret på forlistidspunktet, og det har formodentligt haft en betragtelig levealder.
English: The ship had been extensively repaired at the time it sank and it was probably quite old at that time.

Danish: Skibet var blevet trukket ind på lavt vand i Roskildes daværende havneområde og delvist hugget op.
English: The ship had been hauled up into shallow water in Roskilde's Viking harbour area and partially broken up.

Danish: Skibet var meget omhyggeligt bygget.
English: The ship had been very skilfully built.

Danish: Her har den i tre døgn ventet på gunstig vind på sin rejse hjem til Roskilde.
English: The ship had been waiting three days in Wicklow for a favourable wind for its journey home to Roskilde.

Danish: Skibet har haft mandskabsdæk for og agter samt et åbent lastrum midtskibs.
English: The ship had decks fore and aft as well as an open hold amidships.

Danish: Skibet er årringsdateret til ca. 1250-65 e. Kr.
English: The ship has been dendrochronologically dated to ca. 1250-65 AD.

Danish: Siden er skibet blevet bygget i fuld størrelse af Stiftelsen Nytt Osebergskip (SNOS) i Tønsberg, og byggeriet har taget udgangspunkt i den model og de tegninger, som Vibeke Bischoff fremstillede.
English: The ship has since been built in full scale by Stiftelsen Nytt Osebergskip (SNOS) in Tønsberg, and the construction was based on the model and drawings, which were produced by Vibeke Bischoff.

Danish: Skibet skal hjem til Roskilde igen og der er rigtig mange detaljer der skal på plads.
English: The ship has to come home to Roskilde again and there really are a lot of things that need doing.

Danish: Skibet har:
English: The ship has:

Danish: Skibet her var blevet fundet i 1977, og undersøgelser viser det som et fartøj der størrelsesmæssigt ligger mellem Skuldelev 5 og Ladby, men som dateringsmæssigt ligger nærmest Ladby – også Puck 2 daterer sig til starten af 900-tallet.
English: The ship here was found in 1977 and analyses have revealed it to be a vessel which, in terms of its dimensions, lies between Skuldelev 5 and Ladby, but in terms of date lies closest to Ladby – Puck 2 can also be dated to the beginning of the 10th century.

Danish: Skibet er en rekonstruktion af Skuldelev 2-langskibet, der blev udgravet i Roskilde Fjord i 1962 sammen med fire andre vikingeskibe.
English: The ship is a reconstruction of the longship, Skuldelev 2, which was excavated from Roskilde Fjord in 1962, together with four other Viking ships.

Danish: Skibet er en rekonstruktion af Skuldelev 2 vraget, som blev bygget i området omkring Dublin i 1042.
English: The ship is a reconstruction of the Skuldelev 2 wreck, which was built in the area around Dublin in 1042.

Danish: Skibet er en rekonstruktion af Skuldelev 2, som oprindeligt blev bygget i Irland i 1042.
English: The ship is a reconstruction of the Skuldelev 2, which was originally built in Ireland in 1042.

Danish: Skibet er et lille rejse- og lastskib, oprindelig 14.0 m langt med slanke linier og gennemført godt håndværk.
English: The ship is a small transport and cargo ship, originally 14.0 m long with slender lines that display consistently good workmanship.

Danish: Skibet er et mindre krigsskib, oprindelig 17,3 m langt og indrettet til roning for 26 mand.
English: The ship is a smallish warship, originally 17.3 m long and adapted for rowing by 26 men.

Danish: Skibet er et kraftigt lastskib, oprindelig 16.0 m langt, bygget i Vestnorge omkring 1030.
English: The ship is a sturdy cargo ship, originally 16.0 m long, built in western Norway about 1030.

Danish: Skibet er en krigsmaskine, skabt til høj fart og mange tropper.
English: The ship is a warmachine, designed for high speed and carrying many troops.

Danish: Skibet ledsages også af store, stemningsfulde og dramatiske fotografier fra sejladsen.
English: The ship is also accompanied by large, evocative and dramatic photographs from the voyage.

Danish: Skibet har været ca. 30 m langt, et egentligt langskib, bygget i omegnen af Dublin i Irland, men inden for den nordiske skibsbygningstradition.
English: The ship is an approx. 30 m-long longship, built in the region of Dublin in Ireland but within the Nordic shipbuilding tradition.

Danish: Skibet er tilbage i vandet
English: The ship is back in its element

Danish: Skibet bygges af professionelle bådebygger og frivillige i fællesskab.
English: The ship is being built by professional boat builders and volunteers in cooperation.

Danish: Skibet er bygget med kraftige planker af fyrretræ og har fyldige former, der giver stor lasteevne og høj sødygtighed på Nordatlanten.
English: The ship is built of heavy pine planks, and has a rounded form that gives it a high loading capacity and great seaworthiness on the North Atlantic.

Danish: Skibet er bygget af egetræ, 21,5 meter langt og godt 5 meter bredt og har plads til 30 roere.
English: The ship is built of oak, is 21.5m long and some 5m broad, and has room for 30 oarsmen.

Danish: Skibet er derudover delt op i rum, svarende til de forskellige funktioner, der skal bemandes under sejlads.
English: The ship is divided into invisible rooms matching the different functions that need to be manned during sailing.

Danish: Skibet er udstyret med 60 årer - og 60 skjolde, der er monteret langs skibets øverste kant, essingen.
English: The ship is equipped with 60 oars and 60 shileds, which are mounted along the ship's upper edge, the gunwale..

Danish: Om bord på skibet er der monteret kommunikations-udstyr, der gør det muligt at følge skibets sejlads med oplysninger om kurs, fart og position.
English: The ship is equipped with communications equipment that makes it possible to follow the ship's journey through data about its course, speed and position.

Danish: Om bord på skibet er der monteret kommunikations-udstyr, der gør det muligt at følge skibets sejlads med oplysninger om kurs, fart og position.
English: The ship is equipped with communications equipment that makes it possible to follow the ship’s journey through data about its course, speed and position.

Danish: Skibet er udstyret med "stævnskæg" for og agter, en konstruktionsdetalje som endnu er ukendt i de arkæologiske fund
English: The ship is equipped with “stem-beards” both fore and aft, a construction feature that has not so far been recorded in archaeological finds

Danish: Om bord på skibet er der monteret kommunikations-udstyr, der gør det muligt at følge skibets sejlads med oplysninger om kurs, fart og position.
English: The ship is fitted with communications equipment, which makes it possible to follow the ship and its progress with data on its course, speed and position.

Danish: Skibet hedder Havhingsten fra Glendalough.
English: The ship is named The Sea Stallion from Glendalough.

Danish: Skibet er gået i havn ved Glommen, lidt nord for Falkenberg i Sverige, hvor teltet er rejst og aftenhyggen har sænket sig.
English: The ship is now anchored in the small harbor of Glommen, just north of Falkenberg in Sweden, where the tents are pitched and the cosiness of the evening has taken over.

Danish: Nu ligger skibet fortøjet i Dublin Ports enorme industrihavn.
English: The ship is now moored in Dublin Port's enormous industrial harbour.

Danish: Havhingsten er online via satellit og den aktuelle position kan døgnet rundt følges på www.havhingsten.dk.
English: The ship is on-line via satellite and its current position can always be seen at www.havhingsten.dk.

Danish: Skibet er organiseret i rum, som afgrænses af de tofter (bænke), som roerne sidder på.
English: The ship is organised into six rooms, each delimited by the thwarts (benches) on which the oarsmen sit.

Danish: Skibet stages det sidste stykke ind på kysten, masten lægges og hestene springer over rælingen ned i det lave vand.
English: The ship is poled the last part of the way to the coast, the mast is laid down and the horses jump over the gunwale down into the shallow water.

Danish: Skibet er klart og kursen skal sættes mod fremmede kyster og handelsstationer.
English: The ship is prepared and the course must be set for foreign coasts and trading stations.

Danish: Skibet har formodentlig været 15 meter langt og 3 meter bredt, men også her var meget lidt bevaret.
English: The ship is presumed to have been 15 m long and 3 m wide, but very little of it was preserved.

Danish: Turen går stort set ud i det blå.
English: The ship is sailing off into the blue.

Danish: Skibet er det bedst bevaret af de fem Skuldelevskibe med hele 75 % af skroget intakt.
English: The ship is the best preserved of the five Skuldelev ships with 75 % of the hull intact.

Danish: Skibet er det bedst bevaret af de fem vikingeskibe, fundet i Roskilde Fjord, og er bygget af dansk egetræ.
English: The ship is the best preserved of the five Viking ships found in Roskilde Fjord, and was built of Danish oak.

Danish: Skibet er fundets mindste skib, oprindelig ca. 11,2 m langt, bygget i samme område i Vestnorge og på samme tid, omkring 1030, som Skuldelev 1.
English: The ship is the smallest ship of the find, originally about 11.2 m long, built in the same region in western Norway and at the same time, ca 1030, as Skuldelev 1.

Danish: Skibet er der, besætningen er fortsat aktiv og mange oplevelser venter forude.
English: The ship is there, the crew is still active and many experiences can be anticipated in the future.

Danish: Selve skibet er særdeles smukt udført med flot udskåret ornamentik langs hele bunden og statelige spiralsnoede slangehoveder på stævnen.
English: The ship itself is exquisitely made, with beautiful carved ornament along the keel and with stately, spiral-shaped snake-heads on the stems.

Danish: Skibet forlod Den Helder i Holland klokken 8.30 i morges
English: The ship left Den Helder in Holland at 8.30 this morning

Danish: Skibet ligger på sydsiden af Kalverev, et lavvandet område syd-vest for Masnedø.
English: The ship lies on the south side of Kalverev, an area of shallow water southwest of Masnedø.

Danish: Skibslisten bidrager til at give et indblik i organiseringen af maritim magt ved vikingetidens slutning.
English: The ship list helps to gain an insight into the organisation of maritime power at the end of the Viking Age.

Danish: Skibet fik god fart på, her sejler de omkring 6,5 knob.
English: The ship made good speed, here are sailing the around 6.5 knots.

Danish: Skibet kunne bringe ejeren og hans følge til markeder eller møde på tinget.
English: The ship may have been used when the owner and his associates or family travelled to to a market or meetings at the assembly.

Danish: Skibet var mellem 23 og 27 meter langt og var sandsynligvis et stort roskib.
English: The ship measured between 23 m and 27 m in length and was probably propelled by rowing.

Danish: Skibet har fået et brat endeligt, tilsyneladende før det var udtjent.
English: The ship met an abrupt end, apparently before it had reached the end of its useful life.

Danish: Skibet gøres nu klar til den store tur hjem.
English: The ship must now be got ready for the long journey home.

Danish: Skibet forliste formentlig under en undvigemanøvre - efterfulgt af en fatal grundstødning - fra de faldende bomber.
English: The ship probably capsized while taking evasive action from the falling bombs - followed by fatally going aground.

Danish: Skibet forliste formentlig under en undvigemanøvre – efterfulgt af en fatal grundstødning – fra de faldende bomber.
English: The ship probably capsized while taking evasive action from the falling bombs – followed by fatally going aground.

Danish: Saga Oseberg har sat kursen mod Roskilde
English: The ship Saga Oseberg is a little sensation.

Danish: Skibet sejlede fra Roskilde den 4. juli og forventes tilbage lørdag den 18. juli, alt efter vejr og vind.
English: The ship sailed from Roskilde July 4th and is expected back on July 18, depending on the weather.

Danish: Skibet skulle være hjemmehørende i Tønsberg, ikke langt fra Oseberg, hvor det oprindelige skib i sin tid blev fundet.
English: The ship shall be located in Tønsberg, not far from Oseberg, where the original ship was originally found.

Danish: Skibet som 1. juli 2007 sejler til Dublin er ikke mage til skibet, som blev søsat i 2004.
English: The Ship that departs for Dublin on the 1st of July 2007 is not completely similar to the ship that was first launched in 2004.

Danish: Det var en drake, bygd slik som Ormen, som kongen hadde hatt med fra Hålogaland; men dette skipet var mye større og mer forseggjort på alle måter.
English: The ship was a dragon, built after the one the king had captured in Halogaland; but this ship was far larger, and more carefully put together in all her parts.

Danish: Da han kom tilbake, var bordkledningen lagt.
English: The ship was both long and broad and high-sided, and strongly timbered.

Danish: Skipet var både langt og bredt, det var høyt opp til relinga og bygd av svært tømmer.
English: The ship was both long and broad and high-sided, and strongly timbered.

Danish: Skibet er bygget omkring 1040 af egematerialer fra dansk område.
English: The ship was built about 1040 of oak from Denmark.

Danish: Skibet er bygget i Danmark omkring 1030 med en bund af nyt egetræ, men med planker af fyr og ask fra to forskellige skibe genanvendt i den øvre del af skibssiden.
English: The ship was built in Denmark around 1030 and its bottom was constructed of new oak timbers, but planks of pine and ash from two different ships were re-used in the upper part of the sides of the ship.

Danish: Skibet var bygget for indsamlede midler af en norsk-amerikansk sømandsforening.
English: The ship was built using funds donated by the Norwegian-American Seamen's Association.

Danish: Skibet er bygget i klinkbygningsteknik, hvor plankerne overlapper hinanden, så skibssiden er ikke glat, men har ”trapper” på ydersiden.
English: The ship was built using the clinker-building technique, where the planks overlap each other, so that the ship’s side isn’t smooth but has a series of ‘steps’ on its outer surface.

Danish: Skibet er blevet bygget med stor omhu og med udvalgte materialer.
English: The ship was built with great care and with carefully selected materials.

Danish: Skibet er bygget med de metoder, materialer og værktøj, som vikingetidens bådebyggere brugte, og skibet repræsenterer noget af det tætteste, vi kommer de oprindelige skibe.
English: The ship was constructed using the very same methods, materials and tools used by the Viking boat-builders and the ship is about as close as it is possible to get to the original ships.

Danish: Skibet er bygget med de samme metoder, materialer og værktøj, som vikingetidens bådebyggere brugte, og skibet repræsenterer noget af det tætteste, vi kommer de oprindelige skibe.
English: The ship was constructed using the very same methods, materials and tools used by the Viking boat-builders and the ship is about as close as it is possible to get to the original ships.

Danish: Hele dagen blev skibet tømt for udstyr og rengjort og sent torsdag aften kørte en kæmpe blokvogn igennem byen med en mageløs last.
English: The ship was emptied for equipment, cleaned and late Thursday night a big truck drove through Dublin with a magnificent cargo.

Danish: Skibet var udstyret med et omfattende og pladskrævende elektronisk måleudstyr baseret på det daværende Decca-system.
English: The ship was equipped with comprehensive and bulky electronic measuring equipment based on the then Decca system.

Danish: Skibet er øjensynligt ophugget på lavt vand nedenfor det middelalderlige Skt. Jørgensbjerg, centralt i Roskildes daværende havneområde.
English: The ship was evidently broken up in shallow water below the medieval Saint Jørgensbjerg, which was in the centre of Roskilde‘s harbour area at that time.

Danish: Skibet var mere vellykket end Hugin.
English: The ship was more successful than Hugin.

Danish: Skibet er øjensynlig bygget af en kyndig skibs-bygger.
English: The ship was obviously built by an experienced boatbuilder.

Danish: Siden søsætningen er der blevet sejlet med skibet ved flere træningssejladser og på det store togt til Dublin og retur til Roskilde i 2007-2008.
English: The ship was on a sea trial from Roskilde to Dublin in 2007 and from Dublin to Roskilde in 2008.

Danish: Skibet var kun dårligt bevaret, men da kølen var bevaret i sin fulde længde, har det ikke været svært at fastslå længden.
English: The ship was poorly preserved, but as the keel was preserved in its full length, it was not difficult to establish the length of the vessel.

Danish: Da han havde tabt slaget ved Hastings til Vilhelm Erobreren, søgte hans familie tilflugt og hjælp hos den irske konge Diarmait mac Máel na mBó af Leinster i det sydøstlige hjørne af Irland.
English: The ship was possibly a defensive vessel, i.e. it not only formed part of the local defense force, but was also one of the smallest units in the Danish fleet of the period.

Danish: Skibet har muligvis været et leddingskib, dvs. at det ikke blot har indgået i det lokale forsvar, men også som en af de mindste enheder i Danmarks datidige flåde.
English: The ship was possibly a defensive vessel, i.e. it not only formed part of the local defense force, but was also one of the smallest units in the Danish fleet of the period.

Danish: Skibet er formodentlig bygget af slaviske skibsbyggere, der på dette tidspunkt brugte næsten de samme metoder som de skandinaviske, og det er kun i enkelte træk at skibets ikke-skandinaviske herkomst røber sig.
English: The ship was probably built by Slavic shipbuilders who, at that time, used almost the same construction methods as their Scandinavian counterparts and there are only a few features which reveal the ship's non-Scandinavian origins.

Danish: Skibet er formodentlig bygget af slaviske skibsbyggere, der på dette tidspunkt brugte næsten de samme metoder som de skandinaviske, og det er kun i enkelte træk at skibets ikke-skandinaviske herkomst røber sig.
English: The ship was probably built by Slavic shipbuilders who, at that time, used almost the same construction methods as their Scandinavian counterparts and there are only a few features which reveal the ship’s non-Scandinavian origins.

Danish: De vender hjem igen den 22. juli
English: The ship wil return to Roskilde July 22.

Danish: Skibet vil også medbringe en mobil udstilling til brug i havne, som Havhingsten anløber.
English: The ship will also bring a mobile exhibition for use in harbours the Sea Stallion visits.

Danish: Skibet medbringer desuden en mobiludstilling, spændende fortællinger og en række prøv-selv vikingeaktiviteter for børn.
English: The ship will also bring a mobile exhibition, exciting lectures and a series of ‘try it yourself' Viking activities for children.

Danish: Skibet medbringer desuden en mobiludstilling, spændende fortællinger og en række prøv-selv vikingeaktiviteter for børn.
English: The ship will also bring a mobile exhibition, exciting lectures and a series of ‘try it yourself’ Viking activities for children.

Danish: Skibet medbringer desuden en mobiludstilling, spændende fortællinger og en række prøv-selv vikingeaktiviteter for børn.
English: The ship will also bring a mobile exhibition, exciting stories and a series of ‘try it yourself' Viking activities for children.

Danish: Skibet medbringer desuden en mobiludstilling, spændende fortællinger og en række prøv-selv vikingeaktiviteter for børn.
English: The ship will also bring a mobile exhibition, exciting stories and a series of ‘try it yourself’ Viking activities for children.

Danish: Skibet medbringer desuden en udstilling, spændende fortællinger og en række prøv-selv vikingeaktiviteter for børn.
English: The ship will also bring a mobile exhibition, exciting stories and a series of ‘try it yourself’ Viking activities for children.

Danish: Det vil kunne tiltrække flere gæster, og dermed bidrage til at stabilisere og udvikle museets fremtidige drift.
English: The ship will be able to attract more guests and thereby contribute to stabilising and developing the future work of the museum.

Danish: Skibet søsættes klokken 12.00
English: The ship will be launched at 12:00.

Danish: Her skal skibet ligge til på lørdag, hvor besætningen går om bord og ror skibet gennem Berlins Centrum.
English: The ship will lie here until Saturday, where the crew will go on board and row the ship through Berlin's centre.

Danish: Skibet skal jo overvintre ved Nationalmuseet i Dublin, indtil det i 2008 sejler retur til Roskilde.
English: The ship will winter at the National Museum of Ireland in Dublin, until 2008 where it will sail back to Roskilde.

Danish: Skibets bådsmand Helene Bjerregaard vil skrive rejsebrev undervejs, så du kan få oplevelserne derudefra hevet helt ind i stuen.
English: The ship's boatswain, Helene Bjerregaard, will write a travel blog along the way so that you can experience the voyage from your own home.

Danish: Skibets kurs og fart kan tegnes som en streg med en bestemt længde og retning - en vektor.
English: The ship's course and speed can be drawn as a line of a particular length and direction - a vector.

Danish: Skibets kurs og fart kan tegnes som en streg med en bestemt længde og retning – en vektor.
English: The ship's course and speed can be drawn as a line of a particular length and direction – a vector.

Danish: Skibets besætning havde en god dag på Spree, her på vej forbi Rigsdagsbygningen.
English: The ship's crew had a good day on the Spree, seen here on their way past the Reichstag building.

Danish: Skibsspigerne er varmgalvaniseret.
English: The ship's nails are hot-dip galvanised.

Danish: Skibets sygeplejerske videreformidler i anonymiseret form de sundhedsinformationer, der er interessante for forskningen, i sygedagbogen på nettet.
English: The ship's nurse will enter health data of scientific interest in the web version of the nurse's log in anonymised form.

Danish: Især skibets bagbords side er velbevaret, og fartøjet lod sig rekonstruere som et 17,3 m langt, 2,47 m bredt og midtskibs 1,16 m dybt roskib med 13 par årer.
English: The ship's port side in particular is well preserved and the vessel could be reconstructed as an oar-powered ship, 17.3 m long, 2.47 m wide and 1.16 m deep midships, and with 13 pairs of oars.

Danish: Skibets sejl skal trimmes alt efter vindretningen.
English: The ship's sail is trimmed according to the direction of the wind.

Danish: Når emnet passer, skæres overkanten på bundstokken, og den kan sættes fast.
English: The ship's shape is plotted directly onto the timber, which is then sawn using a band saw

Danish: skibets sider bliver trykket ind og ud
English: The ship's sides are pushed in and out

Danish: Skibets svage punkt har derimod – forventeligt – vist sig at være sideroret; alle store vikingeskibes akilleshæl.
English: The ship's weak point has, on the other hand, predictably proved to be the side-rudder: the Achilles heel of all large Viking ships.

Danish: Skibet, der dendrokronologisk er dateret til omkring 1060-65, stammer formodentlig fra Jylland/Slesvig-Holsten.
English: The ship, which has been dendrochronologically dated to around 1060-65, probably comes from Jutland/Slesvig-Holstein.

Danish: Skibet, som jo er en af de fem Skuldelevskibe som i 1962 blev udgravet og siden udstillet i Vikingeskibshallen i Roskilde, findes også i en rekonstrueret udgave.
English: The ship, which is one of the five Skuldelev ships that were excavated in 1962 and subsequently exhibited in the Viking Ship Hall in Roskilde, also exists in a reconstructed version.

Danish: Skibet, der kun viser få spor af reparationer, er blevet trukket ind på lavt vand på ruller, og der hugget op, således at kun dele af bordlægningen - primært i styrbords side - samt køl, kølloter og ganske få spantfragmenter er bevaret.
English: The ship, which only shows signs of minor repairs, has been pulled over wooden logs into low water and broken up there so that only parts of the planking, primarily on the starboard side, and parts of the keel and a few frame fragments have been preserved.

Danish: Skibet, der kun viser få spor af reparationer, er blevet trukket ind på lavt vand på ruller, og der hugget op, således at kun dele af bordlægningen – primært i styrbords side – samt køl, kølloter og ganske få spantfragmenter er bevaret.
English: The ship, which only shows signs of minor repairs, has been pulled over wooden logs into low water and broken up there so that only parts of the planking, primarily on the starboard side, and parts of the keel and a few frame fragments have been preserved.

Danish: Skibet, der skal bygges på Vikingeskibsmuseet, er en rekonstruktion af det såkaldte Skuldelev 3-skib, et mindre handelsskib fra år 1040.
English: The ship, which will be built at the Viking Ship Museum, is a reconstruction of the ship-find, Skuldelev 3, a small trading ship from ca 1040.

Danish: Skibsafbildningerne optræder i forskellige sammenhænge, og dermed også i forskellige materialer.
English: The ship-delineations appear in various contexts and hence also in different materials.

Danish: Skuldelev 3-skibet blev udgravet i 1962 ved Skuldelev i Roskilde Fjord.
English: The ship-find Skuldelev 3, was excavated from Roskilde Fjord near Skuldelev in 1962.

Danish: Skuldelev 3-skibet blev udgravet i 1962 ved Skuldelev i Roskilde Fjord.
English: The ship-find, Skuldelev 3, was excavated in 1962, near Skuldelev on Roskilde Fjord.

Danish: Skibsfundene fortæller historier om de mennesker som byggede og anvendte skibene.
English: The ship-finds tell stories about the people building and using the ships.

Danish: Sammen med de ovenfor nævnte kriterier tyder skibsfundene på, at forudsætningerne for en professionelt organiseret søhandel (jf. det store skib i Slesvig nævnt i legenden om den hellige Thomas af Canterbury) blev udviklet og opretholdt igennem disse århundreder:
English: The ship-finds, in combination with the other indicators outlined above, suggest that the conditions for specialised merchant seafaring mentioned in the legend of St Thomas of Canterbury and the big ship in Schleswig developed and prevailed during these centuries:

Danish: Skibsgraven fra Ladby hører til blandt de største, og bedst kendte, skibsgrave fra vikingetiden.
English: The ship-grave from Ladby is one of the major ship-graves from 10th century AD.

Danish: Skibsgraven fra Ladby blev udgravet af konservator G. Rosenberg og apoteker P. Helweg Mikkelsen i 1934-1937, og deres optegnelser udgør i dag de primære kilder til oplysninger om fundet.
English: The ship-grave from Ladby was excavated by G. Rosenberg, conservator, and P. Helweg Mikkelsen, pharmacist, in 1934-1937, and their drawings today constitute the primary source-material for information on the find.

Danish: Skibsgraven er anlagt på en gravplads, som ud fra naturvidenskabelige dateringer samt af den relative datering af gravenes genstandsinventar kan antages at være blevet benyttet før anlæggelsen af skibsgraven.
English: The ship-grave was constructed on a burial site which must be assumed, on the basis of scientific dating and the relative dating of the artefact-content of the graves, to have been in use before the construction of the ship-grave.

Danish: Skibsgraven blev udgravet af konservator G. Rosenberg og apoteker P. Helweg Mikkelsen i 1934-1937, og deres optegnelser udgør i dag de primære kilder til oplysninger om fundet.
English: The ship-grave was excavated by G. Rosenberg, conservator, and P. Helweg Mikkelsen, pharmacist, in 1934-1937, and their drawings today constitute the primary source-material for information on the find.

Danish: Sparlösa-stenens skibsbillede er også usædvanligt.
English: The ship-representation on the Sparlösa stone is also unusual.

Danish: Bistand med den skibstekniske vurdering af fartøjet og med udarbejdelsen af de endelige rekonstruktionstegninger ydedes af ingeniør Fr. Johannessen fra Oslo.
English: The ship-technical assessment of the vessel and the final reconstruction drawings were provided by the naval architect F. Johannessen from Oslo.

Danish: De skibstekniske detaljer, som kan læses ud af billedet, er få men væsentlige.
English: The ship-technical details that can be read out of the picture are few but significant.

Danish: Skibet indgår ikke i nogen af Grønnegaard havn udbygningsfaser og derfor må det være et fartøj som er strandet i området, måske under en vinterstorm i 1609, som omtales i de historiske kilder.
English: The ship-wreck does not represent any specific phase of the harbour-filling works, therefore it must have sunk accidentally on the site, possibly during a historically recorded winter storm in 1609.

Danish: Havde man blot anvendt en traditionel opmålingsmetode ville det havde været for tidskrævende og umuligt at opmåle alle skibene inden for en overskuelig tid.
English: The shipbuilder first placed pre-designed identical cleats on the side of the bottom planks at the turn of the bilge.

Danish: Skibsbyggeren kunne derefter blot fæstne en bordplanke på disse klamper for at holde en ensartet vinkel mellem bunden og den nederste kimmingsplanke; på denne enkelt måde, var han i stand til at kontrollere formen i overgangen mellem skibets bund og side.
English: The shipbuilder was subsequently able to attached the first bilge planks on these, and keep them at a constant angle, thus shaping the bilge in a simplified manner, but with constant control of shape.

Danish: Undersøgelsen af B&W 5 antyder at skibsbyggeren som byggede det oprindelige skrog har anvendt et enkelt geometrisk system, som har visse analogier med den engelske metode, relateret til det skeletbaseret byggeri.
English: The shipbuilder who designed B&W 5 used a simple geometrical system, that has certain analogies with the English method (related to the alternative skeleton-based concept).

Danish: Byggeriet, der foregik på værftspladsen, indgik i et større forsknings- og formidlingsprojekt, der bl.a. havde til formål at give større viden om vikingetidens langskibe, materialer, værktøj, byggeprocesser, sejl og rig - og at skabe en større offentlig bevidsthed om den maritime del af vores kulturarv.
English: The shipbuilding was part of a bigger research and dissemination project aimed at providing a better understanding of Viking Age longships, maritime craftsmanship and resources for shipbuilding in the Viking Age in general.

Danish: Dampskibsselskabet ”NORDEN” er sponsor for besætningens redningsdragter
English: The shipping company “NORDEN” has sponsored immersion suits for the crew

Danish: Skibene bliver fremstillet som forholdsvis korte og høje, og det største antal årehuller, der kan tælles i et enkelt skib er 18 på det skib, der bringer Harold jarl tilbage til England.
English: The ships are depicted as being comparatively short and tall, and the largest number of oar-holes that can be counted on an individual ship is 18 on the ship which is bringing jarl Harold back to England.
