Danish: Skibene fyldes med sten og sænkes i Peberrenden, den mest direkte rute til Roskilde.
English: The ships are filled with stones and sunk in Peberrenden, the most direct route to Roskilde. the sailing channel.

Danish: Skibene er pakket med anderledes historiske oplevelser, og fra den 20. til den 31. juli vil de tre vikinge- og middelalderskibe – med 'Havhingsten' i front - sejle den historiske festival 'TOGTET' ud til de sjællandske byer: Roskilde, Orø, Rørvig, Kalundborg og Korsør.
English: The ships are packed with unusual historical experiences, and from the 20th – 31st July, the three ships – with Sea Stallion in front – will sail as part of the historical festival 'TOGTET' - 'The Raid', visiting the following towns on Sjælland: Roskilde, Orø, Rørvig, Kalundborg and Korsør.

Danish: Skibene vidner om vikingetidens specialiserede skibsfart, om krig og togter, om handel og rejser til fjerne egne og om livet i Norden for 1000 år siden.
English: The ships bear witness to the specialised sea faring of the Viking Age, to wars and raids, trade and voyages to distant shores and life in the North 1000 years ago.

Danish: Klassen af de store lastskibe havde en betydeligt større lasteevne end den mellemstore klasse.
English: The ships belonging to the class of large cargo vessels had a considerably larger capacity than the medium sized group of cargo vessels.

Danish: Skibene kunne dateres til 1000-tallet, og var dermed omkring et århundrede yngre end dateringerne af det yngste af de norske vikingeskibe, Gokstad-skibet, og Ladby-skibet.
English: The ships could be dated to the 11th century and were, accordingly, about a century later than the dates for the latest of the Norwegian Viking ships, the Gokstad ship, and the Ladby ship.

Danish: Analysen af skibets funktioner, organisation og logistik vil blive baseret på skibets logbog og sejlmanual, rum-formændenes dagbøger, sygeplejerskens og kokkens dagbog samt film- og foto-dokumentation.
English: The ships function, organization and logistics will be analysed based on the ship log book and sailing manual, the diaries of the foremen, the nurse and cook as well as film and photo documentation.

Danish: Spærringen blev anlagt ved et strømsted, hvor der i stenalderen var afsat tykke lag af østersskaller, og hvor der i rendens bund var en tærskel.
English: The ships had been scuttled at a place where a strong current passed over a natural barrier at the bottom of the channel, creating conditions for the deposition of a thick layer of oyster shells in the area.

Danish: Skibene er alle blevet rekonstrueret til sejlduelige fuldskalafartøjer over en 20-årig periode, startende med Roar Ege (Skuldelev 3) søsat 1984, afsluttet med Havhingsten af Glendalough (Skuldelev 2) søsat 2004.
English: The ships have all been reconstructed as seaworthy full-scale vessels over a period of 20 years, starting with Roar Ege (Skuldelev 3), launched in 1984, and concluding with The Sea Stallion from Glendalough (Skuldelev 2), launched in 2004.

Danish: Engelske Harold jarls skib er det første, der bliver vist under sejl.
English: The ships of the English jarl Harold is the first to be shown under sail.

Danish: Vikingetidens skibe er også oldsager, og fundet af disse har haft kolossal betydning for vores forståelse af den maritime kultur i vikingetiden.
English: The ships of the Viking Age are also artefacts and finds of them have been of enormous significance for our understanding of the maritime culture in Viking times.

Danish: Skibene vidner både om kulturen til lands og til vands.
English: The ships provide evidence of culture both on land and at sea.

Danish: De skibe, der forsat er i vandet, var blevet trukket i bølge- og vindlæ syd om bygningerne på Museumsøen.
English: The ships that are still in the water, had been pulled in the shelter south of the buildings on Museum Island.

Danish: Vikingeskibsmuseets skibe trækkes på land
English: The ships to be pulled ashore

Danish: Skibene var så velbevarede, at tanken om at bygge sejlende 1:1 rekonstruktioner af alle fem Skuldelevskibe hurtigt opstod.
English: The ships were so well preserved, that the idea of building 1:1 sailing reconstructions of all five of the Skuldelev ships quickly arose.

Danish: Hele dagen igennem vil de mange både blive trukket på land for vinteren.
English: The ships will be hauled ashore just after midday.

Danish: Skibene hales på land over middag.
English: The ships will be hauled ashore just after midday.

Danish: Skibene med stævnskæg kan dateres til 950-1025, og kommer hovedsageligt fra det nuværende Danmark og Skåne, dog med ét eksempel fra Östergötland.
English: The ships with stem-beards can be dated to between 950 and 1025 and most of them come from the present Denmark and Skåne, although there is one example from Östergötland.

Danish: Forvandlingen i Port Oriel
English: The ships' balance is fine

Danish: Skibet er i balance
English: The ships' balance is fine

Danish: Styrken i skibene lå også i denne byggeteknik.
English: The ships' strength lay in this method of construction.

Danish: Styrken i skibene lå også i denne byggeteknik.
English: The ships’ strength lay in this method of construction.

Danish: B&W 1 udviser tekniske analogier med B&W 4, men har ikke sidstnævntes simple konstruktion.
English: The shipwreck B&W 1 presents technical analogies with B&W 4, though it does not have the same simplicity of construction.

Danish: Skibets alder er allerede blevet bestemt via prøver, udtaget fra skibets planker til årringsdatering, ved de indledende undersøgelser tilbage i juni.
English: The ship’s date has already been established by dendrochronologically analysing samples taken from the ship’s planks during the initial investigations back in June.

Danish: Undersøgelsen af skibets sejlegenskaber vil dels foregå som en forsøgsrejse fra Dublin til Roskilde, dels som kontrollerede testsejladser undervejs.
English: The ship’s sailing qualities will be studied by means of both the experimental voyage from Dublin to Roskilde and standardised sailing trials on the way.

Danish: skibets sider bliver trykket ind og ud
English: The ship’s sides are pushed in and out

Danish: Skibets sejlads fra Irland blev som nævnt yderst krævende.
English: The ship’s voyage from Ireland was extremely demanding.

Danish: Museumsbutikken har også et interessant udvalg af brugsgenstande kopieret af fund fra vikingetiden, såsom frankiske drikkeglas, vikingespil og keramik.
English: The shop also has an interesting range of implements and decorations copied from finds from the Viking Age, such as Frankish drinking glasses, Viking games, ceramics, bronze and plaster casts of Nordic gods and heroes and beads and coins.

Danish: Butikkens tekstiler omfatter skind, læder og strikvarer fra Danmark og andre Nordiske lande samt tørklæder og sjaler i naturmaterialer som uld, hør og silke.
English: The shop's textiles include woollen products from Iceland, the Faroese and other Scandinavian countries, as well as scarves and shawls in natural materials such as wool, flax and silk.

Danish: Den korteste landstrækning (800 m) mellem Kerteminde Fjord og Odense Fjord findes ved den lille landsby Dræby ved Kertinge Nor.
English: The shortest distance (800 m) between Kerteminde Fjord and Odense Fjord can be found in the little village of Dræby near Kertinge Nor.

Danish: Den korteste landstrækning (800 m) mellem Kerteminde Fjord og Odense Fjord findes ved den lille landsby Dræby ved Kertinge Nor. Den 300 m brede landtange, der adskiller Ebeltoft Vig fra Begtrup Vig og forbinder Mols med halvøen Helgenæs, hedder Draget.”
English: The shortest distance (800 m) between Kerteminde Fjord and Odense Fjord can be found in the little village of Dræby near Kertinge Nor. The 300 metre wide isthmus that divides Ebeltoft Vig from Begtrup Vig and connects Mols with the Helgenæs peninsula id called Draget.”

Danish: Råbet går tydeligt igennem, selvom telefondækningen fra marinarkæologernes arbejdsflåde ud for kysten i Storstrømmen får det til at knase og suse.”
English: The shouts come across loud and clear, even though the telephone connection from the maritime archaeologists working platform off the coast in Storstrømmen isn't the best in the world.

Danish: Råbet afbryder den daglige opdatering fra projektleder Morten Johansen.
English: The shouts interrupt the daily updates from the project leader, Morten Johansen.

Danish: Sideroret var næsten lige så effektiv som stævnroret.
English: The side rudder was almost as effective as the sternpost-mounted rudder.

Danish: Det er de partier der skal spændes ud, så båden bliver bredere end stammen oprindeligt var.
English: The sides of the boat bow a little upwards in the centre of the boat.

Danish: Rufsiderne er hvide og ruftaget er grønt.
English: The sides of the deckhouse are white and the roof is green.

Danish: På siderne af stævnen er udhugget profiler, der giver det indtryk at skibssidens planker fortsætter helt op mod stævnens spids.
English: The sides of the stem have been carved such that they give the impression that the planks of the hull continue all the way up to the tip of the stem.

Danish: Betydningen af dette arrangement er ukendt for os i dag, men må have været genkendelig for datidens betragter.
English: The significance of this arrangement is unknown to us today but it must have meant something to contemporary observers.

Danish: Simplest (og uafhængig af elektronisk opsamling af data) ved opmåling af tid og distance fra start til slut eller ved opmåling af tid og distance mellem de enkelte vendinger.
English: The simplest method (which requires none of the recorded electronic data) is to calculate the time and distance from start to finish or between successive tacks.

Danish: Forliset er dendrokronologisk dateret til efter 1270, hvor en reparation er blevet foretaget på fartøjet, og byggetidspunktet ligger en kort årrække før dette tidspunkt.
English: The sinking is dendrochronologically dated to after 1270, when a repair was performed on the vessel.

Danish: Vi befinder os i området Woodstown langs den sydlige bred af floden Suir, vest for Waterford bymidte.
English: The site was in the townland of Woodstown, on the south bank of the river Suir west of Waterford city.

Danish: Størrelsen er et tydeligt tegn på, at der var store mængder sølv tilgængelig i Irland i denne periode.
English: The size is a clear indication of the availability of large quantities of silver in Ireland at this period.

Danish: Størrelserne på vikingernes flåder omtales tit, og også deres ruter, men der er praktisk taget ingen konkrete omtaler af, hvordan skibene så ud.
English: The sizes of the Viking fleets are often named, as well as the routes they took, but there are practically no concrete descriptions of what the ships looked like.

Danish: Sjægten fører sprydsejl, fok og topsejl.
English: The skiff is rigged with spritsail, foresail and topsail.

Danish: Skipper og styrmand bliver enige om, hvilket vagthold der starter sejladsen, om det er styrbord eller bagbord vagt.
English: The skipper and coxswain agree which watch will take the first turn, whether it is the starboard or the port watch.

Danish: Ligesom for 1000 år siden er det også i dag skipperen og styrmændene, der har det overordnede ansvar for skibet, besætningen, udrustningen, og for at skibet når sin destination.
English: The skipper and helmsmen - just like 1000 years ago - have overall responsibility for the ship, crew and equipment - and for making sure the ship reaches its destination.

Danish: Ligesom for 1000 år siden er det også i dag skipperen og styrmændene, der har det overordnede ansvar for skibet, besætningen, udrustningen, og for at skibet når sin destination.
English: The skipper and helmsmen – just like 1000 years ago – have overall responsibility for the ship, crew and equipment – and for making sure the ship reaches its destination.

Danish: Skipper og to styrmænd har set på forholdene.
English: The skipper and two helmsmen have been assessing the circumstances.

Danish: Skipper giver kommandoen "Hvil på årerne", "tre - to - en" lyder det fra midtskibet og så bryder alle besætningsmedlemmerne ud i et kæmpe Havhingstebrøl.
English: The skipper gives the command to "Rest on the oars", and from midships comes the call, "Three - two - one" and all of the crew break out in a giant Sea Stallion roar.

Danish: Skipper har det overordnede ansvar.
English: The skipper has overall responsibility.

Danish: Nutidens skipper er skibets kaptajn eller fører, og styrmanden er skipperens underordnede og stedfortræder.
English: The skipper on the Sea Stallion is the ship's captain or commanding officer, and the helmsman is the skipper's subordinate and deputy.

Danish: Nutidens skipper er skibets kaptajn eller fører, og styrmanden er skipperens underordnede og stedfortræder.
English: The skipper on the Sea Stallion is the ship’s captain or commanding officer, and the helmsman is the skipper’s subordinate and deputy.

Danish: Skuldelev 2-skibet er et 30 meter langt havgående krigsskib; en 30-sesse med 60 årer og plads til en besætning på 80 mand.
English: The Skuldelev 2 ship is a 30m-long sea-going warship; a 30-seater with 60 oars and room for a crew of 80 men.

Danish: Skuldelev 3-skibet blev udgravet i 1962 ved Skuldelev i Roskilde Fjord.
English: The Skuldelev 3 ship-find was excavated in 1962 near Skuldelev on Roskilde Fjord.

Danish: Skuldelevskibene og skibe i det hele taget blev på nye måder integreret i perioden.
English: The Skuldelev ships and ships in general were integrated into the period in new ways.

Danish: Skuldelevskibene er et nøglefund til forståelsen af samfundets transportbehov og specialisering i senvikingetiden.
English: The Skuldelev ships are a key find for understanding transportation needs and vessel specialization in the late Viking Age.

Danish: Skuldelevskibene gav os fem forskellige vikingeskibe med hver sin fascinerende historie.
English: The Skuldelev ships gave us five different Viking ships each with their own fascinating story.

Danish: Skuldelevskibene er blevet en del af den danske kulturarv.
English: The Skuldelev ships have become a part of Danish cultural heritage.

Danish: The Skuldelev Ships I, redigeret af O. Crumlin-Pedersen.
English: The Skuldelev Ships I, edition O. Crumlin-Pedersen.

Danish: Skuldelevskibene blev udgravet på tidspunkt, hvor den generelle interesse for vikingetiden var voksende, og de bidrog hertil.
English: The Skuldelev ships were excavated at a time when general interest in the Viking Age was growing and the find contributed to this.

Danish: Vikingeskibene blev i vikingetiden sænket på tværs af sejlrenden ind mod den vigtige handelsby Roskilde, som en spærring mod eventuelle indtrængende fjender.
English: The Skuldelev ships were intentionally scuttled across a sailing channel leading to the important trading town of Roskilde, to prevent attack from enemy ships.

Danish: Skuldelevskibene blev udgangspunkt for et vibrerende marinarkæologisk forskningscenter i verdensklasse, som efterhånden også dækkede de forhistoriske perioder og middelalderen, og som har ydet bistand til mange undersøgelser andetsteds i verden.
English: The Skuldelev ships were the starting point of a vibrant, world-class maritime archaeology research centre that has progressively expanded to cover prehistory and the Middle Ages and has provided assistance to many projects around the world.

Danish: Skuldelev-spærringen over Roskilde Fjord, hvis første del menes at være fra ca. 1060, tolkes ofte som et forsøg på at sikre Roskilde mod Haralds overraskelsesangreb.
English: The Skuldelev-blockade of Roskilde Fjord, whose first phase is dated to about 1060, is often interpreted as an attempt to secure Roskilde from Haralds surprise attacks after the disaster in Haithabu.

Danish: Sovepose og liggeunderlag bruges kun ved landgang.
English: The sleeping bag and mat are only used when going ashore.

Danish: Soveposen kaldtes en Húdfat og var et stort skind der var syet sammen i siderne og med plads til to personer.
English: The sleeping bag was called a Húdfat; it was a large hide stitched together along the sides and with room for two persons.

Danish: Sovepladserne er fordelt, så frivagten har et sted at sidde eller ligge, hvor de ikke er i vejen for dem der sejler skibet.
English: The sleeping places are distributed so those off duty have somewhere to sit or lie down where they are not in way of the people sailing the ship.

Danish: Den lille båd fra Gokstad
English: The small boat from Gokstad

Danish: Den lille Gokstadbåd
English: The small Gokstad boat

Danish: Det lille langskib er dekoreret med gule og brunrøde farver, med inspiration fra Bayeuxtapetet.
English: The small longship is decorated with yellow and braun-red colours, inspired by the Bayeux Tapestry.

Danish: Det lille antal sværd tyder på, at de har været forbeholdt at mindretal indenfor hæren.
English: The small number of swords found indicates that only a minority of the soldiers carried them.

Danish: De mindre, og tydeligvis også mindre vigtige skibe, er alle gengivet med en meget enkel, spids stævn.
English: The smaller and clearly also less important ships are all represented with a very simple pointed stem.

Danish: De mindre både, med plads til 8 gæster, har traditionel færøsk sejlføring.
English: The smaller boats, with room for 8 guests, have traditional Faroese sails.

Danish: De mindre bygninger omkring hovedhuset var udhuse.
English: The smaller buildings would have been outhouses.

Danish: Det betyder, at dyrene ikke blev slagtet på øen.
English: The smaller buildings would have been outhouses.

Danish: De små både anvendtes hovedsageligt til persontransport og småfiskeri i det vidtstrakte fjord- og skærgårdsområde ved Trondheim.
English: The smaller Åfjord boats were mostly used for transporting people, and for fishing in the extensive fjords and around the skerries near Trondheim.

Danish: Den såkaldte evakuering af fire besætningsmedlemmer var i lige så høj grad en test af teknikken og kommunikationen mellem Havhingsten og dets følgeskib 'Cable One'.
English: The so-called evacuation of the four crew members was a test of tecnic and communication between the Sea Stallion and the following ship 'Cable One'.

Danish: Den såkaldte VMG (velocity made good); effektiv hastighed i fugleflugtslinje op mod vinden; kan også aflæses i fartrosen - hvordan?
English: The so-called VMG (velocity made good), the effective speed as the crow flies against the wind, can also be read off the speed diagram - how?

Danish: Den såkaldte VMG (velocity made good); effektiv hastighed i fugleflugtslinje op mod vinden; kan også aflæses i fartrosen – hvordan?
English: The so-called VMG (velocity made good), the effective speed as the crow flies against the wind, can also be read off the speed diagram – how?

Danish: Lyden af øksehug og duften af tjære ledsager historiske presseklip, byggetegninger og skibsmodeller.
English: The sound of an axe and the smell of pine tar accompany historical press clippings, construction drawings and ship models.

Danish: Lyden af øksehug og duften af træ og tjære breder sig over værftspladsen på Museumsøen.
English: The sound of axes chopping and the scent of wood and tar spread across the boatyard on the Museum Island.

Danish: Lyden af øksehug og duften af træ og tjære breder sig over værftspladsen og de nordiske både pryder fjorden.
English: The sound of axes chopping and the scents of wood and tar spread across the boatyard and the Nordic boat’s ornament the fjord.

Danish: Lyden af øksehug og duften af træ og tjære breder sig over værftspladsen på Museumsøen.
English: The sound of the axe and the scent of wood and tar spread out over the boatbuilding site at the Museum Island.

Danish: Lyden af øksehug og duften af træ og tjære breder sig over værftspladsen på Museumsøen.
English: The sound of the axe and the scent of wood and tar spread out over the boatyard at the Museum Island.

Danish: Hvis vi også medtager de kilder vi har fra middelalderens første århundreder, får vi mere omfattende tekster.
English: The sources are rather more expansive if we also take into account the first centuries of the medieval period.

Danish: Kilderne sandsynliggør eller afviser hinanden.
English: The sources can confirm or contradict one another.

Danish: Nu bruges pladsen bare til ekstra stuveplads.
English: The space will just be used as extra storage instead.

Danish: Særudstillingen 'The World in the Viking Age' og den ledsagende publikation 'Verden i Vikingetiden' blev til med hjælp fra forskere fra fem verdensdele.
English: The special exhibition 'The World in the Viking Age' and the accompanying book was created with the help of researchers from five continents.

Danish: Særudstilling 'The World in the Viking Age' åbner for publikum fredag den 11. april og vises til 30. december 2014.
English: The special exhibition 'The World in the Viking Age' opens to the public on Friday 11 April and shown to 30 December 2014.

Danish: Særudstillingen I Vikingernes Kølvand er fortællingen om, hvordan de fem Skuldelevskibe har formet Vikingeskibsmuseet: Hvordan det enestående fund har haft afgørende betydning for marinarkæologien i Danmark, og været drivkraften bag vidtrækkende arkæologiske eksperimenter med rekonstruktion og sejlads.
English: The special exhibition In the Wake of the Vikings is the story about how the five Skuldelev ships have shaped the museum to what it is today: how the remarkable find has been of crucial importance for maritime archaeology in Denmark and been the driving force behind far-reaching archaeological experiments within reconstruction and sailing.

Danish: Se film om bådebygning, sejlads, marinarkæologi, konferencer, foredrag og meget andet.
English: The special exhibition tells the story of the Viking Ships - from excavation to sailing reconstructions

Danish: Særudstillingen satte vikingetiden i et nyt, globalt perspektiv og fortalte en verdenshistorie om skibe, mennesker og ting på rejse - fra de yderste egne af Skandinavien til Middelhavet og fra Den Persiske Golf til Østafrika og Kina.
English: The special exhibition, ‘The World in the Viking Age', provided a new, global perspective on the Viking Age and told a world history about ships, people and objects on the move - from the furthest reaches of Scandinavia to the Mediterranean, and from the Persian Gulf to East Africa and China.

Danish: Fartrosen er et godt redskab til at beregne rejsehastighed og dermed aktionsradius i forskellige vindretninger.
English: The speed diagram is a good tool for calculating travelling speed and hereby operational radius with various wind directions.

Danish: Fartrosen er et polardiagram - altså et "cirkulært koordinatsystem" - med vindøjet, den retning vinden kommer fra, som nulpunkt (opad) og den ene akse stigende 180° i hver retning.
English: The speed diagram is a polar diagram, i.e. "a circular system of co-ordinates" - with the wind's eye, the direction from which the wind is blowing, as zero (upwards) and one of the axes increasing 180º in each direction.

Danish: Fartrosen er et polardiagram - altså et "cirkulært koordinatsystem" - med vindøjet, den retning vinden kommer fra, som nulpunkt (opad) og den ene akse stigende 180° i hver retning.
English: The speed diagram is a polar diagram, i.e. "a circular system of co-ordinates" – with the wind’s eye, the direction from which the wind is blowing, as zero (upwards) and one of the axes increasing 180º in each direction.

Danish: Et sejlskibs hastighed er afhængigt af mange faktorer.
English: The speed of a sailing ship is dependant on many factors.

Danish: Strækket fra Wicklow til Torquay bød på krappe bølger den 7. juli 2008.
English: The stage from Wicklow to Torquay included rough waves, 7th July 2008.

Danish: Stænglerne skal tørre helt, inden de brækkes (brydes) for at frigøre den træagtige marv fra fibrene
English: The stalks must dry out before being broken to separate the woody pith from the fibres

Danish: De kontrollerede testsejladser belyser skibets og besætningens præstationsevne under forskellige forhold.
English: The standardised sailing trials will shed light on the performance of both ship and crew in various conditions.

Danish: Den stående rig, der holder masten, er af hamp, medens den løbende rig, der styrer sejlet, er slået af hestehår.
English: The standing rigging that braces the mast is of hemp while the running rigging for the sail is made from horse hair.

Danish: Som udgangspunkt er kursen sat mod Østersøen.
English: The starting point is to set course for the Baltic Sea.

Danish: Skibsfundenes udsagnspotentiale er enormt.
English: The statement potential of shipwrecks is enormous.

Danish: Det styrende element
English: The steering element

Danish: Styresmand var i vikingetiden skibets ejer og ham der havde den militære kommando, hvorimod skipari var den næstkommanderende eller menige besætning.
English: The steersman in Viking times was the ship's owner and had military command, whereas the skipari (skipper) was the next-in-command or an ordinary member of the crew.

Danish: Styresmand var i vikingetiden skibets ejer og ham der havde den militære kommando, hvorimod skipari var den næstkommanderende eller menige besætning.
English: The steersman in Viking times was the ship’s owner and had military command, whereas the skipari (skipper) was the next-in-command or an ordinary member of the crew.

Danish: Stævnene har været krumme og udhuggede med en trappetrinsformet inderside, som gav anlæg til skibssidens planker.
English: The stem and stern were curved and had been carved with a stepped inner surface, which provided a bedding for the planks of the hull.

Danish: Stævnene var ikke så svære at lave, som vi havde frygtet, men de er stadigvæk lige interessante.
English: The stem and stern were not as difficult to make as we had feared, but they were still an interesting challenge.

Danish: Stævne og agterspejl af egetræ.
English: The stem and stern-frame will be of oak.

Danish: Forstævnen skæres også af en egetræsplanke.
English: The stem is also made from an oak plank.

Danish: Stævnen blev så udhulet og de karakteristiske svingende linjer blev skåret ind langs siderne.
English: The stem is then hollowed out and the distinctive sweeping lines are carved into the sides.

Danish: Stævnplanken af eg blev indfældet som lås mellem køl og stævn, og en skiveformet ydre støtte indsattes mellem hornene længere ude.
English: The stem plank of oak was set in as a ‘lock’ between the bottom and stem, and a shield- or disc-shaped, external support was fitted in between the horns further out.

Danish: Stævn og køl sættes sammen ved hjælp af spændbolte gennem stævnknæet, for og agter.
English: The stem, stern and keel are attached using a bolt, which goes through the stem knee, fore and aft.

Danish: Stævnene skal hules ud, så stævnørerne ikke er tykkere, end de bord der skal sættes fast på stævnen.
English: The stem-posts must be hollowed out so that the stævnørerne (stem wings or wings of the stem) are not thicker than the strakes that will be attached to the stem.

Danish: Stævnene og kølen til Gislingebåden er fremstillet af eg fra Vallø skov.
English: The stems and keel for the Gislinge Boat are made of oak from Vallø Forest.

Danish: Stævnene er alle af samme, jævnkrumme type, men der kan skelnes mellem tre forskellige stævntoppe.
English: The stems are all the same, evenly curved type, but a distinction can be drawn between three different stem-tops.

Danish: Køl og stævne blev samlet ved skråskar.
English: The stems are joined to the keel using scarf joints.

Danish: Stævnene kan ses som et tilløb til den såkaldte trappestævn, der er velkendt i vikingetid.
English: The stems can be seen as a forerunner of the so-called stepped stem, which is well known from the Viking Age.

Danish: Til støtte for tildannelsen af sideplankerne blev der opsat indvendige skabeloner for hver meter, vel vidende at dette var uhistorisk, men nødvendigt for en nøje kopiering af originalens form.
English: The stems were supported on the outside and the hogging truss between the stems helped to maintain the position of the stems and the rocker of the bottom.

Danish: Agterstævnen ved at blive passet til.
English: The stern is adjusted to fit.

Danish: Man kalder det for en rundgattet jolle.
English: The stern on a Lynæs dinghy is very special.

Danish: Agterstævnen er specielt udformet og anderledes end på de gamle drivkvaser, som "kun" var bygget som sejlbåde.
English: The sternpost is specially designed and is different to that on the old drifter, which was 'only' built as a sail boat.

Danish: Stævnknæet bliver fastgjort til kølen og stævnen med fire bolte.
English: The sternpost-knee is attached to both the keel and sternpost using four bolts.

Danish: Stævnroret blev ”opfundet” på de nordiske skibe, senere i middelalderen.
English: The sternpost-mounted rudder is first ‘discovered' on Nordic ships later in the Middle Ages.

Danish: Stævnroret blev ”opfundet” på de nordiske skibe, senere i middelalderen.
English: The sternpost-mounted rudder is first ‘discovered’ on Nordic ships later in the Middle Ages.

Danish: Hovmestrene har en proviantgruppe, som består af en gast fra hvert rum i skibet.
English: The stewards have a provision group, consisting of a man from each of the ship's rooms (sections).

Danish: Den del af konstruktionen, der er stivest, bliver den del, der går i stykker.
English: The stiffest part of the construction will be the first to break.

Danish: Runestenen fra Sønder Kirkeby på Falster."..ser satte denne sten efter sin broder As...
English: The stone tells that “..ser placed this stone in memory of his brother As...

Danish: Vikingeskibet sejlede ud i æteren sammen med aflysning af færgen til fastlandet på grund af hårdt vejr og tidevand - og efterlysning af ejerne til en border collie og en kat.
English: The story about the Viking ship was aired along with the cancellation of the ferry to the main land because of bad weather and tide – and a report of a missing border collie and a cat.

Danish: Historien om verdens største rekonstruktion af et vikingeskib – Havhingsten fra Glendalough – og skibets videnskabelige ekspedition over Nordsøen, nord om Skotland og videre til Dublin er en nyhed, som de seneste uger er gået verden rundt.
English: The story about the worlds biggest reconstruction of a Viking ship - the Sea Stallion from Glendalough – and the ships test sail across the North see, north of Scotland and onwards to Dublin has, for the last couple of weeks, been told around the world.

Danish: Historien fra Vikingetiden kan være i kvad, indeholder kenninger og klassen kan hente inspiration fra sagateksterne.
English: The story from Viking times can be in the form of a poem and contain kennings; the class could perhaps obtain inspiration from the saga texts.

Danish: Historien fra Vikingetiden kan være i kvad, indeholde kenninger og klassen kan hente inspiration fra vikingekvad eller sagatekster.
English: The story from Viking times can be poems and contain kennings; he class can obtain inspiration from the saga texts.

Danish: Historien fortælles videre og illustreres evt. som Bayeuxtapetet.
English: The story is continued and is illustrated for example on the Bayeux Tapestry.

Danish: Historien om Roskilde bådeværft begynder med bademester Jens Peder Alfred Jensen, som i 1899 overtog sin fars hus på Strandgade - med det foranliggende strandareal.
English: The story of Roskilde Boatyard begins with boat master Jens Peder Alfred Jensen, who, in 1899, took over his father's house on Strandgade with the strand area in front.

Danish: Historien om Roskilde bådeværft begynder med bademester Jens Peder Alfred Jensen, som i 1899 overtog sin fars hus på Strandgade - med det foranliggende strandareal.
English: The story of Roskilde Boatyard begins with boat master Jens Peder Alfred Jensen, who, in 1899, took over his father’s house on Strandgade with the strand area in front.

Danish: Historien om Havhingstens historiske rejse har allerede opnået stor international opmærksomhed i så fjerne lande som Kina, Sydafrika og Australien.
English: The story of the Sea Stallion's historic voyage has already achieved international attention in countries as far away as China, South Africa and Australia.

Danish: Fortællingerne blev underbygget af et stort antal genstande, der aldrig havde været udstillet sammen.
English: The story was supported by a large number of artefacts, which had never before been exhibited together.

Danish: Belastningerne på skroget er beregnet ud fra en betragtning af båden som en bjælkekonstruktion på elastisk underlag, men usikkerhed om syningernes stabilitet, spændtovets eventuelle bidrag mv. gør, at beregningerne er simplificerede og alene vejledende.
English: The strains on the hull have been calculated on the basis of a simplification of the boat as a beam structure on an elastic base but the uncertainty as to the stability of the fastenings and the contribution made by the hogging truss means that the calculations have had to be simplified and they are only intended as a guide.

Danish: Planken skulle have haft en krumning over kant på 30 cm for at give den af Johannessen rekonstruerede form.
English: The strake should have had an edge curvature of 30 cm in order to yield the shape reconstructed by Johannessen.

Danish: Denne åledrivkvases bordplanker bliver fremstillet i eg.
English: The strakes for the eel drifter are made of oak.

Danish: Bordplankerne skal passes så godt sammen, så de, uden brug af lim eller gummi, bliver vandtætte.
English: The strakes must fit so well together, that they can be watertight without the use of glue or rubber.

Danish: Bordplankerne i Åledrivkvasen er fremstillet i egetræ.
English: The strakes on the eel drifter are produced from oak.

Danish: Rorstroppen er lavet af tre stykker 5mm tyk læder der er syet sammen til et 15mm tykt stykke.
English: The strap for the rudder is made out of three pieces of leather 5 mm thick, sewn together to one piece 15 mm thick.

Danish: I denne bydel fik gaderne nordisk klingende navne med endelsen -gate.
English: The streets in this quarter had Nordic names ending in -gate.

Danish: I denne bydel fik gaderne nordisk klingende navne med endelsen –gate.
English: The streets in this quarter had Nordic names ending in –gate.

Danish: Byen var så godt beskyttet at det tog Raymond Le Gros og Strongbows hær tre forsøg, før de kunne indtage byen.
English: The strength of the town's fortifications is confirmed by twelfth century accounts, which state that it took Raymond Le Gros and Strongbow's forces three attempts to take the city.

Danish: Byen var så godt beskyttet at det tog Raymond Le Gros og Strongbows hær tre forsøg, før de kunne indtage byen.
English: The strength of the town’s fortifications is confirmed by twelfth century accounts, which state that it took Raymond Le Gros and Strongbow's forces three attempts to take the city.

Danish: Sidste års forstærkninger havde også givet skibet en mere fornuftig fleksibilitet; vi stolede mere og mere på Havhingsten.
English: The strengthening the previous year had given the ship a more reasonable flexibility and we trusted the Sea Stallion more and more.

Danish: Årer og roning omtales med vægt på det imponerende i åreslagene, der for Harald Hårderådes storskib blev sammenlignet med ørnens vingeslag: es sem líti innan arnar væng.
English: The strokes of the oars in Harald Hardrada’s great ship were compared with the beating of the wings of an eagle: es sem líti innan arnar væng.

Danish: Den stærke skal -skibets skrog
English: The strong shell - the hull

Danish: Figurerne kan man klikke på og så læse om forskelle og ligheder på de pågældende personer i vikingetid og i nutid.
English: The students can click on the figures and read about the characters in the Viking Age and today.

Danish: Undersøgelsen fortsætter med detaljerede studier af skibsfundene fra henholdsvis Eltang Vig, Lynæs, Karschau og Haderslev (kapitel 5-8), fulgt af en diskussion af alle 19 dendrokronologisk daterede fund af lastskibe på over 14 m længde fra tiden 1000-1250 og fundet i de middelalderlige danske farvande (kapitel 9).
English: The study continues with a number of detailed case studies on the ship-finds of Eltang Vig, Lynæs, Karschau and Haderslev (Chapters 5-8), and a discussion of the evidence of all 19 tree-ring dated cargo ship-finds over 14 m reconstructed length in medieval Danish waters from 1000-1250 (Chapter 9).

Danish: Spændernes stil antyder, at de er fremstillet i Dublin, hvor der er fundet adskillige eksemplarer i kobber.
English: The style of these brooches indicates that they have been made in Dublin, where several copper-alloy examples have been found.

Danish: Den submarine stenalderboplads kan dateres til Villingebækfasen i Ældre Stenalders Kongemoseperiode, ca. 6000 f.Kr.
English: The submarine Stone Age settlement has been dated to the Villingebæk Phase of the Mesolithic Kongemose Period, ca. 6,000 BC.

Danish: Den efterfølgende analyse af skibsresterne viste, at de kom fra et mere end 30 m langt krigsskib, dvs. et fartøj på længde med Skuldelev 2, men langt smallere bygget, og formodentlig kun til brug på Østersøen og i de indre danske farvande.
English: The subsequent analyses of the remains of the ship revealed that they were from a more than 30 m long warship, i.e. a vessel of a length similar to Skuldelev 2 but of much more slender build, and presumably only intended for use in the Baltic and in Danish coastal waters.

Danish: Projektets succes er er blevet indfriet til fulde - ja, faktisk langt over projektgruppens forventninger:
English: The success of the approach has far exceeded the project team's expectations.

Danish: Projektets succes er er blevet indfriet til fulde - ja, faktisk langt over projektgruppens forventninger:
English: The success of the approach has far exceeded the project team’s expectations.

Danish: Sommeren giver mulighed for lidt længere togt.
English: The summer presents the opportunity for a slightly longer voyage.

Danish: Sommerens hovedopgave er en rekonstruktion af Skuldelev 3 - et mindre handelsskib.
English: The summer's main task is a reconstruction of Skuldelev 3 - a small trading ship.

Danish: Sommerens hovedopgave er en rekonstruktion af Skuldelev 3 – et lille handelsskib.
English: The summer’s main task is a reconstruction of Skuldelev 3 – a small trading ship.

Danish: Sommerens hovedopgave er en rekonstruktion af Skuldelev 3 – et mindre handelsskib.
English: The summer’s main task is a reconstruction of Skuldelev 3 – a small trading ship.

Danish: Sol og stjerner
English: The Sun and the Stars

Danish: Solen knaldede ned over en letpåklædt svedende besætning, som grundigt fik brugt kræfterne på en super sommerdag, som de ikke tidligere har oplevet på togtet fra Dublin til Roskilde.
English: The sun beat down over the lightly clothed, sweating crew, who needed all their strength on a super summer's day such as they had not seen before on the voyage from Dublin to Roskilde.

Danish: Solen knaldede ned over en letpåklædt svedende besætning, som grundigt fik brugt kræfterne på en super sommerdag, som de ikke tidligere har oplevet på togtet fra Dublin til Roskilde.
English: The sun beat down over the lightly clothed, sweating crew, who needed all their strength on a super summer’s day such as they had not seen before on the voyage from Dublin to Roskilde.

Danish: Solkompasset er et retvisende kompas, der gælder for et bestemt tidspunkt på året på en bestemt breddegrad.
English: The sun compass is a true compass, which works for a particular time of the year at a particular latitude.

Danish: Solkurverne er såkaldte keglesnit.
English: The sun curves are so-called conic sections.

Danish: Solkurverne må derfor være hyperbler før polarcirklen, parabler på polarcirklen og ellipser over polarcirklen.
English: The sun curves must therefore be hyperbolas before the Arctic Circle, parabolas at the Arctic Circle and ellipses above the Arctic Circle.

Danish: Solen skinnede og der blev vinket fra tilskuerne - og tilbage fra skibet.
English: The sun shone and there was much waving - both from shore and ship.

Danish: Solen var momentvis til stede og hele vejen ind gennem Dublin Bay og op ad Liffey gik Havhingsten for sejl i en svag østlig vind.
English: The sun was momentarily shinning and using a weak easterly breeze the Sea Stallion went for sail all the way from Dublin Bay and up Liffey.

Danish: Solens middagshøjde kan bruges til at finde verdenshjørnerne og bestemme breddegraden.
English: The sun's height at midday can be used to find the points of the compass and determine latitude.

Danish: Aftensmaden, vi har med til turen over Nordsøen er flg.:
English: The supper we bring for the North Sea are following:

Danish: Træets overflade er behandlet med en blanding af trætjære og linolie der giver den smukke mørkebrune farve.
English: The surface of the wood was treated with amixture of wood tar and linseed oil that gives the beautiful dark brown colour.

Danish: Undersøgelserne, som finder sted i 300-året for Dannebroges forlis, skal dokumentere vragpladsens nuværende tilstand, ligesom der vil blive foretaget indsamling af løstliggende genstande på vraget.
English: The surveys, which took place on the 300-year anniversary of the sinking of the Dannebroge, were intended to document the current condition of the wreck site and a collection will be made of any loose objects around the wreck.

Danish: De bevarede dele af skibet er 10 meter i længden og ca. 2,5 meter i bredden.
English: The surviving parts of the ship are 10m in length and ca. 2.5m wide.

Danish: Den bevarede skjaldedigtning fra vikingetiden er forholdsvis omfattende.
English: The surviving scaldic verse from the Viking Age is quite extensive.

Danish: Den bevarede agterstævn består af tre dele, som tilsammen former en såkaldt trappestævn (se Skuldelev 5).
English: The surviving stern comprises three parts, which together form a so-called stepped stern (see Skuldelev 5).

Danish: De få skriftlige skandinaviske kilder, der omtaler missionærerne, beretter i hvert fald, at de mødte stor modstand fra høvdinge og konger.
English: The surviving written sources concerning the missionaries do demonstrate that they encountered great resistance from chieftains and kings.

Danish: Den svenske konge Erik Sejrsæl byggede byen omkring år 980.
English: The Swedish King Eric the Victorious is traditionally considered as the founder of Sigtuna (AD 980).

Danish: Her opstod der kamp mellem den svenske flåde og den dansk-norske flåde.
English: The Swedish Navy and the Danish-Norwegian Navy fought a battle here.

Danish: Sværdet er forsætligt brækket i tre stykker.
English: The sword had deliberately been broken into three pieces.

Danish: Sværdets skede var ved fundet stadig intakt og består af træ belagt med læder og andet tekstil.
English: The sword scabbard was found intact and was constructed from wood and layers of leather and other textiles.

Danish: Sværdene i dette fund er de ældste kendte af deres art i Norden, og deres udformning tyder på, at fælles normer endnu ikke fandtes for denne våbentype inden for Østersøområdet.
English: The swords from Hjortspring are the oldest of their type known from Scandinavia and their shapes suggest that there were as yet no standard dimensions for this type of weapon within the Baltic area.

Danish: Systemet fungerer upåklageligt, specielt på mindre både.
English: The system functions well, especially on the smaller boats.

Danish: Halsen er det til enhver tid forreste nederste hjørne af råsejlet, og den skiftes bogstaveligt talt fra den ene side af skibet til den anden.
English: The tack is always the forward lower corner of the square sail and when tacking or changing tack it is shifted quite literally from one side of the ship to the other.

Danish: Tanktesten viste to fuldstændig forskellige skibe med to forskellige præstationsniveauer.
English: The tank tests showed two completely different ships with very different performance levels.

Danish: Karrets indhold blev knyttet til fortællinger om arbejdet med opmåling, dokumentation og konservering af skibstræ.
English: The tank's content was linked to stories about the work involved surveying, documenting and conserving ships' timbers.

Danish: Båden i fuld størrelse skal varmes over ild, så den bliver blød og medgørlig.
English: The tannins in the oak have given the boat a darker colour.

Danish: Især på smykkerne danner kan man se udviklingen af stilarterne.
English: The Tapestry's value as a source is manifold.

Danish: Tapetets angivelse af at hestene blev transporteret i skibe, der kunne roes, er bemærkelsesværdig.
English: The tapestry’s delineation of horses being transported on board ships that could be rowed is remarkable.

Danish: Her skal du finde ud af, hvor hurtigt Havhingsten egentlig kan sejle.
English: The task here is to find out how fast The Sea Stallion can actually sail.

Danish: Opgaven er som ordet siger at se efter om ankeret holder eller ved kaj om fortøjningerne er iorden.
English: The task is, as the word says, to ensure that the anchor holds or at the quay that the mooring is securely fastened.

Danish: Arbejdsopgaverne var, at trimme sejlet, at tømme skibet for det vand der kom ind, gå vagt og styre roret.
English: The tasks were to trim the sail, to keep the ship empty of water, to keep watch and steer the rudder.

Danish: Teamet gennemførte en minutiøs gennemgang af det originale skib.
English: The team carried out a thorough re-examination of the original ship.

Danish: Teknikken fortsætter gennem vikingetiden, hvor samarbejdet mellem jernudvindere og smede har resulteret i et utal af genstande med stor betydning for vores nutidige forståelse af vore forfædres dagligliv.
English: The technique is used troughout the Viking Age where the cooperation between iron smelter and blacksmith has resulted in a number og artifacts with great influence on our contemporary conception of our forefathers daily life.

Danish: Kløveteknikken var dermed en forudsætning for at vikingerne på en gang kunne bygge lette og stærke skibe.
English: The technique of cleaving was therefore critical in allowing the Vikings to build ships that were both light and strong.

Danish: Deres fremstillingsteknik forudsætter, at det oprindelige træ er mere end dobbelt så tykt som den færdige planke er bred.
English: The technique used in their production requires the original wood to be twice as thick as the width of the finished plank.

Danish: Teinæringen fra Mykines
English: The teinæring from Mykines

Danish: 15 minutter før Havhingsten gled ind i havnen blev telefonen endelig taget på Borgmesterkontoret.
English: The telephone was finally answered at the mayor’s office just 15 minutes before the Sea Stallion sailed into the harbour.

Danish: Bådens ti spanter blev opbygget som på originalen med en friskfældet hasselstok forsigtigt bøjet, smurt og hamret på plads.
English: The ten frames of the boat were constructed like those in the original boat with a newly-felled, carefully bent hazel branch, oiled and hammered into position.

Danish: De ti årehuller, der er vist under rælingen, afslører tydeligvis fartøjet som et roskib.
English: The ten oar-holes that are shown under the gunwale clearly show the vessel to be a rowing-ship.

Danish: Ved prøvegravningen fandtes 53 stk. forarbejdet flint, bl.a. en rhombisk skævpil af Villingebæktype.
English: The test excavation found 53 pieces of worked flint, including a rhombic crooked arrow of the Villingebæk type.

Danish: Prøvegravning af område 7, hvor der skulle anlægges en kanal, som ville ødelægge gytjelaget.
English: The test excavation of area 7, where a canal was to be constructed and which would destroy the sediment level.

Danish: Afprøvningen af rekonstruktionens troværdighed er beskrevet under Bådsmandsdagbogen.
English: The testing of the reliability of this reconstruction is described in the Boatswain’s Journal.

Danish: Teksten er ofte meget kortfattet og forekomsten af indskrifter er meget spredt, både geografisk og kronologisk.
English: The text is often very brief and the occurrence of the inscriptions is very scattered, both geographically and chronologically.

Danish: Teksten i sejlet: Danish Viking Ship from Roskilde * Sea Stallion from Glendalough * visited Wicklow July 2008.
English: The text on the sail: Danish Viking Ship from Roskilde * Sea Stallion from Glendalough * visited Wicklow July 2008.

Danish: Tekstilerne er generelt af fin kvalitet, og udvalgte beklædningsdele har været udsmykket med frynser og vedhæng i guld- og sølvtråd.
English: The textiles are generally of fine quality, and some of the pieces of clothing have been decorated with fringes and pendant ornaments in gold and silver thread.

Danish: Skjaldedigtene kan lettere dateres, da teksterne ikke i samme grad er anonyme, men indeholder konge- og heltenavne, stednavne og beskrivelser af interne kampe eller store krigsslag.
English: The texts are not as anonymous, but contain the names of kings and heroes, place names and descriptions of internal struggles or great battles.

Danish: Teksterne på stenene minder om andre runetekster: Et eller flere personnavne nævnes som dem der rejste stenen, og den rejstes til minde om en far, bror eller en frænde (ven).
English: The texts on the stones are reminiscent of other runic texts: One or more persons are mentioned by name as being those who erected the stone, and it was erected in memory of a farther, brother or friend.

Danish: Og landet (overlappet mellem plankerne) høvles og gøres klar til det næste bord.
English: The the section where the planks will overlap is planed and prepared to take the next strake.

Danish: Temaet indeholder aviser, publikationer og et skatkammer af genstande, der har begrænset værdi nu, men som med tiden vil kunne blive interessante.
English: The theme includes newspapers, publications and a treasure trove of artefacts that have very little monetary value but as time elapses and memory recedes will become of increasing interest.

Danish: Temaet om Erik den Røde indgår som en del af Roskilde kommunes kulturfestival Inuit Nu.
English: The theme of Eric the Red will form part of Roskilde municipality’s culture festival Inuit Nu.

Danish: Bogens temaer blev først præsenteret for the Society of Antiquaries of Scotland i Edinburgh i 2008.
English: The themes of this volume were first presented in six Rhind Lectures for the Society of Antiquaries of Scotland in Edinburgh in 2008.

Danish: Den mellemste båd blev rekonstrueret af Terje Planke og Svein Erik Øya i 2002.
English: The third boat was reconstructed by Terje Planke og Svein Erik Øya i 2002.

Danish: Det tredje kapitel omhandler den arkæologisk metode som blev anvendt ved B&W udgravningerne i 1996 og 1997, og resultaterne af disse diskuteres.
English: The third chapter relates the archaeological method that was used for the B&W excavations of 1996 and 1997, and the results are discussed.

Danish: I tredje kapitel gennemgås de dokumentationsmetoder med registrering i skala 1:1, der er anvendt forud for skibenes konservering.
English: The third chapter relates the documentation methods employed in registering the ships' parts at the scale of 1:1 before they were conserved.

Danish: For de tre vrag B&W 5, B&W 2 and B&W 1 fremlægges resultaterne, selve processen er udeladt.
English: The three other case-studies (B&W 5, B&W 2 and B&W 1) mainly present the results of the analyses, instead of the process.

Danish: Tofterne er i og ringdækket er færdigt.
English: The thwarts are in and the ring deck is finished.

Danish: Flåten blev fjernet for ca 5 dage siden.
English: The tick was removed about 5 days ago.

Danish: Flåten blev fjernet for ca 5 dage...
English: The tick was removed about 5 days...

Danish: Billetten kan ikke refunderes med mindre sejladsen aflyses.
English: The ticket can not be refunded unless the trip is cancelled.

Danish: Tidevandet følger månens rotation omkring jorden.
English: The tides follow the Moon’s rotation around the earth.

Danish: Tømmeret lægges da efter endt dokumentation tilbage i en grube i havbunden, hvor de lægges i lag adskilt af sand.
English: The timbers are, upon documentation, stacked in a pit dug in the seabed, placed in layers separated by sand.

Danish: Emnerne til køl, stævne og essing fik vi lov at købe fra Gilleleje skibsværft og Havnsø bådebyggeri, som havde noget på lager.
English: The timbers for the keel, stem, sternpost and gunwale were bought from Gilleleje Shipyard and Havnsø Boatbuilders, where they had timbers in stock.

Danish: Træet er konserveret med polyetylenglykol (PEG 4000) ved flere forskellige behandlinger: i varmt bad, ved frysetørring fra vand eller butanol, eller i enkelte tilfælde ved overhældning.
English: The timbers have been conserved with polyethylene glycol (PEG 4000) in several different treatments: in hot baths, by freeze-drying from water or butanol, or in a few cases, by simply pouring the PEG over the wood.

Danish: Tidskapslen er blevet til i kølvandet på Havhingsten fra Glendaloughs forsøgsrejse fra Roskilde til Dublin og retur i 2007-08 og markerer venskabsaftalen mellem Dublin og Roskilde.
English: The Time Capsule came into existence in the wake of the Sea Stallion from Glendalough trial voyage from Roskilde to Dublin and back in 2007-08 and marks a friendship agreement between Dublin and Roskilde.

Danish: Tidskapslen er forsejlet og alt indholdet er vakumpakket, så det kan holde sig indtil 2259, hvor indholdet igen kan komme frem til fremtidens undren og nysgerrighed.
English: The time capsule is sealed and all of its contents are vacuum-packed so that they can last until 2259, when the contents can again be unpacked and subjected to the wonder and curiosity of the future.

Danish: Den tid lyden er om at tilbagelægge afstanden viser, hvor genstanden ligger, og styrken af det tilbagekastede signal siger noget om materialets hårdhed.
English: The time taken for the signal to return reveals the position of the object and the amplitude can reveal information about the density of the material.

Danish: Varigheden af manøvren ”sætte sejl” og ”bjærge sejl” noteres særskilt ved angivelse af præcist tidspunkt for manøvrens start (ved kommandoerne ”det er vel roet” henholdsvis ”bjærg sejl”) og manøvrens slut (skibet er under fart for henholdsvis sejl eller årer i den ønskede retning).
English: The time taken to "raise sail" and "lower sail" will be recorded separately by noting the exact time at which the manoeuvre is commenced (i.e. on the "well rowed" and "lower sail" commands respectively) and completed (i.e. when the ship begins to make headway in the desired direction by sail or oar respectively).

Danish: Søen kan desuden beskrives ud fra observationer af bølgelængde (afstand fra top til top) og bølgehastighed (angivet i m/s).
English: The time taken to lower and raise the mast will be recorded and the practicalities involved will be described and assessed, including any inconvenience to oarsmen.

Danish: Værktøjssporene blev genkendt af en nordmand som sprett-telgjing.
English: The tool marks were recognized by a Norwegian as "sprett-telgjing".

Danish: Værktøjet hertil tog udgangspunkt i danske fund af romertidsværktøj af retøkser, skarøkser og stemmejern, da sådanne fund fra førromersk jernalder var meget få.
English: The tools for this work were based on finds of tools from the Roman Iron Age in Denmark including axes, adzes and chisels, since such finds from the Pre-Roman Iron Age are exceptionally few.

Danish: Værktøjet i kisten tyder på, at ejeren har været metalhåndværker og har udført arbejde i kobber og jern.
English: The tools in the box suggest that the owner had been a metal craftsman and had worked in copper and iron.

Danish: Overkanten bliver hugget så båden får jævne og fine linier.
English: The top edge is cleaved so that the boat will have smooth, straight lines.

Danish: De øverste bordgange var ikke fastgjort til stævnen, og der var store problemer med at få bordene til at passe sammen i stævnområdet.
English: The top strakes were not attached to the stem, and there were major problems in connecting the planking to that area.

Danish: Faklen bæres af en tidligere OL-deltager, og overdrages yderst på molen til lokale atleter.
English: The torch will be borne by a previous Olympian.

Danish: Totalstationsmålingerne kunne bearbejdes til udtegning i AutoCAD, mens de to digital-arm-fabrikater Microscribe og FaroArm registrerede punkter og linier direkte til udtegning med tilhørende flader i et Rhinoceros-program.
English: The total-station measurements could be adapted for drawing in AutoCAD, while the digital-arms Microscribe and FaroArm registered points and lines directly for drawing with associated interfaces in the programme Rhinoceros.

Danish: Omvisningen er tilrettelagt for voksne og større børn.
English: The tour is designed for both adults and children.

Danish: Omvisningen er på engelsk.
English: The tour is in English.

Danish: Turen fortsætter i vidjeværkstedet, hvor vi prøver kræfter med at vride vidjer af pil.
English: The tour will continue in the withy workshop where we will try our hand at twisting withies of willow.

Danish: Mødested: Tunet på Museumsøen, lige ved broen.
English: The tours take place outdoors.

Danish: Omvisningerne foregår udendørs.
English: The tours take place outdoors.

Danish: Rundvisningerne foregår inden for museets åbningstid og varetages af museets guider, der er historie- eller arkæologistuderende.
English: The tours take place within the Museum’s opening hours and are conducted by the Museum’s guides, who are either archaeology or history students.

Danish: I sin regeringstid opførte Vilhelm borgen Tower of London i byens vestlige udkant.
English: The town must answer to the king alone and it stands under his full protection.

Danish: Vilhelms privilegier betød, at byen kun skulle svare for kongen alene og stå under hans fulde beskyttelse.
English: The town must answer to the king alone and it stands under his full protection.

Danish: Vilhelms privilegier betød, at byen kun skulle svare for kongen alene og stå under hans fulde beskyttelse.
English: The town soon consented and William therefore gave them issued special privileges.

Danish: Byen var gentagne gange udsat for angreb og var i korte perioder på fremmede hænder.
English: The town was attacked several times and was, for shorter periods, in foreign hands.

Danish: Byens gader lå langs bækken og flere af gaderne var opbygget af træplanker og de havde stort set alle retning mod havnen.
English: The town was located so as to give is easy access from east and west, which is why it became a centre for North European trade.

Danish: Webloggen 'Rejsebreve fra Havhingsten' tager dig med om bord på Havhingstens jubilæumstogt.
English: The travel blog will take you onboard the Sea Stallion for the anniversary voyage.

Danish: Webloggen 'Rejsebreve fra Havhingsten' tager dig med om bord på Havhingstens togt.
English: The travel blog will take you onboard the Sea Stallion for the anniversary voyage.

Danish: Træet, som skibets kølsvin er lavet af, er fældet i maj eller juni måned 1042.
English: The tree from which the ship’s keelson was made was felled in May or June of AD 1042.

Danish: Træet skal være retvokset og knastfrit - og det skal være stort.
English: The tree must be straight-growing and knot-free, and it must be big.

Danish: Den udhulede træstamme er efterfølgende opvarmet og blødgjort over ild, og derefter spændt ud til en ny skrogform.
English: The tree trunks are hollowed out, heated and subsequently expanded.

Danish: Træet stod i Tisvilde hegn, og var blandt de største i skoven.
English: The tree was found in Tisvilde Hegn and was one of the largest in the forest.

Danish: Den træløse ø
English: The treeless island

Danish: Fældningsområdet for træet fra to af disse reparationer har i begge tilfælde været Sydskandinavien (antagelig Oslofjorden og Skåne/Sjælland).
English: The trees used for two of these repairs were evidently in both cases felled in southern Scandinavia (possibly the Oslofjord region and Skåne/Sjælland).

Danish: Forsøgssejladsen vil kunne følges på Vikingeskibsmuseets hjemmeside, hvor der allerede nu ligger mere information om skibet, sejladsens formål og besætningen.
English: The trial voyage can be followed on the Viking Ship Museum’s website, where you can already read more information about the ship, the purpose of the voyage and the crew.

Danish: Forsøgsrejsen fra Roskilde til Dublin og retur i 2007-08
English: The trial voyage from Roskilde to Dublin and back in 2007-08

Danish: Forsøgssejladsen skal kaste lys over væsentlige spørgsmål om nordboernes muligheder for at kommunikere med hinanden mellem de spredte bosættelser.
English: The trial voyage will explore important issues such as how the Norsemen maintained communication between their scattered settlements.

Danish: Trimdagbogen: beskriver hvor meget og hvordan skibet er lastet med ballast og grej.
English: The Trim Journal: describes how much in what way the ship is loaded with ballast and gear.

Danish: Togtet til Norge - set fra skrivebordet
English: The trip to Norway - from the desk point of view

Danish: Denne tur tog 12 minutter, og med trænede folk og heste kunne det være gået væsentligt hurtigere.
English: The trip took 12 minutes and with trained people and horses, the task could have been performed far quicker.

Danish: Sejlturen varer ca. 2 timer.
English: The trip will last about 2 hours.

Danish: Tropperne kan inkludere hovedpersonerne, fanebærer, kriger med forskellige typer våben og ryttere).
English: The troops can include the main protagonists, standard bearers, warriors with various types of weapons and cavalry.)

Danish: Tropperne stødte sammen ved byen Hastings, hvor Harold mistede livet.
English: The troops met at Hastings where Harold was killed and along with him a great part of England's aristocracy.

Danish: Derpå udhules stammen med økse så siderne bliver ganske tynde.
English: The trunk is then dug out with an axe so that its sides are quite thin.

Danish: Sandheden er, at de seneste års mange besparelser betyder, at marinarkæologien i Danmark kommer til at drosle ned.
English: The truth is that the many cut-backs of recent years will force maritime archaeology in Denmark to diminish.

Danish: Tuna Badelunda båden bygges af bådebyggerne Hanus Jensen og Rasmus Budde Jensen
English: The Tuna Badelunda boat was built by Hanus Jensen and Rasmus Budde Jensen.

Danish: Tune-skibet havde også fungeret som gravskib, og i de følgende årtier førte flere udgravninger af gravhøje, til yderligere skibsfund.
English: The Tune ship had similarly functioned as a burial ship and in the subsequent decades further excavations of burial mounds would lead to new discoveries of ships.

Danish: Den drejede trætallerken har nære paralleller i samtidig dansk keramik, hvorfor alle de fundne drejede træsager formodes at være tilvirket indenfor Østersøområdet som dele af Hjortspringhærens udrustning.
English: The turned wooden plate has close parallels in contemporary Danish ceramics, so that all the turned wooden objects are assumed to have been produced within the Baltic area as part of the equipment of the Hjortspring army.

Danish: De to agterste krumme stævnbord bliver, under tilpasningen, spændt ud i den ønskede facon med bordvridere.
English: The two aftermost curved hood-ends are stretched out into the desired shape while being adjusted to fit

Danish: De to smukke fartøjer lå langskibs og udvekslede erfaringer, spørgsmål, kage og røverhistorier fra verdenshavene.
English: The two beautiful ships were moored alongside each other and exchanged experience, questions, cake and tales from the seven seas.

Danish: De to både bliver bygget lige efter hinanden - den første båd blev færdig i januar 2018, og den anden båd skal stå færdig i slutningen af 2018.
English: The two boats are being built right after each other - the first boat was completed in January 2018, and the second boat will be completed by the end of 2018.

Danish: De to spænder blev fundet på bunden af nedgravningen med de hule sider mod hinanden."
English: The two brooches were found at the bottom of the cutting, the hollow sides face to face.

Danish: De to ender af båden var ensdannede, men sydenden antoges at have været agterenden ud fra fundet af løfting og øsekar her.
English: The two ends of the boat were identical in shape, but the southern end is assumed to have been the stern because the raised deck and bailer were found here.

Danish: Herefter kløves stammen endnu engang i kvarte stykker, og disse endnu et par gange, til hele stammen er kløvet ud i trekantede kløvestykker, klar til at blive hugget til glatte skibsplanker - eller 'bord', som det hedder på et skib.
English: The two halves are then cleaved further into quarters and then again to smaller pieces until the entire log has been cleaved into wedge shaped sections, ready to be hewn smooth to ship’s planks – or boards, as they’re called on a ship.

Danish: De to fuldvoksne egetræer skal bruges til byggeriet af et vikingeskib i fuld størrelse, det såkaldte Skuldelev 3-skib, et mindre handelsskib fra år 1040, der blev fundet ved Skuldelev i Roskilde Fjord for over 50 år siden.
English: The two mature oaks will be used for the construction of a full-scale Viking ship, a reconstruction of Skuldelev 3 – a small trading ship from the year 1040, which was found near Skuldelev in Roskilde Fjord over 50 years ago.

Danish: De to nye både bliver rekonstruktioner efter en sagnomspunden båd fra den lille vestligt liggende ø, Mykines: Efter sigende fandtes engang en særlig stor båd - en teinæringur, hjemmehørende på Mykines, der ligger længst mod vest i den færøske øgruppe.
English: The two new boats are being reconstructed after a fabled boat from the little western island, Mykines: It is said that there was once an especially large boat - a teinæringur, native to Mykines, the westernmost of the Faroe Islands.

Danish: De to øvrige genanvendte planker er af fyr, ligesom det genanvendte stykke spantetømmer.
English: The two other re-used planks are of pine, as is the re-used piece of rib timber.

Danish: De to landtanger mellem Limfjorden og Vesterhavet hedder Agger Tange og Harboøre Tange.
English: The two parts of the isthmus separating the Limfjord from the North sea are called, respectively, Agger Tange and Harboøre Tange.

Danish: De to målinger gav dog samme resultater indenfor 10 mm. Første måling udførtes med skroget hvilende på understøtninger i 2/9's afstand fra enderne og slækt spændtov, mens anden måling foregik med båden hvilende på dens specialbyggede trailer.
English: The two sets of measurements, however, were the same within a margin of 10 mm. The first set of measurements was carried out with the hull resting on supports placed at 2/9 distance from the ends and with the hogging truss hanging slack, while the second set was made with the boat resting on its specially-constructed trailer.

Danish: De to skibsbegravelser er ikke enestående for området.
English: The two ship burials are not unique in the area.

Danish: De mange lyde - mastens knirken, skibsskrogets knagen, vindens susen, skippers kommandoer og de rytmiske bølger, der slår mod skibssiden, er reallyde optaget på vikingeskibsrekonstruktionerne Havhingsten og Ottar, under deres togter i al slags vejr.
English: The two ships are stocked with equipment and trading goods, which underline their function and invite for exploration; guests can open barrels and chests, have a look below deck, take a rest in the soft skins beneath the ship's tent or try their hand as helmsman.

Danish: De to skibe scenograferes med udstyr og handelsvarer, der understreger deres funktion og opfordrer til at gå på opdagelse; lette lågen på tønder og kister, åbne dørken og kikke under dæk, gå til ro i de bløde skind i skibsteltet og prøve kræfter med rollen som rorgænger.
English: The two ships are stocked with equipment and trading goods, which underline their function and invite for exploration; guests can open barrels and chests, have a look below deck, take a rest in the soft skins beneath the ship's tent or try their hand as helmsman.

Danish: De to skibe er lastet med udstyr og handelsvarer, der understreger skibenes oprindelige funktion, og opfordrer til at gå på opdagelse; lette låget på tønder og kister, åbne dørken og kikke under dækket, gå til ro i skibsteltet eller prøve kræfter med rollen som rorgænger.
English: The two ships are stocked with equipment and trading goods, which underline their function and invite for exploration; guests can open barrels and chests, have a look below deck, take a rest in the soft skins beneath the ship’s tent or try their hand as helmsman.

Danish: De to træer er nøje udvalgt efter deres form og størrelse, så de svarer til de kvaliteter vikingerne også gik efter, da de udvalgte tømmer til deres skibe for 1000 år siden:
English: The two trees have been carefully selected on the basis of their shape and form, so that they match the level of quality the Vikings would also have sought, when building their ships 1000 years ago:

Danish: Totimers platvagterne skifter her mellem 16 og 20.
English: The two-hours plat-watches change here between 16 and 20.

Danish: Det typiske Dublin-hus var en rektangulær bygning med lave vægge og med en dør i hver ende.
English: The typical Dublin house was a low walled, rectangular building with a doorway at either end.

Danish: I Ulster-annalen står:
English: The Ulster Annal state that:

Danish: Ravamuletten, der aldrig blev færdig er påbegyndt tildannet af en ravklump, der er stor som et hønseæg.
English: The unfinished amber amulet was fashioned from a lump of amber the size of a chicken egg.

Danish: Det fejlslagne togt fandt sted omkring 1041, og Serkland er vikingernes betegnelse for de muslimske områder.
English: The unsuccessful expedition took place about 1041 and Serkland is the term employed by the Vikings of the Muslim regions.

Danish: Sønnerne hører vi ikke mere om, men datteren Gytha blev gift med Vladimir Monomach, storfyrste af Kiev.
English: The unusual characteristic of this warship is that at-some stage in its life the top strakes were damaged and replaced with those from another ship.

Danish: Stævnen var låst fast til bundplanken med en lodret planke af eg, men ligesom bundplanken fortsatte den ud over bådrummet med et langt horn, her med T-formet tværsnit.
English: The upper edge of the stem extended from the end of the actual boat in a long horn, T-shaped in cross-section.

Danish: Overkanten af bordgangen bliver først hugget færdigt til sidst, når alle bord er fastgjort.
English: The upper edge of the strake will first be finished when the entire strake has been attached.

Danish: Da oplængerne ikke var bevaret, er det kun skibets bund og kimming som har kunnet undersøges, og begge viser sig at være skalbygget.
English: The upper frames were not preserved, so it was only possible to establish the building sequence of the bottom and of the turn of the bilge, and establish that both had been built according to the shell-based technique.

Danish: Den øvre del af skibssiden har været afstivet af stringere, kraftige plankelignende forstærkninger naglet til indersiden af skibssidens planker.
English: The upper part of the hull was braced with stringers - robust plank-like reinforcements fastened to the inner surface of the ship's planks.

Danish: Den øvre del af skibssiden har været afstivet af stringere, kraftige plankelignende forstærkninger naglet til indersiden af skibssidens planker.
English: The upper part of the hull was braced with stringers – robust plank-like reinforcements fastened to the inner surface of the ship’s planks.

Danish: Det er en udfordring for bådebyggerne at få bordene pænt rundt, ind til agterstævnen.
English: The uppermost strake has a rounded form and the stern is almost semi-circular.

Danish: En torshammer som amulet er fundet i mange forskellige afskygninger.
English: The use of a Thor's hammer as an amulet is seen in many different guises.

Danish: Brugen af GPS åbner desuden mulighed for, at andre elektroniske redskaber kan kobles til felten.
English: The use of GPS also opens up the possibility that information from other electronic tools can be applied directly at the site location.

Danish: Brugen af rene sejlskibe og især af store lastskibe.
English: The use of pure sailing vessels and large cargo vessels in particular.

Danish: Hvis skibet ikke fungerer som helhed, eller hvis enkeltdele slår fra, må vi revurdere rekonstruktionen.
English: The validity of our interpretation will be strengthened if the entirety of the ship and its many individual parts function as intended.

Danish: Kildernes værdi afhænger således af forfatteren.
English: The value of a source thus depends on the author.

Danish: Havspejlsvariationerne i dette område diskuteres (1.4) på grundlag af nyere fund og undersøgelser, og det konkluderes, at havspejlet i 1000-tallet antagelig lå som nu eller højst 0,5 m højere.
English: The variations in the sea level here are discussed in Chapter 1.4 against the background of more recent finds and investigations and the chapter concludes that the sea level in the 11th century probably was the same, or at the most 0.5 m higher, than it is at present.

Danish: De forskellige materialer er derfor bedre egnet til specifikke funktioner - enten i stående eller løbende rig - og er valgt efter de evner de har.
English: The various materials are therefore better suited to specific functions - either in the standing or running rigging - and are selected accordingly.

Danish: De forskellige materialer er derfor bedre egnet til specifikke funktioner – enten i stående eller løbende rig – og er valgt efter de evner de har.
English: The various materials are therefore better suited to specific functions – either in the standing or running rigging – and are selected accordingly.

Danish: De forskellige sejlstillinger/kurser i forhold til vinden har forskellige navne.
English: The various sail settings relative to the wind have different names.

Danish: De forskellige farvande stillede særlige krav til bådens egenskaber, og bådebyggerne løste opgaven ud fra hver deres erfaring.
English: The various straits placed their own demands on the boats capabilities, and boatbuilders applied their own experience to each build.

Danish: Den vektor, der kan tegnes mellem endepunkterne angiver strømmen.
English: The vector, which can be drawn between the two end points, reveals the current.

Danish: Rejsen begynder 2. juli 2007.
English: The venture starts July 2nd 2007.

Danish: De meget brede bordplanker (kun tre bord i hver side) er særkendet for denne type brugs båd.
English: The very broad planking - there are only three strakes on each side of the hull - is characteristic of this type of working vessel.

Danish: Allerede dagen efter Edwards død, lod han sig krone til Harold II, konge af England.
English: The very day after Edward's death he was crowned Harold II, king of England.

Danish: Fartøjet kan bestemmes som formodentlig en lille skude på op til 11 meter, ud fra dimensioner på jernnagler, planker og tømmer.
English: The vessel can be identified as probably being a small craft of up to 11 metres, based on the dimensions of iron dowels, planks and timbers.

Danish: Fartøjet kan manøvrere i medvind såvel som modvind og lystrer så vidt vides sin besætning i store træk.
English: The vessel can manoeuvre in both fair wind and headwind and, as far as is known, does very much what its crew asks of it.

Danish: Fartøjet har haft en lasteevne på 4-5 tons og tolkes som 'føringsbåd' (lille lastfartøj, primært til transport af egne produkter) og mindre rejseskib for en storgård eller lign.
English: The vessel had a cargo-carrying capacity of 4-5 tons and is to be considered a small cargo ship, primarily for the transport of the owner's personal produce, or a transport ship for a large estate or the like.

Danish: Fartøjet har haft masten placeret i et spor i mastespantet, og var således ikke forsynet med kølsvin.
English: The vessel had the mast placed in a step in the mast frame and was therefore not equipped with a kelson.

Danish: Fartøjet er usædvanligt ved at have en for dets samtid usædvanlig kort spantafstand på kun 77 cm.
English: The vessel is unusual in that it has a frame distance of only 77 cm, which was very short for that time.

Danish: Fartøjet er usædvanligt ved at bundstokkene er trænaglet til kølen, og ved at der er hugget udtag i kølen til de enkelte klinkplader for naglerne, der forbinder køl og kølbord.
English: The vessel is unusual in that the floor timbers are attached to the keel with wooden dowels and spaces for the clinker roves were notched into the keel for the dowels that connect the keel to the keel-board.

Danish: Fartøjet er oprindelig bygget af fyrreplanker i seks bordgange støttet i siden af kraftige bjælker (biter) og knæ.
English: The vessel was originally built in six strakes of pine planks, supported in the sides by sturdy beams (bitis) and knees.

Danish: Her vil vi med ‘Island Fox’, en Nelson 45 to-motors motorbåd, følge Havhingsten på den anden del af togtet.
English: The vessel will be the ‘Island Fox’ – a Nelson 45’ twin engined motor cruiser.

Danish: Fartøjet, hvoraf der er bevaret ca. 30%, er bygget af eg og fyr omkring 1185, sandsynligvis i Vestsverige.
English: The vessel, of which about 30% is preserved, was built of oak and pine around 1185, probably in western Sweden.

Danish: Fartøjet, der kun i meget begrænset omfang er undersøgt, kan bestemmes som formodentlig en lille skude på op til 12 meter, ud fra dimensioner på jernnagler, planker og tømmer.
English: The vessel, which has only been investigated to a very limited extent, can be identified as probably being a small craft of up to 12 metres in length based on the dimensions of iron dowels, planks and timbers.

Danish: Fartøjet, der kun i begrænset omfang er bevaret, har oprindeligt været højest 14 meter langt, formodentlig lidt kortere.
English: The vessel, which is only partly preserved, was originally 14 meters long at most, probably slightly shorter.

Danish: Fartøjet, der blev fundet ved udgravningen af Roskilde 4, var forholdsvist dårligt bevaret, og beskadiget både ved anlægsarbejderne omkring bolværkerne og ved udgravningen af Roskilde 4.
English: The vessel, which was found during the excavation of Roskilde 4, was relatively poorly preserved and was damaged both during the construction work for the wharf and the excavation of Roskilde 4.

Danish: Skibene blev derfor udgravet ved hjælp af maskinkraft.
English: The vessels were therefore excavated using a combination of machine and hand excavation.

Danish: De tilbyder beskueren en række stikord, der lader drømmene flyde og indbyder til at danne egne fortællinger.
English: The viewer is offered a variety of cues that let dreams take flight and invite the audience to form their own interpretations.

Danish: De tilbyder beskueren en række stikord, der lader drømmende flyde og indbyder til at danne egne fortællinger.
English: The viewer is offered a variety of cues that let dreas take flight and invite the audience to form their own interpretations.

Danish: Vikingetiden slutter omkring år 1100, men i Skotland kan man godt sige, at der er en "senere vikingetid" indtil omkring 1300.
