English: The Viking Age ends around AD 1100, but in Scotland it can said that there is a “Later Viking Age”, lasting until around AD 1300.

Danish: Når vikingetiden er særlig interessant, er det fordi den – meget kort fortalt – skabte de direkte forudsætninger for det Danmark, vi kender i dag.
English: The Viking Age is especially interesting because – to put it briefly – it created the direct preconditions for the Denmark we know today.

Danish: Bogen fortæller blandt andet historien om, at vikingetidens bådebyggere ikke kun byggede store, klinkbyggede skibe,…
English: The Viking Age is often seen as the period with the large, beautiful clinker-built ships, with iconic, sweeping ste…

Danish: Det er kunsten at bygge sødygtige, sejlførende skibe og fortroligheden med at sejle på åbent hav, som definerer vikingetiden.
English: The Viking Age was ignited by the art of building seaworthy sailing ships and the skills to sail them on the open sea.

Danish: Vikingetidens tidlige byer som Birka i Sverige, Kaupang i Norge, Ribe, Hedeby og Århus i Danmark, voksede frem af tidligere markedspladser.
English: The Viking Age's early towns, such as Birka in Sweden, Kaupang in Norway, Haithabu and, in part, Aarhus in Denmark, grew out of previous market places.

Danish: Vikingegravpladsen ved Kilmainham i Dublin er en af de største, der kendes, udenfor Skandinavien.
English: The Viking cemetery at Kilmainham in Dublin is one of the largest known outside Scandinavia.

Danish: Fra sagaerne kender man til vikingen Egil Skallagrimsson, som også var en dygtig skjald.
English: The Viking Egil Skallagrimsson, who was also a skilful scald, is known from the sagas.

Danish: Vikingegildet bød på et væld af smage - røget og marineret kød og fisk, søde frugter, grønt og urter.
English: The Viking feast was an abundance of flavors - smoked and marinated meats and fish, sweet fruits, vegetables and herbs.

Danish: Vikingegildet med marinerede makreller, krabber, fladbrød med fennikel og mjød.
English: The Viking feast with marinated mackerel, crab, flat bread with fennel and mead.

Danish: Vikinge-graffitien består af 30 runeinskriptioner, og på en hjørnesøjle er der tre indridsede figurer; en drage eller løve, en hvalros og en slange med knuder på.
English: The Viking graffiti comprise 30 runic inscriptions and on a corner pillar three engraved figures; a dragon or a lion, a walrus and a knotted serpent.

Danish: Derfor tager vikingeskibet Eik Sande nu turen fra Roskilde til Kina, for at kaste glans over udstillingen ”Dragons of the Northern Seas”.
English: The Viking ship Eik Sande is now beginning the journey from Roskilde to China, to add an extra element to the exhibition, 'Dragons of the Northern Seas'.

Danish: Vikingeskibet 'Eik Sande', som i den kommende uge sendes som fortrop til Kina, er en minutiøs rekonstruktion i fuld skala af en båd fra det berømte norske Gokstad-fund.
English: The Viking ship Eik Sande, which will be sent to China as the advance party this week, is a detailed, full-scale reconstruction of a boat from the famous Norwegian Gokstad find.

Danish: Vikingeskibshallen fra fjordsiden med Roskilde Domkirke i baggrunden.
English: The Viking Ship Hall seen from the Roskilde Fjord with the Cathedral in the background

Danish: Vikingeskibshallen, tegnet af professor Erik Christian Sørensen, ligger smukt ud til Roskilde Fjord.
English: The Viking Ship Hall, designed by Professor Erik Christian Sørensen, is beautifully located on to Roskilde Fjord.

Danish: Den ældste del af museet, Vikingeskibshallen, åbnede i 1969.
English: The Viking Ship Hall, the oldest part of the museum, was opened in 1969.

Danish: Vikingeskibet er godt gemt af vejen i et såkaldt vandmærke.
English: The Viking ship is well hidden in a so-called watermark.

Danish: Vikingeskibsmuseet , Roskilde (Denmark )
English: The Viking Ship Museum , Roskilde (Denmark )

Danish: Vikingeskibsmuseet har i forvejen vendt og drejet hver 25-øre og lagt en meget betydelig del af museets samlede økonomi i sejladsen.
English: The Viking Ship Museum already has counted every penny twice and placed a considerable part of the museum’s resources in the project.

Danish: Vikingeskibsmuseet og Havhingsten fra Glendalough bliver igen beriget fra Skibsreder Carsten Brebøls Fond.
English: The Viking Ship Museum and the Sea Stallion from Glendalough benefit once more from the Shipowner Carsten Brebøl Foundation.

Danish: Vikingeskibsmuseet står for en af de absolut mest stemningsfulde oplevelser, du kan få på Roskilde Fjord.
English: The Viking Ship Museum arranges sunset boat trips in traditional, Nordic wooden boats.

Danish: Vikingeskibsmuseet kan se tilbage på 40 forrygende år.
English: The Viking Ship Museum can look back over 40 wonderful years.

Danish: I forbindelse med etablering af en ny bådehavn sydøst for Hjarnø færgeleje foretog Vikingeskibsmuseet en marinarkæologisk forundersøgelse.
English: The Viking Ship Museum carried out a marine archaeology survey in connection with the construction of a new harbour for Hjarnø ferry.

Danish: Lokes Frimænd kæmper på markedspladsen
English: The Viking Ship Museum closes

Danish: Vikingeskibsmuseet lukker
English: The Viking Ship Museum closes

Danish: For at kunne udforske de teknikker, metoder og konceptuelle forståelser, der lå bag bygningen og brugen af et fortidigt fartøj anvender vikingeskibsmuseet eksperimentel arkæologi.
English: The Viking Ship Museum conducts experimental archaeological research in order to investigate the techniques, methods and conceptual understandings utilised while building and using the boats and ships of the past.

Danish: Vikingeskibsmuseet fortsætter sommerprogrammet med 'reblægning' fra den 13.- 16. august.
English: The Viking Ship Museum continues the summer program with warrior from August 13 - 16.

Danish: Vikingeskibsmuseet fortsætter sommerprogrammet med 'krigertræning' fra den 30. juli - 5. august.
English: The Viking Ship Museum continues the summer program with warrior from the 30th July - 5ft August.

Danish: Skibet vil hver aften lægge til i Køge Søndre Havn, og i slutningen af ugen vil de mest interessante af fundene blive vist frem for interesserede på havnen.
English: The Viking Ship Museum coordinated the dive at the site, while Køge Museum was responsible for the registration and preservation of the objects salvaged from the seabed.

Danish: Vikingeskibsmuseet sætter fokus på vikingernes maritime håndværk og deres imponerende skibe.
English: The Viking Ship Museum focuses on the Vikings' maritime craftsmanship and their impressive ships.

Danish: Vikingeskibsmuseet i Roskilde fik forbindelse til Seatrek Training gennem en lokal kontakt på Orkney Øerne.
English: The Viking Ship Museum got in contact with Seatrek Training through a local contact person at Orkney Islands.

Danish: Vikingeskibsmuseet har en lang tradition for at have skoler på besøg.
English: The Viking Ship Museum has a long tradition in educational programs.

Danish: Vikingeskibsmuseet har bedt et antal eksperter om at kommentere Havhingstens togt mod Dublin ud fra deres egen faglighed.
English: The Viking Ship Museum has asked a number of experts to comment on the Sea Stallion's voyage to Dublin, based upon their personal knowledge and experience.

Danish: Vikingeskibsmuseet har fået et gevaldigt økonomisk skulderklap.
English: The Viking Ship Museum has gained massive economic recognition.

Danish: Vikingeskibsmuseet har udgivet seminarindlæggene fra Wismar under titlen:
English: The Viking Ship Museum has published the contributions of the Wismar seminar under the title:

Danish: Vikingeskibsmuseet har i sin bådsamling den svenske isbåd XLNT fra 1905.
English: The Viking Ship Museum has the Swedish ice boat XLNT from 1905 in its collection.

Danish: I Wicklow føjer Havhingsten sig til i en moderne udgave.
English: The Viking Ship Museum impresses heads of state from east and west

Danish: I forbindelse med etablering af ny spildevandsledning på tværs af Holbæk Fjord fra Markeslev Renseanlæg til Holbæk Centralrenseanlæg gennemførte Vikingeskibsmuseet i Roskilde en marinarkæologisk forundersøgelse.
English: The Viking Ship Museum in Roskilde carried out a marine archaeology pilot study in connection with the construction of a new waste water pipe across Holbæk Fjord from Markeslev sewage treatment plant to Holbæk central sewage treatment plant.

Danish: På den ene side har Vikingeskibsmuseet i Roskilde besluttet sig for, at forskningen skal formidles til det brede publikum i realtid - altså mens den foregår.
English: The Viking Ship Museum in Roskilde has decided to communicate the research to the public while it is actually carried out.

Danish: På den ene side har Vikingeskibsmuseet i Roskilde besluttet sig for, at forskningen skal formidles til det brede publikum i realtid – altså mens den foregår.
English: The Viking Ship Museum in Roskilde has decided to communicate the research to the public while it is actually carried out.

Danish: Vikingeskibsmuseet i Roskilde sætter igen det marine-arkæologiske forsøgsprojekt på verdenskortet.
English: The Viking Ship Museum in Roskilde has put its marine archaeological research project on the world map yet again.

Danish: Vikingeskibsmuseet i Roskilde varetager det marinarkæologiske ansvar for alle kulturhistoriske perioder på dansk søterritorie øst for Storebælt.
English: The Viking Ship Museum in Roskilde holds the responsibility to safeguard all archaeological artefacts in the Danish territorial waters east of the Great Belt (Storebælt).

Danish: Vikingeskibsmuseet i Roskilde er Danmarks museum for studiet af nordisk skibs- og bådebygningskultur, specielt i forhistorisk tid og middelalder (10.000 f.v.t. - 1.500 e.v.t.).
English: The Viking Ship Museum in Roskilde is Denmark's museum for the study of Nordic shipbuilding and boatbuilding culture, especially during prehistoric times and in the medieval period (10,000 BC - 1500 AD).

Danish: Vikingeskibsmuseet i Roskilde afholder kursus i bådebygning, hvor interesserede kan arbejde med egetræ og især økser, side om side med museets erfarne bådebyggere.
English: The Viking Ship Museum in Roskilde is holding a course in boatbuilding, where those interested can work with oak, and in particular, axes, side by side with the Museum's experienced boatbuilders.

Danish: Vikingeskibsmuseet i Roskilde er Danmarks museum for skibe, søfart og bådebygningskultur i oldtid og middelalder.
English: The Viking Ship Museum in Roskilde is the Danish museum for ships, seafaring and boatbuilding culture in ancient and medieval times.

Danish: Vikingeskibsmuseet i Roskilde, Roskilde 2007.
English: The Viking Ship Museum in Roskilde, Roskilde 2007.

Danish: Vikingeskibsmuseet inviterer i vinterferien børn og voksne med på en handelsrejse i vikingetiden.
English: The Viking Ship Museum invites children and adults on a shopping trip in the Viking Age during the winter holidays.

Danish: I sommerferien inviterer Vikingeskibsmuseet børn og voksne med ud på en spændende rejse i vikingernes verden!
English: The Viking Ship Museum invites children and adults to take part in an exciting journey in the Vikings’ world!

Danish: Vikingeskibsmuseet inviterer alle til at komme og bygge med på museet og følge med online, gennem en sommer med eksperimentalarkæologi og maritime håndværk!
English: The Viking Ship Museum invites everyone to come and build with us at the Museum, and follow the progress online, during a summer of experimental archaeology and maritime craftwork!

Danish: Vikingeskibsmuseet inviterer dig om bord til en unik sejlads med råsejl på nordiske bådtyper, som har været brugt til handel, fiskeri og transport i tusind år.
English: The Viking Ship Museum invites you on board for a unique sailing trip in squaresailed, Nordic boats, a type which have been used for trade, fishing and transport for a thousand years.

Danish: Vikingeskibsmuseet inviterer til en aften med irske stjerner!
English: The Viking Ship Museum invites you to an evening with Irish stars

Danish: Vikingeskibsmuseet inviterer til en spændende aften med den nye rekonstruktion i centrum.
English: The Viking Ship Museum invites you to an exciting evening, focusing on the new reconstruction.

Danish: Vikingeskibsmuseet er kendetegnet ved et tværfagligt forskningsmiljø, hvor håndværkere, akademikere og sejlere tilsammen udforsker fortidens maritime kulturhistorie.
English: The Viking Ship Museum is a cross-disciplinary environment in which craftsmen, academics and seamen work together in order to discover more about maritime cultural heritage.

Danish: Vikingeskibsmuseet er medlem af brancheorganisationen Horesta og følger organisationens regelsæt for reservation og afbestilling i det omfang, der ikke er truffet anden særskilt aftale.
English: The Viking Ship Museum is a member of the Horesta branch organization and follows the organization's rules for reservation and cancellation if no other separate agreement has been agreed upon.

Danish: Vikingeskibsmuseet rummer også en samling af sejlende både.
English: The Viking Ship Museum is also home to a sailing collection of boats.

Danish: Vikingeskibsmuseet modtager og besvarer gerne henvendelser fra pressen, og museets kommunikationsteam står altid til rådighed for forespørgsler og henvendelser omkring museets aktiviteter og drift samt fotorettigheder mv.
English: The Viking Ship Museum is always available for the press as regards questions and information about the activities, the ships and the operation of the Museum.

Danish: Vikingeskibsmuseet bygger på tre årtiers erfaring med sejladsforsøg, men har kun begrænsede midler til at gennemføre tids- og ressourcekrævende forsøgsrejser.
English: The Viking Ship Museum is building on three decades of experience in trial voyages, but has only limited funds to carry out time- and resource-demanding trial voyages.

Danish: Vikingeskibsmuseet er i fuld sving med planlægning af sejladsen.
English: The Viking Ship Museum is busy planning the sailing.

Danish: Vikingeskibsmuseet i Roskilde er mere end et museum.
English: The Viking Ship Museum is more than just a museum.

Danish: Vikingeskibsmuseet er nu i gang med at forberede næste års sejlads hjem fra Dublin.
English: The Viking Ship Museum is now in the process of preparing next year's voyage home from Dublin.

Danish: Vikingeskibsmuseet er nu i gang med at forberede næste års sejlads hjem fra Dublin.
English: The Viking Ship Museum is now in the process of preparing next year’s voyage home from Dublin.

Danish: Vikingeskibsmuseet satser stort i år.
English: The Viking Ship Museum is pulling out the stops this year.

Danish: Vikingeskibsmuseet står klar med pram og udstyr.
English: The Viking Ship Museum is ready with prams and equipment.

Danish: Vikingeskibsmuseet viser i forlængelse af 'Die Wikinger' udstillingen 'Schiffe der Wikinger', der tager udgangspunkt i fundet af de fem vikingeskibe fra Roskilde Fjord og de mere end 50 års arbejde med at bygge og sejle rekonstruktioner af vikingeskibe.
English: The Viking Ship Museum is showing an extension of 'Die Wikinger', with the exhibition, 'Ships of the Vikings', which is based on the find of the five Viking ships on Roskilde Fjord and the more than 50 years of work involved in building and sailing reconstructed Viking ships.

Danish: Vikingeskibsmuseet er førende i verden indenfor marinarkæologien og den eksperimentel arkæologiske forskning og med Havhingsten af Glendaloughs forsøgsrejse Roskilde-Dublin i 2007 og retur i 2008, er Vikingeskibsmuseet navn slået fast over det meste af verden og har bidraget til at sætte Roskilde by på verdenskortet.
English: The Viking Ship Museum is the world leader in the field of marine archaeology and experimental archaeological research and now, since the trial voyage of the Sea Stallion of Glendalough from Roskilde to Dublin in 2007 and return in 2008, the Viking Ship Museum is known around the world and has helped to put Roskilde on the world map.

Danish: I 2004 søsatte Vikingeskibsmuseet Havhingsten fra Glendalough.
English: The Viking Ship Museum launched the Sea Stallion from Glendalough in 2004.

Danish: Vikingeskibsmuseet forbinder forskningen ved selve genstanden med en eksperimentalarkæologisk tilgang, især med spektakulære fuldskalarekonstruktioner.
English: The Viking Ship Museum links research to the object itself through experimental archaeology, especially with spectacular full-scale reconstructions.

Danish: Angiv altid Vikingeskibsmuseet/fotograf navn som byline.
English: The Viking Ship Museum maintains the copyright of the reproduced images.

Danish: Copyright af optagelser/illustrationer forbliver Vikingeskibsmuseets.
English: The Viking Ship Museum maintains the copyright of the reproduced images.

Danish: Vikingeskibsmuseet skal være en grundsten i dansk marinarkæologi, og skal - i samarbejde med Nationalmuseet og Kulturarvsstyrelsen - opretholde et beredskab, der smidigt, effektivt og professionelt kan løse marinarkæologiske opgaver overalt i landet, når det er påkrævet.
English: The Viking Ship Museum must be a cornerstone in Danish marine archaeology and should, in cooperation with the National Museum of Denmark and the Cultural Heritage Authority, maintain a team that can efficiently, effectively and professionally undertake marine archaeology assignments anywhere in the country if required.

Danish: Vikingeskibsmuseet skal være en god, inspirerende og fagligt/personligt udfordrende arbejdsplads, der bygger på gensidig tillid, respekt og ansvar.
English: The Viking Ship Museum must be a good, inspiring and challenging workplace, both professionally and personally.

Danish: Vikingeskibsmuseet skal være en betydningsfuld, international forskningsinstitution, og skal som sådan deltage i netværk og forskningsprojekter.
English: The Viking Ship Museum must be an important, international research institution and as such it must participate in networks and research projects.

Danish: I anledning af sankthansaften og OL-dagene i Roskilde, byder Vikingeskibsmuseet på gratis adgang og masser af spændende aftenarrangementer lørdag den 23. juni kl. 17.00 - 20.30.
English: The Viking Ship Museum offer free admission and lots of exciting events on the evening of Saturday 23rd June, from 17:00 – 20:30 to celebrate Saint John’s Eve.

Danish: Vikingeskibsmuseet råder over et stort fotoarkiv og en lang række filmmateriale, som kan købes eller lejes.
English: The Viking Ship Museum offers a comprehensive collection of photos and videos for sale or rent.

Danish: Vikingeskibsmuseet råder over et stort fotoarkiv og en lang række filmmateriale,.
English: The Viking Ship Museum offers a comprehensive collection of photos and videos for sale or rent.

Danish: Vikingeskibsmuseet tilbyder sejladser i traditionelle, nordiske både dagligt fra 1. maj - 30. september.
English: The Viking Ship Museum offers daily summer-sailings from May 1st - September 30th.

Danish: Vikingeskibsmuseet inviterer børn og voksne med ud på en spændende rejse i Vikingernes verden.
English: The Viking Ship Museum offers daily, free guided tours.

Danish: Vikingeskibsmuseet tilbyder gratis rundvisninger på engelsk.
English: The Viking Ship Museum offers daily, free guided tours.

Danish: Vikingeskibsmuseet tilbyder hver dag gratis rundvisninger på engelsk.
English: The Viking Ship Museum offers daily, free guided tours.

Danish: Vikingeskibsmuseet tilbyder rundvisninger på engelsk.
English: The Viking Ship Museum offers daily, free guided tours.

Danish: Vikingeskibsmuseet tilbyder unikke sejlture for firmaer, foreninger og øvrige grupper fra den 1. maj til den 30. september.
English: The Viking Ship Museum offers exclusive sailing trips for companies, associations and other groups from May 1st. to September 30th.

Danish: Kurset foregår i vikingeskibene 'Helge Ask' og 'Kraka Fyr' og giver indsigt i den særlige råsejlsteknik.
English: The Viking Ship Museum offers full-day courses for those who wish to learn how to sail a Viking ship.

Danish: Vikingeskibsmuseet tilbyder heldagskurser for dem, der vil prøve kræfter med at sejle vikingeskib.
English: The Viking Ship Museum offers full-day courses for those who wish to learn how to sail a Viking ship.

Danish: Lokes Frimænd kæmper på markedsladsen
English: The Viking Ship Museum opens

Danish: Vikingeskibsmuseet åbner
English: The Viking Ship Museum opens

Danish: Herudover skal Vikingeskibsmuseet varetage et eget arkæologisk ansvarsområde i farvande og landsdele øst for Storebælt.
English: The Viking Ship Museum shall also attend to a separate archaeological area of responsibility in the waters and regions east of the Great Belt.

Danish: Vikingeskibsmuseet skal tilbyde inspirerende og engagerende undervisning til danske skolebørn og gymnasieelever i samarbejde med Skoletjenesten.
English: The Viking Ship Museum shall provide inspiring and relevant tuition to Danish school children and secondary school pupils in cooperation with the Skoletjenesten (Schools Services).

Danish: Vikingeskibsmuseet skal være en synlig kulturinstitution, lokalt, nationalt og internationalt.
English: The Viking Ship Museum should be a visible cultural institution, locally, nationally and internationally.

Danish: Vikingeskibsmuseet personale oplevede det dramatiske døgn på første hånd.
English: The Viking Ship Museum staff saw the dramatic events firsthand.

Danish: Vikingeskibsmuseet ønsker at bruge et besøg til at skabe optimal opmærksomhed omkring projektet, som museet har valgt at kalde ”Fuldblod på Havet”.
English: The Viking Ship Museum wants to use a visit to create maximum attention about the project the Museum calls “Thoroughbred of the Sea”.

Danish: Vikingeskibshallen var allerede inden åbningen en stor turistattraktion.
English: The Viking Ship Museum was already a major tourist attraction even before it opened.

Danish: Vikingeskibsmuseet fik tilbudt at deltage gratis med et antal prøver mod at firmaet kunne udlægge én af deres prøveflåder i Vikingeskibsmuseets havn.
English: The Viking Ship Museum was given the opportunity to contribute with a number of samples at no cost in exchange for the company being able to place one of their sample rafts in the Viking Ship Museum's harbour.

Danish: Vikingeskibsmuseet fik tilbudt at deltage gratis med et antal prøver mod at firmaet kunne udlægge én af deres prøveflåder i Vikingeskibsmuseets havn.
English: The Viking Ship Museum was given the opportunity to contribute with a number of samples at no cost in exchange for the company being able to place one of their sample rafts in the Viking Ship Museum’s harbour.

Danish: Vikingeskibsmuseet byder dig velkommen i en verden af viden om skibe, søfart og bådebygningskultur i oldtid og middelalder.
English: The Viking Ship Museum welcomes you to a world of knowledge about ships, sailing and shipbuilding culture in antiquity and the Middle Ages.

Danish: Vikingeskibsmuseet fylder 40 den 20. juni
English: The Viking Ship Museum will be 40 years old on 20 June

Danish: Vikingeskibsmuseet følger nu op på succesen og udvider sejlsæsonen med to måneder.
English: The Viking Ship Museum will now follow up on last year's success by expanding the season by two months.

Danish: Vikingeskibsmuseet viser i forlængelse af 'Die Wikinger' udstillingen 'Schiffe der Wikinger', der tager udgangspunkt i fundet af de fem vikingeskibe fra Roskilde Fjord og de mere end 50 års arbejde med at bygge og sejle rekonstruktioner af vikingeskibe.
English: The Viking Ship Museum will present a continuation of 'Die Wikinger' with the exhibition 'Ships of the Vikings', which explores the excavation of the five Viking ships from Roskilde Fjord and the more than 50 years of work that have been involved in building and sailing reconstructions of Viking ships.

Danish: Museet benytter lejligheden til at invitere Havhingstens besætning og de nærmeste samarbejdspartnere fra projekt "Fuldblod på Havet" til en reception i forbindelse med præsidentens besøg.
English: The Viking Ship Museum will take this opportunity to invite the Sea Stallion's crew and other important collaborators from the project "Thoroughbred of the Sea" to a reception in connection with the president's visit.

Danish: Vikingeskibsmuseet slår både lørdag og søndag dørene op for publikum fra 10-17.
English: The Viking Ship Museum will welcome the public Saturday and Sunday from 10-17.

Danish: Vikingeskibsmuseet arbejder målrettet med at bevare de maritime håndværk gennem forskellige byggeprojekter.
English: The Viking Ship Museum works actively to preserve maritime craftwork through different building projects.

Danish: Vikingeskibsmuseets adresse:
English: The Viking Ship Museum's address:

Danish: Vikingeskibsmuseets bankforbindelse:
English: The Viking Ship Museum's address:

Danish: Vikingeskibsmuseets bådsamling er søsat, der er tjærelugt i luften, og overalt summer der af travlhed for at få Vikingeskibshallen og de udendørs områder klar til sæsonen.
English: The Viking Ship Museum's boat collection has been launched, there is smell of tar in the air, and everywhere there is a buzz of activity to make the Viking Ship Hall and the outdoor areas ready for the season.

Danish: Vikingeskibsmuseets Bådelaug er et samarbejdsorgan, hvor Vikingeskibsmuseet og repræsentanter fra de enkelte bådelaug skaber rammerne for brugen af museets både.
English: The Viking Ship Museum's boat guild is a co-operative organisation, where the Viking Ship Museum and representatives from the individual boat guilds work together to develop a framework for the use of the Museum's boats.

Danish: Vikingeskibsmuseets bådebyggere hugger planker til Skuldelev 3, der er en rekonstruktion af et mindre handelsfartøj.
English: The Viking Ship Museum's boatbuilders are shaping planks for the Skuldelev 3, a reconstruction of a smaller trading vessel.

Danish: Vikingeskibsmuseets bådeværft bygger to store færøbåde med 10 årer i hver side - på færøsk 'teinæringur'- der skal bruges til sejlads med museets gæster.
English: The Viking Ship Museum's boatyard are building two large Faroe Boats with 10 oars on each side - in Faroese 'teinæringur' - to be used for sailing with the museum's guests.

Danish: Vikingeskibsmuseets bådeværft bygger en færøsk seksæring til museets sejladstjeneste
English: The Viking Ship Museum's boatyard built a Faroese 'seksæring' for the Museum's sailing service.

Danish: Vikingeskibsmuseets bådeværft bygger en færøsk seksæring til museets sejladstjeneste.
English: The Viking Ship Museum's boatyard built a Faroese 'seksæring' for the Museum's sailing service.

Danish: Så tilbyder Vikingeskibsmuseets bådeværft traditionelle træbåde og vikingeskibe til salg.
English: The Viking Ship Museum's boatyard produces and sells traditional wooden boats and Viking ships.

Danish: Vikingeskibsmuseets færøske bådebygger Hanus Jensen reparerede engang en båd for en mand hvis bedstemor kunne huske ringleriet fra bjælderne.
English: The Viking Ship Museum's Faroese boatbuilder Hanus Jensen once repaired a boat for a man whose grandmother could remember the sound from the bells.

Danish: Vikingeskibsmuseets første rekonstruktion af Skuldelevskibene Roar Ege, sejles stadig af et aktivt bådelaug og kan ses i museumshavnen.
English: The Viking Ship Museum's first reconstruction of the Skuldelev ships, Roar Ege, is still sailed by an active boat society and can be seen in the museum harbour.

Danish: Vikingeskibsmuseets flagskib har været i alverdens aviser og elektroniske medier.
English: The Viking Ship Museum's flagship has been in all the world's newspapers and electronic media.

Danish: Vikingeskibsmuseets dygtige guider giver dagligt en spændende omvisning, hvor de fem vikingeskibe er særligt i fokus.
English: The Viking Ship Museum's guides hold exciting tours every day, with a special focus on the five Viking ships.

Danish: På Vikingeskibsmuseets hjemmeside åbner samtidig en webudstilling på dansk og engelsk, der præsenterer tidskapslens genstande.
English: The Viking Ship Museum's homepage will simultaneously open an internet exhibition in Danish and English presenting the objects in the time capsule.

Danish: Vikingeskibsmuseets marinarkæologer undersøger i disse dage et hidtil ukendt skibsvrag.
English: The Viking Ship Museum's maritime archaeologists are currently investigating a previously unknown shipwreck.

Danish: Vikingeskibsmuseets marinarkæologer har Sjælland, Øerne og Bornholm, samt farvandene øst for Storebælt som deres ansvarsområder.
English: The Viking Ship Museum's maritime archaeologists are responsible for the waters of eastern Denmark, surrounding the islands of Zealand and Bornholm.

Danish: Vikingeskibsmuseets mission, vision og værdier
English: The Viking Ship Museum's mission, vision and values

Danish: Vikingeskibsmuseets egne rekonstruktioner og vikingeskibe fra andre dele af landet, vil weekenden igennem vise skibene frem for publikum.
English: The Viking Ship Museum's own reconstructions and Viking ships from other parts of the country will be on display throughout the weekend.

Danish: Vikingeskibsmuseets forlagsvirksomhed har modtaget en bevilling på 30.000 danske kroner.
English: The Viking Ship Museum's publishing company has received a grant of DKK 30,000.

Danish: Vikingeskibsmuseets rekonstruktion af Skuldelev 1, Ottar, kan ses i Museumshavnen.
English: The Viking Ship Museum's reconstruction of Skuldelev 1, Ottar, is on display in the Museum Harbour.

Danish: Vikingeskibsmuseets rekonstruktion af Skuldelev 2, Havhingsten fra Glendalough, kan ses i Museumshavnen.
English: The Viking Ship Museum's reconstruction of Skuldelev 2, The Sea Stallion from Glendalough, is on display in the Museum Harbour.

Danish: Vikingeskibsmuseets rekonstruktion af Skuldelev 5, Helge Ask, kan ses i Museumshavnen.
English: The Viking Ship Museum's reconstruction of Skuldelev 5, Helge Ask, is on display at the Museum Harbour.

Danish: Vikingeskibsmuseets rekonstruktion, Roar Ege, kan ses i Museumshavnen.
English: The Viking Ship Museum's reconstruction, Roar Ege, is on display at the museum harbour.

Danish: Vikingeskibsmuseets rekonstruktioner ligger i Museumshavnen, side om side med de traditionelle træbåde.
English: The Viking Ship Museum's reconstructions are lying in the Museum Harbour, side by side with the traditional wooden boats.

Danish: Endelig kunne Vikingeskibsmuseets forsøgsprojekt fortsætte sin færd hjem mod Roskilde.
English: The Viking Ship Museum's research project could at last continue its return voyage home to Roskilde.

Danish: I dag kort før middag og maksimal højvande forlod Vikingeskibsmuseets forsøgsprojekt ”Havhingsten fra Glendalough” den lille havneby Wicklow i Irland.
English: The Viking Ship Museum's research project, the "Sea Stallion from Glendalough", left the little port of Wicklow in Ireland at high tide shortly before noon today.

Danish: Vikingeskibsmuseets sejlende rekonstruktion af Skuldelev 5, HELGE ASK.
English: The Viking Ship Museum's sailing reconstruction of Skuldelev 5, Helge Ask.

Danish: Vikingeskibsmuseets sejladstjeneste udvider tilbuddet om en unik oplevelse med råsejl og årer på Roskilde Fjord.
English: The Viking Ship Museum's sailing service is expanding its offer of a unique experience with square sails and oars on Roskilde Fjord.

Danish: Vikingeskibsmuseets Skoletjeneste arrangerer sejlture for skoler og øvrige børnegrupper.
English: The Viking Ship Museum's School Service also organises sailing trips for schools and other children's organisations.

Danish: Optagningen af museets vikingeskibe finder sted lørdag den 31. oktober.
English: The Viking Ship Museum's ships will be hauled ashore on Saturday 31 October.

Danish: Vikingeskibsmuseets bådværft havde udlånt en af de bredbil økser, som Havhingstens planker er kløvet med.
English: The Viking Ship Museum's shipyard had lent us one of the bredbil axes, used to dress the Sea Stallion's planks.

Danish: Vikingeskibsmuseets dygtige håndværkere viser deres kunnen og museets gæster inviteres til selv at prøve kræfter med materialerne.
English: The Viking Ship Museum's skilled craftworkers demonstrate their abilities and the Museum's guests are invited to try their hand with the materials.

Danish: Vikingeskibsmuseets rekonstruktion af Skuldelev 6, Kraka Fyr, kan ses i Museumshavnen.
English: The Viking Ship Museum's two reconstructions of Skuldelev 6, Kraka Fyr and Skjoldungen, is on display at the museum harbour.

Danish: Vikingeskibsmuseet har i samarbejde med Samsø Turist- og Erhvervscenter og lokale producenter på Samsø inviteret folkene fra River Cottage til at lave et festmåltid til 100 personer i Langør på Samsø.
English: The Viking Ship Museum, in collaboration with the Samsø Business and Tourism Centre and local producers on Samsø, have invited the people from River Cottage to create a feast for 100 people in Langør on the island.

Danish: Mandag indledte Vikingeskibsmuseet, Køge Museum og Nationalmuseet i samarbejde undervandsarkæologiske undersøgelser på vraget af linieskibet Dannebroge i Køge Bugt.
English: The Viking Ship Museum, Køge Museum and the National Museum have carried out underwater archaeological investigations on the wreck of the ship Dannebroge in Køge Bay.

Danish: Vikingeskibsmuseets bådsamling rummer allerede en rekonstruktion af Skuldelev 6.
English: The Viking Ship Museum’s boat collection already includes a reconstruction of Skuldelev 6.

Danish: Vikingeskibsmuseets Bådelaug er et samarbejdsorgan, hvor Vikingeskibsmuseet og repræsentanter fra de enkelte bådelaug skaber rammerne for brugen af museets både.
English: The Viking Ship Museum’s boat guild is a co-operative organisation, where the Viking Ship Museum and representatives from the individual boat guilds work together to develop a framework for the use of the Museum’s boats.

Danish: Vikingeskibsmuseets bådebyggere bygger en rekonstruktion af et vikingeskib i fuld størrelse, det såkaldte Skuldelev 3-skib, et mindre handelsskib fra år 1040, der blev fundet ved Skuldelev i Roskilde Fjord for over 50 år siden.
English: The Viking Ship Museum’s boatbuilders are building a reconstruction of a Viking ship in full-scale, the so-called Skuldelev 3 ship-find: a small trading ship from ca. 1040, which was found near Skuldelev in Roskilde Fjord over 50 years ago.

Danish: På bådeværftet er museets bådebyggere i fuld sving med at bygge et nyt skib.
English: The Viking Ship Museum’s boatbuilders are busy building a new replica of a Viking ship at the boat yard.

Danish: Vikingeskibsmuseets bådebyggere hugger planker til Skuldelev 3, der er en rekonstruktion af et mindre handelsfartøj.
English: The Viking Ship Museum’s boatbuilders are shaping planks for the Skuldelev 3, a reconstruction of a smaller trading vessel.

Danish: Vikingeskibsmuseets både skal tilbage i vandet.
English: The Viking Ship Museum’s boats shall be returned to the water.

Danish: Vikingeskibsmuseets bådeværft
English: The Viking Ship Museum’s boatyard

Danish: Vikingeskibsmuseets bådeværft løser også bygge- og restaureringsopgaver på klinkbyggede brugsbåde for andre museer og forening
English: The Viking Ship Museum’s boatyard also undertakes building and restoration assignments with clinker-built boats for other museums and organisations.

Danish: Vikingeskibsmuseets bådeværft er påbegyndt en ny rekonstruktion af vikingeskibet Skuldelev 6.
English: The Viking Ship Museum’s boatyard has started on a new reconstruction of the Viking ship Skuldelev 6.

Danish: Vikingeskibsmuseets værft bygger båden i samarbejde med Nationalparkprojektet Skjoldungelandet.
English: The Viking Ship Museum’s boatyard is building the boat in cooperation with the National Park Project, Skjoldungelandet.

Danish: Så tilbyder Vikingeskibsmuseets bådeværft traditionelle træbåde og vikingeskibe til salg.
English: The Viking Ship Museum’s boatyard produces and sells traditional wooden boats and Viking ships.

Danish: Vikingeskibsmuseets direktør Tinna Damgaard-Sørensen kvitterede straks med at sende familien et årskort, en kalender og en flot DVD om Havhingsten.
English: The Viking Ship Museum’s director, Tinna Damgaard-Sørensen, responded quickly and sent the family a year's season ticket, a calendar, and a great DVD about the Sea Stallion.

Danish: Vikingeskibsmuseets første rekonstruktion af Skuldelevskibene Roar Ege, sejles stadig af et aktivt bådelaug og kan ses i museumshavnen.
English: The Viking Ship Museum’s first reconstruction of the Skuldelev ships, Roar Ege, is still sailed by an active boat society and can be seen in the museum harbour.

Danish: Vikingeskibsmuseets flagskib har været i alverdens aviser og elektroniske medier.
English: The Viking Ship Museum’s flagship has been in all the world’s newspapers and electronic media.

Danish: På Vikingeskibsmuseets hjemmeside åbner samtidig en webudstilling på dansk og engelsk, der præsenterer tidskapslens genstande.
English: The Viking Ship Museum’s homepage will simultaneously open an internet exhibition in Danish and English presenting the objects in the time capsule.

Danish: Vikingeskibsmuseets egne rekonstruktioner og vikingeskibe fra andre dele af landet, vil weekenden igennem vise skibene frem for publikum.
English: The Viking Ship Museum’s own reconstructions and Viking ships from other parts of the country will be on display throughout the weekend.

Danish: Vikingeskibsmuseet forundersøger
English: The Viking Ship Museum’s pilot studies

Danish: Vikingeskibsmuseets forlagsvirksomhed har modtaget en bevilling på 30.000 danske kroner.
English: The Viking Ship Museum’s publishing company has received a grant of DKK 30,000.

Danish: Vikingeskibsmuseets Skoletjeneste arrangerer sejlture for skoler og øvrige børnegrupper.
English: The Viking Ship Museum’s School Service also organises sailing trips for schools and other children’s organisations.

Danish: Optagningen af museets vikingeskibe finder sted lørdag den 31. oktober.
English: The Viking Ship Museum’s ships will be hauled ashore on Saturday 31 October.

Danish: Pressemeddelelse: Vikingeskibet, der ikke kunne sejle, har sat kursen mod Roskilde
English: The Viking Ship that could'nt sail, are coming to Roskilde on Saturday

Danish: Vikingeskibet, der ikke kunne sejle, er på vej over Kattegat med kurs mod Roskilde
English: The Viking ship that couldn't sail is headed for Roskilde

Danish: Sejladsen er det største marinarkæologiske eksperiment nogensinde - en forsøgsrejse uden sidestykke.
English: The Viking ship voyage will be the hugest marine archaeological experiment ever.

Danish: Sejladsen er det største marinarkæologiske eksperiment nogensinde – en forsøgsrejse uden sidestykke.
English: The Viking ship voyage will be the hugest marine archaeological experiment ever.

Danish: På 20 sekunder sejlede vikingeskibet 'Dronningen' sig selv ned og alle de ombordværende lå pludselig i vandet med en masse løsøre flydende omkring sig.
English: The Viking ship “Dronningen” sank in only 20 seconds and suddenly all those on board found themselves in the water with all their belongings floating around them.

Danish: Kurset giver deltagerne en hands-on introduktion til sejlads med råsejlet, som vikingeskibenes sejltype kaldes.
English: The Viking ship's special design will also be reviewed during the course, and the ship's cordage will be introduced.

Danish: Vikingeskibets særlige konstruktion bliver også gennemgået på kurset, og skibets tovværk introduceres.
English: The Viking ship's special design will also be reviewed during the course, and the ship's cordage will be introduced.

Danish: Vikingeskibets særlige konstruktion bliver også gennemgået, og skibets tovværk - ofte i originale materialer, som hestehår og lindebast - præsenteres og forklares.
English: The Viking ship's special design will also be reviewed during the course, and the ship's cordage will be introduced.

Danish: Vikingeskibet Roar Ege er en rekonstruktion af Skuldelev 3, det 14 meter lange fiske- og fragt-skib, bygget omkring 1040.
English: The Viking ship, Roar Ege, is a reconstruction of Skuldelev 3, the 14m long fishing and cargo ship that was built around the year 1040.

Danish: Vikingeskibet, romaskinen, dragter samt rekonstruktioner af våben og værktøj, der skal bruges til den levende formidling i udstillingen, i pakkes i container på Vikingeskibsmuseet i Roskilde tirsdag den 20. januar.
English: The Viking ship, rowing machine, costumes and reconstructions of weapons and tools, which will be used as activities in the exhibition, will be packed in a container at the Viking Ship Museum in Roskilde on Tuesday, 20th January.

Danish: Alle skibene bliver sejlet af frivillige fra museets bådelaug.
English: The Viking ships are sailed by volunteers from the museum's boat guilds.

Danish: Vikingeskibene i Roskilde
English: The Viking Ships in Roskilde

Danish: Vikingeskibene fortæller også historien om Roskilde som en af Rigets vigtigste byer i tiden, hvor Danmark blev til.
English: The Viking ships reveal that Roskilde was one of the most important towns in the kingdom at the time that Denmark was being created.

Danish: Vikingeskibene var en væsentlig forudsætning for hele den udvikling.
English: The Viking ships were an important precondition for the whole of that development.

Danish: Vikingeskibenes firkantede råsejl var i størrelse og form udviklet sammen med den enkelte skrogstørrelse og skibstype.
English: The Viking ships' square sail was, in size and shape, developed together with the individual hull size and type of ship.

Danish: Vikingeskibenes firkantede råsejl var i størrelse og form udviklet sammen med den enkelte skrogstørrelse og skibstype.
English: The Viking ships’ square sail was, in size and shape, developed together with the individual hull size and type of ship.

Danish: Vikingeskibets særlige konstruktion bliver også gennemgået på kurset, og skibets tovværk introduceres.
English: The Viking ship’s special design will also be reviewed during the course, and the ship’s cordage will be introduced.

Danish: Vikingeskibets særlige konstruktion bliver også gennemgået, og skibets tovværk - ofte i originale materialer, som hestehår og lindebast - præsenteres og forklares.
English: The Viking ship’s special design will also be reviewed during the course, and the ship’s cordage will be introduced.

Danish: Vikingeskibets særlige konstruktion og materialer bliver også introduceret til deltagerne ligesom skibets tovværk - ofte i originale materialer, som hestehår og lindebast - præsenteres og forklares.
English: The Viking ship’s special design will also be reviewed during the course, and the ship’s cordage will be introduced.

Danish: Vikingebyen Waterford er formentlig grundlagt omkring 914 , hvor det i Fragmentary Annals of Ireland berettes, at "en stor, norsk flådestyrke gik i land ved Port Lairge, og de plyndrede den nordlige del af Osfaige og bragte bytte og mange køer og husdyr om bord på deres skibe".
English: The Viking town of Waterford appears to have been founded around 914AD when it is recorded in the Fragmentary Annals of Ireland that 'a great fleet of Norwegians landed at Port Lairge and they plundered northern Osraige and brought spoils and many cows and livestock to their ships'.

Danish: Vikingernes Uldsejl 1999
English: The Viking wool sail 1999

Danish: Vikingeværkstederne er åbne på Museumsøen.
English: The Viking Workshops on the Museum Island are open.

Danish: Også vikingerne har uden tvivl spillet under sejlads, når vejret var til det!
English: The Vikings also liked to play board games, even on board their ships, if the weather allowed it.

Danish: I nogle af disse fortællinger optræder vikingerne.
English: The Vikings appear in some of these accounts.

Danish: Vikingerne lærte kristendommen at kende i udlandet eller fra de munke og handelsmænd, der rejste til Norden for at missionere og handle.
English: The Vikings became acquainted with Christianity abroad or by way of the monks and merchants who travelled to the Nordic Countries to spread the Christian faith or to trade.

Danish: Med sig hjem fra deres rejser bragte vikingerne luksusvarer, råmaterialer, klæder, smykker og våben.
English: The Vikings brought luxury items, raw materials, clothing, jewellery and weapons home from their journeys.

Danish: Skibet er bygget, som i vikingetiden, af friskt træ.
English: The Vikings built their ships of fresh wood.

Danish: Dog kan vikingerne også have importeret salt fra Østersølandene.
English: The Vikings could, however, have imported salt from the Baltic Countries.

Danish: I vikingeboderne viser vikingerne forskellige håndværk og sælger deres smukke produkter.
English: The Vikings demonstrate hand crafts and sell their beautiful products.

Danish: Vikingerne byggede ikke deres skibe efter tegninger, men gjorde brug af overleverede erfaringer og lokale traditioner.
English: The Vikings did not build their ships according to drawn plans, but made use of experience handed down from generation to generation and also of local traditions.

Danish: Vikingerne kæmpede ikke kun mod irerne – ved midten af 800-tallet fungerede de også som lejesoldater i kampe mellem irske konger.
English: The Vikings did not only fight against Irish: by the mid-ninth century they served as mercenaries in battles between Irish kings.

Danish: Vikingerne brugte ikke saven til at fremstille bordplanker, de kløvede dem ud.
English: The Vikings didn't use a saw to produce planks, instead, the cleaved them from the trunk.

Danish: Vikingerne brugte ikke saven
English: The Vikings didn’t use saws

Danish: Vikingerne havde både årehuller i bordplankerne, men også som her på Gislingebåden årekejper.
English: The Vikings had both oar ports in planks and oar locks, such as those seen here on the Gislinge boat.

Danish: Vikingerne havde både årehuller i bordplankerne, men også årekejper.
English: The Vikings had both oar ports in planks and oar locks, such as those seen here on the Gislinge boat.

Danish: Vikingerne havde mange forbindelser til den grønne ø og et iøjnefaldende bevis på dette, er Vikingeskibsmuseets langskib Havhingsten fra Glendalough.
English: The Vikings had many connections to the emerald isle and the Viking Ship Museum’s longship, the Sea Stallion from Glendalough, is a striking example of this connection.

Danish: Der er også fundet spor efter jernforarbejdning på øen, hvilket har været nødvendigt for at fremstille og vedligeholde redskaber og våben.
English: The Vikings here didn't need a byre because the island had had very limited grazing for animals.

Danish: Vikingerne i England
English: The Vikings in England

Danish: Vikingerne i Irland
English: The vikings in Ireland

Danish: Vikingerne i Irland 2002 - 2004
English: The Vikings in Ireland 2002 - 2004

Danish: Vikingerne i Irland blev – som andre steder i Europa – ikke kristne før engang sent i 900-tallet.
English: The Vikings in Ireland as elsewhere in Europe were not Christianised until the late tenth century.

Danish: Vikingerne i Skotland
English: The Vikings in Scotland

Danish: Vikingerne i Vest
English: The Vikings in the West

Danish: Vikingerne drog ud i verden og gjorde sig bekendt med kristendommen forskellige steder.
English: The Vikings journeyed out into the world and became acquainted with Christianity in several places.

Danish: Vikingerne var, via handelskontakter i området, bekendt med landets store rigdomme.
English: The Vikings knew of the country's great riches through established trade contacts between Scandinavia and the Frankish Empire.

Danish: Vikingerne skulle have benyttet et såkaldt solkompas.
English: The Vikings probably used a sun compass.

Danish: For 1000 år siden sejlede vikingerne til England.
English: The Vikings sailed to England 1,000 years ago.

Danish: Vikingerne slog sig ned i Dublin fra år 841 og frem.
English: The Vikings settled in Dublin from 841 AD onwards.

Danish: Vikingeskibene er bygget på museets bådeværft efter vikingernes bådebygningstraditioner og med kopier af deres værktøj.
English: The Vikings ships are built at the Museum's own boatyard, in line with Viking boatbuilding traditions and using copies of their tools.

Danish: Vikingeskibene er bygget på museets bådeværft efter vikingernes bådebygningstraditioner og med kopier af deres værktøj.
English: The Vikings ships are built at the Museum’s own boatyard, in line with Viking boatbuilding traditions and using copies of their tools.

Danish: Vikingerne selv erobrede allerede etablerede magtcentre.
English: The Vikings themselves conquered already established centres of power.

Danish: Vikingerne udnyttede uroen og hærgede i 980 den engelske kyst.
English: The Vikings took advantage of this and in AD 980 they ravaged the English coast.

Danish: Man kan godt selv lave en trefod af tre kraftige pinde som bindes sammen.
English: The Vikings used iron cauldrons, which they hung up on a tripod over the fire.

Danish: a. anvendte deres uld til sejl.
English: The Vikings used their wool to make sails.

Danish: Efter de første bølger af plyndringstogter erobrede vikingerne sig jord og bosatte sig.
English: The Vikings were also of great significance for the development of towns both in England and Ireland.

Danish: Vikingerne fik også stor betydning for udviklingen af byer i både England og Irland.
English: The Vikings were also of great significance for the development of towns both in England and Ireland.

Danish: a. stor betydning for udviklingen af byer i både England og Irland.
English: The Vikings were of great importance for the development of towns in both England and Ireland.

Danish: Vikingerne fik bl.a. stor betydning for udviklingen af byer i både England og Irland.
English: The Vikings were of great importance for the development of towns in both England and Ireland.

Danish: Vikingerne var dygtige håndværkere og mestrede mange svære håndværksteknikker.
English: The Vikings were skilled craft workers and mastered many difficult craft techniques.

Danish: Vikingerne var dygtige sømænd
English: The vikings were skilled sailors

Danish: Vikingernes tilstedeværelse var fremmende for forandringen af det politiske og kulturelle liv i Irland.
English: The Vikings were the catalyst of change in Irish political and cultural life.

Danish: Vikingerne var de første i skandinavisk historie, der satte sejl på deres skibe og fik muligheden for at rejse vidt omkring.
English: The Vikings were the first people in Scandinavian history to fit sails to their ships and acquire the ability to travel much further.

Danish: Af: Niels Lund, Professor, Dr. phil, Københavns Universitet
English: The Vikings were well-versed in using all these colours.

Danish: Vikingerne er dog oftest det sekundære emne og fortællingerne er fortalt på baggrund af politiske, militære eller religiøse konfrontationer med vikingerne.
English: The Vikings were, however, most often a secondary subject and the accounts were told against a background of political, military and religious confrontations with them.

Danish: Vikingernes udseende, tøj og smykker
English: The Vikings' appearance, clothes and ornaments

Danish: Vikingernes buer, pil og falk - på buebanen ved Jan Hansen
English: The Vikings' bows, arrows and falcons - a show on the archery range, by Jan Hansen

Danish: Vikingernes egne billeder viser som oftest sejl, der er dobbelt så brede som højden, mens de rekonstruerede sejl er mere eller mindre kvadratiske eller højere end bredden.
English: The Vikings' own illustrations most commonly show sails that are twice as wide as they are high, whereas the reconstructed sails are more-or-less quadratic or higher than they are wide.

Danish: De synlige vragdele dækker et område på ca. 15x30m og udgøres af to flade, tæt spantede vragflager samt en række løsrevne dele.
English: The visible wreckage covers an area of approximately 15x30 metres and consists of two flat, closely framed wreckage floes and a number of disconnected pieces.

Danish: Det vil være et besøg af national vigtighed," fortalte Jack Drever.
English: The visit will be of national importance”, said Jack Drever.

Danish: De visuelle og scenografiske udtryk i publikumsområderne skal danne overraskende og smukke ”billeder”, og skal samtidig understøtte det miljø og den historie, der formidles.
English: The visual and stenographic expression in the public areas shall form surprising and beautiful ‘images’ and shall simultaneously support the environment and the history that is being communicated.

Danish: Oversejlingen fra Bergen til New Foundland (3900 sømil) tog blot 27 dage og årerne anvendtes ikke.
English: The voyage from Bergen to Newfoundland (3900 nautical miles) took just 27 days and oars were not used.

Danish: Sejladsen Roskilde-Dublin tur/retur i 2007-2008 blev kulminationen på mange års arbejde, og er det hidtil mest omfattende arkæologiske eksperiment, museet har gennemført.
English: The voyage from Roskilde to Dublin and back in 2007-2008 was the culmination of many years of work, and the most ambitious arcaheological experiment the museum has ever carried out.

Danish: Havhingstens togt er slut for i år - skibet er nu i Dublin.
English: The voyage has ended - The Sea Stallion is in Dublin.

Danish: Sejladsen er planlagt til at vare i seks uger og slutter i Nuuk i Vestgrønland i midten af august.
English: The voyage is expected to take six weeks and will end in Nuuk in western Greenland.

Danish: Havhingsten togt er slut for i år
English: The voyage is over for this year

Danish: Sejladsen mod over Nordsøen mod Orkney starter fra den Norske by Egersund.
English: The voyage to Orkney will depart from this Norwegian town.

Danish: Rejsen fandt sted fra 29. juni til 9. august 2008 og undervejs blev der sendt navigationsdata hjem, time for time.
English: The voyage took place from 29 June to 9 August, 2008, and on the way, we transmitted navigation data to the website.

Danish: Rejsen fandt sted i perioden fra den 1. juli til den 14. august, 2007 og undervejs blev der sendt navigationsdata hjem, time for time.
English: The voyage took place from the 1st of July to the 14th of August, 2007 and on the way, we transmitted navigation data to the homepage.

Danish: Ottars, Abharas og Theodosios' rejser strakte sig over den halve klode, fra Kina til Den Persiske Golf, fra Middelhavet til Nordeuropa og videre til de yderste arktiske egne af Skandinavien.
English: The voyages of Ohthere, Abhara and Theodosios range over half of the globe, from China to the Persian Gulf, from the Mediterranean to Northern Europe and further to the outer-most arctic reaches of Scandinavia.

Danish: De sidste års sejladser har ikke kun haft det formål, at træne besætningen, de er også gennemført for at teste rekonstruktionen.
English: The voyages of recent years have had the purpose of training the crew, as well as testing the ship reconstruction.

Danish: Togterne gik hovedsagligt til destinationer udenfor Danmark og kulminerede i 2007, da skibet lagde kursen ud mod Nordskotland og Dublin.
English: The voyages were mainly to destinations outside Denmark and culminated in 2007 when the ship set a course for the north of Scotland and Dublin.

Danish: Godset, brændingen og farven peger på en datering til 1400-tallet.
English: The ware, firing and colour indicate a dating in the 15th century.

Danish: Den varme damp gør egetræet blødt og bøjeligt.
English: The warm steam makes the oak soft and pliable.

Danish: Opvarmningen har udtørret træet.
English: The warming-up has dried the wood out.

Danish: Varmen vil dog ikke rigtigt komme, jeg vender og drejer mig og får kun sovet lidt.
English: The warmth will not really come, however.

Danish: Krigeren var gravlagt med sine våben, blandt andet et tveægget sværd med sølvindlagte dekorationer.
English: The warrior was burried with his weapons, including a two-edged sword decorated with silver inlay.

Danish: Sæt dig til rette på de dertil indrettede siddepladser omkring håndværkerens værksted, og fordyb dig i det fascinerende håndværk.
English: The warriors must be ready to defend the country against enemies, take part in a raid or fight in the service of the King.

Danish: Krigsskibet "Skuldelev 2" – Havhingstens forlæg – er Skuldelevfundets dårligst bevarede fartøj.
English: The warship 'Skuldelev 2' – the model for the Sea Stallion – is the Skuldelev site's most poorly preserved vessel.

Danish: Når det er nødvendigt må alle tage en tørn med. Vagtsystemet under sejladsen gør det muligt at folk kan få sovet og hvilet sig.
English: The watch system during the voyage makes it possible for people to be able to sleep and rest.

Danish: Vagtsystemerne på Havhingsten
English: The watch systems on the Sea Stallion

Danish: Vagterne kaldes bagbord og styrbord vagt efter skibets to sider.
English: The watches are called port and starboard after the two sides of the ship.

Danish: Bergvordr var posten ved årerne og roret, Rávordr var ved sejlet, Festavordr var ved fortøjningen i land og Strengvordr var posten ved ankertorvet når skibet lå stille.
English: The watchs Bergvordr by the oars, Rávordr by the sail, Festavordr by the mooring on land and Strengvordr by the cable when the ship lay at anchor.

Danish: Vandet fanger årerne, det betyder, at de klemmer sig fast i årehullerne med et flækket og ødelagt årehulsbord som resultat.
English: The water catches the oars and they get stuck in the oar holes, with split and ruined oar-hole boards as a result.

Danish: Vanddybden kan loddes med et blylod i snor eller på lavere dybder med en stage.
English: The water depth can be sounded with a lead weight on a string or a pole can be used for shallower depths.

Danish: Vandstanden er 6. december kl. 15.56 165 cm over daglig vande.
English: The water level on 6 December at 15:56 is 165 cm above sea level.

Danish: Vandet steg til mere end 50 cm over overfladen på Museumsøen, men nåede alligevel ikke langt op på de landsatte skibe.
English: The water level rose to more than 50 cm above the Museum Island surface, but fortunately did not get very far up on the ships on land.

Danish: Vandet slog allerede tidlig højt op på Vikingeskibshallens glasfacade.
English: The water started rising early in the day high up on the Viking Ship Hall's glass facade.

Danish: Vandet stod stadig meget højt, da solen stod op dagen efter stormfloden.
English: The water was still very high as the sun rose the day after the flood.

Danish: Mange hundrede mennesker har set, og fulgt med undervejs i byggeriet af Frederikssundjollen.
English: The waterline is intentionally a little too low - it will be adjusted after the dinghy has been in the water.

Danish: Bølgerne slår ind over molen og græsset ved Vikingeskibshallen.
English: The waves wash over the pier and the grass at the Viking Ship Museum.

Danish: Også fundets våben og øvrige redskaber blev nøjere undersøgt og opmålt, og værktøjsgruppen udførte kopier af en del af våbnene.
English: The weapons and other equipment in the find were also examined and measured and the tool group of the guild produced copies of some of the weapons.

Danish: Slitagen på hjul og aksel er fremkommet under sejladsen Roskilde – Dublin – Lowestoft.
English: The wear on the wheel and axle has resulted from the voyage Roskilde – Dublin – Lowestoft.

Danish: Vejret kan jo være fantastisk, og en sejltur binder fortællingen om vikingernes skibe meget bedre sammen”, fortæller museets formidlingschef Merete Ettrup.
English: The weather can be fantastic and a sailing trip helps to communicate the story of the Viking ships in a far more meaningful way”, explains the museum's Head of Outreach, Merete Ettrup.

Danish: Vejrudsigten er helt udslagsgivende”, siger Carsten Hvid.
English: The weather forecast is the decisive factor”, says Carsten Hvid.

Danish: De melder kuling i eftermiddag, så vi skynder os ud for at få nogle sejladstests i kassen inden...
English: The weather forecast says a near gale this afternoon, so we get out of the harbour in a hurry, to...

Danish: Vejrudsigterne ser lovende ud.
English: The weather forecasts are good.

Danish: Vejret var for en gang skyld med besætningen.
English: The weather was for once on the crews side.

Danish: Vejret var med samsingerne og Havhingsten under besøget i Langør.
English: The weather was good during the Sea Stallion's visit to Langør.

Danish: Vejret var så roligt, at flere tog en lille lur, mens skipper hurtigt fik Havhingsten over T-ruten, hvor de store skibe sejler tæt.
English: The weather was so calm that several took a little nap while the skipper quickly navigated the Sea Stallion out of T-route, where the cargo ships sail closely.

Danish: Væveren fremstiller sejl af uld eller hør til skibene.
English: The weaver makes sails of wool and hemp for the ship.

Danish: Webudstillingen giver dig mulighed for at kommentere de udvalgte genstande og samtidig reflektere over, hvad du mener, fremtiden bør vide om Danmark og Irland anno 2009.
English: The web exhibition gives you the opportunity to comment on the objects selected and to reflect on what you think the future should know about Denmark and Ireland in 2009.

Danish: Webudstillingen giver læseren mulighed for at kommentere udvalgte genstande og samtidig reflektere over, hvad fremtiden bør vide om Danmark og Irland anno 2009.
English: The web exhibition will provide the reader with the opportunity to comment on the objects selected and to reflect on what the future should know about Denmark and Ireland in 2009.

Danish: Bådsmandsdagbogen på nettet indeholder uddrag af projektets mere detaljerede Bådsmands-dagbog.
English: The web version of the boatswain's log contains excerpts from the more detailed log kept by the boatswain during the expedition.

Danish: Logbogen på nettet indeholder uddrag af Havhingsten fra Glendaloughs logbog.
English: The web version of the ship's logbook contains excerpts from the Sea Stallion from Glendalough's logbook.

Danish: Hovmesterens dagbog på nettet er et uddrag af den kost- og drikkevandsjournal, der føres ombord på Havhingsten fra Glendalough.
English: The web version of the steward's log contains excerpts from the journal of food and water consumption kept aboard the Sea Stallion from Glendalough.

Danish: Webloggen føres af Museumsinspektør Louise Kæmpe Henriksen.
English: The weblog is written by Museum curator Louise K. Henriksen.

Danish: Webloggen føres af Museumsinspektør Louise Kæmpe Henriksen og Ph.d.-stipendiat, Morten Ravn under to hovedtemaer.
English: The weblogs are written by Museum curator Louise K. Henriksen and Ph.D. Morten Ravn.

Danish: Publiceringen af videofilm fra Vikingeskibsmuseet er leveret af PROVECTOR, som er et webbaseret webTV, audio og livestream publicerings-system.
English: The WebTV from the Viking Ship Museum is published by PROVECTOR, a Danish webtool which makes it easy to integrate a WebTV on any website.

Danish: Weekenden byder på:
English: The weekend will offer:

Danish: Velkomsten var overvældende.
English: The welcome was overwhelming.

Danish: Den velbevarede forstævn er udhugget af et krumt stykke tømmer, så den ind mod skibet har form som en række trappetrin.
English: The well-preserved stem was carved from a curved piece of timber so that in towards the ship it has the form of a series of steps.

Danish: Den vestnorske kyst har været et naturligt og centralt mødested mellem Norden og resten af Europa, da man her finder den korteste afstand over Nordsøen.
English: The western coast of Norway was a natural and pivotal meeting point between Scandinavia and the rest of Europe, and it is here that the North Sea is at its narrowest.

Danish: Redningsdragten pakkes for sig selv øverst på dørken, så den hurtigt kan komme på.
English: The wet suit is packed separately uppermost on the floor, where we can get to it quickly.

Danish: Hjulene er blevet lidt ovale, måske fordi de er fremstillet af et ret stykke træ, hvor endetræet er mere slidstærkt, end det er på langs med årerne.
English: The wheels have become a bit oval, perhaps because they are made of a straight piece of wood, where the end of the wood is stronger than the wood that runs along the veins.

Danish: Hele familien ærgrede sig over, at det var røget ud af huset.
English: The whole family is sad that it was gone.

Danish: Her ses hele spantet; bundstokken ned mod kølen med en oplænger på hver side
English: The whole frame can now be seen; the floor against the keel with a futtock on either side

Danish: Hele spantrammen var, ligesom de øvrige dele af fartøjet, udført med den største omhu med henblik på at kombinere styrke og ringe vægt.
English: The whole frame system, like the other parts of the vessel, had been designed with the greatest care with the aim of combining strength with lightness.

Danish: Hele processen tog kun 40 minutter.
English: The whole process took 40 minutes.

Danish: Hele verden kigger med
English: The whole world is watching

Danish: Vinden er svag, 4-5 m/ sek. så sejlet slår en gang imellem.
English: The wind is light, 4-5m per second so the sail flapped from time to time.

Danish: Vinden er nu lidt kraftigere, og vi ser nu tydeligt Skotlands kyst hæve sig.
English: The wind is now a little stronger and we can clearly see the coast of Scotland rising up.

Danish: Vinden spiller i Claus Laage-Thomsens grå hår, mens han står på flydebroen i Ramsgate fire meter under bolværkets øverste kant og spiser sin morgenmad, havregrød med mysli:
English: The wind plays in Claus Laage-Thomsen’s grey hair as he stands on the landing stage in Ramsgate, four metres below the upper edge of the quay, eating his breakfast, porridge with müsli.

Danish: Vinden var øgende og det endte jo med kuling.
English: The wind was increasing and it ended up as a gale.

Danish: Vinden var med hele vejen til Korsør.
English: The wind was with the Sea Stallion all the way to Korsør.

Danish: Ruderne begyndte at give efter under trykket fra vandet.
English: The windows began to give way under the pressure of the water.

Danish: De kløftede stævne blev lavet af lokale lindestammer, hvoraf første sæt måtte kasseres på grund af råd.
English: The winged stems were made from local linden, the first of which had to be discarded because of rot.

Danish: Den, der til sidst har alle kortene, har vundet.
English: The winner is the player at the end of the game with all the cards.

Danish: Vinderen af konkurrencen vil blive præmieret med en sejltur med Havhingsten fra Glendalough i den sidste weekend i september 2008.
English: The winner of the competition will win a sailing trip with the Sea Stallion from Glendalough in the last weekend of September 2008.

Danish: Vinderne af Vikingeskibsmuseets fotokonkurrence blev:
English: The winners of the Viking Ship Museum's photo competition was:

Danish: Vinderne får direkte besked.
English: The winners will be informed direct.

Danish: Træets fiberforløb viser, hvordan bestemte dele af træet blev brugt til bestemte skibsdele.
English: The wood fibre structure tell us how certain parts of the tree were used to build specific ship parts.

Danish: Ulden kom fra godt og vel 200 "spelsauer" - efterkommere af norske vildfår.
English: The wool came from as many as 200 "Spelsauer" sheep - descendents of Norwegian wild sheep.

Danish: Uldtråden holder på trætjæren, som forhindrer råd, og den tager det værste vand, der kunne komme, når båden bliver gammel og tørrer ud, hvis den står på land.
English: The wool is coated with tar, which prevents rot, and will soak up the worst of the water that can begin to seep in as the boat gets older or dries out after a period on land.

Danish: Der skal kartes, spindes, filtes og væves, før ulden bliver til færdigt klæde.
English: The wool must be carded, spun, felted and woven before it becomes finished cloth.

Danish: Ordet ”isbåd” dækker over to forskellige skibstyper, hvor den ene er et kraftigt bygget rofartøj med stålskinne under kølen.
English: The word “ice boat” covers two different types of ice boat, where one is a robust row-boat with a steel rail under the keel.

Danish: "Et vikinge-krigsskib vender hjem" stod der på kæmpestore bannere udenfor porten til Collins Barracks, det irske National Museums udstillingsområde i Dublin.
English: The words "A Viking warship comes home" were written on huge banners outside the gates to Collins Barracks, the exhibition area for the National Museum of Ireland in Dublin.

Danish: Ordene kom fra meteorolog Morten Sørensen.
English: The words came from meteorologist Morten Sørensen.

Danish: Ordene skipper og styrmand blev ikke brugt på samme måde i vikingetiden, som de gør i dag.
English: The words skipper and steersman or helmsman were not used in the same way in Viking times as they are today.

Danish: Der er mange oplysninger i værket; beskrivelser af handelsruter, beretninger om krige, om kristne og hedninger og meget andet.
English: The work contains a great deal of information: descriptions of trade routes, reports of wars, of Christians and heathens and much more.

Danish: Der arbejdes ud fra en basishavn, men det er vigtigt at få udført forsøg i forskelligt vejrlig og at de enkelte forsøg gentages så hyppigt, som omstændighederne tillader for at forøge værdien af det indsamlede materiale.
English: The work is carried out from a base harbour but it is important to perform the experiments in different weather conditions and that the individual experiments are repeated as often as circumstances allow in order to increase the value of the data gathered.

Danish: Byggeriet fandt sted i en uopvarmet bygning nær Dyvig, hvorfra søsætningen afslutningsvis fandt sted i 1999.
English: The work of construction was done in an unheated building near Dyvig, and from here the official launching of Tilia Alsie finally took place in June 1999.

Danish: Arbejdet med at konservere, analysere og opstille resterne af de fem vikingeskibe førte til drømmen om at bygge og afprøve fuldskala rekonstruktioner af det unikke fund.
English: The work of preserving, analysing and presenting the remains of the five Viking ships resulted in the ambition to build and test full-scale reconstructions of the unique finds.

Danish: Arbejdet tager udgangspunkt i tanken om, at hvert skib oprindeligt blev skabt og brugt i et komplekst samspil mellem mennesker med forskellige kompetencer og indfaldsvinkler til skibet.
English: The work takes its point of departure in the idea that every ship was originally created and utilised in a complex interaction between people with differing competencies and attitudes to the ship.

Danish: Arbejdet tager udgangspunkt i tanken om, at hvert skib oprindeligt blev bygget og brugt i interaktion mellem mennesker med forskellige kompetencer og indfaldsvinkler til skibet.
English: The work takes its point of departure in the idea that every ship was originally created and utilised in a complex set of interactions between people with different competencies and attitudes to the ship.

Danish: Arbejdet som udføres på værftet findes på to niveauer.
English: The work that is carried out at the boatyard can be seen as existing on two levels.

Danish: Så fortsatte arbejdet med at kløve videre til kvarte-, ottende, og til sidst sekstende-dele.
English: The work then continued splitting the halves further into quarters, eights and finally sixteenths.

Danish: Arbejdet med at undersøge, udgrave, dokumentere og bjærge de arkæologiske genstande under vand kaldes samlet for marinarkæologiske undersøgelser.
English: The work under water in surveying, excavating, recording and salvaging the archaeological artifacts and structures, is termed underwater archaeology.

Danish: Arbejdet udførtes med kritisk gensidig kontrol og dokumenteredes løbende med fotos og video.
English: The work was carried out under critical, reciprocal control and was documented regularly by photography and video.

Danish: Størsteparten af projektets eksterne omkostninger frem til bådens færdiggørelse på ca. ½ mill. kr.
English: The work was carried out under critical, reciprocal control and was documented regularly by photography and video.

Danish: Arbejdet med Vikingeskibsfundet fra Skuldelev begyndte mere end 10 år før indvielsen af Vikingeskibshallen.
English: The work with the Viking ship find from Skuldelev began more than 10 years before the inauguration of the Viking Ship Hall.

Danish: Arbejdet med disse elementer blev afgørende for kvaliteten af den videre indsats, idet mange problemer blev løst og færdigheder opøvet under de i alt 1360 timer, dette arbejde krævede.
English: The work with these elements played a decisive role in the determination of the quality of the guild's continuing efforts, since many of the problems were solved and personal skills improved in the course of the 1,360 hours that were spent on these tasks.

Danish: Arbejdet med disse elementer blev afgørende for kvaliteten af den videre indsats, idet mange problemer blev løst og færdigheder opøvet under de i alt 1360 timer, dette arbejde krævede.
English: The work with these elements played a decisive role in the determination of the quality of the guild’s continuing efforts, since many of the problems were solved and personal skills improved in the course of the 1,360 hours that were spent on these tasks.

Danish: Samtidig betragtes arbejdet med disse fartøjer som et middel til bevaringen af en kulturarv, der rækker fra vikingetiden langt ind i vor tid, så at sige fra ”Havhingsten” til folkebåden.
English: The work with these vessels is at the same time considered a mean of preserving cultural heritage ranging from the Viking Age to the present, that is to say, from ‘Sea Stallion' to a fibreglass sailboat.

Danish: Samtidig betragtes arbejdet med disse fartøjer som et middel til bevaringen af en kulturarv, der rækker fra vikingetiden langt ind i vor tid, så at sige fra ”Havhingsten” til folkebåden.
English: The work with these vessels is at the same time considered a mean of preserving cultural heritage ranging from the Viking Age to the present, that is to say, from ‘Sea Stallion’ to a fibreglass sailboat.

Danish: Arbejdstegninger fra sidste års ”Gisle” kan stadig downloades, og så snart de reviderede arbejdstegninger til Gislinge III er færdiggjort, bliver de også lagt ud på hjemmesiden.
English: The working drawings for last year’s Gisle are still available for download and once the revised working drawings for Gislinge III are finalised, they’ll also be released on the project website.

Danish: Arkæologernes arbejdsmetoder og graveteknikker er ofte subjektive eller bestemt af udgravningslederen.
English: The working methods and excavation techniques of archaeologists are often subjective or dictated by the leader of the excavation.

Danish: Arkæologernes arbejdsmetoder har ligeledes afgørende betydning for fundsbilledet og efterfølgende dokumentation.
English: The working methods of archaeologists are also important for the overall picture of artefacts and subsequent documentation.

Danish: Verden blev lille, forbundet af ruter, der var besejlet og beskrevet før.
English: The world became ‘small', connected by routes that had previously been navigated and described.

Danish: Verden blev lille, forbundet af ruter, der var besejlet og beskrevet før.
English: The world became ‘small’, connected by routes that had previously been navigated and described.

Danish: Af Søren M. Sindbæk
English: The World in the Viking Age

Danish: Verden i vikingetiden - temabog
English: The World in the Viking Age - theme book

Danish: Verden i vikingetiden fortæller en verdenshistorie om skibe, mennesker og ting på rejse.
English: The World in the Viking Age reveals a global history concerning ships, people and objects on the move.

Danish: Verdens største vikingeskibsrekonstruktion vender hjem.
English: The world's biggest Viking ship reconstruction turns home.

Danish: Besætningen på 61 mænd og kvinder og verdens største rekonstruktion af et vikingeskib måtte i dag for en gangs skyld træde i baggrunden.
English: The world's largest reconstruction of a Viking ship and its crew of 61 men and women had, for once, to take a back seat.

Danish: Verdens længste vikingeskib
English: The world's longest Viking ship

Danish: Det verdensberømte skib modtages af Københavns Overborgmester, Frank Jensen, ved Toldboden, hvor skibet kan besøges til og med den 15. august, inden det rykkes ind i Frederiksholms Kanal.
English: The world-famous ship will be welcomed by Copenhagen's Lord Mayor, Frank Jensen, at Nordre Toldbod, where you can visit the ship every day up to and including the 15th August, after which it moves into the Frederiksholm Canal.

Danish: Det verdensberømte fjernsynstårn på Alexanderplatz ses i baggrunden.
English: The world-famous Television Tower at Alexanderplatz can be seen in the background.

Danish: Længe før vor tidsregnings begyndelse fandtes sejlskibe på vej fra Middelhavet til Indien.
English: The worldLong before our calendar began, sailing ships had already found their way from the Mediterranean to India.

Danish: Besætningen på 61 mænd og kvinder og verdens største rekonstruktion af et vikingeskib måtte i dag for en gangs skyld træde i baggrunden.
English: The world’s largest reconstruction of a Viking ship and its crew of 61 men and women had, for once, to take a back seat.

Danish: Det kan være ét ud af tre mulige skibe, Elephanten, David eller København, fartøjer som alle forlod København i 1618 og vendte tilbage i 1622 efter at have gennemført den første danske rejse til Ostindien.
English: The wreck is one of three possible ships, either the David, Elephanten or København, which all left Copenhagen in 1618, and were back again by 1622 after having completed the first Danish journey to the East Indies.

Danish: Et kraftigt bygget træskibsvrag fundet af sportsdykkerklubben Kon-Tiki er undersøgt med henblik på at fastslå fundets udstrækning, art og alder.
English: The wreck of a solidly built wooden ship found by the sports diving club Kon-Tiki was examined in order to determine the scale, nature and age of the find.

Danish: Vraget af Dannebroge er den eneste forlisplads i Danmark, som er beskyttet af et officielt forbud mod dykning.
English: The wreck of Dannebroge is the only shipwreck site in Denmark that is protected by an official ban on diving.

Danish: Vraget af det originale skib blev i 1962 udgravet på bunden af Roskilde Fjord.
English: The wreck of the original ship was excavated from the bottom of Roskilde Fjord in 1962.

Danish: Vraget er dendrokronologisk dateret.
English: The wreck was dated dendrochronologically.

Danish: Vraget fandtes med bunden opad orienteret N-S med stævnen mod syd.
English: The wreck was found with its bottom up and aligned north-south with its bow to the south.

Danish: Vraget (P-2) er et bevis for kontakt mellem vikingetidens to skibsbygningstraditioner.
English: The wreck, named P-2, constitutes a proof of contacts between the two schools in Viking times.

Danish: Vragflagerne må stamme fra fartøjets sider, og dets bund må således befinde sig et sted i nærheden.
English: The wreckage floes must come from the ship's sides and its bottom must therefore be located somewhere in the vicinity.

Danish: Vragflagerne må stamme fra fartøjets sider, og dets bund må således befinde sig et sted i nærheden.
English: The wreckage floes must come from the ship’s sides and its bottom must therefore be located somewhere in the vicinity.

Danish: Vragdelens udstrækning er ca. 10 m i længden og vel en 2,5 m i bredden.
English: The wrecked fragments are ca. 10m in length and 2.5m wide.

Danish: Skribenterne dækker over fagområder som historie, arkæologi, sprogforskning, søfart og sejlsport.
English: The writers cover professional fields such as history, archaeology, linguistics, seafaring as well as boat and yacht racing.
