Danish: Selvom de skriftlige kilder har en del kildekritiske problemer, er de i dag uundværlige i historieskrivningen om vikingetiden.
English: The written sources are indispensable to us when writing Viking history, but they do present us with a number of critical problems.

Danish: Vikingerne efterlod sig kun skriftkilder indenfor to kategorier.
English: The written sources left by the Vikings themselves are mainly found in two particular categories.

Danish: De skriftlige kilder, vi har fra vikingetiden, er næsten alle skrevet af vikingernes ofre eller deres efterkommere og er derfor ikke særlig venligt stemt overfor vikingerne.
English: The written sources we have from Viking times were almost all written by the Vikings' victims or their descendants and have therefore a not particularly positive attitude to the Vikings.

Danish: Året er 1010 og Danskernes sejrrige konge, Svend Tveskæg, kan fejre sin 50 års fødselsdag.
English: The year is 1010 and the Danes' victorious king, Svend Tveskæg (fork beard), is celebrating his 50th birthday.

Danish: Årets største udfordring var uden sammenligning, sejladsen fra Irland til England over det Keltiske hav.
English: The year's biggest challenge without any doubt was the voyage from Ireland to England over the Celtic Sea.

Danish: Årets sejlads til Dublin var på mange måder en stor succes.
English: The year's trip to Dublin was in many ways a great success.

Danish: Men årene har sat sine spor på skibet.
English: The years have, however, taken their toll on the ship.

Danish: Årets største udfordring var uden sammenligning, sejladsen fra Irland til England over det Keltiske hav.
English: The year’s biggest challenge without any doubt was the voyage from Ireland to England over the Celtic Sea.

Danish: Årets sejlads til Dublin var på mange måder en stor succes.
English: The year’s trip to Dublin was in many ways a great success.

Danish: Yngste medlem om bord er 22 år og den ældste er 65
English: The youngest crew member is 22 and the oldest is 65

Danish: Skibets yngste besætningsmedlem var 17 år og den ældste 65.
English: The youngest crew members is 17 years old and the oldest 65.

Danish: Den 'store hær' udgør dog en undtagelse.
English: The ‘great army', however, forms an exception.

Danish: Den 'store hær' udgør dog en undtagelse.
English: The ‘great army’, however, forms an exception.

Danish: Deres gravskikke var hedenske, og de mest velhavende af dem blev begravet sammen med deres personlige ejendele.
English: Their burial customs were pagan and the wealthiest were buried with their personal belongings.

Danish: Deres gravskikke var hedenske, og de rigeste blandt dem blev begravet med deres personlige ejendele.
English: Their burial customs were pagan and the wealthiest were buried with their personal belongings.

Danish: På turen til Samsø vil de tilberede en frokost til skibets store besætning.
English: Their challenge is to cook a lunch for the ship's crew.

Danish: Deres konstruktion afspejler de intentioner og behov, som de blev bygget for at imødekomme, og slid, reparationer, rester af ladninger og selv deres forlis- eller ophugningssted afspejler deres levede liv.
English: Their construction reflects the intentions and needs which they were built to meet; wear, repairs/refitting, remains of cargoes and even the place where they sank or were broken up reflect the life they lived.

Danish: Gæstfriheden var uden ende.
English: Their hospitality was without end.

Danish: Og aftvinger dyb respekt for vikingerne, som måtte klare sig med færre landmærker, end vi har i dag.
English: Their navigation skills require the utmost respect, especially because they managed to navigate using fewer land marks than we have today.

Danish: En profitabel drift forudsætter et samfund, der kan sikre freden og undertrykke sørøveri.
English: Their profitable use depends on a society capable of pacifying the sea and suppressing piracy.

Danish: Fortællingerne giver skibene liv og sætter fundet af de fem Skuldelevskibe i perspektiv til vikingernes maritime kultur.
English: Their stories give life to the original ships and put the discovery of the five Skuldelev ships into perspective in relation to the maritime culture of the Viking Age.

Danish: Fortællingerne giver skibene liv og sætter fundet af de fem vikingeskibe fra Skuldelevskibe i perspektiv.
English: Their stories give life to the original ships and put the discovery of the five Skuldelev ships into perspective in relation to the maritime culture of the Viking Age.

Danish: Deres krigsskibe, handelsfartøjer og fiskerbåde havde stor symbolsk værdi, og skibene var en vikings hjem på de lange togter til så fjerne destinationer som Amerika og Arabien", siger Tinna Damgård-Sørensen, direktør for Vikingeskibsmuseet i Roskilde.
English: Their warships, trading vessels and fishing boats had an important symbolic value and the ships became the Vikings' homes on their long journeys to distant destinations such as America and Arabia", tells Tinna Damgård-Sørensen, director of the Viking Ship Museum.

Danish: Vi forsætter med at dokumentere og dele deres arbejde online, og interessen for deres indsats stiger uge for uge.
English: Their work is again being documented and shared on-line, and interest in following their efforts is steadily increasing.

Danish: Temauger i sommerferien 2016
English: Theme weeks during summer 2016

Danish: Temauger i sommerferien 2017
English: Theme weeks during the summer holiday 2017

Danish: Dernæst blev der opført en høj, omkring 30 m i diameter, og denne blev omgivet af et stolpehegn.
English: Then a mound was raised, about 30 metres in diameter, and it was surrounded by a fence of posts.

Danish: Så en ydre stævn, der stabiliserer og styrker inderstævnen.
English: Then an outer stem, which stabilises and strengthens the inner stem.

Danish: Derefter fulgte fortællingen om byggeriet af Havhingsten, ideen med projektet og selve turen.
English: Then came the story of how the Sea Stallion was built, the aims of the project, and the voyage itself.

Danish: Kontroller dernæst dine resultater ved at lægge solkompasset ovenpå kortet.
English: Then check your results by laying the sun compass over the map.

Danish: Så følger vidneværdsættelsen:
English: Then follows the evaluation of the testimony:

Danish: Herefter opkræves fuld pris.
English: Then full price will be charged.

Danish: Gå bagefter udenfor, og kontroller retningerne i praksis.
English: Then go outside and check the directions in practice.

Danish: Så til Konstantinopel, hvor han kæmpede i den såkaldte varæger-garde.
English: Then Harald moved on to Constantinople, where he fought in the so-called Varangian Guard.

Danish: Derefter reder han sit hår over karret med en kam, snyder næse og spytter i det.
English: Then he combs his hair over the dish with a comb, blows his nose and spits in it.

Danish: Hver eneste snyder næse, spytter i det og vasker sit ansigt og sit hår i det".
English: Then he combs his hair over the dish with a comb, blows his nose and spits in it.

Danish: Frederik Johannesen, der var skibsingeniør, genskabte først Gokstadskibets linjer, Dernæst samlede han stumperne af den største og mindste båd ved at sammenligne pynteprofilerne på de enkelte båddele.
English: Then he pieced the fragments of the smallest and largest of the boats together, by comparing the decorative mouldings on each individual fragment.

Danish: Da tænkte jeg lidt på vores høje mast, hvis vi skulle til at have tordenvejr, men det kom ikke”, sige Anders B. S. Fischer.
English: Then I thought a bit about our high mast should we run into thundery weather, but we didn’t,” says Anders B. S. Fischer.

Danish: Så til kvarte og så til ottendedele.
English: Then in quarters and eights.

Danish: Så kan man selv forsøge at gøre sig nogle erfaringer og sammensætte nogle retter.
English: Then it is possible to experiment, gain some experience and make up your own dishes.

Danish: Så kunne man trække en streg fra det observerede sted i den rette retning og afstand og få et gisset sted.
English: Then it was possible to draw a line from the observed position in the right direction and distance and obtain an estimated position.

Danish: Herefter går rejsen videre til Edmonton, mere end 7.000 kilometer væk fra Vikingeskibsmuseet i Roskilde.
English: Then it will continue on to Edmonton, more than 7,000 kilometres from the Viking Ship Museum in Roskilde.

Danish: Derefter slækkes forstaget en anelse og fastgøres.
English: Then the fore stay is loosened slightly and made fast.

Danish: Herefter gælder museets generelle vilkår.
English: Then the general terms of the museum apply.

Danish: Kongen spurte hvorfor de stod slik.
English: Then the king returned to the town.

Danish: Så gikk kongen tilbake til byen.
English: Then the king returned to the town.

Danish: Dernæst blev årerne stukket gennem årehullerne tværs over skibet, for at besætningen havde noget at skubbe på.
English: Then the oars were stuck through the oar holes across the ship so that the crew could use them for grip when pushing.

Danish: Dernæst skal kilden fortolkes:
English: Then the source should be interpreted:

Danish: Af mere overordnet karakter melder dernæst spørgsmålet om fundets kulturhistoriske placering sig.
English: Then there is the question, at a higher order of significance, of the socio-historical importance of the location of the find.

Danish: Derefter bliver de høvlet med en skrabehøvl, som vi kan se de har gjort det i vikingetiden.
English: Then they are hollowed out with a scraper in the same way that we can see they did in the Viking Age.

Danish: Prøv derefter at bygge maksimums- og minimumsgrænser for besætningens størrelse ind i regnearket.
English: Then try to build maximum and minimum values for the size of the crew into the spreadsheet.

Danish: Så kommer de to politibåde, der sørger for fri passage til Havhingsten, men skibet er stadig ikke at se.
English: Then two police boats arrive, to ensure free passage for Sea Stallion, but still the ship can't be seen.

Danish: Så vil vi ligge med agterenden mod vinden, selvom vi mister roret, og skibet vil ligge meget mere roligt, selv i høj sø.
English: Then we can have the aft against the wind eventhough we loose the rudder, and the ship will be more steady, even in a large swell.

Danish: Og vi lærer noget nyt, som vi kan tage med os videre.og bruge i fremtidig vikingeskibsforskning.”
English: Then we will learn something new that we can take further and use in future research on Viking ships.”

Danish: Så løber vi med”.
English: Then we will run with it.”

Danish: Så begynder man at se ting i vandet, som slet ikke er der”.
English: Then you start to see things in the water that aren’t really there.”

Danish: Der var 11 nationaliteter repræsenteret på skibet fra lande som USA, Irland, England, Norge, Sverige, Tyskland og Canada.
English: There are 11 nationalities represented on board from USA, Ireland, England, Norway, Sweden, Germany and Canada.

Danish: Der var 25 kvinder i besætningen og folkene om bord kom fra vidt forskellige baggrunde.
English: There are 25 women and all crew members comes from very different backgrounds.

Danish: Der er 7 par årer til båden.
English: There are 7 pairs of oars for the boat.

Danish: Der er et par markante undtagelser.
English: There are a couple of striking exceptions.

Danish: Der er enkelte pladser om bord til børn (mellem 4 og ca. 14 år) og andre der ikke kan ro.
English: There are a limited number of places available for children (between 4 and ca. 14 years old) and others who cannot row.

Danish: Der er begrænsede pladser til børn under 14 år.
English: There are a limited number of places available to children under 14 years of age.

Danish: Der er begrænset pladser, da Kraka Fyr kan sejle med 12 gæster.
English: There are a limited number of places, as Kraka Fyr can sail with a maximum of 12 guests.

Danish: Fra vikingetid og middelalder er der fundet en del rigdetaljer som fx. blokke, vantnåle, mastestumper, rå mv.
English: There are a number of finds of rigging details, for example blocks, shroud pins, mast fragments, yard etc. from the Viking period and the Middle Ages.

Danish: Fra Hedeby kendes også eksempler på elmetræsbuer.
English: There are also examples of elm-wood bows from Haithabu.

Danish: Der findes fund fra Dalerne i Sverige, fra Novgorod, fra det irske område etc. Herhjemme er især pilespidserne fra bådkammergraven i Hedeby kendt.
English: There are also finds from Dalarne in Sweden, from Novgorod, from Ireland etc. Nearer to home, the arrowheads from the boat chamber grave at Haithabu are particularly well known.

Danish: Der er også andre forhold, der har gjort det anderledes vanskeligere at sejle langskib.
English: There are also other conditions that will have made it more difficult to sail a longship.

Danish: Der er desuden to kraftige bundstokke i bunden af jollen, det er heri den skal hejses op og hænge i, bag på galeasen.
English: There are also two strong floor timbers in the bottom of the dinghy; it is from here that the dinghy will be raised and hung from the rear of the ketch.

Danish: Fra ældre vikingetid kender vi også fartøjer, som er udrustet med både årer og sejl, men som er markant bredere end ro- og langskibe.
English: There are also vessels from the early Viking times which were equipped with both oars and sails, but which are markedly broader than the rowed ships and longships.

Danish: Der er også vagtposter ved sejlet, roret og i udkiggen.
English: There are also watches by the sail, the rudder and on lookout.

Danish: I værkstedet hænger også vidjerne der blev brugt på Havhingstens sejlads fra Roskilde til Dublin og retur i 2007-08.
English: There are also withies hanging in the workshop that were used on the Sea Stallion's voyage from Roskilde to Dublin and back in 2007-08.

Danish: I værkstedet hænger også vidjerne der blev brugt på Havhingstens sejlads fra Roskilde til Dublin og retur i 2007-08.
English: There are also withies hanging in the workshop that were used on the Sea Stallion’s voyage from Roskilde to Dublin and back in 2007-08.

Danish: Der er desuden to kraftige …
English: There are also …

Danish: Selvom man har gjort arkæologiske fund af instrumenter til at rense og hele sår, og som viser at vikingerne kendte til faren ved infektioner, har infektioner i mindre sår, gennem historien været årsag til blodforgiftning, amputation og i værste tilfælde dødsfald.
English: There are archaeological finds of instruments for the cleaning and healing of wounds showing that the Vikings knew of the danger of infections.

Danish: Der findes arkæologiforeninger, hvor almindelige mennesker i samarbejde med museerne kan prøve kræfter med rekognoscering og udgravningsarbejde - også under vand.
English: There are archaeology associations, in which ordinary people can try their hand at surveying and excavation in collaboration with museums – also underwater.

Danish: Der er både indendørs og udendørs undervisning, og eleverne involveres aktivt.
English: There are both outdoor and indoor activities, and all pupils are actively involved.

Danish: Der findes forholdsvis få runesten med skibsbilleder.
English: There are comparatively few rune stones with ship-representations.

Danish: Vi fik kopier af alle skibene, så man kunne opleve at sejle med skibe fra vikingetiden og samtidig få konkret viden om deres sejlegenskaber.
English: There are copies of all the ships so that one can experience sailing with ships from the Viking Age and at the same time obtain specific knowledge about their sailing capabilities.

Danish: Der forekommer fejl på både GPS-positionen og målingerne fra de øvrige instrumenter.
English: There are errors in both the GPS positions and measurements from the various instruments.

Danish: Der findes ligefrem vandrehistorier om sømænd, der har kastet sig selv over bord for at slippe af med smerten.
English: There are even stories of sailors throwing themselves over board in order to rid themselves of the pain.

Danish: Dog tyder meget på, at Vikingeskibsmuseet alligevel får lov at beholde Skuldelev 2-vraget.
English: There are good reasons though, that the Viking Ship Museum may keep the wreck Skuldelev 2.

Danish: Der er mange bud på den dramatiske historie.
English: There are many ideas about this dramatic story.

Danish: Der er mange store, fine ege i den del af skoven, der støder op til Nærum.
English: There are many large, fine oaks in the part of the forest close to Nærum.

Danish: Det er der jo mange, der gerne vil have?
English: There are many others who would like more.

Danish: Der er mange reparationer, de sidste udført kort før sænkningen af skibet på et tidspunkt, hvor kølen var mør i træet.
English: There are many repairs, the last of which were done shortly before the sinking of the ship at a time when the wood in the keel was mouldering.

Danish: Der er mange spor fra vikingetiden på Orkneyøerne og Shetlandsøerne, Island, Grønland og så langt mod vest som Newfoundland i Nordamerika.
English: There are many traces from the Viking Age on the Orkney and Shetland Islands, Iceland, Greenland and as far west as Newfoundland in North America.

Danish: Mere end 30 både har deres faste plads i Vikingeskibsmuseets havn og præsenteres for museets besøgende sommer og vinter.
English: There are more than 30 boats in the Viking Ship Museum's harbour and they are presented to museum's visitors during the summer and winter.

Danish: Mere end 30 både har deres faste plads i Vikingeskibsmuseets havn og præsenteres for museets besøgende sommer og vinter.
English: There are more than 30 boats in the Viking Ship Museum’s harbour and they are presented to museum’s visitors during the summer and winter.

Danish: Ret venligst henvendelse til personalet i museumsbutikken i Vikingeskibshallen.
English: There are no fixed showing times, but the film is run on request.

Danish: Der er ikke nogen historiske kilder, der beviser, at vikingerne brugte heste, eller dyr i det hele taget, når de skulle slæbe skibe på land eller over land.
English: There are no historical sources to show that the Vikings used horses, or any other animals for that matter, when they pulled their ships onto or over land.

Danish: Der findes ingen kilder eller lovtekster der omtaler en egentlig sygepasser om bord på vikingernes skibe.
English: There are no sources or law texts that mention actual medical care on board Viking ships.

Danish: Der er ingen våben om bord på Havhingsten.
English: There are no weapons on board the Sea Stallion.

Danish: Nu sejles der hver dag fra 1. maj til 30. september.
English: There are now sailings every day from 1 May to 30 September.

Danish: Det diskuteres ofte om den er den værste eller den bedste vagt?
English: There are often discussions as to whether this is the worst or the best watch.

Danish: Der er formodentlig flere grunde til dette.
English: There are probably several reasons for this.

Danish: Der er forholdsvis få skriftlige kilder fra denne epoke, så her giver disse skibsfund stor og ny viden om professionel dansk handelssøfart før hansetiden, som blev domineret af tyske handelsmænd.
English: There are relatively few written sources from that era, so these ship finds provide a great deal of new knowledge about professional, Danish, merchant shipping before the Hanseatic period, which was dominated by German merchants.

Danish: Vestnorge har mange egne med god landbrugsjord; et af dem er området omkring Stavanger.
English: There are several areas of fertile farmland in Western Norway; one of these is the country around Stavanger.

Danish: Der er flere veje til at blive bådelaugsmedlem.
English: There are several different ways to become a member of the Boat Society.

Danish: Der er flere elementer der afgør fundet af arkæologiske kilder til vikingetiden.
English: There are several elements that determine whether an artefact belongs to the archaeological sources for the Viking Age.

Danish: Der findes flere forskellige gratis GIS-programmer på Internettet.
English: There are several free GIS programmes available on the Internet.

Danish: Der er flere forskere, der har arbejdet med deres maritime indhold.
English: There are several scholars who have done research into what the verses tell about maritime conditions.

Danish: Det er helt specielle krav, der stilles til en udkig.
English: There are special requirements that a lookout must meet.

Danish: Der er fortsat mange ubekendte, men målet er klart.
English: There are still a number of unresolved issues, but the objective is clear.

Danish: Der er fortsat folder i sejlet og seks støttetove til masten, men sejlet, der også her er ved at blive bjerget, vises nu i en karakteristisk, trekantet form, som danner mønster for resten af tapetets sejlafbildninger.
English: There are still folds in the sail and six supporting ropes to the mast but the sail, which is also here being taken in, is now shown in a characteristic triangular form that henceforward forms the model for the rest of the ship depictions on the tapestry.

Danish: Der er rester af skibene selv, skitser af skibe på planker, model- eller legetøjsskibe i træ samt net-/linesynk af bly, formet som skibe.
English: There are the remains of ships themselves, sketches of ships on planks, model- or toy ships in wood and lead fishing weights in the shape of ships.

Danish: Og sådan er der mange små fortællinger om de fleste både.
English: There are therefore many small stories to be told about the various boats.

Danish: Der er tre grundlæggende slægtskabsformer: 1) Kilden A bruger kilden B. 2) Kilden A og kilden B bruger begge en tredje kilde X. 3) Kilden A bruger både kilden B og kilden X. (Principielt bør man undersøge hele forfatterskabet for at afklare dette).
English: There are three basic relations: 1) Source A draws on source B. 2) Source A and source B both draw on a third source X. 3) Source A draws on sources B and X. (In principle the entire body of the author's work should be examined to clarify this).

Danish: På denne båd er der tre bord.
English: There are three strakes on this boat.

Danish: Der findes i dag mange forskellige slags kilder til vikingetidens skibsbygning.
English: There are today many different sources concerning Viking ship building.

Danish: Når man skal lave arkæologiske udgravninger på havbunden, er der to afgørende forskelle i forhold til når man laver arkæologiske udgravninger på landjorden.
English: There are two crucial differences between archaeological digs on the seabed and those on dry land.

Danish: To yderligere, formodede langskibsfund kendes fra Foteviken nær Falsterbo i Skåne.
English: There are two further finds of presumed longships from Foteviken, near Falsterbo in Scania.

Danish: Det er der to grundlæggende årsager til;
English: There are two main reasons for this:

Danish: Vikingetidens skibe var lette og stærke.
English: There are two main reasons for this:

Danish: Der kan selvfølgelig være forskellige opfattelser, meninger og strategier i forhold til den foreliggende situation.
English: There can be various perceptions, opinions and strategies with regard to our current situation.

Danish: Der kan derfor være stor forskel på fundsbilledet fra fx. moser med moselig eller krigsbytteofringer.
English: There can therefore be large differences in the overall picture of an artefact from for instance bogs with corpses or victims of spoils of war.

Danish: Fundets datering har længe været omstridt af mangel på klart daterede genstande.
English: There has long been debate regarding the date of the find, since securely-dated diagnostic objects are not present in the find.

Danish: Der har været fremsat mange hypoteser om, hvad der gik galt.
English: There have been many hypotheses about what went wrong.

Danish: Der er fundet forskellige løsfund af ror fra vikingetiden.
English: There have been several loose finds of rudders from the Viking Age.

Danish: På Gislingebåden derimod blev der desværre ikke fundet et sideror under udgravningen.
English: There have been several loose finds of rudders from the Viking Age.

Danish: 4 km til landsby, bad, vaskeri, café og pub, men alligevel er det lykkedes os at komme til byen på indkøb næsten hver dag.
English: There is 4 kilometres to village, bath, laundry, café and pub, but still we've managed to shop in town almost every day.

Danish: Du kan møde blandt andet vikingekrigeren, smeden, rebslageren, bådebyggeren og opleve ’håndværksverdenen’ på nært hold: hvilke tanker gør håndværkerne sig om materialevalg, udformning og kvalitet?
English: There is a ample opportunity to try and experiment, and to think over what it takes to make a boat sail.

Danish: På værftspladsen kan børn og deres voksne forvandle overskuddet fra værftets byggerier til fantastiske modelskibe.
English: There is a ample opportunity to try and experiment, and to think over what it takes to make a boat sail.

Danish: Der går en rød tråd fra eskimoernes endeløse snedækkede jagtmarker i Grønland og til den trange kabys om bord på Havhingsten.
English: There is a clear line from the endless snowy reaches of the Eskimo hunting grounds in Greenland to the restricted galley aboard the Sea Stallion.

Danish: Der er afgørende forskel på om arkæologen foretager en egentlig udgravning eller gennemsøger et område med detektor efter overfladefund.
English: There is a crucial difference between an archaeologist carrying out a proper excavation and just going over an area with a detector looking for surface finds.

Danish: Og så er det muligt at komme med egne kommentarer til de forskellige temaer og udvalgte ting samt bidrage med hvad fremtiden bør vide om os i 2009.
English: There is a feature that allows you to make your own comments on the various themes and the selected objects and to contribute what you think the future should know about the world of 2009.

Danish: Listen over de udfordringer det enkelte medlem af besætningen stilles overfor er lang:
English: There is a long list of challenges faced by every member of the crew:

Danish: I området udfor Barneholm findes der en smal gytjebræmme med et rigt indhold af bl.a. flint og knogler.
English: There is a narrow sediment border in the area outside Barneholm with a large number of flints, bones etc.

Danish: Der er en række historiske og arkæologiske beviser på brugen af de forskellige materialer, som blev brugt til at fremstille reb.
English: There is a range of historical and archaeological evidence for the types of materials used in ropemaking.

Danish: Desuden er der et aktivt laug knyttet til Kraka Fyr.
English: There is also an active guild linked to Kraka Fyr.

Danish: Der er altid meget at se på, når Vikingeskibsmuseets mange bådelaug med fælles hjælp søsætter bådene.
English: There is always plenty to see when the Viking Ship Museum’s boat guilds help each other to launch the boats.

Danish: Det giver god mulighed for at prøve og afprøve - og forundres over, hvad der gør din båd til den bedste sejler!
English: There is ample opportunity to try and experiment, and to think over what it takes to make a boat sail!

Danish: Her kan du træde ind på et aktivt værft og følge bådebyggeren på nært hold.
English: There is an opportunity here to step into an active boatyard and follow the boat-builders at close quarters.

Danish: Det er ikke meget, kvadene kan fortælle os om de materialer, krigsskibene blev bygget af, men det er påfaldende at eik, eg, ofte optræder som del af et positivt udsagn om et skib.
English: There is little that the verses can tell us about the materials from which the warship were constructed but it is a striking fact that eik ‘oak' is often used in a positive description of a ship.

Danish: Det er ikke meget, kvadene kan fortælle os om de materialer, krigsskibene blev bygget af, men det er påfaldende at eik, eg, ofte optræder som del af et positivt udsagn om et skib.
English: There is little that the verses can tell us about the materials from which the warship were constructed but it is a striking fact that eik ‘oak’ is often used in a positive description of a ship.

Danish: Der er mange detaljer der skal på plads, men heldigvis har museet høstet en lang række erfaringer, som indgår i planlægningen.
English: There is much to do, but fortunately the museum has gained a lot of experience that helps the planning.

Danish: Der er ingen tvivl om, at Hedeby havde en stor betydning for vikingetidens handel og var særdeles vigtig for kongemagtens samling og konsolidering i Danmark.
English: There is no doubt that Haithabu was of great significance for trade in the Viking Age, and similarly for the concentration and consolidation of royal power in Denmark.

Danish: Der er ingen tvivl om, at mange drog et lettelsens suk, da vinden og bølgerne lagde sig i løbet af de tidlige morgentimer.
English: There is no doubt that many heaved a sigh of relief as the wind and waves calmed during the early morning hours.

Danish: Det er helt uden tvivl: Skibene [her er ment skibe i det hele taget] er den forhistoriske arkæologis dronninger i Skandinavien og derudover i hele Europa.
English: There is no doubt: Ships are the queens of prehistoric archaeology in Scandinavia and the rest of the world.

Danish: Køkken er der ikke!
English: There is no kitchen!

Danish: Der er ingen grænse for en oldsags størrelse, så længe den fundne genstand kan transporteres fra fundsstedet.
English: There is no limit to the size of an artefact as long as the find can be transported from where it was found.

Danish: Oldsager kan også være affald såsom knogler fra slagtede dyr eller jernslagger fra en smedjeproduktion af våben elle redskaber.
English: There is no limit to the size of an artefact as long as the find can be transported from where it was found.

Danish: Der er ingen, der kan mindes, at vandet har stået så højt i Roskilde før.
English: There is no one who can remember that the water has been so high in Roskilde before.

Danish: Privatliv er der ikke plads til; personlig hygiejne, spisning, søvn, sygdom og arbejde afvikles på åbent dæk.
English: There is no privacy on board and personal hygiene, eating, sleeping, sickness and work must all be handled on open deck.

Danish: Der er ingen sikre kilder på indsamling af frø i Vikingetiden
English: There is no sure evidence of eating collected seeds in the Viking Age

Danish: Der er ingen spor af, hvor kampen fandt sted, hvordan den forløb - udover dens udfald med sejr for de lokale - og hvad der skete med de overvundne krigere og de tre andre både.
English: There is no trace of where the battle took place or its progress (except that the residents of Als were victorious) or of what happened to the defeated warriors and the three other postulated boats.

Danish: Der er ét træk, som forener hele dette store kildemateriale: der er ikke ét billede som vi kan identificere som et stort vikingetidigt langskib i hel figur.
English: There is one characteristic that links all this large body of material: namely that there is not a single picture that we can identify as a full-length portrait of a great Viking-Age longship.

Danish: Her er plads til at træne sejlads over længere stræk, men det bliver vejr og vind, der bestemmer om Havhingsten for eksempel kommer til Kiel, Kalvehave eller Karlskrona.
English: There is plenty of room here to train sailing over longer distances, but it will be the weather and wind that will dictate whethere the ship comes to Kiel, Kalvehave or Karlskrona.

Danish: På et sommertogt til Norge lagde han til i en vig - og lod sine mænd besøge den lokale bonde for at sørge for frisk brød til besætningen.
English: There is really nothing more to it,” says Preben Rather Sørensen, leader of the secretariat at the Viking Ship Museum, charged with planning the voyage of the Sea Stallion to Dublin.

Danish: Så kort kan det siges," forklarer Preben Rather Sørensen, leder af det sekretariat på Vikingeskibsmuseet, som planlægger Havhingstens sejlads til Dublin.
English: There is really nothing more to it,” says Preben Rather Sørensen, leader of the secretariat at the Viking Ship Museum, charged with planning the voyage of the Sea Stallion to Dublin.

Danish: Der er plads til 70 gæster i biografen.
English: There is room for 70 visitors in the cinema.

Danish: Der kunne være op til 60 personer i denne båd.
English: There is room for up to 60 people in this boat.

Danish: Der er noget for enhver smag!
English: There is something for everyone!

Danish: Der bliver plads til fire personer ombord, eller maks 350 kilo og prammene bliver gjort synkefri med opdriftsmidler.
English: There is space for four people or max. 350 kg on board and the prams are made unsinkable with buoyancy materials.

Danish: Der er stærk strøm, lave broer og masser af skibstrafik, så det gælder om at være klar." siger skipper og fortsætter: "Vi har løsnet Havhingstens høje stævne, så vi kan fjerne dem, når vi skal under de lave broer.
English: There is strong current, low bridges and masses of ship traffic ahead, so we have to ready at all times" says the skipper, and continues, "We've loosened Sea Stallion's high stems, so we can remove them when we have to go under the low bridges.

Danish: Der bliver bandet i det stille over besværlige lynlåse og snærende kraver.
English: There is subtle cussing of the tricky zippers and tight collars.

Danish: Om Gorm har hersket over hele det danske område eller blot Jylland er usikkert.
English: There is uncertainty about whether Gorm ruled over the whole of Denmark or just Jutland.

Danish: Der er meget få holdepunkter for vikingernes anvendelse af egentlige navigationsinstrumenter.
English: There is very little evidence of the Vikings' use of actual navigation instruments.

Danish: Der er meget få holdepunkter for vikingernes anvendelse af egentlige navigationsinstrumenter.
English: There is very little evidence of the Vikings’ use of actual navigation instruments.

Danish: Men der savnes en forklaring på forskellen mellem de 776 aftalte skibe, og de 1000 skibe, som Vilhelm hævdes at have til rådighed, udover de frivillige bidrag, og det er blevet diskuteret i litteraturen, om dette skyldes en fejl i manuskriptet.
English: There is, however, no explanation for the difference between the 776 pre-agreed ships and the 1,000 ships that William is claimed to have had at his disposal, apart from the voluntary contributions, and it has been discussed in the literature whether there is an error in the manuscript.

Danish: Sejlads er der ikke meget af på et togt som dette.
English: There isn’t much sailing on a trip like this.

Danish: Der kan godt være flere kurver - svarende til flere vindstyrker, sejlarealer eller forskellige fartøjer - i samme diagram.
English: There may well be several curves - corresponding to several wind speeds, areas of sail or different vessels - on the same diagram.

Danish: Der kan godt være flere kurver - svarende til flere vindstyrker, sejlarealer eller forskellige fartøjer - i samme diagram.
English: There may well be several curves – corresponding to several wind speeds, areas of sail or different vessels – on the same diagram.

Danish: Dér drak de i selskab til solen gik i bjerget”
English: There they drank together until the sun went into the hill.”

Danish: Der blev skiftet besætning undervejs, og mere end 100 deltog som besætning i løbet af rejsen.
English: There was a crew change along the way and more than 100 crewmembers took part in the voyage..

Danish: Fund af enkelte genstande fra middelalder og nyere tid.
English: There was a small number of finds from the medieval period and the modern era.

Danish: Man ville gerne have ham kåret til helgen efter hans død, derfor var det vigtigt at få nedskrevet hans livshistorie og alle de gerninger og bedrifter, han havde begået.
English: There was a wish to have him declared a saint after his death, so it was necessary to ensure that his life history was written down, together with all his deeds and achievements.

Danish: Der var også en vagt forest i skibet til at holde udkig.
English: There was also a lookout in the bow section of the vessel.

Danish: Der var også et udvalg af redskaber, som var uundværlige i forbindelse med handel; vægte, vægtlodder og måleredskaber samt et udvalg af mønter, der daterer graven til efter år 850.
English: There was also a selection of tools vital for trading, scales, weights and measures and a selection of coins, which dated the burial after the year 850.

Danish: Der var gilde i flere dage, masser af mjød, varmrøget laks, spidstegt lam og andre lækkerier.
English: There was feasting for several days, plenty of mead, smoked salmon, spit-roasted lamb and other delicacies.

Danish: Der var mere end 10 tons udstyr og ballast pakket ned under dørken, under togtet til Dublin og retur.
English: There was more than 10 tonnes of equipment and ballast packed below the deck during the voyage to Dublin and back.

Danish: Der bliver dog rigeligt at hugge i, inden plankerne er færdige og sidder som bord på båden.
English: There was plenty to be hewn afterwards however, before the planks were ready and sat as strakes on the boat.

Danish: Formodentlig har der været plads til 30 årepar i skibet.
English: There was probably room for 30 pairs of oars in the ship, i.e. twice as many as the Ladby ship.

Danish: Der var variation i orienteringen og placeringen af husene, og nogle steder var der mellemrum uden huse.
English: There was variation in the orientation and position of houses, and street fronts were not always occupied by a house.

Danish: Roerne kunne ikke være der for hinanden med deres lange åretag, hvilket først blev opdaget efter rejsens start.
English: There wasn't enough room for all the oarsmen with their long strokes, but this was first discovered after the voyage had started.

Danish: De sejler alle syv uger fra Danmark til Irland for at sikre kontinuitet i sejladsen.
English: There we will be met by our second crew group who will be our fresh forces for the onward journey.

Danish: Der var også kvinder og børn i vikingetiden - og var alle vikinger krigere?
English: There were also women and children in Viking times - and were all Vikings warriors?

Danish: Der var også kvinder og børn i vikingetiden - og var alle vikinger krigere?
English: There were also women and children in Viking times – and were all Vikings warriors?

Danish: Der var leg og konkurrencer for børnene, bueskydning samt brynjeklædte krigere til hest.
English: There were games and competitions for the children, archery and warriors on horseback dressed in coats of mail.

Danish: Store dele af havvandet var bundet i resten af den tykke iskappe, der efter sidste istid stadig lå på den nordlige halvkugle.
English: There were large amounts of seawater trapped in the remains of the thick ice cap from the previous Ice Age which still covered parts of the northern hemisphere.

Danish: Der fandtes store mængder bopladsflint fra Kongemosekultur /Villingebækfasen (ca. 6000 f. Kr.).
English: There were large quantities of settlement flint from the Kongemose culture /Villingebæk phase (about 6000 BC).

Danish: Køjer var der ingen af, og rummene mellem hver bænkene på skibet, som kaldes tofter, udgjorde sovepladserne.
English: There were no berths - instead the spaces between each thwart constituted their sleeping places.

Danish: Køjer var der ingen af, og rummene mellem hver bænkene på skibet, som kaldes tofter, udgjorde sovepladserne.
English: There were no berths – instead the spaces between each thwart constituted their sleeping places.

Danish: Langs de prøvegravede kajer forekom der ikke kulturlag, der kan relateres til Middelalder eller Renæssance, og hér er der ikke behov for yderligere undersøgelser.
English: There were no culture layers found along the test excavated quays that can be related to the Medieval period or to the Renaissance and no further investigations are required here.

Danish: Der har formodentlig været 39 par årer og således 78 mand ved årerne.
English: There were probably 39 pairs of oars and, accordingly, 78 oarsmen to serve them.

Danish: Der har nok været en del tyske/frankiske missionærer i Norden, men Ansgar er en af de få vi kender, især fordi der blev skrevet en såkaldt levnedsbeskrivelse om ham (en beskrivelse af hvad han har lavet og hvordan hans liv var).
English: There were probably quite a number of German/Frankish missionaries in the Nordic Countries, but Ansgar is one of the few we know of, in particular because a biography was written of him.

Danish: Turen bød på tre meter høje bølger fra Atlanten og til tider kuling fra vest.
English: There were three-metre-high waves from the Atlantic and the westerly reached gale force at times.

Danish: Det var også stam…
English: There were …

Danish: Der bliver også mulighed for at se og høre om de seneste arkæologiske fund fra havbunden, når leder af Marin-arkæologisk afdeling, Jørgen Dencker byder indenfor i Arkæologisk værksted.
English: There will also be an opportunity to see and hear about the latest archaeological finds from the seabed, when the head of the marine archaeological department, Jørgen Dencker, invites visitors into the archaeological workshop.

Danish: Der vil være øvelser med knob, lægge tovværk, roning, laste skib og meget mere for landkrabberne.
English: There will be challenges with knots, making rope, rowing, loading the ships, and much more for the landlubbers.

Danish: Og der vil være gilde i flere dage, masser af mjød, varmrøget laks, spidstegt lam og andre lækkerier.
English: There will be feasting for several days, plenty of mead, smoked salmon, spit-roasted lamb and other delicacies.

Danish: I anledning af museets jubilæum vil der være gratis entré til museet hele dagen
English: There will be free admission to the museum all day to mark the museum’s anniversary.

Danish: Der vil være gratis entré, når Vikingeskibsmuseet slår dørene op for en fødselsdag med mange tilbud for at se tilbage på Vikingeskibshallens første 40 år.
English: There will be free admission when the Viking Ship Museum opens its doors for a birthday celebration with many opportunities to look back over the first 40 years of the museum.

Danish: Der vil være rig lejlighed til at komme helt tæt på arbejdet med Vikingeskibene - den gang, i dag og i fremtiden.
English: There will be plenty of opportunities to get close to the work with the Viking ships, past, present and future.

Danish: Der vil være skjaldefortællinger, falkonershow og drabelige kampe med krydsede sværd.
English: There will be skaldic story-telling, a falconer show and deadly jousts and sword-play.

Danish: Du kan se den professionelle bådebygger arbejde og selv prøve kræfter med økse, kniv, høvl og bor.
English: There will be two craftworkers in place every day - find out which two of the exciting workshops will be open during your visit by asking at the ticket desk.

Danish: Hver dag vil der være vikingelege- og spil til fri afbenyttelse.
English: There will be Viking games at the disposal of all guest.

Danish: Eksempelvis en computer til, at sende meldinger tilbage til Vikingeskibsmuseet, så man her på hjemmesiden kan følge med i sejladsen og læse besætningens log- og dagbøger.
English: There will, for example, be a computer to send reports back to the Viking Ship Museum so that it is possible to follow the voyage on the website and read the crew's logs and diaries.

Danish: Vikingeskibsmuseet vil syde af liv hele weekenden, når Havhingsten søndag den 1. juli lægger fra kaj og stævner mod Irlands hovedstad, Dublin.
English: There willl be plenty to see at the Viking Ship Museum, when the Sea Stallion on Sunday July 1st will set out and then head for Dublin, the capital of Ireland.

Danish: Med en stor besætning på et langt, smalt skib er der intet privatliv, ingen sted at være helt sig selv.
English: There's no privacy on board a long and narrow ship with a large crew; nowhere to be on your own.

Danish: Der kan alle interesserede se Havhingstens nøjagtige position.
English: There, everyone can se the exact position of the Sea Stallion.

Danish: Derfor er alkohol aldeles forbudt om bord på Havhingsten.
English: Therefore alcohol has been completely banned onboard the Sea Stallion.

Danish: Derfor er der også behov for en stram og struktureret styring af forskningsarbejdet.
English: Therefore an organized and well structured control of the research is needed.

Danish: Derfor blev der på museets bådeværft fremstillet fire små klinkbyggede “skibssider” - to af egetræ og to af fyr.
English: Therefore four small clinker-built “sections of hull” were built in the museum's boatyard - two of oak and two of pine.

Danish: Derfor blev der på museets bådeværft fremstillet fire små klinkbyggede “skibssider” - to af egetræ og to af fyr.
English: Therefore four small clinker-built “sections of hull” were built in the museum’s boatyard – two of oak and two of pine.

Danish: Derfor er det vigtigt, at anføreren hele tiden råber til de andre gaster, så de kan orientere sig efter lyden.
English: Therefore it is important for the leader to yell at her ship mates so that they can react to the sound.

Danish: Derfor er der god tid for besætningen til at blive rystet sammen på ny med de gaster, som tager over på anden halvdel af togtet.
English: Therefore the crew will use the time to socialize with new crew members coming on board and say a prober goodbye to crew members leaving.

Danish: Og denne gang lykkedes det at få en line ned til skibet og at fire en redder og en læge fra helikopteren om bord på Havhingsten.
English: Therefore the helicopter could lower a line with a medic and a doctor on board the Sea Stallion.

Danish: Derfor kan Havhingsten set med en forskers øjne betragtes som en hypotese.
English: Therefore the Sea Stallion can be considered a hypothesis in the eyes of a scholar.

Danish: Og i weekenden lægger vi sidste hånd på de rutiner, som skal sikre, at vi også kan klare os igennem den værste tænkelige krisesituation - at vi er nødt til at evakuere skibets besætning," fortæller projektleder Preben Rather Sørensen.
English: Therefore this weekend was the final exercise of the safety routines that are going to save the crew worst case scenario - if we have to evacuate the ship," says project leader Preben Rather Sørensen.

Danish: Derfor kan alle disse emne hugges ned til små dimensioner og samtidig være stærke.
English: Therefore, all of these elements can be cut down to relatively small dimensions and still be strong.

Danish: De mønter, man finder fra vikingetiden har forskellige motiver på hver side.
English: Therefore, an "upper die" must have existed to make the other side of the coin.

Danish: Derfor kan barken stadig ses nogle steder - det er et tegn på kvalitet.
English: Therefore, bark can still be seen in some places - this is a mark of quality.

Danish: Derfor bruges der forskellige træsorter til forskellige formål.
English: Therefore, different types of wood are used for different purposes.

Danish: I de moderne skove er der derfor meget langt mellem de egnede egetræer, der kan bruges til at bygge skibe med vikingetidens teknologi, hvor plankerne skal kløves ud og hugges til med økser, modsat den moderne teknik, hvor planker bliver savet ud.
English: Therefore, it’s seldom that you can find suitable oaks that can be used to build a ship using Viking Age technology, where planks must be cleaved out and hewn with axes, as opposed to the modern technique, where they are sawn.

Danish: Derfor var kun dele af bunden bevaret.
English: Therefore, only part of the bottom was preserved.

Danish: Derfor kan der kun drages foreløbige konklusioner:
English: Therefore, only preliminary conclusions can be drawn in the following:

Danish: Fra at have en relativ enkelt indfaldsvinkel har undersøgelserne vist, hvor kompleks problemstillingen er.
English: Therefore, only preliminary conclusions can be drawn in the following:

Danish: Derfor brugte bådebyggerene ikke save (hverken med eller uden motor) til at fælde træet.
English: Therefore, our boatbuilders do not use saws (motorised or otherwise) to fell the tree.

Danish: Derfor har nedlægning af mast også været en af de mange sikkerhedsøvelser i fjor.
English: Therefore, taking down the mast has been part of the safety training last year.

Danish: Bådebyggerne førte dagbog undervejs.
English: Therefore, the boat builders will keep a log.

Danish: Derfor medbringes også en særlig romaskine, hvor udstillingens besøgende kan prøve kræfter med en vikingesømands hverdag samt tøj, våben og værktøj til de arbejdende værksteder.
English: Therefore, the exhibition will also include a special rowing machine, which visitors to the exhibition can use to test their strength, as well as clothing, weapons and tools for the active workshops.

Danish: Derfor er de fund vi gør her, med til at fylde hullerne i vores viden om stenaldermenneskenes udnyttelse af det omgivende miljø og ressourcer”, forklarer Morten Johansen.
English: Therefore, the find we have made here, helps to fill in the gaps in our knowledge concerning Stone Age people's exploitation of the surrounding environment and resources”, explains Morten Johansen.

Danish: Derfor er de fund vi gør her, med til at fylde hullerne i vores viden om stenaldermenneskenes udnyttelse af det omgivende miljø og ressourcer”, forklarer Morten Johansen.
English: Therefore, the find we have made here, helps to fill in the gaps in our knowledge concerning Stone Age people’s exploitation of the surrounding environment and resources”, explains Morten Johansen.

Danish: Derfor foregår undersøgelserne som offshore-dykning, der er underlagt store sikkerhedskrav.
English: Therefore, the investigation is conducted as an offshore diving project, which calls for some important safety requirements.

Danish: Illustrationen til venstre viser egetræets forskellige vedtyper.
English: Therefore, the tree essentially needs to be oversized.

Danish: Derfor bruger vi også den ældgamle kløve-metode for at kunne fremstille bådens planker af de store egestammer på samme måde, som for 1000 år siden".
English: Therefore, we also use the ancient technique of cleaving in order to produce planks from large logs, just as they did 1,000 years ago.”

Danish: Derfor gik vi hårdt til arbejdet med kædesaven.
English: Therefore, we used chainsaws and other modern tools.

Danish: Med en stor besætning på et langt, smalt skib er der intet privatliv, ingen sted at være helt sig selv.
English: There’s no privacy on board a long and narrow ship with a large crew; nowhere to be on your own.

Danish: De er alle fra den tidlige delen av vikingtiden og ser ut til å representere samme skipstype, antakelig universalskip, brukbare til krigstokt, handel med lite plasskrevende luksusvarer eller kolonisasjonsferder til Vesterhavsøyene og Island.
English: These are all from early the Viking Age and seem to represent the same ship-type, presumably a universal ship-type used for warfare, trade of small luxury goods or colonising voyages to the North Sea islands and Iceland.

Danish: Det er store gummibåde med kraftige påhængsmotorer, og de klarer sig fint i selv tre meter høje bølger.
English: These are big rubber dinghies with powerful outboard motors, and they cope well with even three-metre-high waves.

Danish: Disse må opfattes som dekorationer på stævntoppe, formodentlig udformet som dragehoved og –hale.
English: These are perceived as decorations on the top of the stem and stern, probably shaped respectively as a dragon's head and tail.

Danish: Kejpen blev ikke fundet, men er en rekopstruktion efter Nydambådens årekejper.
English: These are reconstructions of those found on the Nydam boat.

Danish: Vagterne kaldes bagbord og styrbord vagt efter skibets to sider.
English: These are referred to as port and starboard watch, respectively, according to the two sides of the ship.

Danish: Det er de samme vilkår, som vikingen havde, når der skulle sejles til Gotland eller længere”, fortæller han.
English: These are the same conditions experienced by the Vikings when they sailed to Gotland or further afield” he says.

Danish: Det er præmisserne, når man forsøger at genskabe det forgangne.
English: These are the terms of operation when one attempts to reconstruct the past.

Danish: Det er de ting, som har båret projektet igennem.
English: These are the things that have borne this project along.

Danish: Og deri har det moderne menneske mange træk til fælles med vikingen.
English: These are what the people of today have in common with the Vikings of old.

Danish: Baserne udviklede sig til byer, som i dag hører til blandt Irlands største.
English: These bases developed into towns, which today is amongst the biggest in Ireland.

Danish: De store, sammenhængende trækonstruktioner modsvares ikke af noget på land – for dér er det bare ikke bevaret.
English: These big connected wooden constructions have no equivalent on land – because they have not been preserved there.

Danish: Attesterne skal hjælpe sygeplejersken til, at forebygge sygdomme og behandle besætningsmedlemmerne under sejladsen.
English: These bills help the nurse in the prevention of illness and in treating the crew during the voyage.

Danish: De kunne være lavet af kostbart materiale som glas, tak, tand, rav eller horn.
English: These can be made of valuable materials such as glass, antler, ivory, amber or horn.

Danish: Det kan være regler, der forbyder skikke, som var almindelige få hundrede år tidligere; regler for, hvordan man omgås kongen eller bestemmelser vedrørende handel og lovgivning om organiseringen af skibsbygning.
English: These can be rules prohibiting practices common a few hundred years before, rules for how to behave in the presence of the king, or rules for trading, and legislation about the organisation of shipbuilding.

Danish: Disse kan formodentlig betragtes som en slags all-round fartøjer til både handels- og krigstogter.
English: These can probably be considered as all-round vessels intended for voyages of both trade and war.

Danish: Det markeres blandt andet med en sejlads til sommer med Havhingsten fra Glendalough.
English: These celebrations will include Sea Stallion going out sailing during the summer.

Danish: Bag forandringerne lå ofte håndgribelige forbindelser.
English: These changes often reflect tangible connections.

Danish: Disse betragtninger gælder for langskibe på længere togter.
English: These considerations apply to longships on longer voyages.

Danish: Disse består af mindre fund af skibsdele, der ikke har noget at gøre med Roskilde Havn vrag 2.
English: These consist of smaller finds of ship parts that are unconnected to Roskilde Harbour wreck 2.

Danish: Der er tale om en vragflage spændende fra sjette - løst liggende - bordgang i bagbord side over kølen til anden bordgang i styrbord side.
English: These constitute a fragment of a wreck extending from the sixth – unattached – strake on the port side, over the keel to the second strake on the starboard side.

Danish: Det kom til Irland overvejende i form af mønter, der så blev smeltet om og lavet til smykker.
English: These contain a combination of ornaments, chopped pieces of silver known as hack silver, ingots and coins.

Danish: Attesterne indeholder navn, adresse, telefonnumre til pårørende, oplysninger om hvilke sygdomme besætningen har eller har haft, samt om man bruger medicin.
English: These contain the names, addresses and telephone numbers of close family, information about any illnesses that a crewmember has or has had, as well as about any medication being taken.

Danish: Disse kobberroer måler 19 mm i diameter.
English: These copper roves measure 19mm in diameter.

Danish: Disse kunne også være af basttov.
English: These could also be of bast rope.

Danish: Korsene er alle dateret til 1000 - 1100-tallet og deres indridsninger fortæller historier om nordiske helte, legender og myter.
English: These crosses are all dated to the 1000 - 1100 century and their carvings tells stories of Nordic heroes, legends and myths.

Danish: Et sådant talmateriale vil også kunne sammenlignes med samtidige skriftlige kilders oplysninger om rejsehastighed til søs.
English: These figures can also be compared with information from contemporary written sources concerning travelling speed at sea.

Danish: Dette og andet materiale tyder på, at sværdet først kort tid inden Hjortspring-nedlægningen er kommet i brug her som en lang kampkniv, og at spydspidser af tak og jern har været almindelige i hele perioden.
English: These finds and other material suggest that it can only have been quite recently before the Hjortspring deposition that the sword had come into use as a long battle-knife but that spearheads of antler and iron had been in common use throughout the entire period.

Danish: Disse fem var alle af høj håndværksmæssig kvalitet som de tidligst kendte nordeuropæiske repræsentanter for denne teknik i træ.
English: These five objects were all of a high standard of turning craftsmanship and the earliest representatives in Northern Europe of this technique in wood.

Danish: Ofte var disse huse mere end 20 meter lange.
English: These houses were often 20m or more in length.

Danish: Denne vigtige del af det fuldstændige og funktionsdygtige vikingeskib erkendes kun gennem vikingetidens afbildninger, negative aftryk på skrog og lignende, samt gennem løsrevne maritimt specialiserede genstande.
English: These important parts of a complete and functional Viking ship are known only through Viking Age images, negative impressions on hulls and the like, as well as detached specialised maritime artefacts.

Danish: Bl.a. også et meget flot fund ved Trondhjem i Norge, hvor man i en smeltende gletcher fandt flere spændende ting.
English: These include a very fine site near Trondheim in Norway, where several fascinating objects were recovered from a melting glacier.

Danish: Det omfatter blandt andet udskiftning af en del af kølen og flere planker i forskibet.
English: These include the replacement of part of the keel and several planks in the bow section.

Danish: Disse spørgsmål leder til en drøftelse af, hvordan professionel søhandel kan påvises (kapitel 3).
English: These issues were addressed in an exploration of the evidence for specialised merchant seafaring (Chapter 3).

Danish: Genstandene kan ses i Illerup Ådal udstillingen på Moesgård Museum.
English: These items can be seen at the Illerup Ådal exhibition at Moesgård museum.

Danish: Det er frustrerende for os med disse lange ventetider, men vi har jo en vis erfaring.
English: These long waiting periods are frustrating, but we have a certain amount of experience.

Danish: Disse nutidige håndværkere, anvender deres evner og instinktive forståelse af materialer og håndværksprocesser til rekonstruktion af både og skibe.
English: These modern day crafts men and women apply their skills and innate understanding of materials and craft processes to the reconstruction of boats and ships.

Danish: Disse organismer vil til sidst ankomme som blinde passagerer til Roskilde Fjord, hvor de potentielt kan sprede sig, etablere nye populationer og muligvis forvolde skade på vores hjemlige marine flora og fauna.
English: These organisms will travel as stowaways and end up in Roskilde Fjord, where they can spread and establish new populations that could potentially cause damage to our domestic marine flora and fauna.

Danish: Disse små træsøm var vigtige for forståelsen af de fire skibsskrog oprindelige byggesekvens, som blev undersøgt i en senere fase af undersøgelsen, som er fremlagt i kapitel fire, hvor de enkelte vrag behandles individuelt.
English: These pegs were crucial for the understanding of the original building sequence of the four different hulls, that were examined at a later stage, presented in chapter four, where the eight wrecks are discussed individually.

Danish: Disse mennesker har efterladt sig forskellige spor i skibet - nogle meget konkrete, som f.eks. de værktøjsspor, der er efterladt som primærkilder fra bådebyggerens hånd.
English: These people have left a variety of traces on the ships, some of which are very concrete, such as tool marks that have been left as primary sources from the hand of the ship-builder.

Danish: Disse mennesker har efterladt sig forskellige spor i skibet - nogle meget konkrete, som f.eks. de værktøjsspor, der er efterladt som primærkilder fra bådebyggerens hånd.
English: These people have left a variety of traces on the ships, some of which are very concrete, such as tool tracks that have been left as primary sources from the hand of the ship-builder.

Danish: Disse fotos kan frit anvendes af pressen til redaktionel omtale af Havhingsten fra Glendalough OG Vikingeskibsmuseet i Roskilde.
English: These photos are freely used by the press for editorial review of the Sea Stallion from Glendalough and the Viking Ship Museum in Roskilde.

Danish: Disse problemer gik højst sandsynligt helt tilbage til begyndelsen af opstillingsprocessen.
English: These problems most likely began right at the start of the reconstruction process.

Danish: Disse gode landbrugsområder lå samtidig centralt i forhold til de vigtige handelsveje langs kysten og ad fjordene ind i landet.
English: These productive farmlands also lay centrally relative to the important trade routes running along the coast and to those following the fjords inland.

Danish: Disse specialbyggede skibe forenede indtrykket af elegance og status med stor lasteevne og en moderat dybgang på ca. 1,5 m, som tillod sejlads gennem grunde kystfarvande og fjorde.
English: These purpose-built cargo ships combined an elegant expression of high-status with a large cargo capacity and a moderate draught of ca 1.5 m, while at the same time retaining the ability to navigate in shallow coastal waters and fjords.

Danish: Alle de spørgsmål, og mere, foranledigede bådebyggerne til at undersøge den originale fund materiale igen, for at finde ud af, hvilket råderum der var for en genfortolkning af bådens form.
English: These questions and more prompted the boatbuilders to re-examine the original find material to see what scope there was for reinterpretation of the boats form.

Danish: Disse og flere spørgsmål foranledigede museets skibsrekonstruktør, Vibeke Bischoff, til at undersøge tegninger fra udgravningen af Gislingebåden og fotos af de originale skibsdele for at finde ud af, om der var råderum for en genfortolkning af bådens form.
English: These questions and more prompted the Museum’s ship reconstructor, Vibeke Bischoff, to re-examine the documentation of the original find material to see what scope there was for reinterpretation of the boat’s form.

Danish: Disse forholdstal er væsentlige for altid at kunne ramme den ønskede form, med et vilkårligt størrelse træ.
English: These ratios are essential in order to produce a boat with the required form, using a suitably sized log.

Danish: Disse rekonstruktioner kan ses på Vikingeskibsmuseet – hvis de altså ikke er ude at sejl togt!
English: These reconstructions can be seen at the Viking Ship Museum – when they’re not out on a voyage!

Danish: Disse rekonstruktioner kan ses på Vikingeskibsmuseet – hvis de altså ikke er ude at sejl togt!
English: These reconstructions can be seen at the Viking Ship Museum – when they’re not out sailing on voyages!

Danish: Disse regioner i det sydvestlige Østersøområde må have taget del i en politisk og militær udvikling eller en proces, der peger frem imod stadigt større politiske enheder.
English: These regions in the southern Baltic must have taken part in a political and military development or process that points forward towards increasingly larger political units.

Danish: Sådanne lasker er mindre end tre gange så lange som kølen er bred ved samlingen, ofte kortere.
English: These scarfs are less than three times as long as the keel is wide at the joint.

Danish: Sådanne mindre tønder har nok været lettere at pakke på et smalt langskib som Skuldelev 2.
English: These smaller barrels were probably easier to pack on a narrow longship like Skuldelev 2.

Danish: Disse kildegrupper skal naturligvis også inddrages i fortolkningen af en skriftlig kilde og vice versa.
English: These sources should of course also be used in the interpretation of a written source and vice versa.

Danish: Det er området mellem disse to egenskaber bådebyggeren skal finde den optimale form.
English: These spikes are also used in the frames (floor timbers and futtocks).

Danish: Disse spiger bruges også i spanterne (bundstokke og oplængere).
English: These spikes are also used in the frames (floor timbers and futtocks).

Danish: Disse forsøg – og den forudgående rekonstruktionsproces – trak på den samlede ekspertise af mange forskellige specialister, blandt andet sejlere, bådebyggere og arkæologer.
English: These tests – and the reconstruction process that went before it – drew on the combined expertise of many different specialists, including sailors, boatbuilders and archaeologists.

Danish: De lå normalt ved naturhavne på kysten eller i fjorde med forbindelse til havet.
English: These towns normally lay by natural harbours on the coast or on fjords connected to the sea.

Danish: Derfor var der travlhed i byerne året rundt.
English: These towns were therefore busy all year round.

Danish: Disse træk kan være blevet til tidligt i udviklingen og skal derfor med i en moderne teinæring.
English: These traits may have emerged early in the boat's development and must therefore also be included in a modern teinæring.

Danish: Disse træk kan være blevet til tidligt i udviklingen og skal derfor med i en moderne teinæring.
English: These traits may have emerged early in the boat’s development and must therefore also be included in a modern teinæring.

Danish: De to engelsksprogede forskningsserier er eksternt fagfællebedømt.
English: These two research series in English are externally peer-reviewed.

Danish: De to engelsksprogede forskningsserier er eksternt fagfællebedømt, siden 2009 under inddragelse af anonyme fagfæller.
English: These two research series in English are externally peer-reviewed; since 2009, anonymous peer reviewers have been consulted.

Danish: De usikre tider er formentlig baggrunden for, at bosættelsen ved Ladby flytter længere ind i landet, hvor den finder sin nuværende placering omkring 1 km fra fjorden, og at sognekirken ikke placeres i Ladby, men ved bunden af Kertinge Nor, i Kølstrup.
English: These uncertain times are probably the background for the moving of the settle-ment at Ladby further inland, to where its present situation still is, around 1 km from the fjord, and for the parish church not being situated in Ladby, but at the head of Kertinge Nor, in Kølstrup.

Danish: Disse er ikke mindst betinget af senere fremkomne skibsfund fra vikingetiden og andre vikingetidsfund, foruden vigtige nybearbejdninger af ældre fundkomplekser som skibsgravene Sutton Hoo i England, Oseberg og Borre i Norge samt af begreber som bådgravskikken og nyere analysemetoder.
English: These uncertainties have arisen not least because of ship finds from the Viking Age, and other Viking-Age finds, which have come to light later, as well as important new work on early find complexes such as the Sutton Hoo ship-grave in England, Oseberg and Borre in Norway, and also the development of new concepts such as boat-grave customs and recent methods of analysis.

Danish: Disse fartøjer – vikingeskibenes 750 år yngre arvtagere – er kommet til at spille en primær rolle i rekonstruktionen af vikingetidens sejl og rig, mens samtidens mange skibsmotiver på blandt andet billed- og runesten samt mønter med tiden er endt i en sekundær position.
English: These vessels – the 750 year younger successors of the Viking ships – have come to play a primary role in the reconstruction of Viking Age sails and rigging, whereas the many images of ships on picture and runic stones, and on coins, have with time come to occupy a secondary position.

Danish: Disse besøg har både ført til medarbejdernes personlig udvikling og udvikling af museologien på Polish Maritime Museum, især inden for marinarkæologi og konservering af genstande fundet i våde omgivelser.
English: These visits contributed to personal development of the employees as well as development of Polish maritime museology, especially within the fields of maritime archaeology and conservation of artefacts retrieved from a wet environment.

Danish: Det var de fundne skibsplanker fra Skuldelev, der lå i et særligt bad, hvor de blev hærdet med en plastikmasse, så de senere kunne modstå almindelig luft unden at gå til grunde.
English: These were the planks from the Skuldelev ships, lying in a special bath where they were being hardened with a plastic-like substance, so later on they could survive in ordinary air without breaking.

Danish: Dertil drak man mælk, saft af bær, valle eller urtete.
English: These would have been accompanied by milk, berry juice, whey or herbal infusions.

Danish: De nye vrag dukkede op af jorden, da Vikingeskibsmuseet for 10 år siden byggede museumsøen, hvor skibsværftet i dag ligger.
English: These “new” wrecks saw daylight 10 years ago, during the construction of the museum island, where the boat yard is today.

Danish: De har alle deres udspring i en årbog, som blev initieret af kong Alfred af Wessex omkring 890, og som blev videreført frem til 1154.
English: They all go back to a set of annals that was probably compiled at the court of king Alfred of Wessex in about 890 and the annals were continued until 1154.

Danish: Alle nåede frem til Dublin i bedste behold.
English: They all reached Dublin in the best of health.

Danish: De gav os også et museum, hvor skibene blev synlige, og værksteder, hvor man kom tæt på teknologien.
English: They also gave us a museum where the ships are visible and workshops where you can come close to the technology.

Danish: De skal desuden kunne komme hurtigt op på vagt uden at skulle pakke en masse udstyr sammen efter sig.
English: They also have to be able to go on watch quickly without having to clear up a lot of equipment.

Danish: De indførte også nye våbentyper.
English: They also introduced new weapon types.

Danish: De introducerede også brugen af bue og økse i den irske krigsførelse.
English: They also introduced the bow and axe to Irish warfare.

Danish: De er alle højt specialiserede og kan fortælle en historie, I ikke kan få andre steder.
English: They are all highly-specialised experts and can tell a story you won’t find other places.

Danish: Denne klinkes også fast med kobbernagler.
English: They are also riveted in place with copper nails.

Danish: De er helt fantastiske".
English: They are amazing".

Danish: De bygges som kopier af de pramme, som har været brugt til fiskeri omkring Fejø i starten af forrige århundrede .
English: They are being constructed as copies of the prams that were used for fishing around Fejø at the beginning of the last century.

Danish: Sagaer og skjaldekvad har karakter af, at være "en god historie" om heltemodige bedrifter eller en lovprisning af en særligt god konge.
English: They are characterised by being a "good story" about heroic deeds or praising a particularly good king.

Danish: De er fyldt med dramatik, handling og store ord, og samtidig kunne de også være skabt for at påvirke tilhørernes holdning.
English: They are full of drama, events and great words and, at the same time, they could also be created to suit the views of the audience.

Danish: Og det bliver smurt mod råd og anden djævelskab.
English: They are given a protective layer to prevent rot and other problems.
