Danish: Det kan lade sig gøre, fordi afstanden mellem spanterne, og dermed også mellem roernes tofter, er endnu kortere end i Hedebyskibet, nemlig kun ca. 70 cm.
English: This is possible because the distance between the ribs, and therefore between the oarsmen's thwarts, is even shorter than in the Hedeby ship - only about 70 cm.

Danish: Det kan lade sig gøre, fordi afstanden mellem spanterne, og dermed også mellem roernes tofter, er endnu kortere end i Hedebyskibet, nemlig kun ca. 70 cm.
English: This is possible because the distance between the ribs, and therefore between the oarsmen's thwarts, is even shorter than in the Hedeby ship – only about 70 cm.

Danish: Det er formodentlig rigtigt - i hvert fald viser en anden kilde, Vilhelm Erobrerens skibsliste, tydeligt hvor store kræfter der kunne sættes i bevægelse for at gennemføre en amfibisk invasion i slutningen af vikingetiden.
English: This is probably correct - at any rate another source, William the Conqueror's list of ships, shows clearly what tremendous forces could be set in motion in order to carry out an amphibian invasion at the end the Viking Age.

Danish: Det er formodentlig rigtigt - i hvert fald viser en anden kilde, Vilhelm Erobrerens skibsliste, tydeligt hvor store kræfter der kunne sættes i bevægelse for at gennemføre en amfibisk invasion i slutningen af vikingetiden.
English: This is probably correct – at any rate another source, William the Conqueror’s list of ships, shows clearly what tremendous forces could be set in motion in order to carry out an amphibian invasion at the end the Viking Age.

Danish: Dette er problematisk, da sejlene på vor tids rekonstruerede fartøjer langtfra stemmer visuelt overens med vikingetidens skibsmotiver.
English: This is problematic as the sails on present-day reconstructed vessels far from correspond visually with Viking Age images.

Danish: Navnets ældste belæg er som Odd juxta Ravenserre 1235-49 "forbjerget ved navn Odd nær ved Hrafn's sandbanke".
English: This is Ravenser in Yorkshire, first recorded as Odd juxta Ravenserre 1235-49 'the headland called Odd near Hrafn's gravel-bank'.

Danish: Det kaldes bestikregning.
English: This is referred to as dead reckoning.

Danish: Dette afspejler sig ikke mindst i Kølstrup sogn, hvor skibsgraven fra Ladby hører hjemme.
English: This is reflected not least in Kølstrup parish, where the Ladby ship-grave belongs.

Danish: Dette for at vagtskiftet kan forskydes over to døgn så man ikke får den samme vagt hele tiden.
English: This is so that the changing of the watch can be shifted over two days so that one does not have the same watch all the time.

Danish: Dette er bemærkelsesværdigt, kvadenes orientering mod Norge taget i betragtning.
English: This is striking when we take into consideration the orientation of the scaldic verses towards Norway.

Danish: Dette understøttes af, at biterne tilsyneladende er afkortede, selv om det ikke var muligt at fastslå hvor meget.
English: This is supported by the fact that the biti in the bow seem to have been shortened, although it wasn't possible to determine by how much.

Danish: Dette understøttes af, at biterne tilsyneladende er afkortede, selv om det ikke var muligt at fastslå hvor meget.
English: This is supported by the fact that the biti in the bow seem to have been shortened, although it wasn’t possible to determine by how much.

Danish: Dette støttes af skibets fundsted og af de gentagne reparationer udført i det østnorske og danske område.
English: This is supported by the ship's find-place and by the repeated repairs carried out in eastern Norway and Denmark.

Danish: Det er i så fald den første kirke i Norden.
English: This is the earliest church in the Nordic Countries.

Danish: Det er den første kongehyldning vi kender til.
English: This is the earliest known event of its kind.

Danish: Det er første gang Anna har prøvet at fremstille et håndvævet hørsejl - et spændende fremskridt for maritim eksperimentelarkæologi.
English: This is the first time she will produce a handwoven sail of flax, an exciting step forward in the field of maritime experimental archaeology.

Danish: Det er første gang, museet fremstiller et håndvævet sejl af hør.
English: This is the first time the Museum has produced a handwoven sail from flax.

Danish: Dette er første bind i et tobindsværk, der præsenterer de samlede resultater af arbejdet med Skuldelevfundet, en sejlspærring fra 1000-tallet i Roskilde Fjord med fem skibe af meget forskellig art og oprindelse.
English: This is the first volume of two which present the accumulated results of the work on the Skuldelev-find, a barrier from the 11th century in a channel in Roskilde Fjord, Denmark, containing five ships of varying type and provenance.

Danish: Det er grundlaget for traditionel bådebygning og for at bevare det maritime håndværk og kulturen omkring bådene.
English: This is the foundation for traditional boatbuilding and for preserving the maritime craftwork and culture surrounding the boats.

Danish: Dette skib er det sidste, der vises med andet end stiliserede folder i sejlet.
English: This is the last ship to be shown with other than stylised folds in the sail.

Danish: Det er det mest effektive.
English: This is the most effective methodology.

Danish: Endelig er båden nede i tykkelse.
English: This is the most effective methodology.

Danish: Det er den eneste omtale af tofter i skjaldekvadene, men de bekræfter den arkæologiske observation at langskibene, i modsætning til de ældre skibe fra Oseberg og Gokstad, havde faste tofter i form af tværbjælker til at sidde på.
English: This is the only reference to thwarts in the scaldic verses but it confirms the archaeological observation that the longships, in contrast to the older ships from Oseberg and Gokstad, had fixed thwarts in the form of cross-beams on which to sit.

Danish: Kun på den måde kan man genskabe en bådform, der vil kunne repræsentere en bådform fra 1600-tallet.
English: This is the only way in which we can recreate a boat form that could represent a boat form from the 17th century.

Danish: Derfor blev Skuldelev 3 også det første skib, som Vikingeskibsmuseet rekonstruerede.
English: This is the reason that Skuldelev 3 was also the first vessel the Viking Ship Museum reconstructed.

Danish: Skagens Rev ligger under vandoverfladen langt ud fra land, og ændrer sig hele tiden afhængigt af vind og strøm, så farvandet hele tiden skifter karakter.
English: This is the reason why throughout history, and especially during the age of sail, ships preferred to navigate through the Limfjord rather than embark on the dangerous voyage umme land - "around the land".

Danish: Sådan bliver Havhingstens nye hjemmeside
English: This is the setup of the new Sea Stallion homepage

Danish: Dette er den mindste.
English: This is the smallest.

Danish: Derfor bærer alle på Havhingsten redningsvest, og skibet er udstyret med redningsflåder, nødraketter og lanterner (røde og grønne lygter i toppen af masten.)
English: This is why all the men wear life jackets and the Sea Stallion is equipped with life rafts, distress flares and lights (green and red n the top of the mast.)

Danish: Derfor findes der i dag mønter fra Hedeby hvor den frankiske kejser er afbilledet og mønter med ulæselige bogstaver, der er efterligninger af arabisk skrift.
English: This is why coins from Danish Haithabu can be found bearing the image of the Frankish Emperor, or with illegible characters that are copies of Arabic originals.

Danish: Derfor fik han tilnavnet Erobreren.
English: This is why he was given the name The Conqueror.

Danish: Det er en samling, som kun sjældent ses i vikingetidigt skibsbyggeri, og dens specielle egenskab er, at den kan tåle træk.
English: This joint is only rarely seen in Viking shipbuilding and its special property is that it can withstand tension.

Danish: Sådanne skibsgryder er fundet ved skibsgravene Tune og Oseberg.
English: This kind of pot has been found in the ship graves, Tune and Oseberg.

Danish: Dette dragespænde fra begyndelsen af 900-tallet blev fundet sammen med et lignende eksemplar nær Limerick.
English: This kite-brooch, dating to the early tenth century, was found with another near the Limerick.

Danish: Denne store, tolvmands fyrretræsbåd er bygget i Eidi på Færøerne af Símun Johan Wolles til Vikingeskibsmuseets sejlads med skolebørn på Roskilde Fjord.
English: This large, twelve-man vessel was built of pine at Eidi on the Faeroe Islands by Simun Johan Wolles for the Viking Ship Museum and is used for taking schoolchildren sailing on Roskilde Fjord.

Danish: Sidstnævnte eksempel indikerer at mastetoppen kunne være forgyldt.
English: This last example indicates that the mast-top could be gilded.

Danish: Det medførte forandringer i byggeteknikker og mulighed for at anvende råmaterialer, der ikke tidligere kunne anvendes til skibsbygning.
English: This led to changes in building technology and provided the opportunity to utilise materials, which couldn’t previously be used in shipbuilding.

Danish: Dette løft giver skibet en større kølbugt end hidtil antaget.
English: This lift gives the ship a greater rocker than had previously been recognised.

Danish: Fartøjet har været en lille transportbåd til gods og mennesker.
English: This little working boat transported cargo and people.

Danish: Foruden denne fantastiske flettede sølvkæde med…
English: This long, braided silver chain with the two animal…

Danish: Denne lille, smukke jolle er bygget af egetræ.
English: This lovely little dinghy is built of oak.

Danish: Dette dejlige, gamle sejlskib, bygget her i Dublin for mange hundrede år siden, bør få intet mindre end dét."
English: This lovely old sailing craft, built here in Dublin many centuries ago, should receive nothing less than that."

Danish: De udkløvede bordplanker og spanter fulgte træets fibre, hvilket gjorde de færdige emner meget stærke, selvom dimensionerne blev minimeret på grund af ønsket om at holde den samlede vægt på skibet nede.
English: This made the finished pieces very strong, even though their dimensions were reduced due to a desire to keep the overall weight of the ship down.

Danish: Denne fortælleform gør det vanskeligt at lave en rekonstruktion i nutiden og som moderne læsere bliver vi afhængige af senere prosakilder der har gengivet digtene.
English: This makes modern reconstruction difficult, and we depend on later prose re-workings of the poems.

Danish: For første gang nogensinde åbner et museum i Kina til marts en større udstilling om vikinger.
English: This March, for the first time ever, a Chinese museum will open an exhibition about Vikings.

Danish: Det kan muligvis forklare, hvorfor der endnu ikke er fundet store lastskibe af vestslavisk oprindelse, trods spor af en omfattende søfarts- og handelsvirksomhed.
English: This may be a possible explanation as to why there has not yet been any finds of large cargo vessels of western Slavic origin despite the evidence of widespread maritime activity and exchange.

Danish: På grund af deres indskrænkede manøvreevne og deres vindafhængighed var de dog kun egnede som støtte for massive indsatser og ikke til hurtige, bevægelige angreb og tilbagetrækninger.
English: This may be a possible explanation as to why there has not yet been any finds of large cargo vessels of western Slavic origin despite the evidence of widespread maritime activity and exchange.

Danish: Det betyder, at nogle dyrearter dør, mens nye finder vej ind i det tidligere ferske vand.
English: This may mean extinction for some animal species, while others seek migrate into the previously fresh waters.

English: This means that not only do these vessels belong to the largest known size of cargo ships as defined in written sources, but they are in fact representative of the breadth and extent of that size class.

Danish: Det betyder, at Havhingsten ikke vil komme ud at sejle i de næste mange år.
English: This means that the Sea Stallion will not sail again for many years.

Danish: Det vil sige uden byggeskabeloner som vi kender dem i "moderne" træbådebygning, hvor bådebyggeren bygger efter tegninger, og dermed skabeloner, der er konstrueret på tegnebordet af en konstruktør.
English: This means that they should be built without using moulds as we normally do in 'modern' wooden boatbuilding, where we use drawings and thereafter, moulds, which are developed on the drawing board by a draughtsman.

Danish: Der mangler med andre ord 7.500.000 kroner.

Danish: Dette betød, at forskibet dykkede i stedet for at løfte sig ved fartøgning.

Danish: Det betød, at digtene ikke er præcise i forhold til den enkelte, skildrede begivenhed, men til gengæld ofte indeholder en mangfoldighed af forskellige omskrivninger af det enkelte begreb - og netop derigennem bliver til en værdifuld kilde til, for eksempel, datidens langskibe.
English: This meant that the poems do not give a precise description of the particular event described but often contain a multitude of different terms for the individual concepts - and that is the way in which they can be a valuable source of information, for example about contemporary longships.

Danish: Det betød, at digtene ikke er præcise i forhold til den enkelte, skildrede begivenhed, men til gengæld ofte indeholder en mangfoldighed af forskellige omskrivninger af det enkelte begreb – og netop derigennem bliver til en værdifuld kilde til, for eksempel, datidens langskibe.
English: This meant that the poems do not give a precise description of the particular event described but often contain a multitude of different terms for the individual concepts – and that is the way in which they can be a valuable source of information, for example about contemporary longships.

English: This method might also be used, if we instead of a rope use a withy (a twisted piece of birch- or oaktree).

Danish: Her til morgen var det tid til besætningsskifte og det store farvel.
English: This morning we changed the crew and said goodbye.

Danish: Det naturligt forekommende materiale blev samlet fra moser og smeltet, for at udvinde jernet.
English: This naturally occurring material would have been gathered from boggy areas and smelted in order to extract the iron.

Danish: Kæden skulle ikke nødvendigvis nå hele vejen fra anker til skib, men sørgede for at tynge den yderste ende af ankertovet ned til havbunden, når skibet lå på dybere vand.
English: This need not necessarily have extended all the way from anchor to ship, but in deeper water it ensured that the lower end of the anchor rope was drawn down onto the sea bed.

Danish: Den nye handelsvej fik snart stor betydning i Skandinavien og ved Middelhavet, og ikke mindst i det nye rige, der opstod langs flodruterne, Rusland.
English: This new continental by-pass quickly gained great importance in Scandinavia and the Mediterranean, and, of course, in the new realm which emerged along the waterways: Russia.

Danish: Den ny fortolkning af Skuldelev 3 kommer ikke kun til at reflektere de fremskridt museet har lavet inden for rekonstruktion af arkæologisk skibsfund, men også de praktiske erfaringer Roar Eges bådelaug har akkumuleret i løbet af deres mange år på vandet.
English: This new interpretation of Skuldelev 3 will reflect not just the Museum's advances in the reconstruction of archaeological ship-finds, but also the practical experiences Roar Ege's boat guild have accumulated during their many years of sailing.

Danish: Den ny fortolkning af Skuldelev 3 kommer derfor ikke kun til at reflektere de fremskridt museet har lavet inden for rekonstruktion af arkæologisk skibsfund, men også de praktiske erfaringer Roar Eges bådelaug har akkumuleret i løbet af deres mange år på vandet.
English: This new interpretation of Skuldelev 3 will reflect not just the Museum’s advances in the reconstruction of archaeological ship-finds, but also the practical experiences Roar Ege’s boat guild have accumulated during their many years of sailing.

Danish: Denne nordiske kolonisation betød en opblomstring af handelslivet og bykulturen.
English: This Nordic colonisation prompted a blossoming of trade and town culture.

Danish: Denne nordiske kolonisation betød en opblomstring af handelslivet og bykulturen.
English: This Nordic colonisation prompted an upturn in commercial life and in urban culture.

Danish: Egentlige venskabsbyer er der endnu ikke tale om endnu, men der er nok nogle som håber…
English: This not yet city-twinning, but hopes are probably high…

Danish: Denne lille båd blev bygget til Canadian Musum of Civilization, hvor den står udstillet.
English: This oak boat was built by two boatbuilders from the Viking Ship Museum for the Canadian Musum of Civilization, where it is exhibited.

Danish: Båden blev bygget på Vikingeskibsmuseet til Danish Canadian National Museum.
English: This oak boat was built by two boatbuilders from the Viking Ship Museum for the Danish Canadian National Museum.

Danish: Egetræsbåden er bygget af to bådebyggere fra Vikingeskibsmuseet på National Museum of Ireland, som en del af en særudstilling om vikingerne.

Danish: Egetræsbåden er bygget af to bådebyggere fra Vikingeskibsmuseet på Museé de la Civilisation i Québec, Canada, som en del af en særudstilling om vikingerne.
English: This oak boat was built by two boatbuilders from the Viking Ship Museum for the Museé de la Civilisation in Québec, Canada, as part of a special exhibition about the Vikings.

Danish: Egetræsbåden er bygget af to bådebyggere fra Vikingeskibsmuseet på National Museum of Ireland, som en del af en særudstilling om vikingerne.
English: This oak boat was built by two boatbuilders from the Viking Ship Museum for the National Museum of Ireland as part of the special exhibition about the Vikings.

Danish: Joanna er bygget af to bådebyggere fra Vikingeskibsmuseet på verdensudstillingen "Expo 98" i Lissabon, Portugal som demonstration af vikingetidens skibsbyggeri.
English: This oak boat was built by two boatbuilders from the Viking Ship Museum for the world exhibition, "Expo 98« in Lisbon to show how the Vikings built their vessels.

Danish: Det giver dem en enestående chance for at fordybe sig i deres håndværk.
English: This offers them a unique opportunity to immerse themselves in their craft.

Danish: Denne forundersøgelse fulgtes i 2004 op med uddybende undersøgelser i de nu tørlagte områder.
English: This pilot study was followed up in 2004 with further studies in the areas that had now been drained.

Danish: Denne planke er specielt udvalgt, fordi den havde den samme facon som stævnen skulle have, når den var færdig.
English: This plank has been specially selected, because it had the same shape that the finished stem should have.

Danish: Herefter hugges ydersiden så formen bliver en forlængelse af bordene hvor de løber ind. Derefter udhules stævnen så bordene kan samles til stævnen med klinknagler.
English: This practice is what creates the sleek lines that we typically associate with Viking ships and its presence on a humble working boat like the Gislinge Boat, underlines how central an element of the boatbuilding tradition this was.

Danish: Dette blev løst efter vi begyndte at sejle med birketræsvidjer som rortov/vidjer.
English: This problem was solved after we began to use birch withies to attach the rudder.

Danish: Ved denne proces opløses limstofferne i træet, så det bliver muligt at vride bordplankerne så de ligger næsten vandrette midt i båden, mod næsten lodrette hen imod stævnene.
English: This process dissolves the adhesives in the wood so that it is possible to twist the strakes so that they are horizontal in the middle of the boat, but almost vertical towards the stems.

Danish: Digitaliseringsprocessen betød en subjektiv udvælgelse af væsentlige informationer.
English: This process involved a subjective selection of essential information.

Danish: Med udgangspunkt i de seneste års forundersøgelser med gravemaskine i Roskilde Fjord, Storstrømmen og Køge Havn, formidles en evalueringen af metoden, dens potentiale og dens ulemper, såvel rent praktisk som statistisk og analytisk.
English: This project present the approaches and experiences gained during the sampling of submerged prehistoric sites in Roskilde Fjord, Storstrømmen (the strait between the islands of Falster and Zealand) and Køge Harbour.

Danish: Bogen udforsker ressourcemæssige, organisatoriske og operationelle aspekter i forbindelse med bygning og brug af skibe anvendt til krigsførelse i det 11. århundredes Danmark.
English: This publication deals with the organisational, resource-related and operational aspects of the building and use of ships for warfare in 11th-century Denmark.

Danish: Bogen beskriver forsøgsrejserne med Skuldelev 2-rekonstruktionen Havhingsten fra Glendalough fra Roskilde til Dublin i 2007 og fra Dublin tilbage til Roskilde i 2008.
English: This publication project describes the trial voyages from Roskilde to Dublin in 2007 and back again in 2008 with the Skuldelev 2 reconstruction, Sea Stallion from Glendalough.

Danish: Genbruget skyldes måske, at planken er af ask, som kan have været betragtet som et særligt godt materiale til netop dette formål.
English: This re-use could have been due to the fact that the plank is of ash, and this was perhaps seen as particularly good material for just this purpose.

Danish: Med endnu en rekonstruktion gives et nyt bud på, hvordan båden så ud i vikingetiden.
English: This reconstruction will provide another perception of how the boat may have looked in the Viking Age.

Danish: Men denne rekonstruktion bliver ikke en kopi af Roar Ege.
English: This reconstruction won’t, however, be an exact copy of Roar Ege.

Danish: Derved blev risikoen for at ankeret utilsigtet blev trukket løst reduceret.
English: This reduced the risk of the anchor being torn loose unintentionally.

Danish: Det kræver så lige, at man laver nogle skridtøvelser først for at finde den gennemsnitlige skridtlængde ved (let) løb.
English: This requires that you carry out some trials first to find out your average stride length when (gently) running.

Danish: Forskningen har ført til større indsigt i Osebergskibets oprindelige skrogform og har skabt mere viden om sejlegenskaberne på det tidligst kendte sejlførende skib i Norden.
English: This research has led to a better insight into the original hull form of the Oseberg ship, and has provided more knowledge of the sailing capabilities of the earliest known Nordic sailing ship.

Danish: Dette forårsager, at skibssiden står op mod 7cm tættere til bundstokken, end den oprindelig har gjort.
English: This resulted in the planks appearing up to 7 cm closer to the floor timbers than they originally were.

Danish: Dette resulterer altså i to bord per træ, i modsætning til spejlkløvning, hvor vi kan få op til 32 bord af én stamme.
English: This results in just two planks per tree, in contrast to radial cleaving, where you can get up to 32 planks from the one tree.

Danish: Der blev herved fundet enkelte afslag og enkelte stykker ildskørnet flint.
English: This revealed a few fragments and pieces of flint made brittle by fire.

Danish: Denne reviderede model – Gislinge III – skal nu bygges i fuld skala.
English: This revised model – Gislinge III – will now be built in full-scale.

Danish: Enkelte revner i plankerne repareredes med påsyede lister ligesom i originalen.
English: This saturated thread was laid in between plank in the overlaps.

Danish: Dette skar volder til stadighed problemer.
English: This scarf is continuously causing trouble.

Danish: Hvis din vare er sendt som et Maxi A-brev, vil denne mulighed ikke være til rådighed.
English: This service is not available if your order is sent as a large-letter.

Danish: Denne service gælder kun inden for Danmarks grænser, og når forsendelsen sendes som pakke.
English: This service is only available within Denmark's borders and for orders dispatched as parcels.

Danish: Denne service gælder kun inden for Danmarks grænser, og når forsendelsen sendes som pakke.
English: This service is only available within Denmark’s borders and for orders dispatched as parcels.

Danish: Denne skyggekurve er forskellig på forskellig breddegrad og på forskellige årstider, så til navigationsbrug skal man have en række kurver.
English: This shadow curve is different at different latitudes and at different times of the year, so in order to use it for navigation, a series of curves is necessary.

Danish: Denne udformning findes med få undtagelser på såvel bronzer som helleristninger fra bronzealderens slutperiode V (700-500 f.Kr.), mens styreårer normalt ikke er gengivet her.
English: This shape is found with few exceptions on both bronze objects and rock carvings from the final period of the Bronze Age (Period V, 700-500 BC), while steering oars are not normally represented.

Danish: Skibet er nemlig det andet forsøg på at bygge en rekonstruktion af Osebergskibet, som i 1904 blev fundet i en grav ved Tønsberg i Norge.
English: This ship is the second attempt at building a reconstruction of the Oseberg Ship, which was found in a burial mound at Tønsberg in Norway, in 1904.

Danish: Dette skib, som normalt har mange forskellige specialopgaver, er naturligvis meget dyrt at bruge.
English: This ship normally services oil rigs, so it's obviously very expensive to use.

Danish: Det er blevet bygget efter 1025, og har haft en længde på omkring 36 m - det længste, arkæologiske kendte vikingeskib, der hidtil kendes.
English: This ship was built after AD 1025 and it had a length of around 36 m - the longest Viking ship so far discovered archaeologically.

Danish: Det er blevet bygget efter 1025, og har haft en længde på omkring 36 m – det længste, arkæologiske kendte vikingeskib, der hidtil kendes.
English: This ship was built after AD 1025 and it had a length of around 36 m – the longest Viking ship so far discovered archaeologically.

Danish: Det er det beste skip som har vært bygd i Norge og det som har kostet mest.
English: This ship was the best and most costly ship ever made in Norway.

Danish: Skibet har, ligesom fundets øvrige, ført mast og sejl, og skrogformen har været velegnet til sejlads på åbent hav.
English: This ship, like the others of the find, would have carried mast and sail, and the shape of the hull is well suited to navigation on the open sea.

Danish: Denne korte film viser processen og demonstrerer, hvordan opvarmning over åben ild kan skabe ekstreme vinkler, helt op til 90 grader.
English: This short film explains the process, demonstrating how extreme angles of up to 90 degrees can be made by steaming the planks over open fire

Danish: Det skulle gøre turen til Gotland meget lettere end turen hjem til Roskilde.
English: This should make the trip to Gotland much easier than the return trip home to Roskilde.

Danish: Dette skal formodentlig også ses som udtryk for et særligt omhyggeligt byggeri, hvor man ved at anvende flere, mindre nagler, har spredt belastningerne i skibet bedre.
English: This should probably also be perceived as an expression of the ship's particularly careful construction, where the use of a greater number of smaller rivets made it possible to disperse the loading on the ship more effectively.

Danish: Det viser, at der er flere løsninger, når ikke-fundne dele af et originalskib skal rekonstrueres.
English: This shows that several solutions are possible when reconstructing the parts missing from an original ship.

Danish: Fremtidige undersøgelser af vragets skrogdele (skibet er ikke blevet rekonstrueret) vil kunne afdække vigtige aspekter omkring denne type forlængede fartøjer.
English: This singular ship type may have resulted from the lengthening of existing hulls; the verlangers are historically present at the time when the first flutes emerged.

Danish: De gør arbejdsprocessen hurtigere og den efterfølgende tolkning bringes ud på felten og mere nær det egentlige fund.
English: This speeds up the work process and the interpretation that follows can take place on site and closer to the actual find.

Danish: Denne gran er jævntvokset og tætvokset og er udvalgt i skoven i næsten samme dimension som det færdige emne.
English: This spruce has grown straight and slow, and has been selected in the forest in almost the same dimensions as the finished part.

Danish: Denne stævnform kendes også fra vestnorske og danske rids og bådmodeller, og den sættes i forbindelse med skibstypenavnet knörr, knar, der kendes fra vikingetid og middelalder.
English: This stem shape is also known from west Norwegian and Danish sketches and boat-models and it is linked with the ship-term knörr, knar, which is recorded from the Viking Age and the medieval period.

Danish: Denne sten blev rejst for Asser Saxe, som ejede skib med Arne, og det er uklart om det er et handelsmæssigt, snarere end et militært skibsfællesskab, de to deler.
English: This stone was raised to Asser Saxe, who owned a ship together with Arne, and it is not clear whether it was a mercantile or a military ship-partnership that they shared.

Danish: Sommerens sejladser føjer endnu et kapitel til vores viden om langskibenes rejsehastighed og sødygtighed, der gør det muligt at forstå forudsætningerne for vikingetidens ekspansion.
English: This summer's voyage adds yet another chapter to our knowledge about the travel speed and seaworthiness of longships, making it possible for us to understand the practicalities of Viking Age expansion.

Danish: Denne sommer vil han eksperimentere med at smede værktøj, samt nagler af myremalm til byggeriet af Gislingebåden.
English: This summer, he will experiment with forging tools and rivets of bog iron for the construction of the Gislinge Boat.

Danish: Bådebyggerne arbejder denne sommer på at bygge en mindre gårdbåd fra 1100-tallet kaldet Gislingebåden.
English: This summer, the boatbuilders are working on the construction of the Gislinge Boat - a small working boat from the 12th century.

Danish: Til sommer sejler Havhingsten hjem til Roskilde.
English: This summer, the Sea Stallion is sailing home to Roskilde.

Danish: Sommerens sejladser føjer endnu et kapitel til vores viden om langskibenes rejsehastighed og sødygtighed, der gør det muligt at forstå forudsætningerne for vikingetidens ekspansion.
English: This summer’s voyage adds yet another chapter to our knowledge about the travel speed and seaworthiness of longships, making it possible for us to understand the practicalities of Viking Age expansion.

Danish: Denne teknik var brugt på store og små både i vikingetiden og flere hundrede år før vikingetiden.
English: This technique was used on both small and large boats during the Viking Age and for several hundred years before the Viking Age.

Danish: Temaet giver et bud på nogen af de kulturhistoriske og naturmæssige oplevelser Danmark og især Roskilde-egnen tilbyder.
English: This theme includes some of the cultural-historical and natural experiences available in Denmark and especially in Roskilde.

Danish: Denne gang bliver båden spændt ud med tværpinde alene - uden brug af vold.
English: This time the boat is expanded using bracers, and without excessive force.

Danish: Denne gang går det østpå til det Baltiske Hav og den store svenske ø Gotland.
English: This time the destination is east to the large Swedish island of Gotland in the Baltic Sea.

Danish: Denne gang med en skipper som året internationale sejler i Irland.
English: This time with a Skipper who is Ireland's International Sailor of the Year.

Danish: Denne gang med en skipper som året internationale sejler i Irland.
English: This time with a Skipper who is Ireland’s International Sailor of the Year.

Danish: Rundvisningen forgår delvis inde og delvist udenfor.
English: This tour takes place both in and out of doors.

Danish: Tårnet er muligvis bygget ovenpå en tidligere vikingetidsbefæstning, og kan indeholde elementer af denne ældre konstruktion.
English: This tower may be built on the site of an earlier Viking stronghold and may incorporate parts of the earlier structure.

Danish: Det er en gammel oplæringsmetode på Færøerne hvor indlæring og kontrol foregår løbende.
English: This traditional Faeroese boat building method provides simultaneous training and supervision.

Danish: Typen var sjælden i gamle dage, men enkelte både af denne størrelse blev brugt til fragt af varer og transport af personer.
English: This type of boat was rare in olden days, but a few boats of this size were used for transporting goods and people.

Danish: Denne type isbåde blev tidligere anvendt ved krydsning af islagte, usikre farvande.
English: This type of ice boat was used previously to cross iced-over, unsafe waters.

Danish: Sværdtypen er ret ualmindelig i irsk sammenhæng.
English: This type of sword is relatively unusual in an Irish context.

Danish: Bogen behandler de arkæologiske vidnesbyrd om store lastskibe i danske farvande mellem 1000 og 1250 og bruger dem som vigtige indikatorer for professionel søhandel i det middelalderlige Danmark, før hanseatiske købmænd begyndte at dominere søhandelen.
English: This volume presents the archaeological evidence of large cargo ships in Danish waters between 1000 and 1250 and asserts that they are an important element, and indicator, of specialised merchant seafaring in medieval Denmark prior to the Hanseatic Period.

Danish: Muren er det eneste tilbageværende vidnesbyrd fra det tidligmiddelalderlige kloster ved Bangor.
English: This wall is the only remaining evidence for the early Medieval monastery at Bangor.

Danish: Skjalden var ofte medlem af en konges eller høvdings hird.
English: This was a man often close to the king or chief.

Danish: Det har været en meget rig og fornem skibsbegravelse, men graven er plyndret allerede i vikingetiden.
English: This was a very rich and remarkable grave but it had already been looted in the Viking Age.

Danish: Det var en eliteenhed i den byzantinske hær, som bestod af vikinger, englændere og normannere.
English: This was an elite unit in the Byzantine army, consisting of Vikings, Englishmen and Normans.

Danish: Det var bestemt en operation som kaldte store drenges følelser og drømme frem om legetøj for millioner.
English: This was an operation that really called up boyhood feelings and dreams of toys worth millions!

Danish: Dette var indridset ved siden af en grov skitse af en savlende hund.
English: This was carved alongside a rough drawing of a slavering dog.

Danish: Det blev bekræftet af årringsdateringen (dendrokronologi), der tyder på, at båden blev bygget omkring 1130.
English: This was confirmed by dendrochronology (tree-ring dating), which suggested the boat was built around the year 1130.

Danish: Det blev gjort på den rigtige måde med kiler og økser.
English: This was done in the proper fashion, using wedges and axes.

Danish: Det skete med de samme metoder som ved udgravningen af Skuldelev-skibene, dvs. ved at slå en spunsvæg ned omkring vraget og pumpe området frit for vand.
English: This was done using the same methods as in the excavation of the Skuldelev ships, i.e. ramming a coffer dam around the wreck and empty the area of water.

Danish: Det skete med en helt enkel teknologi: Hver dag ringede skipper Carsten Hvid til museet og meddelte skibets aktuelle position og rute, som derefter blev lagt ind på et kort på hjemmesiden.
English: This was done with very simple technology: Every day skipper Carsten Hvid called the museum providing current data on the ship’s position and bearings, which were subsequently plotted onto a map on the homepage.

Danish: Dette kan næppe kaldes en befæstning, men må snarere betegnes som en afgrænsning af byområdet, indenfor hvilken man skulle overholde byens regler og pligter.
English: This was hardly a fortification but rather a demarcation of the urban area, within which the town's rules and duties had to be observed.

Danish: Dette skyldes først og fremmest vikingernes aktiviteter i landet, og deres åbning af handelsruterne mod øst.
English: This was largely due to Viking activity in the country, and their opening of trade routes to the east.

Danish: Det kan måske være årsagen til, at Vilhelm Erobreren ved Edwards død i 1066 påstod, at han var blevet lovet den engelske trone af Edward.
English: This was perhaps the reason that William the Conqueror, on Edward's death in AD 1066, maintained that he had been promised the English throne by Edward.

Danish: Året har sikkert været 1967 eller 68.
English: This was probably in 1967 or '68.

Danish: Det blev gentaget flere gange, så vi har sikre på, at den var vandtæt.
English: This was repeated several times to make sure it waas waterproof.

Danish: Så kort og klart var budskabet til besætningen om bord på Havhingsten, da 25 gaster torsdag aften besøgte DMI – Danmarks Meteorologiske Institut.
English: This was the brief and clear message to the crew of the Sea Stallion, when 25 shipmates Thursday night visited DMI - Denmark’s Meteorological Institute.

Danish: Det er første gang Mary McAleese besøger Danmark som præsident, men hun oplevede Havhingsten i Dublin, da skibet i 10 måneder i 2007 - 2008 var udstillet på det irske nationalmuseum Collins Barrack i Dublin.
English: This was the first time Mary McAleese visited Denmark as president, but she saw the Sea Stallion in Dublin when the ship was exhibited at the Irish National Museum Collins Barracks in Dublin for 10 months from 2007 to 2008.

Danish: Det er første gang Mary McAleese besøger Danmark som præsident, men hun oplevede Havhingsten i Dublin, da skibet i 10 måneder i 2007 – 2008 var udstillet på det irske nationalmuseum Collins Barrack i Dublin.
English: This was the first time Mary McAleese visited Denmark as president, but she saw the Sea Stallion in Dublin when the ship was exhibited at the Irish National Museum Collins Barracks in Dublin for 10 months from 2007 to 2008.

Danish: Weekendens to sejladser var sidste sejlads og samling for besætningen om bord på Havhingsten fra Glendalough inden skib og besætningen søndag den 1. juli 2007 sætter kurs mod Dublin.
English: This was the last time the crew was gathered to sail before the Sea Stallion Sunday the 1st of July 2007 embarks on the sail for Dublin.

Danish: Dette år undersøgte Nicolay Nicolaysen, der senere blev Norges første statsansatte antikvar, en delvist bortgravet gravhøj ved Borre i Vestfold i Norge.
English: This was the year in which Nicolay Nicolaysen, who later became Norway's first state employed antiquarian, investigated a partially destroyed burial mound at Borre in Vestfold, Norway.

Danish: Denne arbejdsform fortæller os noget om vikingetiden i almindelighed og det originale skib i særdeleshed.
English: This way of working tells us something about the Viking Age in general and the original ship in particular.

Danish: I denne uge begynder marinarkæologer fra Vikingeskibsmuseet det delikate arbejde med at bjærge skibsdele fra et nyfundet middelalderskib, der gennem de seneste tre uger er blevet udgravet i farvandet ud for Masnedø i Storstrømmen.
English: This week, maritime archaeologists from the Viking Ship Museum are undertaking the delicate work of raising the remains of the newly discovered medieval ship, which for the past three weeks, has been excavated in the waters off Masnedø in Storstrømmen (the strait between the islands of Falster and Sjælland).

Danish: I denne uge lægges Havhingsten tilbage i Liffey.
English: This week, the Sea Stallion will be lowered back into the Liffey.

Danish: På den måde var det muligt at følge skibets færd på nærmeste hold.
English: This will allow you to keep close track of the ship.

Danish: Dette bliver en koncert, man ikke skal gå glip af.
English: This will be a concert not to be missed!

Danish: Dette bliver en aften, man ikke skal gå glip af!
English: This will be an evening not to be missed!

Danish: Det bliver fejret med sejladser for publikum.
English: This will be celebrated with sailings for the public.

Danish: Det er første gang Mary McAleese besøger Danmark siden hun i 1997 blev valgt til præsident.
English: This will be the first time Mary McAleese visits Denmark since she was elected president in 1997.

Danish: Det er første gang Vikingeskibsmuseet bygger endnu en rekonstruktion af det samme skibsfund, og første gang at hele byggeprocessen - fra skrog til rig og sejl - kan opleves i et og samme museumsbesøg.
English: This will be the first time that the Viking Ship Museum builds a second reconstruction of the same ship find, and the first time that the entire reconstruction process - from hull to rigging and sails - can be experienced in the same museum visit.

Danish: Det er første gang Vikingeskibsmuseet bygger endnu en rekonstruktion af det samme skibsfund, og første gang at hele byggeprocessen – fra skrog til rig og sejl – kan opleves i et og samme museumsbesøg.
English: This will be the first time that the Viking Ship Museum builds a second reconstruction of the same ship find, and the first time that the entire reconstruction process - from hull to rigging and sails - can be experienced in the same museum visit.

Danish: Der er tale om den ægte vare, når kursisterne går om bord på vikingeskibet Roar Ege for at lære om råsejl, halstov, boline og alle de andre begreber, der knytter sig til vikingeskibet.
English: This will be the real deal when the students go aboard the Viking ship Roar Ege to learn about square sails, tack, bowlines and all the other concepts associated with the Viking ship.

Danish: Den bruges til at skære det endelige egetræsbord efter.
English: This will be used when cutting out the oak planks.

Danish: Alt skal dokumenteres, så Vikingeskibsmuseet kan få et bedre indblik i hvordan skibet sejles og hvilke arvejdsopgaver der er nødvendige om bord.
English: This will give the Viking Ship Museum a greater insight into how the ship is sailed.

Danish: På baggrund heraf kendes den egentlige ”pris” for en vending.
English: This will tell us what the tacking manoeuvre "cost".

Danish: Denne trækirke har sikkert været udskiftet gentagne gange.
English: This wooden church was presumably rebuilt several times.

Danish: Dette ord indgår i ca. 100 stednavne langs de danske kyster, ofte på steder hvor krigsskibe kunne ligge oplagt udenfor synsvidde af forbisejlende skibe.
English: This word forms part of about 100 place-names around the coast of Denmark, often assigned to places where longships could be laid up out of sight of passing ships.

Danish: Ordet stammer fra Urnæs kirke i Norge, der er kendt for sine træskærerarbejder i samme stil.
English: This word originates from the church at urnæs, Norway shich is known for its woodcarvings.

Danish: Dette arbejde blev i 1951-1982 fulgt op af hans landsmand Bertil Sandahls studier af den maritime sprogskat der fandtes i de middelalderlige engelske kilder og som viste sig at være kraftigt påvirkede af skandinavisk sprog.
English: This work was followed up between 1951 and 1982 by his compatriot Bertil Sandahl's studies of the heavily Scandinavian influenced maritime linguistic treasures in medieval English sources.

Danish: Der er også fundet spor efter jernforarbejdning på øen, hvilket har været nødvendigt for at fremstille og vedligeholde redskaber og våben.
English: This would have been essential for the maintenance and replacement of tools and weapons.

Danish: Dette synes dog ofte snarere at betegne et fragtskib, eller måske blot et havgående skib, og næppe et langskib i vores forstand.
English: This would rather, however, seem to denote a cargo ship, or perhaps just a sea-going ship, hardly a longship in our sense of the word.

Danish: Her er der sandsynligvis tale om det danske orlogsskib ”Lindormen”, som sank i oktober 1644 under et søslag med en svensk-hollandsk flåde.
English: This wreck is probably the Danish warship Lindormen, which sank in October 1644 during a naval battle against a combined Swedish-Dutch fleet.

Danish: I år bliver lørdag den 31. oktober til gengæld helt speciel.
English: This year however, 31 October will be very special.

Danish: I år går rejsen til Gotland og knapt 800 sømil og mange oplevelser venter forude.
English: This year, the destination is Gotland and nearly 800 nautical miles and many adventures await.

Danish: Målet er Gotland og knapt 800 sømil og mange oplevelser venter forude.
English: This year, the destination is Gotland and nearly 800 nautical miles and many adventures await.

Danish: Dette års projekt skal selvfølgelig fortsætte som Open Source-bådebygning, hvor hver fase af bygningsprocessen bliver lagt ud online via projektets hjemmeside, Facebook og Instagram.
English: This year’s project will of course also continue with open source boatbuilding, where each step of the boatbuilding process is shared online via the project website, Facebook and Instagram.

English: Thor hallow [these] runes”

English: Thor's hammer: 100,- DDK

English: Thorberg says, “I will tell you, king, who did it.

English: Thoroughbred of the Sea 2006 - 2008

Danish: Fuldblod på havet: Havhingsten fra Glendalough
English: Thoroughbred of the Sea: The Sea Stallion from Glendalough

Danish: De bøger, der er markeret som udsolgt, kan dog stadig lånes på biblioteker eller købes hos antikvarboghandlere.
English: Those books which are out of print may still be obtained from libraries or antiquarian bookshops.

Danish: Der er også sat navne på de gaster, som står på venteliste - en 'reservebænk' med dygtige sejlere, som kan træde til ved sygdom og lignende.
English: Those who will be on the ‘reserves bench' - good sailors who can step in in case of sickness etc. were also chosen.

English: Though not stating the rules of the games the sagas indicate that the ability to play, for example, chess was part of a noble education.

Danish: Disse fund belyser ændringen i materialer og teknikker indenfor den ældre jernalders bådebyggeri fra syede lindetræsbåde fremdrevet ved padling til klinkede roskibe, primært i eg og fyr.
English: Though the method of using total station recording is not new, a new concept was developed and implemented and subsequently used for the field recording during the B&W excavations.

Danish: Selvom formålet var at udgrave vikingeskibet, gav spunsvæggen også mulighed for at undersøge rester efter skibsbroer og de lag af affald og tabte genstande, der igennem vikingetiden havde samlet sig i bunden af havnen.
English: Though the purpose of the investigation was to excavate the Viking ship the coffer dam provided an opportunity to investigate the remains of jetties and the depositional layers accumulated on the seabed during the Viking Age.

Danish: Mange tusind mennesker fulgte Havhingstens indsejling på River Liffey.
English: Thousand of people followed the Sea Stallion on the River Liffey.

Danish: Tusindvis a jernsøm var blevet slået i forhudningen, for yderligere at beskytte skroget, sandsynligvis mod angreb fra pæleorm.
English: Thousands of iron nails had been driven into this pine sheathing to protect the hull, presumably against ship-worms.

Danish: Tusindvis af marine organismer spredes årligt med moderne skibstransport, og studier har dokumenteret transport i 'ballast-vand' eller på skibssiderne af store stål-skibe.
English: Thousands of marine organisms are spread by modern ship transport every year, and studies have documented transportation in bilge water or on the hulls of big steel ships.

Danish: Tusindvis af mennesker var forbi skibet i de 10 måneder den opholdt sig i Irlands hovedstad.
English: Thousands of people visited the ship during the 10 months it spent in Ireland's capital city.

Danish: Tusindvis af tilskuere ser til fra fyldte broer
English: Thousands of spectators look on from the packed bridges

Danish: Tusindvis af mennesker overværede det gribende øjeblik, da Havhingstens 65 mand store besætning tog afsked med famile og venner inden den 7 uger lang rejse mod Dublin.
English: Thousands watched the touching moment when the Sea Stallion's crew of 65 men and women waved goodbye to family and friends before the 7 week long voyage to Dublin.

Danish: Blot tre dag tilbage indtil søsætning på lørdag.
English: Three days to go to the launch on Saturday.

English: Three days to go to the launch on Saturday.

English: Three decades later the ship ended up on the bottom of Roskilde Fjord.

Danish: I Gokstadskibet blev der fundet tre småbåde.
English: Three small boats were found in the Gokstad ship.

Danish: Tre udtjente skibe slæbes ud til det smalleste sted ud for landsbyen Skuldelev.
English: Three worn-out ships are towed out to the narrowest point, just outside the village of Skuldelev.

Danish: Jubilæumsudstillingen beretter om 50 år med vikingernes skibe gennem bl. a. fotos og film fra Vikingeskibsmuseets omfattende arkiv.
English: Through photos and film from the museum's extensive archive the anniversary exhibition tells the story of 50 years working with the Viking Ships.

Danish: Gennem en vedkommende og engagerende forskning, formidling og oplysningsvirksomhed bidrager museet til at fremme en fælles historiebevidsthed og kulturforståelse, som også har relevans for udenlandske gæster.
English: Through relevant and committed research and communication, the museum contributes to promoting a common historical consciousness and cultural perception, which is also relevant for foreign guests.

Danish: Op gennem 1960'erne og -70'erne var det hovedsageligt aptering af glasfiberbåde, der fyldte ordrebogen.
English: Through the 1960's and 70's, it was mainly glass fibre boats which filled the order book.

Danish: Gennem Limfjorden
English: Through the Limfjord

English: Through the streets of Dublin

Danish: Festivalen sætter i april 2011 fokus på Grønland gennem udstillinger, koncerter, teater, dans, foredrag og oplevelser.
English: Throughout April 2011, the festival will focus on Greenland through exhibitions, concerts, theatre, dance, lectures and experiences.

Danish: Igennem alle tider har myter og sagn været genstand for fortælling gennem billeder og skulpturer.
English: Throughout history, myths and legends have been told and retold through pictures and sculptures.

Danish: Igennem hele operationen var der besætningsmedlemmer omkring skibet og i det døgn operationen stod på, var der en magisk stemning.
English: Throughout the entire operation there were crew members surrounding the ship and the twenty-four hours it lasted was magical.

Danish: Rundt omkring på skibet sad besætningen i små grupper og snakkede - og lærte hinanden at kende.
English: Throughout the ship the crew sat in smaller groups and chatted - getting to know each other.

Danish: Gennem hele sommeren sætter vi på skift fokus på de mange forskellige maritime håndværk, vikingernes liv og særlige vikinge-sysler.
English: Throughout the summer the Viking Ship Museum focus on the many different maritime crafts and other special vikinge activities.

Danish: Vikingeskibsmuseets håndværkere inviterer på skift besøgende til at fordybe sig i fortidens spændende håndværk.
English: Throughout the summer we will focus on the different craftwork that surrounds the nordic boat and other special vik…

Danish: Hele sommeren sætter vi på skift særligt fokus på de forskellige håndværk, der omgiver den nordiske båd.
English: Throughout the summer we will focus on the different craftwork that surrounds the nordic boat.

Danish: Hele sommeren sætter vi p…
English: Throughout the summer we will…

Danish: Hele sommeren sætter…
English: Throughout the summer we…

Danish: Hele sommeren sæt…
English: Throughout the su…

Danish: Og det har gennem årene vist sig at være helt uproblematisk, selv om det er mest sandsynligt, at der ikke har været kvindelige besætningsmedlemmer på krigsskibene i vikingetid.
English: Throughout the yeas the sails have showed that having women on board isn't causing any problems, even though it is unlikely that women were on board the warships a thousand years ago.

Danish: Smid en pind eller lignende overbord ved det forreste og beregn farten ud fra den tid, det tager pinden at nå til det agterste.
English: Throw a stick or similar over board at the front place and calculate your speed on the basis of the time it takes the stick etc. to reach the place at the stern.

Danish: tor.
English: Thu

Danish: Torsdag d. 24/8: Pernille Stockfleth og Laura Kamis Wrang kl. 11.00, 13.00 og 15.00
English: Thursday 24/8: Pernille Stockfleth and Laura Kamis Wrang, 11:00, 13:00 and 15:00

Danish: Torsdag den 2. august, 2007
English: Thursday, August 2nd, 2007

Danish: Torsdag den 9. august, 2007
English: Thursday, August 9th, 2007

Danish: Derfor kunne vi på begge etaper sætte det stærkest mulige hold.
English: Thus we have been able to choose the strongest of crew for both stages.

Danish: Derfor fokuserer undersøgelsen på betydningen af og vidnesbyrdene om store lastskibe i danske farvande før 1250 (kapitel 4).
English: Thus, the study continues to concentrate on the significance of, and evidence for, large cargo vessels in Danish waters before 1250 (Chapter 4).

Danish: tofter der bevæger sig ind og ud fra skibssiden, og diagonalt i forhold til hinanden
English: Thwarts move in from and out to the ship side, and diagonally in relation to each other

Danish: Billet købt om lørdagen giver gratis adgang til museet.
English: Tickets bought Saturday give free access to the Museum.

Danish: Billetter kan bestilles i museets booking, hverdage 10.00 til 15.00 på telefon +45 46 300 253 eller på email: booking(at)vikingeskibsmuseet.dk.
English: Tickets can be booked through the museum’s booking office on weekdays, 10:00 to 15:00 by telephone +45 46 300 253 or by e-mail: booking(at)vikingeskibsmuseet.dk.

Danish: Tilmelding kan ske hos museets booking, hverdage 10.00 til 15.00 på telefon +45 46 300 253 eller på email-adressen booking(at)vikingeskibsmuseet.dk.
English: Tickets can be booked through the museum’s booking office on weekdays, 10:00 to 15:00 by telephone +45 46 300 253 or by e-mail: booking(at)vikingeskibsmuseet.dk.

Danish: Tilmelding: Til Vikingeskibsmuseets booking, hverdage 10.00 til 15.00 på telefon +45 46 300 253 eller på email-adressen booking(at)vikingeskibsmuseet.dk.
English: Tickets can be booked through the museum’s booking office on weekdays, 10:00 to 15:00 by telephone +45 46 300 253 or by e-mail: booking(at)vikingeskibsmuseet.dk.

Danish: Tilmelding: Til Vikingeskibsmuseets booking, hverdage 10.00 til 15.00 på telefon +45 46 300 253 eller på email-adressenbooking(at)vikingeskibsmuseet.dk.
English: Tickets can be booked through the museum’s booking office on weekdays, 10:00 to 15:00 by telephone +45 46 300 253 or by e-mail:booking(at)vikingeskibsmuseet.dk.

Danish: Øvrige afgange sælges i billetsalget på dagen efter princippet 'Først til mølle', så det anbefales at komme i god tid.
English: Tickets for the other departures are sold on the day on a 'first come, first served' basis.

Danish: Emner til oplængerne ligger klar.
English: Timber for the futtocks lies ready.

Danish: Tid og sted
English: Time and place

Danish: Tid og sted
English: Time and venue:

Danish: Tidskapsel begraves 1. maj
English: Time capsule to be buried 1 May

Danish: Nu høster vi frugterne…
English: Time to reap the fruits…

Danish: Det er tid til at prøve igen.
English: Time to try again...

Danish: Tidsramme: Lørdag fra 10.00-17.00 og søndag fra 9.00-16.00
English: Timeframe: Saturday from 10.00-17.00 and Sunday from 9.00-16.00

Danish: Jollen er bygget af lærk på eg i Holbæk til fisker Gunnar Pedersen, der brugte den til at røgte ålebundgarn på Roskilde Fjord.
English: Tine was built of larch on oak by boatbuilder H. Willumsen in Holbæk for Gunnar Pedersen, a fisherman, who used it for tending his eel poundnets on Roskilde Fjord.

Danish: TINGET i Rørvig Havn: Kulturhistorisk festival.
English: TINGET in Rørvig harbour: Cultural and historical festival.

Danish: I forbindelse med særudstillingen The World in the Viking Age, udgav Vikingeskibsmuseet en temabog, der uddyber udstillingens temaer og beskriver de udstillede genstande, de arkæologiske lokaliteter samt kilderne til de historiske personer.
English: To accompany the special exhibition, The World in the Viking Age, the Viking Ship Museum published a book that expands on the themes of the exhibition and describes the exhibited artefacts, archaeological sites and the sources concerning the historical figures.

Danish: For at vurdere dette slid er det nødvendigt at skille blokkene ad og tage hjul og aksel ud.
English: To assess this wear it is necessary to take the blocks apart and take the wheels and axle out.

Danish: For at undgå forudfattede holdninger til skibsdesign og byggemetoder ansatte museet ikke professionelle bådebyggere.
English: To avoid preconceived attitudes towards ship design and construction methods, the museum did not employ professional boatbuilders.

Danish: I grunden var der jo ikke så meget at se.
English: To be honest there wasn't a lot to see.

Danish: For at tilgodese de udenlandske besætningsmedlemmer, sponsorer, samarbejdspartnere, medier og det internationale publikum udkommer nyhedsbrevet også på engelsk, så snart det er oversat..
English: To cater for our international crew members, sponsors, co-operative partners, the media, and of course the public all over the world, the newsletter will be broadcast in English, just as soon as each issue is translated…

Danish: I anledning af 10-års dagen har vi samlet nogle af de smukkeste billeder fra Havhingstens rejser.
English: To celebrate Sea Stallion's 10th birthday, we've gathered some of the most beautiful images from the ship's voyages.

Danish: Til sammenligning af Tilia med Johannessens rekonstruktionstegning er beregnet deplacementet ud fra de to linietegninger.
English: To compare Tilia with Johannessen's reconstruction drawing, the displacement had to be calculated from sheer draughts.

Danish: Til sammenligning af Tilia med Johannessens rekonstruktionstegning er beregnet deplacementet ud fra de to linietegninger.
English: To compare Tilia with Johannessen’s reconstruction drawing, the displacement had to be calculated from sheer draughts.

Danish: Afslutningsvis sejlede Tilia ud i åbent farvand i en vindstyrke på 10-12 m/sek., øgende til 14-16 m/sek., skråt ind forfra.
English: To conclude, Tilia was paddled out into open waters in 10-12 m/sec. winds, increasing to 14-16 m/sec., with the wind direction diagonally over the bow.

Danish: Til Danmark i en syndflod af regn
English: To Denmark in pouring rain

Danish: For at kunne gøre det, er det af afgørende betydning, at fundene - ligesom på et gerningssted - ikke forstyrres eller fjernes før al information er blevet indsamlet.
English: To do this, it is crucial - just as at the scene of a crime - that the artefacts are not disturbed or removed before all information has been collected.

Danish: For at kunne gøre det, er det af afgørende betydning, at fundene - ligesom på et gerningssted - ikke forstyrres eller fjernes før al information er blevet indsamlet.
English: To do this, it is crucial – just as at the scene of a crime – that the artefacts are not disturbed or removed before all information has been collected.

Danish: For at belyse livsvilkårene ombord, skal hvert rum beskrive forhold omkring vagtsystemet, hvile og søvn, mad og drikke, hygiejne og toiletforhold, påklædning ved forskellige forhold, personligt udstyr og stemningen blandt besætningen.
English: To document living conditions on board, each room will describe how crew members tackle the system of watches, how they rest and sleep, eat and drink, how they wash themselves and cope with the primitive toilet facilities, how they dress under varying conditions, which personal belongings they use, their moods and spirits and their interactions with other crew members.

Danish: For at sikre sig, at bordenes linierne løber jævnt og fint, sætter Erik og Ture lister op hvortil bordenes overkanter skal gå.
English: To ensure that the boat's lines run evenly, Erik and Ture install mouldings which continue up to the upper edge of the strakes.

Danish: For at være sikker på at nå sine mål om formidling af Havhingstens forsøgssejlads, har Vikingeskibsmuseet nedskrevet en såkaldt formidlingsplan.
English: To ensure the fulfilment of its communication goals concerning Sea Stallion's trial voyage the Viking Ship Museum has set up a Communication and Education plan.

Danish: For at evaluere hypotesen afprøves Havhingsten fra Glendalough under realistiske forhold i de farvandsområder, det originale skib er bygget til at besejle.
English: To evaluate the hypothesis, the Sea Stallion from Glendalough will be tested under realistic conditions in the waters the original ship was built to sail in.

Danish: To fyldte følgeskibe
English: To fully packed escorts

Danish: Skal man have en datering der går helt ned i kalenderår, må man i stedet bruge naturvidenskabelige metoder.
English: To get a calendar year for an artefact, we have to use scientific methods.

Danish: At holde sammen på en sådan flåde, må have været yderst vigtigt for at have de bedste chancer i kamp og mit gæt er, at de har prioriteret netop dette meget højt i forhold til afgørelser, der drejer sig om, hvorvidt man skal sejle eller vente på bedre sejlvejr.
English: To keep such a fleet together must have been extremely important for having the best chances in battle and it is my guess that they will have given this factor very high priority in relation to decisions about whether to sail or wait for better weather.

Danish: For at blive lidt klogere på det emne, må vi hele tiden holde øje med Havhingsten.
English: To learn more about this subject, we keep an eye on the Sea Stallion all the time.

Danish: For at få det til at sky vand og for at gøre det endnu mere vindtæt, blev det færdige sejl behandlet med rå okker og en blanding af hestemankefedt og vand i forholdet 1:10.
English: To make sure the sail repelled water and that it was even more wind-proof, the finished-woven sail was treated with raw ochre and a mixture of horse mane fat and, water in the ratio of 1:10.

Danish: For at lave stævnene, blev stammen kløvet videre til mindre dele, og så kom øksen i brug som det primære værktøj.
English: To make the stems, the oak was cleaved further into smaller sections and then the axe came into play as the principal tool used.

Danish: Linjerne langs siden af stævnen markeres og den første udskæring gøres med et stemmejern.
English: To make the stems, the oak was cleaved further into smaller sections and then the axe came into play as the principal tool used.

Danish: Det viste sig så til vores overraskelse, at flere garn i hver kordel var trukket over på det 4-slåede tov.
English: To our surprise several yarns in each strand had broken.

Danish: For ikke at flække, har de færdighuggede planker ligget i vand lige siden.
English: To prevent them from cracking, the finished planks were lain in water until needed.

Danish: For at forhindre vandsprøjt blev skibene yderligere afdækket.
English: To prevent water splashes on the ships they were further protected.

Danish: For at forhindre vandsprøjt på skibene blev de yderligere afdækket.
English: To prevent water splashes on the ships they were further protected.

Danish: Vil du vide mere om Thrane & Thrane A/S?
English: To read more about Thrane & Thrane A/S:

Danish: For at mildne faderen Hreidmars vrede, måtte guderne svøbe Ottar i et skind af guld.
English: To recompense Ottar's father Hreidmar, the gods made a cover of gold for Ottar to be burried in.

Danish: At sejle bidevind, beita, eller med rebede sejl, vefja, fremhæves også som særligt krævende.
English: To sail close to the wind, beita, or with reefed sails, vefja, is also considered to be specially demanding.

Danish: For at sejle!
English: To sail!

Danish: For at fremskynde opmålingen blev der udviklet en ny metode, hvor der blev anvendt en totalstation til at opmåle skibsvragenes forskellige dele.
English: To speed up the survey process, a total station was used to measure all the different structural components of the ships.

Danish: For at stive båden af lægges krumme spanter (bundstokke) ind, og til sidst klinkes et bord på som en ekstra forhøjning af bådsiden.
English: To strengthen the boat, curved floor timbers are fitted and finally a plank is added clinker-fashion to each side of the boat in order to increase its height.

Danish: Hvis du er ældre end 4 år, og sammen med dine forældre, kan du komme med!
English: To take part, you must be over 4 years old and have an adult with you.

Danish: For at evaluere hypotesen, afprøves Havhingsten fra Glendalough under realistiske forhold i de farvandsområder, det originale skib er bygget til at besejle.
English: To test the hypothesis, the Sea Stallion from Glendalough will be sailed under realistic conditions in the waters for which the original vessel was built.

Danish: Til det formål vil vi i 2017 begynde med byggeriet af vores anden rekonstruktion af Skuldelev 3 og et nyt projekt – Gensyn med Skuldelev 3 – kan begynde.
English: To that end, in 2017 we will begin the construction of our second reconstruction of Skuldelev 3 and a new project – Skuldelev 3 revisted – will begin.

Danish: Til lyden af kirkeklokkerne fra Christ Church Cathedral blev tidskapslen bragt om bord på Havhingsten og sejlet hjem til Roskilde.
English: To the sound of the church bells of Christ Church Cathedral, the time capsule was brought on board the Sea Stallion and sailed home to Roskilde.

Danish: Til hele verden via satellit
English: To the whole world through satellite

Danish: De lå spredt med store afstande: rejste man for at handle, var det vigtigt, at andre handlende opsøgte de samme havne.
English: To those who travelled for trade, it was vital that other traders visited the same ports.

Danish: For at forstå disse kenninger, skal man kunne begribe digterens og vikingernes billedsprog og univers.
English: To understand these kennings we have to grasp the poet's and the Vikings' world and its imagery.

Danish: For at forstå disse kenninger, skal man kunne begribe digterens og vikingernes billedsprog og univers.
English: To understand these kennings we have to grasp the poet’s and the Vikings’ world and its imagery.

Danish: I dag
English: Today

Danish: søn.
English: Today

Danish: Og den slags kalder på respekt i Havhingstens besætning, hvor det er altafgørende, at kunne sejle videre med en besætning så tæt på fuldtallig som mulig.
English: Today all four crew members were back on the ship and ready to sail and that gives respect amongst the rest of the crew.

Danish: I dag udgør Bent Lindgaard en fjerdedel af den firemandsbestyrelse, som administrerer arven efter Carsten Brebøl.
English: Today Bent Lindgaard makes up a fourth of the board, governing the legacy of Carsten Brebøl.

Danish: I dag erkender jeg, at det er en pinlig historie.
English: Today I recognise that it is an embarrasing story.

Danish: Det er i dag svært at sige noget om, hvad mændene foretog sig på skibene, når de ikke var på vagt.
English: Today it is hard to tell what the crew did on board the ships when not on duty.

Danish: I dag tog det 12 minutter at sænke masten og 20 minutter at rejse den igen, da samarbejde mellem besætningsmedlemmerne fungerede bedst.
English: Today it took 12 minutes to lower the mast and 20 minutes to raise it again when the the crew collaborated best.

Danish: Også i dag går den rent hjem for Louise.
English: Today Louise hits the bull’s-eye again.

Danish: Ottar sejler i dag med hørsejl, men startede oprindeligt ud med det gule uldsejl.
English: Today Ottar sails with a sail made of flax, but originally the sail was made of wool.

Danish: I dag søsætter Vikingeskibsmuseet et nyt elektronisk nyhedsbrev for alle, som gerne vil følge Havhingsten fra Glendalough og skibets fantastiske rejse.
English: Today sees the launch of our new electronic newsletter for everyone who wishes to follow Havhingsten of Glendalough and her fantastic voyage.

Danish: I dag administrerer fonden en formue på hele 83 mio. kroner.
English: Today the foundation administers a fortune totalling 83 million kroner.

Danish: Museet har i dag en omfattende samling af kopier af vikingetidens økser, høvle, bor, profilskrabere, knive, stemmejern, mejsler og hamre fra hele Norden.
English: Today the museum has a fine collection of copies of Viking Age axes, planes, drills, profile scrapers, knives, chisels and hammers from all over the Nordic region.

Danish: I dag har vi igen svag østenvind her ved kysten, men ude i havet er der stort set vindstille og svag skiftende vind og det ser ud som om, vi bliver her et par dage endnu i "skiftende mod stille".
English: Today we again have a light easterly breeze here at the coast, but out at sea it is almost calm with light breezes from changing directions and it looks as though we will be here for another couple of days in ‘changeable to calm’.

Danish: I dag er vi ikke byen med den store Domkirke, vi er byen med Havhingsten, Vikingeskibsmuseet – og Domkirken.”
English: Today we are not the city with the big cathedral; we are the city with the Sea Stallion, the Viking Ship Museum – and the cathedral.”

Danish: I dag har vi efterset begge blokke i dragtaljen for slitage på hjul og aksler.
English: Today we inspected both blocks in the halyard tackle to see if the wheels and axles are worn.

Danish: I dag ved vi, at tordenvejr skabes, når varm luft møder kold luft.
English: Today we know that a thunderstorm is created when hot and cold air meet.

Danish: I dag bruger bådebyggeren en tommestok, i ældre tid anvendtes en målepind, en såkaldt tre-alen-stok.
English: Today, boatbuilders use a carpenter's ruler but in times past, a measuring stick - a so-called tre-alen-stok - was used.

Danish: I dag bruger bådebyggeren en tommestok, i ældre tid anvendtes en målepind, en såkaldt tre-alen-stok.
English: Today, boatbuilders use a carpenter’s ruler but in times past, a measuring stick – a so-called tre-alen-stok – was used.

Danish: Infektioner vi i dag kan behandle med antibiotika.
English: Today, infections are treated with antibiotics.

Danish: Leverpostej er i dag en national spise - en spise som også blev nydt af Havhingstens besætning, skønt det var i en langtidsholdbar udgave.
English: Today, liver pâté is a national dish and it was also enjoyed by the crew of the Sea Stallion, though in a long-life version.

Danish: I dag findes et større antal fortidsminder i ældre, urørte skovområder end i det åbne landskab.
English: Today, more artefacts are found in older, untouched wooded areas than in the open landscape, where they are destroyed by agriculture.

Danish: Derimod har Havhingstens skipper en mellemråber ved masten til at råbe kommandoerne videre.
English: Today, on the Sea Stallion, the coxswain is often found aft (at the stern) in the ship.

Danish: I dag på Havhingsten befinder skipperen sig ofte agter (bagest) i skibet.
English: Today, on the Sea Stallion, the coxswain is often found aft (at the stern) in the ship.

Danish: Bopladsen ligger i dag på 5 meter vand.
English: Today, the settlement lies under 5m of water.

Danish: I dag er fårene med til at vedligeholde de fredede naturarealer på Samsø.
English: Today, the sheep help to maintain the protected natural areas on Samsø.

Danish: I dag findes der masser af itu-klippede mønter fra vikingetiden.
English: Today, there are many finds of cut up silver coins from the Viking Age.

Danish: I dag bliver disse såkaldte "danske skibsspiger" freemstillet i Indien fordi efterspørgslen er for lille til at producere dem i Danmark.
English: Today, these so-called, 'Danish ship's nails' are actually produced in India, because there is not enough demand for them here in Denmark.

Danish: Der sejlede to bådebyggere med på Havhingstens togter.
English: Today, two boat builders will take part in the voyages made by the Sea Stallion.

Danish: I dag har man instrumenter til meget nøjagtig måling af hastighed.
English: Today, we have instruments for very precise measurements of speed.

Danish: I dag ved vi, at den beslutning, med ét slag, blev overhalet, da jernskibene tog over.
English: Today, we know that this decision was made irrelevant when iron ships took over.

Danish: I dag er Werner Karrasch fotograf og filmmand på fuld tid og hans mange tusinde billeder og filmklip er en fundamental del af museets forskning og formidling.
English: Today, Werner Karrasch is a fulltime photographer and filmmaker and his many thousand of photos and film clips are a fundamental part of the Museum's research and communication.

Danish: Når man i dag skal påvise disse åbninger og lukninger af Limfjorden, bruger man derfor dyrearterne til at aflæse, om vandet var ferskt eller salt.
English: Today, when demonstrating the openings and closings of the Limfjord, animal species are therefore used to ascertain whether the water in the fjord was fresh or salty.

Danish: Set i bakspejlet kan man roligt sige, at det var en gylden tid for udviklingen af studier i skibsbygningens- og skibsfartens historie.
English: Today, when looking in retrospect, one can safely say that for Denmark it was the “golden age” for developing studies of shipbuilding history and shipping.

Danish: I dag, hvor Ole Crumlin-Pedersen ikke længere er iblandt os, og to centre for studier af oldtidens skibsbygning er lukket forventes det, at mesterens elever vil fortsætte med at udvide Vikingeskibsmuseet - og, at flere skibsvrag, inklusiv de fundet ved konstruktion af museumshavnen, afventer rekonstruktion.
English: Today, when Ole Crumlin-Pedersen is no longer with us and the two centres of ancient shipbuilding studies have been closed, it is expected that the Master's pupils will continue to expand the Viking Ship Museum - especially that more wrecks, including those discovered during the construction of the museum harbour, awaits reconstruction.

Danish: I dag, hvor Ole Crumlin-Pedersen ikke længere er iblandt os, og to centre for studier af oldtidens skibsbygning er lukket forventes det, at mesterens elever vil fortsætte med at udvide Vikingeskibsmuseet – og, at flere skibsvrag, inklusiv de fundet ved konstruktion af museumshavnen, afventer rekonstruktion.
English: Today, when Ole Crumlin-Pedersen is no longer with us and the two centres of ancient shipbuilding studies have been closed, it is expected that the Master’s pupils will continue to expand the Viking Ship Museum - especially that more wrecks, including those discovered during the construction of the museum harbour, awaits reconstruction.

Danish: Tilsammen giver de et mangfoldigt indtryk af vikingetidens skibsbygningskunst, søfart, handel, forsvar og krigsfærd.
English: Together these ships provide a multi-facetted impression of Viking-Age shipbuilding, navigation, trade, defence and warfare.

Danish: Sammen med lokale kokke fra Samsø og Havhingstens kabys-kokke, Kenneth og Solvej, blev der tilberedt et festmåltid til Havhingstens besætning af lokale råvarer fra Samsø, blandt andet makrel, gutefår, løg og strandkål.
English: Together with local chefs from Samsø and the Sea Stallion's galley-cooks, Kenneth and Solvej, they prepared a feast for the Sea Stallion's crew of local produce from the island, including mackerel, Gute sheep, onion and sea kale.

Danish: Gæsterne om bord deltager aktivt - sammen med bådens faste mandskab, ved årerne og når der skal sættes sejl.
English: Together with the boat’s permanent crew, the guests on board will actively participate at the oars and when the sails are set.

Danish: Sammen med de to hovmestre og en til to gaster fra hvert af de seks rum, skibet er organiseret i, er Preben Rather Sørensen ansvarlig for at lægge planer, så madlavningen - skafningen - om bord på Havhingsten kan ske forsvarligt.
English: Together with the two cooks and one or two crew members from each of the six rooms on the Sea Stallion Preben Rather Sørensen is responsible for planning that cooking on board happens in a safe enviroment.

Danish: I fællesskab vil Vikingeskibsmuseet, skib og besætning sætte Roskilde på verdenskortet, som byen ikke har været det siden... ja, vikingetiden.
English: Together, the Viking Ship Museum, the ship and her crew will put the town of Roskilde back on the map for the first time since …the Vikings.

Danish: Tilsammen kaldes stykkerne for "et spant".
English: Together, these pieces are known as a 'frame'

Danish: Tilsammen kan de uddrage størst mulige viden fra de enkelte genstande, der skal rekonstrueres.
English: Together, they can extract the greatest amount of information from the artefact that is to be reconstructed.

Danish: Tilsammen giver de et mangfoldigt indblik i vikingetidens maritime kultur: Skibsbygning, søfart, handel, forsvar og krigsfærd - og muligheden for at søge ud i verden og udforske nye horisonter.
English: Together, they provide a unique perspective on Viking Age maritime culture: shipbuilding, seamanship, trade, defence and warfare - and the ability to journey far and wide and explore new horizons.

Danish: Det giver tilsammen et stærkt og fleksibelt skrog, som er kendetegnet for den åben, nordiske, klinkbyggede båd, der har sin oprindelse i bådene fra før vikingetiden.
English: Together, they result in a strong and flexible hull, which is a typical characteristic of open Nordic clinker-built boats, and which originates from pre-Viking Age boats.

Danish: Tilsammen gjorde dette også skibene lette og stærke, på samme tid.
English: Together, this made the ships light and strong at the same time.

Danish: TOGTET er arrangeret af de historiske attraktioner i Kulturregion Midt- og Vestsjælland, der er gået sammen med turismeerhvervene og hundredevis af sjællandske frivillige om, 10 hektiske dage med besøg i fire havne, at markere regionens mange oplevelser og historier fra Danmarks vikingetid og middelalder - i tiden da Danmark blev til!
English: TOGTET is arranged by the historical attractions in the Mid and West Sjælland Culture Region, who have come together with tourism businesses and hundreds of volunteers from around Zealand to organise 10 hectic days with visits to four harbours, to celebrate the region’s many stories and events from the Danish Viking and Middle Ages – the time that Denmark was created!

Danish: Toirrdelbach Ua Briain, konge af Munster mellem 1063 og 1086, gjorde Limerick til hovedstad, og det vedblev den at være i hans efterfølgers regeringstid.
English: Toirrdelbach Ua Briain, King of Munster between 1063 and 1086, made Limerick his capital, and this continued during the reign of his successor, Muirchertach Ua Briain.

English: Traces have been found of several other barriers in the area (2.4) and samples taken from these suggest that they are contemporary with the Peberrenden barrier, but comprehensive industrial extraction of oyster shells for chicken feed have made it impossible to examine these finds more closely.

Danish: Spor af brand på de bjergede fartøjsrester viser, at skibet formodentlig har endt sine dage som en "brænder", et fartøj der brændende er blevet sendt mod fjendes forsvarsværker eller skibe for at ødelægge disse.
English: Traces of fire on the salvaged vessel remains show that the ship probably ended its days as a fireship: a vessel set ablaze and sent into enemy lines to destroy the ships.

Danish: På toppen af hver stævn var der spor af fire klamper, der kan have været til et langskibs spændtov.
English: Traces of four cleats were found on the top of the stem probably for a rope, stretched from one end of the boat to the other.

English: Traditional forms of museum dissemination in text and images are combined with sound, light, digital installations, engaging activities and artistic expressions keeping the maritime culture alive for young and adults.
