English: Traditional museum work has long involved the preservation and exploration of material cultural heritage.

English: Traditionally - in 'the old days' - boatbuilders didn't build boats using the types of moulds that we do, because each boatbuilder was so skilled in building boats for use in his local area, that he could build by eye.

English: travelled deep into Russia, of Viking mercenaries who served in the emperor´s bodyguards at Constantinople, and Viking mariners who sailed beyond the edge of the known world to North America.

Danish: Forsøgsrejserne med HAVHINGSTEN fortæller os ikke kun om rejsetider og sødygtighed, men også om de store krav, der bliver stillet til grej og mandskab ved sejlads i et åbent skib over Nordsøen.
English: Trial voyages with the SEA STALLION tell us not only about travelling times and seaworthiness but also about the great demands that are made on gear and crew when sailing in an open ship across the North Sea.

English: Trial voyages with the SEA STALLION tell us not only about travelling times and seaworthiness but also about the great demands that are made on gear and crew when sailing in an open ship across the North Sea.

English: Trips take approx. 50 minutes, including allocation of life jackets and an introduction to the ship and rowing technique.

English: Type: Is the source a relic (originating directly from the event it describes - such as decrees, charters and archaeological remains) or an account (speaks of, but plays no part in, the case)?

English: Type: Is the source a relic (originating directly from the event it describes - such as decrees, charters and archaeological remains) or an account (speaks of, but plays no part in, the case)?

English: Under ideal conditions in smooth waters and no contrary wind, we can row the ship at a speed of about 2 knots.

Danish: Under sejl i gunstig vind er vikingeskibet dog overlegent – og dette uden at belaste besætningens kræfter.
English: Under sail with a favourable wind, however, the Viking ship has better results – and without even tiring the crew.

English: Unfortunately building full scale is not feasible for us at this time.

Danish: Medbring altid praktisk og vandtæt tøj.
English: Unfortunately, children under the age of four cannot participate.

Danish: På Gislingebåden derimod blev der desværre ikke fundet et sideror under udgravningen.
English: Unfortunately, no trace of the rudder was found during the excavation of the Gislinge boat.

Danish: Desværre var meget lidt af skibet bevaret.
English: Unfortunately, only very little of the vessel is preserved.

Danish: Museet må desværre tage forbehold for, at vind og vejr kan medføre aflysning.
English: Unfortunately, the course is also dependent on favourable weather conditions.

Danish: Vi må desværre også tage forbehold for, at vind og vejr kan medføre aflysning.
English: Unfortunately, the course is also dependent on favourable weather conditions.

Danish: Men desværre viste plankerne sig at være for smalle til Björkebådens meget brede bordgang, så måtte finde et nyt træ i Tisvilde.
English: Unfortunately, the planks proved to be too narrow for the Björke boat's very wide strakes, so we had to find a new tree in Tisvilde.

Danish: Desværre fortæller sagaen ikke, hvad sæltjære egentlig består af.
English: Unfortunately, the saga does not tell us what 'seal tar' consists of.

Danish: Vi har desværre ingen samtidige skriftlige kilder fra vikingetiden, der kan fortælle hvordan bådebyggerne arbejdede i Vikingetiden.
English: Unfortunately, we have no written source material describing how boat builders worked in Viking times.

Danish: Vi må desværre forbeholde os ret til at aflyse, hvis der ikke er deltagere nok til turens gennemførelse, ligesom vejret naturligvis kan lægge hindringer i vejen.
English: Unfortunately, we must reserve the right to cancel trips if there is insufficient bookings or the weather is a risk to the safety onboard.

Danish: På oversigten ser det ud til at I har været på "slæb" hele vejen over til Æbeltoft.
English: Unfortunately, you must try to translate the blog posts possibly with Google translate.

Danish: Unik tæller
English: Unique counter

Danish: Du kan også se optagelser af indlæg ved seminarer og konferencer samt fra mange af de foredrag, som afholdes af museets Venneforening.
English: Unless otherwise stated, the clips have been filmed and edited by the Viking Ship Museum's photographer, Werner Karrasch.

Danish: Filmene er hovedsagligt filmet og klippet af Vikingeskibsmuseets fotograf Werner Karrasch, medmindre andet er anført.
English: Unless otherwise stated, the clips have been filmed and edited by the Viking Ship Museum's photographer, Werner Karrasch.

Danish: Filmene er optaget og klippet af Vikingeskibsmuseets fotograf Werner Karrasch, medmindre andet er anført.
English: Unless otherwise stated, the clips have been filmed and edited by the Viking Ship Museum's photographer, Werner Karrasch.

Danish: I modsætning til moderne sejlfartøjer, hvor man forsøger at opnå maksimal stivhed via konstruktion og materialevalg, var vikingetidens skibe meget fleksible.
English: Unlike modern vessels, in which the aim is maximum stiffness in the construction and materials chosen, Viking Age ships were very flexible.

Danish: I modsætning til de øvrige kildegrupper, øges antallet af arkæologiske kilder hele tiden.
English: Unlike other sources, the number of archaeological sources increases all the time.

Danish: Denne båd har ikke, som den originale båd, dam.
English: Unlike the original boat, this boat will not be fitted with a wet well.

Danish: I modsætning til de øvrige skibe er Skuldelev 5 bygget af både nyt og genbrugt træ.
English: Unlike the other ships, Skuldelev 5 is build using both new wood and recycled timber.

Danish: I modsætning til de øvrige Skuldelevskibe er det lille langskib fra begyndelse bygget af både nyt træ og genbrugstømmer.
English: Unlike the other Skuldelev ships, this ship is built using both new wood and recycled timber.

Danish: Frem til 1. maj er det muligt at følge bådebygger Ture Malte Møller, som bygger prammene på bådeværftet.
English: Until 1 May it will be possible to follow the boat builder Ture Malte Møller as he builds the prams at the boatyard.

Danish: Frem til Knud Jensens død i 1961 blev der bygget en lang række fine lystbåde.
English: Until Knud Jensen's death in 1961, a long line of fine pleasure craft were built.

Danish: Frem til næste år vil skibet være en central del af det irske Nationalmuseums udstilling om langskibet.
English: Until next year the ship will play a important part of an exibition about the Viking longship in the National Museum of Ireland.

Danish: Omstændighederne bag forliset var indtil for nylig uklare, indtil den svenske arkæolog Rune Edberg fik klarlagt dramaet: Ormen Friske var på grund af vejrliget drevet ind i et amerikansk militært øveområde for bombning.
English: Until recently, the circumstances surrounding the shipwreck were unclear, until the Swedish archaeologist Rune Edberg managed to unravel the drama: Due to the prevailing weather conditions, Ormen Friske had drifted into an American military area used for bombing exercises.

Danish: Kølen fik lov at ligge med sine sten lidt endnu.
English: Until then, the keel was weighted down once again with stones.

Danish: Op gennem 900-tallet udvidedes, befæstedes og styrkedes byerne i en sådan grad, at der tydeligvis stod en magtfuld og velhavende person bag disse forandringer.
English: Up through the 10th century, towns were expanded, fortified and strengthened to such an extent that there lay clearly a powerful and wealthy person behind these developments.

Danish: Indtil for relativt nylig har historikere været tilbøjelige til at skildre vikingerne i Irland, udelukkende som plyndringsfolk.
English: Up to relatively recently, historians tended to reflect the sentiments of the Irish annalists, portraying the Vikings merely as marauders.

Danish: Tidligere har vi jo haft Havhingsten lige ved hånden og de mange træningsweekender har haft udgangspunkt i museumshavnen i Roskilde.
English: Up until now, we have always had the Sea Stallion just at hand, and the many training weekends have been based in the museum harbour in Roskilde.

Danish: Byer, der fungerede som markeder, havne og skibsbyggepladser, med tilbud af arbejdskraft, viden og efterspørgsel for vareudveksling.
English: Urban settlements, functioning as markets, harbours and shipyards with supplies of labour and knowledge, and a need for the exchange of goods.

Danish: Forbrug og forskning
English: Use and research

Danish: Anvend GIS i løsningen af opgaverne tophastighed, roning, krydsegenskaber, vendinger og fartrosen.
English: Use GIS in solving the exercises maximum speed, rowing, tacking abilities, turns and the speed diagram.

Danish: Brug af autentisk påklædning
English: Use of authentic clothing

Danish: Brug af middelalderlige fødevarer
English: Use of medieval food

Danish: Brug af naturhavne frem for moderne havneanlæg
English: Use of natural harbours rather than modern harbour facilities

Danish: Brug sand og lim.
English: Use sand and glue.

Danish: Brug formlen: Distance = fart * tid.
English: Use the formula: Distance = speed x time.

Danish: Brug kortet på hjemmesiden til at finde egnede etaper ved at tænde for vis positioner.
English: Use the map on the website to find suitable stages by switching on show positions.

Danish: Hent kildesættet her til højre og prøv selv.
English: Use the source texts to the right and try for yourself.

Danish: Desuden brugte man hudreb af sæl, hjort, elg eller okse.
English: Use was also made of hide rope of seal, deer, elk or ox.

Danish: Som bruger af de digitale arkiver over fortidsminder, skal man derfor være opmærksom på, at det fulde billede af fortidsmindet måske ikke er repræsenteret.
English: Users of digital archives about ancient monuments need to keep in mind therefore that they may not represent a complete picture of their subject.

Danish: Disse skulle, med mejsel, hugges ud i små firkantede stykker, der så blev brugt til roer/klinkskiver.
English: Using a chisel, these strips would be cut into small square pieces and used as roves for clinker nails.

Danish: Så bliver der mindre spild, og materialerne kan udnyttes mere effektivt.
English: Using a mould ensures that there is less waste and that the materials can be utilised as effectively as possible.

Danish: På baggrund af GPS-sporet kan varigheden af en vending desuden opgøres som den tid der går mellem at skibet krydser sit eget spor.
English: Using GPS data, it will be possible to determine the time taken to change tack as the time taken for the ship to cross its own wake.

Danish: Bundstokkene (spanterne) på Björkebåden er surret fast med enebærvidjer eller enebærrødder, til klamper der er hugget ud i planken.
English: Using juniper withies or roots, the floor timbers (frames) of the Björke boat are lashed to the clamps that are hewn out of the planks.

Danish: I forbindelse med uddybning i Nakskov Havn i området langs den middelalderlige bydel, blev der foretaget en prøvegravning langs Sydkajen (Kaj VIII) og Toldbodkajen (Kaj XI) med Nakskov Havns mobilkran.
English: Using Nakskov Harbour's mobile crane, a test excavation was carried out along the South Quay (Quay VIII) and the Toldbod Quay (Quay XI) in connection with the dredging of Nakskov Harbour in an area alongside the medieval town.

Danish: I forbindelse med uddybning i Nakskov Havn i området langs den middelalderlige bydel, blev der foretaget en prøvegravning langs Sydkajen (Kaj VIII) og Toldbodkajen (Kaj XI) med Nakskov Havns mobilkran.
English: Using Nakskov Harbour’s mobile crane, a test excavation was carried out along the South Quay (Quay VIII) and the Toldbod Quay (Quay XI) in connection with the dredging of Nakskov Harbour in an area alongside the medieval town.

Danish: Med sejlene fik de båden til at drive sidelæns gennem vandet, hvorved drivvoddet blev spilet ud mellem to bomme, en for og en agter.
English: Using the sail, the boat was made to drift sideways through the water, with the seine net spread out between two booms, one forward and one abaft.

Danish: Som regel kan bådebyggerne se på barken, om fibrene snor eller, om træet er retvokset.
English: Usually, you can tell if the fibres are twisted or straight-growing by looking at the bark.

Danish: Valhalla på Vikingeskibsmuseet november 2013
English: Valhalla at the Viking Ship Museum November 2013

Danish: Værdier i kolonne Status
English: Values in Status column

Danish: Arbejdet udførtes med kritisk gensidig kontrol og dokumenteredes løbende med fotos og video.
English: Various data relating to the initial reconstruction of the boat was entered into a computer for processing.

Danish: Forskellige løsninger herfor blev overvejet: indfældning af originalstykkerne i et nybygget bådskrog af træ eller glasfiber, udstilling af en kopi af båden med de bevarede partier indfarvet, eller montering af de bevarede partier på et åbent stel af metalprofiler, der markerede bådens linier.
English: Various possible models were considered for the remounting: the fitting of the original parts into a newly built boat hull made of wood or fibre glass, the exhibition of a copy of the boat with the surviving parts in a different colour, or the mounting of the surviving parts on an open frame of metal tubes that indicated the lines of the boat.

Danish: Hvad de færreste sikkert ved er, at Christian X kunne sejle isbåd.
English: Very few people realise that King Christian X could sail ice boats.

Danish: De særlige dygtige kunne sejle vinterens produktion til markedet og sælge dem eller måske bytte sig til andre goder.
English: Very skilled craft workers could sail their winter’s production to the market and sell or trade them for other goods.

Danish: Skibene fra vikingetiden var andet end store klinkbyggede fartøjer med smukke profilerede stævne.
English: Vessels from the Viking Age were more than just large clinker-built ships with their distinctive stems.

Danish: Gennem i alt fem løft med kolosale kraner og kæmpe lastbiler, blev skibet løftet ud af Collins Barracks kæmpe gård, hen over den elektriske jernbane og en stor mindepark og kørt hele vejen gennem Dublins gader for endelig at blive lagt stille og roligt tilbage i Liffey.
English: Via a total of five lifts from enormous cranes and giant trucks, the ship was hoisted out of Collins Barracks' huge yard, over the electric railway and a large memorial, and driven all the way through Dublin's streets to be put quietly and without fuss back in the Liffey.

Danish: I 2007 fik Vikingeskibsmuseet via diverse fonde, sponsorater og offentligt støtte, skabt økonomisk mulighed for at Havhingsten kunne tage turen til Dublin.
English: Via foundations, sponsors and public funds, the Viking Ship Museum received the financial means allowing us to make the voyage to Dublin in 2007.

Danish: Der var tydeligvis noget galt med konstruktionen, og i mange år efter forliset, blev det blandt andet diskuteret, om det udgravede skib nogensinde havde kunnet sejle, eller om det eventuelt var bygget som et symbol, for at give de afdøde en transportmulighed til Valhal.
English: Vibeke Bischoff from the Viking Ship Museum is an experienced ship-reconstructor, and from the first time she examined the old Oseberg Ship, which stands on display at the Viking Ship Museum at Bygdøy, Oslo, she noticed that there were several serious flaws in the way the ship had been reconstructed and set up for exhibition.

Danish: Vibeke Bischoff har været skibskonstruktør på Vikingeskibsmuseet siden 2003, og har stor erfaring med fortolkning og rekonstruktion af arkæologiske skibsfund.
English: Vibeke Bischoff has been a ship-reconstructor at the Viking Ship Museum since 2003 and has great experience with interpreting and reconstructing archaeological ship-finds.

Danish: Vibeke Bischoff sejler selv med som skipper og deltager i sejladserne sammen med besætningsmedlemmerne fra SNOS og enkelte andre skibskyndige fra Vikingeskibsmuseet.
English: Vibeke Bischoff is on board as skipper and will take part in the test-sailing, together with the crewmembers from SNOS and a select group of skilled sailors from the Museum.

Danish: Vibeke Bischoff er ansat ved Vikingeskibsmuseet som rekonstruktør af arkæologiske skibsfund.
English: Vibeke Bischoff works at the Viking Ship Museum as a restorer of archaeological ship-finds.

Danish: Vikingeskibsmuseets skibsrekonstruktør Vibeke Bischoff tog til Oslo hvor hun, sammen med Geir Røvik fra SNOS gennemgik originalskibet og alt materialet fra udgravningen.
English: Vibeke Bischoff, the Viking Ship Museum's ship reconstructor, went to Oslo, where she and Geir Røvik from SNOS reviewed the original ship and all the material from the excavation.

Danish: Vibeke Bischoff: ”På Vikingeskibsmuseet her i Roskilde er vi jo optaget af at finde ud af, hvordan disse skibe har sejlet.
English: Vibeke Bischoff: “At the Viking Ship Museum here in Roskilde here, we are very interested in learning about how these ships sailed.

Danish: Bind I, der er den arkæologiske del, er udkommet i 2003, medens bindene II og III, der omfatter henholdsvis bygning og sejlads af og med alle de fem rekonstruerede Skuldelevskibe, ventes at udkomme indenfor en årrække.
English: Volume I, which is the archaeological part, was published in 2003, whereas volumes II and III, which comprise respectively the building of, and sailing with, the five Skuldelev ships, are expected to be published in a few years' time.

Danish: Vordingborg Nordhavn
English: Vordingborg Nord Harbour

Danish: Rejsedokumentation på Vikingeskibsmuseet
English: Voyage documentation at the Viking Ship Museum

Danish: Sejlads fra Islay til Isle of Man.
English: Voyage from Islay to Isle of Man.

Danish: Her kan du læse mere om hvordan Vikingernes rejser påvirkede landende i Skandinavien, landende omkring Storbritannien,, samt lidt om handlen med landene øst for Danmark.
English: Voyages connect coasts the world over and bring together people of different ideas, beliefs and traditions.

Danish: Ventetider i havne og benhårde sejladser over åbent hav har været ingredienser til varme og varige venskaber.
English: Waiting time in harbours and exhausting voyages over open seas have been the ingredients for close and lasting friendships.

Danish: Gå 50-100 skridt i den valgte retning, og tjek også retningen på solkompasset undervejs.
English: Walk 50-100 steps in the chosen direction and also check the direction on the sun compass underway.

Danish: Gå det samme antal skridt tilbage igen.
English: Walk the same number of steps back.

Danish: Vild med viden om vikingernes skibe?
English: Want to learn all about Viking ships?

Danish: Krig, kamp og skarpe våben
English: War, battle and sharp weapons

Danish: Krigertræning med sværd og skjold
English: War, battle and sharp weapons

Danish: Varmt tillykke og alle gode ønsker for fremtiden!
English: Warm congratulations and best of wishes for the future!

Danish: ADVARSEL: Udstillingen indeholder lys, der muligvis kan fremprovokere anfald hos personer med fotosensitiv epilepsi.
English: WARNING: The exhibition contains light that may trigger seizures for people with photosensitive epilepsy.

Danish: Kriger og kamp
English: Warrior and warfare

Danish: Er irland et samlet rige?
English: Was Ireland a united kingdom?

Danish: Var det en besked?
English: Was it a message?

Danish: Var det et folkemord, eller blev kun bestemte grupper ramt?
English: Was it genocide or were only certain groups targeted?

Danish: Er det blot fordi, de var vikingernes ofre?
English: Was it just because they were the Vikings' victims?

Danish: Var den magisk?
English: Was it magical?

Danish: Har der undervejs i sejladsen været behov for ændringer eller reparationer?
English: Was it necessary to carry out adjustments and repairs during the voyage.

Danish: Var det kun fordi England var dansk på det tidspunkt?
English: Was it only because England was under Danish rule at that time?

Danish: Var det skrogformen, var der for få personer ombord, for lidt ballast eller for stort sejl?
English: Was it the design of the hull; were there too few people aboard, too little ballast or too much sail?

Danish: Var det kølbugten eller bordindløbet, var besætningen for lille, var der for lidt ballast eller var sejlet for stort?
English: Was it the keel rocker, the shape of the bow, too small a crew, too little ballast, or too large a sail?

Danish: Var der en åben passage mod vest ligesom i dag?
English: Was there a passage open towards the west just like today?

Danish: På Vikingeskibsmuseets filmkanal finder du film om bådebygning, sejlads, marinarkæologi og de mange forskellige aktiviteter, der foregår på museet året rundt.
English: Watch film from the Viking Ship Museum and get an impression of the activities that take place here.

Danish: Se film fra søsætningen af Vi…
English: Watch the film from t…

Danish: Se video om Havhingsten.
English: Watch video about the Sea Stallion.

Danish: Vagter om bord
English: Watches on board

Danish: Det vanddrevne ejektorsug bruges på vanddybder under 10 m, og det er derfor det hyppigst anvendte sug i de danske farvande.
English: Water dredges are ideal for water depths of less than 10 m and are therefore the type most commonly used in Danish waters.

Danish: Vandet er pakket i store dunke under dæk, som fyldes hver gang skibet lægger til land.
English: Water is stowed below deck in large containers; these are filled up each time the ship docks.

Danish: Fart gennem vandet/knob
English: Water speed/knots

Danish: Vand, vind og vikinger Festival 28. - 29. juli
English: Water, Wind og Vikings Festival 28 - 29 July

Danish: For at kunne sammenligne (og dermed kvalificeret foretage valget mellem) roning og krydsning for sejl, gennemføres forsøg med roning under forhold der ligner krydsforsøgenes.
English: Wave height and characteristics will be continually assessed on the Beaufort scale and entered in the logbook.

Danish: Vi tager byggeopgaver ind fra private og andre museet.
English: We accept building commissions from private clients and from other museums.

Danish: Vi modtager følgende kort: Dankort, Visa, Visa Electron, JCB, Master Card og Maestro.
English: We accept the following credit cards: Dankort, Visa, Visa Electron, JCB, Master Card and Maestro.

Danish: Vi ved allerede meget, men hver rekonstruktion giver os nye spørgsmål og svar..
English: We already know a great deal, but each reconstruction provides us with new questions and answers.

Danish: Det gør vi også, så er båden altid tæt, også efter den har stået på land, vinteren over, og tørret ud.
English: We also chose to do this, so that the boat would always be tight, even after a winter on land where the hull had dried out.

Danish: Vi har også et såkaldt NavTex vejrmeldingssystem, som gør det muligt at følge opbygningen af lokale vejrsystemer på ruten.
English: We also have a so called NavTex weather report system, which makes it possible to monitor the build up of local weather en route.

Danish: Vi ved også, at han må have været en betydningsfuld person.
English: We also know that he must have been an important person.

Danish: Forskere fra forskellige lande husker uden tvivl med stor glæde tilbage på den gæstfrihed, de oplevede under deres besøg på forskningscenteret.
English: We also know that many scholars from different countries look back on the hospitality experienced during their visits at Roskilde's research facilities.

Danish: Forskere fra forskellige lande husker uden tvivl med stor glæde tilbage på den gæstfrihed, de oplevede under deres besøg på forskningscenteret.
English: We also know that many scholars from different countries look back on the hospitality experienced during their visits at Roskilde’s research facilities.

Danish: Vi anbefaler også, at du som privatperson har tegnet en ansvarsforsikring.
English: We also recommend that you personally take out your own liability insurance.

Danish: Afstivede også skibet diagonalt ved at spigre noget af dørken fast (som i Osebergskibet).
English: We also stiffened the ship diagonally by fixing some of the flooring fast with spikes (as in the Oseberg ship).

Danish: Og der zoomes ind på materialer og detaljer, der giver mulighed for at opdage det smukke i træet, lindebasten, vanddråberne på tjærede årer og spillet mellem lys og skygger i sejlet.
English: We also zoom in on materials and details that make it possible to discover the beauty of wood

Danish: Vi giver gerne tilbud på større eller mindre restaureringsarbejder for private eller andre museer
English: We are always happy to provide price quotes for large or small restoration assignments for private individuals or for museums.

Danish: Stedet er Inverie i Vestskotland og fotografen er Werner Karrasch
English: We are at Inverie in western Scotland and the photographer is Werner Karrasch.

Danish: Vi får løbende en opdatering om vindstyrke, - retning og forventet afgang.
English: We are getting weather updates and expected departure times regularly.

Danish: Det er med stor glæde, at vi kan præsentere sommerens store museumsoplevelser for alle med interesse i vikingernes historie, håndværk og imponerende skibe!
English: We are happy to be able to present this summer's great museum experiences for everyone with an interest in Viking history, craftwork and their impressive ships!

Danish: Vi er stolte af og dybt taknemmelige for, at Irland byder skibet, besætningen og projektet så varmt velkommen, som tilfældet er.
English: We are honoured and deeply grateful that Ireland welcomes the ship, the crew and the project in such a warm atmosphere.

Danish: Der bliver bestemt lagt op til en aften med det bedste Irland kan tilbyde.
English: We are looking forward to an evening with the best that Ireland has to offer.

Danish: Vi bygger jo ikke en gammel drivkvase, eller en kopi af en gammel båd - men en ny båd med udgangspunkt i en gammel.
English: We are not building an old drifter, or even a copy of an old boat - rather, we are building a new boat which is inspired by the old.

Danish: Vasaller var frie mænd som var under kongens beskyttelse og som derfor skulle stille et antal skibe og mænd når kongen havde brug for det.
English: We are not told much about the ships in question and it is unlikely that they were all longships.

Danish: Nu ligger vi i Hedeby, hvor tusindvis af gæster kommer på besøg ved og på skibet.
English: We are now in Haithabu where thousands of guests are visiting the ship.

Danish: Vi ligger nu i Lowestoft på 11. døgn og venter på god bør til at krydse Nordsøen i.
English: We are now lying in Lowestoft for the 11th day, waiting for a good fair wind for crossing the North Sea.

Danish: Vi er en del af et større skibstræf og vikingemarked, der slutter i dag søndag.
English: We are part of a big Viking ship festival and Viking market that ends today, Sunday.

Danish: Vi er klar til at følge i vikingernes kølvand.
English: We are ready to follow in the wake of the Vikings.

Danish: Vi sejler i Limfjorden
English: We are sailing on the Limfjord

Danish: Vi sejler i LimfjordenDet regnerMen hvad gør detNår hele Nordjyllands befolkning + turisterStår på...
English: We are sailing on the Limfjord It’s raining But what does that matter When the population of...

Danish: Vi sejler de sidste sømil med Havhingsten - for denne gang altså.
English: We are sailing the last nautical miles with the Sea Stallion – for the time being.

Danish: Vi er så heldige, at en stor del af gasterne, der skal sejle Havhingsten til Dublin, har været med om bord lige siden begyndelsen," siger en tydeligt tilfreds skipper, Carsten Hvid.
English: We are so lucky that a great number of the crew which will sail Havhingsten to Dublin have been with us since right at the beginning” said a clearly chuffed skipper, Carsten Hvid.

Danish: Vi er et sted ude midt i Det Irske Hav.
English: We are somewhere in the Irish Sea.

Danish: Der er tale om en større enkeltstående kulturbegivenhed, som kan opnå stor synlighed i kraft af arrangementets professionelle kvalitet.
English: We are talking about an exceptionally important cultural event, which can achieve considerable attention due to its professional quality.

Danish: Vi er på vej!!
English: We are underway !

Danish: Vi ankom her til aften, budt velkommen af øboer og sommerferiegæster.
English: We arrived tonight and was welcomed by islanders and summer tourist.

Danish: Vi glæder os til at være en del af dette og fungere som følgeskib,” slutter John Robertson.
English: We at Seatrek are enthusiastic being able to be part of the expedition as support vessel,” John Robertson states.

Danish: Tilført lidt ris, øl, vin og whisky fik vi den aften konsumeret ca. 40 kg kød.
English: We ate about 40 kilos of meat that night, added some rice, beer, wine and whisky.

Danish: Vi har undgået Pentland Firth mellem Skotland og Orkney, fordi tidevandet giver strøm på op til 12 knob, og vi har sejlet ved Mull ved Vestskotland, hvor tidevandet, på grund af undergrundens beskaffenhed, gav strømhvirvler, der trak Havhingsten fra side til side mellem de kraftige hvirvler.
English: We avoided Pentland Firth between Scotland and the Orkneys because the tide gives currents up to 12 knots, and off the isle of Mull in western Scotland, where the shape of the sea bottom makes the tide give powerful eddies, we experienced how these pulled the Sea Stallion from side to side.

Danish: Vi mener at Gokstadbåden oprindeligt var en regattabåd.
English: We believe that the Gokstad boat was originally a regatta boat.

Danish: Vi bygger med kopier af det oprindelige værktøj og bruger fortidens metoder og teknikker.
English: We build with replicas of the original tools and use the methods and techniques of early medieval boatbuilders.

Danish: Vikingeskibsmuseet kalder det 'Open Source bådebygning', og det vil være muligt for andre bådebygningsinteresserede selv at prøve kræfter med et tilsvarende byggeprojekt.
English: We call it open source boatbuilding and it's also possible for others to try their hand at building their own version of the Gislinge Boat.

Danish: Vi kalder det for ens ”sove buddy”.
English: We call this for one’s “sleeping buddy”.

Danish: Vi kan også tilbyde større arrangementer i Vikingeskibshallen.
English: We can also offer bigger events in The Viking Ship Hall.

Danish: Vi kan være behjælpelig med yderligere pressemateriale, filmklip af Havhingsten og kontakt til skibets besætning.
English: We can assist with additional press material, film clips of the Sea Stallion and contact with the ship's crew.

Danish: Vi kan dele de skriftlige kilder op i flere kategorier som krøniker, sagaer og skjaldekvad.
English: We can divide the written sources up into several categories such as chronicles, sagas and skaldic epics.

Danish: Vi udnytter træet langt bedre ved at save bordene ud, så får vi mange flere bordplanker, end hvis det blev kløvet.
English: We can get the most use out of the tree by sawing the planks - in this way we get more planks than we would have if we the tree had been cleaved.

Danish: Vi kan nu kigge på det originale skib fra et helt andet perspektiv: Mange års samlede erfaringer med fortolkning og rekonstruktion af arkæologiske skibsfund, med al den viden og iboende forståelser det medfører.
English: We can now look at the original ship find from a completely different perspective: one of many years collective experience in the interpretation and reconstruction of archaeological ships, with all the insight and inherent understanding that affords.

Danish: De kan bogstavelig talt følge med i arbejdet på værftet, mens det sker”, forklarer Tríona.
English: We can quite literally let them follow the work over at the boatyard, as it happens”, explains Tríona.

Danish: Strømmens styrke og retning kan vi aflæse i kort og tabeller.
English: We can read the strength and direction of the current in charts and tables.

Danish: Alt det kan vi se på det originale skib, og årsagen til reparationen virker ret indlysende nu, hvor vi sejler rundt herovre i tidevandsområdet.
English: We can see all this on the original ship, and the reason for the repair seems quite clear now when we sail around in tidal waters.

Danish: Vi kan tilbageholde tilbagebetalingen, indtil vi har modtaget varerne retur, eller du har fremlagt dokumentation for at have returneret varerne, alt efter hvad der er tidligst.
English: We can withhold the return payment until we have received the returned item again, or you have provided documentation proving that you have returned the item, whichever occurs first.

Danish: Vi vil ikke acceptere, at den risiko bliver øget ved at tillade alkohol ombord - heller ikke i små mængder.
English: We cannot accept an increase of that risk by adding alcohol to the equation – not even in small amounts.

Danish: Vinden kan vi ikke bestemme over!
English: We cannot master the wind!

Danish: Overvejer om vi i stedet skulle ro.
English: We consider rowing instead.

Danish: Det kunne vi ikke have gjort, hvis ikke træet var retvokset, så måtte den kløves ud for at følge træets fibre.
English: We could not have done this if the tree hadn't been straight-growing; then we would have had to cleave them in order to follow the tree's fibres.

Danish: Vi skar de to nye planker ud med kædesav, for at spare tid og materiale.
English: We cut the two new planks out using a chain saw, to save both time and materials.

Danish: Vi betegner arbejdet som ”eksperimentel arkæologi”–ikke fordi det gennemføres af arkæologer, men fordi betegnelsen indeholder et udsagn om arbejdets grundlæggende holdning og intention: Vi betragter et skibsfund som kilde til en omfattende og kompleks kulturhistorisk viden.
English: We define the work as ‘ experimental archaeology’ , not because it is performed by archaeologists, but because the designation contains an expression of the work's basic attitude and intention.

Danish: Vi gjorde det på en anden måde end vi plejer, så vi kunne være flere folk til at stramme op.
English: We did it in a different way, than we had done before, so more people could be included in tightening the rope.

Danish: Det troede vi ikke selv på, da vi stod i skoven i foråret og forsøgte os med det ene træ efter det andet.
English: We didn't really believe in it ourselves as we tried with one tree after the other out in the forest.

Danish: Vikingeskibsmuseet selv gjorde vi os ikke de store tanker om dengang.
English: We didn't think a lot about the Viking Ship Museum itself.

Danish: Det troede vi ikke selv på, da vi stod i skoven i foråret og forsøgte os med det ene træ efter det andet.
English: We didn’t really believe in it ourselves as we tried with one tree after the other out in the forest.

Danish: Der findes ingen kilder eller lovtekster fra Vikingetiden, som omtaler en sygepasser om bord på krigsskibene.
English: We do not know for certain whether the boat builder (filungar) was part of the permanent crew on the big longships of Viking times.

Danish: Vi ved ikke i dag, i hvor stort et omfang man har brugt hudreb i skibene i forhold til fx. basttov, og hvor meget det har varieret efter geografiske forhold, skibstype, farvand, tidsperiode, ændrede ressourcer mv.
English: We do not know today the extent to which hide rope was used in the ships relative to, for example, bast rope and how much this has varied with geographical situation, type of ship, operational waters, period, changing resources etc.

Danish: Vi ved ikke, hvorfor skibet er bygget på denne måde, men byggeriet og reparationerne er udført af dygtige bådebyggere.
English: We do not know why the ship is built this way, but the construction and repairs are carried out by skilled boatbuilders.

Danish: Det gør vi, fordi det er så uhørt vigtigt for os at gennemføre denne enestående sejlads og den forskning, som følger i kølvandet,” siger Preben Rather Sørensen, som er Vikingeskibsmuseets leder af projektet.
English: We do that because it is so tremendously important to us to see this thing through - the voyage and the research following in its wake,” says Preben Rather Sørensen, who is the leader of the project for the Viking Ship Museum.

Danish: Det gør vi, fordi det er så uhørt vigtigt for os at gennemføre denne enestående sejlads og den forskning, som følger i kølvandet,” siger Preben Rather Sørensen, som er Vikingeskibsmuseets leder af projektet.
English: We do that because it is so tremendously important to us to see this thing through – the voyage and the research following in its wake,” says Preben Rather Sørensen, who is the leader of the project for the Viking Ship Museum.

Danish: Vi ved ikke, hvordan færinger byggede både i 1600-tallet.
English: We don’t know how the Faroe Islanders built boats in the 17th century.

Danish: Vi finder skibe – nogle gange med last.
English: We find ships – sometimes with cargo.

Danish: Vi får en tid hos hende.
English: We get an appointment.

Danish: Vi lærer hinanden at kende på godt og ondt.
English: We get to know each other for good and bad.

Danish: Vi havde et utroligt sammenhold i familien.
English: We had a great family unit.

Danish: Vi havde lige nået hinanden - nået det punkt, hvor snakken blev mere personlig, humoren mere indspist og vi slappede fuldstændigt af i hinandens selskab.
English: We had just come to know each other, reached that point where we went from small talk to more personal stories, the humour was more intimate and we were completely relaxed with each other.

Danish: Vi har 90 pk á 18 skiver med til en uge.
English: We have 90 packages of 18 loafs for a week.

Danish: Havhingsten fra Glendalough nærmer sig målet!
English: We have almost reached our target!

Danish: Vi har bedt en tegner illustrere seks forskellige personer om bord på skibet.
English: We have asked an illustrator to draw six characters on board the ship.

Danish: Vi har været af sted i fire en halv uge.
English: We have been away for four and half weeks.

Danish: Vi har fået til opgave at bygge en jolle til en galease.
English: We have been commissioned to build a dinghy for a ketch.

Danish: Derfor har vi fravalgt rigtig mange ting, som folk sikkert vil savne i sådan en tidskapsel.
English: We have been forced to omit a large number of things that people will feel should have been included in a Time Capsule like this.

Danish: Vi er blevet modtaget med åbne arme i Peel på Isle of Man.
English: We have been welcomed with open arms here in Peel on the Isle of Man.

Danish: Vi har valgt at bygge rekonstruktioner så tro mod originalskibene, som muligt.
English: We have chosen to build reconstructions that are as close to the original ships as possible.

Danish: Vi har valgt at fremstille alle rundholterne af rødgran fra Tisvilde Hegn.
English: We have chosen to make all of the spars from spruce from Tisvilde Hegn.

Danish: Vi har valgt at male udvendigt med tjære blandet med kønrøg (sod fra afbrændning af organiske stoffer) og gul okker blandet med linolie.
English: We have chosen to paint the outside with tar mixed with carbon-black (soot from the burning of organic material) and yellow ochre mixed with linseed oil.

Danish: Vi har samlet billedserier fra madeventyret her:
English: We have collected images from the food adventure here:

Danish: Vi har samlet en lille del af billederne, der til sammen giver et godt indtryk af de mange timer samarbejde om at sikre vikingeskibene.
English: We have compiled a small portion of the images, giving a good impression of the many hours of collaboration to ensure the the Viking ships.

Danish: Vi har samlet en lille del af de mange billeder, der til sammen givet et godt indtryk af de mange timer samarbejde om at sikre vikingeskibene.
English: We have compiled a small portion of the images, giving a good impression of the many hours of collaboration to ensure the the Viking ships.

Danish: Nu, hvor alt er samlet under samme tag, har vi valgt at samle de to grupper af abonnenter.
English: We have decided to combine the two groups of subscribers now that everything has been gathered under one site.

Danish: Enten har vi valgt emnerne i skoven, i kronerne på egetræerne, eller også har vi udvalgt dem på savværker og fået dem skåret op i bestemte dimentioner.
English: We have either selected them from the forest and taken them from the crowns of oak trees, or they have been chosen at sawmills, where they were cut to the correct dimensions.

Danish: Vi har samlet et udvalg af de mange artikler her.
English: We have gathered a selection of the many articles here.

Danish: Vi har ikke haft problemer med skibet overhovedet”, siger Preben Rather Sørensen.
English: We have had no problems with the ship at all”, says Preben Rather Sørensen.

Danish: Alligevel er vi blevet blæst omkuld af den gigantiske interesse for Havhingstens togt til Irland.
English: We have however been blown away by the huge interest in the voyage of the Sea Stallion to Ireland.

Danish: Vi har inviteret producenter, der arbejder for at fremme det gode måltid.
English: We have invited producers who are focused on improving a good meal.

Danish: Vi har hele tiden vidst, at vi havde en god historie at fortælle.
English: We have known all along that we have a good tale to tell.

Danish: Vi har løftet sammen og alle har mærket, at man var en del af en helhed”, siger Claus Laage-Thomsen.
English: We have lifted in unison and everyone has felt that we’ve been part of a whole,” says Claus Laage-Thomsen.

Danish: Projektet kalder vi Fuldblod på havet.
English: We have named the project ”Stallion of the Sea”.

Danish: Når I kommer til Slesvisg, så råb SAMMEN til folket den gode slesvig-sønderjyske hilsen : "MOJN" .
English: We have no evidence for the use of saws in Viking Age and Early Medieval boatbuilding, so the axe is the primary tool used for shaping the timbers.

Danish: Der er fundet forskellige løsfund af ror fra vikingetiden.
English: We have not yet decided exactly which type of rudder we will copy for the new Gislinge boat.

Danish: Vi har endnu ikke besluttet os for hvilket ror vi skal kopiere til denne nye Gislingebåd.
English: We have not yet decided exactly which type of rudder we will copy for the new Gislinge boat.

Danish: Vi har samlet et lille udvalg af billeder fra sejladsen til Norge.
English: We have placed a selection of photos from the sail to Norway.

Danish: Vi har indkøbt et stort egetræ til bygningen af denne lille båd.
English: We have purchased a large oak tree for the construction of this small boat.

Danish: Andre variabler har vi målt: Vindretningen, vindstyrken og sejlarealet.
English: We have recorded the other variables: Wind direction, wind force and sail area.

Danish: Muligheden for den længste enkelte sejlads i Havhingstens historie er til stede i de kommende døgn.
English: We have the opportunity for the longest single voyage in the Sea Stallion's existence in the next few days.

Danish: Derfor har vi sikret alle oplysninger ved en fuldstændig udgravning, gennemført af marinarkæologer, og nu skal vi så til selve bjærgningen af de mange stykker skibstømmer”.
English: We have therefore ensured the recovery of as much information as possible by undertaking a full excavation, carried out by maritime archaeologists, and now we’ve reached the point where we can begin raising the many pieces of the ship”.

Danish: Vi har trænet i to et halvt år til dette og har hele tiden været forfulgt at alt for godt vejr.
English: We have trained for two years and have always had brilliant weather.

Danish: På hele denne tur har vi forsøgt at arbejde med tidevandet, forlade havne så strømmen passede og komme i havn med tidevand og strøm.
English: We have tried to work with the tides on the whole voyage: leaving harbours with the tide and arriving in harbours with the tide.

Danish: De 7000 skiver, vi havde fået leveret fra Kohberg, har vi ikke helt kunnet spise os igennem, men holdbarhedstiden (som var 30 dage) er udløbet, og skønt vi må sige, at brødet har holdt sig utrolig godt og været frisk længe, er det nu slut.
English: We haven't been able to eat all 7000 slices we ordered from Kohberg, and now the life of the bread (which was 30 days) has expired.

Danish: Sønnerne hører vi ikke mere om, men datteren Gytha blev gift med Vladimir Monomach, storfyrste af Kiev.
English: We hear nothing more of the sons, but the daughter, Gytha, married Vladimir Monomach, Grand Duke of Kiev.

Danish: Vi håber, at der kommer tusindvis af glade mennesker for at hilse på og sige farvel.
English: We hope that thousands of happy people will come to say hello and say farewell.

Danish: Så er der lagt lidt billeder på - og skalnok forsøge at fålagt lidt flere på fremtidige blogs
English: We hope you'll enjoy following the rest of the project, we'll do our best to keep sharing as much as we can.

Danish: Vi håber på, med tiden, at få den samme erfaring, så vi kan bygge jollerne uden skabeloner - det kræver at vi bygger mange både..
English: We hope, with time, to build up the same level of skill so that we too can build by eye.

Danish: Vi ved jo, at de er derude!"
English: We know it's out there somewhere!

Danish: Vi ved jo, at de er derude!"
English: We know it’s out there somewhere!

Danish: Vi kender forskellige tiders skibstyper fra helleristninger, billedsten, mønter, kirkevæge og lofter, og meget andet.
English: We know of different types of ships from different eras through petroglyphs, picture stones, coins, church walls and ceilings, and much more.

Danish: At vikingerne kendte til hjulblokke, ved vi fra et arkæologisk fund fra Hedeby.
English: We know the Vikings knew about pulleys from an archaeological find at Hedeby.

Danish: Skakbrikkerne kan dateres på baggrund af den kunstneriske stil, der er brugt især på kongerne, dronningerne og nogle af løberne (biskopperne).
English: We know very little about why the Lewis Chessmen were concealed in the sand dunes, and how they were actually discovered.

Danish: For eksempel ved vi, at Harald Hårderåde under et overfald på byen i 1050 nedbrændte kirken.
English: We know, for example, that Harold Hardrada burnt down the church during an attack on the town in AD 1050.

Danish: Vi fik større bevidsthed om, at værktøj kan være udformet, slebet og brugt på forskellige måder.
English: We learned more about how tools can be shaped, ground and used in different ways.

Danish: Afgang kl. 11.00
English: We leave at 11.00

Danish: Efter en god lammegryde på fregattens banjedækket sejlede vi fra Ebeltoft tirsdag aften.
English: We left Ebeltoft Tuesday night after a good lamb stew on the canon deck of the Frigate Jylland.

Danish: Vi forlod Isle of Man i morges klokken 09:00.
English: We left Isle of Man this morning at 09:00 a.m.

Danish: vi lod de blodige kroppe blive livløse".
English: we let the bloody bodies lie lifeless".

Danish: På Havhingsten lever vi i en boble - en osteklokke uden interesse forverden omkring os.
English: We live in a bubble on the Sea Stallion – a goldfish bowl cut off from the world around us.

Danish: Vi glæder os til at møde dig.
English: We look forward to meeting you

Danish: Blot en nysgerrighed og interesse.
English: We look forward to seeing you.

Danish: Vi monterede en fisk langskibs (en tyk, bred planke i niveau med dørken i centerlinien) i næsten hele skibets længde.
English: We mounted a fish (a thick broad plank level with the flooring on the centre line) along almost the whole length of the ship.

Danish: Man må gå ud fra, at de ikke lige som os, har sejlet alene med ét skib, men derimod med en hel flåde af skibe, bestående af både langskibe og forsyningsskibe.
English: We must assume that, unlike us, they will not have sailed with just one ship but, on the contrary, with a whole fleet of ships consisting of both longships and supply ships.

Danish: Vi må afsted igen og gennemføre nye forsøg…
English: We must away again and carry out new experiments…

Danish: Vi må aldrig presse for hårdt på og gå på kompromis.
English: We must never push our luck and compromise safety.

Danish: Vi skal sejle på havet og sejle med vinden som drivkraft, være afhængig af vejrets luner og døgnets vekslen.
English: We must sail on the sea with the wind driving us, and we will be dependent on the whims of the weather and the cycle of the days.

Danish: Ingen skal være i tvivl om, at vi har brug for al den støtte, vi kan få,” siger Vikingeskibsmuseets direktør, Tinna Damgård-Sørensen.
English: We need all the success we can get - no doubt about that,” Tinna Damgaard-Soerensen, the Viking Ship Museum director says.

Danish: Vi kan bemærke, at Snorres opremsning af byggeriets deltagere er hierakisk - Først nævnes kongen som bygmester, så Torberg som stævnsmed, så skibsbyggerne (dem der samler skibet), så dem der hugger tømmeret til, så dem der smeder naglerne, og tilsidst dem, som blot kører tømmeret.
English: We note that Snorri's listing of those taking part in the building is hierarchic - First the kings is named as responsible for building the ship, then Thorberg as the stem-smith, then the shipbuilders (those who construct the ship), then those who shape the timber, those who forge the nails and finally those who merely carry the timber.

Danish: Vi iagttager teknisk excellence, social interaktion og den effektive erobring af havet som et landskab, der ellers er lukket for mennesker grundet deres biologi.
English: We observe technical excellence, social interaction and the efficient conquest of the sea as a landscape otherwise closed to humans because of their biology.

Danish: Der ydes 25 % rabat til andre museer.
English: We offer a 25% discount for museums.

Danish: Denne båd bygger vi ofte for andre museer, når vi arbejder på udstillinger i udlandet.
English: We often build this boat for other museums when we work on exhibitions abroad.

Danish: Vi har kun den ene ombord.
English: We only have one of those on board.

Danish: Vi anvender sikkerhedsprotokollen SSL (Secure Socket Layer), hvilket sikrer, at dine betalingsoplysninger undervejs i bestillingsforløbet bliver krypteret og ulæselige for andre.
English: We operate the security protocol SSL (Secure Socket Layer) which ensures that your payment information is encrypted and unreadable for others while making transactions.

Danish: Uden for Vikingeskibsmuseets almindelige åbningstid arrangerer vi private selskaber og fester i Café Knarr.
English: We organize family celebrations and offers special events for groups with food workshop.

Danish: Vi ser det som vor opgave at aflæse så meget af denne viden som muligt med henblik på at opnå en større viden om det enkelte skibs konstruktion og sejlegenskaber samt at belyse en række kulturhistoriske problemstillinger, der berører samspillet mellem vikingetidens skibe og samfund.
English: We regard it as our task to discover as much of this knowledge as possible in order to achieve greater knowledge of the individual ship' s construction and sailing characteristics and to illustrate a number of cultural-historical issues that concern the interaction between Viking Age ships and society.

Danish: Vi ser det som vor opgave at aflæse så meget af denne viden som muligt med henblik på at opnå en større viden om det enkelte skibs konstruktion og sejlegenskaber samt at belyse en række kulturhistoriske problemstillinger, der berører samspillet mellem vikingetidens skibe og samfund.
English: We regard it as our task to discover as much of this knowledge as possible in order to achieve greater knowledge of the individual ship’ s construction and sailing characteristics and to illustrate a number of cultural-historical issues that concern the interaction between Viking Age ships and society.

Danish: Et skibsfund er en kilde til en omfattende og kompleks kulturhistorisk viden, og det er vores opgave at aflæse så meget af denne viden som muligt med henblik på at opnå en større viden om det enkelte skibs konstruktion og udrustning.
English: We regard it as our task to discover as much of this knowledge as possible, allowing us to achieve greater knowledge of the individual ship’s construction and equipment.

Danish: Vi nytolkede det sparsomme originalmateriale og fandt heri mulighed for at forstærke skibet.
English: We reinterpreted the sparse original material and found an option for strengthening the ship.

Danish: Den blev skiftet, fordi vi havde valgt et træ i skoven med en dårlig rod.
English: We replaced it, because we had picked a tree with a poor root.

Danish: Vi forbeholder os ret til at aflyse, hvis der ikke er deltagere nok eller vejret er en risiko for sikkerheden.
English: We reserve the right to cancel sailing trips if there are insufficient numbers or if the weather represents a safety risk.

Danish: Vi stævner ud fra Vikingeskibsmuseets havn kl. 18.00 og er tilbage kl. 21.30, lige inden solnedgang.
English: We sail out from the Viking Ship Museum's harbour at 18:00 and return again at 21:30, just before sunset.

Danish: Der sejles følgende aftener i 2018:
English: We sail the following evenings 2018:

Danish: Der sejles følgende aftner:
English: We sail the following evenings:

Danish: Vi sejler to-tre weekender forår og efterår på Roskilde Fjord, for at træne og ryste den store besætning sammen.
English: We sail two - three weekends spring and fall on the fjord of Roskilde, to train the crew.

Danish: Vi skandinaver må klare os uden vores næmest uundværlige rugbrød.
English: We Scandinavians will have to do without our almost indispensable rye bread.

Danish: Donationen fra Augustinus Fonden tager vi også som en anerkendelse af den forskning og formidling, som er et af Vikingeskibsmuseet varemærker,” slutter Preben Rather Sørensen.
English: We see the donation from the Augustinus Foundation as recognition of the research and communication; some of the trademarks of the Viking Ship Museum,” Preben Rather Sørensen concludes.

Danish: Vi satte sejl for en kort stund ved indsejlingen til Slesvig.
English: We set sail for a short while close to Schleswig.

Danish: Vi satte sejl for en kort stund ved indsejling…
English: We set sail for a short while…

Danish: Vi satte sejlet løst med bordtvinger før vi bestemte os hvor hullerne i skroget skulle bores
English: We set the sails loosely with screw clamp before we decided where the holes in the hull should be bored.

Danish: Vi bør derfor koncentrere vores kræfter om at udvikle de nye projekter, der kan flytte museet i fremtiden.
English: We should therefore concentrate our energies on developing new projects that can move the museum into the future.

Danish: Vi lægger ud med 4 timers roning fra Kirkwall.
English: We start by rowing for 4 hours from Kirkwall.

Danish: Vi tager udgangspunkt i de fem originale vikingeskib og fortæller historien om, hvordan det er lykkedes at genskabe de 1000 år gamle skibe, som sejlende eksempler på vikingernes fantastiske håndværk.
English: We start with the five original Viking ships and tell the story of how it was possible to reconstruct the 1,000-year-old ships as sailing examples of fantastic Viking Age craftsmanship.

Danish: Vi træder ned i udgravningen, går tæt på bådebyggerne, følger de sejlende rekonstruktioner på forsøgsrejser og dykker med marinarkæologerne under vand til sunkne verdener.
English: We step into the excavation of the Skuldelev ships, get close to the boatbuilders, follow the sailing reconstructions on trial voyages and dive with the maritime archaeologists to sunken, underwater worlds.

Danish: Vi har stadig forskellige forsøg, vi gerne vil gennemføre.
English: We still have various experiments we would like to carry out.

Danish: Vi mangler fortsat omkring 7 millioner for at opfylde vores ambitioner for næste års sejlads, men Nordea Danmark-fondens bidrag styrker troen på, at vi når det", slutter Tinna Damgård-Sørensen.
English: We still need about DKK 7m to fulfil our ambitions for next year's voyage, but the Nordea Denmark Foundation's contribution strengthens our belief that we will make it,” concludes Tinna Damgård-Sørensen.

Danish: Vi mangler fortsat omkring 7 millioner for at opfylde vores ambitioner for næste års sejlads, men Nordea Danmark-fondens bidrag styrker troen på, at vi når det", slutter Tinna Damgård-Sørensen.
English: We still need about DKK 7m to fulfil our ambitions for next year’s voyage, but the Nordea Denmark Foundation’s contribution strengthens our belief that we will make it,” concludes Tinna Damgård-Sørensen.

Danish: Vi provianterer fortsat til 5-7-dage uden indkøbsmuligheder, så vi både kan sejle løs, når vejret er til det og gå i land i naturhavne, hvor der ingen butukker er.
English: We still provision for 5-7 days without shopping possibilites, so that we can sail a lot when the weather is up for it and put in at natural harbors where there are no shops.

Danish: Natkassen findes igen frem og en håndfuld rosiner og en kop varm te kvikker lidt op.
English: We take out the night box again and a handful of raisins and a hot cup of tea work wonders.

Danish: Denne metode mener vi har været brugt i vikingetiden også.
English: We think that this method was also used in the Viking Age.

Danish: Vi tog igen sejlet ned, og Havhingsten lagde sig på tværs i søen, heldigvis helt uden at tage søer over siden.
English: We took down the sail and soon the Sea Stallion lay across the swell, luckily without taking in water.

Danish: Tre reb blev taget i sejlet.
English: We took three reefs in the sail.

Danish: Vi forstod hvad projektet og Vikingeskibsmuseets mange aktiviteter i øvrigt betyder for en by som Roskilde.
English: We understood what the project and the Viking Ship Museum’s many other activities mean for a city like Roskilde.

Danish: Vi bruger rødgran fordi den er let og fordi vi kan få fat i gode langsomtvoksede, rette rødgraner.
English: We use Norwegian spruce because it is light and because it provides good, slow-grown, straight timbers.

Danish: Vi bruger kunsthamp, det ligner naturfibre og er langt mere holdbart og iøvrigt vedligeholdelsesfrit.
English: We use synthetic hemp, which looks like a natural fibre but lasts longer and doesn't require any maintenance.

Danish: Vi benytter os af de råvarer, der var kendt af vikingerne, så her er hverken kartofler, tomater eller agurker, men fladbrød, kvan, havtorn og perlebyg.
English: We use the raw materials which were known by the Vikings, so there is neither potatoes, tomatoes or cucumbers, but flatbread, angelica, sea buckthorn and pearl barley.

Danish: Vi bruger kobberklinknagler til Drivkvasen, fordi de holder bedre end jernnagler.
English: We used copper clinker nails for the drifter, because they last better than iron nails.

Danish: Vi venter.
English: We wait.

Danish: Vi vil vise folk i Kina, hvordan vikingerne havde et særligt forhold til deres skibe.
English: We want to show people in China the special relationship the Vikings had with their ships.

Danish: Ved havnen blev vi mødt af hurra råb fra besætningerne på Roar Ege og Sif Ege (rekonstruktioner af Skuldelev 3) samt Lindheim Sunds (rekonstruktion af Skuldelev 5)
English: We were met by cheers from the crew of Roar Ege and Sif Ege (both reconstructions of Skuldelev 3) as well as Lindheim Sunds (a reconstruction of Skuldelev 5) at the harbour.

Danish: Projektet er også nyskabende indenfor videnskabelig forskning og formidling… vi vil så at sige formidle vores forskning, mens den foregår… mens skibet sejler.
English: We will be communicating the project while it’s happening…… while the ship is sailing.

Danish: Vi gennemgår de historiske byggemetoder, der dannede grundlag for 300 års maritim dominans (750-1050), koloniseringen af Island og Grønland og opdagelsen af Amerika.
English: We will explore the historical construction methods, which formed the foundation for 300 years’ maritime dominance (750-1050), and lead to the colonisation of Iceland and Greenland, and the discovery of America.

Danish: Vi følger efter Erik den Røde som for mere end 1000 år siden sejlede han med 25 vikingeskibe og 700 mand fra Island til Grønland.
English: We will follow in the wake of Eric the Red, who more than 1,000 years ago sailed from Iceland to Greenland with 25 Viking ships and 700 men.

Danish: Vi beregner os porto ved ombytning.
English: We will pay the cost of postage for returns.

Danish: Vi sejler i Vikingeskibsmuseets traditionelle, nordiske både, som er direkte efterkommere af vikingeskibene.
English: We will sail in one of the Viking Ship Museum's traditional nordic boats which are direct decendants of the viking ships.

Danish: Vi udvinder jern fra myremalm i ovne og viser, hvordan vikingerne for 1000 år siden skaffede sig et af datidens mest eftertragtede materialer, som smeden forarbejder til skibsnagler og værktøj.
English: We will smelt iron from bog ore in a furnace and demonstrate how the Vikings acquired one of the most sought after materials of the day, 1000 years ago.

Danish: Her kommer vi svaret nærmere gennem selve forsøgsrejsen fra Roskilde til Dublin, men også under en række kontrollerede testsejladser undervejs og i Det Irske Hav,” forklarer Tinna Damgård-Sørensen.
English: We will try and get closer to an answer during the sail from Roskilde to Dublin, but also during a number of shorter and controlled test sails in the Irish Sea,” Tinna Damgård-Sørensen explains.

Danish: Må se om vi kan få løst problemet i morgen, så jeg kan få indhentet alle de historier, der er at fortælle fra de seneste dages rejse.
English: We will try to solve the problem tomorrow, so I can catch up on all of the stories to tell about the voyage the last few days.

Danish: Mange hilsener fra Toni
English: We wish you good luck :)

Danish: Roret ville være det 8. eller10. ror, vi havde, fordi de andre var blevet slidt af birketræs-rorvidjerne.
English: We would be on our 8th or 10th rudder, because the others would have been worn out by the birch tackle.

Danish: Vi lagde til kaj i de små havne eller med anker i de mange skønne bugter langs fjorden.
English: We would dock in the small harbours or lie at anchor in the many beautiful bays around the fjord.

Danish: Det gav ingen mening at udtale sig om Skuldelev 2´s sejlegenskaber, hvis skibet kun blev testet i de danske farvande.
English: We wouldn't be able to say anything about Skuldelev 2's sailing characteristics if the ship was only tested in Danish waters.

Danish: Det gav ingen mening at udtale sig om Skuldelev 2´s sejlegenskaber, hvis skibet kun blev testet i de danske farvande.
English: We wouldn’t be able to say anything about Skuldelev 2’s sailing characteristics if the ship was only tested in Danish waters.

Danish: - Vi "praler" jo hele tiden af, at Havhingsten krydser så godt...
English: We ‘boast’ all the time that the Sea Stallion is good at tacking...

Danish: Vi havde talt om, at vi burde tjekke...
English: We'd been talking about...

Danish: Hilsen EstherMogens
English: We'll keep you posted!

Danish: I smedeugen udvindes jern fra myremalm som er gravet op af den danske undergrund.
English: We'll light up the fire, so you can burn tar from pine.

Danish: Vi er klar.... nu vil vi bare gerne snart af sted.
English: We're ready... now we just want to be off.

Danish: Vi er kun lige begyndt at udforske det potentiale, den digitale formidling giver, i forhold til at få folk interesseret og engageret i bådebygning og andre maritime håndværk, og det virker som om vi er på det rette spor”, konkluderer Tríona.
English: We've really only just started exploring the potential digital communication has in terms of getting people interested and involved in boatbuilding and other maritime crafts, but seeing the work being done by Edvards and others makes it seem as though we're on the right track”, concludes Tríona.

Danish: Våben
English: Weapons

Danish: Våben og udrustning
English: Weapons and Equipment

Danish: Våben fundet i vikingegrave ved Kilmainham og Islandbridge, Dublin.
English: Weapons found in Viking graves at Kilmainham and Islandbridge, Dublin.

Danish: Vejrdata fra skibe og bøjer ude på åbent hav.
English: Weather data from ships and buoys on the open sea.

Danish: Vejrradar som for eksempel registrerer nedbør.
English: Weather radar monitoring rainfall for example.

Danish: Vejr og vind:
English: Weather:

Danish: Vejret
English: Weather:

Danish: Vævning af et hørsejl til Gislingebåden
English: Weaving a sail of flax for the Gislinge Boat

Danish: Vævning af et hørsejl til Gislingebåden.
English: Weaving a sail of flax for the Gislinge Boat

Danish: Onsdag d. 23/8: Pernille Stockfleth og Annemarie Krarup kl. 11.00, 13.00 og 15.00
English: Wednesday 23/8: Pernille Stockfleth and Laura Kamis Wrang, 11:00, 13:00 and 15:00

Danish: Onsdag den 6. september kl. 10.00 starter bådebyggerne arbejdet med at kløve en 8 meter lang egestamme med en diameter på ca. 1 meter.
English: Wednesday 6th September at 10:00, the boatbuilders will begin cleaving an 8 meter long oak log with a diameter of ca. 1m.

Danish: Herefter blev besætningen budt på middag med Wicklow-lam.
English: Wednesday evening there was a reception in the City Hall of Dublin.

Danish: Onsdag den 1. august, 2007
English: Wednesday, August 1st, 2007

Danish: Hverdage
English: Weekdays

Danish: Weekender
English: Weekends

Danish: Vejning og generobring af Irland
English: Weighing and the reconquest of Ireland

Danish: Vægt (fuldt bemandet): 25 ton
English: Weight (fully manned): 25 ton

Danish: Vægt:
English: Weight:

Danish: Miniaturesværd i Bronze
English: Weights in Bronze

Danish: Velkommen om bord
English: Welcome aboard

Danish: Velkommen hjem!
English: Welcome home!

Danish: Velkommen om bord!
English: Welcome on board!

Danish: Velkommen ombord!
English: Welcome on board.

Danish: Velkommen til bådeværftet
English: Welcome to the boatyard

Danish: Velkommen til Vikingeskibsmuseets webshop, hvor du kan finde tøj, smykker, bøger og brugsgenstande af høj kvalitet samt hente inspiration til den specielle gave.
English: Welcome to the Viking Ship Museum shop, we hope you will find both inspiration and what you're looking for.

Danish: Vikingeskibsmuseet i Roskilde er mere end et museum.
English: Welcome to the Viking Ship Museum's Boat Guilds

Danish: Ja, det stammer fra de nordiske sagaer, hvor de smukke, men frygtindgydende krigsskibe på lyrisk vis blev omtalt som ’havhest’ og ’bølgehingst’.
English: Well, it stems from the Nordic sagas, where striking and fearsome warships were lyrically referred to as ‘havhest’ and ‘bølgehingst’ – meaning ‘sea horse’ and ‘wave horse’.

Danish: Tja... det er jo forskelligt fra situation til situation.
English: Well... that can vary from situation to situation.

Danish: Er mødet med vikingerne kun negativt som det er beskrevet I bl.a. de irske Annaler?
English: Were the Irish peoples' encounters with the Vikings only negative as, for example, described in the Irish Annals?

Danish: Var vikingerne en samlet gruppe i Irland?
English: Were the Vikings a united group in Ireland?

Danish: Var vikingerne kun plyndringsmænd i England?
English: Were the Vikings only plunderers in England?

Danish: Dette fund blev dengang betegnet som den største tekstilhistoriske begivenhed i Europa, ikke mindst fordi dragterne viste, at heroppe højt mod nord havde nordboerne på trods af deres relative afsondrethed fulgt tidens europæiske mode.
English: Were the Vikings, as contemporary description had it, “a valiant, wrathful, foreign, purely pagan people who swept in from the sea to plunder and slaughter”?

Danish: Var der nogen store problemer undervejs?
English: Were there any problems underway?

Danish: Og mente de allesammen det samme?
English: Were they all of the same opinion?

Danish: Mon de først skal bruges på land eller skød man pile fra skib til skib?
English: Were they intended to be used once the ship reached land or were many arrows shot from ship to ship?

Danish: Werner Karrasch - Fotografier 1991-2016
English: Werner Karrasch - Photos 1991 - 2016

Danish: Werner Karrasch har udviklet et særligt billedsprog, der tegner museets profil og er et visuelt bidrag til vores kulturarv.
English: Werner Karrasch has developed a distinctive imagery, which expresses the Museum's profile and contribute visually to our cultural heritage.

Danish: Werner Karrasch portræt
English: Werner Karrasch portrait

Danish: Werner Karrasch, Vikingeskibsmuseet.
English: Werner Karrasch, The Viking Ship Museum.

Danish: Werner Karrasch
English: Werner Karrash

Danish: Vi kommer med fred”, understreger Louise efter at have fortalt om de dramatiske begivenheder i fortiden og spørger efter flere spørgsmål fra børnene.
English: We’ve come in peace,” emphasised Louise, after she had talked about the dramatic events of the past and asks if the children have any more questions.

Danish: Hvordan er sprog, handlingsforløb, særlige kendetegn etc.
English: What about the language, the plot, special characteristics etc.?

Danish: Hvad oplever han?
English: What are his experinces?

Danish: Jeg kan hans svare bedrifters skare.
English: What are they good at - or not so good at?

Danish: Hvad venter vi på?
English: What are we waiting for?

Danish: Fælles for dem alle var, at de havde meldt sig til, at deltage i Vikingeskibsmuseet store eksperimental arkæologiske projekt og forsøgrejsen fra Roskilde til Dublin tur/retur.
English: What brings them all together is the adventure and the facts that they have listed to help the Viking Ship Museum complete the biggest eksperiment in eksperimental archaeology ever - the trial voyage from Roskilde to Dublin and back.

Danish: Hvad kan man sige om hastigheden i forhold til vindretningen?
English: What can be said of the speed relative to the speed of the wind?

Danish: Hvad kan man sige om vikingernes udseende ud fra dem?
English: What can these tell us about the Vikings' appearance?

Danish: Hvad kendetegner et skjaldekvad?
English: What characterises a skaldic epic?

Danish: Hvad kan de skyldes?
English: What could be the reason(s) for this?

Danish: Det er eventyret, der tæller.
English: What counts is the adventure.

Danish: Hvad skal du styre for at blive på den beholdne kurs 211°?

English: When boatbuilders have to find the material for a floor timber or a knee in the forest, it is vital that the piece of timber has the same profile as the section of the boat where it is intended to sit.

Danish: Til bådebygning er et retvokset træ langt at foretrække, da det er lettere at hugge planker, der er lige tykke, hvis kløvestykerne ikke snor sig.

Danish: Til bådebygning er et retvokset træ langt at foretrække, da det er lettere at hugge planker, der er lige tykke, hvis kløvestykerne ikke snor sig.
English: When boatbuilding, a straight-growing tree is always optimal, as it is easier to produce planks with an even thickness if the cleaved sections aren’t twisted.

Danish: Når man skal bygge en esping vælger man et godt stort aspetræ i skoven, fælder det og hugger stammen i en passende længde.
English: When building an "esping", the first thing to do is to select a large aspen tree in the forest, fell it and cut the trunk to a suitable length.

Danish: Ved bygningen af denne båd, har bådebyggerne forsøgt at finde frem til de forholdstal der blev brugt på den oprindelige båd, da datidens bådebyggere fællede et træ og lavede en udspændt båd.
English: When building the boat, the boatbuilders have tried to work out the ratios that were used on the original boat, when the Viking Age boatbuilders felled the tree and made an expanded boat.

Danish: Da kristendommen kom til Danmark i løbet af vikingetiden, blev juledag faktisk regnet som årets første dag.

English: When Christmas Day approached he travelled towards London in order to be crowned King of England in Westminster Abbey.

Danish: Den angelsaksiske adelsmand Harold Godwinson var på daværende tidspunkt det bedste bud på en efterfølger og da Edward døde i januar 1066, påstod Godwinson, at kongen havde lovet ham tronen på sit dødsleje.
English: When Edward died in January AD 1066, Godwinson maintained that the king had promised him the throne on his deathbed and the very next day he had arranged his coronation, approved by Edward's closest advisors.

Danish: Da Edward Bekenderen i 1042 blev engelsk konge, gjorde han London til ét af kun tre mødesteder for det Kongelige Råd.
English: When Edward the Confessor became the English king in AD 1042 he made London one out of only three places of assembly for the Royal Council.

Danish: Da Æthelred den Rådvilde som ganske ung blev kronet som engelsk konge, gjorde han London til sin hovedstad.

English: When Harald’s father Gorm the Elder, was driven out of Hedeby he settled in Jelling, and the creation of the monument is undoubtedly a demonstration of the power of the family in a new area and a marking of both kings’ achievements.

English: When Harold Godwinson's children subsequently travelled to Roskilde to look for help from Svein, who was their farther's cousin, he chose in AD 1069 to support his brother Asbjörn's expedition to Northern England.

English: When Harold Godwinson, who was in York, received the news of the Normans' landing he is thought to have mobilised his army immediately towards Hastings.

Danish: Han afkølede fingeren i munden og da han smagte dragens blod, kunne han pludselig forstå fuglenes sang.
English: When he sucked the blood, tasting the dragon blood, he could suddenly understand the birds singing.

Danish: ”Det er ganske vist skjaldens skis at prise den mest, som de netop står foran, men ingen ville alligevel vove at fortælle en mand om bedrifter, han skulle have udført, hvis alle tilhørere vidste det var løgn og praleri.
English: When he was victorious in the battlefield he often described his actions in verse: “I have charged around with bloody blade and resounding spear the raven followed me, the Vikings attacked fiercely furiously we held the battlefields the fire raged over the houses of men we let the bloody bodies become lifeless”.

Danish: Når han havde sejret i kamp, beskrev han sin handling ved, at lave et vers om den.
English: When he won a battle he described his actions in verse:

English: When I think of the Vikings' warships and their original purpose, it certainly makes sense to transfer the elegant warship to the ministry dealing with foreign policy.

English: When it came to the point, their aim was not to provide us with an accurate body of material but to create an immortal work that would praise the tremendous exploit of William and his vassals!

Danish: Når egetræ kløves, sker det langs spejlet og langs træets fibrer.

English: When raising the ship parts, they are lifted one at a time, after which they are packed individually and transported to the Viking Ship Museum in Roskilde.

Danish: Når man rekonstruerer vikingernes skibe, må man kombinere forskellige metoder og indfaldsvinkler.

Danish: Når Saga Oseberg ikke testsejler ligger skibet hver dag i Vikingeskibsmuseets havn, hvor alle interesserede er velkomne til at kigge forbi og gå ombord.

Danish: Vi lagde ud med at krydse op gennem inderbredningen i Roskilde Fjord i ganske svag vind fra skiftende retninger.

Danish: Til servering kan kommes en klat smør eller honning i grøden og der kan drysses tørrede bær over.
