Danish: Da Sigurd var ung fortalte Regin ham historien om hvordan Loke havde slået den store fisker Ottar ihjel.
English: When Sigurd was young Regin told him the story of how The god Loki had killed the great fisherman Ottar.

Danish: Når man krydser op mod vinden er det vigtigt at vendingerne er så effektive som muligt, så man ikke sætter tid til eller, i snævre farvande, driver på grund.
English: When tacking against the wind it is important that the turns are as efficient as possible so that no time is lost or, in narrow waters, to avoid the ship going aground.

Danish: Når arkæologen bruger sin viden om de forskellige historiske perioder og sammenligner fundet med andre fundne genstande, begynder fundet af fortælle sin historie.
English: When the archaeologist uses his knowledge about the various historical periods and compares the find with other objects that have been found, the find starts to tell its story.

Danish: Da øksen blev sendt rundt spærrede børnene øjnene op over den stadigt skarpe æg og de indridsede runer i skaftet.
English: When the axe was handed round, the children were wide-eyed over the still sharp edge and the runes engraved on the shaft.

Danish: Når båden ikke bare driver i kraftens retning, skyldes det, at båden jo rager ned i vandet, hvor den "står fast" i vandet ved hjælp af, alt efter bådtype, en mere eller mindre markeret køl.
English: When the boat begins to move through the water with the aid of the wind's force, it will do so diagonally so that the keel causes the water flowing past to change direction in the same way as the sail influences the wind but in the opposite direction.

Danish: Når båden er færdig har den en bredere og dermed stabiliserende bund og den bliver en planke højere.
English: When the boat is finished it will have a broader and therefore more stable base and will also be one plank higher.

Danish: Når kærnemælken skiller tages gryden/lerkarret fra varmen og vallen sis fra gennem et løstvævet klæde.
English: When the buttermilk separates remove the vessel from the heat and sieve off the whey using a loosely woven cloth.

Danish: Når besætningen får besked på, at Havhingsten afsejler næste formiddag, sørger vi for at komme tilpas tidligt i seng.
English: When the crew is told that the Sea Stallion is to sail the next morning, everyone tries to get to bed suitably early.

Danish: Når besætningen får besked på, at Havhingsten afsejler næste formiddag, sørger vi for at komme...
English: When the crew is told that the Sea Stallion is to sail the next morning, everyone tries to get to...

Danish: Mange havde endvidere medbragt våde klude til daglig afvaskning af ansigt, hænder m.m. og når besætningen bader, medbringer mange deres tøj og får det vasket samtidig.
English: When the crewmembers went bathing, many took their clothes with them and washed them at the same time.

Danish: Da danerne blev kristne
English: When the Danes became Christians

Danish: Når forsøgsrejsen med Havhingsten er afsluttet, står den maritime arkæologi i Danmark imidlertid ved en milepæl.
English: When the experimental voyage with the Sea Stallion comes to an end, Danish Maritime Archaeology will have reached a milestone.

Danish: Når den første er færdig bærer slavinden karret videre til den næste, der fortsætter som den første, hvorefter hun bærer det fra den ene til den anden, indtil det har været hele raden rundt.
English: When the first has finished, the slave girl carries it to the next, who does the same, after which she carries it from one to another until it has been all the way round.

Danish: Når forskibet er på vej ned af en bølge, vrider agterskibet sig modsat på vej op ad den samme bølge.
English: When the fore ship is on the way down a swell, the stern twists the opposite way up the same swell.

Danish: Når fuldskala rekonstruktionen efter planen søsættes i oktober 2011, føjes der endnu en kapitel til vores viden om vikingetidens fartøjer.
English: When the full-scale reconstruction is launched according to schedule in October 2011, yet another chapter will be added to our knowledge of the Viking Age vessels.

Danish: Når båden er klædt op og spanterne lagt i er vi kun nået halvvejs.
English: When the hull is complete and the frames have been fitted, construction is still only half-finished.

Danish: Når køl og stævne er samlet skal det stilles nøjagtigt op, i lod og vatter.
English: When the keel and the stem are assembled, they must be raised precisely plumb and level.

Danish: Da kølen blev udgravet, bestod den af mange fragmenter, og kølbugten var derfor ukendt.
English: When the keel was excavated, it had broken into many fragments, so its rocker was unknown.

Danish: "Det er heller ikke noen annen mann jeg venter det mer av enn deg," sa kongen, "at du skulle ha lykke til å finne ut dette og fortelle meg det."
English: When the king came nearer he saw it was so, and said, with an oath, “The man shall die who has thus destroyed the vessel out of envy, if he can be discovered, and I shall bestow a great reward on whoever finds him out.”

Danish: Når lavtrykkene har etableret sig, kører de nærmest som biler i myldretidstrafikken i østlig retning mod kurs direkte mod Storbritannien og Danmark.
English: When the low-pressures have established themselves – almost like cars in rush hour traffic – they drive eastwards, unswervingly towards Great Britain and Denmark.

Danish: Når masten rejses haler både de 20 gaster i forstaget og de to gange seks gaster ved bidevindsvanterne.
English: When the mast is to be raised, the hauling is done by both the 20 fore stay hands and the two teams of six hands at the close-haul shrouds.

Danish: Når Mykinesmændene kom roende ind i en havn, lød der så kraftig ringlen, at man sagde, ”…at nu kommer Mykinesmændene”.
English: When the men from Mykines came rowing into a harbour, the ringing was so loud that people said "...here come the Mykines men".

Danish: Da den norske konge Magnus blev dansk konge i 1042 blev Svend udnævnt til jarl; ligesom hans far, Ulf Jarl havde været det under Knud den Store.
English: When the Norwegian king Magnus ascended the Danish throne in AD 1042, Svein was made an earl - just as his father had been under Cnut the Great.

Danish: Da den originale båd blev bygget omkring år 1030, var det som en forholdsvis lavbordet fiskerbåd med seks såkaldte bordgange, der udgør skibets sider.
English: When the original boat was built around the year 1030, it was as a relatively low-sided fishing boat with six so-called strakes, which formed the sides of the boat.

Danish: Når først faconnen på plankerne er som den skal være, skal plankerne passes helt til.
English: When the plank has aquired the right shape, it must then be adjusted.

Danish: Når hele Nordjyllands befolkning + turister
English: When the population of northern Jutland + tourists

Danish: Da rekonstruktionen blev søsat var der brugt 20.000 arbejdstimer - alene det håndslåede tovværk og håndvævede sejl kostede 5000 arbejdstimer.
English: When the reconstruction was launched it had consummed 20,000 working hours - the rope work and hand-wowen wool sail alone accounted for 5000 working hours.

Danish: Når de store søer kom rullende ind bagfra, løftede skibet sig så meget, at hele roret nogle gange var ude af vandet.
English: When the rought seas came from behind, the ship lifted up and the rutter wasn't in the water.

Danish: Når sejlet ligger nede på sine rågaljer, på langs i skibet, hejses det op til ca. midt på masten.
English: When the sail is lying on its yard gallows, along the length of the ship, it is raised about halfway up the mast.

Danish: Når skarene (samlingerne) er hugget til, kan bordet gøres fast med jernnagler.
English: When the scarfs (joints) are cut, the strake can be made fast with iron nails.

Danish: Da Havhingsten ankom til Dublin sidste sommer stod flere op mod hundrede tusinde mennesker samlet i havneområderne og hyldede det dansk/irske skib.
English: When the Sea Stallion arrived in Dublin last summer, several hundred thousand people lined the harbour to cheer the Danish-Irish ship.

Danish: Med Havhingstens ankomst til Dublin sidste år kom vikingetiden på skemaet for mange irske skolebørn.
English: When the Sea Stallion arrived in Dublin last year, the Viking Era came on the timetable for a lot of Irish schoolchildren.

Danish: Da Havhingsten ankom til Dublin den 14. august, broadcastede det irske nationale TV RTE hele begivenheden live på stationens hjemmeside og på Time Square i New York blev der vist billeder af skibet på en gigantisk billboard.
English: When the Sea Stallion arrived in Dublin on 14th August, the Irish national TV RTE broadcast the whole event live on their website, and pictures of the ship were shown on a giant billboard in Time Square in New York.

Danish: Mads Thomsen vil, efter Havhingstens ankomst til Roskilde og i samarbejde med kollegaer fra Københavns Universitet, indsamle prøver af de forskellige typer af fastsiddende organismer.
English: When the Sea Stallion arrives in Roskilde, Mads Thomsen and colleagues from the University of Copenhagen will collect samples of the various organisms that have attached themselves to the hull.

Danish: Da Havhingsten forlod Irland søndag den 6. juni vidste besætningen ikke, at de først skulle sætter fødderne på land 56 timer senere i Torquay i England.
English: When the Sea Stallion left Ireland on Sunday 6 July, the crew didn’t know that they would first set foot on land again 56 hours later in Torquay in England.

Danish: Når Havhingsten inden længe sejler mod Roskilde, vil et nyt projekt med biologisk og naturhistorisk karakter blive en del af forskningen og forsøgsrejsen.
English: When the Sea Stallion sets sail for Roskilde once more, a new biological and natural history project will form part of the research on the experimental voyage.

Danish: Når Havhingsten stikker til søs søndag den 1. juli med kurs mod Irland, har skibet tre store spørgsmål med i lasten:
English: When the Sea Stallion Sunday the 1st of July puts to sea bound for Ireland three major questions will be part of its cargo:

Danish: Da Havhingsten blev søsat for en uge siden sendte TV2 News live fra begivenheden.
English: When the Sea Stallion was launched last week TV2 News reported live from the happening.

Danish: Når Havhingstens togt og forskning skal formidles sker det, mens skibet sejler og via hjemmesiden.
English: When the Sea Stallion’s endeavour and research is communicated, as it happens while the ship sails via the homepage.

Danish: Da bopladsen var beboet, lå havniveauet lang lavere end i dag.
English: When the settlement was inhabited, the ocean level was much lower than it is today.

Danish: Da bopladsen var beboet, var Storstrømmen en dyb dal med vandløb og vådområder, og marinarkæologernes fund vidner netop om, at fortidens mennesker levede af råvarer fra både skov og hav.
English: When the settlements were inhabited, Storstrømmen was a deep valley with running streams and wetlands and the maritime archaeologists find bears witness to the fact that people in the past lived on resources from both the forest and the sea.

Danish: Når skibet er i havn, og besætningen går i land, har Havhingsten også en ankervagt, som skal holde øje med fortøjninger og skib.
English: When the ship is in port and the crew goes ashore the Sea Stallion also has an anchor watch keeping an eye on the moorings and the ship.

Danish: Når skibet sejler sover gasterne af sikkerhedsmæssige årsager med uldtæpper omkring sig.
English: When the ship is underway, the men sleep wrapped in woollen blankets for safety reasons.

Danish: Da skibet blev udgravet, var det deformeret og bestod af 2000 fragtmenter.
English: When the ship was excavated, it was deformed and broken into ca. 2000 fragments.

Danish: Da skibet blev søsat i 2004, fulgte 52 mio. tv-seere fra hele verden med i begivenheden, så vi har prøvet heftig international presseomtale før på Vikingeskibsmuseet.
English: When the ship was launched back in 2004, we had 52 million TV-viewers from around the world, so we have had to deal with massive international media attention before at the Viking Ship Museum.

Danish: Når de udsendte lyde rammer havbunden eller en genstand i vandet, bliver de kastet tilbage.
English: When the sound waves emitted by the transducer hit an object in the water, they are reflected back.

Danish: Når solen er dækket af skyer kommer selv solkompasset til kort.
English: When the sun is obscured by clouds even the sun compass has its limits.

Danish: Når træet er varmet tilstrækkeligt op, kan udspændningen begynde.
English: When the timber is suitably warm, the expansion can begin.

Danish: Når Vikingeskibsmuseet trækker deres både på land på lørdag, sker det blandt andet med hjælp fra store trækheste.
English: When the Viking Ship Museum pull their boats onto dry land on Saturday, they will do so with help from big draught horses.

Danish: Når Vikingeskibsmuseet på lørdag trækker Havhingsten på land, bliver det for sidste gang i foreløbigt mange år.
English: When the Viking Ship Museum pulls the Sea Stallion onto dry land on Saturday, it will be the last time for many years.

Danish: Da vikingerne kommer til Irland i 795 møder der dem et land og en befolkning, som har været kristne i over 350 år.
English: When the Vikings came to Ireland in AD 795 they encountered a country and a population that had been Christian for more than 350 years.

Danish: Da vikingerne kom til Irland blev de mødt - og fristet - af den kristne kirkes rigdomme.
English: When the Vikings came to Ireland they were met - and tempted - by the wealth of the early Christian Church.

Danish: Da vikingerne erobrede byen, ændrede de ikke blot navnet fra Enforwic til Jorvík, de udbyggede også byen på det beskyttede næs mellem de to floder Ouse og Foss.
English: When the Vikings conquered the town, not only did they change the name from Enforwic to Jorvik, they also extended it out onto the protected point formed between the two rivers, Ouse and Foss.

Danish: Når vikingerne vendte hjem fra togt eller handelsrejser, var skibet lastet med nye og spændende varer og skikke.
English: When the Vikings returned home from an expedition or trading voyage, the ship was loaded with new and exciting goods and practices.

Danish: Da vandstanden kl. ca, 14.30 nåede 150 cm over daglig vande, var hele Museumsøen overskyllet.
English: When the water level at approximately 14.30 reached 150 cm above water level, the whole Museum Island was flooded.

Danish: Et sejl er syet med en vis kurve, så det set fra oven ligner en flyvinge, som da også virker på samme måde.
English: When the wind hits the luff, the front edge of the sail, the stream of air is forced to change direction and speed.

Danish: Når bordene bliver kolde igen, stabilisere de sig i deres nye form.
English: When the wood cools down again, it stabilises in its new shape.

Danish: Når verdens største rekonstruktion af et vikingeskib til sommer sejler fra Roskilde, nord om Skotland og videre til Dublin, er det i stik modsat retning af de fremherskende vinde.
English: When the world’s biggest reconstruction of a Viking ship sails from Roskilde this summer, it goes North of Scotland and on to Dublin; directly against the dominant winds.

Danish: Når de vasker sig, foregår det ifølge Ibn Fadlan i samme vand;
English: When they did wash, it took place, according to Ibn Fadlan, in the same water:

Danish: Når tiden til tjærebrænding, smedning, reblægning, sejlfremstilling osv. regnes med, er der brugt rundt regnet 40.000 timer på fremstilling af skib, sejl og rig.
English: When time for tar production, blacksmithing, rope-making, sail-making etc. is included, approximately 40,000 hours were spent on the manufacture of ship, sail and rigging.

Danish: Da han skulle mærke om kødet var varmt, brændte han en finger.
English: When touching the meat to see if it was done he burned his fingers.

Danish: Når frivilligt arbejde bærer frugt
English: When volunteering brings rewards

Danish: Når vi er på togt med Havhingsten er det nødvendigt med nogle vagtsystemer så mandskabet ved...
English: When we are on an expedition with the Sea Stallion, it is necessary to have some watch systems so...

Danish: Da vi kom i land efter dagens sejlads blev forstaget slækket ca. 10 cm og agterstag og vanttove strammet tilsvarende.
English: When we came ashore, the forestay was slackened about 10 centimetres and the aftstay and the shrouds were tightened.

Danish: Da vi sidste år kom til Orkneyøerne, var det første råd vi fik: ”Det er vigtigere at tage hensyn til tidevandet end til vinden.
English: When we came to the Orkneys last year, the first advice we got was: “It’s more important to take the tide into account than the wind.

Danish: Da vi kom i land købte vi to drivankre, som vi kan kaste ud i en lignende situation.
English: When we got to shore, we bought two drag anchors to throw out in a similar situation.

Danish: Når vi har brug for at vide, hvordan vikingerne byggede og sejlede et krigsskib… ja, så bygger og sejler vi et vikingeskib.
English: When we need to know how the Vikings built and sailed a war ship… well, then we build and sail a Viking ship.

Danish: Da vi rundede Lands End
English: When we rounded Land's End

Danish: Når vi sover i vores seks store landtelte, skal de pakkes ned og transporteres til skibet.
English: When we sleep in our six large land tents, they must be packed away and transported to the ship.

Danish: Når vi vil vide, hvordan skibene sejlede og hvad det betød for vikingernes mulighed for at kontrollere et så stort territorium, som de gjorde - ja, så sejler vi over Nordsøen, nord om Skotland og videre til Dublin, sådan som det sker 1. juli i år med Havhingsten”.
English: When we want to know how the ships sailed, and what it meant for the Vikings' ability to control an area as vast as they did - we go sailing; set out across the North Sea, round the North of Scotland and on to Dublin, the way it happens July 1st this year with the Sea Stallion”.

Danish: Når vi vil vide, hvordan vikingerne byggede deres skibe - ja, så rekonstruerer vi et skib.
English: When we want to know how the Viking's build their ships - well, then we reconstruct a ship.

Danish: Når vi vil vide, hvordan vikingerne byggede deres skibe – ja så bygger vi et.
English: When we want to know how the vikings buildt a ship - we build one ourselves.

Danish: Når vi vil vide, hvordan vikingerne byggede deres skibe – ja, så rekonstruerer vi et skib.
English: When we want to know how the Viking’s build their ships – well, then we reconstruct a ship.

Danish: Når man arbejder med skriftlige kilder som fx. sagaer og lovtekster, er det derfor altid nødvendigt at kontrollere oversættelserne på disse punkter og gå tilbage til originalteksten.
English: When working with sources such as the sagas and legal texts it is therefore always necessary to return to the original text and check the translation on these points.

Danish: Når I er færdige, hjælper i hinanden”.
English: When you are done, help each other”.

Danish: Når du har foretaget en bestilling i Vikingeskibsmuseets Webshop, vil du modtage en ordrebekræftelse på din e-mail.
English: When you have made an order on the Viking Ship Museum Webshop, you will receive confirmation of your order by email.

Danish: Når man har kigget på tilstrækkeligt mange biler, kan man godt se, at en WV Golf er yngre end en folkevognsboble - og at Golfen ligner andre biler fra samme periode.
English: When you have seen a sufficient number of cars, you can easily see that a Volkswagen Golf is more recent than a Beetle - and that the Golf looks like other cars of the same period.

Danish: Da du ser land, kan du konstatere, at du i virkeligheden har bevæget dig ad kurs 130° med 6 knob.
English: When you see land, you can establish that in reality you have travelled along course 130° at 6 knots.

Danish: Når du ser smeden stå og smede nagler ved essen ovre på museumsøen, er det derfor vigtigt at huske på, at det kun er den allersidste fase af en lang og kompliceret kæde af produktion.
English: When you see the blacksmith producing rivets at the forge on the Museum Island, it is worth remembering that this is but the final stage of a long and complicated chain of production.

Danish: Hvornår:
English: When:

Danish: Hvornår: kl. 10.00 - 17.00 dagligt 31. juli - 6. august 2017
English: When: 10:00 - 17:00 every day, 31 July - 6 August 2017

Danish: Hvornår: kl. 10.00 - 17.00 dagligt 27. juni - 3. juli 2016
English: When: 10:00 – 17:00 every day from the 27th June – 3rd July 2016

Danish: Hvornår: kl. 14.00 - 15.00
Hvornår: mandag den 5. til fredag den 9. august kl. 10.00 - 17.00
English: When: Monday 5 August to Friday, 9 August at. 10.00 to 17.00

Danish: Hvornår: Lørdag den 6. september 2014
English: When: Saturday the 6th og September 2014

Danish: Hvornår: Søndag d. 30. august kl. 10.00 - 16.00.
English: When: Sunday 30th August from 10.00 - 16.00.

Danish: Hvor plyndrede de og hvad plyndrede de?
English: Where and what did they plunder?

Danish: Hvor kunne vikingerne købe glas?
English: Where could the Vikings purchase glass?

Danish: Hvor fik færingerne træ til deres både fra?
English: Where did the Faroese acquire wood for their boats?

Danish: Hvor fik vikingerne deres jern fra?
English: Where did the vikings get their iron?

Danish: Hvor stammer ordene fra?
English: Where do the words come from?

Danish: Voldgraven var op til 2,5 m dyb og nogle steder mere end 8 m bred.
English: Where excavated, the ditch measured up to 2.5m deep, and more than 8m wide in places.

Danish: Hvor er Havhingsten?
English: Where is the Sea Stallion?

Danish: Hvor der tidligere havde været en vis national undertone i projekterne, overskyggedes dette nu af det sociale samvær omkring byggeprocessen, friluftslivet og kulturhistorien.
English: Where previously there had been certain patriotic undertones in the projects, this was now overshadowed by social fellowship in connection with the actual construction, outdoor life and cultural history.

Danish: Hvor placeres byen i landskabet og hvorfor?
English: Where were these towns located in the landscape and why?

Danish: Hvor: I håndværkerens værksted, som regel på Tunet.
English: Where: In the craftsman's workshop, usually on Tuney.

Danish: Hvor: Kurset afholdes på Vikingeskibsmuseets bådeværft.
English: Where: The course will be held at the Viking Ship Museums Boat Yard.

Danish: Hvor: Kurset afholdes på Vikingeskibsmuseet bådeværft.
English: Where: The course will be held at the Viking Ship Museums boatyard

Danish: Hvor: Kurset afholdes på Vikingeskibsmuseet bådeværft.
English: Where: The course will be held at the Viking Ship Museums boatyard.

Danish: Hvor: Vikingeskibshallen, Vindeboder 12, 4000 Roskilde
English: Where: The Viking Ship Hall, Vindeboder 12, 4000 Roskilde

Danish: Vikingeskibsmuseet, Vindeboder 12, 4000 Roskilde
English: Where: The Viking Ship Museum in Roskilde, Vindeboder 12, 4000 Roskilde.

Danish: Hvor: Vikingeskibsmuseet, Vindeboder 12, 4000 Roskilde
English: Where: The Viking Ship Museum, Vindeboder 12, 4000 Roskilde

Danish: Hvor: Vikingeskibsmuseet, Vindeboder 12, 4000 Roskilde
English: Where: the Viking Ship Museum, Vindeboder 12, 4000 Roskilde

Danish: Hvor: Vikingeskibsmuseet i Roskilde, Vindeboder 12, 4000 Roskilde
English: Where: Viking Ship Museum in Roskilde, Vindeboder 12, 4000 Roskilde

Danish: Hvor: Vikingeskibsmuseet, Vindeboder 12, 4000 Roskilde
English: Where: Vikingeskibsmuseet, Vindeboder 12, 4000 Roskilde

Danish: De narrative kilder lægger langt større vægt på politisk historie og søkrig end på handelens fredelige hverdagsliv, og det relative fravær af retsdokumenter om emnet skyldes utvivlsomt samtidens skriftkultur og senere tab af forvaltnings- og retsarkiver – ikke manglen på professionel søhandel.
English: Whereas the narrative sources favour political history and naval campaigns rather than aspects of daily life such as peaceful trade, the relative absence of documentary evidence may reflect a limited contemporary use of written records and the subsequent loss of archives by the administration and jurisdiction, rather than an absence of specialised merchant seafaring.

Danish: Om vikingerne led af samme sygdomme for 1000 år siden, er svært at sige.
English: Whether the Vikings suffered from the same illnesses 1000 years ago is almost impossible to discover.

Danish: Om denne perspektiviske virkning har været kunstnerens hensigt, er uvist.
English: Whether this view in perspective was intended by the artist is uncertain.

Danish: Vi har forsøg nok når/hvis der tegner sig et klart mønster i forholdet mellem vindhastighed og VMG, når disse resultater indføres i et koordinatsystem.
English: Whether we have performed sufficient trials can be determined by plotting wind speed against VMG in a coordinate system.

Danish: Hvilke forbindelser har byen til vands og til lands?
English: Which links does the town have on both land and water

Danish: Hvilke midler bruger man i dag i forhold til vikingetiden?
English: Which means are employed now relative to the Viking Age?

Danish: Hvilke af kilderne har kendt til hinanden?
English: Which of the sources draw on each other?

Danish: Hvilken rolle spiller vikingerne i de interne stridigheder?
English: Which role did the Vikings play in internal conflicts?

Danish: Hvilken rolle spillede de i datidens samfund?
English: Which role did they play in the Viking Age society?

Danish: Hvilken rolle spillede vikingetidens byer for samfundets udvikling?
English: Which role did Viking Age towns play in the development of society?

Danish: Hvilken rolle spiller vikingetidens byer for kirken?
English: Which role did Viking Age towns play relative to the Church?

Danish: Hvilke regler skal gælde for besætningen?
English: Which rules should apply for the crew?

Danish: Hvilke kilder kan fortælle os om byen York?
English: Which sources can tell us about the town of York?

Danish: Hvilke kilder har vi i dag, som kan fortælle os om vikingernes tilstedeværelse i England?
English: Which sources do we have available today which can tell us about the Vikings' presence in England?

Danish: Hvilke kilder har vi til Vikingernes tilstedeværelse I Irland?
English: Which sources do we have concerning the Viking presence in Ireland?

Danish: Hvem har skrevet de skriftlige kilder om vikingerne i England og Irland?
English: Which sources do we have today which can tell us about the Vikings' presence in England and Ireland?

Danish: Hvilke kilder har vi i dag, som kan fortælle os om vikingernes tilstedeværelse i England og Irland?
English: Which sources do we have today which can tell us about the Vikings' presence in England and Ireland?

Danish: Hvad er det for ting i natur, landskab og samfund, som kædes sammen med danerne?
English: Which things in nature, landscape and society are associated with the Danes?

Danish: Samtidig med at hun skulle pøse, slog en bølge ind mod skibet, så hun mistede balancen og vred om på sit knæ.
English: While bailing a wave hit the ship making her loose balance and twist her knee.

Danish: I de skiftlige kilder beskrives de som drabelige røvere og udplyndrere, men de bosatte sig hurtigt i Irland og grundlagde vigtige byer på øen.
English: While being described as fierce marauders in historical sources, they also settled in Ireland and founded the most important towns on the island.

Danish: Skibets (og besætningens!) præstationer under roning overfor krydsforsøg under sammenlignelige forhold
English: While concentrating on these main issues, the sea trials will also investigate such specific factors as the following:

Danish: Hvor besætningens forhold og præstationer indgår som en integreret del af resultatet i forsøgsrejsen, vil besætningens evner og kundskaber så vidt muligt blive isoleret fra resultatet af testsejladserne.
English: While crew fitness and performance are inseparable from the results of the experimental voyage, the skill and ability of the crew will be isolated as far as possible from the results of the sea trials.

Danish: Imens Harold kæmpede mod nordmændene, havde hertug Vilhelm af Normandiet planlagt et angreb på England.
English: While Harald fought against the Norwegians, Duke William of Normandy had planned an attack on England.

Danish: Imens kampene mellem Harold Godwinson og den norske konge Harald Hårderåde stod ved Stamford Bridge, forberedte Vilhelm af Normandiet et angreb på England.
English: While Harold Godwinson and the Norwegian king, Harold Hardrada, fought at Stamford Bridge, William of Normandy prepared his attack on England.

Danish: Selvom hamp var det dominerende materiale til fremstilling af tovværk i middelalderen, er der ingen konkrete beviser på, at det blev brugt til at fremstilling reb i vikingetiden.
English: While hemp would emerge as the dominant ropemaking material during the Middle Ages, to date there is no definitive evidence for production of hemp rope in the Viking Age.

Danish: Mens fartroser med rimelighed kan forventes at opstå som følge af den almindelige sejlads mod målet, er det samme ikke tilfældet for krydsforsøg, da al erfaring tilsiger at det bedre kan svare sig at vente på en gunstig vindretning i stedet for at krydse sig frem.
English: While it is likely that sufficient data will be collected to prepare speed roses during the voyage to Dublin itself, it is doubtful whether enough data will be collected on the ship's ability to beat against the wind as all previous experience shows that it is better to wait for favourable conditions than to beat into a headwind.

Danish: Mens nogle af disse formentlig blot er enkeltstående grave, kan andre tolkes som tegn på tilstedeværelsen af en nærliggende vikingebebyggelse.
English: While some of these may simply represent an isolated burial, others may be indicative of some form of Viking settlement in the vicinity.

Danish: Mens de kongelige besøger fyret på Lindesnes, hvor de skal spise frokost, spiser besætningen på Havhingsten frokost på kajen i Båly havn.
English: While the royal families were having lunch at the nearby Lindesnes lighthouse, the crew ate at Båly harbour.

Danish: Mens Havhingstens roede ud mod ’Dannebrog’, tilbød bådsmand Søren Nielsen prins Henrik at overtage roret.
English: While the Sea Stallion rowed toward ’Dannebrog’, steersman Søren Nielsen offered prince Henrik to take the rutter.

Danish: Mens der kendes enkelte andre fund af ankre fra vikingetiden, er fundet af ankerkæden indtil videre helt enestående.
English: While there are other finds of anchors from the Viking Age, the anchor chain is, so far, unique.

Danish: Man kan ikke just sige, at vi er forvænt med varme på Havhingsten, men vi er vant til at vente...
English: While we can’t really say that we’re accustomed to warmth on the Sea Stallion, we are accustomed to waiting...

Danish: Imens vi reparede rorstroppen, kom vi til at ligge på tværs af søen, hvilket gjorde at skibet rullede meget.
English: While we fixed the rudder-strap, the swell came in abeam, which made the ship roll in the water.

Danish: Pisk fløde til flødeskum.
English: Whip the cream until it is stiff.

Danish: Hvem byggede ringborgene og Dannevirke?
English: Who built the ring forts and Dannevirke?

Danish: Hvem kan ramme mest præcist?
English: Who can be the most precise?

Danish: Hvem møder han?
English: Who does he meet?

Danish: Hvem grundlagde Ribe?
English: Who founded Ribe?

Danish: Hvem i det danske samfund ønsker at kristendommen skal være den nye religion og hvorfor?
English: Who in Danish society wanted Christianity to be the new religion and why?

Danish: der stadig fløde.
English: Who is the story about?

Danish: Hvem navngav stedet?
English: Who named the place?

Danish: Hvem begravede man i et skib?
English: Who was buried in a ship?

Danish: Hvem stod bag byggeriet af kirkerne?
English: Who was responsible for building churches?

Danish: Hvem har skrevet dem, og tager de parti?
English: Who was responsible for them, and were they partial?

Danish: Diskuter hvorledes forfatterens baggrund kan have haft betydning for hans beskrivelse af et hændelsesforløb.
English: Who was responsible for writing the written sources concerning the Vikings in England and Ireland?

Danish: Hvem har skrevet de skriftlige kilder om vikingerne i England og Irland?
English: Who was responsible for writing the written sources concerning the Vikings in England and Ireland?

Danish: Hvem var St. Brictius?
English: Who was St. Brice?

Danish: Hvem skriver historien
English: Who writes history

Danish: Hvem har skrevet de skriftlige kilder om vikingerne i England?
English: Who wrote the written sources about the Vikings in England?

Danish: Hvem har skrevet dem og tager de parti?
English: Who wrote them and do they take sides?

Danish: Hvorfor mente både Harald Hårderåde og Vilhelm af Normandiet, at de var berettigede til den engelske trone?
English: Why did Harold Hardrada and William of Normandy believe they had a right to the English throne?

Danish: Hvorfor opstår så mange "skandinaviske" vikingebyer i England?
English: Why did so many "Scandinavian" Viking towns appear in England?

Danish: Hvorfor opstår så mange vikingebyer i henholdsvis England og Irland?
English: Why did so many Viking towns appear in, respectively, England and Ireland?

Danish: Hvorfor ønskede de danske konger, at knytte den danske kirke tættere til den engelske kirke?
English: Why did the Danish kings wish to forge stronger links between the Danish and English churches?

Danish: Hvorfor tager vikingerne til Irland i begyndelsen?
English: Why did the Vikings go to Ireland in the first place?

Danish: Hvorfor gav disse investeringer mening?
English: Why did these investments make sense?

Danish: Hvorfor ser de således ud for alle breddegrader?
English: Why do they look like this for all latitudes?

Danish: Hvorfor har vi museer?
English: Why do we have museums?

Danish: Kan man kalde vikingernes bosættelser i Skotland for byer?
English: Why do we know about the town of York?

Danish: – Hvorfor ved vi noget om York?
English: Why do we know about the town of York?

Danish: Hvorfor skal vi vide noget om denne fortid?
English: Why do we need to know about the past?

Danish: Hvorfor tror du, man opfandt den slags overtroiske forklaringer i gamle dage?
English: Why do you think people invented this kind of superstitious explanation back then?

Danish: Hvorfor ror vi ikke bare?
English: Why don’t we simply row?

Danish: Hvad gør en ung kvinde i et vikingeskib, der oser af lummer mandehørm og hårde fysiske udfordringer?
English: Why is a young woman on board a Viking ship oozing of men and hard physical challenges?

Danish: Hvorfor er det ikke hurtigst med vinden ret agtenfra?
English: Why is it not fastest with the wind directly astern?

Danish: Hvorfor skal Vikingeskibsmuseet have flere penge.
English: Why should the Viking Ship Museum have more money?

Danish: Havhingsten møder Lord Nelsons flagskib
English: Why the Sea Stallion is going to Portsmouth

Danish: Hvorfor blev Dannevirke bygget?
English: Why was Dannevirke built?

Danish: Hvorfor er havnen så vigtig?
English: Why was the harbour so important?

Danish: Hvorfor var udmøntningen så vigtig for kongemagten?
English: Why was the minting of coins so important for royal power?

Danish: Hvorfor efterlignede man arabiske eller frankiske mønter?
English: Why were Arabic or Frankish coins copied?

Danish: Hvorfor/hvorfor ikke?
English: Why/why not?

Danish: Bredde:
English: Width:

Danish: Bredde: 12-20 meter
English: Width: 12-20 metres

Danish: Fungerer skibet efter hensigten, under forskellige manøvrer i forskellige vejrforhold?
English: Will the ship function as intended under various manoeuvres in various weather conditions?

Danish: Er der en fest og en fremtid efter Havhingsten?
English: Will there be funds and a future after the Sea Stallion?

Danish: Vilhelm ankom den 28. september 1066 til Sussex i Sydengland med en stor flåde og hær.
English: William landed on the 28thSeptember 1066 in Sussex in Southern England with a large fleet and army.

Danish: Vilhelm Erobreren bliver engelsk konge
English: William the Conqueror as English king

Danish: Vilhelm Erobreren af Normandiet og England
English: William the Conqueror of Normandy and England

Danish: Vilhelm Erobreren forblev konge indtil sin død i 1087.
English: William the Conqueror remained king until his death in AD 1087.

Danish: Vilhelm Erobrerens skibsliste
English: William the Conqueror's ship list

Danish: Vilhelm sejrede og i de efterfølgende måneder plyndrede og nedbrændte Vilhelm flere byer i Sydengland og overtog herredømmet.
English: William was victorious and in the following months he plundered and burned several towns in Southern England and took power.

Danish: Vilhelms halvbror Odo var Biskop i Bayeux.
English: William's half-brother Odo was the bishop in Bayeux.

Danish: Efter et års tid måtte danskerne indse, at de ikke kunne få støtte til at udfordre Vilhelm.
English: William, who was now under attacked two fronts, showed cunning and burned large parts of the country areas around York.

Danish: Men Vilhelm var snu og brændte store dele af landområderne omkring York ned.
English: William, who was now under attacked two fronts, showed cunning and burned large parts of the country areas around York.

Danish: Hvis vindretninger og vindstyrker tillader det, er ruten gennem Danmark planlagt således: Gennem Limfjorden, med kort stop i Glyngøre.
English: Wind direction and strength permitting, the route through Danish waters will be as follows: through the Limfjord, with a short stop in Glyngøre.

Danish: Vindens styrke og retning
English: Wind speed and direction

Danish: Vinden var den vigtigste drivkraft, men under manøvrer og over korte stræk i vindstille kunne årerne bruges.
English: Wind was the most important means of powering the ship, but the oars could be used when manoeuvring or when travelling short distances in calm weather.

Danish: Vinterferie 2015:
English: Winter Holiday 2015:

Danish: Bliv meget klogere på vikingernes håndværk
English: Winter Holiday: in the archaeologist’s footsteps

Danish: Vinter på Roskilde Fjord
English: Winter on Roskilde Fjord

Danish: Med 1500 avisartikler og flere hundrede indslag i TV og radio, brød Vikingeskibsmuseets flagskib for alvor igennem til de internationale medier under sommerens sejlads fra Roskilde til Dublin.
English: With 1500 newspaper articles and several hundred spots on TV and radio, the Viking Ship Museum's flagship really made an impact on the international media during the summer voyage from Roskilde to Dublin.

Danish: Med 6 knob tog vi et par gode lange krydsben ved Barsø og gik på visit ved værftet, der rekonstruerer Nydambåden fra 320 e. kr.
English: With 6 knots we took a couple of long, good tacks at Barsø and paid a visit to the boat yard which is building the reconstruction of the Nydam boat from AD 320.

Danish: Med 6 knob tog vi et par…
English: With 6 knots we too…

Danish: Med en by som London, med et indbyggertal på over 9 millioner og hundrede tusindvis af turister, er der stor risiko for at forsvinde i de mange øvrige kulturelle tilbud.
English: With a city like London with over 9 million inhabitants and hundreds of thousands of tourists, there is a real danger of being swamped by all the other cultural events.

Danish: Med en besætning på 65-70 mand har det hørt til de stormandsskibe, der prises i skjaldekvad og sagaer.
English: With a crew of 65-70 men, it was a chieftain's ship, like those praised in ancient scaldic verse and sagas.

Danish: Hun udforsker med nysgerrigt sind alle facetter af den mundtlige fortælling.
English: With a curious mind, she explores all facets of storytelling with the spoken word.

Danish: Ved et deplacement på 2,5 m3 har Tilia 5 cm større dybgang midtskibs.
English: With a displacement of 2.5 m3, Tilia has a 5 cm-deeper draught amidships.

Danish: Med en dybgang på kun 25 cm har båden kunnet sejle i fjordens lave vand samt på de omkringliggende vandløb.
English: With a draught of just 25cm, it was able to ply both the shallow waters of the fjord and the waterways leading into and out of it.

Danish: Med et fleksibelt skrog vil skrogformen forandre sig, når det påvirkes af riggen og søen, og fartmæssigt set er det en ulempe.
English: With a flexible hull, the shape will change under the impact of the rig and the sea, which is a disadvantage as far as speed is concerned.

Danish: Med en helikopter fra TV2 News svirrende hen over Vikingeskibsmuseet og to tv-hold fra DR og TV2 til at dække begivenheden på jorden gled Havhingsten langsomt tilbage i Roskilde Fjord.
English: With a helicopter from TV2 News hovering over the Viking Ship Museum and two camera-crews from the Danish Broadcasting Corporation and TV2 covering the event on the ground the Sea Stallion slowly slid back into Roskilde Fjord.

Danish: Med sin længde på 30 meter er det absolut i særklasse blandt vikingeskibe.
English: With a length of 30 m, it is indeed in a special class among Viking ships.

Danish: Storfembøringen på omkring 16 meter var den største.
English: With a length of about 16 m, the "storfembøring" was the largest.

Danish: Med et medlemskab engagerer du dig i vedligeholdelse af Havhingsten, træning, togter og den ånd, der binder lauget sammen.
English: With a membership you engage in training, voyages, maintaince of the Sea Stallion and the spirit that binds the guild together.

Danish: Da der er gået halvandet minut, er der fortsat problemer for flere af gasterne.
English: With a minute and a half gone several crew members still struggle.

Danish: Med en potentiel dagsrejse på 40 sømil/74 km har Hjortspringbåden i godt vejr kunnet komme til Als fx fra Lolland eller Femern på én dag eller fra Skåne eller Rygen på tre dage.
English: With a potential day's journey of 40 nautical miles (74 km), the Hjortspring boat would in good weather have been able to travel to Als from the islands Lolland or Femern in one day or from Skanör or Rügen in three days.

Danish: Med en potentiel dagsrejse på 40 sømil/74 km har Hjortspringbåden i godt vejr kunnet komme til Als fx fra Lolland eller Femern på én dag eller fra Skåne eller Rygen på tre dage.
English: With a potential day’s journey of 40 nautical miles (74 km), the Hjortspring boat would in good weather have been able to travel to Als from the islands Lolland or Femern in one day or from Skanör or Rügen in three days.

Danish: Bugten med stejle klippeskrænter og sandstrande var den perfekte landingsplads for vikingernes langskibe.
English: With a rocky precipice, sandy beach with grass covered sand dunes; the bay was the perfect landing place for the Viking long ships.

Danish: Med vind fra syd i dag og i morgen ser det ikke ud til at Havhingsten kommer videre på sin færd mod Dublin det næste døgn.
English: With a southern wind today and tomorrow the Sea Stallion anywhere the next couple of days.

Danish: Med 2,5 - 3 knobs fart satte vi langsomt kursen mod Odden.
English: With a speed of 2,5 - 3 knots we headed for Odden.

Danish: Med et råsejl kan man gøre det på to måder: Med vinden ind bagfra taler man om en kovending.
English: With a square sail this can be done in two ways: With the wind from behind the term is veering.

Danish: Meteorolog Morten Sørensen spurgte med en bekymret mine, om det er meningen at sejle igennem det berygtede Pentland Firth – det smalle stræde mellem Skotland og Orkneyøerne, som går for at være et af de vanskeligste farvande i verden at besejle og uden sammenligning det mest barske i Europa.
English: With a worried frown meteorologist Morten Sørensen asked, whether the Sea Stallion was to go through the infamous Pentland Firth – the narrow straight between Scotland and the Orkney Islands, supposedly one of the most difficult passages in the world to navigate and without comparison the roughest in Europe.

Danish: Ved tomt skrog (530 kg) fås for Tilia en dybgang på 14 cm, der stiger til 35 cm ved en last på 2000 kg.
English: With an empty hull (530 kg), the draught for Tilia is 14 cm, increasing to 35 cm with a cargo of 2,000 kg.

Danish: Ved tomt skrog (530 kg) fås for Tilia en dybgang på 14 cm, der stiger til 35 cm ved en last på 2000 kg. Endvidere er arealet af den våde overflade beregnet med henblik på bestemmelse af fremdrivningsmodstanden ved forskellige dybgange, og koefficienter og konstanter er beregnet til sammenligning.
English: With an empty hull (530 kg), the draught for Tilia is 14 cm, increasing to 35 cm with a cargo of 2,000 kg. In addition, the area of the wet surface has been calculated with a view to determining the resistance to propulsion at different draughts, and coefficients and constants have been calculated for comparison.

Danish: Og med et udstillingshus til skibet, fremstår projektet med Havhingsten som en afsluttet enhed.
English: With an exhibition house for the ship, the project with the Sea Stallion will reach completion.

Danish: Med brystsvømning bruger i al for meget energi og svømmer en masse vand ind i dragten”.
English: With breast strokes you use way to much energy and force a lot of water into the suit”.
With butter and cheese ...................

Danish: Hertil kaffe/ te & most
English: With coffee, tea and apple juice.

Danish: Med bidrag af Vibeke Bischoff, Kenn Jensen og Peter Henrichsen.
English: With contributions by Vibeke Bischoff, Kenn Jensen and Peter Henrichsen.

Danish: Skuldelev 5 har med sine 13 årepar været en repræsentant for den mindste langskibsklasse, og dens typenavn har formentlig været snekke.
English: With its 13 pairs of oars, Skuldelev 5 represents the smallest class of longships and it was probably referred to as a snekke.

Danish: Med sin frugtbare landbrugsjord og gode havne rundt langs kysten udgjorde øen en vigtig base – ikke blot for plyndring og bebyggelse men også for handel med Irland og Skotland.
English: With its excellent fertile agricultural land and good harbours around the coastline, it was an important base not just for raiding and settlement, but also for trading with Scotland and Ireland.

Danish: Havhingsten er med sin længde på hele 30 meter verdens længste rekonstruktion af et vikingeskib.
English: With its length of 30m, Sea Stallion is the world's largest Viking ship reconstruction.

Danish: Med sin lave dybgang har båden kunnet· færdes overalt i fjordområdet samt langt op ad de omkringliggende vandløb.
English: With its low draught it was able to ply anywhere in the fjord and a good distance along the waterways from and to it.

Danish: Med levende musik og sang blev byen indtaget på behørig vis.
English: With live music and song, the city was conquered in manor.

Danish: Med mere end 10.000 visninger er directors cut-optagelserne af Havhingstens sejlads fra Roskilde til Kristiansand i Sydnorge i 2007 den mest sete udsendelse.
English: With more than 10,000 views, the director’s cut footage of the Sea Stallion’s voyage from Roskilde to Kristiansand in southern Norway in 2007 is the broadcast that has been watched most.

Danish: Med eller uden bemaling?
English: With or without painting?

Danish: Sammen med percussionist og bouzouki-spiller Billy Mag Fhloinn, er der bestemt lagt op til en aften med det bedste Irland kan tilbyde.
English: With percussionist and bouzouki-player Billy Mag Fhloinn, we can definitely look forward to an evening with the best Ireland has to offer.

Danish: Med saltvand i håret og tjære på tøjet udfordres du i et unikt og udviklende fællesskab af sejlere.
English: With saltwater in your hair and tar on your clothes you are challenged in a unique and inspirational community of sailors.

Danish: Med 15 - 20 sekundmeter vind fra syd er der ingen mennesker langs molerne i den smukke og hyggelige kystby Howth en halv times kørsel nord for Dublin.
English: With southerly winds of 15-20 metres a second, there isn't a soul out on the breakwaters of the pretty and pleasant coastal town of Howth, half an hour's drive north of Dublin.

Danish: Måske har man brugt tælleremser for at tælle ens hver gang.
English: With special permission from the City of Bayeux.

Danish: Ved plankløvning kløves træet i to halvdele, hvorefter den ene side hugges færdig.
English: With tangential cleaving, the tree trunk is broken into two halves and one side is fully roughed out.

Danish: I det øjemed skulle der udsættes et antal plader med malingsprøver i forskellige danske havne.
English: With that intention, a number of wooden plates with samples of paint were to be placed in various Danish harbours.

Danish: Med udgravningen af Borrehøjen var forbindelsen mellem vikingetidens søfart og den levende skibsbygningstradition sluttet, og etnografien - eller folkelivsstudierne - begyndte at bidrage til billedet af vikingeskibet.
English: With the excavation of the Borre mound, the connection between Viking Age sea travel and the living shipbuilding tradition was made, and ethnography - or folk life studies - began to make a contribution to the visual perception of a Viking ship.

Danish: Med udstillingen 'Valhalla på Vikingeskibsmuseet' åbner museet dørene for Odin, Thor og Loke og viser, hvordan de gamle nordiske guder fik liv på papiret.
English: With the exhibition 'Valhalla at the Viking Ship Museum', the museum will open the doors for Odin, Thor and Loke and show how the old Nordic gods found new life on paper.

Danish: Med jubilæumsudstillingen Hjerteblod fejrede Vikingeskibsmuseet 50-året for udgravningen af Skuldelevskibene.
English: With the exhibition Heart and Soul the Viking Ship Museum celebrated the 50th anniversary of the excavation of the Skuldelev ships.

Danish: Med udstillingen Valhalla på Vikingeskibsmuseet åbnede museet dørene for Odin, Thor og Loke og viste, hvordan de gamle nordiske guder fik liv på papiret.
English: With the exhibition Valhalla at the Viking Ship Museum, the museum opened its doors to Odin, Thor and Loke and showed how the old Nordic gods found new life on paper.

Danish: Med Projekt Gislingebåd i 2015 udvidede Vikingeskibsmuseet denne dialog, ved at involvere publikum aktivt i processerne.
English: With the Gislinge Boat Project 2015, the Museum aimed to expand this dialogue by actively involving the public in these practices.

Danish: Med Projekt Gislingebåd satser museet på at udvide denne dialog ved at involvere publikum aktivt i processerne.
English: With the Gislinge Boat Project, the Museum aims to expand this dialogue by actively involving the public in these practices.

Danish: Med guitaren på rundgang og et repertoire fra Kim Larsen til Nirvana blev der sunget og festet til de sene nattetimer....
English: With the guitar passing and songs ranging from Danish classics to Nirvana, the crew sang down the sun.....

Danish: Med søsættelsen af Havhingsten fra Glendalough i sommeren 2004 kunne Vikingeskibsmuseet i Roskilde fremvise en hel …
English: With the launching of the Sea Stallion from Glendalough in summer 2004 the Viking Ship Museum in Ros…

Danish: Med udgangspunkt i en opmåling af en gammel Lynæsjolle har Ture ændret på jollens vandlinier.
English: With the measurements from an old Lynæs dinghy as the starting point, Ture has made some changes to the boat's lines.

Danish: Med henblik på at løse de ovennævnte gåder blev der for genstands- og knoglematerialets vedkommende foretaget diverse analyser (røntgenfotografering og -fluorescensanalyse, acceleratordatering, vedanatomisk og antropologisk bestemmelse samt tekstil-, fiber- og tovværksanalyse).
English: With the objective of providing answers to these riddles various analyses were taken of both the artefact material and the bone material (x-ray photographs, and fluorescence analysis, accelerator dating, wood-anatomical and anthropological analyses and textile, fibre and rope analyses.)

Danish: Med premieren på Vikingeskibets skjulte gåder når historien ud til et endnu større publikum fra Skandinavien i nord til Bulgarien i det sydlige Europa og hele vejen til Rusland og Kasakhstan i øst.
English: With the premiere of ‘Viking Voyage', the story will reach an even greater public from Scandinavia in the north to Bulgaria in southern Europe, and all the way to Russia and Kazakhstan in the east.

Danish: Med den videnskabelige skriftserie Ships and Boats of the North bidrager Vikingeskibsmuseet til udforskningen af den nordiske fortids skibsbygning og søfart.
English: With the research series Ships and Boats of the North the Viking Ship Museum contributes to the investigation of the past shipbuilding and seafaring of the North.

Danish: Med den videnskabelige skriftserie Maritime Culture of the North bidrager Vikingeskibsmuseet til udforskningen af den nordiske fortids maritime kultur.
English: With the research series ‘Maritime Culture of the North' the Viking Ship Museum contributes to the investigation of the past maritime culture of the North.

Danish: Med den videnskabelige skriftserie Maritime Culture of the North bidrager Vikingeskibsmuseet til udforskningen af den nordiske fortids maritime kultur.
English: With the research series ‘Maritime Culture of the North’ the Viking Ship Museum contributes to the investigation of the past maritime culture of the North.

Danish: Med Skuldelevfunnet fikk vi skip fra sen vikingtid, eksempler på flere skipstyper til mer spesialisert virksomhet, det være seg handel eller krig.
English: With the Skuldelev find we were given ships from the late Viking Age that are examples of several ship-types for more specialized activities like trading or warfare.

Danish: Med Skuldelevfundet fik man pludselig forskellige typer til forskellig brug, store og små handelsskibe, store og små krigsskibe og måske en fiskerbåd eller færge.
English: With the Skuldelev find we were suddenly presented with different types for different purposes: large and small trading ships, large and small warships, and maybe a fishing boat or a ferry.

Danish: Indenfor borgmuren ligger et rundt tårn fra 1100-tallet, en katedral fra 1300-tallet og senere småhuse tilhørende de engelske lords, der regerede Isle of Man.
English: With the walls is a Round Tower from the 11th century, a cathedral from the 13th century and small apartments from the later Lords of Mann, who ruled on the Island.

Danish: Med overrækkelsen af prisen beviser Vikingeskibsmuseet i Roskilde igen sin evne til trække international opmærksomhed til det sejlende forskningsprojekt.
English: With this award, the Viking Ship Museum in Roskilde once again demonstrates its ability to attract international attention to this floating research project.

Danish: På denne baggrund kan vi opnå en større forståelse af den afdøde i skibsgraven fra Ladby, for hvem skibet formentlig har været af altafgørende betydning for opretholdelsen af en betydningsfuld position i vikingetidens samfund.
English: With this background we can reach a greater understanding of the dead person in the ship-grave from Ladby, for whom the ship probably had overwhelming significance for the maintenance of a ruling position in Viking-Age society.

Danish: Med denne besætning, inklusive en trommeslager til at angive takten, måltes en fart på 7,6 knob ved en kadence på 62 over en 1148 m lang bane.
English: With this crew, including a drummer to set the stroke, a speed of 7.6 knots was measured with a cadence of 62 strokes/minute over a distance of 1148 m.

Danish: Med udstillingen vil vi gerne give et kik bag kulissen og vise, hvordan vi arbejder med skibene - fra den historiske udgravning i 1962 til mere end 20 års rekonstruktion og sejlads” afslutter museumsinspektør, Louise K. Henriksen
English: With this exhibition we would like to give museum visitors a look behind the scenes and show how we work with the ships - from the historical excavation in 1962 to more than 20 years of reconstruction and sailing" says curator Louise K. Henriksen.

Danish: Med det nye projekt, tilføjes en ekstra dimension til traditionen.
English: With this new project, we adds an other dimension to the tradition.

Danish: Når der 'sprettes', hugges øksen i træet i en svagt stump vinkel, bådebyggeren slapper derefter af i armen og lader øksen springe eller skære sig ud igen.
English: With this technique, the axe enters the wood at a slightly obtuse angle; the boatbuilder then relaxes his arm and lets the axe bounce back out of the wood.

Danish: Med Thrane & Thranes Sailor Mini-C bliver Havhingstens position automatisk sendt til havhingsten.dk.
English: With Thrane & Thrane's Sailor Mini-C tthe position of the Sea Stallion is automaticly sent to the seastallion.dk.

Danish: Efterhånden blev det almindeligt at bruge danske mønter, og i slutningen af vikingetiden forsøgte kongerne at begrænse brugen af udenlandske mønter, for at vise deres egen magt.
English: With time, however, it became the norm to use Danish coins and towards the end of the Viking Age the kings attempted to limit the use of foreign coins in order to maintain their own power.

Danish: Hvilken hastighed kommer du frem mod målet med?
English: With what speed will you proceed towards your goal?

Danish: Vidjer har været brugt som humlebånd på originalskibet.
English: Withies were used as oar grommets on the original ship.

Danish: Til Danmark:
English: Within Denmark:

Danish: De skriftlige kilder efterlader mindst to store spørgsmål om søhandelen i danske farvande mellem 1000 og 1250:
English: Within the context of merchant seafaring in Danish waters between 1000 and 1250, the written sources are silent in respect to at least two questions:

Danish: Uden rig vejer masten 450 kg.
English: Without the rigging the mast weighs 450 kg.

Danish: Uden rig vejer masten 450 kg. Foto: Werner Karrasch
English: Without the rigging the mast weighs 450 kg. Photo: Werner Karrasch

Danish: Det skete foran 15.000 tilskuere og 52 mio. tv-seere.
English: Witnessed by 15.000 visitors in the harbour in Roskilde and 52 million TV viewers world wide.

Danish: Kvinder om bord
English: Women on board

Danish: Træsorterne til masterne har også været forskellig.
English: Wood types for masts have also been diverse.

Danish: Træskærer - kom og vær med
English: Woodcarving - come join us!

Danish: Lige som før bliver klamperne sat på plads, flyttet lidt rundt, og inspiceret fra hver side, indtil bådebyggerne er tilfredse.
English: Wooden clamps are used to hold the board in position and are adjusted as the boatbuilders gauge the curve of the board's line.

Danish: trænaglerne spytter kiler ud.
English: Wooden rivets spit wedges out.

Danish: Skovarbejdere og medhjælpere 14.000 timer
English: Woodmen and assistants: 14,000 hours

Danish: Uld er meget elastisk og var let tilgængeligt, mens skind fra sæl og hvalros har en uniform tykkelse og er mere slidestærkt.
English: Wool is highly elastic and very readily available, while hide from seal and walrus has a uniform thickness and incredible resistance to wear, which makes it an ideal rigging material.

Danish: Uld, tætningsmateriale: Àrni Battaberg
English: Wool, sealing: Àrni Battaberg

Danish: Der fandtes forarbejdet træ, heraf et muligt fragment af en stammebåd.
English: Worded wood was also discovered, including a possible fragment from a dugout boat.

Danish: Ord kan være mistet, senere ord eller begreber kan være indskrevet, og den nyere tekst bære præg af religiøse, politiske og historiske ideer i forfatterens egen samtid.
English: Words may be missing, later words or concepts added, and the more recent text may show the influence of religious, political and historical ideas of the author's own time.

Danish: Ord kan være mistet, senere ord eller begreber kan være indskrevet, og den nyere tekst bære præg af religiøse, politiske og historiske ideer i forfatterens egen samtid.
English: Words may be missing, later words or concepts added, and the more recent text may show the influence of religious, political and historical ideas of the author’s own time.

Danish: Arbejdet på den nye rekonstruktion af Gislingebåden er allerede begyndt – kølen er strakt, og den første egestamme er kløvet.
English: Work has already begun on this new reinterpretation of the Gislinge Boat – the keel has been laid and the first oak log has been cleaved.

Danish: På kajen i Tønsberg bygges der på det, der skal blive den nye rekonstruktion af Osebergskibet.
English: Work is now underway on the new reconstruction of the Oseberg ship on the quay in Tønsberg.

Danish: Arbejde eller familie kalder for mange.
English: Work or family call many home.

Danish: Værktøjet bruges også, når bådebyggeren arbejder på værftspladsen.
English: Work with fresh oak and the Vikings' tool!

Danish: Arbejd med frisk egetræ og vikingernes værktøj!
English: Work with fresh oak and the Vikings’ tool!

Danish: Tag med på familieomvisning, hvor der er sat fokus på vikingernes togter.
English: Work with fresh oak and the Vikings’ tool!

Danish: Arbejd med frisk egetræ og vikingernes værktøj.
English: Work with fresh oak and Viking tools.

Danish: Smed med glødende jern!
English: Work with red-hot iron!

Danish: Smed med rødglødende jern
English: Work with red-hot iron!

Danish: Arbejdere til at klinke naglerne 1000 timer
English: Workers fitting rivets: 1000 hours

Danish: Rentegning af det store skib på den runde side af runepinden fra Bergen.
English: Working drawing of the great ship on the round side of the rune stick from Bergen.

Danish: Bestilling af arbejdstegninger
English: Working drawings for the Gislinge boat

Danish: De startede ved rodenden, og de første spor til kilerne blev lavet med en økse, for at markere den linje i marvstrålerne, som bådebyggerne havde valgt at følge.
English: Working from the root end, the first cuts for the wedges were made as an axe blade was used to mark the preferred line the boatbuilders had chosen for the split.

Danish: Hvis denne inddeling i klasser af store og mellemstore lastskibe er historisk korrekt, så kan forklaringen på størrelsesforskellen søges i enten forskellige fartøjsfunktioner eller i ejernes respektive sociale og økonomiske baggrund.
English: Working on the basis that the gap in size between the large and medium-sized cargo vessels is historically correct, an explanation for the different ship sizes may be found either in different vessel functions or in the different social and economic positions of the respective owners.

Danish: Arbejdet med Skuldelevskibene har givet ny viden om vikingerne og gjort Danmark til et af verdens førende lande inden for marinarkæologien.
English: Working with the Skuldelev ships has provided new knowledge about the Vikings and has also made Denmark one of the world's leaders in the field of maritime archaeology

Danish: Arbejdet med Skuldelevskibene har givet ny viden om vikingerne og gjort Danmark til et af verdens førende lande inden for marinarkæologien.
English: Working with the Skuldelev ships has provided new knowledge about the Vikings and has also made Denmark one of the world’s leaders in the field of maritime archaeology

Danish: Det er ikke så tit at de få chancen for at arbejde med træ på denne måde, og de glæder sig til opgaven.
English: Working with wood in this way isn't something they get to do every day and they were almost giddy at the prospect of the task ahead.

Danish: Det er ikke så tit at de få chancen for at arbejde med træ på denne måde, og de glæder sig til opgaven.
English: Working with wood in this way isn’t something they get to do every day and they were almost giddy at the prospect of the task ahead.

English: Workshop - Blacksmithing

English: Workshop in Viking Age ropemaking 2017

English: Workshop with the ropemaker or woodcarver

English: Workshop: boat building

English: Workshop: boat building

English: Workshop: wickerwork

English: Workshop: woodcarving
