English: Workshops at the Viking Ship Museum

Danish: Publikumsaktiviteter: Møntslagning, maleværksted og smykkeværksted på tunet.
English: Workshops: Minting, paint and jewellers at Tunet.

Danish: Sikkerhed står øverst, Forskning i verdensklasse.
English: Worldclass research.

Danish: Vil bådens trim blive påvirket af en anden sejlfacon?
English: Would altering the sails shape impact on the boats trim?

Danish: Ville bådens stabilitet og sejlegenskaber blive påvirket af en anden sejlfacon?
English: Would altering the sail’s shape have an impact on the boat’s trim?

Danish: Vil han gøre det igen?
English: Would he do it again?

Danish: Ville det originale skib have sejlet bedre?
English: Would the original ship have done better?

Danish: Ville de også have ventet så længe i vikingetiden?
English: Would they also have waited so long in the Viking Age?

Danish: Ville du skrive det samme, hvis det var din private dagbog?
English: Would you write the same if it was your own private diary?

Danish: Et fund af vragdele fra Hasnæs på den jyske østkyst, dateret til midten af 1000-tallet, er et eksempel herpå.
English: Wreck fragments from Hasnæs on the east coast of Jutland, dated to the middle of the 11th century, are an example of this.

Danish: Vrag og bopladser, der er dækket af aflejringer, kan afsløres med et magnetometer eller et penetrerende ekkolod, som både kan identificere geologiske lag og enkeltobjekter, der er begravet under havbunden.
English: Wrecks and settlement sites covered by sediments can be revealed by a magnetometer or a sub-bottom profiler, capable of identifying geological layers as well as single objects buried below the seabed.

Danish: Skriv dagbog for en dag i vikingedrengen Eriks liv, da han sammen med sin far kommer til Ribe.
English: Write a diary entry for a day in the life of Viking boy Eric, when he comes to the town of Ribe for the very first time with his father.

Danish: Skriv en besked
English: Write a message

Danish: Skriv en side I jeres klosterannal om den dag vikingerne kom.
English: Write a page in the monastery annals about the day that the Vikings came.

Danish: Skriv en side I jeres klosterannal om den dag vikingerne kom.
English: Write a page in the monastery's annals about the day the Vikings came.

Danish: Skriv en side I jeres klosterbog om den dag vikingerne kom.
English: Write a page in your monastery annals about the day the Vikings came.

Danish: Skriv et kvad om dengang du kom til en smuk vig i Skotland for første gang.
English: Write a poem about the time you arrived for the first time at a beautiful bay in Scotland.

Danish: Skriv et skjaldekvad om Slaget ved Stamford Bridge.
English: Write a skaldic epic about the Battle of Stamford Bridge.

Danish: Diskutér forskellen mellem vores samfund i dag og vikingetiden!
English: Write a story about how you think life was in Viking times.

Danish: Ring eller skriv
English: Write or call

Danish: Skriv to historier om en farefuld sejlads.
English: Write two stories about a dangerous voyage.

Danish: Skrift, billede eller genstand?
English: Writing, image or artefact?

Danish: Skriftlige kilder fra 900-tallet beskriver, hvordan mænd og kvinder kæmmede deres hår hver dag.
English: Written accounts from the tenth century describe how men and women combed their hair every day.

Danish: Skriftlige og arkæologiske kilder kan give os nogle ideer og tanker om, hvordan livet har været i disse byer, hvordan vikingerne har haft indflydelse på byernes udvikling.
English: Written and archaeological sources can provide us with some ideas and thoughts concerning how life was in these towns and how the Vikings influenced their development.

Danish: Skriftlige og arkæologiske kilder kan i dag give os et indblik i, hvordan livet har været i de danske byer i vikingetiden.
English: Written and archaeological sources can today give us an insight into what life was like in Danish towns during the Viking Age.

Danish: Skrevet af Silas Tavs Ravn
English: Written by Silas Tavs Ravn

Danish: Skriftlige vidnesbyrd og arkæologiske fund fra plyndringerne af den hollandske by Zupthen vidner om grovheden i vikingernes aggression.
English: Written sources and archaeological finds from the plundering of the town of Zutphen in the Netherlands, bear witness to the brutality of Viking agression.

Danish: Vi har ikke mange skriftlige kilder fra selve vikingetiden, og kun få af disse kilder omtaler skibe eller langskibe.
English: Written sources from the Viking Age are rare and there are especially few of them that can tell us anything about the contemporary longships.

Danish: Fra Norden er det meget sparsomt, hvad vi har af skriftlige kilder fra vikingetiden.
English: Written sources from Viking times are very scarce in the Nordic Countries.

Danish: Skriftlige kilder nævner flere gange Århus i forbindelse med kirkelige affærer.
English: Written sources make several mentions of Aarhus in connection with ecclesiastical matters.

Danish: Skriftlige kilder beretter, at man allerede i vikingetiden samlede flåden I limfjorden, når man skulle på togt til England, og at Knud den Store kom vest fra ind i Limfjorden på vej hjem fra England.
English: Written sources recount that the Viking fleet gathered in the Limfjord before embarking on expeditions to England and that Cnut the Great, on his way home from England, sailed from the west into the Limfjord?

Danish: Wulfstans beretning om en rejse fra det internationale handelscenter Hedeby (Slesvig) til handelspladsen Truso i Wisła-deltaet tegner et sjældent og farverigt billede af den sydøstlige Østersøregion i tidlig vikingetid, med fokus på vandvejen til havet og den lokale kultur.
English: Wulfstan's account covers a voyage from the root of Jutland to the Vistula Delta - connecting the trading centres of Hedeby and Truso - and provides a rare and vivid view of the south-eastern Baltic Sea region in the early Viking Age, including aspects of inland navigation and local culture.

Danish: Wulfstan's Voyage er blevet støttet af Fritz Thyssen Stiftung, Nordea-fonden, George Jorck og Hustru Emma Jorck's Fond og Dronning Margrethes og Prins Henriks Fond.
English: Wulfstan's Voyage has been generously sponsored by Fritz Thyssen Stiftung, Nordea-fonden, George Jorck og Hustru Emma Jorck's Fond and by Dronning Margrethes og Prins Henriks Fond.

Danish: Wulfstan’s Voyage er blevet støttet af Fritz Thyssen Stiftung, Nordea-fonden, George Jorck og Hustru Emma Jorck's Fond og Dronning Margrethes og Prins Henriks Fond.
English: Wulfstan’s Voyage has been generously sponsored by Fritz Thyssen Stiftung, Nordea-fonden, George Jorck og Hustru Emma Jorck's Fond and by Dronning Margrethes og Prins Henriks Fond.

Danish: XLNT (eller Excellent, som det sig hedder) blev bygget i Sverige i 1905.
English: XLNT (or Excellent, as it is called) was built in Sweden in 1905.

Danish: Dette lag bevæger sig år efter år længere ind mod højens midte og forhindre tilgange af ilt til højen.
English: Year by year, this layer moves further in towards the centre of the burial mound and prevents oxygen entering the mound.

Danish: De gule planker er af fyr, den blå af ask, de brune af eg og den grå af el.
English: Yellow planks are pine, the blue is ash, the brown oak and the grey alder.

Danish: Javel, det var en hård tur.
English: Yes it was a rough sail.

Danish: I går aftes mødte en flok lokale rugby-spillere op med en udfordring til besætningen på Havhingsten; kaproning i to af de vikingeskibe, som ligger i Peel havn.
English: Yesterday evening a bunch of local rugby players challenged the crew of Sea Stallion to a rowing match in two of the Viking ships in the harbour of Peel.

Danish: I tekstilværkstedet vil det også være muligt selv at fremstille uldne bånd i smukke farver efter vikingernes teknikker.
English: Yesterday evening a bunch of local rugby players challenged the crew of Sea Stallion to a rowing match in two of the Viking ships in the harbour of Peel.

Danish: I går aftes, lørdag, hold den lokale sejlklub afskedsreception for Havhingsten.
English: Yesterday evening, Saturday, Wicklow Sailing Club held a farewell reception for the Sea Stallion.

Danish: I går var der bålhygge og god musik, på tværs af kulturer og interesser.
English: Yesterday we all sat around a camp fire listening to good music, despite the difference in culture and interests.

Danish: I går havde vi således fornøjelse af at der var gået hul på en pose pastaskruer.
English: Yesterday we had the pleasure of a torn bag of pasta.

Danish: Endnu en smuk, funktionel og snedig løsning fra vikingetidens bådebyggere.
English: Yet another beautiful, functional and ingenious solution from the boatbuilders of the Viking Age.

Danish: Endnu et ord for skib, som genfindes på runestenene, er "knôrr".
English: Yet another word for ship that is found on the rune stones is knörr.

Danish: Men netop forbindelsen mellem de to meget forskellige verdener, åbnede Vikingeskibsmuseet op for i 2015, hvor Vikingeskibsmuseets bådebyggere genskabte Gislingebåden – en 7,7 meter lang brugsbåd fra ca. 1130.
English: Yet it is just this connection between these two very different worlds that the Viking Ship Museum opened up for in 2015, when the Museum’s boatbuilders reconstructed the Gislinge Boat – a 7.7m long working boat from ca. 1130.

Danish: Men det er derfor, vi er her.
English: Yet that is what we are all here for.

Danish: Alligevel husede de et umiskendeligt byliv.
English: Yet they housed an unmistakably urban way of life.

Danish: York er grundlagt af romerne, men byens lange historie er i høj grad præget af vikingerne.
English: York was founded by the Romans, but the town's long history has, to a very great extent, been influenced by the Vikings.

Danish: Du er også inviteret!
English: You are also invited!

Danish: Mød reblæggeren, der enten laver lindebastov i det åbne tovværksted på tunet, eller slår reb ved reberbanen ved Vikingeskibshallen.
English: You are always welcome to visit the workshop and watch this ancient craft in action.

Danish: Du sejler kurs 56° med 3,5 knob.
English: You are sailing on course 56° at 3.5 knots.

Danish: Du er velkommen til at kommentere.
English: You are welcome to post a comment or question.

Danish: Du kan også vælge at fjerne målinger, hvor skibet ligger stille i havn.
English: You can also choose to remove records from when the ship has lain stationary in harbour.

Danish: I kan også skære brikker ud af større knogler som okseben.
English: You can also cut gaming pieces out of larger bones such as cattle bones.

Danish: Du kan også dekorere en torshammer eller lave smykker af farvestrålende glasperler.
English: You can also decorate a Thor’s hammer or make jewellery from colourful glass beads.

Danish: Projektet kan også følges på Facebook og Instagram, hvor der ligger film, billeder og andre nørddetaljer.
English: You can also follow the project on Facebook and Instagram, where we share film, photos and other nerdy details.

Danish: Derudover kan du lære råsejlet at kende i mindre fartøjer, og sejle med på sommertogt i nationale og international farvande.
English: You can also learn how a single square sail is operated in smaller vessels, and sail on sommer voyages in national and international waters.

Danish: Mød også krigerne, der viser kampens håndværk.
English: You can also meet the warriors, who demonstrate the craft of fighting.

Danish: Ligeledes kan du opleve Jan fremstille langbuer- vikingernes mest frygtede våben- og se ham demonstrere deres styrke!
English: You can also see Jan's display of longbows - the Vikings' most feared weapon - and watch him demonstrate their power!

Danish: Man kan også prøve at lave et lille orienteringsløb med solkompasset, hvor man bruger afstand og retning fra post til post.
English: You can also try to construct a little orienteering course with the sun compass where the distance and direction are used from post to post.

Danish: Besøg også værftspladsen på Museumsøen.
English: You can also visit the boatyard on the Museum Island.

Danish: Du kan også skrive dit navn med runer eller spille vikingespil.
English: You can also write your name with runes and play a Viking game.

Danish: Du kan altid melde dig ud af Vikingeskibsmuseets Bådelaug.
English: You can always withdraw your membership of the Viking Ship Museum's boat guild.

Danish: Du kan altid melde dig ud af Vikingeskibsmuseets Bådelaug.
English: You can always withdraw your membership of the Viking Ship Museum’s boat guild.

Danish: Det er muligt at tilmelde sig online på Havhingsten hjemmeside.
English: You can apply on-line on the Sea Stallion website.

Danish: Du kan også være med
English: You can be a part of this

Danish: Du kan være sikker på, at han sidder og griner," slutter Bent Lindgaard.
English: You can be certain, he is laughing,” Bent Lindgaard finishes.

Danish: Det kan tydelig ses, hvordan siderne går indad, henover midten af båden.
English: You can clearly see how the sides incline inwards across the middle of the boat.

Danish: For at forstærke skroget inden udspændning, lægges et bånd i rælingen i begge ender.
English: You can clearly see how the sides incline inwards across the middle of the boat.

Danish: Du kan styre oplysningerne på kortet ved at 'hakke af' i felterne, for også at få adgang til fotos, log-punkter med angivelse af fat og position samt oplysninger om de historiske steder, skibet sejler forbi.
English: You can control the information on the map by clicking the check boxes to access photos, logpoints and position as well as information about the historical sites the ship sails by.

Danish: Du kan downloade et program til at lave solkompasser med fra værktøjer her til højre.
English: You can download a programme for making sun compasses from the tools menu to the right.

Danish: Her kan du gå på opdagelse i byggeriet af Havhingsten gennem filmklip, billeder og 3-D modeller.
English: You can explore the building of the Sea Stallion through film clips, pictures and 3D models..

Danish: Nogle af bådene vedligeholdes og sejles af medlemmer af museets frivillige bådelaug.
English: You can find more photos, film clips and a lot of travel blogs in Danish language.

Danish: Det er muligt at holde sig orienteret om skibets position på www.havhingsten.dk, inden man begiver sig ud i sommervejret for at opleve Havhingsten sejle forbi.
English: You can find out where the ship is at any time on www.havhingsten.dk before you go out into the summer weather to watch the Sea Stallion sail by.

Danish: Det bedste overblik over dagens aktiviteter finder du i Vikingeskibsmuseet kalender:
English: You can find the best overview of daily activities in the Viking Ship Museum's calendar:

Danish: Når du bliver optaget som medlem, vil du kunne logge dig ind på det lukkede område.
English: You can first access the private forums when your application for guild membership has been accepted.

Danish: Her kan du følge bådeværftets arbejde med at bygge den lille Gokstadbåd.
English: You can follow the boatyard's building of the Gokstad boat here.

Danish: Hele rejsen kan følges på vikingeskibsmuseets hjemmeside, hvor skibets elektroniske udstyr hvert 15. minut sender oplysninger om, kurs, fart og position til det interaktive kort.
English: You can follow the voyage on the Viking Ship Museum's website, where the ship's electronic equipment sends data about their course, speed and position to an interactive map every 15 minutes.

Danish: Deres arbejde kan følges hver dag i løbet af de ca. 4 måneder udstillingen varer og publikum kan stille spørgsmål til materialer, værktøj og teknikker og gennem dialog med de dygtige håndværkere, få en levende og nærværende formidling af vikingernes imponerende skibsbygningskunst.
English: You can follow their work every day during the ca. 4 months that the exhibition will be on display, and the public are welcome to ask questions about the materials, tools and techniques, and through dialogue with the skilled craftsmen, can get a living and detailed understanding of the extraordinary ship building skills of the Vikings.

Danish: Du kan blive klogere på hvordan vikingerne byggede deres både, lavede reb i verdensklasse og hvordan man sejler et vikingeskib med den særlige råsejlsteknik.
English: You can gain insight into how the Vikings built their boats, made world-class ropes and learn how to sail a Viking ship.

Danish: Send den flotteste og mest fantastiske tegning af Havhingsten for fulde sejl til:
English: You can get a copy of the drawings by filling out the form below.

Danish: Du kan lige se forskellen i farven i træet, som er resultatet af et indgreb af Oksetungesvamp.
English: You can just see the difference in tone in the oak, caused by the presence of Ox Tongue fungus in the oak.

Danish: Gryden skal være af jern, stål eller aluminium uden barkelit- eller plastikhåndtag, og hænges op med nogle kroge
English: You can make a tripod yourself from three thick branches or sticks lashed together.

Danish: Du vil blandt andet kunne ”slå hovedet på sømmet”, smede en Torshammer, et bæltespænde og meget mere.
English: You can make an iron nail, a Thor's hammer, a beltbuckle and more.

Danish: Du kan fremover studere de enkelte både i tekst, film og billeder på museets hjemmeside.
English: You can now study the individual boats in text, film and pictures on the museum's homepage.

Danish: Du kan fremover studere de enkelte både i tekst, film og billeder på museets hjemmeside.
English: You can now study the individual boats in text, film and pictures on the museum’s homepage.

Danish: Vikingeskibsmuseets hjemmeside kan nu tages med overalt.
English: You can now take the Viking Ship Museum’s homepage with you wherever you are.

Danish: De maritime udtryk, som du møder i opgaverne, kan du ofte få forklaret ved at læse artikler og dagbøger andetsteds på sitet.
English: You can often find an explanation for the maritime expressions, which you will meet in the exercises, by reading articles and diaries elsewhere on the website.

Danish: Byggeriet kan følges her på hjemmesiden.
English: You can read about the process here on the website.

Danish: Hvad der siden skete, kan du læse mere om i Kampen om England.
English: You can read about what happened next in The Battle for England.

Danish: Du kan læse mere om opdagelse af svampen sidste år her .
English: You can read more about the discovery of the fungus last year here .

Danish: Du kan læse mere om opdagelse af svampen sidste år her.
English: You can read more about the discovery of the fungus last year here.

Danish: Du kan læse mere om deres arbejde ved at klikke på menuen til venstre.
English: You can read more about their work by clicking on the menu to the left.

Danish: Du kan søge nogle af svarene på nettet.
English: You can search for the answers to some of the first problems on the Internet.

Danish: På museet kan du se en lille udstilling om skibet, og du kan følge skibets sejlads på skærme.
English: You can see a small exhibition about the ship at the museum, and you can follow the ship's voyage on displays.

Danish: På museet kan du se en lille udstilling om skibet, og du kan følge skibets sejlads på skærme.
English: You can see a small exhibition about the ship at the museum, and you can follow the ship’s voyage on displays.

Danish: Du kan se dramatiske skud af Frederikssundsjollen Marcus Noer med bølgerne sprøjtende om forstævn og besætning, håndværkere med imponerende kunnen og ikke før viste billeder fra det rekonstruerede langskib Havhingsten fra Glendaloughs rejse til Dublin tur/retur - museets største eksperimentalarkæologiske projekt nogensinde.
English: You can see dramatic shots, such as those of the Frederikssund dinghy Marcus Noer, with waves foaming around the stem and crew, craftsmen with impressive skills and never before shown images from the reconstructed longship Sea Stallion from Glendalough's voyage to Dublin and back - the Museum's biggest experimental archaeology project to date.

Danish: Det kan ses at de har prøvet det før.
English: You can see that they've tried this before.

Danish: Man kan godt fornemme, at der er en plastikhinde over plankerne.
English: You can sense the plastic-like membrane on the planks.

Danish: Der er dagligt en Craftsman's Talk - på engelsk - kl. 11.30, og der er særlig workshop kl. 14.00.
English: You can sit in on the daily Craftman's Talk at 11.30 and participate in a special workshop at 14.00.

Danish: Du kan smede løbende igennem hele dagen, med kyndig vejledning og god hjælp fra smeden.
English: You can smith throughout the day, with expert advice and help from our blacksmiths.

Danish: Du kan herefter bruge hjemmesidens interaktive kort til at identificere den eller de etaper, som du har brug for til den enkelte opgave, og derefter klippe en mindre bid ud af filen til at arbejde videre med.
English: You can then use the website's interactive map to identify the stage or stages which you need for the individual exercises and then extract a small part of the file to work on.

Danish: Du kan herefter bruge hjemmesidens interaktive kort til at identificere den eller de etaper, som du har brug for til den enkelte opgave, og derefter klippe en mindre bid ud af filen til at arbejde videre med.
English: You can then use the website’s interactive map to identify the stage or stages which you need for the individual exercises and then extract a small part of the file to work on.

Danish: Gå i krigertræning som hirdmand og lær at kæmpe med sværd og skjold.
English: You can try your hand at the fighting techniques mastered by the Vikings.

Danish: Du skal bruge programmet Adobe Reader for at læse rapporten.
English: You can use the program Adobe Reader to view the reports.

Danish: Alle deltagerne inddrages i fortællingen om vikingerne og bliver en del af historien om vikingernes togter og handelsrejser.
English: You can watch the professional boatbuilders work while working with the axe, hammer, drill and knife yourself.

Danish: På værftspladsen kan børn og deres voksne forvandle naturmaterialer som bark, træ, tov og fjer til fantastiske fantasiskibe.
English: You can watch the professional boatbuilders work while working with the axe, hammer, drill and knife yourself.

Danish: Værktøjet bruges også, når bådebyggeren arbejder på værftspladsen.
English: You can watch the professional boatbuilders work while working with the axe, hammer, drill and knife yourself.

Danish: Man kan ikke altid arbejde med målebånd, da de let tages af strømmen og ikke står lige, og man kan ikke regne med at kunne se fra den ene ende af målebåndet til den anden på grund af tang og mudder i vandet.
English: You cannot always use a measuring tape, because it gets easily caught by the current and bends, and there is no guarantee that you can see from one end of the tape to the other.

Danish: Du ændrer kurs til 260°.
English: You change course to 260°.

Danish: I kommer tæt på vandet, tæt på vikingetiden og får fælles oplevelser, der holder!
English: You come close to the water, close to the Viking Age and create memories that last!

Danish: Stil eventuelt spørgsmålet: Hvad ville der være sket, hvis danskerne havde kunnet samle tropper nok mod Vilhelm?
English: You could ask the question: What could have happened if the Danes had been able to assemble enough troops to face William?

Danish: Fyld evt. nogle dåser med lidt sand skyd efter dem, eller opstil en rund ring og se om du kan skyde i gennem
English: You could fill some tin cans with a little sand and use them as targets or hand up a ring and see if you can shoot through it.

Danish: Find og download eventuelt et passende gratis baggrundskort fra Internettet.
English: You could find and download a suitable free background map from the Internet.

Danish: Du kan udforme fine lerbrikker og brænde dem i en dåse med halm.
English: You could form the pieces from clay and fire them in a tin can with straw.

Danish: Brikkerne kan også laves af knogler, Evt. kan I få små fordrodsknogler fra fåret hos slagteren.
English: You could obtain some small sheep foot bones from the butcher.

Danish: Udvælg evt. kun en mindre del af togtet, f.eks. langs den irske østkyst.
English: You could perhaps select a small portion of the voyage, for example along the Irish coast.

Danish: Skriv det evt. som digt (evt. klosteret på Iona).
English: You could perhaps write it in the form of a poem (for example about the monastery on Iona).

Danish: Man kender jo ikke den beholdne fart, men kun den sejlede fart - længden af den vektor, man ønsker at finde.
English: You do not know the speed made good but only the sailed speed - the length of the vector you want to find.

Danish: Man kender jo ikke den beholdne fart, men kun den sejlede fart - længden af den vektor, man ønsker at finde.
English: You do not know the speed made good but only the sailed speed – the length of the vector you want to find.

Danish: I får et indblik i, hvordan vi arbejder med at bygge rekonstruktioner af vikingeskibene - værktøj, materialer og teknik.
English: You get an insight into how we work when building reconstructed Viking ships – tools, materials and techniques.

Danish: Du har styret 126° og målt din fart til 4,5 knob.
English: You have steered 126° and measured your speed at 4.5 knots.

Danish: Du har ret til at fortryde købet uden begrundelse inden for 14 dage.
English: You have the right to cancel your purchase within 14 days.

Danish: Du har ret til at reklamere i op til 2 år efter et køb, hvis der konstateres produktionsfejl ved varen.
English: You have the right to complain for up to 2 years after a purchase, if a manufacturing fault can be identified in the item.

Danish: Det er man nødt til, for ingen kan være på hele tiden”.
English: You have to do that, because no-one can be ‘on’ all the time.

Danish: Derfor udnytter man i stedet muligheden for at opløse jorden i vand og suge den væk ved hjælp af en slags "støvsuger" drevet af vand- eller lufttryk.
English: You have to use the option of dissolving the soil in the water and sucking it away with a kind of "vacuum cleaner" driven by water or air pressure.

Danish: I har to minutter til at komme i sikkerhedsdragterne”.
English: You have two minutes to get into the safety suits”.

Danish: Du kan få brug for at frasortere målinger, hvor det pågældende instrument har været ude af drift.
English: You may need to remove records where the instrument in question was malfunctioning.

Danish: Du måler din hastighed til 4,5 knob.
English: You measure your speed at 4.5 knots.

Danish: Du returnerer varerne uden unødig forsinkelse og senest 14 dage fra den dato, hvor du har informeret os om udøvelsen af aftalens fortrydelsesret.
English: You must return the item without unnecessary delay and within 14 days from the date where you have informed us that you wish to exercise your right to return.

Danish: Du skal bruge data fra etaper, hvor der sejles tættest muligt på vindretningen - vel at mærke for sejl!
English: You need to use data from stages when the ship sails as close as possible to the direction of the wind - under sail, of course!

Danish: Du har ophavsret til de billeder, du selv tager.
English: You own the copyright to any images you personally take.

Danish: Du skal også huske at holde det vandret, når du bruger det.
English: You should also remember to hold it horizontally when you use it.

Danish: Vi har ikke mulighed for at rejse ned og være med på træffet i Hedeby,
English: You should have received a mail with a link to where the files can be downloaded.

Danish: I deltager i processen, oplever materialerne og mærker duftene.
English: You take part in the process, get your hands on the materials and smell all the scents.

Danish: Du hæfter for eventuel forringelse af varernes værdi, som skyldes anden håndtering, end hvad der er nødvendigt for at fastslå varernes art, egenskaber og den måde, de fungerer på.
English: You will also incur any charges arising from any reduction of the items original value, which have arisen as a result of handling above and beyond that which is necessary to establish the items type, capabilities and the method by which it functions.

Danish: Fra det øjeblik Ottar smider den sidste fortøjning i Museumshavnen den 25. juni, og til den returnerer omkring den 7. august, kan du følge med på Vikingeskibsmuseets hjemmeside.
English: You will be able to follow Ottar online here on the Viking Ship Museum's website, from the moment that the ship casts off the last mooring in the Museum Harbour on 25 June until she returns around 7 August.

Danish: Fra det øjeblik Ottar smider den sidste fortøjning i Museumshavnen den 25. juni, og til den returnerer omkring den 7. august, kan du følge med på Vikingeskibsmuseets hjemmeside.
English: You will be able to follow Ottar online here on the Viking Ship Museum’s website, from the moment that the ship casts off the last mooring in the Museum Harbour on 25 June until she returns around 7 August.

Danish: Du vil møde betagende irske sange på både gælisk og engelsk.
English: You will be treated to enchanting Irish songs in both Gaelic and English.

Danish: Du vil møde betagende vokal fra Muireann og Mairéad, når de synger irske sange på både gælisk og engelsk.
English: You will hear enchanting vocals from Muireann and Mairéad, when they sing Irish songs in both Gaelic and English.

Danish: Du komme til at medvirke aktivt i sejladsen og undervejs fortælles om vikingernes skibe, sejl og tovværk.
English: You will participate actively in the voyage and learn about the Viking’s ships, sails and rigging.

Danish: Du får udleveret kort og Svend Tveskægs ønskeliste i museumsbutikken.
English: You will receive a map and Svend Tveskægs wish-list in the museum's shop.

Danish: Du ønsker at komme frem ad en beholden kurs på 275°, men der er en nordgående strøm på 1 knob.
English: You wish to proceed along a course made good of 275°, but there is a northwards current of 1 knot.

Danish: Man kan ikke mærke på ham, at han om en time sejler den definitivt sidste tur med Havhingsten.
English: You would never have guessed that he will be sailing his absolutely last trip on the Sea Stallion in an hour.

Danish: Din egen by i vikingetiden
English: Your own town in Viking times

Danish: Din deltagelse i arbejde og sejlads med Vikingeskibsmuseets både betragtes som fritidsbeskæftigelse, og vil derfor kun være dækket af din private ulykkes- og livsforsikring.
English: Your participation in working with and sailing the Viking Ship Museum's boats is viewed as a leisure activity and you are therefore required to have your own private accident and life insurance.

Danish: De bestilte varer vil blive afsendt senest tre hverdage fra modtagelse af ordre.
English: Your purchase will be dispatched within three days from placement of the order.

Danish: Denne styrke bestod formentlig af mænd fra klosteret.
English: © The Dept. of Environment, Heritage and Local Government.

Danish: Kristendommen i Hedeby
English: © The Viking Ship Museum.

Danish: © Vikingeskibsmuseet.
English: © The Viking Ship Museum.

Danish: © Vikingeskibsmuseet.
English: © Viking Ship Museum.

Danish: Stig om bord indeholder historier.
English: ‘Climb aboard’ contains stories.

Danish: ”Gisle”- som båden blev navngivet - er den første båd, der er blevet bygget efter principperne om ’Open Source-bådebygning’.
English: ‘Gisle’ – as the boat was named – is the first boat built according to the principles of ‘open source boatbuilding’.

Danish: 'Bare' ved hjælp af enkelte mål og en masse overleveret erfaring og kendskab til det farvand, båden blev bygget til.
English: ‘Just' with the aid of a few measurements, a wealth of experience that has been handed-down and knowledge of the waters the boat is built to sail in.

Danish: ’Bare’ ved hjælp af enkelte mål og en masse overleveret erfaring og kendskab til det farvand, båden blev bygget til.
English: ‘Just’ with the aid of a few measurements, a wealth of experience that has been handed-down and knowledge of the waters the boat is built to sail in.

Danish: ”Moderne” træbådebyggere bygger både efter en tegning, som en skibskonstruktør har tegnet.
English: ‘Modern' wooden boat builders build after drawings, which have been drawn by a ship-designer.

Danish: For de besøgendes øjne går vikingeskibsbyggernes skabertalent, arkæologernes forskerevne og halarkitektens bygningskunst således op i en højere enhed
English: ‘On front of the visitors' eyes, the Viking ship builders' creative talent, the archaeologists' research talents and the architect's design art all combine in harmony.

Danish: ’Undersøgelser og erfaringer’ skrives af bådebygger Søren Nielsen fra Vikingeskibsmuseets bådeværft, og udføres i samarbejde med skibets øvrige besætning.
English: ‘Research and experience’ will be written by shipbuilder Søren Nielsen from the boatyard at the Viking Ship Museum, and will be produced in collaboration with the rest of the crew.

Danish: Vikingeskibets skjulte gåder følger Havhingstens sejlads fra Roskilde til Dublin, der fandt sted i perioden 1. juli til 14. august 2007.
English: ‘Viking Voyage' follows the Sea Stallion's journey from Roskilde to Dublin, which took place from 1 July to 14 August 2007.

Danish: Vikingeskibets skjulte gåder blev produceret som en del af BBC's populære og ansete Timewatch-serie, og når Viasat History den 17. august har premiere på programmet, er det første gang, det bliver vist uden for Storbritannien.
English: ‘Viking Voyage' was produced as part of the BBC's popular and respected Timewatch series, and when Viasat History premieres the programme on 17 August it will be the first time that it has been shown outside the United Kingdom.

Danish: "Vi pakker en del af Vikingeskibsmuseet ned om bord og sejler oplevelserne med ud på sommerens rejse” fortæller Rikke Johansen, kommunikationskoordinator på Vikingeskibsmuseet.
English: ‘We're packing part of the Viking Ship Museum on board the ship, and will take these experiences with us when it sails on the summer voyage', tells Rikke Johansen, Communications Co-ordinator at the Viking Ship Museum.

Danish: Den Irske marines LE Roisin vil eskortere Havhingsten ind til Dublin havn og det sidste stykke op ad Liffey.
English: ’LE Roisin’ of the Irish Naval Service will be escorting the Sea Stallion up the last part of the Liffey and into Dublin harbour.

Danish: ”En kopi fordrer, at man har et 100 % originalt skib som forlæg, og selv om vi står med 75 % af Skuldelev 3 skibet, overlades der stadig en del til fortolkning".

English: “The plan is to sail onward to Dublin, but the ship is reaching Orkney in July.”

Danish: "Planlægningen af den kommende sommers sejlads er i fuld gang på museet og om 14 dage fastsættes den endelige besætning.
English: “The planning for this summer's voyage is going on right now at the Museum and in 14 days' time the final crew will have been chosen.

Danish: ”Bevaringsforholdene under vandet er så gode, at vi finder rester fra stenalderfolkets dagligliv, som ellers sjældent er bevaret.
English: “The preservation conditions under the water are so good, that we're finding the remnants of Stone Age daily life, which otherwise very rarely survive.

Danish: ”Bevaringsforholdene under vandet er så gode, at vi finder rester fra stenalderfolkets dagligliv, som ellers sjældent er bevaret.
English: “The preservation conditions under the water are so good, that we’re finding the remnants of Stone Age daily life, which otherwise very rarely survive.

Danish: ”Projektet har også haft gennemslagskraft i forhold til politikerne.
English: “The project has also had considerable impact on the politicians.

Danish: ”Projektet er blevet modtaget med åbne arme i Irland.
English: “The project has been received with open arms in Ireland.

Danish: “Undersøgelsen er en af de største marinarkæologiske undersøgelser, der er foretaget i Norden i mange år, og de kommende uger står på hårde, lange arbejdsdage, 7 dage om ugen, hvor vi får fravristet dybet de data, som vi har brug for, for at sikre vragene for fremtiden og finde ud af hvilken del af Danmarkshistorien vragene tilhører”.
English: “The project is one of the largest maritime archaeological investigations conducted in Scandinavia in many years and the coming weeks mean hard, long hours, 7 days a week, where we will have wrested from the depths the data we need to preserve the wrecks for the future and find out to which period of Danish history the wrecks belong,” concludes Jørgen Dencker.

Danish: ”Projektet er så godt og sejladsen til Dublin passer så fint med fondens formålsparagraffer, at vi har valgt at støtte Havhingsten alligevel.
English: “The project is so good and the voyage to Dublin fits hand in glove with the paragraphs of purpose of the foundation that we have chosen to fund the Sea Stallion anyway.

Danish: "Når vi har nul-tolerance overfor alkohol om bord på Havhingsten, er det først og fremmest et spørgsmål om sikkerhed.
English: “The reason we have zero tolerance concerning alcohol on board the Sea Stallion primarily relates to the question of safety.

Danish: ”Havhingsten har simpelthen klaret det enorme pres helt fantastisk.
English: “The Sea Stallion has coped with the enormous pressure just fantastically.

Danish: “Skibet i sig selv er jo smukt og et ‘lykkeligt’ skib – en kæmpe anerkendelse til bådebyggerne og alle de mennesker som har været involveret I bygningen af rekonstruktionen.
English: “The ship it self is beautiful and a fine ‘lucky’ ship – a huge credit to the boat builders and all those involved in her construction.

Danish: ”Skibet” giver gennem 20 rigt illustrerede opslag læseren lejlighed til at gå på opdagelse i skibets konstruktion og få svar på spørgsmålet ”Hvor ved vi det fra?”.
English: “The Ship” gives, with the aid of 20 richly illustrated entries, the reader the possibility to explore the construction of the ship and to answer the question “Where do we know this from?”.

Danish: ”I vikingetiden lagdes kimen til det samfund, vi kender i dag.
English: “The Viking Age laid the basis for the society we know today.

Danish: ”Vikingeskibsmuseet skiller sig ud fra de fleste forskningsinstitutioner ved, at vi så at sige forsker i skala 1:1.
English: “The Viking Ship Museum distinguishes itself from most research institutions by the facet that we so to speak that work in the scale 1:1.

Danish: ”Vikingeskibsmuseet og besætningen på Havhingsten er utroligt glade for og stolte over, at Kronprins Frederik er protektor for skibet og sejladsen.
English: “The Vikinge Ship Museum and the Sea Stallion crew are proud and extremely delighted that Crown Prince Frederik is patron of the ship and its venture.

Danish: ”Vikingerne kom med sværd og skjold og hærgede og plyndrede i England.
English: “The Vikings came with sword and shield and ravaged and plundered England.

Danish: ”Rejsen” fortæller om forsøgsrejser som forskningsmetode og om Havhingstens rejse til Dublin og retur.
English: “The Voyage” tells about experimental voyages as research tool and about the SEA STALLION's journey to Dublin and back.

Danish: ”Så har vi jo også hjemmesiden.
English: “Then there is the website, too.

Danish: "De vasker sig hverken efter at have skidt, tisset eller efter seksuelt samkvem, og de vasker ikke hænder efter at have spist".
English: “They never wash themselves after they have defecated, urinated or had sexual intercourse, and neither do they wash their hands after they have eaten”.

Danish: "Dette projekt er et af de største marinarkæologiske forsøg, der nogensinde er udført.
English: “This is one of the largest marine archaeological experiments ever carried out.

Danish: ”Dels er vores nuværende samlede skovareal langt mindre end i vikingetiden, dels er egetræer, når de kommer op i den størrelse, vi skal bruge dem i 90-100 cm i diameter - for længst blevet hugstmodne i nutidens moderne skovdrift”.
English: “This is partly because the current forested area is much smaller than in the Viking Age and partly because the majority of oaks are felled before they reach the 90-100 cm diameter that we need”.

Danish: ”Togtet er et eventyr, som intet menneske i næsten 1.000 år har vovet sig ud på.
English: “This journey is an adventure that no man in 1,000 years has undertaken.

Danish: ”Togtet er historisk.
English: “This journey is historic.

Danish: ”Projektet har fået en umådelig gennemslagskraft både i det internationale forskningsmiljø og i den brede befolkning.
English: “This project has had a tremendous impact both among international researchers and in the general population.

Danish: "Dette havgående fragtskib havde lavere stævne og et markant anderledes design end trappestævnen, og vi giver dermed et andet bud på, hvordan den oprindelige båd har set ud, da den sejlede i de vestnorske fjorde for 1000 år siden".
English: “This sea-going cargo ship had a lower stem and a radically different design than the stepped stem, and we are therefore offering a different suggestion about how the original boat might have looked when it sailed into the western fjords of Norway 1000 years ago.”

Danish: "Det udspringer af, at Carsten Brebøl var meget dansksindet.
English: “This stems from Carsten Brebøl being very patriotic.

Danish: "Denne weekend skal bruges til at gøre skibet klart til turen over Nordsøen.
English: “This weekend will be spent making the ship ready for the voyage across the North Sea,” she said.

Danish: ”Vi er et par besætningsmedlemmer som vil prøve at arbejde med astronomisk navigation, og vi kommer helt sikkert også til at lege med solkompasset igen.
English: “We are a couple of crew members who wish to work with celestial navigation, and I'm sure we will also use the solar compass again.

Danish: ”Vi er et par besætningsmedlemmer som vil prøve at arbejde med astronomisk navigation, og vi kommer helt sikkert også til at lege med solkompasset igen.
English: “We are a couple of crew members who wish to work with celestial navigation, and I’m sure we will also use the solar compass again.

Danish: "Vi er utroligt glade for denne donation, som løser både løser et stort behov og fortæller resten af verden, at projektet er vigtigt og værd at støtte.
English: “We are incredibly happy about this donation, which both solves a big problem and tells the rest of the world that this project is important and worth supporting.

Danish: ”Vi er en ganske almindelig familie, og har fulgt projektet med Havhingsten fra starten.
English: “We are just an ordinary family, but we have followed the Sea Stallion project from the beginning.

Danish: ”Vi sætter ikke kun Vikingeskibsmuseet på det kulturelle og historiske verdenskort.
English: “We are not only putting the Viking Ship Museum on the cultural and historical world map.

Danish: ”Vi forsøger at bevare vores håndværkstraditioner og I forsøger at genskabe jeres”, sagde premierministeren, da Anne C. Sørensen fortalte om arbejdet med at rekonstruere vikingernes håndværk.
English: “We are trying to preserve our craftsmanship traditions and you are trying to recreate yours” said the prime minister, when Anne C. Sørensen described the work to restore the Vikings' craftsmanship.

Danish: ”Vi forsøger at bevare vores håndværkstraditioner og I forsøger at genskabe jeres”, sagde premierministeren, da Anne C. Sørensen fortalte om arbejdet med at rekonstruere vikingernes håndværk.
English: “We are trying to preserve our craftsmanship traditions and you are trying to recreate yours” said the prime minister, when Anne C. Sørensen described the work to restore the Vikings’ craftsmanship.

Danish: ”Vi er meget glade for Augustinus Fondens donation.
English: “We are very pleased to receive the grant from the Augustinus Foundation.

Danish: ”Vi har i mange år gået med tanken om at bygge en båd.
English: “We had been thinking about building a boat for several years.

Danish: ”Vi har massive fund af dyreknogler; alt fra større pattedyr, helt ned til de mindste fiskeknogler‐ og -skæl.
English: “We have a massive find of animal bones: everything from large mammals down to the smallest fish bones and scales.

Danish: "Vi har et stærkt hold og vi har en stærk reservebænk.
English: “We have a strong crew an a strong reserves bench.

Danish: "Vi har endda været i den heldige situation, at der var flere gaster at vælge mellem, end der var pladser om bord på skibet.
English: “We have been in the fortunate situation at there were more potential crew members to choose from than places on the ship.

Danish: ”Vi har fået den ønskede sydvestlige medvind, så vi har en agten for tværs.
English: “We have got the south-westerly we wanted, so we have a following wind.

Danish: "Vi har haft flere hold i Dublin for at gøre Havhingsten søklar til den 29. juni.
English: “We have had several teams of people in Dublin to get the Sea Stallion ready for the sea again on 29 June.

Danish: ”Vi står med mange ubesvarede spørgsmål, men en ting ved vi: Vikingerne annoncerede ikke deres angreb på forhånd.
English: “We have loads of questions unanswered, but one thing we do know: The Vikings did not announce their attacks beforehand.

Danish: ”Vi har været grundige i vores analyse, og der er meget på spil for museet i denne sag”, fortæller Vikingeskibsmuseets direktør Tinna Damgaard-Sørensen og fortsætter: ”Det ville kræve en ekstraordinær stor indsats fra museet, hvis et besøg skulle blive en succes.
English: “We have made a thorough analysis and there is a lot at stake for the Museum”, explains Tinna Damgaard-Sørensen, Director of the Viking Ship Museum, and continues: “It would require an extraordinary effort from the Museum to make a success of such a visit.

Danish: “Vi bliver aldrig trætte af at bygge Gokstad Færingen.
English: “We never get tired of building the Gokstad Færing.

Danish: Vi skal også tage imod 16 nye besætningsmedlemmer lørdag aften og sige farvel til 16 af de gamle på søndag, svarede Vibeke Bischoff.
English: “We say hello to 16 new crew on Saturday evening and goodbye to 16 of the old crew on Sunday.”

Danish: ”Vi skal have flere penge, fordi marinarkæologien er nødlidende, og fordi kulturarven på havbunden bør omfattes med samme opmærksomhed, samme omhu og samme ansvarlighed som kulturarven på landjorden.
English: “We should have more money because marine archaeology is destitute and because the cultural heritage at the bottom of the sea ought to be treated with the same attention, the same care, and the same responsibility as that on land.

Danish: ”Vi betragter sejladsen i Skagerrak sidste sommer som en svendeprøve for skib og besætning og for museets beredskab for formidling og sikkerhed.
English: “We view the voyage of last summer in Skagerrak as an important test passed for ship, crew, and for the ability of the museum to handle issues of communication and safety.

Danish: ”Vi skal så langt mod syd som muligt, ned langs den irske kyst", siger skipper Carsten Hvid.
English: “We want to get as far south down the Irish coast as possible,” says skipper Carsten Hvid.

Danish: “Vi var nærmest rystede over omfanget af skibstømmer og kanoner, der ligger på kryds og tværs på havbunden.
English: “We were almost shocked at the extent of ship timber and cannons that criss-cross the seabed.

Danish: Vi starter med at tømme hele skibet, personlige grej op, få alt skidtet og lortet ud, også de tabte spegepølsemadder og makrelsalaten nede i bunden".
English: “We'll start by emptying the whole ship, taking out personal effects - get the whole damn lot out, including all those salami and mackerel salad sandwiches right at the bottom.”

Danish: ”Der er tale om eksperimentalarkæologi, hvor vi får mulighed for at afprøve nordboernes rejse- og kommunikationsvilkår i praksis.
English: “We're talking about experimental archaeology, where we get the chance to explore the Norsemen's travelling conditions in practice.

Danish: ”Ja… så er der gået tre minutter,” lyder det utålmodigt fra Jan Larsen.
English: “Well… more than three minutes have past,” Jan Larsen impatiently exclaims.

Danish: ”Der er tale om eksperimentalarkæologi, hvor vi får mulighed for at afprøve nordboernes rejse- og kommunikationsvilkår i praksis.
English: “We’re talking about experimental archaeology, where we get the chance to explore the Norsemen’s travelling conditions in practice.

Danish: ”Vi er naturligvis glade for, at arbejdet med Storstrømsbroen kan være med til at kaste lys på et ellers ukendt område som middelalderens skibe.
English: “We’re very happy that the work on the Storstrøm Bridge can help to cast light on an otherwise unknown area, like medieval ships.

Danish: ”Hvad spiser I ombord?”
English: “What do you eat on board?”

Danish: "Hvornår skal vi af sted mod Danmark", blev der spurgt fra besætningen.
English: “When do we leave for Denmark?” one of the crew asked.

Danish: ”Når det sker, kommer hjemmesiden for alvor op i det femte gear, vi hele tiden har haft som ambition.
English: “When it happens, we will seriously put the homepage into the fifth gear, like we wanted to all along.

Danish: "Når den mere stabile nordlige vind kommer, kan vi stryge stik syd ned mellem Irland og England," siger skipper Carsten Hvid.
English: “When the more stable northerly wind comes, we can strike a course due south between Ireland and Wales”, says the skipper, Carsten Hvid.

Danish: "Når vi bygger vikingeskibe, er det vigtigste at rekonstruere skibet så tæt på den oprindelige som muligt, samtidigt med at vi bygger med det oprindelige værktøj, og bruger fortidens metoder og teknikker", fortæller bådebygger Martin Dael.
English: “When we build a Viking ship, the most important thing is that we reconstruct the ship as closely to the original as possible, by using the same tools, techniques and methods as they did in the Viking Age”, tells boatbuilder Martin Dael.

Danish: ”Og når vi kommer til søndag den 1. juli og afsejlingen til Dublin, forventer jeg, at interessen for hjemmesiden vil eksplodere.
English: “When we get to Sunday the 1st of July and the departure for Dublin, I expect the interest to soar.

Danish: ”Når vi bruger ordet rekonstruktion, er det fordi, det er mere præcist end at tale om en kopi”, understreger Søren Nielsen.
English: “When we use the word reconstruction rather than copy, it’s because it’s a more accurate term”, emphasises Søren Nielsen.

Danish: ”Når I skal over Nordsøen og ud i Atlanterhavet, skal I helt klart krydse fingre for en række lavtryk, der går syd om Danmark.
English: “When you are heading over the North Sea and into the Atlantic Ocean, you should definitely cross your fingers and hope for a line of low-pressures passing South of Denmark.

Danish: "Ja, den paragraf skyldes jo, at Carsten Brebøl var en meget ivrig jæger.
English: “Yes, that paragraph owes to the fact that Carsten Brebøl was a very keen hunter.

Danish: ”På en forsøgsrejse som denne, kan man altid lære mere.
English: “You can always learn more on an experimental voyage like this one.

Danish: ”Sikkerhed er at betragte som summen af en lang række faktorer: Skibets tilstand, besætningens uddannelse og velbefindende, udstyr og ledsagefartøj for at nævne de vigtigste.
English: “You can view safety as the sum of a series of factors: the condition of the ship, the fitness and training of the crew, the equipment, and the support ship – to mention the most important.

Danish: ”Og så er der en fantastisk stor interesse for Havhingstens hjemmeside og den formidling af historie, marinarkæologi og skibsbygning, vi har planlagt skal gå hånd i hånd med aktuelle opdateringer af skibets position, fart og kurs sammen med daglige historier om livet om bord”.
English: ” There is also a huge interest in the Sea Stallions website and the communication of history, maritime archaeology and ship building planned to follow actual updates from the ship - updates about the speed, course, the position of the ship and daily stories about life on board”.

Danish: ”Analysen af hypotesens holdbarhed – og dermed svaret på det første store spørgsmål – vil være baseret på en helhedsvurdering af de data, der fremkommer under forsøgssejladsen”.
English: ”analyzing the validity of this hypothesis – and the answer to the first big question – will be based on estimations of data appearing during the test”.

Danish: "Og selvom der fortsat bygges klinkbyggede både på nogle af landets værfter, er det langt fra alle steder, at publikum kan komme helt tæt på".
English: ”And even though clinker-built boats are still constructed at some of the country’s boatyards, there are only a few places where the public can observe from up close”.

Danish: ”Både Margrethe og Anne-Marie ville også gerne vide, hvordan vi sover i uvejr, hvad vi får at spise om bord og hvordan vi holder varmen om natten og når vejret er barskt,” fortsætter Solveig.
English: ”Both Margrethe and Anne-Marie wanted to know how the crew got any sleep during rough sailing, what we are eat on board and how we keep warm at night,” Solveig continues.

Danish: "Carsten Brebøl var en excentriker.
English: ”Carsten Brebøl was an eccentric.

Danish: ”Der bygges fortsat klinkbyggede træbåde i Danmark – om end i meget lille målestok.
English: ”Clinker-built wooden boats are still built in Denmark, though to a very limited extent.

Danish: ”De kontrollerede testsejladser belyser skibets og besætningens præstationsevne under forskellige forhold.
English: ”Controlled test sails illustrate the capacity of ship and crew under different conditions.

Danish: "I mit lange virke som diplomat tænker jeg tit på, hvornår jeg er med til at gøre en forskel og jeg må ofte tænke meget længe...
English: ”During my many years as a diplomat, I have often thought back over times when I have been able to really make a difference, and they have not always been easy to find.

Danish: ”Først takkede han nej, men da han blev spurgt anden gang, sagde han ja-tak og satte sig til rette ved Havhingsten rorpind,” fortæller styrmand Vibeke, der stod side om side med Dronning Margrethe.
English: ”First he said no, but when I asked for the second time, he agreed and sat down at the rutter,” says steersman Vibeke, who was side by side the queen.

Danish: ”Og god tur videre…” råbte Dronning Margrethe, mens hun fortsat vinkede til besætningen på Havhingsten.
English: ”Have a safe journey…” the queen called while waving to the crew members.

Danish: "Normalt plejer vi jo her på museet at være involveret i at grave ting op af joden, men nu graver vi noget ned.
English: ”Here at the museum, we are normally involved in digging things up, but in this case we are burying something.

Danish: ”Hvordan formidler vi et skib, der er langt fra land og langt fra publikum?
English: ”How are we going to tell the story about the ship when she is far from land and the public?

Danish: Under samme udgravning blev også ”Anlæg 2”, ”Anlæg 3” og ”Anlæg 4” udgravet.
English: ”Installation 2”, "Installation 3” and "Installation 4” were also excavated during this excavation.

Danish: "Det skal understreges, at det er et forsøg, da hestene af gode grunde ikke har haft mulighed for at træne i denne helt specielle opgave.
English: ”It must be emphasised that this is an experiment, since the horses have never had an opportunity to train at this special task, for good reasons.

Danish: ”I den fremgår det, at vi blandt andet vil sætte fokus på rejsen, vikingetiden, billedet af vikingen, langskibet og selvfølgelig de nyheder, som måtte opstå undervejs.
English: ”It tells, that we will focus on the journey, the Viking Age, the image of the Viking, the longship and of course the news and stories that come up during the sail.

Danish: ”Det kan godt give mig søvnløse nætter.
English: ”Just the thought of that gives me sleepless nights!

Danish: ”Normalt sejler vi kun i weekender fremtil skolernes sommerferie, men vi vil meget gerne tilbyde publikum en sejltur på hverdage i maj og juni også.
English: ”Normally we only sail at weekends until the beginning of the school summer holidays, but we now wish to offer the public the opportunity to also sail on the fjord on weekdays during May and June.

Danish: ”De andre spørgsmål går mere på det videnskabelige projekt i sig selv.
English: ”Other questions focus on the research connected to the test sail.

Danish: ”Stednavne, der indeholder ord som Drag-, Drå-, Dræ-, Drej- og –dræt, ligger ofte på smalle landområder mellem to forskellige farvande” fortæller museumsinspektør og ph.d. Anne C. Sørensen fra museets forskningsafdeling.
English: ”Place names that contain words like Drag-, Drå-, Dræ-, Drej- and –dræt often lie on narrow strips of land between two different stretches of water” explains museum curator and PhD, Anne C. Sørensen from the museum’s research department.

Danish: ”Interessen for projektet er enorm.
English: ”The interest is enormous.

Danish: ”Det gammeldanske navneord 'drægh' betød oprindelig 'landtange, som skibe kan trækkes (drages) over'.
English: ”The Old-Danish place name 'drægh' originally meant 'isthmus, over which ships can be hauled (dragged)'.

Danish: ”Det gammeldanske navneord ’drægh’ betød oprindelig ’landtange, som skibe kan trækkes (drages) over’.
English: ”The Old-Danish place name ’drægh’ originally meant ’isthmus, over which ships can be hauled (dragged)’.

Danish: ”Vi kalder projektet ’Så til søs’ og tanken er at formidle arkæologien, skibet, sejladsen, ruten, besætningen og projektet… som undervisning,” fortæller Louise Kæmpe Henriksen fra Skoletjenesten.
English: ”The project is called ’Going to sea’ and the idea is to communicate the archaeology, the ship, the sailing, the route, the crew and the project…… as education,” says Louise Kæmpe Henriksen from the School Service.

Danish: Fondens bestyrelse blev første gang opmærksomme på Havhingsten, da skibet sejlede Skagerrak rundt i 2006.
English: ”The Sea Stallion caught the attention of the trustees of the foundation for the first time when it sailed round the Skagerrak in 2006.

Danish: ”Havhingsten er en rekonstruktion af et skib, hvor kun 20 procent er bevaret i dag.
English: ”The Sea Stallion is a reconstruction an original were only 20 percent is preserved today.

Danish: ”Udgangspunktet er Havhingstens hjemmeside.
English: ”The Sea Stallions Website is the base of the project.

Danish: ”Det andet store spørgsmål går på skibets sejlegenskaber.
English: ”The second question asked is about the sailing ability of the ship.

Danish: "Tidskasplen indeholder lidt mindre end 100 effekter og det begrænser selvfølgelig udvalget voldsomt.
English: ”The Time Capsule contains just under 100 objects, and of course that severely limits the range.

Danish: ”Risikoen for en ulykke om bord på Havhingsten er stor.
English: ”There is a huge risk of accidents on board the Sea Stallion.

Danish: ”Også en slags danskere”
English: ”They are almost Danish”

Danish: ”Forsøgsrejsen giver os mulighed for at undersøge og dokumentere skibets sødygtighed, manøvrerevne og fart under realistiske forhold.
English: ”This experimental journey gives us an opportunity to examine and document the seaworthiness, the manoeuvres and the speed under realistic conditions.

Danish: ”Og så får vi en helt fantastisk hjemmeside med mange daglige opdateringer og mulighed for at følge livet om bord ned i selv den mindste detalje.
English: ”We will develop a brilliant website with daily reports from the ship, which will give many a chance to follow life on board in every detail.

Danish: ”Med fire 2-spand trækheste foran Havhingsten bliver det både spektakulært, rigtigt flot – og en anelse nervepirrende”, fortæller bådeværftets chef Søren Nielsen.
English: ”With four pairs of draught horses on front of the Sea Stallion, it will be both spectacular and really beautiful, but also a bit nerve-wracking” explains Søren Nielsen, head of the shipyard.

Danish: ”Uden at afsløre for meget, kan jeg godt sige, at vi planlægger at fylde hjemmesiden med guf.
English: ”Without revealing it all I can say that we are planning to place a lot of great and exciting things on the website.

Danish: ”Wulfstan sagde, at han rejste fra Hedeby, at han var i Truso på syv dage og næt-ter, at skibet hele vejen gik under sejl…”
English: ”Wulfstan said that he travelled from the Heaths, that he was in Truso in seven days and nights, that the boat was all the way running under sail…”

Danish: • 'Falafel' af flækærter
English: • 'Falafel' of split peas

Danish: • En mobiltelefon
English: • A mobile telephone

Danish: • Et stykke af Orange Scene fra Roskilde Festival
English: • A piece of the Orange Stage from the Roskilde Festival

Danish: • Et forseglet brev fra tidligere Lord Mayor of Dublin Paddy Bourke
English: • A sealed letter from the former Lord Mayor of Dublin Paddy Bourke.

Danish: • Besætningens oplevelser og rejseberetninger
English: • Accounts and experiences of the crew

Danish: • Spidsen sættes på, der lægges en klat tømmerlim på først og blunt eller gummiprop presses på.
English: • Affix the rubber bung or blunt to the tip of the arrow using wood glue

Danish: Følgende opgaver er nedslag i
English: • Also draw their family tree.

Danish: Tegn også deres familietræ.
English: • Also draw their family tree.

Danish: • Avisen The Irish Times
English: • An edition of the Irish Times
